He is a native of Prague and showed us things on our tour that we never would have thought to look for on our own. I would book another tour with him in a heartbeat should we visit Prague again. Thank you Stanislav for giving us the most memorable experience of our entire vacation!

Great service. I was just amazed with the whole product. First just very quick introduction, then we head for the ride and saw amazing places in historical Prague. The guide Standa was very friendly, knowledgable and professional . I have seen hidden spots around the Prague castle I didn't know even existed. He certainly has deep knowladge where to take people . After arriving back home in Australia I got email with HD pictures from the tour Standa took of me - it just made my day! Service well and truly goes the extra mile, fantastic value for money, can't wait to do it again next time!

Great, cheap and friendly Segway tour. My girlfriend and I went on a Segway tour with Standa. It was really great. He took loads of pictures of us, which he afterwards mailed to us. We went on a 3-hours ride, that was really fun and informative and I think lasted maybe 4 hours. We stopped at really nice places, and was a part of the tour, not just on a tour. I would defiantly go again next time I am in Prague.

A wonderful experience - just do it!. A truly memorable trip, we saw places we would not have found on your own. Great guide, fluent in English, and an extremely nice guy, very interesting trip that we would highly recommend to anyone visiting beautiful Prague - Just do it, I promise you wont regret it! :-)
An Awesome Experience. Our family saw parts of Prague with I Love Segue that we never would have discovered on our own. So thankful we got to see so much of this beautiful place! A great tour.
Awesome Owner/Operator. Thank you Standa for the great day! We really enjoyed the stories you shared, your business history and the fun ride. We will visit again.Zeman
"Fun". Excellent way to know Prague! We had a lot of fun and went to beautiful places. David, our guide, is very nice. He explained everything to us! We enjoyed so much that we did it twice.

iLoveSegway.com: An Unexpected Adventure in Prague. While on a walking tour of Old Town, we ran into Standa of ILOVESEGWAY.com. Standa and several of his colleagues were out marketing their Segway tours of Prague. We had the next morning available and arranged for a 2 hour Segway tour for our group of 4. Standa arranged for a taxi to pick us up at our hotel and drop us off at 9:30 AM the next morning. All went as planned and we were taken to iLoveSegway's base of operations, which happens yo be the U Maliru restaurant. A couple members of our group had never been on a Segway and were a bit weary. Standa met us at the cab, paid the fare and immediately set to putting our minds at ease. After taking care of the necessary paperwork, we were given a safety briefing and brief, but adequate training session. Within 15 minutes we were on our way. Standa led us on a an amazing tour of Prague. From the Lennon Wall to the "Eiffel Tour" to the Metronome to the Prime Ministers House... We viewed Prague from the top of the three hills surrounding Prague. Standa scheduled frequent stops along the way to allow us to take photos and stretch our legs. He made sure we were comfortable with the pace and duration of the tour. Standa asked if we wanted to extend the tour for a bit ( at no additional charge) and we readily agreed. We returned to iLoveSegway's base of operations 3 hours later with smiles all around. This tour is not a lecture on the history of Prague. It is an exhilarating experience which allows you to see Prague in a unique fashion. I highly recommend iLoveSegway.

Brilliant . First time to Prague and this is a brilliant way to see the sights and learn about them. Our guide was great, really friendly and spoke perfect English. I can't recommend this enough to anyone visiting Prague. High on the to do list. Steve & Claire

Great service and tour!. It was a rainy day, so we earned a private guided tour. We've discovered that using an ebike is a great and efficient way to explore the parks around the city. Karel our guid, gave us also a good perspective about the every day life in Prague. The bikes are easy to use, you will find them very comfortable and controllable. Mary, who runs the place, is very responsive and care about your little details. Ask them for any tip, their knowledge is priceless. At any weather it is highly recommend :-)

Outstanding service and tours! All Inclusive is worth every penny!. sed this company last week for a tour in Prague. We opted for the All Inclusive tour, which ran us a little over $300 USD for 2 people. However, we were more than satisfied. Mary, who runs their operation, was prompt with her communication and even texted me often with info and updates. This type of modern business technique is not often seen in Europe, so it was a nice change. Once we arrived at the office, we were offered a welcome drink (go with the sparkling rose!) and met our guide "Charlie." The all inclusive tour is limited to 8 guests, but we were the only ones for that day, so we really had a private tour guide. We did everything listed on their website and more. Charlie was an outstanding host/guide and knew all the secret spots to visit, back entrances to avoid lines, and all the history. Between seeing the key sights, sampling beer, sausage, a great Czech lunch, wine, river cruse, and other experiences, we could not have been happier. We certainly got our monies worth during the 7-8 hour tour. Everything we did was covered by the price of the tour. We didn't spend a single cent more. You rarely see anyone rated at 5 stars on trip advisor anymore, but these guys earned. Thanks!!!

Chocoholic tour!. Our family of four includes three kids ages 10, 12, and 15. We took the Chocoholic tour this week with a wonderful guide named Karel. We all four have different likes and dislikes for sure, but this tour was a hit with each of us! Karel made sure everyone was engaged and interested as the tour progressed. We all highly recommend taking this tour no matter your age!

Excellent, effortless orientation tour. Booked this ebike tour before we left the UK. Booked based upon other trip advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. My husband and I were the only 2 on our tour with Alois. He really knew his stuff and answered our incessant questions. The ebike is very quick and easy to get used to. I wish I had one at home! Prague is extremely hilly and is cobbled so touring by bike was the best thing to do. We pretty much saw it all. Then the next day we went back to some of the stops to see them in more detail. Perfect:)

Night cruise. me my wife booked a night cruise and they picked us from hotel and dropped off back also, and they added for us a half an hour tour in the city. the guide was great, good food and music. And the most important a reasonable price.

Ebike - Great way to see Prague . Riding an Ebike for the first time was an awesome experience, especially when negotiating the hills around the castle. The guides, Aloi and Charles, provided wonderful insight and background of the many sights you'll see on the tour. The tour was well organized and they even provided a box lunch. I had great time and they have my highest recommendation.

Great way to see it all. What a great day trip this was and a great way to see the best of Prague. We only had 2 days in Prague, so this trip really appealed as it meant we would see all of the highlights. The guide we had was very knowledgeable, didn't rush us and as it was a small group tour, we could ask lots of questions. I would recommend this tour to anyone, who wants to see it all. Only word of warning- there is a lot of walking involved, but it is at a very leisurely pace.

Best way to see prague. Landed in Prague at midnight for a 36 hr trip,Took a shot in the dark and emailed the operator regarding the ebike tour.Got an instant response from Mary who facilitated us.Very friendly and warm couple/ operators who was eager to give us the tips on things to do in Prague.We toured on ebikes with Charlie who was excellent as well.The route was great and touched on all important sights in Prague and the information given actually helped you appreciate it more. Thoughtful was the snackbox included and sitting on the benches after Prague castle overlooking the city and chatting with new friends at the midpoint of the trip.I haven't ridden a bike in years and was still able to hop on and after their brief ebike tutorial ready to concur Prague.This was a unique way to do Prague and when back in Prague i'd definitely use this tour company. Ps: make sure and listen to Charlie talk about the TV tower. Hilarious

The best tour in Prague. If you have only one day to do it all or if you just want a tour that doesn't involve a yellow bus, 30 tourists, a guide with a microphone followed by a large group of multilingual tourists...or if you want a premium experience then that's the tour you need to do. I randomly found it online after failing to find a better option with my hotel concierge. I was not disappointed. It was simply amazing. My wife and I ended up being just us two so that was pretty much a private tour. The guide was awesome. We went pretty much wherever we wanted to go and we learn a lot about cool stuff in the city. Yes it cost double the price the usual tour offer so if you are looking for cheap this is not for you. But if you are looking for an amazing experience with an old car ride, a boat ride, lunch, bear and wine tasting and a private tour, then I don't think there's anything in town better than this. This is a good 7 hours total tour so be prepared it's long. That includes a lot of walking obviously but it's done so you have breaks for tasting or lunch or rest on a boat for an hour. It's really well done and well organized.

EXCELLENT AND COMPLETE TOUR OF PRAGUE. A excellent way to see all of the significant sights and learn about all of the historic events of Prague. Our personal guide (Robert W) is a true historian and I cannot imagine anyone knowing more of the sights and history of Prague than he does. I would recommend this full-day private tour to anyone who really wants to learn about Prague. Be ready to walk a moderate amount, too. Excellent!

E-bike tour was fantastic. Took the e-bike city overview tour on our first day in Prague and it was the perfect way to get acclimated with the city. It was our first time on e-bikes and we picked it up without a problem. We had 2 guides for 4 riders and Charlie and Robert were very knowledgable and did a great job making us feel comfortable and providing interesting information about Prague, it's history and all there is to do there. It helped us plan out our stay over the next few days. Also got to Stop for a snack and a beer at the monastery near the castle, which we returned to the next day. I arranged the tour via email with Mary and it couldn't have been easier. Well worth the cost and I would recommend to anyone.
All Inclusive Tour. Fantastic Tour! My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our tour of the city, filled will great food, lots of facts and above all the beautiful views! Fully recommended :)

Delightful way to see the city!. If you're comfortable on a bike there's no better way to experience Prague than by ebike. We did the three hour tour and it was just so enjoyable. Our guide Charles was friendly, professional and knowledgeable and was able to tailor the tour to our interests as we were the only participants. He also gave us tonnes of great tips for the rest of our stay. You will be in great hands with this provider.
Great way for us to see Prague. Alouise, our guide, was great! The tour was fun and informative. Ebikes were easy to learn. So many beautiful sights. Thank you!

First Class. Having ducked out early from a Prague All Inclusive tour as it was so bad, we had missed seeing the Jewish Quarter. Very last minute we booked a Heroes of the Holocaust tour with Premier Prague Tours for the following morning.We arrived for the start of our tour and received a friendly welcome and were informed that we were the only people taking the tour. This was great for us as we do like to ask lots of questions. Robert was our tour guide and his knowledge was second to none. He pointed out all the interesting features and supplemented with additional information as well. He was very easy going, even helping with translation when we wanted to stop for a drink and snack. He explained very clearly the historical sequence of events but also answered our other questions even though they were not related. At one point he was explaining what it was like to grow up in a communist country, which we found fascinating and hugely informative.I would highly recommend using this company rather than "following the orange umbrella".

Heroes of the holocaust. We came across this tour purely by chance after going on a terrible tour with the Prague all inclusive walking tours. We weren't all that sure we even wanted to do another tour but we left our first one early and subsequently missed the Jewish quarter. So we booked up at 8pm for a tour the next morning, which was confirmed within a couple of hours. We arrived and they knew exactly who we were and told us that we were the only ones on the tour! Which turned out to be fantastic, never have I met a more knowledgable enthusiastic tour guide. Robert made our tour an absolute joy, he was a little shy to begin with but soon warmed up, he explained everything fantastically and his enthusiasm bought it all to life. He was happy to answer all of our questions, even the ones completely unrelated to the tour! He signposted things for us to visit in the future and showed us the entrances, pointed out nice places to eat and even translated for us so we could have a snack! He is an absolute credit to the company, as were the other members of staff we met before our tour. Everyone was so welcoming and made us feel important which was something we hadn't had before! If you're visiting Prague, this is the tour to go for, the all inclusive walking tour may be more popular but in my opinion it is not worth it. Book Prague premier tours instead, you will not be disappointed. We will definitely be going back to them next time we visit.

A Primo Operation. All of the staff were just wonderful and helpful on any questions about Prague. We took the E Bike ride with Charles and he was very knowledgeable about his city and he took us everywhere. The E Bike is the way to go when there are hills. You must try this tour out. From Tom Bay Area Bicycles Corpus Christi, Texas

Fantastic e-bike city tour. It was fantastic. A local family with English background. Very friendly and very helpful during booking and pre tour! Tour guides knew their stuff and make you understand their city. And to top all this the most eye catching tour on an ebike that allows you to discover a city like Prague at its best, we are pleased to have checked trip advisor and found you. The three hours are really worth it. Bread roll, apple, chocolate bar and water included and we even were presented with a bottle of Sparkling wine for our anniversary. Thank you Mary

Great family e-bike tour. The four of us, two parents, our 17 year old daughter an 10 year old son had a great afternoon. Two relaxed and well-informed guides took us around Prague's center and learned us a lot. Together with driving an e-bike it was an experience to recommend to anyone.

An awesome e-bike tour. This week, I took part in e-bike tour through Prague with my friends and it was an unforgettable experience. Since I was in Prague for the first time, this tour was very informative and unique for me. The whole tour took us for about 3 hours and we could see the main sites of this beautiful city. We were able to see the whole historic centre of Prague in a short time, but we were not rushed. We had a lot of time to listen to the commentary of our guide, taking photos or refreshments. The e-bikes were awesome and easy to ride. The biggest gratitude goes to our guide Viliam. His commentary was amazing. He was a really nice guy, very knowledgeable and full of enthusiasm. Thanks a lot for a great experience and I highly recommend this tour to everyone, who is in Prague for the first time.

Fun, you cover a lot of ground - great to get an overview and some offbeat stuff. The tour covers a set route that provides a great view and overview of the Old City and the Lesser Town from up high. The electric bikes are both fun and efficient. It is a nice complement to the regular tours of smaller areas and also provides some thrills down the hills. Snacks and bottled water comes with the tour, and the guides are very attentive to safety.

ebikes are amazing. We recently did an ebike tour around Prague and absolutely loved it! It was a great way to see a lot of the city. Our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and very willing to answer any of our questions. The snack picnic was so fun to sit and enjoy while we looked down on the city! The ebikes were a blast to ride and just as you all predicted we all think we need them now!

Excellent tour, enthusiatic guide. Me and my girlfriend had a great time renting Ebikes, and we had a private guided tour to see some of the key points in Prague. The e-bikes are fun and easy to drive and you can cover a lot of ground with them. I higly recommend booking this for the first day you are in the city, so that you will know where to hang out the rest of the time!

Amazing e-bike tour!. Myself and my husband took part in the 3 hour e-bike tour up to Prague castle and the monastery brewery, and we would highly recommend. Our two guides, Alois and Bert, were full of great knowledge about Prague, and so funny on top of that! It was a great way to see some of the main sites of Prague, as well as a fantastic view over Prague from the monastery. The bikes were fantastic, and we barely had to peddle to get around. We would highly recommend to anyone who is visiting Prague!

Fantastic way to see Prague. First time on an ebike for me- fantastic fun! Great way to explore the hills around Prague with spectacular views of the city. Our guide was knowledgable and friendly and made sure we were safe from traffic at all times. Nothing he could do about the cobblestones though, except cast a positive spin on things by calling it a "Prague massage"..! Walking through the elevated parklands may well have killed us on a hot summers day so the ebike was a perfect travel option. Do the tour- it is SO worth it.

Best tour experience in Prague. I thoroughly enjoyed our e-bike tour through Prague. It had a balanced mix of tour explanations and riding time. Alouise and Eric were super friendly and made the tour that much more enjoyable! Great tour for those that want to do something sporty while also seeing few of the many spectacular views of the city.

Great way to see the city. A 3 hour private Segway tour, stopping at all the important locations, including the monastery brewery. Though we were running over time, we weren't rushed. Our guide, Robert, was very knowledgeable about his city and clearly loved it. Lunchtime snack provided. Of all the Segway tours we saw in the city, our guide was the only one that we saw wearing a helmet. A clear commitment to safety. Really welcoming owners of the business. Highly recommended.

An awesome E-biking experience throughout Prague. I had the chance to discover the "E-Bike Tour" with some friends of mine at the end of a sunny afternoon in Prague. I must admit this activity was one of the best moment I had in the Czech Republic capital city. Not only the tour is cool for those who enjoy riding a bike and doing some sport but also for those who want to discover specific and funny information about the city. As an extremely professional fellow, the "E-Bike guide" was totally available to answer our questions and propose us a state-of-the-art track through astonishing spots in the city. I can't but encourage you to try this wonderful experience that made my Czech journey even more unforgettable.

A great time discovering Prague and its secrets. I had a really good time during this tour. It was my first time on an electrical bike and, although we made quite a big tour around Prague; it was always effortless (even on steep roads).The guide was very passionate about the city and full of knowledge. Despite the fact that lived in Prague for 6 months, he taught me alot about architecture and anecdotes about this wonderful town. Besides being interesting the visit was always on friendly and funny tone. We had more the impression of a hike with friends than a regular visit!I strongly recommend this tour for any history/art lovers, and no need to be a great sportsman to do it!

A superb E-Bike Tour or Prague. Went on a City Tour with this company and i can honestly say it was a super experience.A lovely couple run this business and are very friendly and helpful.The bikes are an excellent way to see the city and very easy to ride,almost effortless.The tour takes you across the river and 90 percent of it is cycle paths and quite areas to the hills and parks overlooking the city,so very safe.We had Robert as a guide who was full of knowledge and very enthusiastic about his city and country,having lived there all his life.He was knowledgeable from art to architecture and history,and always willing to answer any questions. all in all a great experience so a big thank you to them all.

E-bike Tour. We did the eBike tour with Allouise. He was great and the bikes where great. I can't imagine biking some of the hills in Prague without an eBike. It just gives you that little bit of an extra boost that you need. You get to see a lot f the city with the bike from various parks, great views and the John Lennon wall. We stopped a lot along the way to walk through the castle briefly, walk through the cathedral briefly, and we learned a lot about history and Prague folklore. Great tour and we highly recommend this company!!

Best food tour in Prague!. We booked this food tour online for 3 people while we were still in Australia. We were corresponding with Mary who was very quick with her email replies. On the day, we met our guide Elois (not sure if I spelt that correctly). Took us to some nice restaurants to taste beer, wine and their local food. He tried to personalize it to what we wanted as we don't really drink beer. A lot of variety and definitely worth it if it's your first time to Prague. We had previously randomly gone to a few places on our own and they were all let downs compared to the places he took us. The tour was expensive but well worth it. The service at the restaurants and the wine tasting was much better than any of the places we experienced ourselves around Prague. Food was cooked perfectly. Elois is also a certified tour guide and told us a bit of history of places we walked by. Don't let his scruffiness fool you. He is very knowledgable and was able to answer all our questions with detailed explanations.

Food tour. We happened upon this food tour somewhat indirectly while we were in Prague this last week. We contacted Mary who immediately responded with booking and requests about food allergies which did impact our family. When we arrived for our tour, everything proceeded along beautifully. We had a private tour with Robert who was a fund of knowledge about not only food but Czech and European history in general. It was very eye-opening for my mid-20s children who were not aware of the historical significance of this part of Europe over the last century and I appreciated the free instruction as well! The food choices were very indicative of Czech culture and there was an abundance of beer and wine as well! We were stuffed! I highly recommend this tour to anyone desiring a professional food tour that was very intimate and tailored to our needs as well.

Great way to see Prague. This establishment is located close to the Old Town, and minutes walking from the Marriot/Hilton. We were a group of 4 and had two guides (Charles and Bert). Though it was only a 3 hour tour, they packed us a nice snack and provided water. Our tour around the outskirts of Old Town gave us great strategic views. The e-bikes are ideal for the hills of Prague. The guides gave us great suggestions of what to do and where to go afterwards. Great tour for initial intro to Prague. Their shop is located behind a courtyard.

You will Never want a Normal Bike Again! EBikes are AWESOME!. If you are in Prague, please ignore the Segway tourist traps and go for a tour on an E-Bike with this great company!! Prague is flanked with hills upon more hills and with these E-Bikes we were able to glide effortlessly all over Prague to see some of the most amazing sites with 2 great tour guides!!This tour was definitely a highlight of our trip. The guides did a great job of taking us to all of the major sites! They were even kind enough to let us get off of our backs for an unscheduled stop so we could walk through St. Vitus cathedral next to Prague castle! They packed a lovely snack for us as well, which my husband was especially thankful for as he's of course always hungry!!Take this tour if you are in Prague and it won't disappoint!

Another GREAT bike tour of Prague. My wife and I did this Ebike tour about 1 1/2 years ago on our first visit to Prague. This time, we brought our son and decided to take him on the tour we enjoyed so much last time. None of us were disappointed, from the amazing welcome from Mary ("I remember you!") to the guided easy bike ride with our two guides, we all had a blast. DEFINITELY worth doing when you're in Prague. The bikes are motorized and help make the hills a breeze to navigate. Worth the money and the time for anyone visiting this amazing city. Thanks again for a great adventure!!

EBikes Rule!!! Fantastic!!!. For anyone worried about the Ebikes don't. They are great. We booked for an afternoon 2pm tour. Luckily we were the only two and Charlie (Karol I hope I got it right) our guide was absolutely fantastic. My wife was a bit unsure about using the bike but he was very patient and encouraging. We were gone for over 3 hours and the time just flew by. Our tour covered all the main sights with a lot of local knowledge and we were guided in and around traffic very safely. All in all I would highly recommend the hire and tour to anybody. Helmets are provided and they fit like no other helmet I have ever used before. A Snackpack and water were also part of the cost. Have a beer at the Monestry Brewery under a shady tree!!

You NEED to do this when in Prague!!. E-bike Tour is absolutely amazing! So easy to do & the bikes are a real joy! This is honestly the best & quickest way to see the city. It's completely safe, granting you know how to cycle! The staff are brilliant fun & extremely knowledgeable! I cannot recommend this activity enough, I nearly want to do it again before I go home!Thanks guys :-)

Prague on ebike.. It's THE package. A welcoming lady when you show up. A charming man preparing your ebike. Truly human and authentically friendly. A tour guide that knows his stuff well and makes you feel good. And to top all this. The most exciting and eye and heart catching tour on an ebike that allows you to discover a city like Prague from its best side. Am I glad I found that online. These three hours are worth it. And they even provide you with an apple and water. Yes. Do it.

Great city and food tour!. This was basically a private tour with a local. He took us to 6 different great food and drink places and stopped and told us history and fun facts about the city and the locations we walked past. All the food was great and there was a lot of it! Great tour guide!

Ebike and Running Tour. Excelent way to know Prague!
Ebike tour is wonderful and it's so easy cycling!
Running tour is also a different and very interesting way to enjoy the city!
Mary and the guides are so friendly!

Mr Gary James. BRILLIANT FOOD TOUR More my partner's idea than mine, we plumped for this company as we'd enjoyed a bike tour with them on a previous visit.Having never done a food tour, I wasn't quite sure what to expect but was really impressed with the whole experience.We ate in a correct order and got to sample a nice variety. For me,the beer tasting had an amazing wow factor but everywhere was top notch. The guide was both friendly and interesting and we got on well with the other couple on the tour which was a bonus.Highly recommended.

Ebike and Food tours.. We took 2 tours the Ebike tour and the food tour with our 13 and 11 yr old kids and loved the both!We were very pleased with the Ebike tour and the fact that there were 2 guides. One was always in the front and one in the rear. This made us feel more comfortable and safe especially since we had the kids with us. There is no way we would have navigated the 16km up the hills without the ebikes. The views were amazing!The food tour was the best we've ever done! One of our kids has a corn allergy and they made sure none of our tastings had corn. It was a great balance between food and drink. My favorite drink was the fresh Rosemary "lemonade" that they made for the kids at the beer tasting. I also was surprised to have lemonade water keifer at the dessert place - a drink that is usually only served by home brewers. It was lovely! My favorite foods were the pickled cheese and beef dish. My only critique is that I would skip the Spanish restaurant so to have more time to savor the food and drinks at the other restaurants. We were a little rushed the last few places. The regional wine was excellent- I bought 4 bottles to take home!

A wonderful way to experience Prague. Was on a private segway tour with my mum as we were in Prague to celebrate her birthday. Among the best experiences during the weekend, even if the rain was pouring most of the tour. We were both beginners, but felt completely safe with the wonderful guide Miguel. Got to know a lot about Prague, not only about history, but also about life in Prague today. Also got to se far more than we would have by sightseeing by foot. Good and service minded company. Definitly recommend it!

Great way to see the city!. We decided to do the Ebike tour based on the great reviews. We had never done electric biking before but it is really easy and fun. The tour covers a lot of ground that would be really difficult on foot. Our tour guide was "Charlie" -he was fantastic. The other tour members never made it so we ended up with a private tour. Charlie was so knowledgeable and friendly. I would recommend doing this on the very first day as the tips on what to see/do/eat are super helpful. Also, they keep the tour size small which is really nice as we saw some huge tour groups in Prague - it didn't look manageable or fun to be in a very large tour group. Overall, highly recommend!

Great opportunity to see many-sided view from Prague. We had only two days in Prague and we wanted to get many-sided view from the city. We decided to test e-bikes and that was terrific choice :). The tour takes 3 hours and after that we did know what we want to see and do during the trip. With e-bikes you can go places, where you can´t go by buses or where is to far to go by walk. We visit many places and get intresting information for Prague history. Guides speaks very good english and was so friendly. Thanks very much!!

Just do it!! you will not regret.... Karel, our guide was warm and friendly.We was very knowledgeable about the areas we visited. This was the perfect way to see the city on the first day visiting Prague.

Ebike tour of Prague. We LOVED and have already recommended this tour. The Ebike is the best way to get around the hills for 3 hours. I happen to ride but my co travellers do not and found this very easy, sorry we didn't even break a sweat and we had someone in the back as well so we felt very safe. It was great for up hill and down hills. But why THIS company, well, I couldn't have expected to learn so much about what I was seeing, rather than just "what I was seeing". Robert was amazing and they even packed a cute snack for us with apples, bottled water and chocolate wafers! Do this with them. You won't regret it.

Excellent tour of Prague. EBike is a great way to see Prague and I thoroughly recommend it. We booked online and arrived prior to the tour for a few basics of how the bike works. There were 3 of us on the tour plus the 2 guides. The guides had excellent knowledge and made the tour fun. We covered a lot of Prague and as we did not want a break they added extra places into the tour for us. Plenty of photo opportunities and snacks and a drink included. Well worth the money and definitely recommend it when visiting Prague and the electric bikes were fun too.

E-Bikes are THE MOST FUN. I've never ridden an electric bike before, but holy cow, so fun!! Prague is the perfect place to ride them, tons of bike paths with amazing views of the city. Definitely recommend this!

Fun and Friendly. I went on a two person tour of Prague and it was fantastic, the tour guides were friendly, funny and had lots of interesting facts about the city. It was such a great way to see Prague and the E-bikes make cycling up hill a dream!!! I highly recommend to anyone that wants a great day of exploration and beautiful views.

Prefect introduction to the city. We booked onto the tour 'out of season' so they put on the tour especially for us. There was only two if us on the tour and our amazing guide took us through how to use the e-bikes before we set off. We were also provided with water and snacks. The e-biked were incredibly easy to use and took be by surprise just how fast they went when you kept peddling. Karel, our guide was incredibly warm and friendly and really made our tour personal and special. We was very knowledgeable about the areas we visited and really easy to talk to. This was the perfect way to see the city as we covered to much ground.

Can not recommend them enough. Myself and my friend did an ebike tour on a lovely warm February day. Meant to last 3 hours we were shown around for closer to 4 as a private tour kindly arranged by the owners out of season. It was an excellent day and our guide Karel was so accommodating allowing us to stop for pictures, taking us to many interesting places and always having a story or 2 to tell. Karel was aware of Edinburgh where we come from so was able to say this area is similar to this and relate things to our knowledge and experience.We did a full tour of the city and saw all the main attractions and I assure you the bike absolutely does all the work for you. We even stopped for a beer and a chat half way through the day and to say it was like an old friend showing you their home is the best way to explain the experience.I can not recommend this activity or this company enough and so glad we chose the ebike rather than a segway tour. Safety was a top priority alongside our enjoyment and we left with a packed lunch which we hadn't expected, great memories and a list and map marked with recommended things for us to do and see for the rest of our visit.I say again, excellent experience and absolutely something to try.

Fun and Informative Tour. It took some sweet talking to get my husband to do a bike tour in Prague. This was a last minute booking and it turned out to be much better than expected! The tour lasted about 3 hours, which was the perfect amount of time to keep my husbands attention. The Ebikes were a fun, fast way to make our way around the city and it really took no exertion on our part to power the bikes - great for making our way up to the castle. The guides were informative and quite hilarious. Would definitely recommend!

It was as if we were visiting old friends who proudly wanted to show us their city.. Despite being a cool day, the hosts of eBikes were prepared to see we got off to a good start, outfitting us with added gloves and jackets as well as with substantial helmets. We were suitably trained in the use of our eBikes and closely monitored as to our skill level as we launched our tour. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable, engaging and courteous adjusted the tour to our requirements. Really, it was as if we were riding with an old friend. The manner in which he guided us was conscientious, keeping us out of harms way. The route included not only the significant focal points of the city, such as Prague Castle and Charles Bridge, but along paths and through parks that offered spectacular views of Prague. It is a great way to be introduced to Prague and to entice one to pursue a more in depth investigation of its culture and focal points.

Loved our Ebike Tour!!!. We had a fantastic tour of Prague with Ebikes. We took the classic tour which covered all of the main sites in Prague. It was a bit chilly so instead of eating our snacks which they provided, we stopped for beers at a monastery. Our guides were so knowledgable and gave a ton of detailed information on Prague. This was a real highlight for our trip to Prague. I highly recommend this tour.

Fantastic Ride - Great Guides!. We thought twice about going on this tour since the weather did not cooperate with our plans. Despite the light drizzle, we decided to go for it, and we were so glad we did. Although we spent quite of bit of time IN the city on our own, the bike tour gives you an entirely different perspective on the outskirts of the city. The e-bikes were so much fun (very little effort - this will NOT be a workout!), the guides were extremely knowledgable, funny and friendly, and we saw several sights that we would have otherwise missed. We highly recommend the tour - you won't be sorry!!
some of my best spent hours in Prague!. Easy route, excellent guides and new well functionally bikes! A lot of information and most interesting places to see.

Great tour of Prague. Just the two of us this afternoon so ended up having a private tour. Ebikes made the tour really easy... Too easy :) had a lot of fun on this tour highly recommend as something to do at the start of your Prague visit.

Amazing! Great way to see the city. What an amazing Tour! We were newbies to the whole Segway thing and it was very simple and loved it. It is definitely the way to get around. We had our own private Tour Guide and he was great! We really got to see alot of the city and were able to get some really nice shots together! I would totally recommend this company. They were extremely professional and cautious through out! My only recommendation is that they should provide two routes...those for first timers to Prague and those that are visiting again....may a tour of New Town. I will look up and see if they have another Segway route when i plan my trip return trip to Prague! Great Job Ebike!

Awesome Tour!!!. Alois and Rob were terrific! Alois the comedian; Rob the historian. Professional outfit with great knowledge. Small groups and take time to answer all your questions etc. Ebikes are really easy to use. Provided with lunch and water and stop off for a beer too. Couldn't recommend this place any more. JUST DO IT!

Great tour with an amazing crew!. We've been to an e-bikes tour guided. by Alois and Carel. They taught us so many things about each and every site we saw and gave us a lot of tips for the rest of our trip in Czech Republic (not only about Prague).The tour pretty sum up all of the interesting places in Prague (Besides the obvious ones everybody visit anyway, such as Wenceslas square and Old town square).We would really like to thank Mary and her husband (Sorry for not remembering the name) for being so nice and friendly - they even let us use one of their own coats since we didn't have one warm enough.Extremely recomended for every one who looks for an informative tour with a friendly attitude and having the nice experience of using e-bikes at the same time.Matan & Liron.

Super tour. The tour with ordinary bikes were fully booked so we choosed the e-bike tour instead. It was a great tour with Robert as an exellent guide. We actually got a private tour since nobody else had prebooked. It was really fun cykling an e-bike. We felt very strong going up hills :-). Exellent way to get an overview of prague.We really recommend it.

Perfect use of time. Because of the rain, I ended up being the only participant riding with Alois. I was slightly apprehensive as the rain was quite heavy and it was a little treacherous with the slippery cobblestones that Prague is known for. The beautiful views and Alois' engaging stories more than occupied my mind and I ended up happily buzzing along on the ebike. The company was really detailed in preparing ponchos, gloves, water and a lovely snack box which they packed for me to bring with me after the ride as we could not stop for a picnic due to the rain. I was glad I went for an ebike as there were a few slopes along the route which would be challenging to maneuver a manual bike on. I would heartily recommend ebike Prague for the views, the care and just overall fun. A word of advice, if you are not already comfortable on a manual bicycle normally, perhaps consider postpone the tour if it were raining as the route can be a little tricky when wet.

Great way to see prague. We did this on our first day to get an idea of Prague and where the landmarks are etc. guide was great and we had a private tour as we managed to be the only ones to book for the Sunday afternoon. Well worth the money in the E bikes too!

Best way to view Prague. Highly recommened! Best way to get an overview of Prague. The e-bikes are easy to paddle even if riding uphill, and we felt completely safe throughout the trip because there were guides both in front and following behind the group. The guides are also friendly with good English and also good sense of humour.

Great Tour. What a great 3 hours! Was nervous to do the ride as I do not like going down steep hills but i have to admit that I had nothing to worry about. You sign in, get fitted with your bike and your helmet and then are given instructions on how the ebike works. Essentially it is always on, gives you a boost when you first start off and then you can press the boost button to help get you up the hills and on flat land. We did this on our last day, just how it worked out and still loved it. To do it at the beginning of the trip would have been great but did not work out that way. It is hard to believe that you travel around 16km in total with about 6 stops including a lunch break to learn some history and interesting facts about Prague. You get to visit the castle grounds and are taken around the courtyards and inside the "free" part of St. Vitus and given some background history. We still learned stuff even though we had been on a castle tour a few days earlier. The best part we thought was you get to see a lot of the parks like Letna and Petrin area, something hard to do in a short visit. Would highly recommend to everyone.

Fantastic experience. Decided to do the ebike tour as we thought it would be an interesting way to see the city. It was a fantastic experience. The tour guides were very friendly and were knowledgeable of the city. The tour brought us up to the hills where we got some magnificent views of the city. We were allowed time to take in the sites and to take some pictures if we wished. The tour also brought is to the lesser town and and to the castle. The guides also gave us a lot of recommendations for things to do during our stay in Prague. During the tour we were also provided with a picnic outside a brewery where we were given the option of getting a beer (the nicest beer we had throughout our stay) I would definitely recommend this tour

Must do!. We booked with ebike for our first full day in Prague. Started at 10am which was great - had heaps of time to go back to places in the afternoon. The guides were very helpful & gave us lots of tips along the way. Super easy riding the ebike as its mostly just steering. Would definitely recommend.

Great way to spent a few hours. Very professional, delightful guides and owners. Can highly recommend this way to see Prague, hadn't ridden a bike for years, found the bikes easy to ride and manage. Felt very safe. A small snack and water supplied.

Ebike those cobbled streets. From the first point of contact, we had a great experience. Only 5 minutes from our hotel, we found it with no bother. On arrival we met the two friendly English owners who chatted away with the group and fitted us with our ebikes and helmets. Both were comfortable, new and professional looking. We were then introduced to our two friendly Czech guides who gave a brief instruction of how to use the bikes and off we went with one at the front and one at the back to ensure the small group stayed together through traffic lights. The tour was informative at designated stops but the emphasis was on sight seeing and getting a good lay of the land of Prague which helped us on our second day as to where we wanted to explore more. A nice surprise was the provision of a light lunch of water, cheese roll, chocolate biscuit, cheese and small bread sticks and an apple which was a nice added extra that wasn't expected. The ebikes are brilliant for exploring the cobbled streets of Prague and are not taxing what so ever. Highly recommend.

Best experience of our trip!. My boyfriend and I have recently returned from inter-railing around Europe. We both agreed that despite visiting Berlin, Munich, Brussels and Amsterdam, our segway experience with Ebike in Prague was the best part of our trip! Our guide was a young girl who lives in Prague. Her English was perfect, and her knowledge of the history, culture and sites of Prague was astounding. She took all of our pictures, could answer any question we asked about anything, and showed us quirky and fun things about Prague that we would have never known otherwise.The segwaying itself was an amazing way to see the city, as we got so much done in such a short amount of time. We were provided with a complementary picnic, which we ate overlooking some breathtaking views of the city. This is a must-do activity if you visit the city. The value for money is amazing (after talking to other couples who went with other companies we found ours was the cheapest!) A massive thank you for our tour guide for making our trip something really special. It's awful that I can't remember her name- but our tour was on September 8 at 10am.

Great way to see Prague. I highly recommend you take this tour. The owners of the company are just delightful to talk to and the guides were fantastic. We got to see a lot of the city, learned about each of the stops in detail, and took some great photos. This is an awesome way to see the city that doesn't wear you out too much.

A fun, exhilarating and interesting tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our e bike tour in Prague and I recommend the experience to anyone who learnt to ride a bike as a child. My husband and I are in our 60's and I am not very fit - but it's so easy. The absolute minimum of effort will get you up any hill!The tour lasted three hours and was, for 90% of the time, on cycle paths. The owners and our guide were very friendly and knowledgeable. From the old town we crossed the river and then "sailed" up the hill to make our way through a park from where we had splendid views of the town and the river with it's many beautiful bridges. We stopped at the metronome, the Summer Palace, St Vitus Cathedral as well as various view points and then "sailed" up a second hill before making our way down, through orchards to the river, which we cycled along before turning inland and back to the start.The tour lasts three hours, it's great fun and worth every penny. Many thanks.

Seeing Prague on an EBike. I enjoy a little more active tour than historical tour plus, I have been wanting to try an ebike (electric), so signed up for a 16.5km tour that took us to Letna Park, Prague Castle and Petrin Park, before returning to Old Town. The website clearly shows the route; it was easy to reserve online, which I did about three weeks before my trip and I did not pay until I arrived for the ride. There was one other couple and myself on the ride; we were given brief instructions on safe riding in Prague and on using the ebike (all that was really needed). We had roomy packs on the back of the bike, with snacks and room for personal items. We also got a bottle of water. Robert was our leader - he shared interesting spots and stories along the way. We had time for photo ops. We had a quick stop at the Summer Palace and St. Vitus Cathedral - enough to see the highlights. Robert pointed out a few more things you don't usually hear about from the guidebooks. He was assisted by Hank, an expat from Cleveland, so we enjoyed exchanging stories about the midwest. It is always a bonus to learn about an expat's experiences in a country. All in all - a very enjoyable tour and experience. I am glad I did it!

Fun Ebike Tour in Prague. My husband and I visited Prague for the first time, so we decided to do a Ebike Prague Tour. Every staff is very friendly and professional. Our tour guide Robert and Sara was very helpful navigating through Prague. There are hills, but with our ebike, there was no problem at all. We were able to see beautiful city view from the top of the hill. They also packed us picnic, so we could take a break overlooking the city. It is a great way to see the city.

Great tour, even better staff. Did this tour with my mate last week in Prague. The staff are all friendly, down to earth and love their city. They recommended for a bit more, we do the e-bike tour instead of the standard bike tour as we cover a lot more ground and get out of the city centre. Was a great decision and we got to tour a lot of Prague in just a few hours.The bikes are well maintained and super easy to ride.Recommend to anyone who visits Prague and thanks again guys for a great day.

Fantastic way to see the city!. We pre-booked the ebike tour prior to our trip which was just as well as it turned out to be full. The owner, tour guides Robert and Sara, were absolutely welcoming and approachable. The bikes were all new, clean and so much fun! Pedalling up hills were no bother! We covered around 11 miles of Prague with breathtaking views of the city and clear history and fun with Robert! Absolutely recommend this company for their tours! Great value for money! Very friendly staff! Would don't it all over again!

Best bike tour in Prague. Fantastic bike tour with electric assisted bikes means you go a long way in some hilly terain with minimal effort. Great views and a lot of ground is coveed. The guides have a great knowledge of local history and speak great English making the tour very enjoyable. Probably the best tour we did here in Prague.

Fantastic experience in Prague.. this was the highlight of our time in Prague. Excellent tour giving a fabulous experience. Our local guides were brilliant and both spoke very good English. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour. Electric bikes made the whole ride easy and not strenuous despite the hilly terrain. Thanks heaps, David and Jacqui from New Zealand

Wonderful way to see Prague!. I booked this in advance via email and received an immediate response. My husband and I enjoy bicycling, and ebike was the best way for me to bicycle in Prague because of the hills. The quides were wonderful. We got to see Prague in a fun and exciting way. I am in my 50's and really enjoyed the ebike experience. Thank you for such great guides!!

Very professional company with fun !. We have been on various bike tours in many European cities and this tour and company are up with the best . Normally we would book a traditional bike but Prague is VERY hilly so the use of an ebike is brilliant . The ebikes supplied are modern and well maintained .... The guides know their stuff and offer a fun tour from start to finish . Also the booking process online is easy with great communication as needed from Mary . So yes pick this company and see more of Prague whilst enjoying your stay .

Funny, beautiful, exciting, professional . My friends and i went there on August 11th . The staff was greattt ,friendly, funny ,professional and nice. We were 7 and they always made we were comfortable and that no one is having trouble or missing the sites were amazing and we got an explanation about everything.We truly recommend them.

Best way to see Prague!. My boyfriend and I showed up for our tour a half hour early and we chatted with the owners for a bit. They were so friendly and welcoming - answering any questions that we had and making sure we were comfortable with our ebikes. Our guide (Elewis?) was fantastic. We felt safe on the road and trails as he would let us know what we were going to be doing right before we did it. He also pointed out good tourist spots and non-tourist spots for later in our trip. The ebikes have quite the boost on them! The bikes were so effortless that I had more fun focusing on the scenery. I did find that the standard ebike was a bit big for me. The owner had offered to change the seat for me back in the shop but said it wouldn't be as comfortable as the standard one. Also when going downhill, relying on the brakes was difficult as my hands were a bit too small to comfortably grip the brakes. But that was just a minor problem to me as I didn't feel as if I was in danger. The stops on the tour are phenomenal. A great variety of tourist attractions to peak our interest and definitely a good "first stop" of our Prague vacation. Three hours was the perfect amount of time for the tour - including time to eat our delicious complimentary snacks (and grab a beer!)I would recommend this company to anyone who is looking for a relaxing, exciting way to explore Prague. Fantastic customer service from start to finish, knowledgeable guides, and fantastic sights.

The tour that brightens your trip. I had so much fun during the 3-hour tour on the E-bike with Laura and Robert. My experience exceeded my expectations after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor.After few weeks, I still remember the ride we had. We explored nice parts of Prague and got to know lots of history and culture through both guides. The views were awesome allowing for great pictures. The stop at Prague Castle was fantastic and Laura had a couple of secrets that were a nice touch. The break in the middle of the tour was also memorable with Laura and Robert giving us tips about where to go and which good restaurants to enjoy.The E-bike themselves are so much fun. And I thoroughly enjoyed the 'race' we were allowed to do at a point during the tour (although I lost).Highly, highly recommended!!
EBike Guided Tour - Brilliant way to see Prague. Amazing experience and an incredible way to see Prague.A must, excellent knowledgeable guides, not to be missed

Brilliant way to get a feel for Prague. When we booked our ebike tour we were initially worried that it was going to be too hot and not at all enjoyable... it was 34 degrees on the day we went. How wrong we were, this was one of the best ways we could have spent that hot sunny morning. The ebikes are fantastic, you peddle and the electric motor kicks in and you glide through the city and even up the steepest of hills with little effort. (Other than when one of us accidentally turned off our electric motor!) Along with the great bikes comes the brilliant staff and tour guides. Having been briefed on the bikes... given our complementary picnic and water we were on our way with our guide to get a great overview and feel for Prague. The cycle route is great and takes in parts of Prague you would struggle to see all of on foot or by public transport. Our guide was knowledgeable and fun and indulged us in stopping and taking pictures at many points throughout the trip. This tour is a great way to spend a fun morning or afternoon whatever the weather. We had a great time thank you.

Segway was fun but first-timers proceed with caution!. The husband and I had fun on the 3 hour Segway tour of Prague. Tour itself was great, and we covered 15km all up. Was my first time on the Segway and not being a sporty person I found it relatively easy on the straight but did have a 'near miss' coming down a slope (yes, there are a few!) but came away unscathed except perhaps for the ego! The husband on the other hand had his speed jacked up by the tour guide and couldn't be happier!! So if you are a first timer then proceed with caution unless you are a snowboarder/skier etc then you'll feel right at home in no time as BALANCE is required down the slope! eBike - would recommend that you change the FAQ on your website ("I've never ridden a Segway before, is there any training required?") - I don't think we got even 5 minutes training? I do commend eBike for only doing private Segway tours (rather than large groups), as during our tour we did see some Segway groups and one lady who came off while trying to 'park' the Segway on a flat surface!

Amazing tour. The best tour we have been on!. We love bike tours and have done them in many cities. This now takes the trophy for the best we have done. The company is highly professional. When we arrived the bikes were ready in pairs and equipped with cold water bottles and snack boxes. I have never been given this on any tour. The bikes are amazing. I have never ridden an ebike but it was amazing. It makes the 16kms seem like a breeze. I also think this would help people that may be reluctant to choose a bike tour due to body ailments or age. Very accessible. The tour has a maximum of 10 riders. Love this!You get two guides which makes sense. One at the front and one at the back. Good if something happens on the tour then one can attend to it whilst the tour moves on. I have never had this on a tour.Our guides were fabulous. They knew so many different things and had a great way of engaging the group. They knew so much about Prague, both the historical facts and more off-beat information. There were plenty of stops with awesome views, great street art and beautiful parks. The guides are just fabulous. I know you will love this tour. It is the best in Prague and the best I have been on.

Great Introduction to Prague. We did the evening tour on the day of our arrival in Prague. Making a reservation was easy via email. It looked like we would be the only ones on the tour, but two other groups joined us last minute. So, we had some touring companions from Israel and Canada. As soon as we started out, it began to pour rain. Laura, our "front guide" had us stop under a tree and give us a great introduction to Prague while we waited for the rain to stop. The ride was a bit bumpy on the cobblestones. I was a little more timid about riding but our "back guide" stayed with me the whole time letting me go at my own pace. The weather turned cold after the rain, so the guides took us on a detour to get warmed up at a great little cafe. The ebikes are a great way to get around with Prague's hills and the guides are very helpful and informative.

An amazing way to see Prague. Just the best way to see Prague if you ask me!! I had a great tour guide who knew loads about the great city. I was shown loads and the three hour tour was just perfect... the views I seen, and photos I captured would never have been possible without the route the guide took me on. Having previously done segway tours in other cities and Prague having majority cobbled roads, I thought I'd try the electric bikes this time for a smoother ride... what a great decision that was. The electric bikes are just fantastic, not much effort at all to get around the city and the seats a very comfortable. It's also worth mentioning how great their mobile website is to navigate... a great run company who puts the customers first. I'd highly recommend to do the tour on your first day in Prague. Thanks for the great experience!!

A definite RECOMMEND!!. Easy pedaling & fun facts along the way. After touring castles and museums, this was a welcome change & family fav. We saw parts of Prague that we wouldn't have seen on our own and the guides were wonderful.

AMAZING!!!!! So much fun!. This was one of THE BEST tour I have ever been on. The EBikes were awesome, took some getting used to, but a lot of fun!!We ended up being a 2 person tour, so we were off with 2 people and 2 tour guides! It was the BEST TIME! Our guides were amazing, a lot of fun, and very knowledgeable on all things Prague. The company even provides you with a snack which we ate outside of our guides favorite coffee shop.It wasn't a hugely in-depth tour, but we we able to hit a lot of the major spots and see Prague from up high! I would definitely go again with this company, husband and wife owned - they were amazing to deal with as well!!THIS is the bike trip in Prague!!! DO IT!

Great way to see the city. This was a great time with very nice guides. If you are an athlete looking for a workout, this is not your tour. Although you pedal the bikes the motor works so well, anyone could do it. We cover lots of territory in 3 hours, and the information was more laid back. I would recommend for those people who don't like touring every single thing. It moved at a good pace with some nice info but not too much.

Odd but fun. I thought there would be a button you press for power. There isn't. You pedal a bit and it takes you off flying! You get used to it after a few minutes and the uphills are a joy.The tour gives you some decent views over the city and you get some time at the "castle" and "gothic" cathedral - castle is like an office building and the cathedral (like many things in Prague) is not as old as it seems. For about £30 for 3 hours, this is a fine way to spend your day. Enjoy the Czech massage (ie the plethora of cobbled streets you ride on.)
better and safer than segway. although there is a problem visiting interiors, this is excellent opportunity to see more of Prague than Hop on Hop off tours or Segway
Wonderful way to see Prague!. This was an amazing tour on our first day in Prague. Loads of historical information and soooooooo much fun! Guides www exceptional and wonderful. Highly recommended!

Fun way to get quick overview of Prague!. Prague is huge! It's impossible to get a quick overview by walking it. It's also very hilly and the Ebikes were an easy and comfortable way to cover a lot of up and down territory in 3 hours. My husband and I are in our 60's and loved the bikes!The owners are very nice. We arrived late and missed the tour as we got lost walking from our hotel. The owners actually sent us out with a separate guide to catch up with the group. The guide was careful to provide commentary along the way so we wouldn't have missed any part of the tour.Highly recommend!

See Prague without killing yourself. A great way to see the city. With the hilly terrain, Prague can be tough to get around. These bikes have electric boosters, which can make the long bike trip very easy for people of any age. Friendly and English speaking staff really help.

Great way to see Prague. We did the e-bike tour with Laura for 3 hours - great way to see the city and the Castle especially in the heat (36 degrees in Prague today)!! Laura was an excellent guide - very knowledgable and very fluent in English. Having not been on an electric bike before I found it very easy to use - made going up the hill to the Castle very easy. Included was a lovely packed lunch and a bottle of water. Would highly recommend Ebike Prague Tours!
Great tour, great servis. Me and my friend took the tour, the guid aluise was great. Speakes great english and really knows his stuf. Worth the cost

Fun and easy way to see the city. We usually try and do a bike tours in our travels especially on the first day of a new city. We did it again with this tour and were not disappointed. It's a great way to get an overview of the city. The Ebike was great for the hills and made the tour fun and more enjoyable. You didn't have to work hard going up the hills. Our tour guides were knowledgeable, friendly and kept us safe. They also packed us a nice snack which we enjoyed in the park. Booking was easy and Mary responded promptly. Bikes were easy to ride and in excellent condition. I would highly recommend this bike tour and do it early in your stay.

Great way to see Prague. We did a 3 hour private tour with Ebike Prague and Lucie was our wonderful guide. After a 10 minute instruction on how to ride a segway off we went. The ride was along the sidewalk and also through parks, around the back of the Prague castle and back to the office. We managed to stop at traffic lights and Lucie went nice and slow at the start as we were still learning. Lucie knew a lot about the history of places and was willing to stop along the way to let us take photos where we wanted. She also suggested places to see the best views. We stopped at a brewery and had a beer and E-bike had also prepared a snack box for us, apple, cheese,bread roll and water- all very yummy. We would definitely recommend doing a segway tour of Prague as you see different perspective than walking and are less tired!

A must do in Prague . We took a bike tour on our first day in Prague to get familiar with the city geography, history, and culture. It was a terrific intro and helped us determine what we wanted to do on the few other days we had. Booking was easy and Mary responds very quickly. The bikes were in excellent condition and the staff took time to help us set everything up comfortably. Our guide, Robert, was amazing. He is so knowledgeable about everything. We asked a ton of questions and he made it very accessible for us to understand and put in context. I would highly recommend to everyone and would do our again.

Great segway ride for 3!. We went on a great segway ride around the sights of Prague. I have taken 2 other segway tours in 2 other countries and I think this was very good. We had a personalised 3-hour tour around the city with plenty of stop-offs for photos, but the highlight was probably the packed lunch stop. Wish it never ended.....or, that I owned a segway myself(!).

eBike tour gives you a perspective via distance traveled. I had a great time taking the ebike tour, which is the longest distance-wise of the 3 tours offered by this company. Before I tell you how great it is (5 stars!), let me tell you what it's not: an in-depth history lesson of Prague. You will barely bounce of the surface of history at each stop. So why is this tour so great? Just like life, it's about the journey and distance traveled. You get a great perspective of Prague as you loop around and through the city. The bikes themselves are fun and easy to use, when you pedal the bike (and yes, there is a little pedaling involved), the bike propels itself forward via the electric motor, so every pedal you do is equal to, say, 10 pedals on a normal bike. The cobble stones can make certain sections bumpy and uncomfortable. I recommend standing up on the bike on those sections to protect your bottom. There was a break with a snack in the middle, which was was really nice, as you can sit around and get to know your fellow tourists and form some comraderie. The couple (British, I think?) that owns the tour was super nice, and they had cold water bottles attached to the bikes as we were assigned bike and helmet, this is a well-planned operation (helmets are optional, btw, I took one because it's stupid not to, imho). Helmets were comfortable.
Best bike tour in Europe! . I've done 6 or 7 bike tours across Europe, and this was *easily* the best. Amazing guide, food provided and lots of fun! I highly recommend doing this.

Fabulous tour. Even in the rain, we had a gorgeous tour of Prague with our lovely Spanish guide. We had never been on an Ebike before but it was easy to adapt to its speediness. Due to the rain, other clients postponed so we had a tour to ourselves. Great introduction to this beautiful city. The morning tea break at a micro brewery was very pleasant and the hill climbs were a dream. Very warm professional operation.

Great time exploring the city. I loved the Ebike! I will have to buy one now! The tour was so much fun! Kinda scary at first because it goes fast, but a great time! Our tour guild Laura and Linda were wonderful! Highly recommend if you want to see the city!

Fun time. From our initial contact til the end of our tour, this was a very professional well run experience. Mary was very responsive by email answering all of my questions and concerns responsively and expeditiously.The Electric bikes are lots of fun and extremely easy to use not requiring much physically, if you so choose. We had a very comprehensive tour that even included some of Prague Castle complex. The guides were very responsive and the snack provided was more than substantial (and tasty)It was a fun and exhilarating day that we thoroughly enjoyed.

Best tour in Prague. If you like bike riding and seeing all of a city in 1 day, DO THIS. Seriously, this was a great tour. The 2 guides make sure you are happy, the bike is working well and are there to answer any questions of the town. We had never riden electric bikes before, but these were EASY. No really, one rotation and you could get up any hill and boy did we. We had some older couples on our tour in their 70's and did great. How can you say no? Do this.

no other way to see Prague during a short visit. This idea is excellent, our guide, Nicholas, booked us in at the last minute and took us on a 3 hour bike ride around so much of Prague which one could normally only see over a few days, and even some places I think the regular tourist would not see. Great for the outdoor type of person who can ride a bike well but also does not want to put too much energy into the journey. Would do it again! loved every moment, great fun and saw loads of the city.

Fun morning around Prague. The Ebike team accommodated us last minute and they were so friendly throughout. We had a fun group of people from Scotland, Korea and us from the USA. We had a great time with our guide, sometimes joking around and other times discussing serious subjects like communism, WWII, anti semitism and the floods. Happy we chose this as a start to our first full day in Prague.It is extremely hot in Prague right now so we're glad we did the morning tour.

Do this on your first day. Like my title says, do this on your first day in Prague. You'll learn a lot about the city, and find places that you will want to visit later. The eBike was great. It allowed a not-so-thin guy as me to go on the 3 hour tour with minimal effort.

The most exciting and fun way to see Prague!. I can't thank the Ebike Prague Tour team enough for their wonderful service. The guides were so friendly and knowledgeable it truly made our first day in Prague so exciting! From all the beautiful sights to the history our guides made sure we got to see and learn so much. The Ebikes were amazing, the perfect way to travel around the city, they gave you the perfect boost of energy when you needed it, my fiancé is now convinced we need electric bikes at home. Thanks again Ebike Prague Tour team!!

Doesn't get better than this. Two great guides, lovely talk with owner, incredible electric bikes (wow!), perfect overview tour with a surprising amount of history. Snacks. Reasonable price - Very very happy patron.

The only way to travel!. Fantastic service and the best bikes, tour guides and snacks. The English couple who own the business have really ensured nothing is left to chance. A must do way to experience the city of Prague with local tour guides that absolutely love what they do.

The reviews here are spot-on. Normally we like to do the push-bike tours, but due to the hilly nature of the some of the highlights, we went for the e-bikes! Bets decision we made. The best sites and views would not have been accessible without the added boost e-bikes gave. We are a family of five, our twins are 10 years old, they had no problem with the child size e-bikes available. Mary and Sol run a tight ship, and are not pushy in any way (not always the case with some operators). They think of every small detail including snacks and water for the tour. The length of the tour, time spent at each location and the number of rest stops was all spot-on.Our two tour guides were Czek Nationals (I think Alois and Linda), and both were very knowledgable in the history of Prague (actually they seemed very knowledgable in a wide range of topics). It was good spend time with both. Having two guides, one leading and one following, was reassuring. Much of the tour is on bike paths, but some is on the roads with traffic, both guides were very conscious of road safety.As many have stated, THIS IS UNDOUBTEDLY THE BEST WAY TO SEE PRAGUE!

Best way to see Prague. This is definitely the best way to see Prague away from the tourist crowds. It allowed us to see places a regular tour bus couldn't take us. Alois and Linda were excellent guides. The picnic in the park overlooking the city was a pleasant touch. Mary and Sol run a professional tour group. Thanks for the wonderful time. P.s. There is a very nice sea food restaurant (SeeFish) next door.

Highlight of trip. This was worth the hype. Saw a lot of sights I wouldnt have seen otherwise. The bikes were awesome. Almost too easy. Our guides were great too. Laura and another really funny guy in a pink jacket (sorry I forgot your name). Good amount of history with out being completely boring. Book the 6pm in. Nice temperature and nice light to take pics.

The most fun biking ever!. AWESOME!!!!! This is the second time I have been on Ebikes and each time is more fun than the last. The first time I went by myself. This last time, I had to bring my friend, James, because I knew he would love it! Sage is such a good tour guide and her knowledge of the city is so solid and unique. I've lived in Prague for 6 years and she knew things about the city I had no clue about. PLUS, the whole time I was riding the Ebike, all I kept saying was "WEEEEEEEEEE"!!!!!!! I cannot wait to go again!

Amazing Guide - Great Way to See Prague!!!!. Sage was amazing and showed our group a side to the city we haven't seen before, despite visiting Prague numerous times. THANK YOU SO MUCH SAGE!!!Firstly - the e-bikes are amazing. I had a huge smile on my face from the off. Secondly - Our guide Sage was really friendly as was keen to show us places we hadn't seen before which made it the 3 hours we spent with her more the better. The highlight being enjoying cherries plucked straight from the tree while enjoying some fabulous views of the city. I regularly travel to Prague and will be visiting again!James Appleby

Perfect introduction to Prague. On our first morning in Prague we took the 3 hour ebike tour around the city. It was the best way to see the city and from the moment we emailed to book to the moment we returned the bikes the service was excellent. Our guides were excellent, providing us with lots of information along the way and suggestions for where we may want to return and look at things in more depth later.We are regular bike riders and the ebikes are great fun to use, very easy and amazing how well they go up hills. I am not good riding up hills and found it incredibly easy on an electric bike.Can't recommend this tour option highly enough, the best way to see Prague.

Best city tour experience!. After looking through the numerous tour options for Prague, we settled upon Ebike and we were not disappointed. Both the owners and guides were exceptionally kind and welcoming, starting with a quick explanation of how the bikes worked. It doesn't take long to get used to the bikes, they are very easy to cycle and you can get up to quite a speed with very minimal effort, especially useful up the hills! The tour took us around the city, taking in some spectacular viewpoints. The guides could not have been more helpful. One definite plus was the tour size, the maximum size is 10 which means you feel like an individual rather than one in a crowd. I highly recommend spending 3 hours on this tour, you will see far more of the city than you would on a walking tour and you also get a small picnic thrown in too!

Amazing Tour of Prague. We had an awesome experience. Sage (our tour guide) was excellent. We would highly recommend this company and our tour guide. She was very personable and took great care of us. Just the 3 of us around Prague. It is well worth the money and time.

Ebike: The best way to start your visit to Prague. Get oriented to Prague via E-bike tour with Ebike Prague Tours. No big deal if you have never ridden an E-bike. Learn in 30 seconds! And you will be thankful that you are using an Ebike instead of regular bike as the tour includes several hill climbs. The owners are very welcoming and our guide was very knowledgeable. On a 3+ hour private tour, we stopped for beers with the guide and a snack lunch overlooking the city. I think the ebike is the way to go as compared to the Segway! Definitely a great experience.

AMAZING & magical way to see Prague, don't miss this!!!. I've lived in Prague for over 20 years and every time a visitor comes for the first time they want a 'tour', which I'm happy to give them but I've gotten a little bored with fighting the tourists and doing the same Old Town-Charles Bridge-Castle Walk time after time. When our friend's daughter came to stay with us, based on great recommendations from people we know, we decided to take the Ebike Prague Tour and WOW!!!! I cannot recommend it highly enough! First of all, the bikes themselves are so safe and easy to operate I couldn't believe it! We were able to go up hills easily and quickly, it was really great and very simple to control. But the most amazing part was I saw parts of the city from a perspective I've never seen before, learned very cool facts and stories, and completely fell in love with Prague again. Our guide, Jenda, was hilarious and so much fun, but he also really looked after us and made us feel safe. Our guest said it was definitely the best part of her visit and that she felt like a VIP! I'll be sure to recommend this to all of our future visitors (and I'm looking forward to doing it again too for my birthday!). Highly recommended for newcomers and locals alike, THANKS, EBIKES!!!!

DFW family enjoys Prague overview. We booked this after seeing it on TA. Great follow up and customer service via email before we ever arrived. We took tour on the morning of our first full day. Great experience and views of parks and overlooks we might not have seen otherwise. We felt very safe and enjoyed our guides Laura and Carl's insight, as well as advice they gave on other Prague locations. Prague no longer allows bikes by the crawling baby sculptors, but our guides told us how to find them (pictured in other posts from last year.) If I were to do one thing different, it might be to take evening tour when crowds at the attractions have died down.

Great way to see the sites. We took an Ebike tour in the evening all around the outskirts of the city and returned in the morning for a regular bike tour through the city. Great way to cover a lot of ground and get great information. The Ebikes were a great way to tackle the hills without much effort at all. The Ebike staff and guides were great to work with.
