The bikes were new, exceptionally clean with state if the art helmets provided and a locking container to carry waterproof, picnic etc. Unfortunately the rain came down in torrents and our kind guides offered to take our bikes back for us- so allowing us to stop when we passed our hotel to go in for a welcome hot bath. We had a v.g. time despite the rain and I would recommend this company especially if you have children as safety standards are very high. Prices are competitive and lower than some companies. The bikes (having compared) are far superior to other tour groups. Had an email from the owners later apologising for the weather (hardly their fault) and offering us a free tour next time. We only missed the last half hour so this was most generous. All round wonderful service and a great way to see Prague!

loved this!. What a great way to see Prague! Our only regret is that we did this on our first day instead of our last. Great guides, friendly and fun and marvelous views and attractions in the city. We were introduced to several things (parks, restaurants and clubs, etc) that we wished we had time to visit. This is a much better way to see Prague that the Hop on- Hop Off buses that are often a great introduction to the city.

outstanding prague. My partner and I took ebikes on our last afternoon in Prague. We both wished we'd done it on the first day as we seen so much more of this spectacular city in 3 hours than we had done previously by walking around. You only need your camera and this very well run tour takes care of the rest, thanks for your knowledge and friendliness Mary and Solly !. Highly recommended.

The best way to see all the hidden gems in beautiful Prague!!. My husband and I flew into Prague knowing that we only around 40hours to experience this amazing city! Worried we wouldn't be able to see do and relax I asked the concierge at our hotel what was the best way to see this place! Se immediately said that we had to do this tour and I truly thank her! It was a five minute walk from out hotel (art deco imperial) and we were greeted by three lovely men who were waiting excitedly for us. They showed so much enthusiasm right from the get go - even though we were the only two on the tour! We opted for the twilight tour which was stunning! The tour lasted was three hours, we cycled on electronic bikes (which made it real easy) thorough all little off streets and hidden quirks! No way would we have discovered such areas without this tour! We stopped on this hill overlooking the city whilst we enjoyed a lovely provided snack then continued on the last leg of the tour. We were able to stop whenever we wanted to snap up some pics and ask as many questions without feeling discouraged. The two guides that took us we highly driven on our safety and making sure that we enjoyed every minute as the three hours goes so fast! Even when we returned the guides got our map and circled all these other places which were musts to visits before leaving - so kind! Loved the tour way better than sitting in a bus looking out a window or waking around with an ear piece!!

Great fun for everyone!!. It wasn't your usual boring tour. The bikes (and rain) provided us with plenty of fun and the guides with factual and interesting knowledge...it was simply brilliant. The lunch provided hit the spot and the hospitality exceeded all expectations. Thank you ebikes for making our hen party that bit more special.

Terrific team fun. We signed up for ebikes on our recent Euro trip and can't recommend these guys enough.The bikes were a blast and the 4 of us all think it was one of the highlights of our month long vacation.We had 2 guides who were both real fun and informative.A picnic lunch was included which helped absorb the previous nights fun,awesome.

Can't recommend highly enough!. E-bikes is a fantastic way to see the sites of Prague. Mary in particular provided excellent service with a smile from beginning to end! The guides were also experienced and full of knowledge of the city to ensure a worthwhile tour despite the torrential rain. It is also very competitively priced amd the picnic provided is a nice touch. Have already recommended to a work collegue!

fantastic way to see a city. as part of my hen weekend all 10 of us ventured out to see the sites of prauge in what can only be described as one of the funniest things ive ever done. not only did we have an amazing time we felt safe and very well looked after. lunch is also provided and we were picked up from our appartmens too. i would tell anyone going to prauge to give it a go, it rained our whole trip but it didnt dampen the experience one bit, its a must do

Fantastic Experience. I visited Prague as part of a Hen party, we took the Ebike tour on our first day and it was a fantastic way to see the city. The weather was terrible but if anything it made it more of an adventure. We would never have ventured out of our apartment in the rain and managed to take in as much as we did had we not been on the bikes. After being more than a bit scared to begin with we soon got into the hang of them and they are seriously fun! Our guides were fantastic and kept us safe and entertained. We loved every minute of the tour and I would not hesitate to recommend the tour to anyone coming to Prague. This is a friendly and very well run business we really felt that we were in good hands and that it mattered that we enjoyed ourselves. Our Bride felt really special and had an unforgettable experience. Thank you xxx A+

HIGHLY RECOMMEND! i loved ebikes. I recently returned from a backpacking trip through europe, and the ebike tour of Prague was one of my favorite things that we did through the entire trip! The staff of ebikes was awesome, could not have asked for any better. The ebikes themselves were really fun, since Prague has many hills it made it much easier. They took us to the best views of Prague, and showed us some really cool spots. The snacks they put in our boxes were awesome as well! I suggested ebikes to all of my friends that were going to be in Prague after us, and they all loved it! If you are ever in Prague... do an ebike tour... can not stress that enough!

Nice people and a great tour. We took a tour a few days ago. I very often say I'm going to write a review but never do. I felt compelled. Tour guides were great, route was awesome and I really felt like everyone there cared that we had a good time. Which we did. So glad we did it the first day here. Helped us better understand where to go for our short time here. Oh, the bikes are easy to use... And it's really easy to get around. The ebike does all the heavy lifting. If you want more exercise you can always turn it off (I didn't though... LOL).

ebike Prague. We took the city tour of Prague by ebikes and had an absolutely fantastic experience. The guides are very knowledgable and with my hubby suffering from a bad back walking tours are no option at all. Using the ebikes was the solution and it is not hard to ride them at all. In fact, I never got up a hill on a bike as easy as today........ Highly recommended! Thanks guys for a fantastic experience.

Great way to get your bearings in Prague. We had read about EBike Tours and so on our first day in Prague we thought we go and see what it was all about.When we arrived at their "office" at 9.45am, we were told they didn't have anyone booked for the 10am tour and it would be our own personal tour! How could we resist?!We had US Simon and Aussie Matt as our guides. Both have spent many years in Prague. One stayed in front and the other at the rear to keep an eye on us. I'm not much of a cyclist, so it was good to have Matt help me out when needed. The bikes were great, especially for those hills around the castle and fairly easy to learn to ride.Doing the tour on the first day in Prague was great as we were shown many places and things in a short time (3 hrs) and then knew what we wanted to return to and spend more time at.Simon also had lots of interesting information that you don't read in the guide books.A snack box and water are included which fit into your storage box attached to the bike. Because I had a medium size camera, lens and warm jacket as well, it wouldn't fit, so Matt took a backpack and carried mine. Rain jackets were provided and used on the day we went, though luckily not much rain. We were able to leave excess gear at the office.Very friendly and would definitely recommend.

((((eBikes trumps Segways BY FAR!!)))). Your constantly on your feet on the Segway, which is way too much for a 3 hour tour. I had NO idea electric-bikes were so much fun. They zip along effortlessly, wherever you go. Our tour was tailor-made for the eBikes and was the perfect amount of time. A laid back, educational and super fun experience. We covered a lot of ground and went to places and saw things regular walking or bus tours can't access. The guides had fun, interesting stories and told us all about Prague's rich history, without droning on and becoming boring.Refeshing picnic at the perfect place, perched high above the city! Amazing views everywhere.I could easily go on, DON'T MISS THIS ONE!!Great value, you won't be disappointed.

Awesome Fun. I've been studying here a while and always meant to do some tourist things!With family visiting,I had no excuse.The ebikes were a perfect fun way to tour and I saw loads of places I haven't yet seen.Sol was really welcoming and his team great fun.Would definitely recommend to y'all wondering where to take your folks!

The best day in prague. On my last day in Prague, when my legs hurt from walks I decided to rent a bike, fortunately I met the most lovely people in Prague!!Bikes were great, the guide was lovely, just pure pleasure!Strongly recommends to start the first day of your trip there.

Amazing fun time on ebikes. We took the love Prague afternoon tour, it was wonderful. The bikes are supreme fun and make climbing hills a doddle! The guides were fun, friendly and informative and we all felt really safe. The picnic spot is superb and the snacks are tasty too!

Great tour! Super easy, super fun.. Was surprised at how fun these bikes were to ride.I'd recently tried a Segway tour in Budapest which was also great, but I really prefer the ebikes. More relaxing and enjoyable since you don't have to stand up for the entire tour.I definitely recommend it. Super polite team, informative, easy going guides, nice picnic snack and STUNNING views from several points amongst Prague's amazing parks. Super fun! Thanks for an amazing morning ride!

The only way to see prague!! TAKE THIS TOUR!!. We (Me+gf) couldnt decide how to go about seeingpeague and we settled on the ebike prague tour we were not! To summarise The bikes are cool and soo easy to get used to! the guides (bert & ted) were fantastic allowing you to go at a comfortable pace that suits you whilst simultaneously letting you really test the bikes out.The route was spectacular with some truly breathtaking views that cannot be described and would be so easy to miss by not taking the tour.TAKE THIS TOUR!!!!!!!

Best way to see sights of Prague. An exceptionally professional group, an absolute must for anyone wanting to see some of Pragues most beautiful sights. The bikes are top quality, and provide loads of laughs, great for young and old. Possibly the best 3 hours spent in Prague! Thankyou so much to the Ebike team!

You must jump on ebike Prague!. I booked in for ebike Prague tour in Sept'12 at the end of my few weeks in Prague / Czech Republic as my holiday and conference buddies had left. It has to be one of the best tourist activities I've done in my 30 years of travelling. Even though after a few weeks we had done lots of activities in and around Prague - this tour still took me places I hadn't seen or experienced. The staff are all brilliant - helpful, fun, knowledgable, pleasant, etc.They provide a lunch and water so you just need to bring a camera! I'm a cyclist but had never been on an ebike before ... now I'm a fan.....but you don't need to be a regular cyclist to do this tour - the stored power is great for getting you up the inclines/hills. I wished they had a full day version at the time - I just could have kept going .. but I had a plane home to Sydney to catch! Big thanks to the ebike team for the experience!

Amazing Tour !. Ebike Prague Tours is the way to see Prague, You got the feeling that you were seeing all the main attractions along with some places that only the locals get to see. The technology of these electric bikes were amazing going up hill, you really just sat there and it would take you straight up a hill without any effort. Our tour guide Ted was extremely funny and had some great history to share with us along the way. Why I really liked seeing Prague on bike, was that there is so much to see in Prague and it takes to long on foot, and cars and buses are not allowed in most of these areas so this was the perfect way to see Prague for me. I highly recommend this tour! A big Aloha to Ebike Prague Tours ! Chris from Honolulu Hawaii

EBike, the future of guided tours.. I have just finished the EBike tour and feel the need to write a report straight away. From booking online with Mary, to the moment we left, everything was so professionally handled.We went out under the expert guidance of Bohumil and Bert and suddenly realised the bikes were going to add to the experience. I have done bike tours in the past and enjoyed them. But the assisted bikes makes the ride so much more enjoyable. Although I'm a keen cyclist, my wife isn't and was a little nervous, but that was totally unfounded. The tour itself was very interesting and the knowledge of the guys just added to it. I I will definitely tell people how good this is. Thanks team EBike for a great 3 hours and good luck for the future. From Craig and Anneli.

E bikes rocks!. this tour was really cool, the bikes are excellent;so easy to use. It's basically the same as riding a normal bike but without any real effort, the hills might as well have been flat roads! The amiable guides managed to balance the tour really nicely, giving appropriate snippets of info without droning on, allowing us to really make the most of the whole ebike experience.

Ebikes rock!. I'd never tried riding ebikes before but this tour was a fun new way to get around and see the city whilst learning about the sights from the amiable tour guides. The ebikes are excellent and so easy to use, it's basically the same as riding a bicycle but without any real effort, the hills might as well have been flat! I liked the fact that the guides managed to provide a good balance of snippets of info-whilst allowing you to take in the sights in your own time and really make the most of the whole ebike experience. We really enjoyed it.

Must DO experience in Prague. Ebike Prague Tours is one of the BEST experience that my girlfriends and I have had on vacation and was definitely our favorite experience in Prague, hands down! From the beginning, Mary was amazing to work with for booking the tour, was very responsive to emails and text messages and was so sweet to give us detailed walking and bus directions from our hotel to their site. When we got there in the morning, we were greeted by their staff who fit us to our bikes and helmets and got us ready for the ultimate EBIKE experience. We walked the entire city the day before and let me tell you, it's a lot of walking. To hop on an EBIKE that basically does all the work for you, you're able to see and cover the city in minimal time, and fly through the city...literally! The EBIKE experience itself was great, but I have to say that what made the tour so amazing was our guide Burt. He was such a good storyteller in giving us the history of the points of interest that we visited without dragging information on (you all know what I'm talking about!) and had such an ease and love for the city that truly shows. They are super nice and patient so bikers of all levels need not be afraid. Burt even went the extra mile by offering to take photos for our group at each point of interest (we're a group of girls so this was a major plus!). This tour is seriously awesome. It covers all the major areas that you want to visit (and then some!) and the people that run the company really give you an intimate experience where you feel like you're amongst friends. Best tour ever and we would definitely do it again. We are on the third country of our Europe trek and we're still talking about it.

Fabulous way to see the city. We were undecided whether to do this tour due to rainy conditions but when we turned up for our booking Sol was very welcoming, yet we didn't feel pressure from him to honour the booking. But being short on time and wanting to do this on our first day for an overview of the city, we were leaning towards doing it. However Sol had a windcheater that I could borrow as well as gloves for myself and my husband - it was that that sealed the deal! So off we went with Bert and I have to admit the rain got worse before it got better but to be honest it added to the adventure - and also the greenery! The great thing about the bike tour is that you can cover vast distances in no time and you almost feel like you're in the countryside. I didn't realise that Prague has so many parks and it was wonderful to be out in the fresh air whilst listening to Bert's passionate and well-informed tour. When we went through more crowded areas you just give the bell a good workout! The water and the snacks were an added bonus in the lockable box and the fact that you can leave anything at the bike shop was really helpful so if you have long coats or a backpack they can stay there. The bikes themselves were comfortable, in great condition and simple to use. I turned mine off a few times on the flat and it was nice to have that cycling feel but I must add you don't have to be at all fit to use the electric bikes. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone - it was a great experience with great people and I wish Sol and his team all the best for a successful Summer.

Top quality tour. We're not usually into group tours but this one caught our eye as my other half loves cycling! We weren't disappointed, it was great fun and the bikes were amazing - really well looked after. They took really good care of us (I felt safe and am not hugely confident on a bike :-)) - we had two guides for our small group. The route was perfect, the weather definitely helped - who knew Prague was so warm? Highly recommended - specially for cycling widows!

Bikes were a blast.. We are a couple in our late 50's. We really loved the bikes--so easy to use in Prague's hilly terrain. This tour gave great vistas of Prague and we really got a good visual overview. For me, though, I also tour a city to learn about it, and I thought that this tour could have offered more of that. We have taken bike tours in several cities, and those were much more informative than this. Don't get me wrong, there was a lot of stopping and explaining, but I would have enjoyed more of that. Otherwise, everything was perfect. All of the personnel were really nice and spoke "American" English, so communication was terrific. The length of the tour was just right at about 3 hours.

Ebike Prague the best way to see the city!!!!. Knockout experience.We, (five friends in our thirties), were recommended this tour by some fellow hotel guests and, as the responsible one of the group, I was elected to write the review,lol! Well,what can I say, we had a blast. The ebikes are amazing and so much fun to ride with zero training required. We saw more of Prague in 3 hours than we'd managed to see in 3 days ,great guides,nice picnic,incredible vistas. Do it,you'll love it.

Loved it!. This was a great tour. The folks running the tours were very personable and had great information about what we were seeing. The e-bikes made the hills and cobblestones so much easier to handle than regular bikes or walking. They showed us several great spots around the city. I would not have enjoyed Prague as much if I hadn't taken this tour. I definitely recommend it.

Highlight of our stay in Prague. We covered twice as much ground in 4 hours as we did the entire day before walking!!Very laid back, friendly, and professional business. Mary emailed us several times to make sure we had perfect directions for the start of the tour. She was one of the nicest people we met in Prague and her team of tour guides were first class. Matt and Caarl (sp?) made sure the entire group was happy, safe, and entertained. I highly recommend Ebike Prague!
Awesome tour. Knowledgable and fun tour guides. Beautiful sights, easy to get around. It was also so great that they provided us with lunch and waters as well.

Top Ebike fun in Prague. We chose Ebike Prague as my aunt did a tour with them last month and loved it.Sol and his team are super friendly,giving a warm welcome from the minute you arrive. I hadn't been on a bike in a few years and secretly felt a tad nervous but quickly felt at ease, not least as there was a second guide at the back of the group for our safety.This tour oozes quality,the ebikes are so smart and a breeze to use,join in the fun,you won't be disappointed.

Wowed indeed by ebike!. Their leaflet promised they'd wow us and wow us they did! Without a doubt this was the biggest highlight of our recent trip to Prague helped,of course, by two (yes two) fantastic guides,excellent weather(we'd come from a cold UK) and definitely the most beautiful city we've ever visited!We had fantastic fun throughout, the ebikes are truly amazing and make very light work of the steep hills.If you pay to do one thing in Prague,make it this. Supreme value for money and highly recommended.

Spectacular Fun. I had a stopover in Prague and came across these guys on trip advisor.Having read the reviews I thought I'd give it a try and I'm so pleased I did.It was great fun, the ebikes make cycling ridiculously easy, I've never had to go up a gear, going uphill before-what a novelty!The guides were great fun and nicely informative.It was the perfect adventure for my short time in Prague,highly recommended.

Fun bike tour with great views. The 3 hour bike tour was a lot of fun and using the ebikes was a blast. Every time the motor kicked on and pulled me up a hill a big smile grew on my face. The tour takes you around in a big circle around all the main attractions in the city of Prague and the views overlooking Prague near the castle are spectacular. I would highly recommend this bike tour if you are looking for a short (3 hour) tour and don't want to sweat all day long from manually pedaling up all the hills.

A "Must" in Prague. A must in Prague. Owners are very accommodating and made sure that safety is primordial. We will definitely recommend it to friends who plan to visit Prague. Way way better than doing the walking tour and the electric assisted bikes are so cool that I plan to save money so I can buy one. The tour will allow you to see green places of Prague and the best view of the town from the hill. Other tours will not allow you to see places up the hill. Excellent is an understatement.

Great way to see Prague and have fun at the same time.. My wife and I had an excellent time on our tour of Prague on the ebikes. We saw so many sights that we wounldn't have seen if we did a walking tour as the bikes made everything so accessible and easyto get to. Hardly any effort is needed even on the steeper sections so fitness levels are irrelevant. We covered about 17km in three hours but did not feel like anywhere near this distance thanks to the ebikes. All the staff and tour guides were extremely helpful and full of information about our surroundings. They made the tour feel very personal almost like a private tour. The pinic supplied was good quailty and enjoyed even more because of the setting we had it in with a stunning view over Prague. I would recommend this tour to everyone any age and any fitness level even if you have been to the city before ebikes gives you a whole new veiw of Prague.

Amazing bike tour!. I had the best time with my friends (all age 20) on this bike tour! The bikes were super fun and easy to use, and we got to see many areas of the city from incredible viewpoints. The guides were very friendly and shared a lot of interesting information about the city with us. I could not recommend doing this bike tour enough, it was SO much better than doing another 3 hour walking tour.

Most fun way to experience Prague. My husband, son (23 years old) and I loved seeing Prague on the ebikes. They were easy to use and allowed us to go up all the hills surrounding the downtown of Prague. Certainly the best way to see the Castle area. So much fun! The Ebike does make cycling ridiculously effortless. Being not the Museum types, this was right up our alley. Ted and Karel, our guides, were excellent. They provided a nice snack from a high vantage point overlooking the city. I would recommend this tour in a heartbeat.Thanks!

Great experience with the guides Bert and Ted - exactly what I wanted to experience. I had a chance to do something physical so I chose to do this bike tour without looking at reviews or anything but I wanted to see as much as possible in a pretty short amount of time. I found the shop easily and from the start they offered me some tea or coffee and the whole crew was really sweet. I didnt have a waterproof jacket or gloves and they lent me some. Super patient explaining the bikes which are awesome because you don't have to do much work going up hill so we were at the other side with the Stalin monument looking over Vltava River in maybe 10-15 minutes. Ted and Bert were great in explaining everything that we saw and Ted even showing me old pictures of what parts of the city used to look like. They packed some snacks and water for the break. We really did go around a see everything and they both recommended other places to go like restaurants, pubs, ferries, types of neighborhoods, artists etc. They both have a great affinity for Prague and show you their respect and love for the city.

Best bike tour ever. This had to be the fastest three hour bike tour ever. We didn't want it to end, it was wonderful. We had no idea what to expect, we had never taken an “E” bike tour before. WOW! It’s so easy the motor does all the work, you don’t want to tour to stop. The views are breathtaking and you get a chance to stop and enjoy them. We had time for a picnic lunch that has provided and our guide filled us in on the history along the way. Just the BEST!!!

Fabulous tour and a 'must do' when in Prague. Despite it being a really cold day, this was still a fantastic thing to do! Our guides were really knowledgeable and ensured we saw all the sites which we would not been able to achieve on foot! Our comfort was their priority and they even shared their gloves with us! We had a lovely picnic to eat en route but as it was so cold we waited until we returned to the office to have it and enjoyed it with a lovely hot cuppa!Don't be put off if you have not been on a bike for a long time as this is suitable for all ages and all levels of fitness. We would really recommend you give this a go!

E-bike Prague - a great way to see the city. This is an excellent way to see the sites of Prague. The bikes were very easy to ride - you simply pedal and the electric motor does the rest. Our guides - Ted and Bert were excellent sharing stories and the history of this fascinating city. The tour was nicely paced and an electric bike is a great way to see the city. So even if you haven't been on a bike for a while don't let this stop you from taking this excellent tour.

ebike Prague. Wow. What a wonderful three hours. I had never ridden an electric bike before - but it is effortless; the motor does all the work. We covered about 17 km in just three hours, including a stop for a picnic lunch provided by the tour. Our great guides were informative and enteraining, ensuring our safety, but also encouraging us to enjoy the many wonderful vistas along the way. A brilliant way to spend a morning or afternoon in Prague.

Not to be missed.. We took this tour following a recommendation from some fellow guests at breakfast time! They'd tried the ebikes the previous day and were so enthused that we thought we'd give it a go. We're not usually huge fans of guided tours but have got to say that we were ultra impressed with the ebikes,what fun and so easy to use.from start to finish, we were completely bowled over,the guides were fun and informative,the views to die for and they even threw in a picnic!

Fantastic. G James England. With only one free day following a conference in prague, i was eager to discover this beautiful city. With a bombardment of choice, I opted for the ebike tour and wasn't disappointed. It was my first time on an Ebike and I loved every second. The guides were really friendly,entertaining and very safety conscious and I met some lovely people on the tour. A great thing for the single traveller.highly recommended.

e-bike Tours. What a fantastic way to explore Prague! I was a little nervous at the start as I hadn’t rode a bike for years but the e-bikes were extremely user friendly (just like a normal bike with added controllable power) and super fun... I didn’t want to get off! Our tour guide was great and had very good knowledge of the city. If your travelling to Prague this bike tour is a must!

Great way to seenPrague!. The EBikePrague tours were fantastic from start to finish. Mary and her team were helpful and fantastic from the get go. Their number 1 priority was safety which is reassuring when you are travelling!! we did this as a family outing and it was a fantastic activity for all of the different ages including teenagers! Even in the cold winter it was a great way to see the sites of Prague. I recommend to do it at the start of your stay to get your bearings in this amazing city.

Fun entertaining and informative. This tour is excellent! A great way to see the city, get a (little) exercise and fresh air, find out about the city without being overwhelmed with details. A must for anyone with 3 hours!

A true must do in Prague. I've been to Prauge on numerous occasions previously, however I must say that the E-Bike tour was most definitely the best way of seeing all the main attractions around this beautiful city. From start to finish myself and my partner enjoyed every moment of it and would recommend anyone regardless of age to try it for yourself!

A new experience!. I travelled to Prague in september and I took the tour on my third day there, I regret not having taken it before, cause it was an amazing way to get an impression of the city. As you ride along the opposite shore to the city centre, you get wonderful views of it! and it's easier to orientate yourself and to choose what do you prefer to visit afterwards! 100% advisable!

Great way to see Prague. I loved riding these bikes! They are a breeze to use and great fun, especially in a city like Prague where the many hills might discourage a conventional bike tour. You can cover a lot of ground, and the tour guides are friendly and relaxed about making sure guests have enough time to see the sites. The worst part of the tour is having to turn the bikes in -- once you've ridden one, you don't want to give it up!

EPIC PRAGUE - by Ebike. Whether you've got week or a weekend in Prague kickstart your stay by Ebike. With only 3 days and 2 nights I knew I had to make the most of it. My ebike tour delivered beyond expectation and was the highlight of the trip. The 3 hour tour was spectacular - late in the season by general traveller timing, the autumn colours and views were magnificent. The guides were highly professional in every way, safety conscious, personable and nothing was too much trouble. Their knowledge was astounding with fascinating tales and anecdotes from beginning to end. A fabulous entree to explore Prague further. The tours flexibly cater for all ability levels. Within minutes of my first time ebike experience I was ready to take to tackle the hills - what a delight to find I'd to pedal no harder than on a straight. I will most definitely be back again, has whet my appetite for more more more...

Absolute Blast. We're not big bikers, so we were a little nervous when we first started riding, but it was an absolute blast and i'm so glad we decided to do it! We covered a lot more ground than we could have walking, and the 2 guides we had were fun and well versed on the city. One of my favorite memories was riding down through the apple orchard above the city in late september. I highly recommend it!!

funny, adventurous and original tour!. What amazing experience! I was in Prague in September with a short time to visit it. Generally when I visit a new city also if I don’t have so much time, I avoid guided tours, I find them boring and expectable, but in this case I decided to try Ebike tours because I love bikes and I’d never tried an e-bike before. Now I really want to recommend it because it’s a perfect way to experience a city having fun and discovering places that in another way it would be difficult to find out or to reach because far from the centre. I enjoyed the view from the Metronomo, the picnic in Petrini park, the strange echo in the Castle, but above all I had fun climbing hills without any effort…ok I swear I’m not so lazy! I’m also a sport girl but sometimes it’s great to forget everything and just experience what is around you, moreover the two guides were very careful about our safety, so I didn’t need to think also about that! They were vey informative and funny, they told us some strange stories and curious details that I’m sure I’ll never find in a guidebook! At the end of the tour they also gave us some useful information about good Czech restaurants and typical pubs (thank you, I really enjoyed one of them)So I’m not used to recommend guided tours but this is an exception and if I come back to Prague (I hope) I will do it again for sure.SabrinaItaly

Fun and history melded together. We visited Prague in September 2012 and this tour was the highlight. Not sure where to start our short stay, we decided to try the Ebike tour to maximise our time. The first thing that struck was the professionalism of the team at Ebike, and their passion for Prague...a passion that did not wane on our tour. Our guides were fantastic, providing just the right level of information about the city's history, took us to visit interesting sculptures and sights, even suggesting places to visit later that day so we could squeeze as much out of our visit as possible. We saw things we would never have discovered on our own. The Ebikes were so unbelievably fun (I want one!), and were comfortable to ride for the duration. We took several bike tours in Europe, and I can tell you not all bikes are this well maintained or comfortable! I felt very safe as a result of the instruction provided before we set off and the two guides - one at the front and one at the back - who were on hand whenever we had a question. We saw more in 2 hours than we would have in 2 days on foot in a city we had not visited before. I will never forget flying down a hill through an orchard, it was exhilarating! There are several stops on the tour to take a break, hear some history, have a snack and take some photos, several of which our helpful guide took for us (and his photography skills far exceeded mine, so double hooray).Love love love this tour and recommend it to anyone.

An Ebike Prague Tour (http://www.ebikeprague.com) will "make your day" in Prague. Just Do It!. E-bike Prague Tours left a brochure in my hotel. (http://www.ebikeprague.com)There were many brochures and many tours. I am so happy I saw their brochure and made the connection. Mary helped me select a tour time and gave me precise directions from my hotel to their place. Solomon was there when I arrived, and shortly after my two guides, Ted and Burt, make their appearances. We had coffee and chatted. It was nice.After we got to know each other, I signed the standard disclaimer and paid the money, and when the time for the tour arrived we left the office with our e-bikes. In addition to a helmet, the guys provided me with an ear(s) band and warm comfortable gloves (not to mention keys to my bike's compartment with my picnic lunch and drink). I was the only one on the tour, a tour that could have included up to nine others, so I was very lucky. I don't think they would have had warm gloves and ear bands for 10 people. It was late November, and without the extra "warmth-gear", the tour would not have been as pleasant and fun as it was!I had a fantastic time! They guys gave me a short but complete intro to e-bike operations and we were off. The three hour tour was over in a blink of an eye, it seemed, thanks to the company's choice of the tour route, the professionalism, competence and friendliness of my guides, Ted and Burt, and the beauty of the areas of Prague we toured. I was pretty tired of climbing stairs after a couple of weeks in Turkey and given the terrain of Prague, I couldn't have experienced what I did on this e-bike tour, on any of the other tours available, bus or walking tours. Riding the e-bikes gave me the freedom to climb the hills, get off the beaten paths, get into and through some beautiful parks, and get to other out of the way places in a unique and physically easy manner.I cannot recommend this experience enough if you are in Prague now (fall 2012) or are planning a trip here. Bonus: the guys also gave me a few specific suggestions of places to go on my own later, based on what they learned about my interests during the tour.I tipped them. They deserved it!- Tim - Solo Traveler - Saskatchewan

Amazing tour of a beautiful city!. Toured with these guys back in October and it was perfect. I was a solo traveler and everyone at eBikes was super friendly and knowledgeable. The bikes are perfect for Prague as there are quite a few hills and the extra push really makes the difference! They hit all the key sites and kept a good pace for photos. They also packed us a nice lunch/ snack which we enjoyed at a lovely city viewpoint. They shared the city's amazing history and also had some fun personal stories. I laughed a lot and enjoyed every minute of it! Great way to get the lay of the land when you first arrive in town!

Great way to see Prague from different vantage points!. It was my first time on an EBike & it had been many years since I was on a bike - the instruction on how to use the bike was great. Ted & Bert were very patient & Informative. It was easy to find the shop according to the brochure (a few minutes from Old Town Square) and the welcome in the shop was very hospitable. It is possible to leave stuff in the shop while you're out on the ride. They also provide you with a snack & water for a stop during the tour. It was easy & fun to ride up the hills without any effort. The ride was very professional with Bert following in the back & warning of any possible dangers (car coming up behind us). Prague is progressing with demarcating bike paths. I highly recommend the tour!

The High Point of Our Trip to Prague. My brother, sister and I visited Prague for 7 wonderful days but the 3 hours on the E-Bike Tour were the high point of our trip. Even though we had never tried electric bikes before, the e-bikes were pretty easy to get used to, and it was a blast to use the Turbo charge for going up hills. It was great to travel to the various hilly parks to get panoramic views of the city. Our guides made the whole experience fun, comfortable and informative. We didn't want to get off the e-bikes at the end; it would be great if a full-day tour of the countryside surrounding Prague were an additional offering.

Wow -- What a fun time!. We had a fabulous time with Ebikeprague! I had never been on an ebike before but it was so easy to learn how to use it -- and once we had ridden a little bit in the neighborhood and had gotten comfortable on our bikes, we set off on a wonderful tour of Prague. We zipped up hills with never a thought, and saw some of the major sights which I had never visited on my previous trip to Prague. I especially loved the ride through the gardens below Petrin Park! Two guides went with us and they were knowledgeable and fun and very safety-minded, making sure we all were together and safe as we crossed some major roads. I absolutely LOVED the ebike! This is a new company but they are doing things with class and skill, and I can't wait to return to Prague and ride with them again.

A must do adventure.... During my visit to Prague I had an unforgettable experience when I discoverd ebikes. So much so I did it twice.! I have visited the city many times and feel I know it quite well. However I have to say I explored different parts of the city I had not previously. The service was exellent, the guides were friendly and very knowledgeable. It was great value for money. I would recomend that everyone take the plunge and see Prague this way. The bike was easy to use once I got over my fit of giggles (I felt like a big kid) and it does all the work for you, which was great for those hills!! The sights were amazing which was ideal for some great photographs.The picnic in the park was a great opportunity to meet other people and have a chat. A must do adventure which is really fun!!

Bert & Ted's Excellent Adventure!. An Ebike tour is a really fun way to see some of Pragues major sites outside of the Old Town. The equipment was top notch & our guides Bert & Ted were informative and amiable. In a three hour period, we were guided around such sites as The Metronome in Letna park, Prague Castle, fantastic views of the city from Petrin Hill & the Lennon wall in Mala Strana. Bert & Ted provided lots of interesting information in a chilled out way. We would highly recommend this tour!

Take the sting out of sight-seeing!. Travelling by Ebike means you can cover a lot of ground in a relatively short space of time and so effortlessly! I wasn't sure I would get the hang of an Ebike at first but they are really simple to use and make it so easy to climb hills and see fantastic views without any exertion.I thought I would just use it like a bike but I soon changed my mind;the organisers explained how to use one before we set off and it couldn't have been easier.The guides make sure you are safe and there are several stops to admire the fantastic views of this beautiful city together with a picnic stop-drink and snack provided.Definitely one to do again and I would highly recommend it.Although I was on my own,I was made to feel like one of the group so no need to be lonely!

An unforgettable tour with a difference!. I must say this was the highlight of our trip to Prague. It's very much an outdoors type of tour yet very relaxing as the electic bikes flattens any uphill climbs. The tour guides not only gave the typical historical information but they also had some great quirky stories which you would never hear on a bus tour. It's a great tour to meet other people too. Since it was a small group we got chattin to people from Canada, the UK, Russia and Bulgaria which was lovely. Honestly, I just really enjoyed the tour and had nothing negative to say about it. In fact, it inspired me to get an ebike when I got home and I've been commuting to work on it since!

eBike Prague - Professionalism Par Excellence !!!. Dear eBikePrague FriendsJust a short THANK YOU - 2 small words with BIG meaning !We were in a group tour last month with your team.The welcome in your shop was warm and hospitable.During the tour, the front guide and the back safety guide (I forget their names - they were both tall men) were equally wonderful, helpful, caring and very obliging. Even the half time snacks were perfect timing and such a nice touch !The tour was truly an eye-opener for us in Prague and greatly enjoyed by all in the group.Well done to you allLes MJohannesburg, South Africa:-)

Great way to see the city. What a great way to see a great city. We'd spent a couple of days exploring Prague on foot and tram but didn't really know what to look at next. We had looked at the Segway tours but realised that they didn't really go any further than we had walked. The E-Bike Tour went through all the major parks, crossed and followed the river and went up to a number of the hilly vantage points overlooking the city. The bikes were easy to use. A thorough briefing and time spent getting set-up with the brand new bikes, comfy saddles and helmets was followed by the opportunity to try the 'e' bit of the bike in a quiet street where we could get used to it. A very strange feeling initially, the e-bike is a joy to behold. As you begin to pedal an electric motor takes over and powers the back wheel. You'll find yourself effortlessly whizzing up hills and down roads putting no more effort in then if you were sitting on a sofa moving you knees up and down! Once accustomed Ted and Mary; our two tour guides, took us on a really informative trip around the city. Happy just to let us ride around enjoying the bikes they took time to understand our interests and tailor what they focused on and told us. Time flew by and as we realised we were a bit hungry, lo and behold they had provided a health snack and some water in our bike box. With all the friendly chat, and time they had taken to answer all our questions we realised we were running behind schedule. A quick dash back into town, a recommendation for a night out, a restaurant and another 3 things for our 'to do' list and we really couldn't have found a better way to spend a morning exploring.Exceptional value, learned huge amounts and was great fun. Would recommend to anyone (and I really mean anyone whatever your fitness level) who wants to have a bit of fun exploring the city.

E Bikes( Electric Bikes). One of our travelling companions has a problem walking great distances. He, his wife and my husband rented E bikes and had an excellent tour around Prague. They did not have their cycling gear with them just normal warm clothes but this was one of their most enjoyable experiences when visiting Prague. We wish this young man geat success in his E bike business.

E Bike Tour in Prague. This new company ( E Bike ) needs recognition as its top notch guides and bikes are noteworthy. They are located directly opposite the Beer Museum Pub in city center of old town. 5 min walk from old town square. Fantastic 4 hr tour led by Mario and Bert .Very professional with safety key priority,fun second. Very informative but best of all ensuring everyone got pictures and great ride.We stuck to bike lanes as much as possible and let the bikes do most of the work.Highly recommend seeking out this group and going on this tour.

Disappointed. Made a reservation direct with Prague e-bikes online for 1 October and received a confirmation response. However when four of us went to the departure point at Besedni2 as directed there was no one at the office in fact it was all closed up. We waited from 9.40 till 10am. Very disappointed.
Best way to discover the city. Nice welcoming , good e-bikes in good condition, very professional tour-guide( thanks Michael) perfect trip with a lot of informations ! One of the best tours we did...
E-bike tour idnprague. Excellent way to see Prague. E-bikes make it supper easy. Michaele was very personable and super knowledgable. Highly recommend, especially with Michaele as your guide!

Best way to discover Prague. No sweat. If you want get to know Prague's history, landmarks and funny insights in little over 3 hours, Prague by ebike is the most simple and informative way to do it!
Bikes are easy to ride, and the views are fantastic. Try it to bilieve.

Awesome way to see Prague!. We did this tour based on a recommendation from our hotel (Pod Vezi) - I would never have thought about doing it otherwise but it turned out to be the best way to see Prague and an enormous amount of fun. Definitely recommended, even if you're not sure if you can physically do it or not. I have average fitness and can be very absent-minded, so was worried I'd fall off or get hit or something but it was no problem at all - I never even felt scared, even when we were on the old cobblestones. You cover a huge amount of ground and see Prague from all of its (extraordinarily beautiful) angles, our guide was very knowledgeable, the electric bike was way easier to use than I thought, and we could easily go up and down a lot of hills that we couldn't have walked (we went in September and it was really hot). Other benefits - we ended up being the only two people on the tour (personal tour for a group tour price!), our guide sent us a link to all the photos of us that he took within about 30 minutes (before we even got back to our hotel!), and it feels really safe (you get a helmet, a saddle bag, and water). This was so good, I was even tempted to look into getting an electric bike when I got home - all the fun of cycling without most of the effort!

The only way to see Prague!. Incredible experience and fun way to see Prague! Our tour guide Michal was incredibly informative, energetic and passionate about his job. His depth of knowledge gave great history and insight to this beautiful city. He even provide tips to do after the eBike tour. This is a great option for folks that love to be active as well as people that are not very mobile. The bikes adjust to your skill and effort level making it a breeze for all participants. We spent 2 weeks in Europe and this by far was the most memorable and fun! Dekuji Michal!

BEST WAY TO SEE PRAGUE!!. This spectacular tour meanders more than 14km around the City of Spires in just three hours! It was a warm day but we barely broke a sweat. The E bikes are comfortable and there is very little pedaling, even up steep climbs.You zip past all of the major sights and take in incredible views-- something you can't see on ANY of the other tours, even by Segway. We LOVED our tour guide Michal who spoke perfect English, is well educated, and gave us great insight into his beautiful city! You are able to make frequent stops and take photos. It's a great way to see EVERYTHING -- you can later decide which landmarks are worth buying tickets and waiting in lines. But at least you'll leave Pragus knowing you saw everything. This is a MUST! Remember : ask for MICHAL

Excellent way to tour Prague!. I can't recommend Prague By E-Bike enough! Our tour guide Michal was amazing. The bikes are amazing! The tour itself was about 3 hours long (it actually went over on the day we were there, our tour guide Michal was nice enough to go a little long with us!)There were four of us total on our tour, us and one other couple. Michal showed us all around the interesting points of the city, stopping to take pictures and talk about all of the interesting locations. I don't think there is any other way we could have seen as much of the city and received as much background information on the city than doing it by E-bike!The E-bikes themselves were great. They were comfortable to sit on, and powered you all around, so you barely had to do any work yourself, which is awesome when you are on vacation. There are a few hills on the tour, so Michal showed us how to change gears to easily let the bike get us up the hills. The tour covers all of the important sites in the city. You don't need to be athletic to do it, just need to be able to ride a bike!
Great tiur. Tour guide was fantastic very thorough and friendly. I left my camera on the bike and he returned it to our hotelHighly recommend

Amazing Time, See Entire City. This was literally the highlight of our visit to the city. The bikes and tour guides are awesome with a real focus on safety. We saw all the major sites and had panoramic views. Loved it.

Assisted Pedal Power . We had a wonderful tour with Mikkel. An e bike is a great way to see Prague, covering distance without exertion. The route taken was largely congestion free but still taking in the highlights and covered what we wanted to see. Mikkel was informative and passionate about his city. He took great care with our safety and pace and also took photos of us at various vantage points. We were the only two on our tour and took the 10am slot which was a bit cooler than an afternoon tour and probably less people around. Would highly recommend this tour.

Best way to see Prague quickly. We decided to go on the e-bike tour when the hotel recommended it and we are so glad we did. Out of the 25 sights my husband wanted to see we covered 18 just on this trip. It would have been impossible for us to cover as much by foot in the couple of days we were in Prague (we realised this after walking for an hour or so on our first evening when we returned to our hotel with aching feet). The bikes are really great as you can relax and let the motorised bike do all the work. I hadn't cycled much before, and never on a road, so was a bit nervous but didn't need to worry at all. Michael, our guide, was great (there was just two of us on the tour so we got great value!), he was very knowledgeable (and patient!) and was happy to stay longer at certain sights and take our photos. Totally recommend this as a way to see Prague - I felt so happy afterwards.

A brilliant 3 hour tour.. All you have to be able to do is ride a bike. Don't worry about your age (me 64) or your fitess level as the bike does most of the work. Modern bikes with electric motors, even a booster switch for going up the occasional hill. Nickolas was a great guide. There were 4 of us on our tour and we covered many of the main Prague highlights with plenty of photo stops. In summer, its best to go in the morning (10am departure) as there's not as many people on the streets.

Unique views of beautiful Prague. Our hotel booked the tour for us and it couldn't have been any easier . We had a small group , stopping often for pictures and for our knowledgeable tour guide to point out historical places and points of interest . Our last bike stop was at the castle, giving us a brief overview and whetting our appetite for a return visit. Although the bikes were powered , we would add that some athleticism and balance is required . Some streets can be narrow and heavily congested . Overall we were very satisfied with the tour and the vast overview of the city that we took in.

Great way to see this hilly city!. Michel was our guide for an e-bike tour of the city. He was both knowledgeable and friendly. He took us to some unexpected hidden spots in the city as well as spots with extraordinary views. In spite of having done bicycle tours in other cities, we were a bit hesitant to navigate this hilly city. The e-bikes made it a breeze. Highly recommend for a great way to cover everything from old town to the castle!

Probably the best ebike company in Prague. We had a great tour of Prague. Our guide (whose uncle owns the company) was engaging and knowledgeable. We LOVED the ebikes....not sure my friends will ever use pedal bikes again.

Love those E-bikes!. Our hotel recommended this company for a bike tour and we were very impressed! Booking with them was easy and the tour was amazing. There were only 6 of us so it was easy to stop, ask questions and we learned quite a bit about Prague in the process. The bikes are very easy to use and you rarely have to pedal; definitely not a workout if that is what you are seeking. The town is hilly therefore this type of tour is very easy for the topography. There are segways everywhere and it was nice to cover more ground with this type of tour. Anyone who can sit on a bicycle seat can do this tour. I particularly loved the stops at the Kafka museum to see the scandalous sculpture in the front as well as the John Lennon Peace Wall. Our guide was very patient as we stopped many times for photos. This is a great tour and highly recommended.

Great fun and the perfect overview of Prague. We were a group of 3 adults in our fifties and have done lots of tours together. This e-Bike tour was perhaps the highlight of our entire European trip this time. Prague is quite a hilly city and therefore difficult to cover in a single walking tour. It was our first time on e-Bikes but they are easy to get used to and make it seem like riding on a "flat Prague". As well as seeing all the places of interest along the river, you also get the view from the highest point without much effort at all. Our guide, Christian, was VERY knowledgeable, spoke extremely good English and gave us more than the allotted time for no extra charge - as there was no tour booked for the afternoon. I would highly recommend this tour as the ideal introduction to Prague. Very good value for money. We intend to do it again next time!
E-Bike. Great E - bike tour with informative and friendly guide. Bikes were fun and great views looking out over Prague. Lots of information about the city and county.

Great way to see Prague. We have done bike tours all over the world on this was Tully one of the best ever. The ebikes are so easy to handle and make the hills of Prague non existent and everything operates at a simple peddle whether on the flat or climbing. The scenery along the way is stunning and is hidden unless the follow these bike paths. Lots of short stops along the way to provide some interesting commentary. Nickolas was a great tour guide and I would recommend this tour to everyone who travels to Prague.

Praque by bike. Very helpful stuff! Saša!!:)
And a great guide, Ondrej! Could grasp the Old Town after the bike tour and got a lot of interesting information in history of Praque and of the inhabitants! Would love to do it again on the next visit!

Fantastic way to start a visit to Prague. Prague by E-Bike was recommended to us by our hotel and having enjoyed similar bikes in a different city on a previous trip, we thought we would try it again. Whereas our previous experience was not a guided tour this one was and Petra our guide was great. Seven of us were treated by Petra to an informative tour of Pragues best known attractions and a few lesser ones as well! The E-bikes were a breeze to ride with just the right amount of effort required to feel like you have had some exercise but without the strain particularly when climbing hills. It was an absolute pleasure riding around Prague for what was surprisingly 15 kilometres. The tour starting and finishing point is the E-Bike shop which well located not far from the Charles bridge. I thoroughly recommend you start your visit to Prague with E-Bike you will love it.

The best!. Seriously the best way to get a sense of Prague and to see all the city has to offer. Mikal gave us a fabulous tour, which turned out to be me and my husband only. We stopped at so many places we would not have along the way and leaned so much about the city. This is an easy tour and should be doable by anyone of any age. We usually do hop on hop off tours to get a sense of the city but this was way better. I can't recommend this tour enough.

Loved It!. On our arrival in Prague to our hotel - this tour was highly recommended and we are so glad that we said yes! Our tour guide, Michal was the best. He was very knowledgeable about all things Prague and shared his knowledge in a way that was easy to understand. Michal was very good at explaining what we needed to do on our bikes so it wasn't a surprise. He was happy to let us take photos anywhere and even was happy to take photos of my husband and me along the way! We are so pleased that this opportunity came our way. Best money spent in Prague!

Great Introduction to a Marvelous City. Like Christine M, we did this tour at 10 am on our first full day in Prague, and it gave us a comprehensive view of the whole city. I agree with all the positive reviews. Not much else to add. Our hotel (Hotel Julian - highly recommended) made reservations for us and collected payment, which was quite convenient, and the shop is within walking distance from the hotel. The ebikes are very easy to get the hang of, even for a those of us in our late 60's, and almost effortless to power. Our guide Petra was friendly, informative and safety conscious. No problems even with some heavy traffic and wet cobblestones. After the tour we ducked out of the drizzle into the Restorance and Steak Kamparium, a cozy little cellar restaurant just down the street from the bike shop, for lunch and beer - excellent!

Excellent experience!. We did the 3 hour e-bike tour on the morning of our first full day in Prague. It was a wonderful experience and a great way to see many sights and get a fantastic overview of this spectacular city! My husband and I were traveling with two teenage boys and the tour was fun for all of us! Everyone in our party is in fairly good shape and exercise regularly, but we are not cyclists by any means. Most of us have not been on a bike in many years! However, that was not a problem at all. The e-bikes are very easy to use. There are a maximum or 6 people per tour, so it was not too big a crowd. We had 5 participating in our tour (4 of us and one other) and 2 tour guides (the second was training). Both guides were very friendly and knowledgable about their city. The tour was at a very nice pace. We took frequent stops, had plenty of time for photo ops, and learned a lot of information about Prague! It was a completely enjoyable experience!

spring break. Worth doing, there is so much to see and do in Prague, this gives a whistle stop tour , pleasantly on the bikes, Nicholas was funny, had loads to tell us, and we were lucky it was just the 2 of us, he takes great photos for you along the way too!

Great way to see the city. I went on this bike experience alone as my friend was sick. It was so worth it! I wish I had done it when i first got to Prague. Our guide was Michael and and he gave great information regarding the history of the places we saw. He made every effort to make it a wonderful experience for all of us On a E bike it is so easy to travel. I highly recommend this tour. You won't miss a thing.

Wonderful day. Nicholas was a wonderful guide, showing us all the must-see sites of. Prague. He was extremely knowledgable. The bikes are safe and well maintained. We were fortunate that my husband and I were the only ones on the tour so we had individual attention.

A great and fun way to see this amazing city. My wife and I enjoyed all 3 hours of our Prague by E-Bike tour, it was fun, very interesting, and all of the highlights of this gorgeous city. Michal, our guide, was great: very knowledgeable and fun, open to suggestions and ready to answer all the questions. I think that this is the best tour to have if you want to keep yourself active during the cold season!

Un unexpected journey!. Having just one day/night to celebrate the 40th aniversary of my beloved wife I've thought that a city tour will be the best way to know as much as possible about Prague after a long party in the night.It was the best choice, thanks to Michal from E-Bike. He was the best guide I ever meet, his history knowledge and calm humor made our day!Thanks to electric bikes it was a relaxing ride through all the places not accessible by car. We visited entirely the old city not beeing tired at the end and having enough time for small "memories" shopping and good meal after this tour.I recommend E-Bike tour to everyone!
great way explore Prague. It is a truly great way to see all the important sights in a limited time. Bikes are easy to handle and guides are awesome :) Definitely recommended...

See all sides of Prague. We were lucky enough that being off season it was just my boyfriend and I on the tour...It lasted around 3 hours and covered everything there is to see in Prague with some added incredible views.Our guide was very knowledgeable and answered any questions we had!The bikes are the added bonus... they carry you up the steepest hills without even breaking a sweat!

Great way to get your bearings and a history lesson at the same time. We had this recommended to us by our hotel concierge and it was worth it! We had done 2 different walking tours in Prague (one of old town and one of Prague Castle) and this was so much better! Small group (just 3 of us) and way more ground could be covered. The tour lasted about 3.5 hours. Don't worry about your fitness level. The bikes do the work. You're just along for the ride.
Prague sights on e-bike. Perfect way how to get to know the main sights in limited time! E-bikes were easy to ride and special thanks to our guide...
Perfect experience. You can enjoy Prague in just 3 hours! Very easy ride, great guide, amazing views! I would definitely recommend it! Easiest way how to enjoy the most important sights...
Great Tour!. This tour was great! the guide was the best! despite the weather we enjoyed the tour. I will surely recommend this tour.

Probably the best way to see Prague. We were recommended this tour by our Hotel Pod Vezi and advised this was suitable for all ages and fitness levels. My sister who I did the tour with isn't the most coordinated person and we both had concerns she'd fall off her bike but am super happy to say she didn't even come close to hurting herself (or others). Our guide Michal gave us a safety run through on how to use the e-bikes, which are surprisingly easy to use and makes you never want to ride a normal bike again. Our tour consisted of just Michal & my sister & I, Michal was knowlegeable and friendly, he kept an eye on us at all times and gave clear directions on where to turn and when to change down or up etc. We had great informative stops with some amazing photo opportunites. Michal took photos of us and had emailed us the link to the photos before I even got back to my hotel. We travelled all over and saw so much that we wouldn't have seen without this tour. Bike Helmets and small carry case attached to the bike were included as was water, and a raincoat too but this wasn't needed.

Great experience. I took this tour with my boyfriend and we were lucky since our guide (Michal) was there just for the both of us. He was knowledgeable, kind, patient and respectful. He took the time to answer our questions, take pictures of us and also recommend less touristic spots of the city. The tour covers a comprehensive view of the city and includes lovely panoramic views.I strongly recommend taking this tour!

Great experience & value. This is definitely one of the best fun ways to get around Prague. Plus, with a personal guide (we had Michael), you get so much more out of it. Details about the buildings, the culture, the history make it such a great trip. Ok, we did this at the end of Oct 15, so it was a bit cold at times but, as it was dry throughout, my children loved all aspects of ebiking around the city. If you do nothing else, do this. You will laugh, learn and have a great time, just as we did. Since returning to the UK I have noticed that there are other tours with ebikes available. However, we used 'Prague by E-Bike' and would thoroughly recommend this tour company. Our day out was booked directly through our hotel with the vouchers provided being exactly the same cost as if we had booked direct. So no extras for booking through a third party.

Great way to see Prague and have lots of fun too!. Great tour around Prague with informative guides. E bike is super fun to ride and a great experience. If you want to sightsee and have some fun, then this is the tour for you. Highly recommend.
Great tour. The guide is nice and the bikes are great way to explore the main locations of the Prague. Thank you!

Better talk to someone on the phone!!. I made a reservation online and got an email confirming my 10am tour for the next mrng. Headed out the next mrng to Mala Strana and the bike shop but i was the only one there. Pounded on the door...but no one. Big waste of my precious vacation time!!

Excellent way to see Prague...... My & my husband loved this tour - our guide was fab & the three hours flew by. The bike was so much fun & got to see such alot when we were only in Prague for two days - recommend 100%
Great fun. Fun way to see areas of Prague not practical to visit with a walking tour. Tour is 3 hours but goes by quickly and is very informative.
Excellent tour! . Took the tour with nicholas. Great experience, great guide, the electric bikes are fast, lots of fun, and convenient.Highly recommended!

Outstanding. An absolute must. Recommended by our hotel (Pod Vezi) we booked the electric pedal bike tour. A brilliant way to see and hear about so much of Prague. Mikeal was so knowledgeable and his English was immaculate.The bikes were so much fun and made pedalling so easy.You simply have to do this if visiting Prague for the first time

Great tour. . We are a 60 year old Australian couple and we like to see as much as we can when we travel. My husband is a good rider but I only ride occasionally. We were guided by Nicholas along pathways in parks and side streets and alleys to avoid the busiest areas.We rode 17 km in 3 hrs, all over the city including at Vitis cathedral and the castle.We also saw the sculptures of David Cerny, big baby, in utero,puss fountain. Our guideways very well informed, stopping every5 mins to give us new information. Fabulous morning. Highly recommend.

What a great way to see Prague's highlights!. My wife and I always try to book a bike tour when ever we travel to a European city, as a very efficient and fun way to be introduced to a new environment....the concept of e-bike is even better, as you can cover a lot of sites (including those with hills to access) with not much effort. In addition Michal our guide was fantastic!

Top 5 of things to do in Prague. We took this tour on the 31st of August in a small group with guide Michal. It was a very hot day so e-bike was probably the best option to climb those picturesque hills of Prague. Bikes are really easy to use and comfortable to ride. We rode past all of the main tourist attractions and learnt about Czech and Prague history, both distant and most recent. Michael is an excellent guide and I highly recommend anyone visiting Prague to take this tour!

Excellent way to see Prague. Great way to get around Prague and learned so much interesting history.' Prague has a lot of hills and it would have been very difficult without the E bikes. Peter was extremely knowledgeable and patient! Highly recommend!

Amazing. I hadn't been on a bike for 10 years so approached this "mad" venture with some trepidation. What an experience! So easy to learn how to use the gears and boost and since most of the tour is on side roads or through parks to get to the sites I didn't have to worry too much about traffic. Igor was a great guide. Highly recommended.

A great way to spend 3 hours. This a fun, informative and non strenuous way to see all the main sites of Prague in 3 hours. The bikes are easy to use and Nicholas, our guide, was a very good host. There was 4 of us on our tour with the maximum being 8. Thoroughly recommend.

Great way to see Prague. Matt, our guide was very helpful and gave us a good guide to the beautiful city of Prague on Sunday 23rd August.The bikes are great fun, but the cobble stones can make your teeth ( and other extremities) chatter!I would recommend you do this at the start of your visit so you can be fully orientated and then decide where you want to spend more time.Great value too!Tony A

A tour you should try on the first day in Prague. This tour is better taken on your first day in Prague. because you can get a lot of information in short time, and then you choose what place to visit for more on the next day. My family of 4, really enjoyed this trip.Riding e-bike in Petrin hill was the best thing we did. When we passed by some tired walking tourist, they shouted to us "Look that lucky people, they're riding bikes" :)Suggestion for this tour, better if you slow down the pace and stop on every intersection road. Especially when there is a kid in the group. My kids were very enthusiast with this tour and became less alert. I had to shouted to my kid, when they just speeding following the tour guide without looking their left-right side. A tram almost hit them. Thank God they stop a few seconds before the tram pass by.

Nice Tour. My guide, Michal, was a good guy. He showed me a lot of interesting things through the tour, that was long enough to enjoy the city but not too long to get bored. He was also speaking a very proper and correct english. The bikes weren't that great but I don't think they were different from the other tours' ones. At the end of the day, an interesting experience with a nice price!

3 Hour toue. It was excellent. We were lucky enough to be the only tourist on this morning trip. Temperature was 36 so understandable why some didn't want the exercise! Our guide Nicolas was knowledgable and interesting. The ease to cycle was just right for me! We even had a discount to use at a local restaurant post tour. Truly worth it and would be happy to recommend to all that visit Prague

Got to see so much in a short time. Very easy to pedal and get around on a guided tour of Prague. Enjoyed it very much and got to see places we would like to come back and explore in more detail later on during our stay.

A great way to be introduced to Prague. We thoroughly enjoyed our ride around Prague.Our guide was very knowledgeable and the e bikes made the cobble stoned streets and hills easy to tackle. It gave us our bearings around the city which we then explored on our own knowing something of the city's history. Highly recommend this tour.
Brilliant way to see the city . We loved our ebike tour! Great fun while visiting everything we wanted to see. Definitely recommend it. Our guide, Igor was fantastic!

Great way to see Prague, easy,nice, like a breeze. We took the 3 hours tour with Michal, he was great, nice, knew a lot of Prague, history, details, very nice youg man.The bikes are great forget about up hill rods, etc (in Prague, there are a lot by the way)WIth the E-bike is easy, confortable, no pain, no sweating, just nice and easy, and of course your are riding a bike so you can go where pedestrian go, and from one point to the other you go like cars go!Highly recommended for ANY AGE AND ANY PHYSICAL CONDITION!

Great way to see the sights. We started our time in Prague with this e-bike tour - it was a great way to get our bearings and know where we wanted to go back to see more. Our guide was so friendly and knowledgeable. And if you've never ridden an e-bike before (like us) it was great fun! Effortless way to climb the hills for the best views. Although slightly expensive if you're on a budget.
Great tour of Prague. We really enjoyed our e-bike tour. Nicolas, our guide, was knowledgeable and relaxed. This is a wonderful way to see the city. We would strongly recommend it.

Loved seeing Prague by e-bike. I highly recommend this tour. We loved this tour. We got a great overview of the history and layout of the city. Our guide, Nicolas, was wonderful. Although the day was hot, we did not even break a sweat on our e-bikes (I am an avid cyclist, I wish going up hill was always as easy as today!). A few things stood out: the guide was excellent, the bikes were well maintained and very easy to use, the service was exceptional (including providing us with helmets and bottles of water), the small group was just perfect, and the pace was spot on. Prague by e-bike primarily takes less than 6 people per tour. Our tour only had 4. Because we were a small group we were able to spend more time at some spots, and less time at others. The pace was driven by us. Although we did not go into any of the sites, we did get a great feel for the layout of the city, and now have a more refined idea of what we want to see more in depth.

Prague Bike Tour. Igor was an excellent guideHe had a calm and easy going attitudevery knowledgable about Prague and its historyThe tour itself was an excellent way to get our orientation around PragueWould highly recommend itThe bikes were funI think my wife wants me to buy her one when we get home
Best Tour. I strongly recommend the Prague By E-bike tour. Michal was an excellent guide.Very friendly and knowledgeable. Best three hours I spent in Prague.Frank Bedard, Toronto, Canada

E-Bike tour--the best!. My family of 4 including 2 teenage daughters did this our first day in Prague. Michal was a fantastic guide and gave us a wonderful tour and overview of the history of this beautiful city. I had an injured foot and found the e-Bike so comfortable and easy to use--it was nice to give my foot a break from al the walking on cobblestone streets!

Prague in 3 hours!. If you only do one thing in Prague, let it be this. Our guide Michal is a gentleman and a scholar and a great guide to the sights and culture of his beautiful home town. We did this tour early in our trip and when we were done we felt very well oriented, having covered a wide area on both sides of the river. Also it was our first ebike trip; they are a revelation, making hills and distances a breeze! I'd give this 6 out of 5 if I could.

Great way to see the city and get oriented in short time. I have an e-Bike at home and was thus pleased to see the tour advertised and the good reviews on Trip Advisor. I signed up via the website and received a confirmation e-mail. My guide, Igor, was friendly, knowledgable and had a good sense of humour. He also spoke good English, so communication was no problem. The bike was more powerful than mine and the ride was great. You see a lot more than a walking tour - cover a much bigger area and get to more places, especially high vantage points overlooking the city. You can still easily stop at points of interest and Prague is very bike friendly, so we were able to ride on special bike paths, through parks, pedestrian areas etc. only dismounting in the castle grounds. I was very pleased that we visited the Lennon wall. All round a great way to become familiar with the city, key places and overall layout. Thanks!

The best day ever!. If you only have a few days in Prague this should be the first thing you do! By the end of the tour I had seen most of the sights I had read about. Beautiful buildings and amazing panoramic views of the city.Michal is a fantastic guide who has excellent english and knowledge of the history of Prague. The tour helped us orientate ourselves for the rest of the trip. It was much easier to walk back to take a closer look at some of the sights.The bikes are comfortable and easy to use. No real effort required, the bike does the work. We took the 10 o clock tour and even though we were out in the noon sun it felt cool because of the breeze while pedaling on the bike.There were less crowds around at time also.I would highly recommend this tour. Put it on your to do list. You won't be disappointed.

Peddling Prague. Peddling was involved, but the E-bike definitely helped. Some skill with a bike is necessary. It was a great way to preview all of the key areas of Prague. Michal was extremely knowledgeable about the complex history of Prague. He was also patient with his cycling followers.

A highlight of our trip to Prague!. Our family of four all had the best time on this terrific tour! The e-bikes are so easy and fun to ride and we were rewarded with amazing views all around Prague.
