Great way to see Prague. We had never been on Segways before but done a lot of waterskiing, surfing etc so agreed it was easy to do & yes very simple after just a couple of minutes. Was a very cold day so anyone in winter, rug up, your body isn't doing the normal movement you would be walking!! We throughly enjoyed the tour around Prague & gave us a great insight. Thanks Stanley!

Segway Tour. The best tour we have done in Prague all weekend.. had a very friendly tour guide from Germany(can't remember his name ) it was fantastic I would highly recommend this tour, they even change locations if you want for example we went to Prague castle-beautiful views

Best way ever to tour a City in 2 hours. There were 4 of us, Jeff was our guide he did a fantastic job. We were all Segway virgins, after 10 mins tuition that all changed! We were raring to go - I was initially concerned about the idea of 2 hours on these devices we had not experienced before. Within minutes was sugesting that we sould forget the idea of knee or hip replacements and just invest in Segways instead! Had a great time, Jeff was really helpfull, kept an eye on us whilst stopping to explain the historical relevance of many buildings and areas of Prague.

fantastic. What a great way to see the city. we were 5 people in the party from age13 to 76 and all were perfectly happy. Prague has endless walking so it was a pleasure to not have to walk anywhere for 2 hours. We saw everything and our guide, who's name i forget but was something like Christian or Christopher or something was charming and spoke really good English.I would highly recommend a tour and would go so far as to say that Prague is not complete without a segway tour near the beginning of your trip and at least one ballet or Opera.EnjoySasha

Segway tour with Adam. Great experience with the guide Adam :). We had an amazing time, riding all over Prague centre for 90 minutes. Definitely recommended for everyone who wants to experience Prague in a different way.

Mr Robert vassallo. I am the guy from malta. I paid 40 euro for one hr ride but it took us two hrs in total not driving but waiting for you to replace a broken segway and to see which ones are charged before the tour it was a complete rip off . Euro segway its a big no no.

2 Hours visiting Prag in a sort of private tour, with a enthousiastic guide, called Renė. I recommend this Segway company. Everyone is customer oriented and ready to help and find solution. René, who is speaking a good french made this moment very enjoyable.
Awesome!. That was the first time we try this with my family: we really enjoyed it! The guide, Rene Diz, was so kind & knowledgable. It was lot of fun. My 7 years' son loved it!

The Best Experience in Prague so far!. The overall experience was really enjoyable. Kingsley was very friendly, charismatic and convincing! He did his job well. So did Mark, our guide, whom I highly recommend. A very calm, pleasant and understanding person. Not so sure about other members of the stuff (the girl in the blue coat) and one guy who weren't friendly at all. Probably they'd had a bad day. However, my friends and I had a great time!

Alex was our guide very recommended . Alex was our guide, we enjoyed it very much (all four of us) and he was a great guide. Very good experience and excellent service he took. A quick way to get to know around

Best day ever. We had an absolutely fantastic time on the Segway tour, highly recommended! Tiko took us around on a 60 private tour around the city centre. He was really helpful, friendly and informative - explaining every bit we went to. We had a great laugh on the tour, as well as covering everything we hoped for. He stopped to take photos for us and let us grill him with questions about the city. Even after the tour was finishing, he advised us on places to go. We wouldn't have had the trip we have had to Prague, had we not gone on this tour. A massive thank you to Tiko, and the rest of the Segway tour team. Love Tami and Tash.

So much Fun!!!. Friendly staff with the right level of knowledge of the city, not information overload like you get on some tours. The segways are so much fun and you see much more than you would on foot. The 90 minutes flew by and we didn't want to get off - in fact walking around after felt far too slow! Worth it just for getting up to the castle that hill is looooong... Definitely Recommended

Thank god!!!!!. How lucky we found this tour, discovered these amazing vehicles and saw awesome aspects of Prague we would never have seen. By the way euro segway much quickier than all others companies. They Still eating our dust!!! Alex best guide quy, thank you very much for everything!!!
Awesome tour. Awesome tour. Our guide Alex was very knowledgeable and made the whole trip around the city and castle very interesting. I can't recommend this tour enough!! Great value.

Fun way to explore the city. We were trying to find a walking tour in the old town square and were approached by one of these guys offering us a segway tour. He was really nice and not pushy. I said I was a bit unsure of whether I could ride the segway and he gave me a little tutorial which put me at ease. We decided to go ahead and had Tiko take us on a personal tour for 90 minutes straight away. It was really fun and informative. Tiko knew his stuff and also did some awesome little things like film us with our phones and bring a pen so we could write on the John Lennon wall. He also have us some good tips about other stuff we wanted to do after the tour. It was getting cold and we would never have seen everything we did if we were walking. I would really recommend this way of seeing the sights and using this company because they were a perfect mix of professional, knowledgable and fun. It was something I will never forget. Thank you!

Surprisingly good!. There are a lot of Segway tours in Prague, we were hounded frequently. Based on TripAdvisor reviews we went with Euro Segway. We booked an hour's tour which ended up being a private tour. It was lots of fun, a great way to ease all the walking we had been doing. It was cold though, gloves are a must and wrap up warm. Good guide, friendly and knowledgable. Thoroughly enjoyed it!

Great experience. Very helpful staff.. The Armenian guy who introduced us in segway was very polite and helpful. Our guide the Russian guy was simply amazing ! He new everything and he turn our tour into a magic dream. Eurosegway is simply the best. Thank you all guys. I visited in two hours what i havent seen in 3 days..

Segway is the Way to See Prague. Our 2-hour Segway Tour in Prague was the absolute BEST way to see Old Town, Charles Bridge, New Town, Prague Castle, Cathedral, and Park. We also did the All-in-One bus/boat/walking tour the day before, but the Segway Tour was our favorite way to truly experience this beautiful city. Ask for Stanislaus and Marek as your tour guides and you won't be disappointed. They made our tour easy, educational and FUN! Thanks, Guys, from our family of four for such great memories!! -- The Safko's and Jarvis's in SC, USA

INFORMATIVE AND FUN. Fabulous fun tour for any age group. Damien our guide was patient, accommodating and very aware of the needs of our group. His local knowledge was excellent and his sense of humour made the whole experience amazing fun.
Nice Tour with Alex. We took the 1 h Tour and it was really fun.Alex is a great tourguide. He showed us interesting sights in the City with interesting facts about it. It was a pleasure :-)
Great experience!! . Best way to get around Prague !!! Stanley was our guide. Very informative and knowledgeable. Just a quality guy !!! Marc, Chris and Ollie x
Brilliant. Huge fun. Had an hour out on the Segway with Euro Segway. Really friendly and helpful guide and the best fun wizzing round town. Next time its a 2 hr session..

The Most Fun Way to Tour a City!. This was so much fun! Tour guide was great and informative also. Great activity to do when you first arrive as you are immediately shown how to walk to some of the nicest parts of the city.
Highly recommend.

Fantastic fun! . Myself and my partner were a bit skeptical of what this tour was going to be like but I have to say it was so much fun. Our guide, Ais, was very lovely and very informative. Would highly recommend!

Best way to see Prague. Absolutely great experience guaranteed. We were just wandering around old Prague, when a Guy on a segway approached us. At first we were very sceptical about the trip around old town, but after 2 minutes of talk we decided to give it a shot. Payment and safety instructions were easy and very comprehendible, everything was very friendly and professional. We had a goPro camera with us, so they provided us with charger and helmet with a holder. Our guide's name was Pavel, and he did a magnificent job of showing us all of the most interesting places in old Prague. Very friendly, funny and memorable trip. Would definitely recommend.
awesome. thanks for the fantastic tour, TIKO you are the best, a very good tour, i wouldve done it again but i was flying the next day but fully recommend with TICO and RENE DIZ he is the best,

A great way to see Prague. Complete novices we did a one hour tour of the city on our first day here. A great way to get a feel for the city and to find the places to explore at our leisure later in our trip. Our guide Constantine gave us time to get used to the Segway and led us at our pace through the city and over the river. A lovely guy, superb English and an obvious passion for the city. We would have no hesitation in recommending Euro Segway.

Hilarious, great fun way of sightseeing.. Did this on our last day and saw some quirky, unusual sites not seen on our walking tour or in the guide books. Thanks Alex for such an enjoyable 30 minutes. Will do a longer tour next time!

Damien was a 5 star guide!. We would highly recommend Euro Segway and tour guide Damien. We took a 3 hour tour of Prague and Damien was very informative and engaging. Really enjoyed the tour even though it was cold. Also Damien, gave us tips on great restaurants where the locals dine. We enjoyed the meal and the prices. Thank you Damien, you will be a great Doctor. Namaste Doreen and John
Great tour. We did a 2hr tour on the segways taking in all of the city, our guide was vey informative and patient, great way to see the city and so easy to use .

segway tour. It was snowing when we started our tour with Damien but that didn't deter us at all.We learned so much about the history of Prague and it's the ideal way to see so much of the beautiful city. We covered a lot of ground in the 2 hours we were on these way and I must say, it was value for money, many of the other segway companies were charging more for their tours, I would recommend them to anyone visiting the city,well done guys!

Informative and Fun. Our guide was apparently called Geoff or Jeff. He was lovely. Friendly and informative we discovered lots of great things about the landmarks and sights and had some interesting chats about politics too. Its a great way to see a lot of sights in Prague in a short time. Its worth remembering that Segways must irritate some locals sometimes so we tried to remember road sense and courtesy. We had a rainy, cold day which made us concerned but we did not need to be. We were given rain capes, a must! The instruction is useful and the Segway is easy to use. If it's cold its important to dress warmly and wear gloves because your hands are exposed. Do it its lot of fun and really made our short trip.

Excellent tour but poor organisation. Our tour was excellent! A great way to take in the main sights of Prague, especially if you're short of time. René's commentary was original and well informed. Wrap up warm if you're there at this time of year, as the previous reviewer advised!The main drawback for us was that we called ahead to say we'd arrive ten minutes late for our booking and then had to wait for almost an hour before the tour began. To make matters worse, the coordinators didn't tell us this, so instead of going odd for a coffee and coming back we ended up simply waiting in the street (and the cold). This was disappointing and cost us valuable time.

Wrap up warm!. Great experience, but if you're going in the cold weather do make sure that you wrap up warm as you're basically standing completely still in the cold for an hour or more, with the extra wind chill factor of the segway whizzing along. I'd suggest at least a wooly hat under your helmet and two pairs of gloves!Usually you'd be sent out with just your party and a tour guide but myself and my partner were buddied up with a french couple. This did mean that the tour took over the booked hour as the guide had to say everything in french and english, but I didn't really mind this, we got a discounted group rate and it meant more time on the segways.The guy that we booked with was really helpful and the booking process was really easy. With a lot of these things the people selling you the tours can be really pushy but Adam wasn't like this at all, he just gave me his number so I could book later over whatsapp when we found a convenient time.The segways themselves were great fun and very easy to control, literally feel like you have more manoeuvrability than walking by the time you've got used to them.

Segway Prague. The best moment of our trip to Prague was a 2 hr Segway Tour! The guide, René, was amazing ! He speaks Portuguese and has an entire history book inside his head ! I definitely recommend René !

BEST way to see the sights!. We absolutely loved our Segway Tour! Was so much fun! Could ride on one of them all day. Best way to get around and see the sights of Prague, for sure. Don't forget your gloves!! Its chilly out and about in the wind. Our guide Stanley was awesome! He took us on a 90 minute tour. He's young, fun, chatty and really knew his way around. We would definitely do this again! Highly recommended. Not to be missed :) Thanks Stanley :)

Segway tour 1.5 hours. So much fun! Alex was our guide and we are so glad we decided to do the tour. Best way to see Prague since all the sights were quite far apart. 1.5 hours and we saw all that we wanted to, and saved the energy and time otherwise spent walking. Alex also took some amazing photos for us. Excellent service!

2 hour of sheer fun via Segway in Prague. We had our first Segway experience in Prague last week, thanks to Euro Segway Tours it was wonderful. Stanley was our guide. He was only 16 but information and knowledge he has is unmatchable. He was very helpful, he explained us importance of each and every tourist attractions on our tour. We covered from Old Town Square , Prague castle, lenon wall, and many other places during our two hour tour. To us it was a very safe, informative and well organised tour.Thanks Stanley and Euro Segway Tour. If we visit Prague again we will take this tour again. :)

Amazing tour, amazing guides. Peter and Jacob our tour guides were super friendly, professional, caring for our safety and were determined to make our experience a unique and exciting one. It was our first night in Prague and was certainly an unforgettable one. Thank you both very much. We were also treated to water and nice warm coffee at their office after we finished our tour. I would definitely go back to them and dot he tour again and again if I get the chance.
It was great!!!!. It was best expierience ever and tigran was amaizing guid!!!! I recomend !!!! He was profetional and funny ...

Simply PERFECT. those guys are perfect , i tried them on two tours very helpful guides with you, it is just the best way to see prague, you can stop for photos videos rest during your tour . i give them 10/10 .
Great experience!. Great tour! Alex our guide took us round Prague, he was very friendly and very knowledgable. Well worth the money spent. Would definitely recommend.

Brilliant Tour Guide. Brilliant Tour Guide Alex made us feel well at ease with out Segway Experience!! He even met his idol while we were out! A gent that did a lot of the sculptures in Prague, David something. All in all great value tour with many bits of info from Alex. Loved the Peace Wall. A+

Perfect tour. This had to be one of the highlights of our trip. Did this just to experience a Segway as had never been on one, little did I know it was probably the best way to see the tourist attractions in Prague. Our tour guide Rene was fantastic, a true gentleman with an extensive knowledge of the city. I obviously can't speak for the other tour guides, but if you request Rene I can assure you will have an amazing experience. Price was reasonable, other members of staff were friendly, and the views and attractions you are shown are jaw dropping.

A Great Alternative to Walking. We were walking through the square when Nastya approached us and asked if we wanted to try out the Segway. She said it would not cost anything to try it out and then we could decide if we wanted to sign up for a tour. I was very hesistant to try because I am not very coordinated and I am 64 years old!! However, Nastay was an excellent instructor and in no time I had the hang of it and was ready for the tour. There were four of us in our tour and Nastya was very patient with us as we stopped to look at the sights and take pictures. She even offered to take pictures for us so we could all four be in the same picture. We saw things we would have missed had we walked on our own. She share many very intersting facts about Prague and its history. We had a wonderful time. I would highly recommend this tour. We took the 90 minute tour, but I could have ridden the segway all day. Really fun!

The best way to see Prague!. Great Guides (Alex, in our case) and very informative, giving some great historical facts, as well as tips for places to go.If you haven't used a Segway before, don't worry! They are by far the most intuitive motorised transport I have ever used, and in less than two minutes I felt confident. We went on a one hour tour; and despite leaving it to the last day of my second visit to the city, I still leant new things about the city. Costs are reasonable at around £28 per person for the hour; well worth it in my opinion.

Great tour, very professional. . The devices in this company are real segways as oppose to others who rent a replica. The guide was very professional and always went an extra mile: took pictures and even took us longer route than the one we paid for.Needless to say that the tour itself is a must. From now on we take segway tours in every city we visit
Guiding tour. Guided by the most charming red hair girl in Praha overall the first impression was good absolutt an anfordable and recommendable place to be on.

Prague by Segway. This is a most exciting way of touring the city. We had done a bus and walking tour the day before so we did not require much of the commentary from our guide but when needed Alexandria was able to fill in the blanks. We did a two hour tour which took us through the city and into the parkland in the Lesser City overlooking Prague Castle. Just fabulous. The segway was easy to manage even over uneven terrain and gave me the feeling of just gliding along. Our trip went to the miniature Tour Eiffel atop the park where we enjoyed coffee and cake before descending and returning to the segway office. We chose to start early so that there were no pedestrians around but by the time of our return the streets were alive but no trouble for us experienced segway riders. Would do it again in a heart beat.

The best way to tour the city. We tried it as the most comfortable way to see the city. And did the same the next day. As a result we had 30 + km long excursion and , probably, the fullest possible knowledge of the points of interest. Great team and great experience.

Fun way to see the town for teenagers . It was great fun whizzing around the streets on segways. Surprisingly easy to get used to, and enabled us to cover a lot of distance in a relatively short time. We did the tour to include the castle which was well worth it as its up a big hill! It gave us a good overview of the city, including some quirky details like the John Lennon wall. However I would have liked to learn a bit more about the history of Prague, but I guess that's something to get from guide books etc. it's also quite expensive, but not more so than other Segway tours. The location was good for us near the old town square.

ou have to give it a go. you must give it a go in Prague!! My friend and I did the last day we were there. A nice girl stopped us and asked if we'd love to have a free try on segway. after that, we decided to have a segway trip to see Prague one last time before we headed to the airport. We two share a private tour guide named Alex. He was awesome!! He let us know many things we didnt know before. About the national theatre, the narrowest street and the ironic statues in Prague. Big love to Segway tour and big thanks to Alex as well!

Would have liked more Explainations. It was nice covering a lot of ground fast. Not much commentary and our guide was texting or on his phone all the time. If you want a brief overview of Prague but not a real tour it was fine.

Beats doing any other kind of tour around the city!. My husband and I booked a one hour segway tour around the city center. There was the option to go longer which included the castle but we had visited the castle the day before by foot. Our segway guide was Mark who was excellent. He always made sure we were comfortable, safe and weren't struggling. As I was a little nervous getting up and down the curb he always stopped to help me which made it a lot easier.We stopped at many spots around the city where Mark would give us some background information and facts. He also took us to some great spots for photographs. Highly recommended!

Not much of a tour. In our group a lady fell over twice and once seemed to have damaged a car. Our guide rene was very concerned for her the first time, however the second time did seem more concerned that he would not get paid for the over time so must carry on. He did seem a really nice guy though and could be seen on the break socialising with those from the group. He was also very happy to take photos for people in the group.I don't know whether the car incident influenced this, but it all seemed very rushed with historical facts kind of being shouted whilst on the move. It was definitely more of a guided Segway experience round the city than a tour to learn stuff. you get some training to begin with but they will then expect you to be able to go up slopes, downhill, up small steps etc. Without actually having that training and having only practiced on a flat road.

It's about Alex!!!!!!!!. Alex is just a star we had so much fun with him he was nice kind and caring he made sure that we are having the best time Eva and we did !!!!!! He went out of his way to help he is responsible and informative we highly recomend him you will enjoy him !!!!!!!!
Segway prague. Fantastic great value - ask for Nicholi-great tour guide not boring- very safety conscious Professional outfit!

Great tour.patient guide. Unique spots. Great experience. Alex our guide was great. Very patient, knowledgeable and energetic. They have a sist company in Barcelona Spain..should anyone be going there.I suggest take the early morning (9am or10am) departure as the streets are not very crowded.They will negotiate on price if you are reasonable. It was a lot of fun!!

Hilarious! . Basically. I promised a review to our incredible tour guide Poly so here it is! During our stay in Prague nothing even came close to being anywhere near as funny than this segway tour. From the very beginning watching 'grown adults' drive into walls, to stopping at a beautiful pub overlooking the city and even the detailed information about Prague's history and architecture; every minute of this tour was a laugh and a different, enjoyable way to spend an afternoon. Definitely recommend the 2 hour tour to anyone coming to visit!

Segway fun with René Diz in Prague. This experience was probably the highlight of our trip to Prague. Highly recommended especially if you don't have a lot of time in the city to see everything. The 2 hour segway tour was a great way to see the city, and also in my opinion the most entertaining way! Our tour guide Rene was extremely informative about Prague's interesting areas, and spoke English very, very well. However among English he also speaks Spanish and French so he can provide for a variety of people! Rene tailored the tour to suit our needs- if we needed to stop for a drink or loo break he would, and asked us what in particular we would like to see/ tour around which was lovely as the tour felt personal and friendly.Not only did he give us interesting information about the city,he also gave us noteworthy advice that four young girls wouldn't have even considered beforehand, so thank you Rene! The experience with Rene felt very professional and well-run, yet at the same time was very relaxed and personal, allowing for a lot of laughter and fun!A great added bonus was the chance to have pictures taken of us whilst touring Prague beside interesting landmarks, which Rene made look fantastic.Thank you Rene for making Prague a memorable experience!

Funny funny!. Brilliant, tour guide full of local knowledge. Training good, got to do it! We went with three others who we didn't know, but this made it more fun. We saw parts of Prague not yet seen on foot, so a good way to look at other places. Had to wear helmets, but actually, there's lots of crowds to navigate through, and they do move!

Segway experience with Guide René Diz in Prague. An amazing tour, It is highly recommended for a city like Prague to take the Segway experience. Moreover we had the great chance to have a guide - René Diz - who speaks a lot of languages (Spanish, French, English as far as we could see) and who knows very well the city of Prague and all the interesting points to visit with the Segway. Empathic with his clients and preoccupied at any time for people that are not used to the Segway, he really adapts the tour and the timings in function of your personal mood and interest and make it very funny. Thank you René for making our visit joyful.

Great ride!. It was a fantastic tour, we were in 6 people and we didn't have much time to stay in Prague, so we decided to rent a segway to make the ride easier and fun.It was a great experience because our guide René really knows the history of the places we have been, making it much more attractive.That way we could see all the sights in about 2 hours!I definitely reccommend it!
Great tour! . It was an amazing tour! René is a great guide and he made it so much fun:) definitely recommend him for anyone!

Pathetic attitude in the staff.... We chose to do Segway since we were on a short trip to Prague...And I have no regrets in saying this the staff was pathetic except 2 guys 1) Archie our guide he was extremely patient 2) a the guy who sold us the Segway tour....Apart from that the girl who was at the desk she behaved like she is doing a favour to me by giving this Segway and the others if I asked for my bag from the locker he replied how would I know can't you see it yourself....excuse me hello I am the customer here....the Segway was good Archie showed us quite a lotta stuff in the lil time if an hour we were with him....If you don't have issues with people attitude it's a great place to choose....we paid a price of 60mins for 90 mins....They negotiate please use your skills...

Great intro to old town & fun!. Our boys (11 & 14) were very keen to do this so we took a one hour tour as a family led by our guide (Polly) on the morning of our first full day in Prague. We all really enjoyed it, particularly the 11 year old who would not be old enough to be allowed to ride one most other places. The tour was a great initial overview of central Prague and our guide was friendly and informative.

Euro segway amazing tour. Me and my wife took a segway tour of prague you will find lot of people at old town square with segway one with a orange segway is from euro segwayIt starts from old town square and covers a lot of places in prague details can be seen in the brochure for 2 hours costs around 1200 crownswith amazing views and a good guide.

Very nice way of taking a city tour. We were 5 friends and were there in Prague for just one day. Taking seaways for the tour was a good decision because it is fast, less tiring and also provides a guide. The name of our guide is Adrian.

Very nice way to visit Prague. Visited Prague a fortnight ago... We did sightseeing on this strange vehicle (Segway) on te day we arrived. Our tourgide was René...What a nice bloke and what interesting stories he could tell us about Prague. We enjoyed our stay very much, thanks to René who guided us around and showed us the most stunning sights and views... Because he was so ethousiastic we were too! Thanks for everything René, you are the best....Maybe we'll see you again in Barcelona... You never know. Greetings, Linda and Marcel

good for start. this is a good way to start on Prague. you get a chance to see a lot and come back later at points you liked. start is almost at karls bridge at Hradčani side. it is very exciting for kids

A great way to see Prague. Our tour guide, Alex, a student in International Relations, led us on a terrific Segway tour up and down the Castle Hill, through the Jewish quarter, through the old city and the new city and through the huge city park that overlooks the city. It's great way to get a sense of the place and you can stop anywhere you want to go in or look around. We had so much fun on the Segways we kept moving most of the time, though we stopped for a great beer and snack at the monastery atop the hill. Alex knew enough about all the major landmarks to make the trip informative and fun for all of us (two adults, two teenagers). The three hours flew by. And all of us now want our own Segways.

Amazing tour!. We had our tour with René and he was a great tour guide! He knew so much about the city and made lots of photo stops for us. One of the highlights of my trip and I would 100% recommend!

truly fantastic. we went for a hour tour of the city with a lovely french tour guide called Arno.
he was truly fantastic and we had great fun on the Segways. He knew a lot of information and gave us a brilliant price.
would highly recommend

best segway tour of prague!. segway is the best mode to have a sight seeing delight in prague. Euro segway is the best bet...its nearest from the old town square. our guide Renee from Spain was the best guide we could have. he trained us ....did a 90 min tour...clicked pics and videos for us...even whatsapped them to us...the tour till the monastry was detailed. he took us to the routes we would have missed by road or walking...

Must try!. My daighter does love her time riding the segway in Prague. For her segway is the best part of her trip in Prague. She rides it 2 times with her dad. We rent for 30 minutes tour. The guides are very nice, they gave a free trial and some discounts too. Remember that we can bargain the price... And then we have a very nice memorable time segway tour around the Old Town in Prague. A bit pricey but very must try activity in Prague.

An amazing tour with a great guide René. The Euro Segway ride was my first ride on a Segway and I totally loved it. We luckily got a great guide René who showed us around Prague and had amazing historical info about every place we visited. The trip was more fun because he was our guide. Some of our friends who got a different guide were happy with the ride but not the guide.I recommend doing the Segway ride in Prague and remember to ask for René as your guide ;-) You'll have a fun ride.

Renee was an amazing guide. Renee not only showed us the nooks and corners of prague but also went out of his way with sharing the historical information of those places :):) made the segway ride so much more fun :):)
Lots of fun!. The segways were very easy to use and a fun way to get to see the city. Renè had great knowledge of the city which I have also shared with my friends. Would recommend it to anyone.
Great experience!. Easy to use and verry funny! Our guide Renè was verry nice! Prague is a great city and segway is a great way to discover it, Try it!

Easier than I thought. Quite easy and funny. Except for the hard pavement stones on the sideways. A grandma was told how to manage her engine in less than 5 minutes ! Nice trip around Mala Strana and along the Vltava

coment in Prague. Tripadvisor:RenéI was with my freind for 2days in Prague.We was already been there but we wanted to travel onemore time.so it was last week.and we saw segway.and we tried.it was fun.and we took a Segweg.and we met René.we want to get some picture for Segway. and we asked to him.but he doesn't refusal about that.his explain was interesting and fun.i was satisfied,that i he met.If one of my friends go to Prague,ich want to recommend segway and René.thanks.

Segway tour of Prague - ask for Rene...an amazing guide and nice guy :). Wife and I did a Segway tour of Prague and Rene (our guide) was amazing. Rene is very skilled on using the Segway and his expertise and calmness whilst teaching us was much appreciated.Rene also has an excellent knowledge of the history of Prague so our trip was not only enjoyable for the sites...but also for the history.I'd recommend a Segway tour to everyone...and if you can, ask for Rene.

Fun way to discover the city. The segways provide a fun alternative for exploring the city. Easy to use, and certainly a lot faster than walking. Our tour guide Darya was very friendly and had a lot of knowledge of the city. If there was anything in particular we wanted to see, we only had to ask. She didn't mind stopping so that we could take pictures and was just very laid back in general. The only downside was that we often rode between the pedestrians, which meant we couldn't go very fast.

A great way to see the sights. If you have never segwayed before, you dont know what you are missing. Its best described as travelling on a flying carpet, you lean and it goes. Segway tour is a great way to see a city as you can cover so much ground in a short period of time. Our guide, Rene, was very helpful, attentative, and showed great local knowledge of Prague. A good ambassador for the company and would have no hesitation in recommending him and the tour to others.

Highlight of Prague! . They're really good and accommodating - they didn't have a tour guide on hand when we dripped by, but my friends and I were more interested in just riding about (not on an actual tour), so one of the other staff came out with us and tagged along while we were allowed to go where ever. I think a let down for them was they seemed quite unorganised and they didn't easily comprehend what we wanted initially - and you'd expect these tourist focused businesses to have great English comprehension, but I do have to say the segway ride was the highlight of my trip to Prague.

Fantastic way to see Prague!. I was in Prague on business so only had a few hours to see the sights; me and a group of colleagues decided on a Segway tour and it was the best decision we ever made. Rene took us on a two hour tour where we saw the best bits of Prague and better still was Rene's knowledge, I found out more in those two hours than what I would've on my own. He was a fantastic tour guide and made the whole experience thoroughly enjoyable, thank you Rene!!
René. What an Amazing moment in prague. Three friends with the best guide in this town. segway is perfect to visit Prague.

Sophistocated/silly old Aussies in Prague. Brilliant afternoon on spur of the moment offer. Rene our guide helped open our eyes to the wonder of Prague. What a delightful young man minding my initial nerves till we realised what a breeze cruising uphill on a Segway could be! Rene shared great historical insight with us and was a good fun. Louise O'Shea and Bill, Murwillumbah Australia

Excellent Way To See The City. I was part of a group visiting Prague on business. Fortunately on the last day we had some downtime and so decided to see the city on a Segway and what a good decision that was! Our guide was Renee, he spoke very good English and was obviously both knowledgeable and enthusiastic about his adopted city. We were entertained by many anecdotes, some funny some quite dark but all were fascinating. I would highly recommend this company and if you've any doubts about your ability to safely use a Segway be assured that if I can do it anyone can!! Our experience was further enhanced by Renee taking plenty of photos and video which he forwarded onto us after the tour at no extra cost. At the end of the tour I was surprised how quickly the time passed, how much I'd learnt (including useful tips for the future) and how much I'd like to try a Segway out again. 10 out of 10. One tip, don't be afraid to negotiate a good rate particularly if you're in a group.

Excellent Segway through Prague. We took a 2 hour segway trip with Rene. He was an awesome guide and gave us a great tour around Prague. We managed to see all the sights, but didn't feel rushed at any point in time. We were able to take pictures while segwaying through the streets. Rene also gave us some nice history lessons about the Lennon Wall, Charles Bridge and a few other popular buildings. The segways were in good condition and easily maneuverable. Would definitely recommend these guys if you're ever in Prague!

Segway experience. it was an amazing experience to see city while having fun on segway❤️ strongly suggest to have this experience in Prague .. İf you have chance To choose guide Rene is perfect and very helpfull guide with his smiling face
Rene the guide. The Segway trip was great fun made even better by the guide Rene; I would recommend a trip around Prague following Rene and seeing the sights. Fab day out!

Segway Joyride with a nice Guide. Me and my girlfriend are the first time in Prague. One of the first things we saw were alot of segway drivers. So we dicided to do it too. So I spoke with a guy who had a segway and he took us directly to the office. After all they explained us rhe rules and than we started a 30 minutes tour with the nice Guide René, who showed us many things and was very sympathic. Everyone who wants to do a sigeway tour go to this office and very important, ask for René. Greetings

Fantastic sightseeing experience. We were on a business trip to Prague and therefore our time was limited. However we wanted to see the sights of Prague and not waste the opportunity to be in such a beautiful city. Renee was our tour guide, and he was fantastic from start to finish. His knowledge was extremely impressive, and his humour enabled the telling of some of the darker stories of Prague to be told in a lighthearted way. He was very professional at all times and made sure our safety was being looked after.The segwaying was a brilliant experience, and we managed to fit a lot in to 2 hours that we would have never been able to see if on foot. Having Renee take pictures and videos of us too even further advanced the all round package of how we were looked after, and added an extra touch to the experience.Well worth the money.

Excellent way of SEEING Prague quickly. After literally 1-2 minutes, a Segway is easy to use and very safe. Pedestrians seem wary of them, but once you know how to ride them, there really is no issue. Euro Segway were very friendly and polite. We loved this tour, but please do note that this is really a sightseeing tour, where you will see the majority of Prague very quickly and get to go places you wouldn't normally go if you were walking, such as up high in the hills. You will get some great photos also. If you want detailed history of the places you visit, I would suggest finding another way to get around. Oh and although its not a very physical activity, you will feel it in your calf's at the end, but again, a lot less than you would walking!
segway tour.. Very nice tour of Prague on segway. I got to know more about the city and guide coach was very help full.

What a wonderful tour and excellent guide. This tour with segway was one of the most fun things of my trip to Prague. You can see all historical and important places in Old town Prague less than 3 hours and if your guide is René, that makes it much much better. He behaves not just your guide but your friend living in Prague and showing you the city.Thank you again, René

Best guide in Prague is René. René is the best guide in Prague. He is very firendly and doing his job perfectly. In 3 hours we almost see most known symbol of Prague. If I have time, I will come Prague and I am going to find René again, he is like a friend...

Prague from an individual view. We made a guided Segway Tour on our Prague-Weekend. My Wife and me were very happy about our decision. We got an awesome guide named René from Spain but very well English spoken. We enjoyed very much the different views and eplanations which we got from René.

Best way to see Prague. We did a 2hr Segway tour with Philip. He was great - very patient whilst we learnt the ropes of 'driving' a segway - and very knowledgeable about the city. Would highly recommend it.

The only way to see Prague. We arrived in Prague and arrived in the Old Town Square to see the clock and saw loads of people zooming around on Segways. We spoke to 2 guys; the second one being Filip. I really liked the fact that he was straightforward with us. He showed us the map of the route and what we could see in the time. We ended up doing the 120 min. It was great value for money and I am well and truly convinced that I was born to ride a Segway. Filip was brilliant. He showed us the sights and he really personalised the tour. He recommended places and was really informative answering our questions. He's lived here a long time and he really knows the town. I would highly recommend it. If you are going to do any kind of paid tour in Prague - the only way is Segway and Filip is your guy!

Frozen Segway (in a lovely way). Renè was such a good tour guide, in just one our he could show us a Prague which i have never seen. I appreciated the tour so much. It was such and amazing experience. Tks, Renè!!

More than a tour... A life experience (thanks René). We are a Belgium family, and we did the 90 minutes tour. I was afraid about safety for my kids 10 and 7 years old. But after we did talk with our guide before the tour, this afraid was gone, he talk in a way that make you feel very save and confortable, very good psychological skills. He did watch a lot for our kids and while he did explain us many things that in a walking tour has not explain to our family, he knows a lot about Prague, and we did check in internet some things that other guides told us diferent than René, and René was right, other guides from other tours, didnt said the true. Ride a segway it was much more easy than we ever expected. With pictures in his phone our guide explain to us many things that we were not able to see because the distance, like Žižkov tower, "the babies tower". And with the segway, we discover that Prague have amazing hiden places.They have gloves for free, and René did pictures with his phone and we got this pictures just 6 hours later, by whatsapp, and totally free of charge. If you want to enjoy a new experience, take a tour with this company and ask for René, the best guide we ever had in all our hollidays!!!! PS.- thanks René for all!!!

The whole Prague for two hours. Segways are the extremely cool way of discovering cities, especially if city has a lot of hills and nice trails like Prague. Euro segway gave us a discount and personal tour for just 2 person. Our guide showed us a lot of hidden places and tell a lot of stories. All were very friendly and made everything to make us happy.

Awesome tour!. What an incredible experience! We had so much fun exploring this beautiful city, our tour guide Rene was lovely and very knowledgeable, he even helped us out telling us the best places to eat and drink! Would definitely recommend :)
René. René was our guide, he's amazing and experienced.. :-) visiting Prague has been great with him! :-).
Pharmacist. I went in a Segway trip around prague it was with René he was very informative very friendly and honest. He let me enjoy my visit for prague very very much although I was alone.

Really funny!!!. It was the first time that me and my daughter try to go with segway and it was really funny. We meet Renè and we went with him around Prague and Moldava river. He teach us how to use the segway and he told some information about the history of the city. He also made us some photo and beautiful video. If you go to Praga and you are italian ask for Renè he speak italian and he is really friendly.

Amazing segway tour. During my trip to Prague, my friend and I came across the segway tours and decided we wanted to give it a go. We did an evening segway tour and René was a great tour guide... He took us to many sites we wanted to see and was very friendly. We loved it and would definitely recommend him to anyone considering doing a segway tour.
Great experience through the streets of Prague!. We had an amazing time with our guide Philip and toured through all interesting sites of Prague... Highly recommended!

Not a tour but a nice ride through the city on Segway. Our guide did not stop or tell us anything about the city. She was very good at riding the Segway and actually was on her phone through our "tour". We paid 1100kc each for our 90 minute Seway ride. Maybe if we had another guide this would have been better. It was fun to ride through the city and the views from the castle were beautiful.

Fantastic experience in segway tour. Our guide philips is really nice and patient,taught us how to use segway and introduced the background of scenic spot.It's really interesting way to visit praha. The day we visited by the segway is snowing.We seem to come to the fairy tale world when we almost arrived in the praha castle.

Great experience. We r a gruppo of friends We did our tour with phillip(nice patient guy ) it was a amzaing experince best way to explore the town in a short time \ ottimo tour in prague con il segway . Famtastica esperienza

A nice way to discover the city. We met our segway guide at the old town square, and he took us to their office by the jewish quarter. We chose the 90 min tour that we had for the price of a 60 min tour, probably an offer everyone gets. But time fly fast, so at least 90 min is recommended. We went to the castle and then around town, seeing places that we wouldn't have done otherwise, like the Lennon wall and the hanging Freud. Our guide was very good and nice.
So much fun!!!. Our guide, Phillip, such a lad. Saw soooooo much of Prague, Jewish quarter, castle, loads!! A bit on the expensive side but REALLY worth doing!!!

Good tour but bad guide. We were in Prague just for couple of days so we decided not to walk and try something new, a Segway. We booked a tour with this company because they seemed that they know what they are doing and their segways looked a bit better than those from another companies. When we got to the meeting point our guide showed us how it works and we were good 2 go. But what had upset me was the fact that all the guides from this company AREN´T CZECHS. They are russians or ukraines or something like that. And that just pissed me off. We are foreigneirs in this city so we had expected that our guides will be czechs but they weren´t.Besides this fact our questions had been left unanswered and we also had to make our own photo stops and the guide didn´t tell us something more. He was like wikipedia just full of things you can read somewhere.Definetly not good worth for the money!!

More of a Guided Rental than a tour. . Our guide was really good at riding segways... And we followed her through the city. If you already know the city and don't need to ask any questions, this is your tour. Our guide did not know answers to any questions. You will have to initiate your own stops for photos. If you would like to know any information about the places you travel past, find another tour. Segways are in good condition, helmets and warm gloves available. Good tour routes.

Total blast!. Totally loved itPro:- they are super fun - young cool fun guys- u can see way more than just by walking- super informed tour guideTipp: - try the longest route - really worth it- if u have places u wanna see, tell them and theyll get u there (especially since woth all these streets it aitn easy to find everythingOverall totally loved it! Thx so much to Alex - the coolest and most fun guy ever!!!

Segway is the best way!. Wonderful Segway tour round this great city. friendly staff who really take care of you. easy to use and saved my tired feet from more walking! you see so much more on Segway and this was great value and so much fun! a really fantastic experience!

A great way to see Prague. A brilliant and fun way to see Prague and would recommend it! Our guide was friendly, helpful and able to give some commentary as we were riding around. The only negative was that we were a group of 10, so they didn't have the Segways immediately available and we were told that we would have to wait about 20 minutes. Not a real problem, so we waited in a nearby bar fro what turned out to be over an hour that we had to wait.I would definitely do this again, maybe a longer tour next time!

UNREAL SEGWAY TOUR OF PRAGUE. WOW WOW WOW!! If you want to see the Prague in a fun way....experience it with EUROSEGWAY tour!It was amazing! The tour-guides are all really friendly and accommodating. Thanks again EURO-SEGWAY!and...its a GREAT PRICE :)

Great way to see all of Prague. Although we've been here for a few weeks already, we decided to go out on a segway tour to see more of the city. The guides were very helpful and friendly, and Alex showed us his own personal tour that showcased some of the lesser-known areas. Very fun and very easy, and pretty affordable too. Highly recommend!

Excellent tour with great guide!. I took a 30 minute Segway tour with Euro Segway Prague and the guys who work there are so great. They are really willing to customize the experience to be something you're interested in.

Excellent!. Chose to do the 90 minute tour of Prague with Alex as our guide. He was very friendly and knowledgeable of Prague's landmarks and history. The segway's are easy to use after a few basic instructions from your guide. Highly recommend this as a fun activity for all ages. We'll definitely do it again. Thanks Alex !!

Great fun and friendly guides.. I had an hour Segway tour of prague this weekend. The tour guide was friendly and helpful. The tour was a reasonable rate, we got to see so much more than we could have on foot. Most importantly it was brilliant fun! Thanks so much, I hope to do another Segway tour with you in another city soon!

Segway is the best way. I went to Prague with my girlfriend this weekend and we went on a guided Segway tour of Prague for an hour and it was so much fun and we saw sights that we just wouldn't have managed to see on foot The guide was so helpful and friendly and the segway's were lots of fun to travel on Highly recommended!!! I'm a segway convert for sure

Alex. Last weekend, myself and my friends went to Prague and went on a Euro Segway tour of Prague. We were assigned a very helpful guide named Alex who assured us that working a Segway was just as easy as walking. For myself and one of the girls that was certainly the case, but alas, another struggled. Nonetheless Alex persevered to ensure she had an excellent experience on her Segway tour - which indeed she did! The Segway tour was the highlight of our trip to Prague, it's an amazing way to see all the sights. 10/10 would definitely Segway again.Big thanks Alex for making the whole thing a blast! x
Awesome.. Fantastic fun experience, great way to explore the old and new town streets. Good value for money, would highly recommend.

Most amazing experience!!. First time i tried riding a segway. We are a family of six and we toured the city of prague usuing the segway with Euro segway. It was the most amazing experience. It was very easy to learn and an enjoyable feeling when riding. Will definitely love to do again and for much longer. The guys were very nice and patient with us and even gave us some extra time...Awesome and highly recommended!!

Fantastic tour and guide!. We were looking for a Segway tour and came across eurosegway in old town square. They were very kind and helpful. They showed us the main attractions in Prague! The guide was very informative and they have a lot of time and patience for you. We strongly recommend this!!

Best way to see Prague.. We were initially reluctant to buy into this 'tourist sell'. But with lots of begging and pleading from the kids we gave in and enjoyed a trip around Prague in Segways. Fantastic way to see the city, our tour guide was funny and knowledgeable. We were a group of 7 ranging from 9 years to 30+ years. We all thoroughly enjoyed the two hour tour.

Fantastic experience!. My girlfriend and I elected for the one hour Euro Segway tour on our first day (of five) in Prague. Not only were the segways really fun to ride and easy to maneuver around crowds, but the quick progression through a clever route allowed us to map out exactly what we wanted to see in greater depth. We could not possibly have seen all of these amazing sites in three days, let alone one hour. This tour was efficient in that it allowed us to get a sense of scale and Prague geography. Highly, highly recommend!

Best way to see Prague. We did the hour tour and our excellent guide Alex showed us many interesting features of Prague that we would never have found on our own! Highly recommended and such good fun.
Eurosegway. Great way to get around, it was more about the Segway than the tour but none the less great fun. I would highly recommend it. Make sure you barter as they will come down in price.
Fantastic ride with Aria!. I did the one hour tour with Aria who was very friendly and gave me good information about the city! I'll be back!

FUN WAY TO SEE PRAGUE. We only had two nights in Prague, so not much time on our hands and we were looking for a fun and exciting way to see the most important sites in Prague. We came across Euro Segway and was amazed how friendly and patient our tour guide was. The first ten minutes we were trained on how to use a segway and before we knew it, we were ready to go on our tour. It was full of adventure and interesting facts and very easy to navigate and turned out to be such fun. Will definitely recommend them and can't wait to try it again.

Fun way to see Prague. We did the hour tour with Euro Segway and our lovely guide Polly. It was our last day in Prague and was so nice to wizz through the city. The tour took us to places we hadn't been before, and the views were beautiful. I would recommend doing this in Prague!

Go Polly!. Great tour with Polly. Did the 1 hour tour today and was really fun and great way to see the city. Was surprised how easy they are to navigate the segways. Had been in Prague for 3 days and saw sights I hadn't seen purely because it's a large city. Great tour!

So much fun and informative too!. Four of us embarked on the Euro Segway Tour of Prague and we had a ball! 2 hours of unbelievable sightseeing with such fantastic, knowledgeable tour guides. We had no experience on Segways but within 10 minutes we all felt comfortable. Marik and Serge we can't thank you enough, you really made this a thoroughly enjoyable couple of hours and we would highly recommend Euro Segway!
Great fun. This was a great funny way to discover Prague! Our guide Marcel was really good and helpful. We booked a 60 minutes Tour. Thanks a Million for the Tour!
Very nice way to discover the town.. We chose the 90mn tour. Very nice and easy way to go to the Castle and have interesting sightseeing.

Possibly the best way to see the city. 10 of us did the segway tour....it took us from the old town square to prague castle and then back..60 mins of sheer fun with some amazing sights around the city.

Best Segway in the town. Best Segway in the town. It is one of the best thing to try in Prague. Without this your trip is incomplete. It's an experience, u will explore beautiful small streets of Prague.
My guide named Siarhei was really nice n helpful. I loved the experience.

Prag glide was awesome!. The coolest thing Ive tryed in my life! You stand on the ground, but you flying. It seems to be impossible but it is real!!! I enjoy segways in Prag for two hours and its a pity that I found this at the last day of our trip. You need to get segway tour at first days of your Prag stayng - you will save a lot of time and energy. And get a real fun!My son love segways too. May be one day I will buy my own segway.
Fantastic tour. The guide VLADI was a very helpfull and extra carefull whit us !We spend a fantastic 2 hours tour !We recomend this company and this Guide Vladi !Thank you !!PauloMadrid

A fun experience and swift way to see Prague. We did the Segway today with Vladi (guide) and had a lot of fun. Our first time on a Segway and our guide was careful, helpful and keen to take care of our safety.We did the 2 hour tour around the city outskirts: Metronome, parks, Palace, hill to the mini "Eiffel Tower" etc.This Segway tour was worth our time and money. We went where we wanted as we wanted.

Best way to get around Prague!. Highly recommend this Segway tour. We had the best guide. he was very helpful and knowledgable about Prague, he was even willing to take us 'off the beaten' track to see the things we wanted see that weren't on the set tour. Got to do steep hills and had great views! We did the 120 min tour and it was over way too soon because it was fun. Do it!

Thoroughly enjoyable tour. I did the double whammy, which is essentially the castle tour and the city tour. It is marketed as a 7 hour tour, but is not really the case as there was a two and half hour break in the middle where you are taken back to the base and left to your own devices Our guide was Andrew, who did an excellent job of explaining the varied history of the city and pointing out the good coffee shops. Most of the streets and pavements in Prague, particularly around the castle and in the old town are cobbled and can be a bit bumpy. The bikes rigid frames did not help. Andrew and the base staff were great, extremely helpful and did an excellent job of looking after us. Would highly recommend this company to anyone visiting Prague.

Fab way to see Prague . We did the City Tour - thoroughly recommend this tour as a great way to orientate yourself around Prague. Our guide was from Prague and littered his talk with tales of his family which really bought it to life. An easy going ride full of information, all the key sites and fun. You won't regret doing it!

Thanks Andrew!. What a great way to see the city on our first day of holiday. Andrew was a super guide, clearly explaining the interesting history of Prague and answering all questions with the insight of a local. We did the 2.5hr city tour, saw the most famous landmarks of Prague, time for plenty photos and even got the option of a tea break!

Great Way to Tour Old Town and Lesser Town. Prague is a great city for walking, but you can easily get lost and end up going in circles, which is what happened the first day I was there with my daughter. Being tired of walking, we decided that a bike tour of the Old Town and Lesser Town might be a nice change of pace. It was great. Our only regret was that we didn't do it the first day. We were especially pleased with our guide, Andrew, who was very personable and extremely knowledgeable of the history of Prague and Czech Republic. He let us go at our own pace and showed us some places that we may have never seen on foot. I highly recommend Praha Bike and Andrew as your tour guide.

Great day tour. My husband and I enjoyed a reasonably priced guided day trip with Praha Bikes, from the center of Old Town to Karlstejn Castle. The ride is only about 22 miles, mostly flat with a couple short hills. The guide was easy-going, informative and capable, and we were delighted to learn that it is simple to bicycle out of town into the countryside. We rode one way and took the train back, something we've often done on our own while bicycling in the Czech Republic--but if you haven't, this is a great way to learn how to do it. It really opens up opportunities for self-guided bicycling, especially when you get used to using Czech cycling maps. We recommend Praha Bikes trips for the occasional cyclist as well as more dedicated riders who want to join a group or just get used to riding out of Prague.

Good Tour - Just a long day.. My 6 friends and I visited Prague in late September and took the full day bike tour. The tour was around 7 hours but we stopped about an hour and a half for lunch. The tour was actually two of the half day tours combined (so there were some people that were only there half the day). The tour was LONG especially with so many of the streets being stone. We seemed to do a lot of back and forth whereas if it was just one tour we could have done it in a more streamlined way (like doing one end of the city then the other). If I were to go again I would just do the morning tour and then do the John Lennon Wall and any other sights I feel I missed later. Our tour guide Francesco was great. He was so knowledgeable so I don't want that to be taken away. I just think for the 7 of us we think the tour could have been a little shorter if it was done in a different order. I would definitely recommend the morning tour if someone was to visit Prague.

Bohemian paradise hike. My daughter (in her twenties) and I ( in my forties) were in Prague and wanted to hike the bohemian paradise. I wanted a guide so we would not get lost. This was an awesome trip Michal was great. He was on time to pick us up at hotel, stopped at a store so we could get water. Hiked at a pace that was great for both of us. Spoke English very well, he also speaks German. Helped us find a great dish to eat at restaurant, and gave us another one in Prague for later that night with a model train that serves your drink (Vytopna on the second floor)I wish we had had one more day there so we could have gone with him to the bone church. He was very informative and the trip was one of our favorite things we did.

you gotta CZECH it out . my husband and i took the karlstejn castle tour (20 miles) and LOVED it. we travel frequently but usually stray away from guided tours. our expat friend recommended the tour and we figured we'd give it a shot. out of all our travels, this has probably been our favorite experience. great way to see prague and the surrounding area without it feeling overly touristy/commercialized. given how much we enjoyed the experience, it was a total steal cost-wise. the bikes: easy to figure out, comfortable seats, sturdy, reliablethe route: amazing. some pretty majestic scenery. worth the ride for this alone. even got to pet sheep! the guide: we had andrew and thought he was awesome. super friendly, approachable, informative, constantly double checking to make sure we were staying on route. he had a good sense of humor but also knew a ton about prague/history. he rocks a great man-bun and takes good photos if you ask him. the food: we dropped into a cafe under the castle and andrew helped us pick out some traditional czech food. very tasty and reasonably priced. overall: 100% worth it. couldn't recommend it more.

Awesome tour with an awesome guide! . This is simply one of the best ways to view Prague's beauty. Our guide Joseph (is it Josca?, please correct me if I'm wrong) was an absolute gem of the touring industry. He had fantastic knowledge of the city itself and some of the most interesting anecdotes to go along with it. My partner and I took the day tour, and even when stopping for lunch, Joseph showed us a nice bar/restaurant to have a bite to eat and joined us as well (even recommending a nice beer for us to try). Bonus! The tour itself is amazing, and after a small hiccup with one of the bikes, and a quick changeover from the shop mechanic, we were back on the road! The tour offers beautiful panoramic views from hills and heights around Prague and intricate details of the inners of the city! A "must do" for anyone wanting to check out Prague in a nutshell. Cheers Joseph for a top day!

Excellent Way to See it All . My wife and I were in Prague for a long weekend so we had limited time to explore the city. We took the panoramic tour with Praha Bike and were able to see parts of Prague that we would never have visited otherwise, which was perfect. The pace was ideal and allowed for many appropriately timed stops although by the way for (you guessed it) panoramic views of the city. The line was also short enough at Prague Castle to let us into the gardens and church for a quick visit. One of the patrons' bike broke down on the tour and our guide quickly assessed the damage. The guide gave up his bike to the guest, and another employee met us at the bottom of the hill 15 minutes later with a replacement bike. A slight delay, but I was impressed how prepared and ready to assist the company was to make things right as quickly as possible.

Wonderful day!. The bike tour to Karlstejn was a wonderful day! Our guide, Britton, was friendly, organized, and full of information. Highly recommended to anyone visiting Prague and wants a nice, active day to somewhere outside the city!

Greatest Tour guide! . We loved this bike tour and Francesco gave a wonderful tour. We had so many questions and he was able to answer all of them. He even took lots of pictures for us and with us! Highly recommended!!

A Great Way to See Prague. The bike tour wasn't too strenuous and provided a great overview of the city. Our guide, Britton, was extremely friendly and he did a great job of mixing in history with humor. The bikes were what I expected for a rental bike (think "heavy and industrial strength") and the staff at the shop were courteous. If you opt for the all-in-one "7 hour" tour, please keep in mind that it's two separate tours and you're only actually moving on the bicycle for less than an hour for each portion of the tour. (I had auto-pause enabled on the GPS)... All things considered, I would definitely use this group again. I was seriously considering doing another tour the very next day, but opted to check out a local farmer's marker instead & explore the city by foot.
Excellent bike tour!!!. Francisco was an incredible! We saw so many sights, learned a ton and went off the beaten track. One of my favorite bike tours bc it's so easy to bike around. Highly recommend

Prague classic city bike tour . Fantastic way to get orientated with the city! Our guide Andrew was very good! Funny and a lot of history. Did a good job to keep us all together and the microphone/headset combo made sure you did not miss anything. He even recommended places to go after for food and beer! Highly recommend!

Brilliant bike-based introduction to Prague. Our guide Josca was really well informed and sparky, with all sorts of facts mixed in with interesting anecdotes, none of your dull droning commentary here! He also gave us an excellent tip for a lunch spot off the tourist trail, and ideas for more places to visit. We'd totally recommend Praha Bike!

Awesome Castle Tour with Sasha . We had a wonderful e-bike tour with Sasha. Lovely views, great information, and a fun stop for coffee and cake. He gave lovely restaurant recommendations and joined us for lunch. Couldn't ask for more!!!

Electric Bike Tour. Prague. Make even a chilly, rainy day fun with Praha Bike Tours! Sasha was an excellent guide and gave us a great tour of the city. He is very personable. This was my first bike tour experience. I highly recommend the electric bike for a hilly, complete tour of Prague. Bikes were easy to use, staff was friendly and prices were good.

We would thoroughly recommend Praha Bike Tours, & Sasha was an excellent guide.. Sasha from Praha Bikes Tours was very well organised, he ensured we were well prepared for the ride, bikes were great. Sasha has a broad knowledge of the local history that he shared with us in a very easy going manner. He was aware of the delays that could occur, due to crowds, so was able manoeuvre us to places where there was smaller queues. We would thoroughly recommend this tour. Thanks Sasha.

Highlight of my trip!. My guide Britton completely made this tour! A fun, beautiful ride that was the perfect balance of leisurely and earning-my-pilsner strenuous. Loved the history and stories speckled in at every stop. Would recommend to anyone visiting Prague!

Thumbs up!. I would highly recommend Praha Bike. My son arranged the tour and everything went as planned. Nice bikes, very friendly staff and well organized. Sasha, our guide, was really good with my grandkids, and all of the funny questions they ask. Definite thumbs up!

Great way to see a lot of prague. Prague City Bike Tours is an excellent introduction to the city. Guests are lent comfortable bikes and earphone receivers that connect to a microphone used by the guide. Our guide, Francesco, was excellent and helped us understand Czech history, architecture and culture. Prague has much to offer. The best part of a bike tour is that it covers a lot of ground in a short time. You won't go in buildings or in depth on specific topics. Also, if you are uncomfortable riding a bike in heavy traffic or around cars and pedestrians, this tour may not be for you. This tour is a fine survey of Prague. We recommend it highly.

Rented bikes to karlstein castle. I called for guided tour to karlstein castle, but it wasn't available. Praha bikes suggested that we rent bikes and do the trip ourselves (about 30 miles) and take the train back.. The trip was magical, beautiful scenery, bike trail was safe... BUT..there are hills (evoke helped a lot), we got lost several times and had to ask locals who don't speak English because the bike trail is not continuous (you have to go through towns) ... If you get lost make sure you ask the locals about "bike" trail not car directions to karlstein...and there was poor signage ... We made it but list quite bit of the figuring out our way... You take the train back just make sure they describe to you how to buy tickets. Have google maps so that you can ride from main train station back to Praha bike shop. Although they clise st 7:30 they waited for us till 7:45 but we didn't know they would do it so we're a bit stressed out to get back before they close (they should have mentioned that to us)..we tried to call but none was picking up the phone for hours !! :) anyway, before you rent the bikes on your own, make sure you iron out these details w them ..beautiful bike ride through czeck country! I will do it again now that I know how it works! Good luck :)

Fast and fun way to see the city. The staff at Praha Bike were unbelievably helpful. Having only been in the city for a day, we were given a map and directions to follow the river around the city. Cheap and easy to do; a great way to make the most of the late summer sunshine in Prague.

All Day Bike Tour of the City of Prague. We spent the whole day following Francesco through the streets of Prague on sturdy bikes. We learned about the interesting history and beautiful architecture of the lovely city from an extremely knowledgable and articulate guide. We also enjoyed some delicious Czech food and beer. Even though the streets were filled with tourists, cars and trams we always felt safe. Francesco represented Praha Bikes very well and we highly recommend this tour.
Bike Tour Karlštejn. I had a fantastic time today. The weather, the tour, the company was great. Britton was our fabulous guide. I highly recommend this tour.

Big tour of Prague!. I would highly recommend this day out! It was a fantastic way to tour the city and we saw and explored every corner of Prague! Our tour guide, Francesco, was excellent and made the experience thoroughly enjoyable!

Fantastic Panoramic tour of Praha on eBikes. Sasha our guide was wonderful! We will definately ask for him again on our next visit. Informative and entertaining and eBikes were brand new and we highly recommend for this particular tour which has some hills and covers a large area. Well Worth the price and Praha Bike People a great group to use.

Good thing to do the first day in Prague. Nice your to cover a lot of ground and get familiar with the layout of Prague. Inexpensive with nice guides. I would have liked more talking, more history. Did city tour, flat and easy.

Excellent and informative way to see Prague. This was our first time in Prague so decided to do a bike tour to get a feel of the city. We took the 3 hour city guide from 11:30 - 14:30 on the 15th September 2016 and it was a great experience.Check in was straight forward with the tour company and we were each given a suitable bike. Our tour guide Mikel was a great tour guide- being a citizen of Prague his entire life, he has a wealth of experience and knowledge of the city that he was able to communicate to the group during the tour. Physically the tour was not challenging as it was on the flat so anyone worrying about being on a bike for 3 hours need not worry - there was also frequent breaks to look at the areas in more detail. Would recommend to anyone to get a better feeling and knowledge of the beautiful and historic city of Prague.

Countryside Tour on E­Bikes from Prague to Karlstejn Castle. Great tour! The tour group had a wide range of abilities on the bike so we moved a slower pace than expected but this was a blessing because it ended up being a beautiful day. We did not tour inside the castle but the climb and views were worth the hike.

Great tour of a beautiful city!. My husband and I spent the day with Andrew and a family from Germany on the combined castle and city tour. We knew Andrew was going to be a great guide when we saw that he was wearing a Toronto Blue Jays cap! As we live 2 hours from Toronto, we found lots to talk about when we weren't learning about Prague. Andrew really knows his new home and told us so many interesting things. We particularly enjoyed the morning up on the hill and touring the castle. At lunch we returned to the bike office and he took us to a great restaurant where the locals hang out. My husband was thrilled with the food as it was traditional Czech fare. We both had a beer and a big plate of food, enough to keep us going for the afternoon tour. The afternoon was very hot and we got a bit weary which is the only reason I didn't rate the tour a 5. Andrew was great, taught us lots, showed us places to return to but we were fading from the heat! I would definitely recommend these tours when visiting Prague!

What a great way to see the city, with Britt as our guide. Britton was a great guide, taking us to various places in the old city and always interjecting snippets of interesting trivia behind different parts of the city. We love Praha, and would go back again in a heartbeat. We heartily recommend having Britton as our guide.

Britton's Bike Tour - Amazing!!!. I had one of the most WONDERFUL days ever in Prague on a bike tour with Britton! He knew so much about the beautiful city including history, architecture, and fun facts. We learned and saw so much while laughing along the way! By the end it was like we had known him forever. This is one of the best ways to see the city while you are there -I absolutely recommend it!

Awesome way to see Prague!. What a great way to see the city! Britton was an awesome guide and really personalized our tour. We did the classic city tour our first day in Prague, saw all the sites, and learned some history about the area. The biking was straightforward and easy to follow. Afterward, Britton took us to a delicious lunch spot and gave us some more tips on places to eat and grab a beer. We absolutely loved our experience with Praha Bike. Thanks, Britton!

Unforgettable experience! . I absolutely loved our bike trip to Karlstejn with Praha Bike and it exceeded my expectations in many ways. Firstly and most importantly our tour guide Britton was fabulous. He made us feel comfortable and entertained throughout the whole journey with his positive and cheerful personality. If you decide to go on this trip definitely choose Britton as your guide! The trail itself was amazing because it felt like we were riding through fields, hills, and villages from a fairytale. I was surprised by how accessible it was to get out of the city so easily by bike and into the beautiful Czech landscape. Not to mention the route is extremely safe and we rarely had to share the road with any cars. If you're looking for a fun and unique outing outside of the city, I couldn't recommend Karlstejn through Praha Bike more :)

Great City for cycling. We did 2 tours with this company, The Classic City tour & Prague Castle Tour. The Classic City tour is a must to get a feel of the city and is slowly paced with each rider having a headset to listen to the guide whilst riding and when stopped. This tour will give you most of the sights so you can return at a later time. Lovely coffee stop in an open park as well. Highly recommended.The Prague Castle Tour was ok, but turned in to a walking tour around the Castle. 2 teens found it boring and a bike ride without a coffee stop is unforgivable.

Fantastic Bike Tour. My boyfriend and I enjoyed a lovely afternoon with Francesco. We were lucky enough to have him give us a private tour since no one else signed up on this rainy afternoon. The rain added to the experience. He was very knowledgable about Prague and its history. He was easy going and we felt comfortable spending about 3 hours with him and asking him questions about Prague's history and also what to do or eat in Prague. We highly recommend this company and hope that you get a tour with Francesco!

Great Trip!. I had a great time on my bike trip to Karlstejn Caslte with Praha Bike! Britt was our guide for a group of about 15 people and he did a great job keeping us at a good pace, while offering plenty of breaks to take pictures, check out the scenery and relax. Britt was also very knowledgeable about Prague and Karlstejn castle and was a great guide throughout our day! I would definitely do this again!
Perfect in every way. What an incredible way to check out this beautiful city and it couldn't have been any better without out awesome guide Britton! Thanks for the memories ☺️

Excellent Tour. We did the City Tour on our first day in Prague , this got us orientated with the lay out of the City . Francesco was our guide and was friendly, very informative , and patient, the bikes were very good mountain bikes , best for the cobblestone streets. The tour was extensive and covered most of the Old Town and Lesser Towns top tourist attractions.I strongly recommend a City tour with Francesco and Praha Bike Tours.Keith and Robert , Sydney , Australia
