Great city ride!. Had an excellent tour with Britton! Lots of enthusiasm and awesome information. The other staff was also really friendly. The mechanic, I think it was Kuba, set up my bike for maximum comfort! Great job guys

Cancel the tour 15 min before to start. Unfortunatly i cannot say anything good about them. I booked a tour with 36 hr en advance. They correctly advised that confirmation will depends if the minimum of 2 person will participate and they will confirm 24 hr in advance. Anyway, i went to the shop 2 hr before to re confirm (otherwise i planned to take another tour) and they confirmed. Then, 15 min in advance they cancelled (i missed the other tour)... They offered me to do the tour for me alone "as a favor" ..... Too late, i would like to be advised at list of "may not happen" before...so i can decide if i take the risk.
Great guide . Had a wonderful time riding through the back streets of Prague. Leisurely pace with an informative guide. A must when in Prague.
Great way to see the city. We were given a bike tour by Britton, very knowledgeable on city history, culture and entertainment. A pleasant way to cover a large area and learn about the city.

Great Tour of the City. Our family of four, 2 adults and 2 kids, ages 8&10, went on a city tour across the river and back. Our guide, Britton, was excellent. He was patient with the kids, explained things in just enough detail to inform but not bore, and was very friendly. There is one good uphill and one pretty steep long downhill. Our kids were able to manage both, but had to go a little slower. Overall, I would highly recommend Praha Bike, and Britton as a guide.

Prague 2 hour Bike Tour. Easy and scenic with informative stops. Our bike leader Britton made sure we knew where to go and waited for us if we were too far behind. We also had ear pieces in so we could hear him the whole ride.

Private Tour - Full day to Karlstejn Castle. We had a perfect day. The bikes were new and comfortable and the staff were efficient and helpful. Fluent English was spoken by everyone we dealt with. We booked in advance before we went to Prague, and followed their advice. Everything was waiting when we arrived. We were a party of four, all with very rusty cycle skills with two very unfit adults and two very fit teenage boys. Our guide was Mikel who was the perfect host. He quickly made friends with the boys and went out of his way to make sure everyone was comfortable with the pace. Mikel was very knowledgeable and extremely good company. We would be happy to recommend this company, and especially Mikel to anyone and will definitely book again when we next visit Prague.

Jirka was Great!. We enjoyed the ebike tour with Jirka. He was a great guide and funny. It was a great way to see the city and he knew the back way into the castle which we avoided the long lines. We stopped for a quick hot chocolate break and we enjoyed spending time with him --- just hanging with a local was a true treasure to experience. Thank you Jirka!

Amazing experience!. Zirka (George) was an amazing guide and made the trip so much more enjoyable with all the fun stories. Loved seeing Prague from a locals perspective! Totally recommend this tour to get familiar with the city.

Good renting service. We rented a hybrid-trekking bikes for our journey across Czech Republic in Praha bike and were very satistfied. The bikes were sturdy (tested on a few gravel and dirt roads) and comfortable, and we have no problems with them. Company provides you with almost everything you need, including a proper repair kit. However, if you are going outside the city - as we did - you need to bring your own flashlight that can serve as low beam headlight. The ones that are provided are just a daytime running lamps.

Praha Bike a MUST. We scheduled a night tour the same day we arrived in Prague. For us, this worked out beautifully. Since we had been in up since 2am and in the the air 2/3 of the day with much daylight left this was a perfect opportunity for us to take in fresh air, stretch our legs and get a layout of the land! If you have the stamina, I would recommend doing this on the front end of the the trip. It will also help address potential jet lag. Praha Bike Co. was magnificently cool... Francesco was our guide and did a phenomenal job. We had our 7 year old son on tandem with dad and myself. Francesco was quite conscience of safety and our over all well being. We never felt like we were checking boxes of sights but getting a personal conversation along the way. We enjoyed it so much, it was considered to another tour as time allowed later on in the trip with Praha Bike. Francesco, thank you again for leaving a lasting impression with our family, you kindness and hospitality was much appreciated.

Niels, Denmark. Had a fantastic tour on a normal bike which was in good condition. that was told good information about the sights :) This was not my first trip to Prague, but I saw and heard a lot of new info about Prague ... Thanks to the real empathetic guide Andrew from Canada who made it all easier to understand and enjoy :)

Beautiful City Ride. We did the city tour with Mikel on Friday afternoon. Wow! He sure knows his history. Be prepared for enthusiastic commentaries related to historical buildings by the twinkly eyed charming Mikel. The cycle ride was well guided and effortless, a relief as I had not ridden a bike in many years. Thoroughly recommend Praha Bike !

Wonderful tour thanks to Francesco! . Chose to do a panoramic tour in the morning at rather short notice and I got much more than I expected. Ended up staying for the afternoon tour as well to round up the entire experience which was very helpful to appreciate a beautiful city such as Prague.Francesco was very knowledgeable and so approachable. The tour proceeded even with only 3 guests and this shows their professionalism in delivering their tours. Just a tip, come dressed appropriately, shorts and t shirt works better under the summer heat and beware of the ride up the slope on the way to the Prague castle if you are going there. Not an easy climb if you are not accustomed to it. In any case, be careful and slow down. Francesco will always look out for you. Have fun!

Worthwhile way to see a lot of city in short period and learn history. Had a tour recently on our first afternoon in Prague and yet again a great way to get your bearings in a city and find out good places to visit, eat, tour etc. I have done similar in Copenhagen, Madrid, Krakow and highly recommend it as a way of planning rest of stay. Our guide was always keeping an eye out for group and criss crossed us through Prague to numerous sights, some interesting history on Mozart, Charles bridge, WW2 etc interspersed with funny stories and able to ask any questions from best place for Czech beer to must see exhibitions to where to eat like the locals. Tour took 2- 2.5 hours and was nice leisurely pace, One point to note is that it is very busy and you cut on and off pavements a number of times, we all had bells though and no real issues. Recommend it.

Great service. I rented a bike for a few days while visiting Prague. I was very happy with their service. More importantly, when the bike I rented broke down when I was at the top of a very steep hill, they sent one of their technicians out to basically rescue me asap. I wanted to give a very special shout out to Britton, who literally ride a replacement bike up the entire way, swapped the bike with me, and took the broken bike all the way back down the hill and via the metro back to the shop. And he never complained or showed any anxiety about the trip at all. What a stud. I very much appreciated him and the service he provided. So I was happy all around.

Beer Garden tour with Andrew. My partner and I did the Beer Garden tour of Prague with Andrew last week. We had an absolutely great time. Being able to experience a different (more local) side of Prague and enjoy a few beers along the way was very enjoyable. At no point did Andrew make us feel rushed, he was only concerned that we had a good time. Usually when we do these tours we prefer that we get a guide that is local to the city just for that added sense of authenticity, however it was refreshing to finally get a guide that is not local who did not annoy us. Thanks for the great day :)

Best way to see Prague for sure.. I spent two days in Prague before the tour and the tour covered everything I saw and more! It's definitely the best way to get a glimpse of the city. Try the night tour, it has an amazing charm. Ask for Francesco, he is a very good guide

Best thing you can do!. We did this the morning after we landed..after booking it whilst out round prague... experiencing its fab nightlife!It was so worth it... explored the panoramic views of the city.. botanical gardens...the castle.. andrew was absolutely fabulous.. i think that was his name.. long weekend and longer nights... the bikes were fine and the guide better.. encourgaed me to do more activites like this in future

fantastic bike ride to karlstejn castle. I went on a bike trip from Prague to Karlstejn Castle in late May with a group of friends, led by the awesome tour guide, Britton. We biked along the river and made a lot of great stops along the way and he was able to tell us all about the different places we went through. We also had a picnic by the river on the way there and got to walk around the castle. It was just the best way to spend a Saturday, and Britton is highly recommended as a guide. I will definitely be requesting him again for future trips with Praha Bike. Thanks!

Great Bike Tour through Prague!. Our bike ride with Jirka was our favorite day in Prague! Jirka was such a personable guide who knew so much about the city and it did not seem like a cheesy tour guide experience. You got to see so much more than just the inner city sights with his tour as well. There really is no other way to see this city! Highly Recommend!
good way to explore the city. tour guide (Michal) -- beside showing the tourists places he also showed some interesting lesser known places and gave tips on where to visit more.

E-Bikes- The BEST new thing I've done in ages!. What a fun afternoon! We took the PRAGUE RIVER TOUR TO TROJA CHATEAU on the EBIKES! Since it was a Monday, we scheduled a private tour for 4 of us. It was the most fun I've had on a tour and on a bike. One peddle and you're on the go. The scenery was great, and the breeze from biking was needed on a hot day. Loved the stop at the kayak training area, but the highlight was an unbelievably scenic beer garden. I would recommend this for couples or families. Biking on the paths with no cobblestones or traffic was a highlight of our trip to Europe!

Casual relaxed Prage ride. this tour was hosted by Britton. An American working as an English teacher in Prague. Britton knows the rich Prague history whilst expressing his own views. An engaging but small enough group we covered both sides of old and new town. What made the tour equally exciting was crossing over the bridge to see some other leftfield sites such as John Lennon memorial wall and the controversial sculpture to Czech Republic decision to join the EU. An enjoyable ride and relaxed atmosphere put on by Britton.

An outstanding guide made for a wonderful informative and fun afternoon. Ondrej was our guide. What a perfect way to get an overview of Prague. History, culture and politics shared in an easygoing way while having a great time. This is a top notch company. Having ear pieces allow for commentary while you are riding. Great for all levels of bikers. Skip the hop on, hop off bus or cars and don't miss this!

Informative. I was there in February, when there was snow. It was quite cold and I didn't have gloves with, but they arranged for that. The tour was just to my taste-information I wanted to hear. Our guide Saša showed us loads of interesting places.

Wonderful tour!. Excellent tour of Prague by bicycle with guide Andrew. Andrew was very knowledgeable and also kept us entertained with stories. He truly knows Prague history. It was a hot day, but he was able to find shady places to stop to view the historical sights. I highly recommend this tour with Andrew!

This tour improved the rest of my stay. I judge bike tours by two questions:"Am I more comfortable navigating the city after the tour?"and"Did I learn things that I will help me appreciate the city and have future conversations about the country?"Britton was one of the better tour guides I have had during my fortunate travels. The headsets are a game changer for bike tours because you hear quick comments about buildings, etc that are nice to know, but not really worthy of stopping the whole group of bikes.Praha Bikes and their good team of tour guides will keep you safe, smiling, and motivated to explore more of the city. I highly recommend this tour early in your trip because you will learn things that will make you want to explore more.I am glad to be the 700th person to give them the highest rating that Trip Advisor allows. Thank you to Britton for a great tour and for the other three workers who made an extra effort to help me enjoy my stay.

Great day tour to Karlstejn. We spent a nice and very enjoyable day with our guide Ondrej. Being from Prague he has a lot of knowledge of the local history, habits and shortcuts on the route. Hearing his stories about life during communism was very interesting and impressive. Also he told stories from his own experience or from his families experience which made it more easy to relate to.He introduced us to Kofola and provided pink ponchos when it started raining. Not too proud to wear one himself either... ;-)We will never forget Ondrej, he is a funny guy, very enthousiastic and dedicated. And in for a joke too.Thank you for a great day Ondrej!Many greetings from Chantal and Mirjam

Outside In view of Prague. Sasha was warm, personable and knowledgeable providing a lot of inside tips. Was a custom 18 mile tour that hit touristy spots from a locals point of view while avoiding crowds but still getting the feel and beauty of Prague. Thank you St. Norbert Brewery!.

A Nice Trip to the Country. We took the Karlstejn Castle tour. Very pretty and not too tough. Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable, but since we were usually in the back of the pack we missed out on much of what he pointed out. The write up said a headset would be provided but was not. The bikes were good but not great. Several of us had issues with gears slipping. The guide mentioned that they were the last bikes because the best ones were rented for long hall trips. Mine had some larger problems and I was offered a partial refund. I expected to enter the castle but we arrived too late, not Praha's fault, but maybe should be better stated on the website that it isn't a sure thing. I would recommend this trip, and this shop for other trips or bike assistance. Everyone was friendly and helpful.

Praha Bike a wonderful way to experience Prague. I took a tour in mid June with two friends. It was my first bike tour and I will definitely do more. Our tour guide, Mickel, was very knowledgeable and went out of his way to make sure we got the most out of our experience. He produced a pen so we could leave our own message on John Lennon's wall, described recent historical events which brought them alive and gave us tips on where to find non-touristy restaurants. I highly recommend Praha Bikes! It was definitely a highlight of our time in Prague.

Praha (George) Bike Tour. My husband and I enjoyed George for his informative information and humor. We found Prague to be a very walk able city, but biking opened our eyes to places we did not see via walking tours. We experienced John Lennon's wall, Stalin/Metronome park, close up of Jewish quarter, a beer pub nestled in a public park "Bernard beer". Many out of the way public parks and historical places to see which we enjoyed. The E-bikes really made the experience easy biking the castle district. We highly recommend this bike company!

First time E Bike Tour. We signed up for this E Bike Tour because we had never tried an E Bike before. We have done city bike tours in London and Warsaw.This time we thought we would try something different. It was great! You hardly have to peddle at all. There is even a "boost" button when you go up an incline or hill. We took a ride along the river up to a chateau. Our guide was friendly, informative and a lot of fun. It was over 90 degrees the day we biked and I was very worried that it would be too much but with the E bikes there was absolutely nothing to worry about! We stopped at 2 beer gardens and had a great time. Our guide even suggested a restaurant close by for dinner ( which I reviewed separately) It had amazing food. All in all this was a first class memory of an afternoon in Prague!!

Family. My husband, my daughter & I spent a week in Prague & our all day bike trip with Jirka was memorable & delightful. It was a perfect work out & an enlightening trip which included history, architecture & beer--doesn't get better than that:-)

Excellent City Tour. We would definitely recommend taking the city bike tour. It's a lovely way to see parts of the city and our guide was very informative. All the staff were very friendly and we were made to feel very welcome. I'm not one for hills, so was very grateful this tour didn't have any! The tour is suitable for all ages and abilities. Try it, you'll definitely enjoy it. We now do bike tours in every city we visit when we go away. Great fun - you always have a couple of people that compete to be at the front though lol!! It did make us chuckle.
Great tour. Great tour on the team bike with an awesome guide, props to Francesco for being a laugh as well as being very knowledgeable. Good value.

Bike trip to Karljstejn Castle. Began trip at 9:30 am at Praha Bike in Prague. It was a short ride out of Prague (approximately 10 minutes) and was a little difficult do to traffic and cobblestone street especially if you are not use to riding in city. Once out of the city center after reaching the Vlatava river the ride was very pleasant, mostly flat and minimal traffic. We made several stops along the way for beer and lunch. When reaching Karljstejn there is a 15 minute hike up a very steep hill. The castle is impressive and the view was wonderful. No one in our group toured the inside of castle. The bike tour is mostly about the ride in the countryside and not the castle. We then had about a 5 minute ride to the train station and tickets were included which was handled by our guide. You are responsible for getting your bicycle on and off the train and through the train station. After reaching Prague about 6:00 PM there is a 10 minute ride back to Praha bike. I would recommend this tour if you have extra days in Prague. I would say the bike ride level is moderate if you are not a cyclists.

Highly Recommended. Really great. Sasha our guide firthe 11am tour. He was informative and had a good sense of humor. Not much time for photo taking at each stop. Do the tour early in your trip and pick places you want to go back and spend more time at. I found out they have beer garden tour also, would try that next time.

Praha Bike. Really enjoyable light bicycle ride, basically all flat grounds and was not strenuous at all. Ages raging from 20-70 on our tour emphasises this. A great way to check out many areas of the city in a short space of time (2hrs). Would recommend doing this as early as possible in your trip to make the most of the tour guides tips of Prague. Our tour guide Frankie was very informative about the cultural hotspots of the city, and was more than happy to help with everything else, even gave us his whatsapp if we wanted any further tips or tricks of Prague at any point.

Fun and informative. I did the night bike tour with Francesco. It was a relaxing ride around Prague, which I would definitely recommend. The tour consisted of urban legend tales, historical facts and the city's architecture. Just a heads up: the city center of Prague isn't made for bikers, so prepare for some mountain-biking action, which can be exciting but also a bit bumpy at times too. Still, this was probably one of my favorite things that I did during my trip in Prague.
Great bike tour. Had an all-day tour with Britton. Fun and informative - a great introduction to the highlights, architecture, food, history and language of he Czech Republic. Highly recommended.

Great . We did the 2 hr bike tour in the late morning on our first day in Prague. A great way to see the city and get our bearings. Francesco was a wonderful guide, who provided interesting facts about the historic and modern art and architecture around the city. Highly recommend

Well located bike rental. . I wanted to rent bikes and found this place as it is very centrally located on a Main Street. The staff was helpful getting our bikes ready, and the bikes also came with sturdy bike locks which I appreciated. For their rentals, you pay when you return based on how much time you used the bike. The price was reasonable although not inexpensive, but I would recommend their service.

Very engaged tours (city & karlstejn). I would highly recommend you do the city tour & if you have a day, then do the Karlstejn Castle tour. Both my guides were fantastic with a lot of knowledge about the city & managed the group very well..

Fantastic trip to Karlstejn!!. I've been on a few different tours and excursions in different European cities, most of them very good. This is the first time I've reviewed on TripAdvisor, because this trip to Karlstejn Castle was by far the most enjoyable!I'm a mid-40s guy, travelling with my 17 year old son, and we were led on the trip by the very knowledgable and friendly guide, Britton.Excellent scenery, decent Czech lunch, delicious beer. All at a slow to moderate pace that even I could keep up with (despite being 40 pounds overweight!). Although I did put in a few hours cycling practice and bought padded cycling undershorts prior to the trip.......without the practice and shorts it might have been quite painful.!!!If you like beautiful countryside, if you like moderate exercise, if you like small doses of history, if you like good, cheap food and beer, if you like good company from a great tour guide.... then do this trip!!!Thankyou Praha bikes. Thankyou Britton.

A great way to see the city. A really interesting and engaing tour. We saw lots and were told about Prague's history as well as other interesting facts about the city. Our tour guide Franscesco was friendly and knowledgeable and also gave us good recommendations of restaurants and bars. The bike mechanic Sacha was also really efficient! We really enjoyed it!

Excellent bike tour. Thoroughly enjoyed this bike tour and would recommend it to anyone. Extremely reasonable pricing. Tour guide was very friendly and informative. Learned a lot about the city and its history, and saw some amazing sites.

Must do experience outside Prague. This was an approx. 37km bike with a few inclines along the way. Some great views outside the city. Our guide Sasha was well informed and we had 3 breaks along the way (1 for lunch). Also met a great group of people (some families) from all around the world who are passionate about active life and biking. Our guide gave us a great amount of flexibility and we had the option of opting out of going going inside the castle, instead he took us through the surrounding woods of the Karlstejn Castle.

A great experience we had traveling to the Troja Castle along the Vltava river bank and returning on the hills on the ot. Mikel lead us along the Vltava river bank and returning on the hills on the other side of the river with stunning views on Prague

Perfect day to bike to Karlstejn Castle. We had a terrific guide, Andje, who seemed thrilled to be with us, share his knowledge of the country and make sure the group stayed together. The only down side is we did not have enough time to tour the castle or shop in the village. In exchange we had a lovely lunch nearby and the group really got along.

Excellent bicycle tour of the river and Troja Chateau. Our guide, Andrew, was fun and informative. He led our tour around the river to Troja Chateau. He kept a good pace and we stopped occasionally to learn a bit about Prague. It was nice because it took us out of the tourist places and we got to see more of the city. After getting to the Chateau, we went through a couple of parks and got to hang out at the beer gardens. It was the perfect way to see what life in Prague is like. I highly recommend this tour.

This is a great way to see and appreciate the city of Prague!. A well-planned bike ride through the city with stops at key historical sites. Our guide, Mikel, was extremely knowledgeable and did a great job providing the history and context of what we were seeing. Way fun - and a perfect way to start a visit to the city.

The "Classic City" bike tour: a great introduction to a great city. My group of 5 decided to do a bike tour for our first day in Prague. The goal was to get an overview of the city, and a lay of the land. This was a perfect way to do that.Our guide, Josca, was very knowledgable, and took us around to the main sights. We didn't spend long at any of them, but did learn where we wanted to spend additional time. The bikes were in great condition, and the tour included a headphone system so we could all hear Josca. The terrain was mostly flat, so it was easy everyone in our group, from teens to adults The trip lasted the full 2.5 hours.I highly recommend this as an introduction to the city.

Cycle from Prague to Dresden. We booked a self-guided cycle trip from Prague to Dresden through Cyklustrails, which was coordinated by Praha Bike. All went well and was well organised. They were great at keeping in touch via email beforehand, organising luggage transport and bike pick up in Dresden for us too. The bikes were ok, basic hybrid bikes with a few minor rattles here and there. They supplied the guide book, tools, repair kit, helmets, bike locks and Ortlieb waterproof panniers. We were also guided out of Prague by a member of staff until we were safely on the right path along the river. Only negative things was that the bike pump supplied didn't work and we had to buy our own along the way.
Great way to see Prague. We had a great tour led by Francesco. He was very knowledgable on the history and architecture of Prague. The best way to get an overview of the city! Thanks Francesco!

Fantastic trip to Karlstein castle . I did the trip to Karlstein castle last minute style and it was totally ok. The bikes were good, the scenery fantastic and we had plenty of time to chat with the guide about the country, the culture and everything else. There was never any hurry, it felt like a really relaxed trip and was really great.

City bike tour. Thanks Jirka, we just completed the short (2.5 hr) city tour, having arrived in Prague yesterday afternoon. A great intro to a wonderful city, very informative and interesting way to get a feel for the layout of the city and places to come back to. Very relaxed and easy riding also.

Fun way to tour Prague. We went on the evening "Prague Legends" tour with Francesco- it was definitely a highlight of our trip. The employees were very friendly & helpful, and our guide was super. He had a great knowledge of the city and told us not only about the Legends of Prague, but also about the history and architecture of various buildings. A+!

Panoramic city bike tour. The bike tour was excellent. Our guide Michal was really good and he gave us great information about the history of Prague and added some very interesting stories from his local knowledge. He took us at a very good pace and the views over the city were excellent. The tour was very good value and we would recommend it to anyone wanting to get a good overview of the city.

Great activity. We had a grear bike ride with Francesco as our guide. It was just me and my boyfriend. He was very understanding as I wasn't the best with bikes, helping with bike selection and great detail on tour. Also, Francesco took pictures of us and gave handy hints after the tour. Great way to seevthe city.
Great way to visit Prague. We had a 7 hours tour. Really a must do to see a lot of the city. We did a private Dutch tour and our guide (Josca) was great so ask for him!!

Awesome ride - loved the radio headset. Ondrej was our tour guide and he provided interesting and entertaining information during the Classic City Bike Tour. He was friendly and always waited for participants if they got caught at an intersection. I loved the radio headset we wore so we could always hear Ondrej even on crowded stops. I especially enjoyed the sometimes hilarious commentary as we rode our bikes around - warning us of various obstacles we might encounter.

Highlight of Prague vacation . The bike tour is an absolute Must on your first day in Prague. First off Andre was the man and the best tour guide one could ask for giving your history, social and cultural stories of Prague and it's people I never knew of. Additionally you don't realize how much more ground you cover on bike. I'd say it would take almost two days on foot what we covered in 3 hours.Also the tour guide gives his own opinion on beer gardens, restaurants and sights that should be hit and the ones you should pass up on if you don't have time. It's great to get the orientation of the city before hand.Oh yeah by the way it's a blast! Thanks Andre!!

Great way to see Prague. Francesco was our guide. It was awesome - we saw some beautiful parts of the city that were further out, got some photos, and some great beer. Francesco was knowledgeable on the tour and gave us some great recommendations for afterwards. Would strongly recommend to anyone.

Great Way to See Prague!. I recently went on a bike tour and Britton was my tour guide--he's the best! We did the 27 mile tour that takes you to Karlstejn and it was absolutely amazing. I loved getting to see other areas in the Czech Republic besides just Prague. It was very scenic, the terrain was great, and we obviously had THE best tour guide. I highly recommend the long tour if you have a day to block out. :)

Great and what a great guide!!!!. In almost 3 hours you have the chance to see the most typical places that you could never have by foot ! Great experienceDon't hesitateThanx to our amazing guide Sanje ( hope i spell it Wright ;)
Great panoramic tour. Great tour with Britton! Beautiful views over the city, very clear and interesting explanations about Prague and Tcheque republic history.

"The Lucky Wanderer's". We did our tour today to Karlstejn with Andrew. We were with a really nice bunch of people! Throughly enjoyed the ride, beautiful scenery and the weather was lovley! It was about a 3 hour ride with stops and lunch along the way which was just the right amount! Mostly flat and we meandered along the river, over bridges, through Poppy fields and through cute villages! The castle was stunning well worth the trip!Highly recommend the tour to anyone if you want to get out of the city and see the real Prague! Andrew was great & super friendly! Thankyou so much!

Great tour, excellent guide.. We took the 'big all in one Prague tour'. Our guide Ondrej was fantastic, had a great knowledge of Prague and its history and provided his personal experiences which really helped relate. Would highly recommend this tour, company and hope you too get Ondrej.

Fun ride and not too long. We did our tour with Andrew today and had a fine time. The bikes were in good working order, and they had shocks, which is a must on the rough cobblestone. The tour is pretty short, but there was still plenty to hear about. The roads can get a bit tight, but our guide helped us maneuver through the traffic. Andrew knew plenty about the city and locations, and also provided entertaining banter along the way. Afterwards, he was nice enough to recommend his favorite sites for food and beer. Advice which we will surely follow.
Great tour in a beautifull city. Perfect tour thanks to the guide Andrew, Very nice atb bikes and a guide who can keep all our attention during the tour.And that all for a good price.

Great citytour by Andrew. We had so much fun on our biketour. Prague is a beatiful city and a bike tour is the best way to see a lot in little time. The bikes were in exelent condition and Andrew knows a lot about the city, but even more important was polite and very funny. I would recomend a tour with Andrew.

views of city, easy biking, great guide. Britton was awesome. Great route, easy climb to Castle. Pretty chill day. Great views, cool info. We enjoyed the easy biking, small group, cool technology, decent bikes, good location.

Great ride, guide (Francesco) and journey. Took the full day Guided Bike Tour to Karlstejn Castle with Francesco as our excellent guide. Starting with good equipment (good bike, clean helmet), the 40km ride was well done by Francesco. Although navigating out of the city requires patience, the scenery was wonderful, the lunch stop provided really good local food in a relaxed setting, and the ultimate destination in reaching the Castle was great. Our entire group was up to the task, and very relaxed which made the trip even better. It's not a 40km race to the Castle, but rather a nice pace that average riders can enjoy. All the staff at Praha were super nice and focused on getting the right equipment for you.

Team-bike tour in Prague. As part of a seminar I spent a week in Prague, and me and some friends decided that taking a bike tour of the city was a good way to see the major sites. On Tripadvisor we came across Praha Bike, and found that they had a "team bike" where six of us could be on the same bike along with a tour guide. This seemed like a fun idea and we decided to give it a try. Our guide was Britton, and for 45 minutes he expertly guided us around town while telling us stories and anectodes about the sights that we passed.Britton was knowledgeable, friendly, and ensured that we had a great experience with Praha Bike. The price was very affordable and I would warmly recommend the tour to others.

Prague City Tour. Had a great tour of Prague city with Praha Bike Tours. My guide, Britten, showed me around even though I was the only one who ended up booking for the tour. He knew his stuff and had great stories about the city. The route was flat and we only rode on quiet streets so traffic wasn't a problem, it was a great way to see a lot I a short space of time.

Perfect day on the Karlstejn tour!! . We did the Karlstejn and Classic city tours with Praha Bike. The office staff was very helpful and the tour guide Britton was awesome - super personable and easy going. This was the perfect way to see something outside of Prague, and feel like we truly experienced a little bit of the beautiful Czech countryside! (Also thanks for taking our picture in front of the castle, Britton!) I would recommend it to anyone that is spending a few extra days here and wants a more authentic experience.

Troja Chataux. I organised a bike tour as I wanted to see a different part of Prague. Francesco was my guide and he looked after me very well. It was very informative and a nice pace to the Tour. Would highly recommend Praha bike tours if you ever visit. And he takes very good photos :)

Fun tour, safe route, awesome tour guide.. We came from Chicago and Utah. (2) Couples on a fun trip to Prague. Our amazing tour guide was Michael and he was a doll. So kind, friendly and very knowledgeable of Prague's history that bonds you to Prague and it's culture. He's full of fun and sometimes tragic antidotes that truly capture Prague's amazing personality. We reserved a private tour, which I recommend for a party of two or more. It's nice to be on your own slotted schedule and he was quick to adapt to requests. You can tailor the ride to your experience, skill and destination.He made the tour such a great experience that we would love to go back and see different parts that we missed due to our limited schedule.We'll be back for sure.Happy riding!

Spectacular ride through the countryside. Saw a different side of Prague and outskirts on the one day bike tour to Karlstejn Castle. Beautiful day and beautiful sights. Totally enjoyable thanks to our really friendly guide Michal, who got us there safely and gave us lots of info all along the way. Worth the aching legs.......

Brilliant, fascinating tour!. A friend and I took the classic tour with Ondra earlier today.The cycling was paced well and Ondra was very patient, friendly and an excellent guide.The history he gave us was a fascinating insight into such a beautiful city. The tour took in so many of the well known sights and Ondra shared anecdotes and stories that could only come from a local guide.I would thoroughly recommend this as a way to see the city.Thank you!

Awesome!. The best part of Prague for us was this tour. We did a 2.5 hour morning tour of the city and of Prague castle. Decided to go to lunch with the group and it was great! Tour guide was awesome. Thank you!

Brilliant Tour for a short stay in Prague. We booked the 7 hour all in on tour which encompassed both the Prague castle and big city tours. Andrei was our guide and he was great in not only giving us information about the different places to see, but telling us about his and his family's life over the past years which really helps you to relate to the info and gives you an insight into what life was really like. Would highly recommend doing both tours if you are on a short trip as you get to see pretty much all of Prague (and get taken to a lovely local restaurant for lunch)! We had an amazing time thanks Andrei!!!

A Great ride in the country. And a great way to meet Czech people. Our party of 3 took the ride out to Karlstejn castle with Michael. As fascinating as Prague is, it was a break to get out of the city and away from the throngs. We arrived a Karlstejn mid afternoon, after the tour buses had left - perfect timing. The tour follows the rivers for the most part, so you see some water birds, pheasants and to the delight of my daughter, some baby goats. Karlstejn is Karlsejn. I'll leave that to another review. As with most guided tours the key is the guide. Michael gave us just enough history and local color and we were with him long enough to get to know him a little, to compare life in the Czech republic and our home country. A great day all round.Booking via web and follow up by email was easy.

Fun fun fun. 'Fun' was had by all because of our guide Britton. We took the City and Country side tour with him. Very knowledgeable and over all great guy.The attached picture was taken during our ride through the country side. Thanks Britton for making our Biking so much - yes, again Fun! (:

Really enjoyed our time with Francesco. Our 2.5 hour tour was informative, fast-paced and fun. Francesco brings a deep knowledge of Prague history, architecture from various periods and some insights into "legends/ghosts" of this magnificent city. Biking is the only way to get around and the twilight hours of the tour guarantees easy access to monuments and ancient landmarks.

A great trip!. We spent one afternoon on the city bike tour with Jirka and had a fantastic time. It was a great way to see the city, especially on a sunny day! The cycle was leisurely and relaxed. Jirka was very friendly and informative but allowed for 'down time' so that it didn't feel like an information overload. The ride was mostly flat and a mixture of on and off roads. I felt very safe throughout the trip and would highly recommend this as a way to get to know the city as we saw many parts we hadn't explored to yet. We only did a short tour but I would be very keen to do a longer when when I return to Prague. Thank you Jirka!

A Fantastic Experience. My wife and I undertook the 35km guided bike tour to karlstejn castle with Jirka (e.g. George) as our guide. The tour was a phenomenal experience. It started in Old Town Prague and wound through the countryside along the Vltava and Berounka rivers. The tour took a total of about 8 hours and was relatively flat most of the way. We were tempted to ride the 35km back to Prague but a thunderstorm at Karltejn castle made us opt for the train ride back instead. Jirka was a great guide. Fun to be with and knowledgeable about the country and scenery. We stopped several times for breaks along the way and had a great lunch in a village about a mile from the castle. We discussed with Jirka the option to ride straight from Prague to the castle with no stops, which he was willing to accommodate, but we opted for the couple of stops. All in all, a great experience. We would do it again. Actually, we’re considering doing an extended tour next time we are in Prague (e.g. maybe Prague/Dresden, or Prague/Vienna). Praha Bikes can arrange special trips like these.

Just Great!. Gathering point is not far from Old Town Square. I took a classic city bike tour which is about 2.5 hours. I would get big all-in-one tour if I have more time in Prague. All bikes are in pretty good condition - not rust, no squeaks, different sizes and shapes to fit you best. Our tour guide, Britton, was very friendly. We got a little rain during the tour, so Britton gave us raincoats. The ride was easy, part on roads, part on sidewalks depending on traffic. Classic City Bike tour is for those who is really short in time. I would definitely recommend this for any of my friends. I really enjoyed it. Good job!

Great way of seeing the city. We had a great time today on one of Praha Bikes city tours. My girlfriend and I have done some bike tours of other cities in the past and this one was right up there. The tour guide (Britton) was really funny, informative and made our trip all the more enjoyable. The use of the headsets for each rider is a really good idea by the company as well. This allowed all of the group (even if you were at the back) to hear what Britton was saying as we cycled through the streets. They were not only useful for information but also safety tips during the ride.The whole tour flew by and was a great way to see so much of the city in just 2 and 1/2 hours. When we got back, the staff at Praha Bikes were really helpful in informing us of good restaurants, bars and spots to head to for the remainder of our stay. I would highly recommend doing this tour as one of your first experiences in Prague. It gave us so many ideas for the remainder of our break and was thoroughly enjoyable.

Great tour. Great tour, to loads of really interesting sites around the city. Britton was our tour guide and he was excellent, knew so much about the city and gave us some great recommendations for the rest of our trip!

Great tour with lots of fun and information. We booked Praha Bike after reading the good reviews on Tripadvisor, and it was a blast. We did the classic city tour on our first morning, and it was a fantastic way to get a first overview of Prague. Our guide Mikael was very knowledgeable, gave us great information and answered all our questions. We made several stops on our way, and had enough time to take all the pictures we wanted. After the tour Mikael sat down with us to give us some restaurant recommendations, which we really appreciated. We highly recommend the tour, and would book it again anytime we come back to Prague. Thanks, Praha Bike and Mikael, for the great time! And a special thanks to Mikael for pointing out the David Černý-sculptures on the way - we loved them so much, that we made an effort to see all of his other work that's displayed all over in Prague while we were there.

Sasha is the Man!. Great day out on the Karlstejn tour with Sasha. Having read all the positive reviews about Praha Bike and Sasha on here, I was pleased that we had him as our guide. Our group of 5 was the perfect size and Sasha was more than accommodating to our needs (castle tour or not, another beer or 6, etc). He was open and extremely friendly and genuinely took an interest in each of us ensuring not only our safety along the route, but also our fun.I highly recommend Praha Bike and Sasha!

Good bikes and good staff. This was our third time rent a bike from this company, Every time satisfied with The service and never had problems bikes and staff. We bought beer tour, city tour and this time just rented the bikes for seeing around. Staff is very helpfull.There are cheaper alternatives but trusting a company worth it.

Fun bike tour. This was a fun way too see Prague. It gave me ideas on what else I would like to see while in town. Our tour guide, Jirka, was very knowledgeable about the castle and the other stops as well. Highly recommended!

Karlstejn Castle bike tour. We went on the full-day bike tour to Karlstejn Castle. Our guide, Ondrey, was fantastic. He told us the history of key points of interest and shared stories about current day life in the Czech Republic. The bike ride runs along the river through beautiful countryside. The bikes were well-maintained and Ondrey had all the supplies we needed for the ride. We loved it!!!

Tour and Rental. My wife and I took the standard city tour. Our guides were very friendly, we covered some of the main sights, and it really helped to orientate us within the city. In fact, we returned the next day and rented a tandem bike to further explore in and around Prague. If I wanted to be especially critical, it would be fantastic if they could weave the history into more of a narrative as they move from one sight to the next.

Bicycle tour. The tour guide Mr. Britton was excellent and well knowledge in explaining the history and showing things around the old and new town. Also I would suggest to other people about the tour and the guide Mr.Britton made my trip happy and safe with my children.Ashu from Kingsport, TN USA

Great bike tour of Prague . Been in Prague and been on a few tours already such as a boat one. But this has been best tour of the city after a week here. Britain the tour guide was helpful and very friendly. I will highly recommend this tour to friends

Karlštejn. Nice weather. Castles. An unexpected rodeo. Rivers. And bike paths.
Brit was a great tour guide.
Highly recommended.

Incredible ride to a fairy tale castle with a wonderful guide. We took the tour to Karlstejn castle in a group of 15. The ride follows the river to the south, winding through small Czech villages and beautiful rolling landscapes. The majority of the ride is on well-paved bike paths and is relatively flat, making it well suited for beginner and intermediate riders. The ride took several hours but our wonderful guide Britt knew just where and when to stop for food, pivo, and relaxation. Britt was knowledgeable about the places we passed through and set a steady but fair pace. Bonus points to him for being able to herd the 15 of us all 25 miles of the ride without losing anyone. I highly recommend him and this company!

Bike tour was great for our one full day in Prague.. My boyfriend and I only had one full day to truly explore the city of Prague and this bike tour did an excellent job on hitting the main attractions that we wanted to see during our time here. Our tour guide (Sienna) was amazing and very informational. She even took the time to answer our questions about the city in general, and gave us recommendations on what food to eat and places to see/eat outside of the tour. This tour also allowed us to know which areas we wanted to explore after the tour was finished.

Great organisation. Very delighted with the professional way of working of this company. We have been with a group of 60 pax and everything went smoothly. We really recommend this company . Thanks Josca to be our guide.

Great Intro to City. We did two tours with Praha Bike, booked through TripAdvisor. Our 2 1/2 hr. city tour was great, our guide was Francesco -- very good English, great sense of humor. We saw some highlights. The second tour was to Karlstein Castle, about 22 miles from Prague. Beautiful bike ride up the Vlata River from center of Old Town, then up tributary to the castle. Very informative and scenic. Tip not solicited, but appreciated. Mikael accompanied as an extra guide for the second ride, he was great also. Highly recommend.

Panoramic & Prague Castle Tour. We (family with two grown children) took this tour on our first morning in Prague. We highly recommend this tour as it gave us a perfect overview of the city in a short 2-2.5hr. If we were to walk it all, it would take way too long to get the same overview (and we are pretty fast walkers). It's been a couple days since our bike tour, and we are constantly recognizing/referencing all the places we had been to on our bike tour. Of course, we have to give this credit to our guide, Migel (sp?). He not only told us about the history of the city and country but also gave us info we needed during and after the tour, which helped us to become familiarized with the city quickly. We left from Praha Bike Shop (just a few minutes walk from Old Town Square) and crossed the Vltava River via Hlavkuv Bridge (we think) to end up at Letenske Park. Then we went onto Prague Castle complex and by Strahov Monastery and down to Mala Strana and Kampa Island. We crossed the river back and ended at National Theatre. Then we went by Vaclavske Square and then Old Town Square and back to Praha Bike Shop. It was really an awesome way to spend our first morning in Prague. The pace was great as Michael allowed plenty of time to stop for pictures and helped take many family pictures for us. We did it on regular bikes and enjoyed it (except for just the one hill - some of us got off and walked the bike up because we had forgotten how to change gear fast enough ... we are not avid bicyclists and only ride about once a year when we are on our big vacation as we like doing bike tour of the cities we visit). Anyway, there is also the e-bike option which would make it a whole lot less exercising.

Panoramic and Prague Castle with Jirka. This tour was a great way to get a big picture view of Prague. Some amazing panoramas at a good pace. Our tour guide Jirka was knowledgeable, sweet and so helpful! He led us through some amazing vistas of the city from Letna and Petrin park and recommended a local Czech restaurant where the fried cheese was amazing. He answered all our questions, gave great suggestions and even accompanied us to take the station where we had to take the Tram back to our hotel. Thank you so much Jirka!

Really fun way to see the sights of Prague in a couple of hours. I took the basic city tour, which was about 2-1/2 hours. Sasha was a great tour guide -- very engaging, had lots of great stories, answered all our questions and did a great job of keeping track of everyone in the group. Prague has a lot of cobblestone streets, but the mountain bike they gave me was well-maintained and had no problem handling all the bumps. The old parts of Prague are obviously not designed for bikes, but the route we took kept us out of the traffic and I always felt safe riding there. There were people on my tour from China, Columbia, Canada and the U.S., and it was nice talking with everyone. It was also surprisingly affordable (but Prague is like that).
Sasha. Sasha is the man. Excellent tour guide and then took us out for lunch afterwards. Took us to some awesome spots and was just a joy to be around

Classic City Bike Tour. I took the bike tour through Prague with Jirka and it was so great! He was a very knowledgable guide and we had a lot of fun touring the city. He gave me a map at the end of the tour outlining where we had gone and also highlighted some areas/places he thought I might enjoy seeing. I would definitely recommend this tour!
Great tour with Sasha. Prague is a great city to tour by bike, and our guide did a fine job of showing us around. We got a great overview that helped us plan the rest of our stay.

Sasha is a God. I had Sasha as my guide and we were able to understand the creation of Old Town. He also pointed out the little details that I would have missed if I didn't have a tour today such as the small artistic details done by David Cerny. I would love to have the experience again.

They are EPIC!. My wife and I signed up for the Panoramic & Prague Castle tour and it was absolutely amazing. Luckily it was just the two of us for the tour and our guide Sasha was brilliant. He gave us all the information we needed on the tour and allowed us ample pit stops to take pictures and ask questions. After the tour we got lunch with Sasha during which he told us more about the city, places to visit and just generally chatted about places we all wanted to visit. I would definitely recommend them to anyone because they are EPIC!

Awesome Ride to Karlstejn Castle!. My family (including 2 20-something daughters) did the day trip to Karlstejn Castle. It was a beautiful ride! George was a fantastic guide, giving us lots of information along the way about the sights and history of the area. He was really interesting and funny! The terrain was flat and the pace was good so we got a good workout - not hard but not too easy either. We recommend this tour to anyone!

Cycle tour Old and New Town. Britain was our cycling tour guide this day. The tour lasted more or less 3 hours and the atmosphere was very relaxed. Britain provides you with cultural, religious and historical information in combination with enough stand stills to tell us facts, letting us taking pictures or having a nice break.For us, this was the best way to get to know Prague.

Great tour, great guides. All-around excellent!. We took the one day bike tour to Karlstejn Castle in mid-April. We booked the day before, but they were still able to make it work on short-notice and despite the fact that we were the only ones booked on the the long day tour.Our guide was Jirka and, along for the ride, were two new guides who were intoduced as "trainees" for this tour, Britton and Ondřej. All three were excellent guides, with Jirka and Ondřej being locals and Britton being an American expat, it was fun to chat about the comparisons between everyday Czech and American life. Jirka's stories personal experiences of being a young child under Communism and Ondřej's family stories from World War II and Communism were absolutely fascinating.The bikes were in excellent condition. However, at one point, my bike developed an annoying click/grind in the bottom bracket (probably just some dirt in the bearings). Being a regular bicycle rider, this was really a non-issue for me. Regardless, noticing this sound almost immediately, Ondřej was quick to attempt to repair the issue and, when unable, insisted that I swap bikes with him. The trip continued without incident. We made two stops on the way to the castle...one for beers and the next for lunch. Both were enjoyable, inexpensive, and provided plenty of opportunity to chat. We made it to Karlstejn Castle and spent some time taking a look around the castle and village. While we chose not to take a tour of the inside, it is certainly an option. We enjoyed walking around the outside and our guides took us out a back exit that took us through some nice wooded trails back to the main road. From there, we took the train back into Praha. At that point in the day, it was a welcome sight-seeing trip home for people with tired legs.While walking around the village Jirka and Ondřej talked about one of the items sold at the trinket shops. I believe they called "luck"...basically an inexpensive grab bag with some unrelated old items that you purchase without knowing what is inside. My wife and I didn't purchase anything at the village but, since we had purchased lunch for them, our guides presented each of us with a bag of "luck" when we got back to the shop. It was such a thoughtful and kind gesture from a group of really fun guys.All in all, we had a wonderful day trip with Praha Bike. The long ride is as-advertised: mostly flat and on bike trails for most of the trip. The guides were attentive, fun, and happy to answer questions or just chat. We would happily do another ride with them on our next visit to Praha.

An absolute must. The tours I took with Praha Bike were by far the best part of my trip to Prague. The shop is centrally located, set back in a peaceful setting where you are certain to receive a warm welcome from the front desk. I went on both the Classic City Tour and the tour to Karlstejn Castle and recommend both very highly. The bikes rode like a dream, and our tour guide was kind enough to help us with our seat position and understand the way they worked. Britton was our tour guide for both tours and his wealth of knowledge, sense of humor and love of the city made him a winning tour guide. If you want to get out of the city, the Karlstejn Castle is an absolutely beautiful ride. I’ll never forget the views I saw that day. If you want to fall in love with Prague and gain a deep respect for the Czech people, take the Classic City Tour. I’m sure every other tour they have is fantastic as well, and if I ever get a chance to go back to Prague, I will absolutely return to Praha Bike.

Good informative tour, small group, good price. We went on this tour when first arriving in Prague. Our guide Britain was very good. He was chilled out and catered for the group - which was only 5 of us so he was able to give a personal touch. He was very informative and showed a keen interest in his tour and Prague.The pace was great and the 20 min rest stop was great as we got our first Prague beer. I would recommend this tour to everyone, there were so many qualities about it and nothing let it down. Great price too compared to some other bike tours I've seen, very impressed.

Great guide and a great route. A group of 10 collegues had a great time biking around Prague - starting near the old town and then heading up thorugh the park towards the castle. It was a scnenic route and we had a great time with our competent guide Fransesco who adjusted the route according to our wishes.

Highlight of our Prague visit!. Our visit to Prague was definitely enhanced by the great bike tours at Praha Bike and our personable and knowledgeable guide, Britton. He provided amazing information about this area of the Czech Republic as well as the fascinating history of the Czech people. We took the tour to the Karlstejn Castle one day and found the journey to be incredibly beautiful and peaceful. It was definitely a favorite day in our 2 weeks in Europe. We also did the Panoramic and City Bike tours, again with Britton. We enjoyed the views from Letna Park and learned much about the history of Prague in Old Town Square. This is a must do! Definitely choose a bike tour over the Segway tours-- Great way to get some exercise to offset the great Czech food! Thanks, Britton and Praha Bike!

Harry the guide know his stuff.... Did this Praha classic bike tour in April – and was fortunate to have Harry the guide share his knowledge and love of Prague with us. The tour lasted some three hours and figure it would have taken a day to cover the same ground on foot. Interesting and recommend.

Loved it!. Having done a few of these now, we had very high expectations, and Andre (I'm sure I've mis-spelt his name, apologies!) did not disappoint. He was an excellent guide, and kept us informed and entertained throughout the tour. The wireless receiver and headphones were a good idea as it meant he could talk to us even when we were on the bike, particularly useful for instructions on the road.

Praha night tour with Francesco- an ABSOLUTE MUST. We did a night bike tour of Prague city with Francesco and its a must do. Prague is super crowded with tourists during the day but at night it's empty but so magical! Everything is beautifully lit up and there are legends and stories behind buildings which makes this tour an absolute must. It was very cold when we did this but still worth it. It would be amazing during the summer. Plus the bike would help burn those extra calories before you hit the pub again! As s bonus you cover lot more thanks in a shorter time and it's pretty flat terrain!

Very worthwhile tour. I rode on the Panoramic and Prague castle half day tour. Francesco was my guide, he was well spoken and professional. The tour started out with some safety tips and he was constantly turning his head to make sure the group was together and safe. The tour was informative and offered some awesome views, highly recommended and very worthwhile. Be advised there are some steep hills on this tour. Thank you Francesco and good luck to you
Awesome . Ondrej our guide is an awesome guy. He is passionate about history, travel and the city. He is a story teller We loved the city and the bikes are new

Francesco - THE BEST GUIDE!!. We had a fantastic tour on these bikes in Prague this weekend as 8 girls for our 21st birthdays. They give the option of e-bikes and normal bikes which was perfect for us because we had a range of abilities. There is just the right amount of description of each sight. Our guide Francesco was very helpful. They provided us with headsets so he could describe the sites as we rode around. The views were spectacular and plenty of stops to take them in. Couldn't recommend it any more !

Hen Party team bike. We had such a laugh with Jirka (George) our tour guide. We all have not laughed so much in ages , 6 of us was on the team bike and 4 on tandems. What a great time we had , such fun and stopping to have a cocktail on the way was even better. Highly recommend this xxx

Karlstejn Castle by bike. We wanted to enjoy some of the scenery outside of town so opted for the Karlsteijn Castle tour. The castle is more impressive on the outside than on the inside, but far more impressive was the guide and bike ride out to the castle. Andrei was an awesome guide and the ride out was picturesque. Andrei is Czech with awesome English. He has great personal family stories about Prague/Czech Republic as witnessed by him and his family. If you want a leisurely 22 mile ride opt for the e-bike tour. If you want a bit more exercise opt for the regular bike tour. Great way to spend a day.
Nice tour from our Italian friend. Today we had the big city trip planned. In the morning the castle trip and afternoon the city trip. The tour was nice and the guide was really nice.

Great e-bike Tour through Prague. Really fantastic trip through Prague and one of our favorites during our time there. Well worthy the time and price of the tour. The e-bikes were a lot of fun , our first time, to go on the up and down hills throughout Prague and see it from different perspectives.Sasha is a great tour guide, very well informed about the city, with a patient and friendly demeanor, that is willing to give you time to go off path to explore areas.Not to be missed. We highly recommend it.
Bike Tour. Great tour and our guide Britain looked after us very well - highly recommended as a quick way of getting an over view of Prague central attractions.
DO IT. This was definitely the highlight of my Prague trip. Very informative and our guide Sasha was very fun and new a ton about the city! Highly recommended.

Great private tour. We spent a few days in Prague and saw an ad for Praha Bike tours on one of the city maps. Although the tour season didn't start until a week later, I emailed them about a private tour. They promptly responded and a couple of days later, we were on our way to Karlstejn Castle. The staff was super friendly and provided water, gloves, and rain ponchos (the weather wasn't great that day). Our guide, Yana, was very friendly and knowledgable about the city and surrounding areas. It was still a bit chilly, so about halfway through the trip, we stopped for tea and strudel in a small-town pub to warm up. The trip there through the countryside was great and Yana continued to check that the speed was ok and that everything was fine while we were biking. Once we made it to the castle, we had a relaxing lunch and a good time just chatting. We saw a lot, biked a lot, never felt rushed, and really enjoyed this trip! If you're not a regular biker/fairly active person, be prepared for a few sore muscles, but the day trip is definitely worth it! Thanks Praha Bike tours!

Great way to see the whole city in a short time!. We did the all day tour because we only had two days in Prague and thought it would be a good way to see as much as possible in a short time. It was basically two tours combined but both were great. Our guide Britton was knowledgeable about all the sites, very personable and a great guide over all. I definitely recommend Praha Bike and Britton as a guide.

A great trip to Karlstejn with Jirka!. These folks were friendly and honest. I started with a bike that was not as comfortable as my own and their team changed-out the bike and quickly made adjustments to accommodate me. The 20 mile journey on bike from Prague to Karlstejn was spectacular and worth seeing. We enjoyed the great scenery during the tour. Our guide, Jirka, was knowledgeable, friendly and cautious — a true professional! We stopped along the way for some beer/lunch and had great conversations with Jirka — By the end of the tour, we felt like we just made a great friend. Definitely recommend!
Best way to see the city. Did a 2.5 hour ride through Prague- great bikes with plenty of suspension which is essential for all the cobbles!!Great guides, very safe, highly recommended

Fun bike tour. I was glad Praha Bikes did not cancel the tour as I was the only person to go this day -- it's nice to know you can count on them keeping the commitment esp since I was really looking forward to the experience. The ebike was a blast to ride -- provided what felt like a rocket booster push. Francesco and Thomas were delightful companions on the Karlstejn Castle tour and the day was a highlight of my trip.

Bike Tour. EXCELLENT. Our tour guide Britten was fantastic. He was very knowledgable about the different locations and was able to answer questions/provide tips for tourists. We got the feel for the city and would never have been able to cover that much ground without his assistance. Highly, highly recommend!! Thanks again!

A great tour!. A great way to get to know the city - we did this on our first day. The tour took us round lots of places of interest we'd have struggled to find on foot. The tour guide Jirka was lovely - friendly, helpful and knowledgeable- he made the tour! Would highly recommend

The best way to visit Prague . Seriously, This is the best way to see the city ! Safe, easy to work your way around the sights, simple orienteering clue- keep the river to your right if you're in the old town, simples!!!!
Bike shop super efficient and very reasonable price.

Excellent tours. We did 2 tours with Praha bikes in the short time we had in Prague . The first tour was just around town seeing the major sites- it was very enjoyable and Briton was a great guide - we covered alot of ground in a short time and saw much more than we would have had we walked.The 2nd tour we did was to Karlstejn castle - 38 kms from Prague - so it took a good deal of the day but it was really worth it to see some of the czech countryside.This tour was with Sacha - he was a fantastic guide and a really genuine and nice person which all added to make the trip very enjoyable. I would highly recommend.

Great bike tour... super safe and stress free. Praha Bike tours is a short walk from the Old Town, and because it isn't an auto heavy city like Barcelona (bike tour was chaos), it made for a really enjoyable tour! You can cover much more ground than Segways, and you aren't sitting in a bus or trolley. Francesco was a wonderful and super knowledgeable guide and made sure my three girls (youngest is 10) were safe and wearing their helmets. Highly recommend.....
Amazing. Great adventure. Very good guide Francesco Good knowledge of history and areas visited. recommend the adventure to all.

Fun, interesting way to see Prague. We (2 adults, 1 teenager, 1 dog) choose the 2,5hr tour. George was our tour guide. He made the tour interesting and informative - our son actually remembered a lot of the facts. Great way to see the city from a different perspective. Nice people.
Family bike tour . Excellent ! Great safe ride , beautiful scenery and very friendly guideBike lanes with out cars 90% , very good bycicles
Cheap and friendly.. My girlfriend and I rented bikes for the day. Cheap friendly. Good bikes with storage rack. Helmets locks and gloves provided. Perfect service!

Great Tour. Just finished the bike tour with my girlfriend today. We were the only 2 so could go exactly at our own pace, which was perfect after a late night before!! Britton, our guide, was super friendly, knowledgable and gave us great information on not only the landmarks but the history of the country itself. Definitely worth booking if looking to find out more about this city in a friendly and easy way.

Best bike tour . We did the classic tour on a lovely sunny lunch time. Our tour leader Britain was amazing and had a lot of local knowledge, we got to see way more than I thought we would! Prague is super pretty! Would definitely recommend doing, especially on your first day so you actually get to know your way around the city

Old town tour excellent. Cafe stop great. Jirka was my guide and as it turned out I was the only person on the ride. Pretty amazing as in no other city does the ride go ahead with only one person. He had a love of the city and a great knowledge answering my random questions as we cycled along. The tour covers all the major points. I also hired a bike to go selfguided to Carlstejn castle. Bikes were in good condition and staff extremely helpful in making sure you enjoy your cycle. Recommended
great fun, great guide. Had a great time cycling around Prague with Sasha. He knew his stuff. great guide. also knew where we could get a warming drink during our ride

Prague by bike. Fun, educative, friendly!
Despite the wind and cold weather, we still had an amazing tour around Prague and had the opportunity to see and hear about its famous historical buildings as well as intriguing stories. Special thanks goes to Saša, who made this whole tour unique, pleasant and memorable!

Brilliant Bike Tour. Sasha was fantastic, he added details and interesting background information at all the right times, as well as being entertaining. It's a really carefully designed tour; the stops are spaced out well, they were all engaging, and it takes in a fab coffee shop.

Fun tour of hidden and less hidden Prague. A bike tour even my sceptical daughter enjoyed. Sasha was fun, kept the tour moving and had lots of fascinating stories to tell about Prague and its history.He pointed out things we had passed several times on our own and not noticed.easy cycling, very flat, great coffee stop. One of the best cycle tours we have done.Thank you Sasha

Bike tour of the city. Had a super bike tour of Prague this morning with our very friendly and informative guide Sasha. Despite the weather being a little cold and damp, we were taken round the city with frequent stops to share some of its rich history. A great way to see some things you might like to return to and to have some of the history of Praha brought to life.Thanks Sasha.Ruth and Amy

Great way to cover the lesser known places along with some Czech history. I visited during the Christmas period of 2015 but winter did arrive a little late this time and the conditions were good for cycling in Prague. Our guide was extremely friendly and showed us some exciting places which I would probably not have covered otherwise. He also had some great facts for us and was able to keep us engaged in the tour. The controversial "art" designs of David Cerny were probably the most memorable ones. We did take a drinks break which helped breaking the ice within the group. Our guide even brought markers so that we could leave a "mark" on the famous Lennon wall in Prague. It's a good trip to take especially if you're traveling solo and the weather is kind.

Great tour with Sasha. If you're thinking of doing this tour I highly recommend it. We went on our bike tour on Sunday 17th Jan when it was -5 and very snowy so it was no surprise when our guide, Sasha, informed us that we would be the only guests on the tour!Having introduced ourselves and worked out how to get outside after the door handle had fallen off we felt that Sasha was very informative, knowledgable and interesting, often going above and beyond what might be expected on a bike tour (for instance providing us with pens to graffiti the John Lennon wall-something that is encouraged and legal!).Although only two hours long we believe we saw and learnt a lot about the city of Prague and Czech history that we simply wouldn't have been able to otherwise. Thanks again Sasha-you were great (other than when you showed me up by jumping straight on to David Cerny's babies!)

Loved it!!. We had a great time on the tour, Jiri took us to places we would not have seen otherwise. It was very enjoyable and interesting even in the cold. Jiri was excellent and we are glad we decided on this activity.

Quality tour with quality guide. My wife and I booked a group bike tour but due to the freezing weather and snow it turned into a private tour as no one else showed up which was great for us! We had Sasha as our guide who was very knowledgable and answered any questions we had. He was very friendly, approachable and easy to talk to. Would recommend this company of you want to see and learn more about Prague. Much better than walking in my opinion as you see more faster!
Bike and Segway tour. Excellent guides with first class information on the whole of the tour, super to see all Praque from the top of the city.Sasha was a super guide, knowledge was excellent.

Reasonable option. The good - My wife needed time to get use to the bikes and the guide was very patient. The bad - our tour was supposed to be 3.5 hours and was 2.5 only, without all kind of things that are mentioned on the website such as beer stop in the middle, map of the city, etc. My ebikes stopped working on the middle, the guide fixed it, but 2 days later when i rented an ebike for my solo use, the battery ended after about 2 hours, no refund or apology. The staff were very polite and friendly in general, but again - not the level I'd expect.

Praha City Bike Tour - great guide & super start to our break!. We went in November - lovely sunny day with Sasha as our guide. Four of us windng through the streets and back roads of Prague. Great start to the trip as we saw a lot of the main sites (and so could decide which to go back to for a longer look) and also some areas we would have missed eg: John Lennon Wall; Love Lock Bridge; and some great art work throughout the town which you really notice when you hear what it is and why, from Sasha. He was very knowledgeable, friendly and answered all our questions - was a lovely way to see the city. Thank you Sasha.

Cracking Tour. Went on the group tour but only ended up being me and my girlfriend! It was a brilliant tour and our tour guide Sasha was Brilliant! Very friendly, laid back and knowledgeable on Prague! Highly recommend this tour!

Most enjoyable.. The traffic in Prague is very quiet compared to many cities which makes its easier for cycling although there are a lot of cobbles to contend with! Helmets are provided should you choose to wear one. We learnt a lot and saw things that we wouldn't have got round to on our own and, of course, it is great fun.

Fantastic tour with a greta guide. It was a special weekend in Prague and Sasha (our guide on the bike your) made a massive contribution. Very friendly, laid back and great knowledge of the history of Prague. Thanks!!

Amazing and fun!. What a great experience we had in Prague with this tour. Really fun way to move around the city and see some special places and get to know some things which many people might totally miss out. Our guide Ramon was absolutely perfect. He knows the city very well and is lots of fun to talk with. Highly recommended! :)

Great Prague Experience. Sasha was our guide and we had a fairly large group of about 10 people. He was great and really go involved with our group dynamics. His knowledge of Prague was very good and we saw some awesome spots. Highly recommended!
The best experience in our vecation. .Sasha is the best guide: kind, patient & professional He showed us very nice places which we didn't know about them. We enjoyed very much!

Great way to experience the city of Prague. Sacha guided us through Prague and had many great stories and facts about the areas we cycled through. And next to that he was fun to be with - many thanks!

A brilliant, fun and informative way to see Prague. We did the morning city tour and our guide was Sasha. He was absolutely brilliant, telling us all sorts of historical nuggets and present-day anecdotes that you would never find in a guide book. We covered a surprisingly big area in just 2.5 hours and even fitted in a coffee stop! It was our first morning in Prague and by the end of the tour we felt that we really knew our way around. I did the tour with my 12-year old nephew and he loved it too. It was the best possible start to our break. Can't recommend it highly enough.

The flavour of Prague in 2.5 hours. I discovered the joy and benefit of cycle tours in other cities. This one just confirms that a bicycle 'reccie' of a city is a MUST DO on any short break. I booked this online from home and everything was well organised and the basic hybrid bikes where well maintained,rugged and suited touring. Our guide Sacha was engaging and well informed and spoke excellent English.We took in the sights with his background knowledge to let us know a brief history of what we where looking at and some of the legends and folklore of Prague itself. The tour is at a relaxed enough pace for any nervous cyclist to keep up and we fortunately chose to do the basic city tour on a Sunday which meant less traffic was about.If I had more time I would have considered doing the castle tour as well.Strongly Recommneded

Best way to see this beautiful City is cycling!!!. We have made few inquiries over the phone and emails before we book with Praha Bikes and was planning to turn up on the day if the weather permits. Finally we booked for Private tour to see the main attractions in the city and tour of the castle. Our guide Jirka was very friendly and approachable. Tour started with an overall map demo and some boring safety instructions. Jirka is a Prague born local who has inside knowledge and history of every attractions in Prague. He has never shown any hesitation to stop and enjoy panoramic views or to take photos where ever we wanted. We have cycled along the river and enjoyed the magnificent views of the city from Letanska Sady, Prague Metronome and Belvedere gardens. Jirka also shared some interesting facts about every buildings visible. Prague Castle, Presidential residence and St. Vitus Cathedral are must do while you are in Prague. Change of guard at 12:00 noon is another interesting custom to see in Prague.
