Please note you won't be allowed to cycle within Castle compound and you will have to park the bike outside.Our tour continued through Cerninsky Palace, John Lennon wall, Kempa Park, Crawling Babies and lot of breathtakingly beautiful green areas and interesting cobblestone streets. We stopped for coffee and cake in a restaurant (Mlŷnska) before we cross the river for busy city traffic and lot of lost tourists. Prague city is very cyclist friendly and vehicles do adhere to make way for cyclists. We cycled the city with fun and joy. We have managed to see all major tourist attractions including Old Town Square, Wenceslas Square and Charles Bridge.Cycling tour with Praha Bikes especially with Jirka was a great way to start our holiday and we have learned a lot about the places to re-visit for rest of our stay in Prague. We were pleased to have chosen to start our holiday with cycling. When we returned to the base, staff warmly welcomed us and gave us some tips for rest of the holiday.

Friendly, fun going the extra mile. We did the late afternoon tour with Francisco, who was solicitous, rescued the tour member when he went off in the wrong direction, knew his history, and rescued my cell phone when I dropped it. Beautiful route, easy for not the most athletic sorts. Do bring cash; no plastic.

A great way to get around Prague. We toured with Francesco who was extremely informative. With all the cobblestones and other obstacles biking is the way to go. He lead us through some very interesting neighborhoods and gave us some very useful information and suggestions. The bikes were comfortable and easy to ride. A great diversion and a great experience. Definitely recommend

A fun and informative bike tour. We wanted to learn about the major sites within the city of Prague without doing a lot of research and thought that doing it via a bike tour was the way to go. Glad to report that our tour with our friendly guide Francesco from Praha bike turned out to be both fun and informative. It was a bit of a chilly day so aside from equipping us with helmets and a bike, the staff also provided us with loaner gloves which was a thoughtful touch. Once we got going we found the ride on the city tour route to be well planned (we manage to avoid the large crowds of tourists) and relaxed (good pace, not a lot of road riding with traffic). Aside from being able to cover a lot more ground that on foot, the best part was that Francesco helped us understand the significance and gave meaning to all the major sites that we visited. Overall a very pleasant experience that exceeded our expectations!
Sasha's tour. Great day and awesome guide. Took us to all the historic spots and had a great knowledge of the area. Thanks sasha

Prague - to bike or not to bike - that is the question.... Sergei led us on a very informative and interesting bike tour through the crowded streets of Prague. The head-sets supplied were a definite advantage when riding through busy traffic. This is a great way to get q quick overview of the city but if you're not comfortable riding a bike on crowded streets and sidewalks then I would recommend a bus tour or walking tour

What a fantastic company. I visited Prague with 3 friends. We all had different bike needs and one of us did not even want a bike at all. All the staff were extremely helpful, flexible and well informed and provided us with maps and excellent advice about where to go. They even provided me with a plastic raincoat which was useful for the rest of the holiday. I had a great day and highly recommend them :)

Great tour. We had Sasha for our bike tour last week and he was great. There was just the right amount of information while also being fun and interesting. He took us to a traditional Czech restaurant after, the food there was delicious. The bike ride itself was easy and covered the main parts of Prague. Thanks Sasha!
Fun way to see Prague!. We had a great time on the electric bike tour with guide, Sasha. Electric bikes were easy to use and made going up the hills a breeze. I would highly recommend it!

Wonderful guide Sasha , best way to spend a day at Praha. 35km to KARLSTEJN CASTLE. Everythings great except I don't know how to use the gear. 😝 they have ebike tour. Great way to cheat. 😁😁 Wonderful company , Wonderful guide.

Panoramic View of Prague. We were led by the intrepid guide Jirka who led us on a bike tour through the old town area and along the river up to the castle atop of Prague. We learned a fair amount about the various areas of the city that allowed us to map our activities for the following day. Since this was a late day / early evening tour, we needed bike lights to see (sort of) and to be seen (as necessity). Heading down from the castle down a fairly steep cobblestone road was a bit harrowing given that it was tough to see the path but we made it down in one piece. We felt that we had a great overview of the city.It should be noted that biking in early October can be chilly so dress accordingly.

going to prague for the first time ????. hi if you are going to prague for the first time ... make time for a bike tour with praha bike tours... we had a great couple of hours on a tour with sasha..a very interesting. informative and funny guy... seen and learned a lot more than some of the guide books tell....wel well worh a visit ..... thanks praha tours for the experience

Great way to see and learn about praha. I recently did bike tours of three major capitals of Europe. All were great. Our guide Sasha was friendly, knowledgeable and extended himself with help beyond my tour and rented a bike on my own.

Wonderful service and best city tour!. My husband and I missed our morning reservation so had to reschedule for the afternoon--Praha Bike was wonderful about letting us do that. Then we realized we were the only two scheduled for the afternoon trip, and instead of cancelling, Francesco took us on our own private tour of the city! It was wonderful. Francesco is great--so friendly and knowledgeable. He answered all of our questions and took time to point out good restaurants and places we might want to visit. This is an incredible way to see Prague! We took many city bike tours while in Europe, and this was by far the best! We definitely recommend. Thanks Praha Bike for the incredible experience!

Fun way to explore Praha!. We decided to do a bike tour to get a glimpse of the city so that we could then pick a few of our favorite places and explore them at leisure. This is exactly what we got from Praha Bike's tour. Our bike tour guide, Jerka (George), was super friendly and informative. He gave us great recommendations on places to shop, eat, drink and relax. I would definitely recommend them to anyone visiting Prague!

Highly recommend this as a way to see more of Prague. We took this one day bike tour which involved a bike ride along the river and out into the countryside; stopped for a beer on the way, and then for lunch at a local pub. We had an amazing time - the bike ride was not difficult though I do believe you need to have a reasonable level of fitness. Our tour guide, Jirka, was excellent.

Great way to see Prague!. Francisco was a fabulous tour guide and we really enjoyed our bike tour of the Beer Gardens in Prague. What a wonderful way to experience some of the unexpected and amazing places in Prague.
Praga by bike!. Very nice! Is a good tour for just 3 hours. Praga is amazing. It worth it to go by bike, walk and go on the boatss. . I recommend it!!

Great bike tour. We went on the evening city panoramic bike tour with Francesco and it was fantastic. The route took us up to Prague castle and the ride wasn't too bad up the hill on a regular bike. I think the people with the electric bikes found it more difficult than we did. This was a perfect way to see the city and a perfect time to do it with the sun setting and the buildings lit up.

Great ride to Karlstejn Castle. We wanted to know Prague surrounding a little better. that why we decided to take a bike trip.
The trip was great with beautiful scenes.
Sasha the guide was real professional and nice.
מומלץ מאוד!!

Fab!. I believe this is a smaller Segway/bike company in Prague however the service and staff were great. We had Sasha as our guide for a night time tour around Prague on Segway. Sasha was great, very friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. Since there were only 2 of us, Sasha was able to tailor and guide us to historical sites which we had not visited during the previous days.If you have not experienced Segway, I would highly recommend it to all as it is easy and a really fun way to see any city. If you are visiting in fall/winter, bring gloves and wrap up!

Wonderful evening bike tour of the castle . This was a great tour with our guide Francesco. He knew what he was talking about and indeed showed us the panoramic views of the city. He explained the architecture of the buildings well and it was really magical seeing the buildings lit up at night. We really enjoyed ourselves.

Excellent tour with Mira, great value!. We did the classic tour with Mira and she was just so wonderful! She was very knowledgeable about the history of Prague and we learnt more about the city as well as the history of Czech Republic than we would have in a year of school! The pace was good for us, not slow or boring and she was always checking how we were going and if we had any questions. Great value for money. Would recommend to everyone. Thanks Mira! From Chris and Emily.

Great value for money. Had a really fun time on the bike tour today, the guide was very knowledgeable and really friendly. I would recommend because you see some amazing views whilst on this tour and learn a lot about the city.

A Tandom built for Two in Prague , go team Shamichael !!. Praha bikes was great , our tour guide "Ramon" was very welcoming , safe to follow on a bike in a strange city and knowledgable regarding the cities landmarks and history , recommend this trip to anyone on your 1st day of holidays or break as you will find your bearings very quickly and see areas , restaurants and land marks that you just wouldn't know existed if you followed maps by foot , your tour guide will also advise you on best places to visit and spend sometime in , places to dine and nighttime entertainment without paying over the odds in the touristy areas

Great tour with Sasha!. Great bike tour with Sasha, we did the panoramic tour and it was really beautiful only a few uphills and some stops to take pictures. Nice exercise through the beautiful city of Prague!

Sasha - good stuff . My buddies and I were visiting Prague from the states. Our very first day in Prague we decided to do a bike tour and it was the best idea we could have hoped for. We had Sasha who was an awesome guide! He's from Slovakia but lives in The Republic and is extremely knowledgeable. I've done many tours before - some better than others - but the tour with Sasha was great. He didn't bore us with tons and tons of crazy details that we wouldn't remember. He knew just the items to cover in a memorable way to help us learn all about Prague. We did the panorama tour and you see great views of Prague, some of which would be hard to get to without a bike, but be ready for the hills! Thanks Sasha! From the Boston Boys - hope you get to visit the states sometime soon

Bike tour Carlstejn Castle. My wife and I took this great full day tour. We took and E bike and a normal bike, which made the ride very easy and convenient. Absolutely beautiful ride along the river and through the country side to the castle which was visually spectacular. Our guide George was very entertaining, funny and knowledgeable.Thanks George for a great day out.

Awesome tour around Prague. We went by bicycle to see different places in Prague. Ramon was our guide: a super funny Spanish guy who had lots of interesting stories to tell. I would totally recommend Praha Bike tours to anyone wanting to see and discover Prague. Enjoyed it!

Bike tour Karlstein Castle. Enjoyed our day trip to the castle and train ride back to Prague. Good bikes and good guide! Thanks Sasha!
Catherine and Roger
Great bike tour!. A few buddies and I went for a tour with Sasha our first day in Prague. He did a great job of taking us around to see the sights and was very informative.

Bike tour old city & highlights of Prague. On our first day in Prague we joined this amazing tour by bike that will take you along all the main highlights, including the Charles bridge, opera house, university and several art statues by David Cerny. The tour host was a friendly Spaniard named Ramon who definitely knows the stories behind the buildings and often gave historical background knowledge to take home after your holidays. Because of him I learned Prague played an mayor role in classic cultural development regarding Opera's, Ballets and more. Next to being a centre hub of Eastern Europe. Tour Group Size is not too big and after doing a tour you get rewarded by a discount on your next one. Not a bad deal at all!
Best bike tour. The Best bike tour in Prague with the Guide Francesco. Friendly, simply and he has a really good Knowledge.

Great overview of Prague. Spent my first full day in Prague by bike and really recommend it! You don't need the skills of a Tour de France cyclist, but one needs to be fairly comfortable on a bike, as the tour is all cobblestone streets and maneuvering around pedestrians/narrow alleys (part of the charm). They have a range of bike sizes to choose from. Our guide, Francesco, was very knowledgable, friendly and kept everyone safe.
Bike tour of Prague. Very good tour guide (Sasha) who was knowledgeable of the area and made the bike tour thoroughly enjoyable!

Great experience! . We did the classic bike tour on our first full day in Prague. It was a great way see and learn about the city. Vasek was an awesome tour guide. He was extremely knowledgeable and helpful! Overall great time!

Best bike rental I've ever been in. Don't let the generic name "Praha Bike" fool you, these guys are pros.I went to Prague with my wife and we both wanted to cycle through the parks north of the city to see the views from above. We didn't know the place or any good routes so we were counting on the employees to help us out.Luckily we were greeted by one of the nicest and most helpful person, who explained everything to us in great detail, gave us a huge map and drew 2 possible routes for us to travel, with spots we should look out for (e.g. stairs, bridges, bad roads etc..).My wife is 5ft tall and I'm 6"5' with back problems. The fellas in Praha Bike fitted us with 2 bicycles which were exactly what we needed! We rode for at least 4 hours and had a blast. The big map served us well. The weather and views were incredible and the bikes were in excellent shapes, fast and not making any noises. You can easily tell they get good treatment by the folks at Praha Bikes.The price was not expensive at all. If I hadn't discovered the place on my second to last day there I would've gone for a second ride.Highly recommended! If you wanna explore the city fast, rent a bike here.

Sasha is the best!. My bike tour of Prague was incredibly fascinating and enjoyable. Sasha, our guide, was knowledgeable, entertaining, funny, and kind. He showed us the top sites of Prague as well as a few lesser known, interesting, newer additions to the city. Throughout the trip, he talked to us and carried on friendly conversation. The tour itself was wonderful - as an architecture student studying abroad here for a semester, I was delighted to discover places that I had heard about or read about but couldn't find myself. It's a great way to see a lot of the city in a short amount of time. I highly recommend a Praha Bike tour, especially with Sasha!
Amazing!. Amazing tour with Ramon !! Some time ago I did this nice tour in the city of Prague. Ramons was very funny and charming guide, who knew almost any secret from this astonishing city.

Highlight of my trip!. We booked a private tour for a party of 6 people. We are not spring chickens but still active...we loved this tour. We did select the e-bikes which were needed for the elevation of the tour. Sasha was our guide and he was fantastic. His English was superb and his knowledge of the area was extensive. We had a bike mishap as one of the seats broke and he got it repaired immediately. Loved everything about this tour and company. We wanted to take Sasha home with us but his girlfriend would probably not have been too happy!
SandiHamm. So fun and a great way to see the sights.Sasha, our guide was Great! He made the trip! We had a group of 6. I would do this again.

Honeymoon in Prague. I am really confused by all the great reviews. We booked a 2.5 hour city tour and had taken an amazing bike tour in Munich. Our group was small and our guide still was not able to make sure everyone was following him. He never checked back on us and just kept going without regard to the group. His english was broken and it was difficult to understand, which is unfortunate for a tour guide. The bikes were extremely uncomfortable and I was sore for two days after. Maybe bike tours aren't the best idea in Prague because of the cobblestones but the tour could have been done much better. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone and was sad/annoyed throughout the whole tour.

wet and wonderful Prague. We (my wife and I)arrived in Prague, it was raining. Next day we had a bike tour booked, it was still raining. We got to Praha Bike, They were very friendly and welcoming.They said everyone else had cancelled, due to the weather did we still want to go. We said sure, they said great, we were getting a private tour, our Guide was Francesco. We were fitted for our bikes, donned rain poncho's, and off we went. Francesco, was a mine of information, took his time at every stop, information, explanation, and lots of trivia. No rushing through due to the rain. Francesco took photos of us, we of him, and us. It was the best way to see Prague. We highly recommend Praha Bike and Francesco. The bikes were good for the tour comfortable on teh cobbled streets, with enough gears to handle the hills. Awesome tour, the ONLY negative, was the weather, and not much anyone could do about that!. We would definately return to Prague and Praha Bike.

Best way to learn about Praha!. We were very pleased we did this tour! The amount of knowledge we took away was astounding! We were kicking ourselves for not doing this on the first day there! Don't hesitate and book! Great way to soak up the history and culture!

Awesome experience riding to Karlstejn Castle. I was traveling with a friend and another woman and we aren't huge bicycle riders but this tour sounded great. It was! Sasha was our guide and he was outstanding. His good sense of humor and calm kept our large group at ease, even with a couple of flat tires, falls, and fear of heights. The ride started through the cobblestone old town but soon led to a beautiful bike path along the Vltava river. There wasn't much bike traffic and it was awesome passing homes and locals enjoying the river and the many beer gardens we passed. We stopped for beer along the way, and then for lunch at an awesome restaurant~the menu was completely in Czech so Sasha interpreted for us. The ride was pretty flat most of the way-we did cross a bridge which freaked out one gal and led to a spat with her boyfriend for leaving her high and dry but Fernando, the other guide, held her hand and helped her cross. The couple eventually made up. The little bit of drama kept it interesting and everyone on the tour seemed to enjoy themselves tremendously. We made it to the castle and toured it~ very interesting! Then took the train back to Prague. I've been on many bike tours but Sasha far surpassed any other guides I've had. He told us great stories and had vast knowledge of the history and area. I would highly recommend this tour and be sure to ask for Sasha!

Very informative but lacking a sense of fun. We enjoyed our tour and our guide was extremely well informed and shared his knowledge with us. However , compared to a Fat Tyres tour it was a bit slow and dry. This may not have been helped by two of the participants feeling the need to compare everything to things American !! Bigger and better .....Bikes were OK. Cost reasonable.

Great orientation to the city. My husband and I took the Classic City and Panoramic & Prague Castle tours. Fortuna was our guide on both tours. We found her to be quite knowledgable and personable. The itinerary was perfect for a good orientation to the city and culture. Staff was quite flexible, as we showed up a few minutes late for our group tour and they just got another guide to lead a private tour for us at the same price. Definitely recommend this bike tour. Such a great way to see a new place efficiently!
Prague tevisited. Great way to se the city. Good fun and very informative. Ok for any level of cyclist. Did the classic city your which was all on the flat no hills.

Great Comprehensive Tour. We did the long 6.5 hour bike tour and saw/learned so much about Prague. Our tour guide Vasek was very knowledgable- he knew the answer to every question we asked. It was especially great because the day my friend and I booked our tour no one else had signed up so it was essentially a private tour for us. The restaurant the guide took is to for lunch was great too. Some bits of the bike ride were up pretty steep hills but manageable. I highly recommend Praha Bike.

Relaxing and informative tour. My friend and I did the city tour with Jana. She was great. Very friendly and did well to inform us on the history of the sites we czeched out (Yes I did that). Been on a lot of bike tours and this one was the most chil. We were not rushing around and we were able to coast about town. There are a lot of tourists walking around so heads up when you are biking. But for the most part it was really easy to get around. They have headphones so your guide can talk to you and you do not have to be right up on them which is very handy. I would recommend this company, Jana as a guide and the city tour. Now go book it!

Wonderful way to explore Prague! . The first day I took the classic city tour and I had such a great time that I came back the next day for the panoramic castle tour! Both days Jana, who was very competent, has been our guide. The tempo was perfect and the bikes were in a good shape. The staff -including our guide- was very friendly and helpful! I highly recommend them!

Bike Tour to Karlstejn Castle. Take a bike tour with Praha Bike. We did the visit to Karlstejn Castle. A 31 km cycle - easy and mostly all flat, except one small steep hill. During the heat wave in August it was a great activity to do and get out of the city. Our university educated Czeck guide was very fluent in English; Jakkub was most interesting and informative and kept us interested and safe as ventured out of Praha. Tour the Castle, our young guide was most informative and makes history come to life with super interesting anecdotes about the King Charles the IV.Karlštejn castle was founded in 1348 by the Czech King and Holy Roman Emperor Charles IV in an impressive 19 years.It was the place for the royal treasures, particularly the devout Charles' collection of holy relics and the coronation jewels of the Roman Empire.

Best Prague Bike Tour - Amazing Guide!!. Just finished the whole day city tour, and I'm blown away. Our guide Sasha was one of the best I've ever had. I've travelled to more than 30 countries, so have done my fair share of tours. He was extremely knowledgeable: full of interesting facts, stories, legends, general prague info, and had an answer to all our questions. He couldn't have been better. He also took us to a traditional non touristy Czech lunch spot which I loved cause it's always nice to know what the locals enjoy to eat and not what they make for tourists. Overall it was one of the best day's/tours I've been on in a while, and all due to our great guide. If you can ask for Sasha, you should. It will be worth it!!

Prague Night Legend Bike Tour. Left at 730pm with our guide Francesco who essentially gave us a private tour as we were the only two on it. A fantastic way to see the city as the daytime crowds have thinned out and the temperature was much more bearable. Seeing the Old Town at night was amazing and the knowledge Francesco imparted was interesting and in depth. Would highly recommend for those wanting something a little different.

Awesome bike ride to Karltejn Castle!. We booked a bike tour to Karlstejn Castle through Praha Bike and it was excellent! Office was easy to find as it was close to Old Town Square. Guide was knowledgeable.I would highly recommend it if you like to bike and want to see Czech in a different view.The tour can be up to 10 bikers but when we did it, it was only my husband and I. It was great! We bike often so we were able to keep a good pace and ended early. There are a few uphill sections. You go through a bunch of different terrain- smooth bike path, city cobbles stones, and uneven surfaces. I wouldn't recommend this particular tour for beginner riders.

6 hr tour of the city. We had Francesco for our tour guide and he was brilliant.. Very knowledgeable and helpful and just a lovely guy. My partner and I had a great day.. Would highly recommend it!! Great way to see Prague, learn all the history and see all the main landmarks and attractions.We did the walking tour the day before and you definitely get to cover a lot more ground being on a bike!!We did struggle a little to find the meeting point (though I put that down to my partners navigation) I would suggest to leave an extra few mins incase you get lost

Pedal Oh!. As we had enjoyed bike tours as a means to see the sights of other visited cities I was under strict instruction to “get one booked” for our visit to Prague.In all honesty I had tried with the most recommended tour but they were fully booked. As it turned out, as a second choice, Praha better suited us as it was closer to our hotel - as we found out when we wandered into the city on our first day.The tour is a good means to see the sights though we found out that we had visited all of them [except for the John Lennon wall] on the previous days walk.My wife struggled with her bike seat which couldn’t be fixed and tilted to and fro during the tour and although I was last to get a radio set [to hear the guides commentary] ahead of three latecomers who had to do without it never worked effectively throughout the 2.5 hour tour [even though I had taped down the jack to improve contact].Whether it was the route or there is an in-bred dislike of cyclists in Prague there were some interesting challenges to keeping the group together and on track.I thought that it was a perfectly enjoyable way to spend a couple of hours and, for the cost, was very reasonable.I’m guessing that the higher rated tours simply have better kit and marshalled routes.

Wonderful Cycle Tour. Myself, my wife and teenage daughter booked the cycle tour to Karlstejn Castle. We were joined by 2 Swedish ladies and 2 Americans. We opted for the easier ebikes. Total cycle length was approximately 40 km, which was done at a leisurely pace to suit the group. The tour was led by an amazing guide- Sasha (probably the most helpful guide I have come across, nothing was too much trouble for him). Apart from an initial section on roads through Prague (which Sasha guided us through excellently) the majority of the ride was on cycle paths through the lovely Czech countryside. Although we had ebikes we switched off the power for the majority of the ride, only putting it back on the help us up a couple of shortish hills. On route we could stop to take photos and Sasha rotated around the group to keep us informed of our surroundings, get to know us and check we were ok. Not far from the castle we stopped for lunch at a popular (with locals) restaurant which offered a good choice of food at excellent prices. Sasha did an excellent job of both translating the menu and then explaining further what the dishes were like. Once we arrived at the village of Karlstejn we had a short walk up a steep hill to the castle which was very picturesque surrounded by lovely views. We returned to Prague on the train with our bikes where again Sasha was a great help. The total trip was about 8 hours long and was thoroughly enjoyable with a great guide. I would recommend this to anyone spending a few extra days in Prague.

A great tour to start our Prague visit. We decided to take a bike tour of Prague our first afternoon in the city. Our guide Daniel was awesome. He provided a lot of great information about the city's history, and current tips about what to do and see. The tour takes you to some parks on the hills around the city, so the views are amazing and we were able to get a sense of what the city was like in just a couple of hours. It was a great start to five wonderful days in Prague. Thanks Daniel and Praha Bikes!

Great way to see the sights of Prague. We booked the 2.5 hour City Bike tour and thought it was fantastic. We did it with 2 small children and the Praha Bike people accommodated us very well with children seats fitted to our bikes. The tour is mainly over flat grounds, at a reasonable pace with frequent stops at historic points. The route also tries to avoid traffic and some tourists. The bikes are well maintained and the commentary was insightful. Our group was 11 people (young and old ) and well managed. We would recommend this tour to all!

Karlstejn Bike Tour. Had a few extra days in Prague and decided to bike 18 miles out to Karlstejn, along the river and through the countryside.It was scorching hot the day we went, with temps nearing 40 degrees celsius, but it was a wonderful ride nonetheless. Our guide Jana was wonderful - she knew the route well, but made sure she didn't ride too far. She also gave a great history of King Charles the IV, as well as the history of Karlstejn. We stopped for lunch close to the castle, at an authentic Czech restaurant. i highly recommend ordering the drop scones for dessert. :)One word of warning, the cycling is described as easy - for the most part the ride was on level ground, but there were a fair number of hills, which my poor sister had trouble scaling. She had to dismount and walk her bike up most of those times. I would recommend this tour only to those who have a decent amount of conditioning, especially for biking long distances.

Super city cycle tour. Just returned from Prague, spent 5 days there last week, always make sure we do some sort of city sightseeing when in any city, This time was no exception, did the bus , boat and Prague castle tours, best of those was the castle tour by far. So next came Praha bike city tour, and Mira our tour guide, about 17/18 of us on the tour and Mira left no stone unturned, she explained everything in just enough detail so we all knew the history of not just the city and its origins, but the main people involved over the centuries and the places they built, most of which we visited on the tour. Nice 15 min break half way for a cool beer(about 38 degrees that day). Mira made sure everyone was made to feel part of the whole Prague experience. Praha bikes team did the rest, right size of modern bike for all the different shapes and sizes, helmets if needed or wanted, so all I can say is thank you Mira and Praha bike city tour, do use this company when in Prague for your bike tour or bike hire.

Lovely tour. I took the Classic City tour and was given excellent information by Daniel, the guide. It is a lovely way to get acquainted with various Prague neighborhoods and includes a leisurely cycle through a park making for wonderful views of the city. Daniel was very knowledgeable on the city's history and made it a pleasant as well as an interesting experience. Kathleen.

Lovely Tour with a great guide (even with the terrible weather)!. It was a very wet and rainy day in Prague when we did this tour. But we had booked it months before and decided we would press on. Our tour guide, Sasha, was excellent. He was very knowledgable and had loads of funny little interesting stories to tell. We would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who is visiting Prague.

Pay attention to the weather!. We booked the following tour: Troja Chateau Bike TourMy review is skewed by the horrible weather we had, so please keep that in mind. 20 minutes into our ride, we were caught in a torrential downpour, which affected the whole tour. Please make sure you check the forecast before booking.The first 15 minutes of the tour took us a less than desirable route. It was a bit sketchy, but still fun to be active and not on a typical walking tour. After we waited out the rain (45 minutes under a really seedy underpass) we started to see some really great areas on the left side of the Vltava River. We passed several areas that could have been mentioned on the tour, but probably weren't since we were behind schedule and trying to get to the Chateau. Things you will pass include the freestyle kayak course on the river and a super cool Trojan Horse. We were too late arriving at the Chateau and it was closed seconds before getting there. The grounds and Chateau were very beautiful and the ride back was through some pretty parks. I know we would have had a much better experience, if not for the weather. Our guide was friendly and very nice, although he was having to translate in two different languages the entire trip, as the other couple was from Italy. I'd recommend this overall, though. There was one area that was a bit of a challenge, but the route was usually very flat and easy to manage.

Praha Bike Tour Guide Was Amazing. My wife and I took the all day trip to the Karlstejn castle. The trip itself is a very doable bike trip (even for those not in the greatest shape) and I highly recommend it. Our tour set a record for having the most flat tires (my wife had 3!). The trip is amazing, but Sasha is what really made this bike trip outstanding. With that many flats to fix, he never once complained...in fact, he was nothing but cheerful and helpful the entire trip. He was completely service-oriented, spoke fantastic English, was personable, and made sure those of us who were less experienced bikers feel completely supported. I hope they pay him well! He deserves it.

Guided bike tour to Karlstejn Castle. Our guide Sasha was fantastic. He was personable, eloquent, gave great information on Prague, its history and the castle. He chose a fantastic spot for lunch. It was the best food we had in Prague and very affordable. The bike ride was long but we went at a relaxing pace that was not strenuous at all. I would highly recommend this tour for anybody looking to see the Czech countryside, get some exercise and get out of the tourist mobs!

Panoramic Castle City Tour. We took the Panoramic Castle Tour last week with Jana. Had a great time. we had seen the old town the day before and what a great way to get to the castle via Letna Park and the Royal Gardens. Great views over the City before you arrive at Prague Castle. Then downhill back to the City to the Jewish Quarter, Old Town Square and back to base. A great 2.5 hours. Some hills to go up, but the views are worth it and even in 35 degrees last week it was not so hard. And the free wheel back down is great. Jana was a good guide and looked after our bikes as we went into the Castle. A great morning - Thanks Jana.

Great Trip to Karlstejn Castle!. I've just returned from visiting Prague and we spent one of our days biking to Karlstejn Castle. It was a great 18 mile bike ride with several decent climbs, along the two rivers in Prague. The traditional Czech lunch was great, and very much enjoyed the "Raddler" during our rest stop. There is a steep walk once you reach the castle to visit the ruins, but overall I recommend this trek to anyone who wants to actively experience the city and countryside.

Great experience. Bike tours are the best way to explore a new city, and when you can do it in the company of a well versed and knowledgeable guide then that is even better. We really enjoyed our tour and our children were also catered for with the correct bikes.

Lots of fun. My husband and I had a great time with Sasha and David on a bike tour around the city. We saw very interesting sites we never would have found on our own, and learned the legends and rumors about those sites. We especially liked al the Gehri statutes.

Legends Tour-Fantastic!. My sister and I did the Legends tour last night with Fransisco. We had a brilliant tour, there were only the 3 of us! Fransisco was very knowledgable and easy going, allowing us to stop and take a closer look at anything extra that interested us along the way. We definitely recommend doing this tour as it gives you a different perspective of Prague in the evening, also the glow from the street lamps feels like you've gone back in time! Just magical, an experience we will always remember.

Good bike tour. If you are confident on a bike this is a neat way to see a few of the major sites. Sure the city may not be as bike friendly as say Copenhagen or Amsterdam but it is possible. Our guide was good. Her English was ok; we all managed to understand her. They provide helmets for those that want them.

Day trip to Karlstejn Castle with Sasha as guide. Booked trip to the castle and arrived there Sat am at 09:00. Met with Sasha and we were warmly greeted, natural and friendly guy who can make conversation easily. There were 5 of us in total and it was a great day. Weather was fab and Sasha was able to answer all our questions about the area/region - no matter how stupid they were. It was our best day out during our Prague trip and most of it was down to Sasha. Great job..............beer along the way was also very nice!!!!

Excellent tour with Sasha. Myself and five friends went on a bike tour around Prague. Definitely the best way to see Prague is on an e-bike. All bar one of us bought an ebike, and the friend that didn't clearly regretted it once we set off! Sasha was an excellent guide with a lot of enthusiasm. He showed us the best places to eat and go out in Prague.

Best way to see a city. My husband and I, along with 3 other couples, did a city 2.5 hour tour with Mira. Having done a bike tour of Barcelona I had to persuade my husband that this is the best way to see a city and he now agrees! Mira was very knowledgeable and thorough in her content and delivery. We wouldn't have learnt this much from the guide books! The pace of the tour was spot on, even in the blazing sun!

Awsome tour. I really enjoyed our tour to Chateau Troja. Our guide Francesco was super friendly and knowledgeable when it came to the history of Prague. If you want to see some of the beautiful sites of Prague away from the mobs of tourists then this is for you!

such a beautiful way to see the city!. We had a wonderful tour with Praha Bikes! We did one of the longer tours (about 3-4 hours) that went outside the city to various places, including the Troja Chateau. It was so wonderful to get away from the popular tourist areas and see the beautiful parts of the city that you otherwise wouldn't see. It was our favorite thing that we did in Prague and would recommend it to anyone! Our guide Vasek was so wonderful and it was great learning about the city from a local.

Awesome private and group tours. My husband and I did a private tour to Karlstejn castle. It was approximately 24miles, mostly on a bike trail which was mostly flat, but with one hill (careful of the speed bumps on the way down). We could go at our own pace and we stopped every fifteen to twenty minutes for sites and watering. We stopped for a nice lunch at a restaurant about five to ten minutes from the village below the castle. The castle sits up on a hill above a small quaint village with nice views up to the castle. After visiting the castle, it is a five minute or so bike ride to the train station. Biking through Prague city streets is a bit of a challenge with cobbles, people and cars. It is not a bike friendly city, but the bike trails are nice once you get to them. They are mostly paved. I highly recommend a private tour so you can go at your own pace, but there are pros and cons with either I am sure.

Brilliant way to explore Prague. Took a bike tour with our guide Sasha. The 2 1/2 hour overview of the city was an excellent way to discover many of Prague's impressive sights and architecture. The tour was fun and informative and Sasha's enthusiasm was very good. He also gave us good tips on where to eat. Would certainly recommend the city tour. Bikes were in good condition and cycle helmets were offered. I had a bicycle with a rear basket.

excellent way to get to know Prague. Took the 2 hour intro to Prague. Great value and a good way to get to know the city. Made enjoyable by our guide Ramon who took us around at a good pace, but had top knowledge of the city. Best bits - the street art / sculptures and the John Lennon wall

Great Overview of the City!. After tackling the Prague castle by ourselves, I decided that I needed a general tour of the city that would be fun, but insightful. After reading some reviews on Trip Advisor, my boyfriend and I chose the 2.5 hour City Bike Tour with Praha Bike, and I'm glad we did! The tour was 2.5 hours, relatively easy, and provided a wonderful overview of the city (I wish I would have done this on our first day to get acquainted with the city!). The biking is easy and you avoid most of the high-traffic areas. Our tourguide was Mira, who was just delightful. Our group of 8 people (4 couples) was fairly diverse, but no one had any issues understanding her. She did go quite into the details of Prague and Czech history, which I loved. Praha Bike also offers Segway tours, but we chose the bikes, mainly because of the price difference. It seemed quite affordable and a good value for the money! I would definitely recommend taking at least one tour from Praha Bikes, at least to get a good overview of the city. Mira was wonderful, and it was definitely a highlight of our trip.

Best Segway tour! !. We took the 2 and a half hour tour around Prague with the most amazing guide, Sasha. We've been traveling the world for many years and this tops it, the team at the shop was friendly, professional, and courteous. And our guide was the best ... Good luck with your music Sasha, hope to see again on our next visit.Avi & Suri Stern

Brilliant way to explore prague. Awesome bike tour around Prague taking in some fantastic sights with interesting information on some of pragues top tourist attraction. Tour guide Mira was brilliant and kept the tour very interesting!!

Outstanding service and a wonderful way to see the city.. We hired a tandem for the day and had a great time. The staff were really friendly; they were very accommodating when we asked to reserve the bike (which we could do with a skype call) and gave excellent advice on routes to follow and sights to see. They have two tandems, lots of bikes and they also do a number of tours and excursions. Bike hire is by the hour or by the day and they provide locks helmets and loss/damage insurance. We took the tandem for 5 and a half hours and it was kc 550 (about £15). We had a really lovely day riding through the parks and streets and got stunning views from the hills surrounding the city!

Countryside Tour to Karlstejn Castle. We had a large group (17 riders), so Praha Bike provided two guides. Harris and Francesco were both wonderful and worked really hard. They did a great job of keeping us safe and entertained. We got to see the Czech countryside outside of Prague, and quaint small towns along the way. We stopped for lunch at a nice restaurant, then rode the last mile and dropped our bikes with the Praha Bike van. We all hiked up to the Karlstejn castle and afterward caught a train back into Prague. It was a great way to get away from the crowds for a day and do something healthy and fun. Totally recommend this tour, and very high marks for Harris and Francesco.

Great tour by mira. Me and three friends took the half past 2 tour around Prague with Mira. It was very interesting and Mira was very knowledgable about the monarchy and history of Prague. Although I would have liked to known a little more about the culture of Prague and a little more about modern Prague. Mira was very good at answering questions and had very good English. We were also allowed to keep our bikes to use ourselves after the tour had finished at 5 which was a great little touch! We biked round Prague ourselves. Prague has lots of lovely big parks that you can freely bike around

Great overview of prague!. Went on a city tour (the long one, I forgot the name) with Daniel. Very good information on the tour. We went on not so touristy routes (which I returned to after the tour), a very good thing when biking in a highly touristic city. We also got a glimpse of everyday czech life and the czech way of living through the history that Daniel talked about and his personal experiences. A good way to orientate yourself to the city, and to stay away from tourist crowds!

Great overview of Prague with Harris. It's a nice activity to do when you have few time and want to see a lot. Me and my girlfriend really enjoyed the tour with Harris, who was patient, knowledgeable and gave us many advices.

Praha bikes:). I really enjoyed my tour on bicycles. Even though it rained a little, our guide, Jana, made sure we all enjoyed our trip and got to see all the interesting places Prague has to offer. I will def recommend the tour to my friends, next time they visit Prague:) děkuji !!!

An unexpected delight! Great day!. We went on the all-day trip out to Karlstein Castle, and it turned into such a great day! It was interesting to go from the heart of Old Town, then work our way out of the city and gradually find ourselves in beautiful countryside. Our guide Daniel was exceptional. Such a nice guy, so adaptable to our group, and really a pleasure to be with. Physically, the ride was pretty easy, as it was mostly flat. The length seemed just about right -- we traveled far enough to make it feel like a real journey, but not so far as too feel like we were trapped on our bikes. Have to reiterate that Daniel was great. This trip is a MUST DO!!!!

so much to see, so little time!. I've been to Prague for the first time last weekend and I do believe that bike tour with Praha Bike was my best decision! within this 2,5 hrs I could see main atractions and learn many interesting facts from wonderful guide, Jana! I strongly recommend! Pity I didn't have time to take part in Panorama Tour as well.. I guess I need to come back ;) Thanks Praha Bike! Thanks Jana!

Franciso rules!. My friend and I had a great time with Francisco. He's a great storyteller and fun person. He really knows his architecture. Special highlights for me beside the amazing architecture and history were the sculptures by a modern artist. Thanks so much Francisco!

Fun panoramic tour. Harris was a great guide for our small tour (group of 3). We did the Panoramic City Tour and it was indeed full of great views. Harris was full of great info and was patient with us and our questions!

Great bike tour with Saša. Saša was an amazing tour guide. I cannot say a single bad thing about him! It was a very hot day, but thanks to Saša who was incredibly considerate and easy going, we were able to enjoy our tour. The tour was very well organized and I thought we stopped by all the perfect spots to get to know the city better.
Fantastic! . We did a private tour of the City and beyond. Francesco was a fabulous tour guide and was exceptional with his knowledge and navigation around the city. Highly recommend!

City bike Tour. Sasha was a great guide. He was helpful and interesting and took us to many places all over Prague city. The cobblestone roads are brutal though, but the bikes are good--wide tires and shocks on each wheel. Everyone there seemed to be genuinely nice and helpful.

Just what we were hoping for. Vasek was awesome. Literally hit every highlight of the city, which laid the groundwork for a great 4 night stay in Praha. Highly recommend the all day tour.Biking is always the best way to see a city :)

Great bike trip to Berlin. We are a group of 7 friends (aged between 60 - 70) who hired bikes from Praha Bikes for our 10 day ride from Prague to Berlin. We found Oleh ( owner of Praha Bikes) excellent to deal with over the 9 months of planning. They picked up the bikes in Berlin as arranged, no fuss, bikes on the whole good although one broke its chain twice which was a little disconcerting and caused a bit of a delay. We can recommend Praha Bikes as a reputable provider of bike tours and rental.

Get Off the Bus and On a Bike to See the Real Prague. This week we had a great experience with Sasha who led our group on the castle tour outside of Prague. Sasha was fun, interesting and although much younger than our group (aka "Old Folks on Spokes"), managed not to kill us on some of the hills. Sasha is low-key and personable and truly went out of his way to make sure we were all comfortable and safe as we journeyed along the rivers and wheat fields of outer Prague. Also, don't skip the lunch stop he recommends; the restaurant is excellent. If you do the castle tour at the end, you even get to climb straight up a long, steep hill! So get off the bus, jump on a bike, ask for Sasha as your guide and you will not regret it!Signed, Boris, representing Old Folks on Spokes, Washington, D.C.

Awesome way to see the countryside.. We did the full day bike trip to Karlštejn. It was a fun day, but the ride was a little longer than advertised. We would definitely recommend the trip as it was nice to be outside of the city and the countryside is really beautiful. For photos and more information please visit:http://sixbestfriends.com/2015/06/19/exploreing-the-czech-countryside/

Horrible bike riders but a fun time none the less!. Sasha led our tour to Troja and the beer gardens. It ends up my husband and I weren't the best bike riders but we managed to make with just a few scrapes. Sasha was very patient with us and we still had a great time! It was wonderful to get out of the tourist center and see some different parts of Prague.

Great tour. We did a bike tour recently with Praha Bikes and it was great fun. Nick was our guide who was very knowledgable of the city and helpful in giving advice on where to go and what to see in Prague. Despite it pouring with rain it did not dampen the tour as we all had such a nice time cycling around Prague, taking in the sights and stopping off for a warm drink in a lovely cafe in a park. Highly recommend it.

Best way to see Praha. We went on this bike tour the first day we were in Prague. Our guide Sasha was fantastic. It was low key and informal but very informative. Sasha was knowledgeable and friendly. We rode to about every corner of the city and saw everything we wanted in one trip. It was great to know where we were when traveling around the city for the next few days as well.

Fabulous trip to Troja Chateau and Karlstejn Castle!!. Initially we booked an afternoon trip to Troja Chateau, but curiosity got the best of us and we also decided to try the all day bike ride to Karlstejn Castle the following day. Cheers to George,(I can't remember his Czech name), who captivated us with his great personality, and immense knowledge of Czech history, and led us on the Troja Chateau trip. We were a group of 6, 3 adults and 3 kids who were 16, 20 and 21. After a nice, brisk bike ride, a tour of the Chateau, and a visit to the Letna Beer Garden, we each were completely satisfied! So….the next morning we met at 9:30 at Praha Bikes and were introduced to our guide Nick. He is from Massachusetts and lucky for us a history major who spent time in the Czech Republic. Great guy, full of interesting facts, put the history of the Czech Republic in simple terms, and made the day just perfect by really making an effort to spend time with each one of us on the ride. He was professional, safety conscious and very knowledgeable. The ride was absolutely beautiful, flat bike path through gorgeous countryside. We made a few stops, had lunch right outside the castle in a neighboring town, and rode to up to Karlstejn Castle. After walking around the grounds of the castle, we took the train back to Prague. It was one of my favorite days of our vacation….nice to get out of the city and see the backroads and countryside!! Two great trips, two great guides. Highly recommend both!!!

All day trek to Karlstejn Castle. The perfect way to spend my last full day in the Czech Republic. We take off down the river and bike through the picturesque country side. We stop for a quick brew then take off for the castle only to stop again for lunch. Make sure you wear something athletic, it can be strenuous only for no more than 10 minutes of the entire day. Once you get to the castle be sure to have your expectations in check. The purpose of the castle was to only store the family jewels, so it's not as extravengant as I expected. The only reason I gave this tour 4 stars instead of 5 is because our tour guide, as nice as he is, really didn't give us any historical context... ever! Other than that it was a blast, don't forget to stay in a line!

2 hour city cycle Tour with Sasha . Very friendly team at the Praha Bike . The guide Sasha is very friendly and takes you through old town , new town , charles bridge , john Lennon wall , David Churney's sculptures , kampa gardens , Jewish town , dancing building -- gives succinct commentary and historical nuggets - very enjoyable - thanks to the whole team .. They are happy to give information about other attractions and gave us useful information .. Siva Pillai

Fun Bike Tours!. We went on the city tour (with Ramon), and liked it so much that we went back the next afternoon for the castle tour (with Vaček). Both tours were terrific - a super way to see a bigger slice of Prague and a great orientation to the city. Both of the leaders were very good - they kept a nice easy pace, checked the group behind themselves often, stopped frequently to explain sites and allow for photos, and were all-around friendly. The bikes are solid and have fat tires (good qualities for the cobblestoned areas) and hand brakes, and are easy to use. FYI: The city tour is on flat but densely-pedestrianed ground, the castle tour has some significant climbs and one big drop, all of which were safely handled by our guide and our group (which had widely varying ages, biking abilities and levels of athleticism). Don't let fear of hills scare you; anyone can manage the castle tour and it is well worth it. We saw parts of Prague we never would have seen on foot, and also found the bike tours a terrific way to escape the madding crowds. Highly recommended!

Great night legend bike tour. had a wonderful time biking around Prague tonight with Francesco. He did a fantastic job explaining different sites and of course, the 'legend' that comes with them. Definitely a highly recommended tour. Now I can even tell my friends a story of Prague and it's different main sites. and I guess we are lucky that we were the only two in the group..

Great way to see the city! . We just did the Classic city tour. It was the cheapest we could find and it was great! Our tour guide Vasek was brilliant, he brought us to all the main sites and gave us info at each place. Really recommend it! Great way to see the city!!
Wonderful experience. The night tour is excellent and highly recommended. You get to see the major sites lit up for your enjoyment. The tour is pretty much a flat ride, so fear not.

Karlstejn Castle Tour. We had a great ride to Karlstejn castle with our guide Jana. This is a beautiful and relaxing trip out of Prague that follows the river through the countryside. Jana was very friendly, engaging and overall ensured we had an excellent experience. The trip is about 18 miles so it provides some decent exercise.

Beer and Bike Delight.. Had a fantastic beer and bike tour with Francesco. It was a very hot day so the beer was especially good and he told us a great deal about Prague on our tour. The ride wasnt hard and went through some beautiful parks. Highly recommended.

Excellent series of tours with Praha bikes. Ive done pretty much all their tours now and just took the beer garden tour today with francisco who is great..... Probably my favourite tour out of all of them.... The city tour is quite standard out of necessity, but you still see a lot, but the others that cross the river and get out into the parks are my favourites.... I would recommend this company to anyone and everyone - they have great bikes, prices, routes and always an eclectic mix of travellers from all countries and all ages - an absolute cornerstone of my two trips to prague, and highly recommended, you will see so much!!

Amazing trip to Karelstejn.. I had a great experience biking to Karelstejn.The trip is a great way to see Prague in a different way + to exercise a little bit whil eon vacation.The scenery is beautiful all over there and luckily for bikers there is a very nice road (it is super safe!)Our guide was Nick Wilson and he was fantastic! (great knowledge of the city, very energetic + can talk about Prague for hours)

Great way to see the city!. I went on this bike ride as a part of a tour and had such a fantastic time! Our tour guide (I can't remember her name - sorry!) was great - very informative and very patient with our mediocre riding skills and extended photo stops. She even recommended and joined us for lunch at a local restaurant after the ride.It's such a great way to see the city as it covers so much ground in a few short hours. I would definitely recommend this bike ride, just be prepared for the cobblestones!
Friendly helpful staff, good value. Fun day out with family. Kids 6&9 on a bike each, parents on tandem. Given map and suggestions and set off along river path. Great.

perfect tour. very nice classic tour of the most interesting places of Prague. Jana our guide gave us, a lot of infos about Heritage and current Situation in Prague in a very sympathic way. The bikes were in a good shape and with a nice suspension to ride the old streets. We enyoyed it a lot and we recommend to make a tour with praha bike.

Terrific way to view the surrounding area!. We chose the 4 hour tour and beer tasting tour around the general area of the city, getting out a little bit to surrounding bike lanes on the river and through local parks. Our guide Sasha was professional, courteous and lots of fun to hang out with. He was also a fountain of knowledge about the local area. One note of caution? for women, I like my beer but even I was thinking about water on the last stop (although to be honest, not seriously)! Both women in our group gave up after two beer but Sasha always provided water or juice in its place. Bikes were in good shape and route is easy. If you find yourself with a free afternoon or evening, definitely check these folks out.
Fun!. Very good tour and lots of fun. Our guide Francesco was very knowledgeable and had a good answer for every question asked, no matter how difficult they seemed. Recommended!

Prague at Night. Delightful tour. Highlight of a ten day river cruise. Strongly recommend the night time tour. Francisco was a knowledgeable and insightful guide. Also, arrived early and they recommended an excellent and reasonably priced Czech restaurant. Great experience at a very reasonable price.

Very good, but itinerary lacks small of the beaten track stops. Our guide was a lovely Mexican lady, who knew how to tell us about quintessential Prague. I felt as if I knew something about this beautiful city. I also felt very safe and all question I asked were answered with great extent.However, in similar tours in other cities itinerary always had something cool to share, something tourists would not be able to find out. Hence, I am giving this tour 4 not 5 stars as I was hoping for a moment where I go "wow, I got to go there".
Perfect!. Perfect way to discover the city. Thanks to Harris, he was an excellent guide! Audio was a great advantage!
Beer Garden Tour. My husband and I had a wonderful time on the Beer Garden Tour. Our guide "Travis" went above and beyond to make our experience unforgettable. We highly recommend this tour!!

Wonderful bike ride through the country side. Francisco was an amazing guide, had lots of fun facts throughout the ride and did a good job giving a tour of the castle.As a cavaet, it's definitely a tough ride, very flat but over 3 hours long. The whole way is absolutely beautiful so if you are in good enough shape I would recommend it!

Very enjoyable--fun and educational!. Vasek was my guide, and he did such an amazing job. It was a rainy afternoon, and I was the only guest for the 2:30 tour. It didn't matter; he took me to all the sites and gave me such a great history lesson on the major areas, buildings, and events in Prague. I learned so much and am now interested in doing a little more research on events (like the Mendelssohn on the roof story). The Classic City Tour is a really great way to get oriented to the four main areas of Prague and see the beautiful architecture. You will be treated very kindly and professionally by the staff--Vasek was willing to answer all my questions.

Wonderful way to see the city. We booked a Big All-in-One bike tour for our first day in Prague. Everything met or exceeded our expectations. Our guide, Jana, was just lovely, enthusiastic, knowledgeable and organised. We covered so much. In the morning we went around part of the old town and down the river as far as Vysehrad, then back to base. We had lunch at Maitrea, a great vegetarian restaurant that Jana picked for us (just what we wanted), and in the afternoon we went north along the river then across to Letna Gardens and the Castle area. The biking was on bike paths, lanes, ramparts and roads, a bit bumpy because of the cobbles, but the bikes had fat tyres and were well suited to this. It was mostly flat with a few hills which were quite manageable with the gears. Some of the stops had wonderful views of the city. Jana gave us lots of information and told us what to expect. Ondrej at the base was helpful and let us change there and store our luggage. Highly recommended.

Best way to see Prague!. We were in Prague on a Contiki tour so we had 40 people on our tour. They divided us in 3 groups to see the city. I was lucky enough to get Sasha (male- since they also have a Sasha female guide too!) He was great at getting us all set on bike and ready for the tour.The tour was about 2 hours which was perfect with the cabble stones... butt didn't hurt too bad. Sasha kept the pace comfortable and mostly flat so enjoyable ride. We got to see so much of the city and was definitely my highlight to Prague. Anyone visiting the city must do and especially with Sasha. Had a great time!Sasha- thank you so much! You made our stsy in Prague fantastic!

"breath-taking views of the city". We took the Panoramic Tour with our guide, Sasha. He picked us up at our hotel and got us set-up with bikes and helmets. We biked on cobblestone streets, crossed bridges, and were introduced to one of the most beautiful cities in the world. We had an amazing and surreal downhill ride through the castle complex. Sasha was very thoughtful, knowledgeable and patiently answered everyone's questions. (My son became very nausea on the tour and Sasha was sincerely concerned and helpful).
Amazing way to see the city. Rented a bike to go on a trip by the river and up to St. Vilnus church. It was a great way to see the city and the staff help us to understand where to go.
Great Day. Fantastic tour of Prague, Sasha our tour guide showed an astounding depth of knowledge about the city. Never a dull moment. Would highly recommend this tour.

Karlstejn tour . Great tour if you want to get out of the city and enjoy a nice bike ride with some amazing views. Nick was an awesome guide amd had answers for all of our questions. You must do it if you have the time.

Dont miss it. It's highly recommend, we took 3.5 hours beer garden tour, very good experience to see another life in Prague, riding along river, garden, seeing panoramic view.Tour guy named Jirka, very nice, helpful, consideration, knowledgeable, with excellent service, L I K E!

Highly recommend. I looked into bike tours as I was only in Prague for two night and I guessed this would be the best way for me to see the best sights. I was not wrong, I ended up booking a beer gardens tour around the parks of Prague. This was truely amazing! The sight seeing was next to no other, Francesco our tour guide was extremely friendly / knowledgeable and the beer was tops!This was. 3.5 hour tour which was not strenuous at all. Just don't have too much beer!

Couldn't recommend high enough!!. Loved every second of this tour! Our guide was amazing, so friendly and knew so much about the city and each site we went to. We saw so much of the city as well in a short time, which was good as we are only spending two days here, and we would have never have seen as much on foot and not have received all the amazing facts about each monument if we tried to do it alone! Could not recommend these tours high enough! A must do!!
praha bike. it was amazing and we really enjoyed it. it was fun and we were riding for like 20 minutes and we went to the river and it was really nice u should ride it cause its the best

Excellent guide, wonderful way to see the city, worthwhile investing time and money. After this trip I realized that the best way to explore a city is not by tourist buses and group tours but bicycles where you actually go where you want to at your own pace. Got to try the amazing Czech beer, Czech local food with advise from Vasek, our excellent cycling guide and friend. He was extremely friendly and since we were a little slow, he did not mind spending an extra hour with us. Absolutely refreshing trip!!!

Rental bicycle. Praha Bike is a very nice comany. We rent bikes for cycle from Decin to Prague. Every contact by mail was perfekt, they are very service-minded. They booked train tickets for us and the bikes. I strongly recommend Praha Bikes if you want to rent bikes i Czech. Thore from Sweden

Best part of our trip. This was the highlight of our trip. Our guide Sasha was excellent, nothing was too much trouble, he really made the afternoon for us. I don't know what the other guides are like but they cant have been as good as Sasha. I would definitely recommend Praha Bike.

Fun day out in Prague!. I highly recommend doing this bike tour of Prague - 2 hours flew by, we saw loads and our guide, 'Travis', was so well informed and interesting - I learned so much from him about the city. A bike tour is a great way to see a city, and this is an excellent one to choose. Thumbs up!!

Bike Tour to Karlstejn Castle. We were a group of five colleagues who booked this trip a few days in advance, our guide Nick was an American who had studied histoie and geography.He was very clever, nice and helpful. I would recommend Nick as a guide on this trip. Lunch near Karlstejn and train fare back was included. Lunch was at a wonderful restaurant with yummy food from the kitchen or outside grill.

We loved it so much that we took 3 tours in a week!. My wife and I took our first bike tour of the city to determine which sites we would like to see during our stay. Vasek, a political science student at the local prestigious Charles University spoke near-perfect English. His knowledge of the city was impressive. We enjoyed the tour so much that we took a second tour the next day. Our second tour guide was Travis, an American living in Prague. Again, this tour was delightful and provoked us to take a full day tour to the city of Karjlstein. My wife and I used electric bikes on this tour only, which were a joy because we could stop peddling and use electric power whenever we were fatigued or lazy. Our guide, Nick, like his colleagues was fantastic. The manager of Praha bikes, Andre, knows how to treat customers well. Discounts are given for repeat customers.

A fantastic trip into the Czech countryside. Ask for Nick for this tour!. My new wife and I enjoy lengthy bike rides to see the cities transition to the country for the perspective. The day trip to the Karlstejn Castle definitely fit the bill. We were led by a very affable and eager-to-please Nick and were joined by one other couple from Germany. Nick is also one of the two mechanics so there was no fear in any bike issue as we had 20 miles ahead of us (in fact he made some key adjustments to a fellow riders bike). The bike ride was long but never arduous and provided many scenic views including red poppy flowered fields and cute rivers. We had informational stops as well as a beer stop and lunch at an incredibly excellent lodge. I found my meal to be one of the best of our Prague trip. Besides being a guide/mechanic, Massachusetts-raised Nick is a history teacher so his enthusiasm for the experience was very evident. His aim was to please offering whatever information he could. We enjoyed getting to know him. The tour paid for our beer stop as well as our train tickets back into the city. It is a lengthy ride with some large hills so first-time cyclists be warned.

Great tour with Sacha! Tour shows you almost everything there is to see!. Great tour with Sacha! It was a lot of fun and our guide Sacha had great knowledge of the city and its many anecdotes! The tour takes you everywhere!

The best day ever!!!. When booking always ask for Sasha. This tour was really good value for money and is not only great for adults but also family friendly. Sasha's local knowledge is second to none. Don't leave without going on this tour.

Great tour. We (four adults and two children) took the city tour with Vacek (tour guide) and had a wonderful time. As a local, Vacek knew a lot about the city and was able to take a large group of cyclists through the city with ease. The riding was not difficult at all, despite lots of cobble stoned areas, and breaks were frequent to catch up on some local sites, history and drinks. Highly recommended way to see this wonderful city!

Fun ride. Travis and Praha Bike offer a fun way to see the highlights of Prague in under a few hours. Relaxed and comprehensive, it is a good way to start your visit in this beautiful city. From all of the main points of interest, to an interesting look at the work of sculptor David Černý, the only missing piece is another hour or two to take in more sights. Be sure to ask Travis about the local beers, he's something of a beer sommelier.

Customized eBike tours by the river, to a Chateaux and up to Petrin Tower .. thru some lovely parks. My family had a great time. it was a lovely day, a trifle hot perhaps but the cool breeze in the parks helped. Our guide, Sasha, was wonderful. very knowledgable and helpful. Would strongly recommend to all who would like to explore the city beyond the obvious .. the views from Petrin of Prague are amazing.

Beautiful!! City, Experience & Guide!. I visited Prague with a group of girls for a birthday and had no expectations as I'd never really considered going before. The bike ride was suggested and I happily went with it. Well, what a great way to see a beautiful, picturesque city!!! From the cobbled streets to a stunning lush green park and amazing views! I highly recommend!! We all also fell in love with our tour guide, Sasha. Not only was he was patient, caring and full of knowledge, he was also very easy on the eye!!! The bikes were motorised so don't be put off if it sounds too taxing... it wasn't !!! DO IT!!

Electric Bikes. I'm just back from a weekend in Prague and have to say the highlight of my weekend was the half day tour that I took with four of my friends on electric bikes. The tour guide Sasha made it most enjoyable with his easy, relaxed but most professional attitude and great knowledge of the area. I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Prague. We covered so much in half a day and really got a feel for this beautiful city.

Our guide Travis was incredible!. Would highly recommend Praha bike tours to anyone! The electric bikes were fun, the price was reasonable and the service was impeccable. Our guide Travis was amazing. Very relaxed as well as being extremely knowledgeable. Will be holding all future tours to this standard. Thankyou again Travis!

Awesome bike tour. We booked e-bike tour. Luckily there were no other bookings for the tour and the tour went ahead with just two of us and our guide - SASHA. He was awesome - had good knowledge and was very polite. Had a really fun time with him. We ended up with probably one of the best part of our tour and a friend.

Fantastic bike tour. Great and fun way to see some of the more unusual sights of Prague, our guide Travis gave us a lot of informative and very interesting information. The route was easy to navigate and stops were great. Would highly recommend this tour.
Thanks Francesco. Super informative bike tour, without overwhelming me with too much information. We opted for the 6.5 tour and really hit the whole city. Francesco was a delightful guide.

Parha Bike City tour. Nice way to see the highlights and learn the historical insider information. The route was very easy to navigate. Our guide Travis was very informative and stopped and all the major spots. Very friendly guide and we never felt rushed through the whole tour.

Stellar bike tour of Prague!. While on a study abroad tour of Europe, in Prague my group and I had the chance to see Prague in an intimate, personal way: on bikes! The staff at Praha Bike Rentals was great and our tour guide, Travis, was the best! He took us to all of the main attractions in Prague: the Charles Bridge, Old Town Square, and showed us many of the works of the infamous Czech artist, David Černý, that can be found around the city. Travis was very knoledgable about the city and had answers to every question we had. Thanks, Travis and Praha Bike Tours!

Great intro to city . Every time we visit a city we try and do a bike tour on our first day to get a feel for places we might want to see in more detail and to meet people . We did the big city tour with francesco as our guide . This is a great tour , it was only when we walked through the city the next day that we realised how clever Francesco was in guiding us around and avoiding the crowds . We saw just about every area you should see in Prague on a visit and had a delicious lunch with a lovely group of Americans /Irish and English . Francesco gave us just the right amount of history and architecture and ably led us around the narrow streets . One of the best bike tours we have done thank you .
Great Way to See Budapest. George was a great guide who truly knew his Hungarian history and enjoyed sharing it with us as we biked through Budapest. Wonderful tour and great tour guide!!!

Fantastic evening tour!. We booked this last minute to take advantage of a beautiful night in Prague. Francesco was fantastic! Bikes were great and all safety checked before we left. Our tour took about 2.5 hrs and covered all the highlights-Old Town, New Town, Mala Strana, Jewish Quarter-with a number of stops for photos and interesting historical, architectural and legend stories. A great way to see the city, avoid the crowds, catch Charles Bridge at sunset while getting your bearings for future exploration.Highly recommend and really a great way to get out enjoy the city.

Grat day trip to Karlstejn castle. We had a great day trip to Karlstejn castle, leaving Prague by bicycle and travelling home by train. The bicycles were in perfect condition, our tour guide Sasha was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed it a lot and can recommend it.

Great tour with friendly Jirka who knows Prague!. The classic tour brings you the highlights of Prague in 2,5 hours. Jirka, our tourguide, steered us through traffic and told us interessting things. The highlight of the tour was the stop halfway, coffee, tea, beer from a small brewery and a nice conversation with our fellowtravellers and Jirka.
River by Bike. Wow , what an amazing experience .Cycle along the river , feed the swans ans top off for a beer on the river bank or a coffee .Drinking and driving is not allowed

Great tour with Vashek. Thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Vashek last week in Prague. As a political science student Vashek is a mine of information on the city and its institutions - and is equally passionate about sharing his love for the city. The bike was truly a great way to see the city at a leisurely pace and enjoy the weather and sights.Thanks Vashek !David & Fiona
Good friendly service. Rented the bike late in the afternoon, paid for 24 hours but actually got about 4 hours free as they let us keep them until close of business the following day.

Just Do It :). Like to be a little active after fantastic lunches and dinners in Prague? Book your day tour here and you will get to escape the sometimes crowded Prague and get to see the beautiful scenic countryside outside the city. Thanks Sasha for your friendly and informative guidance!

The most unique way to see Prague and the Czech countryside!!!. We took the 25 mile bike ride from Prague to Karlstein Castle. Our guide, Sasha, was incredible! He took care getting us through the busy streets of Prague then allowed the group to travel to Karlstein at their own pace. I don't know how he kept up with everyone as it was a decent sized group with varying biking experience but he did it!! He knew his history and interesting facts. We thoroughly enjoyed the trip and would advise it for anyone in reasonable shape!

Awesome bike tour.. We had a blast on our bike tour. We were able to see so much in a short amount of time. The things our guide Sasha took us to see were great. Our daughter even put her art on the John Lennon wall.

Bike Tour to Karlstejn Castle. The team at Praha Bike was very friendly and professional. Bikes were in excellent condition and they checked them thoroughly before we left. We were only 3 in the tour in addition to our guide Francesco. He was very knowledgeable about Prague and Karlstejn and we had a great time riding with him. 90% of the ride is on bike paths along the Vltava and Berounka rivers, which makes it so enjoyable. I actually wouldn't have minded coming back to Prague the same way!I recommend taking the 50-min tour inside the castle, which was very informative. Keep in mind the castle was not used primarily as a residence but as a fortress (to protect the crown jewels of the Czech kingdom and the Holy Roman Empire), so you won't find inside the kind of lavish decoration and furniture that you see in other famous Czech castles (Hluboka, Cesky Krumlov).We came back to Prague by train and had a final short ride in from the train station to Praha Bike's office. Highly recommended!

City Cycling Tour with Vasek. Best way to introduce an outsider to Prague. Our local guide Visak was a highly informative and passionate guide. Who as a local, knew everything there is to know about Prague. I highly recommend Vasek and his guided tour.
