Bike Rental. Rented two mountain bikes, but wanted to try out a tandem first! Went badly but all in good spirits. Great prices, great and friendly staff who suggested great cycle paths and things to do and see later and during the ride. Highly recommend this to anyone visiting Prague

Excellent E-Bike Tour. My girlfriend and I booked the e-bike tour and Francesco was our tour guide. We had a very enjoyable time, the tour was great - it highlighted all of the city's history and Francesco did an excellent job explaining the significance behind each building. It was our first time using an e-bike and we loved them! They are perfect for travelling all across the city. We highly recommend.
2 hours in praha center. Another way to discover this noce city.i strongly recommand sasha as a guide. He was very good and speaking a perfect english.

Bike trip to Karlstejn Castle. Beautiful countryside from Prague to the Castle. Sasha was an accommodating guide allowing faster cyclers to ride ahead to a designated checkpoint while accompanying slower riders. Hope to return for a longer bike trip with Sasha as our guide!

Classic City bike tour. We really enjoyed the Praha 'classic city' bike tour, with our guide- Jirka, who was excellent. His knowledge on Prague was fantastic, it was great to get the history behind the beautiful buildings and monuments of the city. All in all, a very interesting and fun way to spend a morning or afternoon in Prague! Highly recommended. Sophie and Simon

Great way to see Prague. The bike tour is a great way to see the city. Jana was very informative and took us to see many interesting sites in a short period of time! The artwork and Jana's information about the art were the highlight of the tour for me!

Bike tour From Prague to Karstejn Castle. I spent the today on a fantastic bike tour from Prague to Karlstejn Castle. The guide, Francesco was friendly, very knowledgeable and always looking out for our safety. The trip followed some roads, but about 90% on bike trails. It was a great way to see the Czech countryside outside of the city. It took a leisurely 3 hours or so to get there and we returned by train, which was comfortable and included in the price. Bike was well maintained, comfortable and worked great. Castle was definitely worth the trip. If you like to bike and have a free day this will be the best 1,140 crowns you'll spend.

Awesome Tour!. We had an amazing trip -- all thanks to Vasek! Biking through Prague allowed us to see the city efficiently -- and from a "different" perspective. Vasek was enthusiastic, informative and personable. He encouraged questions and injected humor along the way. We would absolutely recommend Praha Bicycle Tours!

Thanks Jirka. This was an excellent tour. We really enjoyed our guide Jirka's enthusiastic and informative guide. Highlights were the various art pieces around the city and the John Lennon wall.I highly recommend this to anyone

Thanks Sasha!. Eventhough the weather wasn't the nicest, Sasha made our bike tour very interesting and fun. He knew a lot of things about Prague's history, nice stories about the old times, we saw very cool pieces of art and he guided us safely amongst the traffic. Thanks Sasha, you were super!

Bike tour excellence. Yes, take it. It really was worth it! Sasha gave us an excellent tour around the Prague city by bikes! Bikes were actually very comfortable and also the other personel very friendly. We rented the same bikes for another day and it was a good choice.

Excellent tour - excellent knowledgeable guide. We really enjoyed this bike tour. Andrew our guide was fantastic and went above and beyond our expectations. We learned so much about Prague. Very friendly, excellent English, customized our tour as we were very interested in History. The bikes are comfortable and we highly recommend this company.

Francisco's fantasic tour. It didn't look like nice day but this tour and our guideways excellent and really lifted the day. Pre flight checks include checking you are ok with the bike and the bike is ok with you. Don't worry if youdont do much cycling normally this is a leisurely and informative tour and much easier than walking. We we're d carefully around many parts of Prague and invited to ask questions at any point. Highly recommended activity and tour guide.
Great experience with Sasha a guide is recommended. We have a very great time with the electrical bike and with Sasha a guide four hours tour in the city of Prague parks town city and bridges

Great Bike Tour in Praha. I spent a great afternoon seeing the sites the way they should be seen - leisurely, no stress, and comprehensively. My guide was Vasek, and he was an excellent source of information about the city, as well as other insights into politics and history. I would highly recommend this tour (and him) when you first get there so you can get a feel for the layout of the city, and decide where you want to spend more time. The tour encompassed both sides of the river, so we really covered a reasonable amount of space, without being overly taxing.Don't worry about the biking itself - good pace, very few issues with traffic, and the bike was a sturdy, off-road bike that easily handled cobblestones and trolley tracks.

Superb company, very easy to deal with and great bikes. What a great company. The bikes were basic but very well maintained and worked fine. Tyres were pumped, brakes worked, gears were indexed properly with smooth and easy shifting. Even though we were off-season they still organised a guided tour of their longer day ride out to Klarstejn Castle. Our guide Sasha was brilliant. Very friendly and spoke excellent English. He made us all feel relaxed and soon it was like riding with a friend. The lunch stop was at a great local restaurant. Good quality and great value food. There was just 3 of us on the tour and we made good time, so Sasha was happy to ride back to Prague rather than take the train. He varied the route a little on the way back and we rode about 70km in total. It was nice to see the country side and the sights out of the city. I would thoroughly recommend this company.

Friendly enthusiast. Those experts of cycling from Praha Bike has provided most comfortable and professional services with their enthusiasm I ever experienced. A little care even leads big surprise while they prepared us marker pens to paint graffiti onto John Lennon Wall. What a brilliant cycling tour! Ondrej is the guy!

Best activity to do first. My wife and I jumped straight into this activity after just flying into Prague. Sasha, our tour guide, was our tour guid,e and we couldn't have asked for anything more. He had such great and honest details of the culture, historical sites, and places to eat. We would totally recommend this to everyone that comes and visits. This attraction is the easiest and fastest way to see the city. It is great to get an overview and then go back to anything needed. Sasha was also very patient and gave us details of where to eat for the local cuisine.

Great way to start our Prague trip. Me and my friend booked in for a tour on the first day of our trip. Nobody else was booked (off peak, on a Tuesday AM) so we had a private excursion!Travis was an amazing guide. We visited a lot of historical places and had plenty of time to ask questions. We even stopped for a beer at lunch, and Travis gave us lots of great recommendations for our trip (most of which we followed up)!I highly recommend this tour for anyone- the route was easy and fun, and we got a lot out of it.Thanks Travis!
Great tour!. We had a great time on our tour today with Vasek! He was very knowledgeable about the city and sites we saw. Couldn't think of a better way to see this beautiful city!

Best way to see the city. So I'll start off by saying- I don't know how to ride a bike and I booked the activity for a large group thinking I would be unable to join them. However, our guide Sasha was extremely friendly and suggested that I go on a tandem bike with him- so I actually got to ride a bike for the first time and it was an amazing experience. Sasha was very knowledgeable about the city and made sure everyone was able to keep up. He also took us out for a cheap & delicious lunch at a local place afterwards. Overall, the staff at the tour office were very friendly and experienced, and had great customer service. I would definitely recommend this, as it's much better than a walking tour- 10/10

Fabulous bike tour with Sasha. Sasha provided an enthralling tour of the old town in Prague. He was extremely knowledgeable about the various architectural marvels we passed and even guided us to a homely tucked in diner later on

Very down to earth. Did the bike tour 14 March. I had a bike tour with another company (city bikes) but they no longer did the 4:30 tour. However, Sasha and Travis were able to make my experience in Praha awesome by accepting me at the last minute and doing a bike tour. Travis was excellent and knew the city very well. I'm glad they were both able to accommodate a short notice request. Next time I'm in Praha I will defiantly do another bike tour with this company.

The most beautiful city in the world!. Praha bike tour by Sasha today was fantastic. Best way to see the city. The cobble stones are fun to ride on and our guide knew everything there is toknow about Pragues history, culture, food, architecture, art, music everything! We highly recommend this tour! Thanks again!
Wonderful Experience . We do bike tours in every city we bist and Parha Bikes didn't disappoint! Saša was our guide. He was very knowledgable and funny! I highly recommend him for future tours!

Great way to see the city. Me and my girlfriend had a great day today on this tour. It was our first full day in Prague and it was a great way to see the sites and get to know the city.We did the classic city tour, which is done at a nice pace with many stops. Our guides name was Travis and he was very friendly and knowledgeable! I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting the city!

Excellent guide - Nazar. Did the One-Day Guided Bike tour to Karlstejn Castle ( http://www.prahabike.cz/en/news/karlstejn-bike-tour.html) I do not recommend for anyone who is not used to cycling and I definitely suggest that you wear good biking shorts. The ride itself was not hard at all but the ride is well over 1 hr so the butt will get sore without the padding! Stopped at a pub situated along the route for a beer part way thru the ride there - was a great little break and the beer was excellent! We also had lunch before walking UP to the castle. The restaurant that our guide chose was not fancy but the food was excellent, authentic and not expensive.Our guide Nazar was excellent, he was super pleasant, didn't rush the group and made my experience wonderful!

Challenging . Nice way to see city's most beautiful parts and view. Suits for people who like biking and traveling with no any guide. Praha Bike's service is great, they gave us a city's map and advises for places to go to. Moreover, bicycles quality was high; good enough for tracks!

Travis ROCKS!. Me and my guests had an amazing time with Travis, learning the history of Prague, the politics, art and enjoying the beer. It was an amazing time and one I would fully recommend to anyone wanting to get a taste of such a rich region.

Nice tour and nice guide. This tour was pretty fun, Sasha was a great guide and knew little interesting details of the sites, restaurants, bars, and other nice places to visit. Also,since it was very cold the staff let me borrow gloves :0)...overall nice guide and nice tour.

Great Tour and great way to see Prague. Having seen previous reviews on trip advisor we decided this was the bike tour company for us. We had an excellent guide Sasha who as well as being very knowledgeable along the way he gave us great advise on pubs and restaurants to visit while in Prague. Would definitely recommend this company and a bike tour is a great way to see Prague.

bike tour: guide sasha :). Great tour : sights and company. the company we booked the tour through hadn't informed sasa our arrival but he was very obliging.the craic was good and perhaps we will visit again soonash and annie

Nice way to see the city. We rented bikes following advice from other Trip Advisor reviews. We used the Tripadvisor app with the sat nav to find the shop as it's a little bit out of the way. Good price for bikes, friendly staff who provided maps and advice, and also recommended an amazing vegetarian restaurant. Would recommend.
Great 2 hours off the beaten track. great tour of Prague with professional guide Yana who shared many annecdotes and showed us many hidden gems and many reocs. Thumbs up

Sasha N0. 1 tour guide!. I thought that the bike ride was the highlight of my trip, Sasha was knowledgable, friendly, interesting an most importantly concise, it was great value for money and I would highly recommend it! Thanks Sasha

A great way to see Prague. I turned up on a weekday and was the only person there... But there was no problem, Sasha tailored the tour to where I wanted to go and what I wanted to see. The sights were interesting and the Sasha knew what he was talking about. In a city full of tours of varying quality, this is one well worth taking.

We love Sasha!. We were a group of 14 wanting to see the sites of Prague easily as we were such a big group so the classic city tour was perfect for us! I booked our tour the week before by email and put a deposit down of around £50 via PayPal which was very easy to do and convenient. Our tour guide Sasha was very attentive with our bikes making sure we were all OK before we set off. He also knew a lot of fun facts and places that we wouldn't see if we went around Prague ourselves, and took us to a really nice pub which sold yummy cake! Also at the end of our tour he pointed out loads of restaurants and bars he would recommend on a map for us to visit for the rest of our trip which was very helpful! Great value for money would highly recommend!

The best way to see the Old Town.. At the beginning I was not so confident because I was a couple of years without ride a bike. However, after the 5 first minutes the tour became completely enjoyable. Our guide was a lovely girl who I unfortunately don't remenber the name :-(Her explanations about the landmarks were detailed and clear and she made us feel very confident and safe during the tour.An unmissable experience for me!

Amazing Bike tour. Great way to see the city in all its glory...We had a super friendly tour guide Sasha who went above and beyond to help us enjoy the city so for that we can recommend this tour highly!Thank you again for making Kims hen do fantastic Christina

A great way to discover Prague . Had a great time today. The bike tour was well paced and a good way to get to know the city. Sasha, our guide, was really friendly and well informed. He gave us a lot of great tips at the end. Highly recommended!!!15-11-2014

Definitely recommend. An excellent way to see Prague. As a large group with limited time we were offered a private tour for an hour and it was well worth the money. Sasha was our tour guide and he catered it to suit us, as many of us had been on bikes for many years. A really enjoyable activity and would definitely recommend.

Covering a lot of ground. If you don't have much time to spend in Prague and want to see a big part of it all at once, this is the tour!As I was lucky enough to be the only one on the tour, my guide Sasha decided to alter the route for me and to go to the places I haven't been to yet! I'm a slow rider and Sasha was very patient especially with uphill and downhill rides. He had a lot of knowledge of the city and knew a lot about the Czech artists which was great for me as an art lover! He also recommended me places to go even after the tour, places I would perhaps had never been able to find as a tourist.All in all, it's a great tour! I highly recommend it! It's a must, as Prague is a beautiful city to cycle in.

Lovely way to spend a few hours!. Our guide Sasha was a lovely friendly guy. He goes at a very easy relaxed pace. My only criticism would be that we didn't go to the castle area and we could have stopped at a few more sites but it was sufficient and not at all boring. We went to lunch afterwards with Sasha to a traditional czech restaurant which was lovely and very cheap. This was not part of the tour. It was Sasha just being very hospitable inviting is to join him. I would definitely recommend this tour as it's an easy enjoyable way to get around most of the city and find out other places of interest which you can explore at another time.

Great tour of the City. Did the bike tour recently with six friends. This a great way to see a number of the sights in this wonderful City. The ride is very easy with plenty of stops and a pretty flat terrain. Our guide was Sasha and he had tremendous knowledge of Prague - very good English - and had some very amusing stories on the history of the City. Thoroughly recommend the bike tour and thanks to Sasha for a very enjoyable couple of hours.

Fantastic way to spend a few hours. Our guide Travis took us on a leisurely and easy ride around the Old Town and over the bridge along the river stopping along the way to tell us little stories about the different sights and the history. It was informative and interesting without going on and boring us. We had a lovely group of about 8 people and it was a really great way to spend a few hours. I'm not a bike rider as such but I felt safe on the roads we took and Travis made sure everyone enjoyed their ride. Thanks Heaps Travis you were great!

Great bike ride. Despite cycling on the wettest day of the year, I thoroughly enjoyed the guided tour with Oliver. Best part was getting away from the touristic areas to benefit from local knowledge. Really enjoyed the beer on route. Flat and easy ride. Actually worked out as the most expensive aspect of my holiday, but I would do it again. A's fan.

Best way to cover the entire city in one day. We booked a private bike tour for a group of 10 people and Sasha did an excellent job as a tour guide. He is very knowledgeable and kept the group moving at a decent pace. The tour took us approximately 7 hours because some of us were tired and were slow. Sasha did take care of everybody. He took us to the places we wanted to go telling us everything about the history. He also took us to a local restaurant and also offered to take us for a drink.I would really suggest this to anybody who are on a time crunch and the price is also very reasonable.

Excellent bike tour. We did the 6 hour bike tour with our guide Sasha, who turned out to be a very pleasant young man, with a lot of knowledge about the sites we passed. He took plenty of time to explain the various buildings and site in the city.We can really recommend this tour which is ideal way to see more of the city.

Dehydrated and loooong. We took the tour out to the castle and I found the description of the tour to be VERY misleading. It made it seem as if this was a leisurely tour with stops along the way. Fun right? No. We were given one little bottle of water for a 20+ mile ride. The ONE stop was at a beer garden-ish. Our guide told us to get a bite to eat "if we wanted" but this wasn't lunch. If we hadn't had something to eat, I would have fallen over from the heat and pure exhaustion. Then you get to the castle and have to hike up hill. This tour felt like fat camp vs. a leisurely ride in the country. A few suggestions for Praha tours:1: Provide ample water or inform guests to bring it.2: Accurately describe this tour. We would have enjoyed it if we knew that this was an athletic ride. I have plenty of pairs of bike shorts. I would have brought them had the tour been correctly described.3: Provide some granola bars or something.4: Give everyone a cheap photo copied map of the route in case you get separated. Two people in our group got completely separated from the group - we lost them for HOURS. And at one point my two travel partners and I were separated for about 15-20 minutes until our guide realized we had been left behind.5: If someone says they can't ride a regular bike and need a hybrid (electric bike), just tell them to take another tour. This is not for them.

Great Trip. Guide Travis is awesome!. We just took the small tour thorugh the inner city and it was d blast. Our guide, Travis, was great, and getting to know the city by bike is da totally different and great opportunity. Thanks!

Awesome. Great fun! Our knowledgeable and wonderful guide, Sasha, expertly maneuvered our group of 12 through the pumping streets of Praha. We chose the 2.5-3 hour inner city tour which took us to amazing places (Opera House, National Gallery, John Lennon wall, Kafka museum, the Fred & Ginger Dancing building, the giant babies outside the Museum of Modern Art, etc.). We rode across bridges to quieter areas and along the river. We stopped halfway through for a short break to grab a coffee, tea, beer and visit the loo. The bikes were in great shape and were equipped to handle the cobble stones very well, plus there was a bike tech bringing up the rear and fixing seats along the way. Great guide, great tour!

A lovely way to see the city. Our guide, Travis. He is a gem - this is not a job to him, it's a passion. We did this tour on the first morning of our stay, it was a great way to get some orientation and some gentle exercise. Don't be nervous of joining the Classic City Tour if you can't even remember the last time you rode - it really is a very relaxed pace & the bikes very comfortable.Travis could not have been more helpful in answering our questions and giving us tips on places to visit and dine, he even marked up a map for me (thanks!).

prague bikes. We had a great experience in prague with Praha Bike. The service is good (thanks Alexandra!) And the bikes are in good shape. By bike you realy see the city and its beauty in another way.

Fantastic trip around Prague Old Town and environs. We went on a 2.5 hour bike tour around old town with Travis who was a tremendous guide. He gave us some historical facts about the city, his own personal preferences, and showed some art works by David Cerny. We had (with another company) been around Prague Castle which was incredibly dry, we both wished we had gone on a bike tour with Travis - I reckon we would have had a much better time.

Classic biKe tour. We were 7 Italian friends. We had a two and a half hour bike tour with the amazing and competent Italian guide Elisa, but she spoke (perfectly) English because we were together with other Indian guys. The tour is easy and interesting and you stop by several sights of which Elisa explains you history and gossips about. Best green way to See the city.

Best Way to enjoy The town with Elisa. You have to visit The town with Her because She is very amazing And Can give You some tips And curiosities that you 'll never find in a book guide. Praga by Bike is very exciting.

Excellent bike tour to Karlstejn Castle. This was a full day tour from Prague through the countryside to the stunning Karlstejn Castle. You start at the city centre bike hub where you are allocated a very comfortable bike in good condition and plenty of gears. We had Jana as our guide.Then started the tour and you have to cycle out of the city. This is when I must warn others that you need to be proficient on a bike and be capable of changing gears. You initially have to cycle through city traffic and trams before you reach the river paths. Even then while the route is generally flat, there are inclines and short hills and the pace was comfortable but certainly faster than slow. A couple of our group did not meet these criteria and struggled.Once we were out of the city, the tour is along river paths and occasional village streets. The views are lovely but don't expect to cycle past historic monuments and places of interest. We stopped for a morning coffee or beer approximately halfway (your expense). We also had lunch in the village of Karlstejn which was excellent (also your expense) before walking up to the castle. That is when you discover that the interior is not really worth seeing, it is all about the impressive view of its exterior. So don't bother paying the entrance fee. That said, Jana took us around the free parts within the castle walls and admired the views back to the village below.Then you catch the train back to Prague (ticket is included in the tour price) for another cycle through the streets of Prague back to base. We got back at around 5.30pmOverall I loved this trip and would recommend it to anyone who knows how to truely cycle a bike. However, I'm not sure if the two ladies at the back of the group who struggled to keep up and cycle their bike would agree.

AMAZING Bike Tour with Sasha!!. I've done bike tours in a few places and have been very happy with all of them, but Sasha's tour was truly terrific. We were scheduled to do the Classic City Tour, but because there were only two of us, Sasha offered to take us on a hybrid of that tour and the Panoramic tour. Though there were a couple of steep hills, the views were worth it, and Sasha used the views masterfully to point out things in the city that we would not otherwise have seen on a short stay. He also had great information and fun facts about each stop, included the Prague Castle, TV Tower, and the Metronome. Would definitely do another tour again with Praha Bike - many thanks to Sasha for an outstanding job!

Great tour, great stories. This summer me and a friend did the Praha Bike tour, led by Travis. It was fun to tour around the city by bicycle. Travis did a great job, he had great stories to tell that we hadn't heard before. Defenitely a recommendation from our side!

Great Bike tour, really enjoyed it.. A large group of us on a business trip did a 6 hour tour. We saw so much of Prague and really enjoyed it. Very worthwhile and informative. Sasha was our guide and did a fantastic job, He was very knowledgeable and kept our group moving, we all had a lot of fun with him, and he fit in like one of us. He took us to a great small local restaurant. One of the best events I did on this trip. Will rethink bike tours on other vacations, as I have never taken one before. btw, the e-bike is worth the upgrade price. easily does 6 hours and used it to assist others up the hills on occasion.

THE best time!. My husband and I did the 3.5 hour bike ride through the back streets and on cycleways whilst enjoying the beautiful views of the river and countryside. Having a few refreshing ales added to the experience. The young American couple who were on our tour were great company. The guide, Vladamir was exceptional: friendly and knowledgeable. Would thoroughly recommend this tour and the company. LOVED it.
Informative and fun!. My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our bike tour. The sights were amazing, our guide Kat was knowledgeable and a lot of fun. We would definitely recommend this tour.

Great bike ride, guide not so great. As a daily bike commuter and avid weekend cyclists, we jumped at the chance to do a 23 mile ride in the country to a castle.We almost booked with another company based on a flyer, but checked out the t.advisor reviews, and with only 11 reviews, and only 2 since 2012, booking with these guys was a no brainer, as all the reviews were as good as it gets.Booking was easy, on line through PayPal.The bikes -were in good working order, comfy seats, water, carriers for all your stuff, 18 or more gears, plenty of rangeThe group-8 in all, of mixed ability, but all totally capableThe ride- basically totally flat, along the river for the most part, very easy ride even for folks who do t ride, great scenery, nice little villages and a spectacular castle at the end, interesting architecture all along the route,Route conditions- mainly paved with a small amount of single track on firm ground through some scrub, small amount of traffic riding in the city, but all in all very good conditions even on the cobble stones. Bikes performed great in all conditionsAt this point I would review the experience as 5 stars, why only 3 stars you may ask. ....?Our guide jana was very nice and pleasent, except very inexperienced.As this was a long ride and not a city tour, we did not expect a blow by blow commentary on every site we passed, from other reviews of this ride the guides gave at least some discriptions.Between prague and the castle we were told the name of the two rivers we crossed only, and nothing at all else!, for real, I mean nothing else at all.My fellow riders thought this a little odd that not even the names of the village's we passed through were not even mentioned, let alone any of the wonderful sites. Most other rides I have been on, at the stops they at least give a brief description of where you are going. So this is really no big deal as we were there to ride. What was most disturbing was the guide never once,looked back to check on her group, this was noticed by all of us, once we realized this was not just a fluke of not seeing her look back at all we started looking out for each other. ! As the path took many turns, some not well marked and the group was spread out at times, and none of us knew the way, the guide would just turn off and if you did not see which way she whent, or see another of the group you were screwed, myself and another rider kept back to make sure the others could see where to go, on at least 2 occasions the turn off was not clear and I'm sure we would have lost a few otherwise.On another occasion on a long straight part I noticed 2 of our party were not in sight so I road back about 1/2 km, and still could not see them, they eventually came into view and had stopped for photos,( as we only stopped once at a pretty crappy, dirty smokey bar), it took us a while to catch up, but it could just as easily been someone had fallen off.By this point our impression of the guides cycling and tour experience was pretty low, and this was confirmed as we watched her attempt to change a flat, which to her credit she managed to do, but to all watching it was clear jana had not changed a bike tire often,( yes the chain needs to around the gears for the bike to work, and the axel needs to fit into the slots on the frame before you tighten the wheel, and it helps if the wheel is centered in the frame so it is not hard up against the frame, but I digress)That said, it was a great ride, but the guide should really look back and make sure they do a head count once in a while, especially after a turn or going through traffic.I would recommend this ride but suggest you check ahead, and see if kat, sasa, or Vladimir are doing the tour to the castle as their reviews are excellent.

Great way to see the city. Loved taking the bike tour last week. It was a perfect way to spend a few hours and learn something about such a beautiful city. Our tour guide, Kat, was both informative and funny and kept everyone moving at a relaxed pace. Can't recommend it all enough!

Awesome time. If you want to explore the streets of central Prague and not afraid of a little leg-work, the bicycle tour is a great activity.You get to go around the town with your family (6 seat bike) and enjoy all the sites with a cold beer in hand.The operator of the bike is very kind and informative (thank you Jacob) and it was a great experience in the city.

Amazing bike tour to know more about this beautiful city. this tour is a good opportunity to know more about this beautiful city, the guide is a local person and knows a lot of information about the most important points of interest of the city and also gives you information about the where to visit and go for food. I did this bike ride tour two weeks ago and despite the weather was not good at the beginning it was an amazing day visiting a lot of interesting sites and enjoying a beautiful afternoon in Prague, very recommendable

Bike ride to Karlstejn Castle. Well-guided ride of about 18 miles to spectacular castle outside of Prague. Friendly and knowledgeable guide sensitive to needs and expectations of clients. We went as a couple, no other riders, so ride really was customized. Highly recommend. Daylong trip covers biking along river path, walking around castle, train ride back to Prague, bike rental. Clients buy their lunches at restaurant with superb castle view.

Praha Bike Tour Review. Me and 7 friends participated in the bicycle tour in September 2014. We were apprehensive to whether it would be worth the effort at first as we had all enjoyed a few to many beers the night before the bike tour! However, the outdoor air, exercise and sheer enjoyment whilst on the tour soon surpassed out hangovers and it was well worth while doing. Our tour guide "Sasha" (apologies if that is a spelling mistake) was fantastic, very knowledgeable, friendly and also funny and welcoming. We were tempted to invite him for a beer with us! After the tour he generously offered to share his local knowledge of good bars, restaurants and sites to see on the remainder of our trip.The tour itself involved very interesting history of the city and opened our eyes to the gloomy political struggle the city has survived over the previous centuries. It showed us great things we would have never otherwise seen or known about and was a brilliant laugh at the same time.The only thing I would have done better would be to go on the tour on the very first day instead of halfway through the trip as we did as it really gives you a scope, knowledge and taste for the city. 10/10

Guide Kat was amazing!. Went on the riverside tour to Troja and it gave us a different view point of Prague and how local people live! Not everything looks like the old town which was fantastic! Guide Kat was fantastic as she was really informative on the gears, what to expect, how to change our gears and set our expectations which this was the first any bike tour has done so thanks Kat and really enjoyed it!
Great tour of Prague. We had a great tour with Sacha around Prague, and we saw many unexpected and beautiful sites. I really enjoyed the artwork and the amazing buildings and history.Do it!!

great experience, thanks Kat and Sasha. My first tour was the classic city tour, there was a group of 12 of us going on the tour , quite a large convoy. However our tour guide Kat kept us all together. Kat was a friendly, lively tour guide, giving a fun interesting narrative along the route. Plenty of time was allowed for pictures and taking in the 12 location stops. After this first tour Kat and the other employees were available or any last minute tips for the rest of your holiday. My second tour was the panoramic and castle tour, this time it was just me and Daniel from montreal being lead by Sasha. Again a friendly lively tour guide, who agreed to slightly alter the route to make it more challenging and see slightly different areas to the classic city tour.I will mention that initially i booked a full day tour however i was the only one booked on and so it was changed to two 2.5 hour tours i was told this one day before, slightly late notice but the tours were still very fun and i would definitely recommend them as a great way to see prague.

Something new!. We are a group of six adults 20 years old and the oldest is 57 years old. Normally we try to visit all the cultural a famous places in the cities, we dont like to spend money on things like this but today was the exeption, and we dont regret about that! It takes around 40 minutes to make the tour and we enjoy it all between laughing, drinking beer during the tour and the beautiful city ... Something new! Is not expensive and you have to try it!

Kat was a great tour guide. my wife and I went biking with Kat in Prague with Praha Bike. Kat was an excellent tour guide and her abilities as a teacher showed through. She made the tour entertaining and a great deal of fun. Many similar tours provide for an endless run of tedious and remote European history and monarchs, whereas Kat made the tour relevant to current events while adding in interesting and important facts about Prague. The bike ride allowed you to cover a lot of ground quickly while remaining close to the people and points of interest. Kat is from the US so her English was excellent and her suggestions for things to see and restaurants were superb. This tour was a highlight of the visit.

Great 2.5 hour tour around a beautiful city!. My friend and I did the Panoramic and Prague Castle Tour, with guide Oliver. There was 3 of us on the tour and Oliver was really informative and adapted the tour to suite our interests. We got to see the well known sights and some interesting hidden statues too. Great tour and lots of fun!

Enjoyable trip with 4 Aussies and an American. Today I went on a Praha Bike Tour with our guide Travis and 4 Australian customers. It was very enjoyable. We started in Dlouha in the old town and visited some very interesting sites that I had previously not covered on several visits to Prague on foot or by bus.Travis is in his first year as a guide and although he does not know everything his passion and enthusiasm means he will learn quickly.The weather today was not great but he supplied rain macs for the riders. It did not rain too heavily during the ride but collectively we did not stop for a break reserving that in case of extreme downpours. this proved to be the correct decision as as soon as the tour concluded it rained heavily.For me the most interesting sites were the David Cerny pieces, the dancing building and Jan Palach Square.Travis certainly knows his history and the information about Jan Palach, Reinhard Heydrich and Jan Hus for me were very interesting.So much better that a walking tour as it is more intimate and you really get good information from the guide

Good way to get an overview at start of trip. Had a really nice morning classic city tour with Elisa. Fairly central office. Good quality bikes in 3 frame sizes which is good. Easy riding & got nice overview of key points. She even had rain macs in case we needed them (light drizzle)

Great bike tour. Wauw what a great tour with guide Vladimir, he knows so much about the town and we came to some great places around town.This was the perfect way to discover Praha!Vladimir knows also allot about great restaurants and food places, don't forget to ask him!
A great way to see Prague!. A very fun and exciting way to explore Prague. Well worth the cost and would recommend to anyone! Big thanks to Travis who was a terrific guide. He won't disappoint you!

Great way to see city highlights. praha offers several differnt tours. we did the mid afternoon city tour. bikes had shocks and were comfortable even on cobblestone. kat was very knowledgeable and helpful, especially when it came to post ride recommendations.

Bike tour. I came with friends of mine from Siberia and to see Prague we decided to rent three bikes. After brief googling we choose Praha Bike. We were first time in the city but decided to not hire any guide and go by our own. Service was just excellent; skilled and communicative Alexandra advised us all most important sightseeing places and carefully mapped them for us. Magnificent Prague is great by bike. I would highly recommend this experience to anybody who wants to actively spend time there.
Thumbs up for Travis. Thumbs up for Travis. Nice guy with broad knowledge of the history of Prague. Highly recommend Praha Bike and Travis as guide. Best, the 9 danes

Excellent bike, friendly service!. I rented a bike to ride to Karlstejn castle. Praha Bike not only rented me the perfect bike for the trip, but also took the time to explain the suggested route and show me the key turns on a map. Highly recommend both the trip and the shop!

3 Beergarden Bike Tour. This was one of many tours offered by Praha Bike and we decided to take this particular tour as it was only 4 hrs in length. This particular bike shop was recommended by Rick Steeves in his 2014 Prague tour book. (My wife is a BIG fan) Our tour guide was Kat, originally from North Carolina and very knowledgeable in the local history, we saw sites that would normally be off the usual tourists guide. Local concert sites, slalom kayaking training area to name a few. We would highly recommend this bike shop as we did require greater detail to access the bike trails out of Prague and they had all the necessary trail maps. I believe it was Andre whom highkighted the best routes for us also.

Panoramic & Prague Castle. This was a great way to see Prague, offering different views and escaping the hustle and bustle. Sasha was our guide, and we couldn't have hoped for anyone better. Prior to the start of the tour he had noticed my fiance, also on the tour, was Bosnian, and as Sasha also speaks the same language, he greeted him in his native tongue, which was a great personal touch. Despite only living in Prague for the last few years he was extremely knowledgeable and took the time to talk to everyone. I haven't ridden a bike in a number of years, and it wasn't as easy to pick up where I left off as I had expected, Sasha was extremely patient with the entire group and took it at a pace to suit everybody. Once we reached the castle complex Sasha took us slightly further up to the Petrin Lookout Tower, which isn't actually part of the tour but we had made good time. The ride down from here was breathtaking, offering more beautiful views of the city. When we were finished with the tour he also offered a few tips on places to eat and drink. Would definitely recommend to anyone, it was one of the highlights of our trip.

Panoramic & Prague Castle city bike tour. Two and a half hours well spent, thoroughly enjoyed it despite not having ridden a bike for over 10 years, the views were fantastic. Our guide Sasha was brilliant, he was everything you could hope for in a tour guide, full of interesting facts, patient, spoke English easily and had a sense of humour. Would definitely do it again.

Booked the big tour - a really nice day filling experience. We had Eliza as our guide and she did not spare any troubles to give us a superb Prague experience. One thing you notice during the tour is the missing bicycle infrastructure, but the city is to blame for that

A great few hours!. We had Travis for our classic city tour and he was awesome, he knew a lot about the city and people were asking questions which he knew all the answers to. I would recommend this bike tour to people who were in Prague for 2-3 days and wanted to see the city and learn a lot about it.

Awesome way to see Prague. My friend and I did a full day bike tour trough Prague whit our great guide Sascha! He showed us around everywhere and had lots of fun facts about the city! Definitely a nice way to see Prague!
Great way to see Prague!. Our guide Cat was very friendly and was informative in a light hearted way!Went to all the main sights and it was an easy ride

Must do!. We had a great tour led by Travis. He was knowledgeable, friendly and made the trip exciting. As we were only in this beautiful city for a few nights, it was an amazing way to see all of the major sights in Prague. We didn't have enough time to join him on the beer garden tour (bummer!) but that would have been next on our list. Travis, we thank you for making our visit to Prague unforgettable! Best wishes from NYC (& Florida), Jenn (& Jenna)

Beer Garden Bike Tour. My boyfriend and I took the beer garden bike tour and had an amazing time. We ended up having a private tour and our guide, Travis, did an excellent job showing us some Prague sites we definitely would have missed on our own. He was very friendly and we really enjoyed having a few drinks with him in a few of prague's beer gardens. He also took lots of pictures of us which, as a couple traveling alone, was something we really appreciated. Additionally, our tour lasted about 4.5 hours so it was definitely a great value. We would highly recommend both Travis and Praha bike tours!

Bicycle tour to Karlstjen Castle. This was a 33 kilometer ride from central Prague through the countryside to Kalstjen Castle. There were 14 of us ranging from probably 10 to mid-60s, and we all greatly enjoyed it. Our tour guide was Jana, and she did a great job of keeping us all together. It really was an excellent ride, and the views were amazing! I would highly recommend this.

Only way to see Prague. I wanted to show my husband Prague and Praha bikes and their great English speaking guide Elisa were the best way. From the old town to the castle and along the way we had a very relaxed and informative view of the city.

Highly recommend it!. Well what can we say, a surprisingly excellent tour by an intelligent and friendly service. Our tour guide was Sasha, who cycled us around the different sights that prague had to offer. With each stop it was accompanied by an intriguing run down of history with each attraction we saw. I would highly recommend this tour (the classic tour) as the variety of sights we saw and the amount of knowledge we gained outweigh ed the 5 hours of walking we did around prague the day before, Sasha was extremely friendly and the tour felt very personalable as a result, it was a great way to start our second day in prague even though it was raining!!

Great one day bike ride along the Elbe river!. My husband and I wanted to organize a day long bike ride for our trip to Prague this past month, and came across Praha Bike online a few weeks before we left. We saw the information for longer bike rides (over a few days) that go all the way from Prague to Dresden along the Elbe river, but we contacted them to see if we could customize a bike ride along the Elbe for one day only. Oleh, one of the co-owners of the shop, responded to my email very quickly, and gave us options for the ride with or without a tour guide, and for 30 or 50 km. We decided that it would be much more fun with a guide who spoke the language (we don’t!), and decided to do the 50 km ride. Oleh himself came with us on the ride (along with his friend Alex), and he was a fantastic guide and host! The bikes were ready when we got to the shop, they were loaded into the van for us, and we were all driven to our starting point in Melnik, a very nice, small town located where the Elbe and Vltava rivers meet. The ride was beautiful, and for the most part, extremely flat, which was perfect for us as we do only recreational cycling. We stopped for lunch about halfway in a quaint town, Roudnice, and sat outside overlooking the river while enjoying traditional Czech food. The ride ended in Litomerice, another quaint town on the river, where we were met again by the van, and driven back to our hotel in Prague. Both Oleh and Alex were exceptional tour guides, talking a lot about what we were seeing as we cycled along the river. Overall, it was a really great day, and Praha Bike Shop did a superb job in ensuring we had a good time.

Put on your top "things to do in Prague" list. Must see and experience the 20ish mile bike ride to Karlstejn Castle. The whole experience is amazing. It starts with the welcome from your guide at the bike shop. Mine was Sasha. Sasha made the trip engaging fun and relaxing. You ride at a leisurely pace on mostly flat road or path through gorgeous countryside and quaint villages. Frequent stops along the way if needed. You see the castle overlooking the village once you get to Karlstejn. Then it is a nice walk up to see the castle. We chose not to go in but the outside was enough. Sasha was knowledgeable about the history and seemed to enjoy telling us stories. He showed us around then brought us back down a great wooded path that was off the main road. We had lunch at a nice local place that accommodated my food allergies (Sasha helped with that). The train ride back was filled with more stories. We were back before we knew it. Awesome off the beaten path trip. I highly recommend if you have the time while in the Czech Republic to contact Praha Bikes ask for Sasha and book your day trip to this castle.

Great Tour and Tour Guide!. I did the 2.5 hour Classic City bike tour back in early July and had a great time :)To be honest, my first impression of the city of Prague was not a great one. I wouldn't call Prague a beautiful city, in fact, many parts were quite dirty. However, this bike tour changed my mind about the city. Perhaps Prague is not aesthetically beautiful (although there is interesting artwork and sights throughout the city), but it is certainly a city chockfull of history lessons! As others have mentioned, having Travis as a guide was a definite plus! I thought it was great that he shared with our group a little about his background and why he chose to move to Prague. His passion for the city was contagious :) Apart from being informative, he was also quite helpful in recommending good local eats, helping out with directions to main sights after the tour, and just plain nice :D This tour is not to be missed!

One day bike tour. Thanks to Praha Bike and specially to our guide Jana, we had a wonderful day and visited some really nice places, which otherwise we wouldn't be able to find as tourists. Nice tips, great spots, views and history of Prague from a very kind, nice and professional guide. Voila!!! P.S. - good organisation, helpful staff and flexible enough to change bookings due to the bad weather.Pedro and Patricia.

Fantastic bike tour to Karlstejn Castle. A couple of friends and I went on the Karlstejn Castle bike tour and had an amazing time. The bike tour itself is fairly long but not tiring as it is mainly on flat bike paths and the countryside away from all of the Prague tourists is really beautiful. Our tour guide, Sasha, was very cool and really chatty and helpful and made sure that everyone on the tour was happy. All in all, I would highly recommend this tour!

Good exercise!. We went for the Karlstejn castle bike tour after finding it on Viator.The staff were really friendly.. We got lost and only reached the bike shop about 20mins after the meeting time. The staff (didn't manage to get his name!) was still friendly, nice and calm and didn't get mad at us.We didn't have the best day to go on this tour as it rained continuously throughout the day but we didn't let that ruin this experience. Our guide, Sasha, passed on ponchos and that was fine. More on the tour.. It was advertised as a 30km ride on Viator.. However we clocked a 40km ride instead. I think the route might be challenging for older folks or people who do not really exercise (like me!) as there are some uphills and rough terrain. However, if it's too steep/hard to ride, you can always get down your bike to push. The scenery & castle visit at the end is beautiful and I think the experience is well worth the pain in my thighs and butt at the end of the day.Sasha is a wonderful friendly young man. He didn't let anyone feel alone and chatted with us throughout the whole journey. He also adjusted the pace accordingly and always kept a look out for our safety. Our group had 2 flat tires and he got them changed quickly. He also introduced some nice places to eat after that, and we really loved his recommendation. Request for Sasha if you would like an interactive biking tour!

Week with Praha. I did 3 tours with Praha bike: Classic city tour, panoramic castle tour and Karlstejn Castle. My guides Jana, Eliza and Sashay were all very informative and fun. I also rented a bike from Praha for the 4 days I was in Prague. The bike I was allocated was in a very good condition and I appreciated the extra maps, and puncture tyre kit I was allocated. My only suggestion would be regarding the Karlstejn Tour: we were an abnormally large group which meant the ordering and paying for lunch ended up taking quite a while for the restaurant. The restaurant also did not split bill. One suggestion would be for Praha bikes to form I an alliance with a particular restaurant on the hill and let them know in advance of the numbers coming for the day. Other then that it was a very professional organisation.

Have wheels will travel (bike wheels). There's no better way to get to know a country than to step outside the city and get a taste of the countryside. While you will need a full day and some energy, biking out to Karlstein Castle with Praha High bikes as your guide over the bumps, up the hills, along the river, and topped off by a visit to a castle built in the 14th c., it's worth the energy extended! It rained our entire time, but there wasn't a complaint in our group of seven. Sasha, our guide, was fabulous - looking after us, guiding us through a Czech menu and encouraging us up the one hill we encountered. Our group consisted of one Slovenian (Sasha), two Ozzies, two from Singapore, three from Scotland, and one from the U.S. (ranging in age from 21 − 68. My day was the highlight of my stay in Prague. Hop on a bike. Put a Praha Bike tour on your list of To Do's whether it's a 40k trip, as was ours, our a couple hour pedal around the city.

great day of cycling. During our roadtrip through Europe we made a stop in Prague. For sightseeing of the city we decided to rent a bike. Praha Bike delivered great bikes en great routes through Prague. The Lovely Alexandra helped us out with a great route for the day. She noticed all the highlights and we were ready to go. During our trip of three hours we have seen a lot of nice places in Prague. Praha Bike is a great rental shop, and especially the service of Alexandra who understands her job made our cycling trip a day we never forget.

Praha Bike Tours - don't miss it. Had arranged for a guided tour with Praha Bike Tours. The staff is superfriendly, and the tour is great. The tour guide Travis had a lot of insights to share in addition to the standard sightseeing information. He also recommended restaurants and other tour tips. Definitevely a must do in Prague! Jochen from Munich.

Awesome ride. Our 2.5 hour bike tour of Prague have gone by really fast - shame on us we decided not to go for the 6.5 hour tour!We're definitely not sporty (that's why we were dubious at first), still you do not have to be a bike-junkie to enjoy it, we can assure you that.It was fun! The centre of the city is mostly flat and there's plenty of pedestrian zones, so nothing too challenging or dangerous. You can enjoy the wonders of the city while riding, and every time you stop in front of some nice spot or building you get the opportunity to discover the history of Prague thanks to your guide, along with some amenities and fun facts you won't read on any book.We were lucky. Elisa was our guide. Though she seems British (red hair, blue eyes, really fluent in English), she's Italian (just like us!), she's a very nice girl, kind and well prepared. Besides, we've later discovered that actually French is her mother tongue.You should definitely try this bike tour. Little advice, go pub crawling the night AFTER the tour... ;)Thanks to Elisa and "bravo" to all the guys who have come up with this idea!

Excellent tour with an excellent guide. The bike tour to the Karlstejn castle is an excellent way to see not only Karlstejn but also a lot of beautiful scenery along the way. The route is not strenuous but in the end it is a good workout before the tasty lunch that awaits once in Karlstejn village. The icing on the cake is Travis, the tour guide, who is very knowledgeable about Czech history and makes sure the tour is fun and interesting, and truly takes care of everyone on the tour. We highly recommend Travis and Praha Bike, and particularly this itinerary to Karlstejn, It's a great way to spend the day.

40 km bike tour to Karlstejn Castle. I went on a 40 km bike tour in August 2014. Our guide was a young fellow named Sasha. He was very knowledgeable and did a great job leading our group. I asked for a extra large bike and was able to get it. All of the bikes in our group of four worked well.

Parah Bike - great bike tours. We did two bike tours with Parah Bike, one of the old city and one of the Prague Castle. The old city tour was great with lots of interesting facts and stories set at a pace that kept our kids aged 8, 10 and 12 interested and engaged. However, the highlight of our entire stay in Prague was the Prague Castle tour. Our guide, Cat, was fantastic and pitched the tour at the perfect level for the kids and managed to keep our slightly crazy group together and hanging on her every word for the whole 3 hours.

Great way to see and learn about Prague. I first took the Classic City Tour. Fun and informational trip riding bikes through center of Prague is a must do. I must commend Kat, our tour guide, for leading a great tour and making each of our stops interesting and fun.

Prague discovery bicycling with Travis. By joining Praha Bike tour for an afternoon, we wasn't expecting this pleasure. Our guide Travis took the time to show us the greatest and nicest parts of Prague, with time, knowledge and passion. This has been a great way to discover Prague history and culture, that I recommend to anyone travelling in.
Classic bike tour with Elisa. Wonderful trip at a steady pace around the busy city. It was a great tour and i recommend this tour to visitors looking to see the key sights of Prague with little time!

Awesome view of the Chateau and Prague. Pretty neat tour. We got to see some interesting dights and explore the chateau grounds. Travis, our tour guide, allowed plenty of time to walk around and was very insightful. Definitely recommend.

A guide is most useful. We were starting a longer tandem tour from Prague to Vienna early to see this beautiful city. After walking around the city it initially didn't seem that bike friendly. Our hotel (Hotel Antik) was right next door to Praha so we decided just to take the city tour. Our guide, Travis, was most helpful and informative. So I took a second tour along the river. Having a guide was most helpful and a really great way to see the city. Travis was a great, quite unassuming guide. Definitely would do another tour with these folks.

Challenging ride but covers a lot of ground. Our tour guide Jana gave us a very comprehensive tour of Prague. It is a great ride and Jana was very helpful getting us prepared for some of the steep bike climbs we had to face. She knew all the great places to visit for lunch and afternoon refreshments. The monastery beers she introduced us to were the best lagers in all of Europe. We loved the parting magnet gifts too.

Best way to see Prague. I booked in on 2 tours - the early evening Panoramic tour and the mid-day tour of the Old Town. Biking around Prague was quite an experience and I'm so glad I did it! Sasha was the guide on both tours and he was fabulous - really knows Prague and willing to help with anything. He even recommended a great vegetarian restaurant that did not disappoint. I'm 60+ and was by far the oldest person on both tours and I'd recommend the tours to any senior citizen who enjoys a bike ride. The pace was comfortable, Sasha made sure that no-one got left behind and the others on the tour were friendly and considerate as well. Definitely a great way to get around Prague. The traffic and the crowds are not as scary as they appear at first - just relax and enjoy!
We loved the help in the office!. Nice views, reasonable bikes and great service!! We loved the tour and the city and especially the great service at the rental point! Great quality/price!

great way to see Prague!. We did the Praha bike day tour on our second day in Prague and it was a wonderful experience. We happened to be staying only up the road, saw the sign as we walked by and looked it up on the internet later. Booked our tickets, and came by the next morning. Easy! There was a small mixup with the guides, so we were a bit delayed with the start. It didn't really bother us, but as with most things when you travel, do budget a bit of extra time if you need to be anywhere after. We ran late because of our late start (which was nice of the guide to do even though he had an evening tour to do as well!). Prague streets seems a little scary at first to the inexperienced, but you get the hang of it quickly. We had a second trainee guide with us, who was great for looking out for us too. Most of the terrain is flat, with a few hills, but they are mostly spaced out throughout the day. And there are plenty of stops too. Would highly recommend to everyone!

Highly recommended. I've been to Praha many times but this time decided to get out of the city on a trip to Karlstejn with Praha Bike. I was one of two people on the trip along with a trainee guide and our official guide, Saša. The whole Praha Bike experience was good and Saša was an excellent guide and a credit to the company, with excellent knowledge of Praha and Karlstejn and even needed to fix a puncture, which he did on the train on the way back to Praha. His English is also excellent. The trip went at the pace of the customers and was clearly centred around customer wishes when choosing breaks and places to eat. The bikes were also good. As a cyclist I noticed that they had Shimano Deore gears, so clearly not the very cheapest. A word of caution to UK visitors: the brakes are the opposite way around, although I think we British are the odd ones! Altogether a great trip. I would happily use Praha Bike again.
Great bike ride. Rented a bike, and travelled all around Prague! Great experience thanx to the lovely Alexandra who helped me choose some destination, and explained where to go, really fun!!!

Highlight of Trip to Prague. Loved, loved, loved all of Prague, but my wife and I really enjoyed our day trip to Karlstejn Castle. It was fun seeing more of the city and the beautiful countryside. The castle was cool to see, but the journey really made the experience. Our tour guide, Nazar, was easy going and very knowledgeable. Highly recommend Praha Bike and the Karlstejn Castle ride.

Great evening bike tour with Travis. My daughter and I took the Night Legends bike tour with Praha Bikes and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had lots of activities scheduled for the days we were there, so being able to schedule an evening tour was great. Our guide was Travis, an American who lives in Prague and is passionate about it. That showed in his thorough and thoughtful descriptions of all of the places we stopped at - from a haunted church to the Jewish Quarter to the John Lennon Graffiti Wall to the Main Square and a number of other destinations in between. He answered all of our questions and was very considerate and kind with us. He took us several places we would never have seen on our own, which was another benefit. Prague is not yet an especially bicycle-friendly city compared to other European cities (lots of cobblestone streets and not many bike lanes) so it was good to have a knowledgeable guide like Travis. This tour covers almost all flat terrain in the Old Town and Little Quarter and is not strenuous at all. A great introduction to central Prague! Tip - this is a 2.5 hour tour that runs at 7:00 PM and 8:00 PM every evening in the summer, BUT it requires booking at least a day in advance - don't expect to show up 10 minutes before and book it on the spot.

A great way to see the city of Prague!. We did the 6 hour tour on our first day in Prague. It covered so much of the sights that the rest of our time here was actually very freed up. The bikes are great & easy to ride, though when they say 'moderate' they mean you need to know how to ride. Our guide Sasha was a lovely man; very knowledgeable & made everyone very comfortable. He was able to tailor the stops for photos or longer breaks as needed. This is a great way to see Prague. On foot this would take at least 3 full days. We were also given a complimentary bike to use the following day as we completed the full tour the day prior.

Classic City Bike Tour. Did the 2.5 hour tour on August 10. Combination of riding on roads, cobbled stone roads and paths, pavements and cycleways. Expert guidance from Oliver who certainly knew his stuff and was sensitive to adapt the tour to the different needs of the group (cultural info and general chat). He was interesting to listen to and interested in getting to know us. Great value for money and highly recommended as the first thing to do on arrival in Prague.

highlight of our trip. Would highly recommend this tour.Me and my girlfriend decided to take the six and a half hour tour of the city.The tour was not only very interesting regarding the history of the city but also gave you a great feel of how to get around the city yourself.Our guide ( a girl from northern Italy ) was excellent , full of knowledge , great fun and very friendly.Allan and LynnDublin Ireland
Classic tour. Very nice tour with K@!Cool fun facts and stop spots.Will recommand it for a first overview of the city.

Karlstejn bike tour from Prague. We have had an awesome day on this trip. It does take all day but you enjoy picturesque views all the way that just take your breath away. Our guide Sasha was fantastic. It is not an easy ride to be honest, especially if you are not used to being on a bike for four hours but the time goes quickly, the bike paths are really good and mostly flat all the way and our guide was happy to accommodate as many stops as needed. Getting to the castle was just magic. This is a must do.
Bike tour Classic. Great way of a first introduction to Prague. Give an overview of the city without having to hop on and off a bus. Thanks Cath for the kind Company and excellent guidance!

Great Prague Orientation Tour. It was a great way to cover a lot of Prague in only 2 1/2 hours. Jana and Alex were great tour guides. We saw the Old Town and New Town, Jewish Quarter and Lesser Town. It helped us get oriented to the city and know where we wanted to return. Very well done!

Great way to see Prague . We were only in Prague for one night and wanted a good way to get it all in. Sasha our tour guide was amazing. He knew his facts but more importantly he was very personable and friendly. Was really keen on making sure we had a good time and that's exactly what we had. The tour in itself was amazing. Hit all the highlights while at the same time took us off track to parts not too frequented by tourists. The views were great too. With the limited time we had I was afraid we might not see the real Prague but this tour was our savior. Thanks again Sasha and Praha Bike

Great Tour!!. Very nice and comprehensive tour of the city. Eliza, our guide, was super attentive and well-informed. Great stories too! She even told us some not-so-touristy things to do which was very helpful. All in all, day well spent!

Great fun. We were on a stag weekend with a dozen guys. The bike tour on a sunny Saturday was a great way to see the city and have some beers. Kat was a great guide - funny and informative. It was her personality that really made the day special

Panoramic bike tour is the 1st thing you need to do in Prague!. Great tour! This tour is definitely the first thing you need to do upon arrival to Prague. Oliver, our tour guide, took us to main panoramic sites of the city while providing fun and educational stories on each location. Will recommend the tour to all my friends visiting Prague.

Gilamun!. The bike tour was pretty fun! My favourite part was riding down this HUGE hill. Kat was my tour guide and she was helpful from the very start. She remembered everyone's name, knew a lot about the city and in general waa\s just a fun person! Great tour!

Praha Bike Tour - A Great Mix Of History And Fun!. Yesterday, my family took a tour around the city and honestly, it couldn't have been a better balance of both a fun and educational experience! Our tour guide, Kat, made learning about each building and its significance extremely entertaining! For all of you tourists looking for a great way to explore the city, this is the way to go!
Kat is great. We had a lovely bike tour through Prague with Kat. She was funny and knew a lot. We enjoyed it a lot.

Great way to start knowing the city. We had the classic tour, easy to ride, very informative, great views of the city.you will get many useful tips from the Guide( our's was the amazing Cath) about resturants, bars,statues,prices,historical buildings and great locations.Very recommended.

Beer garden - River tour. TOTAL FUN! Mostly because of our great tour guide Kat. We had a small group (4) Two from the U.S. and two from Sweden, and she made everyone feel welcome and instant friends. She was informative, funny, and answered all our questions. She let us decide on which (of the first two) gardens to visit and we we're all in agreement and LOVED them all! She also is an invaluable guide as to where the locals go to hang out after you're finished with the tour and will help you not get ripped off. The bikes were really easy to ride and the ride itself is VERY easy. Getting out of the city only takes a few minutes and after that you're on fantastic bike paths the whole way. Can't recommend this company or guide highly enough. Definitely one of our highlights of our trip to Praha!

Excellent option!. I recently did a bike ride from Prague City to Karlstejn Castle in Czech Republic and it was great. Albeit the advert said 30km and it ended up being nearly 39kms it was a very pleasant ride and easy with only two hills and made very safe by our guide Sasha (Sasa). It was a much more pleasant way of see the countryside rather than looking through the bus window. And whilst I must admit the bike ride and lunch was better than the castle, it was a lovely way to spend the day and a little power snooze on the return train ride home didn't hurt! Do it!

Sasha is the man. We have just finished a classic city tour with Sasha. We were so Lucky that we were the only 2 people on the tour (the weather was very hot but thunderstorms were forecast hence the reason I think for being quiet) For the whole ride we had Sasha's undivided attention and he was very very knowledgeable especially about the music and politics of the city and country in general. It rained heavily for last last 30 mins but Sasha was well prepared and had ponchos ready for us. I would highly recommend this as a great way to see the city. Thank you Sasha.

Absolutely Wonderful Way to See Prague. Just a note of thanks to Praha Bikes and especially Kat for a wonderful city tour. The tour was awesome and a great way to get on all the "big ticket" sights. Kat was definitely knowledgable of the city and sights and her energy and enthusiasm was great! Thanks for an awesome tour!

Great way to see the city. A full day with Sasha will take you to all important sites in Prague. Easier than walking.Saves energy. Saves time.Complete information on each site from our guide Sasha.We were very lucky to have him for a private tour.Next day a bike tour outside of town. Biking along rivers. Beautiful. Recommended.

Wonderful Tour! . While on our short visit in Prague, we decided to start it off with a bike tour with Praha Bikes. Great decision! Our tour guide Sasha was wonderful! He had so much info to share with us about the city's history as well as places to eat and hang out. The bikes had suspension which made the cobblestone ride much more enjoyable. We were able to see a lot of the city in only a couple hours. I recommend this bike tour and our guide, Sasha to everyone interested in getting around the city via bike!

Great way to experience Prague. Did the Troja Chateau tour yesterday with Kat, and loved that we got to see some of the real Prague, off the tourist trail. Good to speak with Kat to find out more about the city, as well as lovely scenery and beer!! Highly recommend.

Excellent way to see the city. So happy I took the Big All-in-One tour. I really saw all the best parts of Prague! Our guide Jana was extremely knowledgeable, friendly and took us to a few places off the regular tour because some people asked if she would. The tour covers everything you would want to see and know and the lunch spot was perfect, not an overpriced touristy place. The ride itself was more challenging than I expected, with many hills, but you see everything you can't cover on foot. You do need to be in shape for this all day tour. The cobblestone streets do get tiresome after a while, so if you have cycle shorts wear them, but I was ok in my regular street clothes. Jana gave me ideas on what to do the next two days I was staying, but I really did see everything I wanted, or would've seen or known about, on the tour.

Sasha was great!. My husband and I were traveling on a Contiki tour and were given the option to do a bike tour in Prague. Our guide, Sasha, made the tour very interesting with great historical information, funny stories, random facts, and chose a variety of sights throughout Prague. I did find that riding a bike through Prague was a little out of my comfort zone. It's a very busy city with lots of tourists, lots of other bikers, pedestrians, very short tram crossings, cobbled streets, and basically lots of things that I found distracting while on a bike. This wasn't an issue for my husband so I guess it depends on how great you are on a bike. Overall, good time, great guide.

What Fun!. We had a wonderful time on our bike tour with Praha Bikes. Our guide, Sasha, was very charming and gave us a great tour of the area. We were a family of four with two teens and he did a great job keeping us all engaged and interested. While we were supposed to see Chateau Troja, it was closed for a private event but we didn't mind as the rest of the tour more than made up for it. Lovely way to see a city and surrounds while getting some exercise.

Would not trust anyone else. My travel group has been using this company for 5 years and never once have we had a bad tour. This past week when I did the tour I had Kate and Yana. My students said that this tour was their favorite thing in Prague. The tour covers everything you would want to know. They also give you ideas of things to do and places to go. I would not go anywhere else for a tour. They are the best of the best!

A wonderful day with Sasha. What a great day!! Sasha was wonderful and gave us so much information about Prague, he was very friendly and professional. We had the best time seeing all the sites and hearing about the city. Highly recommend this tour and even higher recommendations for Sasha as the guide. Lots of thanks Katie and Jason Australia

Loved our bike tour. Travis, our guide, was very informative. I liked the philosophical input he added to our tour. The city is beautiful and took us to heights I wouldn't have ventured to on my own. It was one of my favorite activities during our week in Prague.

Tons of Fun!. We did the beer garden tour on my wife's birthday. It was a ton of fun and we both really enjoyed ourselves. Kat, our guide, was both knowledgable and entertaining. The tour was well paced and it was a great way to see some sights (and drink some beer) that are off the main tourist paths. The bikes are well maintained and the ride was not difficult.

Travis is the man, informative and enjoyable. Travis was our guide we were lucky enough to be a real small group. He handled all of my stupid history questions with ease and sorted us out with a few micro breweries to try after the tour! Bikes were in great condition and Travis was real safe with the at times hectic traffic. Saw everything we wanted to in old town and more. Would go again

Karlstejn Castle. The bike tour to Karlstein Castle was very enjoyable. They were four of us including the tour guide, Alex K. Fortunately the weather stayed dry during our bike ride. Alex was very knowledgably of the route and the surrounding area. This isn’t something I would have attempted on my own, I would have got lost! She set a steady pace and most of the route was on cycle paths. The bike I rode was in perfect condition and very easy to ride which made the journey all the more enjoyable. We left the bikes at the bottom of the hill and walked up to the Castle. Alex showed us round parts of Karlstejn Castle which is very pretty and worth a visit. We travelled via train with the bikes back to Prague although Alex was willing to bike back if we’d wanted to.If you would like a 20 mile bike ride through Prague and the countryside, I recommend this tour. Thank you Alex K for a wonderful day.

Too fast!. We did a whole day tour to Karlštejn Castle. The castle was beautiful, really worth a visit. But the guide went too fast most of the way. We lost sight of him, almost got lost once and didn't stop anywhere along the ride for pictures of beautiful sights. We stopped for refreshments and then for lunch. But along the way there were many pretty sights and we would have liked to stop at least once or twice for a quick picture but it was not possible because we were worried about catching up with the guide. Before going, we were told it was possible for anyone to do this tour and we are quite fit.Apart from that, the bikes were good, we left on time and got back by train without a problem.

Amazing!. The tour was great and they lead our group of 20 with ease. Our guide was American (our group is American) so it was nice to see the city through her eyes and hear about her experience of moving to Prague.
Great value. I took the classic tour at 11.30 with Kat, it was ace she's very knowledgeable and friendly, the bikes are sturdy and we got a well rounded tour of the city. Thanks!

Enjoyed it so much we went twice!. My family loves exploring by bike. One of our first activities in Prague was the city tour. Our guide was Cat. She did an excellent job of orienting us and explaining lots of sights. She had an excellent sweep and they made sure everyone stayed together and was safe. We had so much fun we decided to go on the all day castle tour a couple days later. Our guide for that was Sasha and it was even better. Lot of great scenery and fun stops along the way. He gave an excellent tour of the castle town and the outer part of the castle itself. Much of the castle can only be visited with an official tour. Sasha was very flexible in letting us decide if we wanted to do that or not. He was actually very flexible the entire time allowing us a fair amount of flexibility. The return on the train was even fun as Americans we have little experience with trains. I recommend the city tour as fun way to get oriented and a long tour if you want to get outside of Prague and see the countryside.

Great way to see Prague. We showed up a little late to the tour, however it was only a small group and they waited for us to grab our bikes before heading off. Elisa was our tour guide, she was very knowledgeable despite that she had only been doing in for a month or so and she friendly, and made sure we were ok at all times riding behind her. She had a great attitude towards the tour which made it more enjoyable. Definitely a great way to see some of the sites of Prague without having to walk.

Castle bike ride. Went on a 2 1/2 hour bike tour at 5:30 pm. Great War to see the highlights of prague and the tour leader, Elisa, was excellent. Ride was not strenuous. Rivers had the option of walking the few steep uphill portions

Carlstejn day tour. In June, I took the Praha Bike Carlstejn all-day tour with Daniel as our guide. I wanted to see something beyond Prague and this was ideal.
