The three hour ride took us past some great street art (some in unexpected places), along the Vltava River, through pretty countryside and quaint towns. Raincoats and a bottle of water were provided, but making it to Carlstejn just as the thunderstorm hit was one of the day's highlights. We ate a hearty Czech lunch then walked up to the castle, learned of its history and looked around the free section. Daniel was a pleasure: knowledgeable, interesting and affable. We had a great time, well beyond that of a typical bike tour.
great tour, awesome guide. totally worth it. Alex K an is awesome guide. She showed us all sort of stuff and she has the history bug! just do it!

Fun bike tour to Katlstejn Castle. Our guide, Sasha, was fantastic. Bike rentals and helmets( if desired) are provided for an enjoyable 20 mile bike ride through the countryside primarily on bike paths to Karlstejn Castle. There were 7 people on our tour. We stopped along the way for a beer or soda. We all had lunch together at a restaurant near the castle. Some people went on a tour inside the castle and 2 of us remained with Sasha for a tour outside of the castle. We rode our bikes to a nearby train station, put the bikes on the train with us, and took the train back to Prague. The group got along well together and Sasha was a great guide!

Biking with Travis!. This bike tour was a quick and easy way to familiarize yourself with the city of Prague. Our guide Travis was very good at keeping our group together (there were quite a few of us) and you could see his love of the city by how talked about each part of Prague. I learned a lot of fun and unique stories about the city that I can't wait to share with my friends!I also appreciated that after the tour, Travis helped my friend and I with a map and wrote out some good restaurants for us to try. Very sweet of him!

5 Stars. My wife and I were visiting Prague for the first time and wanted to see as much of the city in one day as we could, so opted for the "All in One" Tour. Our guide was Elise and, although not originally from the Czech Republic, you would not know it. Her energy and enthusiasm were unwavering - despite some challenging weather. Her overall knowledge of Czech history and the city was quite impressive. Nice thing about the All in One Tour is, you will often have the guide all to yourself! 6.5 hours went by really quick - Awesome tour - Well worth the price. Thanks to Elise!

Very interesting & informative. The value of money for the tour was really good and the whole tour of Prague was really useful and interesting. Despite the wet rain showers the whole 2 1/2 hour period was good. Also very good to do the tour when you first arrive in Prague so you get to know the city and find out tips from the tour guides. I recommend it for anybody how wants to do a tour of the city to find out more about it. One place the tour doesn't go around is Wensecles Square which is quite an iconic site.

Brilliant "Big Day" tour. We had a fantastic 6.5 hour day trip with Jana. 5 of us, aged 20 to 60, spent a great day seeing the sights and doing some fairly mild exercise (though a few of the hills were steep enough to give a good cardio work-out!). Lunch at a traditional Czech pub/restaurant was a treat, with Jana providing a few hints about culinary options! We felt at the end of the day that this had been a brilliantly paced way for us to take in the sights of this amazing city, getting some local knowledge and exercising as well. It was an added bonus that Jana could cope well with our kiwi accents!

Amazing tour! City centre bike tour (guide Jana). Found out about tour through trip advisor-chosen based on great reviews. Went to many of the hot spots-old town, Jewish corridor, Charles Bridge, Lennon wall,etc. it was as good as advertised. It rained however they were prepared and offered rain ponchos. She was easy to talk to, answered all of our questions and 2.5 hours was just the right amount of time. Lots of stops and never got too behind the group. We also had a mechanic following who fixed someone's flat tire and blocked traffic which at times was busy. Only downside was group size- we had 16 in ours.
Excellent!!!. Elisa was the best tour guide. Lovely, helpful, and patient. You get a feeling of the city. nice views.

Great Bike Tour. My wife and I took the Praha Bike tour to the ONE DAY BICYCLE TOUR to KARLSTEJN CASTLE. Our guide, Sasha, provided a very interesting and enjoyable trip. We highly recommend this to those who would like to get a little exercise while enjoying the countryside south of Prague.

Great way to spend a day in Prague. My wife and I were looking for a way to rent bikes, and found Praha Bike via Google.cz. We initially decided on the Beer Garden Tour, but ended up doing 2 trips in 1 day, it was spectacular. Well-organized, not too fast, not too slow, highly recommend. Kat was our tour guide for both tours, was knowledgeable as well as friendly. She made it educational and fun! We will remember this day forever! Highly recommend!

Helpful front desk. The guy at the front desk gave me detailed info on how to get to Praha castle stopping at a nice park and where to get the best picture of the beautiful old town. Highly recommend this bike rental!

Great bike tour in a lovely city!. We had a great bike tour to Troja with Kat. She was a lovely guide and answered all of our questions about the city. Even for someone who hadn't ridden a bike in a very long time, I was able to keep up and it was a flat ride! Definitely recommend this tour.

Amazing ride with an amazing guide. The tour was a great way to see Prague. The cobblestones are a bit bumpy to ride on but it was worth it! Make sure you ask for Kat as your tour guide, she was hilarious and knew a lot about Prague's history.

Bicy-COOL !. Had a fabulous time on the panorama and castle tour! Sasa was so great and informative, and tailored the trip to individual preferences. There were great views and it was very safe the whole way. Only a few tough hills but most was very easy. So much fun!
Nice ride around town!. Travis gave us a great tour around Prague. He was super nice and knowledgable. We really enjoyed it! Highly recommend doing a bike tour!

Do the beer tour with Travis!. A bike tour is a great way to take a break from the city center and see more of the countryside surrounding Prague. Travis took us through some beautiful parks and we stopped at three different beer gardens to try well-known Czech beers. He was super knowledgeable about both Prague and beer, and we learned a lot. My friends and I were the only people on the tour that day, so it felt more like hanging out with a friend than going on some rehearsed and boring tour. Travis deviated from the usual route to take us to a beautiful overlook of the city at the end. It was a beautiful bike ride and good beer. Definitely recommend!

Awesome experience. On the Eastern Road Contiki tour we had the opportunity to do a bike tour with Praha Bike. Saša was our tour guide, and he was extremely knowledgeable, and patient with us as well. It was a fun activity and a great way to see and learn more of the city. Definitely a must-do activity.

Excellent Guided Bike Tour to Karlstejn Castle. Daniel led us on a fantastic, scenic bike tour from the center of Prague to Karlstejn Castle. I was a little apprehensive about the tour because I’m not a very experienced biker (I only ride a bike once or twice a year). But I think anyone who knows how to ride a bike and has a moderate level of stamina would enjoy this tour. The pace was leisurely allowing time to enjoy the scenery, stop to take some pictures, etc. Our cycling time to the castle was about 3.5 hours for a total of about 18 miles. About a third of the way we stopped in a small village for a drink, then on to Karlstejn Village for lunch in a traditional Czech restaurant. We tried the pickled cheese (apparently a local delicacy) which was actually quite good. Then, we left our bikes behind to walk up to the castle grounds. After visiting the castle, it’s a short bike ride back to the Karlstejn station. The train ride from Karlstejn to Prague was less than 30 minutes and the bike ride from the station back to the Praha Bike office was less than 10 minutes. Our guide Daniel was terrific – friendly, knowledgeable and very attentive. Our tour group was very small – just my husband and I (generally I think tour group size is around 3-6 people). The bikes were in very good condition. With the exception of 5-10 minutes leaving and returning to the center of Prague (which doesn't have heavy traffic), you are on a bike path or the occasional country road where car-drivers are used to bikers. I am extremely glad I did this tour and highly recommend it.

Praha Bike tour was the best!. Travis Cahill of Praha Bikes led us on an evening tour of the city. It was amazing. He knew the most fascinating stories about the history of Prague and was a delight to spend time with. Everyone should take a Praha Bike tour. Ask for Travis!

The Ride to Karlstejn Castle was FANTATIC. We had an absolutely epic day on our ride to Karlstejn Castle. Our guide Travis was fantastic. Informative, patient, helpful. The riding was flat and we stopped halfway for a refreshment (pivo) ...and then a fabulous lunch at Karlstejn. The castle tour was excellent. The train ride back was fun too. We are a family of 4 ... w kids age 17 and 15 ...and not athletic ...and all parents and kids were fine and had an absolute blast.THANK YOU PRAHA BIKE and TRAVIS for a great day !!

Best Choice of my Trip - Amazing experience. Praha Bike offered a great opportunity to do a full day bike excursion to Karlstejn Castle, which included a 1/2 day bike ride, visit to the castle (extra cost to go inside), and train ride back.The ride was guided, on quality bikes (not cruisers thankfully), an was approx. a 30 km (18 mile) ride. The guide was great, tour group was small, and the ride was breathtakingly beautiful. This is a low intensity ride with very few hills, but participants need some level of stamina since the ride is several hours in duration.The reason to do this particular tour ought to be the scenery. The castle at the end was beautiful on the outside, but the inner tour was only worth it for the view from the top at the end.I loved this ride. The whole thing was on a path system once outside the old town. I would do another tour with Praha bike in an instant.

Good tour..worth the money!. This is the second bike tour my husband and I have taken in a European city. We find them a great way to see a lot of the city in a short amount of time and you get the highlights of the city with a lot of breaks to take pictures. Our tour guide was Ollie. He was very informative, gave a lot of history and could answer most of our questions. The only part of the tour that wasn't so great are the bikes. They do the job, but could be better. My husband had an issue at one point and also another member of the group had to switch out the bike before the tour started. But, not the tour guide's fault at all. Prague is a beautiful city, and the tour is well worth the money spent to enjoy a great ride through the cobblestone streets and learn a bit of history along the way.

Went with North Carolinian Kat on a couple hour easy bike tour.. We went with Kat, who is from the US, on a couple hour easy bike tour. She is full of energy, easily understood, and knows her way around Prague. It was a good introduction to the city.

Best bike tour in Europe!. Kat lead us on a very nice and relaxed city tour around Prague. The tour lasted around 2.5 hours and we had a break in between in a nice park. I love bike tours and this one was no exception, we got to see and hear much about the city historically, and from a local's perspective. The tour flowed very well and the ride was very easy (no hills etc). Kat also gave us some other spots around town to go and see (clearly marked on the map so we could find them) depending on our interests and then sent us off with a some awesome recommendations for food and beer!! Thanks Kat!!
Kat was our guide!. She was an awesome guide! So educational and had an awesome time! Great experience and I would recommend it! Great way to see Prague! Thanks Kat!

See Prague like a local!. 2-3 hour bike tour of Prague. Travis was our guide - he was well informed and humorous. The cycling was a little challenging at first, as the roads within Prague's old town are all cobble stone streets and they can rattle your bones! But as soon as we got out of town and started heading towards the castle, it was very enjoyable. Stunning views, amazing landscape, truly local experience! I really feel I "know" Prague, after doing this tour.

Best rental in historical centre, friendly. Rental is situated in historical centre, near Old Jewish Quarter. There are very friendly guys work here, they advise most profitable fares for you, settle the matters of parking in your hotel, if you rent bike at several days. We explored Prague district two days without any problems, visited Karlstein, Cernosice and several pretty villiages. I will advise Prahabike to all my friends who plan to spent vacation in Prague. Thanks!

Panoramic Castle Bike Tour with Sasha!. We had such a great time on this tour. Sasha our guide had so much knowledge about Prague and made the tour very fun. The views and sights at the top of the castle are wonderful. If you are planning on going a bike tour I would recommend you go on this tour and request Sasha!!

Great way to see some of the city's sights. My friend and I had a great time on the Panoramic Castle Tour. Our guide, Sasha, was very friendly and also gave us some great information and facts about the sights we saw. I would definitely go on another tour if I had more days left in Prague!

Awesome bike tour with Saša. The classic city tour was about 2-2.5 hours and covered the main city attractions in Praha. It was a quick preview for all you want to see in the city. Takes a while to get used to the cobblestone and dodge pedestrians but it was still worth it! Saša was very informative, easy going and fun. After the tour, Saša gave us a map of the city with restaurant suggestions which was extremely helpful! Lots of places around old town square are pretty expensive/touristy so try to avoid that.Overall, I highly recommend this tour if it's your first time in Prague! Thanks Saša! :)

Must do this tour!. This tour is a must do in Prague. We had Saša who was a great tour guide! It is a 2-2.5 hour bike tour which covers old and new town and we got to see some really cool sites like the graffiti wall and the "islands." I would suggest doing this tour as one of your first activities in Prague because you get to see a lot of the city and then you can visit those places later. Saša was so nice and answered all of our questions. He even gave us suggestions and showed us places to eat and go out at night. He also spent time with us after the tour and marked up a map for us with his suggestions. The only thing I had a hard time with was getting used to the cobblestone so perhaps wear good shoes. Otherwise this was a great first biking tour experience for me!

Great Experience in New City. My friends & I did the 2.5 hour City Bike Tour with Saša. It was kind of chilly outside and so we only had 4 people in our group. This was kind of nice since we were able to ask him more questions and personalize the trip a bit based off our preferences. Saša was very knowledgeable when it came to Prague history and he was able to answer all of our questions. Moreover, he was funny and kept the tour very interesting. The bike tour was a great way to see the important sites in Prague and I think this is the best way to begin your trip here. As a tourist, it's hard to get accustomed to the city and it's very easy to get ripped off by local vendors. However, Saša was able to guide us to some good local spots and even took a detour on the trip to show us some restaurants. Overall, we had a great time and would recommend this trip to anyone new in Prague!

Relaxing and informative. We had Eliza (from Sondrio) as our guide. She took us to all the places on the usual tourist route plus a few that aren't. She was very knowledgeable and her English was good. This is a very pleasant way to see much more than you could do on foot, and it avoids being part of the milling crowd of tourists, which is something to be thankful for. Definitely to be recommended.

Nice way to experience the old town.. We had a great time riding around the old town. Our guide was Oliver and he was very good and provided a lot of important info for us. Would do this tour again if we come back to Prague.

Great way to see Prague!. We had Travis, who was knowledgeable and never rushed the tour, which can make or break the experience. Travis was chill and knew a lot of specific background of Prague. He even told some pretty hilarious historic stories of Prague's past, which is always my favorite part of these tours; you get well beyond the boilerplate tourist facts.

Panoramic & Castle touring with Sacha. My sister and brother-in-law had never done a bike tour before, so after reading reviews of Praha Bikes we decided to sign-up for the Panoramic & Castle Tour. It was a perfect choice as we were able to see parts of Prague that we wouldn't have on foot with only 3 days to see the city. Sacha, our guide, was fantastic! He had lots of knowledge of the city and the history attached to it. He kept us intrigued and excited the entire tour and even convinced us to bike all the way to the "Eifel Tower". We were happy that we went the extra distance in the end. Thank you Sacha for helping make my family's first bike tour ever a fun and memorable one. :)

Karlsteijn Castle with Sacha. (written by Leo's wife) This was a great alternative day to city sightseeing. The weather was great the day we went and the 3,5 hours on the bike flew by! Equipment was reliable. We had one flat tire along the way which Sacha fixed promptly while the rest of us had a beer. Mostly the level was easy, except for one substantial hill which some of our group just had to walk up for a few minutes. No big deal. I went by myself, as my 2 travelling companions weren't up for it...a great way to get to know new people! The lunch was very good, castle also quite nice but most impressive looking at it from below in my opinion. No one in our group was up for a tour inside so I can't report on that. Sacha and his colleague (young woman, I'm sorry I can't remember her name!) were delightful.

Just What We Were After. We did the Beer Garden cycle tour and it was just what we were looking for. We were after a little bit of beer, relaxed fun and gentle cycling to see some of the lesser explored parts of the city and we were not disappointed.The fact that we weren't inundated with history was a plus, but there were a few interesting stories. Our guide gave us more of an insight into living and working in Prague more anecdotal than the architectural history of some of the buildings.We rode out along the river and visited 3 beer gardens (small beer included) and rode through parks and pretty much stuck purely to cycle paths so I didn't get the fear. The city centre and major sights may not be built for bike users, but the beer gardens certainly are!

Very good tour!. We did the classic city tour with Kat. Good and fun explanation of Prague. Seen allot of interesting buildings, statues etc. Bike was good and easy to ride. Thank you from the Dutch (2)people.

Not the best city to bike in, but still interesting. Prague may not be the best city to enjoy riding a bike, but it has some nice views, which could be reached easier with a bike. The cobblestones also are not the best surface for a bike, but they are not such a big problem.We did the all-in-one tour, which was great because of our guide Travis - one of the coolest guys we've ever met. We were interested in some non-tourist beer places and he knows really a lot about beer, so we were lucky.

Great way to experience the city. I had a great experience on two different tours. I did the Big City tour with Jana, and it was a great way to learn about the history and see the sites. She was knowledgeable and honest, and gave us a great perspective of the city from a Czech native. I also did the Karlstejn tour with Travis. It was a great tour out to the countryside. Not a very difficult ride, and he kept it at our pace. Also, was interesting getting the perspective from an American living in Prague. He was great to talk to and learn from, and was willing to adjust the tour to whatever we were willing to do. I was more than happy with what I got out of the tours, and would recommend at least one of the tours, if not both.

GREAT tour to Karlstejn Castle with Sasha!!. We booked a day tour to bicycle from the city of Prague to Karlstejn Castle. Sasha is a really great and knowledgeable guide, and it was a fabulous day. The tour follows the river, and it is a great way to get outside the city of Prague and enjoy the beautiful Czech countryside. We saw farms, flowers, charming houses along the river, we stopped at a beer garden, had a delicious lunch, toured the castle, and then took the train back to Prague. Great day!! Definitely request Sasha!

Karlštejn Castle Tour. Today I was sorting some old photos and remembered this great tour to Karlštejn Castle in June 2012. Although the distance, it was an easy ride. The guide was joyful and informative. The castle is nice, but the best memories come from a stop by the middle of the tour, at a small bar in front of the river with great beer (as usual) and ran by an old guy whom seem to be one of the greatest Sinatra fans.
K@ Nip. AWESOME!! K@ was amazing! Great ride and great sights! I wish someone told me where to find a house party in Prague..
Kat is the best!!. Great tour of the town, request Kat if possible. Easy biking and lots of good information!! I love this city!!

Wonderful, unique experience. My friends and I went on the bike tour to Karstejn Castle. This tour allowed us to view the countryside of the Czech Republic, an opportunity most tourists do not have a chance to experience. Our guide Daniel made the trip especially entertaining and memorable. We were chatting most of the way and he did a great job of explaining all of the sites along the way. I would highly recommend this company and hopefully you get paired up with Daniel!
Kat's the best!!. Absolutely amazing way to see Prague. Good views, Kat was very informative and heaps down to earth. I highly recommend it!!

Fun, friendly, and knowledgeable guides. I actually went on two bike tours in the same day, the Prague City one with Hattan and the Panoramic one with Travis. Both were excellent tour guides. They were informative, helpful, and friendly, especially Travis. Since the tour with Travis only had me and one other person, he frequently chatted with us and catered the tour towards our individual preferences (e.g. I wanted to take pictures of everything). Overall, great tour with great guides. These tours were why I loved Prague so much. I would recommend this to anyone.

Informative and fun. We are just back from our wonderful ride with our guide Kat. The ride through Prague was fun on its own, but a bit was scary at times. However, guide made it easy for us. The bikes were in very good condition to ride on cobble stones and steps, the guide was fun to be around and knowledgeable, Prague is a beautiful city what else you would like to get from a bike ride?

The scenic side of Prague. The bike tour I took of Prague proved to be a very effective way to explore the city in a short period of time. Our tour guide, Kat, was very informative, and I would recommend this tour for anyone who would like to see the city without walking all day.

Great ride, ok tour. Initially I wasn't going to write a review. However, after getting ask several times on and after the ride and then getting an email from Praha Bikes encouraging me again, I decided to write it. First off, I thought the ride itself around the city was excellent. I also thought our guide, Kat was nice and energic. That said, two things really bothered me about the tour. First, there were lots of jokes about the partying ex-pats - where they drink, how much they drink, and how awesome it is. I think Prague is an amazing city. But the thing I like least about it is frankly the drunken ex-pats whose primary mission it seems is to get as wasted as often as possible. There was a couple from New Zealand on my tour and I was frankly embarassed by the constant references to drinking. We were even encouraged at the end of the tour to visit a local pub because of all the great beers you could get. I thought, "Really? That's what we should go do in the Prague?" The second thing I found annoying was how little was actually convey about the city or country during the tour. This is a bike tour so I'm not expecting an indepth lecture. But I guess I was hoping for more than a rehearsed caption. This is actually a critique of other bike tours. Rather than offer a couple of tour-by trivia, what not mention three major challenges the city has struggled with in the last couple of centuries - or even in this century. Or three city-planning things that make biking in the city better? Or just three important reasons to care about the city - architecture, science, nature, or anything really. Again, I'm not looking for a doctoral thesis. But on this tour and the one I took in Paris, it was like hearing a tired script that lacked any context or reason to care. Again the bike ride was great and our guide was amiable. I would also add the the bikes themselves weren't great. My daughter's bike broke and we had to get it exchanged. My bike also had to be exchanged. I imagine they take a beating but I thought the bikes could have been in better repair.

Must Do! Loved Prague!. My friends and I had an amazing time on this tour. Sasha was our guide...He was reaallyy good! Gave us a lot of info about the city and its history. Sasha took us to a local restaurant where we ate Czech food...it was great and cheap! Our tour was 6.5 hours! it was great..it went really fast. We took this tour b/c we only had a day to see the City...totally worth it! Prague is amazing and charming! Thank you for such a great tour!!

GREAT TO DO!. Vlad was our tour guide...he was amazing! Added lots of information about the city and history and politics! The tour was 2.5 hrs but was great. The cobblestones take a little to get used to but are easy to bike on. He showed us a great place to eat at down the road - it was fantastic!!!

We love praha!. Had an amazing time with Kat on our Beer Garden Bike Tour. Loved riding along the river and through the parks of Prague, would've never found these places on our own. Thank you Kat for a great ride and all of your help, you made our trip!

Fantastic way to see Prague!. Prague is an incredible charming city, relatively small yet has several districts. Biking through the maze of crooked streets and alleys was wonderful. Daniel our guide was knowledgable and entertaining. Daniel kept an easy going pace and gave a colorful review of the many landmarks and historical sites. He was also very helpful in making recommendation for local restaurants and clubs as we'll. Also, the young woman at registration was very helpful as well, and gave us a great" Lokal" lunch recommendation too.

Indeed the best way to see prague. We got in to prague on the 18th of may and we took a 2.5 hour tandem bike tour around the city and along the river. It was beautiful. The experience was amazing. We regretted not doing it for the rest of our stay there but I would highly recommend biking around the entire prague with the various tours they have rather than walking for hours. This is amazing! Ask for Travis! Excellent guide!

Best way to see Prague. What a fabulous way to see Prague ...we booked in advance for the whole day bike tour for the first day of our visit to Prague. We arrived to discover that we were the only participants - so it was my partner and I plus the tour guide Sasha (not sure thats how he spells his name) and an Italian female tour guide who was learning the ropes. We had an amazing day, with some very funny moments including the local police chasing us on his sedway because we had gone down a pedestriam path, and a complete soaking when the heavens opened in the last half hour of our ride !! We saw so much, had a couple of beer stops (it was extremely hot apart from when it rained !!) and a fabulous czech lunch in a traditional resturant. Sasha was a brilliant guide and great fun to spend the day with. We learnt loads about the history of the city and various landmarks. I would highly recommend this as a really great way of seeing the city and would certainly suggest that it is good to do on the first day of the visit as it enables you to identify places that you might like to go back to and spend more time.Thank you Sasha - you made our visit to this beautiful city even more perfect !

Best tour to see the charm of Prague. This is a locally operated company, not a corporate type facility, that has competent tour guides that take you to the most sought after landmarks and views -they know the best of the best.We picked this bike company because it had a wide variety of interesting tours that sparked our interest, and the best price.Our guide was Travis, he is from the United States but lives and works in Prague, his new home. He was knowledgeable in when to use what bike gears and made it easy and safe for us to follow along. He was full of history specific to our stops and landmarks he pointed out, he also entertained us with answering cultural and political questions so we could gain a locals perspective.After we returned to the bike store we were pointed to a great mostly locals place near by to eat. Also, once a tour is competed buying a Praha bike shirt comes at a discounted price... We got a few.

Excellent way to take in 'Praha'. Ask for Kat!. If you want to take in a lot of what Prague has to offer, this excursion is for you. It was an overcast, rainy day when my tour group went (less than ideal for a bike tour). However, I still rate my experience as 5 star, given the knowledge and outgoing nature of our tour guide, Kat. She was funny and engaging, while giving through descriptions of each site we stopped at. She also provided some great recommendations for lunch spots and other attractions to take in following our excursion.

Perfect way to see the city!. Had a tour with Kat this morning, she was funny, smart and very knowledgable of all things Prague! She came for a beer with us after and had some awesome advice on what to do with the rest of our day here. Go Kat go!
Kat is the best!. The best way to see Prague. Make sure you get Kat as your guide, she went above and beyond to make an enjoyable experience.
Great way to explore.. Kat rocks! Thanks so much for all your advice and fun facts. We explored the whole city and learned where to return and what to see/do in our short stay.

Just As Advertised. My wife and I decided to take a bike tour to maximize our time in Prague. It was a great decision. Vlad was our guide -- he's a really cool guy from Prague, with an easy going personality and genuine love for his city. He gave us a lot of information about the things we were seeing, but it didn't seem scripted, which was nice. And he was able to answer all of our questions. He also did a nice job of explaining the culture of the city, including its current political climate, and how it all compares to the things we experience in the U.S. That made for a very well-rounded tour. I was also pleasantly surprised by the easy pace of the ride and the quality of the bikes. They're mountain bikes (probably because of the many cobblestone streets in Prague), not the beach cruisers that many tours use. That made the ride much more comfortable.
Great tour.. One of the high lights of our trip. Our tour guide, Kat is the best!!! This was a great way to learn about the city, get some exercise and have some fun!!!

Great Experience. There are a lot of tour options in Prague - including other bike places - and we are so glad we found Praha Bike. They went out of their way to accomodate us. We attempted the Beer Garden Tour and got rained out soon after we started. Our wonderful guide Kat invited us to go on her City Tour the next morning AND took the time afterward to personally take us to one of the Gardens we missed the afternoon before. On top of that she is a wonderful and informed guide who knew a lot about the city. We decided also to keep the bikes for the afternoon and they were great.
Recommend it. They have a great level, normal cost, good bikes and good instructors. I recommend it for you. We were satisfied of our trip from Prague to Zbraslav and Dolni Brezany.

Greenways bike tour support. When we began planning our 2014 Prague-Vienna-Budapest bike tour, we reviewed all of the options, including the multinational tour companies and the locals. Our search led us to a conversation with Praha Bikes. Since we were comfortable going it alone, traveling with our own bikes and touring unassisted, what we really wanted was a local contact in Prague who could help us with the really tough stuff. Things like helping us with airport transfers, bike mechanical issues if they came up after unboxing the bikes, maps and most importantly, local knowledge. The team at Praha bikes were awesome! They were happy to help us with what we needed and never tried to talk us into extras that we didn't. We'd love to do a tour with them someday. We'd highly recommend Praha if you are considering a bike tour along the Greenways or catch up with them on one of their other tours.

Terrific 4 hours in Prague. We took two tours in prague - the chateau tour with kat, and the paroramic tour with vladimir earlier in the week. Both tours were great but quite different. The chateau tour is mostly flat and take you out of the city along the river. We stopped for delicious beers in two great outdoor locations and had a terrific time. There is just one big hill and its easy enough to push your bike up, if thats whats needed.The panoramic tour took us up by the prague castle for some terrific views however, you could walk up there to see the same thing. Nothing wrong with this one but we liked getting out of the city and stopping for beers at some prague non tourist spots. Oh, the chateau is very impressive to see but it isnt open so you walk around it and look at the gardens for 20 minutes.Both tours are easy to do if you are in decent condition and ride a bike once in a while. The washroom in the bike shop is a bit nasty so use one elsewere before you ride. The shop is easy to find as its close to the main square and astronomical clock. My suggestion is to get your Prague history and in town orientation using the excellent free walking tours (we used prague airport transfer service and their terrific free four hour tour).Remember to tip your guide at the end. We certainly recommend getting out on a bike outside of Prague!

Great tour of Prague with Kat!. We went on the all-day bike tour with Kat and loved it! She was super informative about Prague's history and we had a great time at the beer garden and lunch. I definitely recommend the all-day tour to anyone visiting Prague!!! Thanks for everything Kat!

Great Way To See Wonderful City. Was a brilliant way to see the city which I would highly recommend. Our tour guide Sasha was excellent. He was friendly with a great knowledge about the city and even went beyond the call of duty by helping arrange our remaining time in Prague explaining bus and tram times and recommending local restaurants and bars which were great. Regards the tour itself, was extremely interesting and I felt it was a great way to explore the city and get a taste of the rich history and culture.
Great tour of Prague!. Awesome way to see Prague! Our tour guide Sasha was great and knew so much about the buildings/history etc. So much fun!

Epic Bike Tour. We signed up for the Epic bike tour which includes a 2 1/2 hour panoramic tour of the city by bike and then a pub crawl afterwards. The bike tour part with our guide Vladimir was excellent!! Ask for him if you do any bike tours. He is a Czech resident and was a Teen during the early 90's and has a passionate viewpoint of the liberation going on at the time. The next part however (pub crawl) could have been better. There was supposed to be an organized dinner in between to a favorite Czech restaurant (dinner price not included but still supposed to be accompanied). That part didn't happen. They just told us to go grab a bite and then come back for the pub crawl. There was a large group and they basically just took us to a bar for one free hour of drinking. then on to two more bars for welcome shots and then to a nightclub. There was not "tour" part where they might have explained the history of the bar, etc. It was basically just follow around the horde and drink. I would have liked a smaller group and maybe some explanation of each locale. The guides were fun and enthusiastic though. I would have just enjoyed some history mixed in with the drinking.

A good way to see Prague. A group of 8 of us decided to see the highlights of Prague via bicycle . This cost us 540kc approx £16 a person. Our guide was an American girl called Kat, her local Knowledge was brilliant. She knew all sorts of interesting things and took us to places we probably wouldn't have found ourselves. I'm not a cyclist and I managed to keep up. We stopped regularly, to make sure we were all together, there was 12 of us in the group altogether. There was only a couple of places where you had to have your wits about you, but Kat made sure we all knew what was coming and how to deal with it. The length of the tour was approx two hours. And I would definitely recommend .

Great way to sight see Prague!. My husband and I went on a short 2 hour bike tour around Prague with Sasha. We had a great time and we got to see places we wouldn't had seen even otherwise. Sasha was friendly, knowledgeable and flexible. I would recommend it to anybody wishing to sight see Prague by means of bicycle!
Nice tour with Vladimir. Vladimir is a nice guide who can easily adopt to the people he guides. You see the highlights of the city, definitely worthwhile.

Classic city tour is a must!. I took a bike tour around main sights of the city.The guide Vladimir was very knowledgable,shared really interesting stories about the places. He also gave great recommendations of local restaurants and breweries. Besides it is an excellent way to meet new people.You definitely must start your acquaintance with Prague from this bike ride!

Quick bike rental. Rented bike for 2 hours. Got quick and adequate help from a friendly clerk. He lined up various bike routes in town. They turned out to be perfect. Prices was ok. The only con was that the gear of the bike was making some short cuts from time to time.

Cycling Praha and surrounding area. Great outfit - booked on line and joined 3 different tours, all were well led and had a great mix of people. The tour guides were all different and gave their own emphasis. All were knowledgeable. The long ride out to Karlstejn castle was great including beer stops and lunch. The castle visit was accompanied by thunder and forked lightening! Will was great at getting the group to mix and and share experiences of Praha. Many Thanks

Panoramic Tour led by Travis. I love bike tours because you get to see so much and glide in between attractions, while having a local give his or her insight. Our guide, Travis, made the evening/night. What was scheduled to be a 2.5 hour tour ended up nearly 5 hours thanks to Travis' patience and interest in showing our small group around. He was knowledgable and, more importantly, honest in answering our questions and giving his opinion, lifting the veil of tourist marketing.And thank you, Travis, for suggesting the local food and beer joint that I would have never found on my own.

Great guide, that actually spoke english😃. Be prepared for lots of bumpy roads and a sore back. But the Tour take you around the City and gives you a good view. Our guide Kat, Was very informative and helpful - also Towers strangers

Kat was FAB. We really enjoyed our bike tour round the city of Prague. Despite the traffic, cobbles and tourists, Kat and Martin made sure we safely crossed the city. We had frequent, informative stops. It really was a great way to see Prague. Thanks.
Excellent bike tour. We had a bike tour with Kat who was energetic, knowledgable and fun. We were able to ask as many questions as we wanted and she was always willing to help. Recommend this tour.

3 hour town bike tour with Victor. 21/04/14 Was a great few hours, got to see the sites and our guide was really good. Very helpful, told us plenty and made sure we had a great time. He refreshment stop was excellent, bikes were good too. Thanks

If you want a bike tour look no further. Our guide Travis was amazing. Very knowledgeable, laid back, and just a really cool guy. His insight on the history of Prague was very informative. The weather cooperated and I'm glad I booked this tour. Been on a mini Euro trip and this was by far the best tour with the best guide. Thanks!

Day trip to Karstejn castle – best excursion ever!. We took the country bike tour down to Karstejn castle, about 40 km south-west of prague. Even for unexperienced cyclers it's a great route as it's 99% flat, you just need to sit back and enjoy the wonderful mountains and countryside around you. The castle itself and village below it are one of the most beautiful places I've seen in Europe. The nice thing about it is that the tour is much adjusted to the groups' desires – there's no official schedule and finishing time so you set the pace… you can either take your time and have a laid back tour, spend more time at the stops (beer and other drinks included in the price), or take it more seriously.But eventually, what made the tour so great was no doubt our guide Nick. Nick was very attentive to our preferences, suggested different route options, took us to his favorite points even if they were off the main route, adjusted himself to our pace and in Karlstejn he took us to the best restaurant in the Czech republic. Mainly, you could tell that his not in it just for the money and is very enthusiastic to share his passion and knowledge. It felt more like an outing with friends than a guided tour. Bottom line – ask of Nick.

Great Time and Tour!. I did a tour with Kat and half of my Contiki group and had a great time! We got to see so much of the city and Kat was an excellent guide with great information - also, she put up well with my non-stop bell ringing! Great sites, great company, interesting history and information about the city and culture. Highly recommend!

Brilliant Day and Ride to Karlstejn Castle. Three of us joined the 38km ride to Karlstejn and its Castle. It took about 3 hours and our guide Sasha was wonderful. He was informative and helpful and the pace was just right. It's generally flat ground with only one small hill. It's a beautiful ride by the river and through the countryside, and the castle is majestic, perched on the hill above the village. I would thoroughly recommend the tour.

Best day in Czech! . I booked a day trip to Karlstejn castle. I was the only one who booked for the tour that day and they made no complaints about running the tour for one person! Sasha was my guide, and he made my day! He made sure I was comfortable, and had lots of knowledge about the town and its history. He answered everyone of my questions. The ride was easy and enjoyable. The castle was amazing, better than I expected, I was really just on the tour for a ride through the country side. The scenery is picturesque, I definitely recommend this tour for anyone that wants to see a little more of Czech!

Awesome. Had an incredible experience with this Company. Such Value for money and friendly service. The staff were so friendly and informative. We enjoyed ourselves so much on the Classic tour that we hired bikes the following day to explore the City by ourselves. Totally recommend the E bikes for a long hire, the time flew by and the sights so interesting.

Cycling and beer. Kat from Praha bike brought 2 of us on the Beer Garden tour on Saturday after helpfully reorganising due to rain on (Good) Friday. It was a lovely sunny day and Kat showed us parts of Prague that we would never have seen on a weekend trip. We watched the Kayakers practicing on the canal and visited Stromovka and Letna parks. It was such a relief to get away from the hordes of tourists crammed into the old city and the sardine-like experience of Charles Bridge. She was really friendly, informative, chatty and great fun to cycle around with. A thoroughly enjoyable experience - suitable for easy-going cyclists of all shapes and sizes........with good Czech beer as a bonus :-)

Nice escape from the hordes. Thanks Kat. Lovely afternoon in the sun on the Beergarden tour. We enjoyed the route, the bikes, the people watching, the olympic kayakers, the beer gardens, the parks, the company, and getting away from the five hundred million people on the Charles Bridge. Would definitely recommend this to anyone in Prague for a couple of days and interested in how the Pragers spend their sunny days. Cheers, Nick
Our guide KAT was awesome!. As part of my contiki tour we got a bike tour. KAT was an awesome guide. Very knowledgable and very personable. Highly rec

A highlight of our trip to Prague! . We did the classic city tour during our stay in Prague. Our first ever bike tour of a city so was a little anxious at first and didn't know what to expect but we absolutely loved it! Our tour guide Kat was great who was so lovely and knowledgable and made us feel very safe cycling with her. An easy, relaxing bike ride suitable for anyone! We saw lots of the main attractions and some we wouldn't have gotten the chance to see had we not taken the tour. The beautiful weather made it even more pleasant. Will definitely be going back to Praha bikes for another tour if I'm ever in Prague again. One of the highlights of our trip and would highly recommend this tour, thanks Kat and Praha bikes!

Bike Tour of Prague. My family booked the City tour with Praha Bike Tours and Rental. The route is flat, bikes easy to use and the pace very easy going, suitable for all levels of fitness.Our guide - Hatem - was the revelation! His knowledge of Historic Czech Architecture was not only extensive but was delivered in a truly engaging manner.Although we were out on the roads in cold weather we could easily have spent the whole day with Hatem such was standard of the tour.On our return to Prague, which will now be sooner rather than later we hope to book Hatem and Praha Bike Tours again. As this tour guide leaves you wanting to know more about Prague.

Would give 10 stars and do it all over again.. We booked a cycle tour with Praha Bike from Prague to Karlstejn Castle which leaves at 9.30. The route is flat and follows cycle-ways along the river Vltava and a smaller tributary river to the bottom of the castle. There was a quick pub stop along the way and a food stop at Karlstejn village before walking up to the impressive castle which towers above. We enjoyed the cycling so much that we asked if we could cycle back instead of taking the train (as is usual). We cycled on quiet but more hilly country roads and cycle-ways, and arrived back around 6 pm having enjoyed all of it! The scenery, bikes, foods and especially the tour guides were fantastic ! Andre (and Daniel) was down-to-earth, knowledgeable and local. What a great way to explore such beautiful city with superb guides. If you are gonna choose only one tour, look no further.

Fab day trip to Karlstein Castle. My husband and I took a day trip to Karlstein castle last week with our guide alex, who was very informative and nothing was too much trouble. Alex discovered we were keen cyclists and even read our minds and suggested we cycle back instead of the train ! Can't recommend the company enough . , even after over 47 miles of cycling x

Great way to se the City. Nice bikes, good guides, 2 1/2 hours tour over the main attractions of the Old Town Prague, you dont need to be an expert on biking to make this tour.After the tour i rented my bike for another 3 hours and visited the tower up the hill.

Karlstein Castle. My family and I took a day trip to Karlstein Castle. Alex was our guide. We also had Travis with us as he was in training. We had a great day. Alex was informative and interesting. It was a terrific day,We realized when we arrived back at the train station in Prague, that where we were go to next was just blocks away. Alex made arrangements to have 2 or the 3 bikes ridden back to the bike shop. The 3rd bike was WALKED back by Travis. The ride was a 10 minute event through town. It saved us a lot of time. It was very much appreciated. They went beyond the call of duty and made it happen for us.I would not hesitate to recommends Praha Bike to future travelers. The bikes were well kept and comfortable.Thank you Alex and Travis and the entire staff and Praha Bike. I trust you will have a wonderful season.!

Relaxing ride after dark!. We went on the 'Night Prague Legend Bike Tour' and were pleasantly surprised that it was a private tour for 2 (500kc per pax). Our guide, Hatem, was extremely friendly and entertaining. He shared his passion for the lovely city, telling us myths and lesser known facts as we cycled around the cobbled streets. It was safe to cycle as night, as there was less traffic and pedestrians. Helmets could also be rented from the store before departure. The tour was about 2 hours and we started at 8pm (it got quite chilly as we cycled). The tour provided a great summary of the key places of interest in Prague: John Lennon Wall, Prague Castle, David Černý's artworks, Astronomical Clock, Jewish Quarter, Charles Bridge. Would definitely recommend this tour!

Excellent city tour. Just the best way of visiting Prague. Our guide, Travis, was so professional yet cool and told us many fun facts you wouldn't expect on a guided tour-all the better :-) all in all, definitelly recommend it!

Worthwhile, I can recommend it.. Although I've taken much more entertaining bike tours in other cities, this bike tour was certainly good enough that I would recommend it. I was very happy with the equipment, the sites we visited, and the guide's handle of the streets and the course we took. We took our kids, ages 10, 8 and 5. The ten-year-old had no problem with the bike they had for her, and they accomodated the other two by providing a tandem for myself and the eight-year-old, and a rear bike seat for the five-year-old riding with my wife.

amazing !. The best part of our trip ! beautiful weather and also a great way to see the city and learn some interesting facts. our tour guide Yana (not sure if I am spelling that correct!) was very sweet and told us lots of things we wouldn't have known and places we wouldn't of found. highly recommended and worth the money :)

Perfect for Orientation. This is an ideal way to see the layout of historic core of this compact city, following an almost flat route (though look out for some rough setts and shallow steps). Vladamir, our guide, gave us a brief history of the city, and had a refreshingly unstuffy angle on its sometimes troubled history. The pace was perfect for us, and included a short break with (optional) opportunity to enjoy the local beer. On our first of three days in the city, this was ideal for us to identify places we wanted to come back to and see a little more of.

Excellent way to see Prague in a short time. Excellent!! I only had 3 days in Prague and seeing the city via cycling was a good choice! Bikes were well maintained, Prague is very cyclist friendly too! Ondrej as our guide for the day. He's very knowledgeable, and kept the tour interesting. He was able to point out interesting facts and places that I would not have known or missed if I were to explore the city on my own. Thumbs up!

Praha Bike - Great way to discover Prague. Travelling home from our holiday on ski's in Spindeleruv Mlyn we spent a day in Prague and deceided to stretch our legs and ride around Prague with Praha Bike. The bikes were well prepared and robust to coop with the cobblestone streets in Prague. It made me feel comfartable and looking at the infrastructure of Prague I was glad we were not riding around on a Segway or Ebike there. We had an amazing and informative ride around the city on the Classic City tour. Learned more about the Czech and Prague history. Enough to, now we are home, dig more in what was learned and prepare for our next visit there :). Jan Hus, David Cerny ..... we will be back soon.Thanks Praha Bike for the great tour !!

Excellent way to see the city. Excellent way to see the city, tour guide was a Czech native and was extremely knowledgeable. group size was perfect and our tour guide gave us some excellent recommendations for food and bars. good value for money

The way to see Prague. We did the cycle tour of the city on our first day in Prague and what an enjoyable and informative way to gain an insight into the city. The equipment was well maintained, the guide knowledgeable and friendly. The cycling was not too demanding with plenty of stops at interesting locations. Half way though the tour we stopped for a drink and food. This was just a great way to see Prague and I would recommend you do it as soon as possible after your arrival in the city.

Very Enjoyable tour. Just back from the Classic City Tour. Our guide was Andre who was very informative and witty. Very enjoyable tour in a relaxed fashion. Saw loads in the 2.5 hours, including places we probably never would have walked too. Must do if in Prague. Keep up the good work guys.

Great Tour of Prague. It's a really great deal if you're looking for a fun way to see Prague. I've taken several bike tours in Europe, but Praha Bike was great. My guide, Francesco, was able to answer most of my questions while also pointing out and explaining all the main historical spots on our tour. I absolutely recommend a tour with them when visiting the city.

Great way to see the city. Vladimir was an excellent guide, sharing his local knowledge and experiences as well as giving all the historical facts. Lots of tips on where to visit and local eating and drinking venues.
Amazing fun. Lots and lots if fun. Really cheap and good bicycles. The ebikes are really great. You can tour the whole city in several hours. I went to petrin hill.

Great bikes, great guide and great memories. Researched this tour prior to visiting Prague and this tour certainly didnt disappoint. We opted for the electric bikes and although the weather worsened at the start of our tour, Praha Bike were more than happy to reschedule to the following day. Our guide Francesco was enthusiastic, knowledgable and really made the tour for us. This is the best way to see this fantastic place. Take a camera as you will see some of the best sights of the city. On top of all this we ended up with some great personal recommendations for places to eat and drink, which of course we had to try! Thanks to all the team at Praha Bikes and a special thank you to Francesco!

Didn't get a lot out of this one. I love a bike tour but there just didn't seem to be much biking here and the guide seemed rehearsed/wasn't really reading the crowd for interest. We hit some beautiful spots, I just wish we'd gotten more intel on what the city neighborhoods are currently like, rather than just the longer-winded historical points.

Boring and not much riding. My friends and I love doing bike trips when we travel in other counties but were not impressed with this one at all. Our guide was very boring, talked for long periods of time and shared dry, boring facts about historical landmarks. We barely rode our bikes-- maybe less than 5 kilometers in 2.5 hours.

Best tour ever!. My husband and I did the all day Ebike tour with Praha bike tours to Karlstejn Castle with Francesco as our guide. It was probably the best all day tour we have ever done in Europe. The scenery was absolutely amazing and the Ebike so easy to ride! We rode 45km in under 3 hours! Highly recommend this tour and an absolute must when visiting Prague!

Great way to see the city. We did the prague city tour- a whistle stop 2 1/2 hour trip around the major city sites. The bikes were of good quality and the biking easy as the tour we did was completely flat. The tour was great value compared to the price we have paid in other European cities.The tour guide Vladimir was very knowledgeable about the history of Prague, the sights and places to eat. Biking in Prague is safe enough although other road users aren't as bike aware as in the other cities we have had cycle tours in. Worth every penny- would definitely recommend

Excellent Bike Tour. My wife and I participated in the Praha Bikes All In One Tour on our recent visit to Prague. What an excellent adventure. Perfect way to see ALL of the major sites of this beautiful and historic city in one day while getting some great exercise. We were joined by three fun loving Aussies and a really great guide, Francesco, who was both very informative and and interesting guy. Highly recommend this activity to all bike lovers.

Bike to Karlštejn Castle. This review is based on our trip to Karlštejn Castle.While the 8:45 AM starting time was early for my California sleep patterns, the journey made it well worth waking up. The scenery was beautiful. And the surprises (good) were plentiful. There's some coordination necessary for some of the tours at the castle. (http://www.hradkarlstejn.cz/informations-for-visitors-2013/guided-tours/ ) Note that without the castle tour you still see the castle - get to walk around the grounds, go down to the well, all with great information from the guide, but if your intent is to take the interior tours, coordinate in advance. Do: Bring a camera - there's plenty of pictures to be take Bring the right gear, though I believe Praha Bike can help out with some of it if needed. I brought a backpack with my waterproof jacket and camera. Lucy strapped a basket on so I didn't have to wear it all day – a nice bonus.Based on what I’ve read on tripadvisor and my experience, expect the guides to be worth their weight in informational gold. Lucy was knowledgeable about the city, the countryside, and the castle. Everything from the suggested photo ops, delicious crepes, and wonderful insight into life in Prague was appreciated. Děkuji to Lucy and Praha Bike
Pleasant. It was so close to city center and stuff was very friendly. They draw us a good route. Bikes were well kept. And after biking they offered a good place to eat. It worth every penny.

Fantastic experience!. The private bicycle tour of Prague with Francesco was one of the highlights of our trip! We were a few minutes late, but the staff were expecting us since we made reservations and pre-paid online which was very convenient and easy to do. Helmets were included in the price and Francesco and the other staff found us good, comfy hybrid bikes and adjusted the seats accordingly. We reviewed bike safety and rules of the road prior to starting The pace and flatness of the Classic City Bike Tour was easy for a couple of 30-somethings and at the first stop Francesco checked to see how our bikes were working and made sure we were comfortable and not having any equipment problems. Francesco was extremely knowledgeable about architecture and the history of both the city and the various highlights of the tour. He was also very kind and took our picture upon request many times. We felt like we saw much more of the city than we would have been able to do so on foot and got a much richer history at the same time. The price of the tour was excellent and well worth the value and Francesco gave a stellar tour of Prague!

Get away from the crowds and see the country. We took TWO bike tours in our four day stay in Prague and were lucky enough to have Francesco both times. We took a bike trip to Chateau Troja and a longer one to Castle Krumlov. Francesco was a wealth of knowledge about the history and sights as well about what to see and do AND eat! We choose the country rides to get away from the throngs of tourists. It made for a nice balanced stay and the exercise was good after consuming all the pork and beer.

Electric Bikes Awesome!. Just finished a 3.5 hour bike tour of Prague with Francesco (an Italian from Perguia). My first time on a steroid-fueled electric bicycle through the Old City of Prague, across the river with mind-blowing views of Prague's famous bridges, to the top of the park with breath-taking views, and into the golden light of late afternoon sunlight on Prague's castle walls. Okay, downhill on cobblestones was not my favorite part but after a stop in the beer garden I was able to cope. Praha Bikes is a nice group of people, running a good operation. All were courteous, professional,and reliable. Don't miss this experience. Patti from Nevada, aged 66.

Excellent city tour of Prague by Francesco at Praha Bike. Prague is a lovely city, but with so much to see, we found that a knowledgeable tour guide really helped us to discover much more than we could see by foot. Francesco was helpful, attentive, and provided many insider tips. We loved the diversity of our ride, and the stop at the John Lennon wall was the highlight of the tour. The ride was not difficult (all levels and ages could easily participate), yet it was nice to feel we got a big of exercise to work off all of the good meals we consumed during our stay. The shop is located right off of the main square - easy access. This was a highlight of our trip - highly recommended. And thank you Francesco for beign an excellent host.

To orient yourself to this fab city, Praha Bike teach, entertain, and invite you to experience Prague.. After arriving at 1300 and checking into lodgings, I lucked out with Hatam Berrezouga as my guide for an evening Legends tour by bicycle. He engaged me in his story telling and invites admiration and affection for this unique city and history. He offered a 'buffet' of history and insights through linguistics, religion, politics, (ghosts), and polished off his tour with recommendations for his favorite places. I have been to 4/5 of his recommendations so far and found his assessment made expectations match experience--I enjoyed every one! Hatam's delight in this city he conveys with each story; it's infectious.The staff welcomed me back the next morning for a different tour and helped me settle into a better tour to round out my exposure. Daniel kindly showed me around for this one and patiently answered my questions. Daniel (and Hatam) helped me select a day out of Prague by bus adventure as well....By the completion of two Praha Bike tours, I had a sense of Prague then and now, as well as the ability to navigate by landmarks. What a splendid trip(!), free of floundering and frustrating time lost by getting lost. Thanks!

enjoy the Moldau by bike. After walking through the historical city center, also want to explore the country side. A good way to do this is by bicycle. So I rented a mountain bicycle from Praha Bike. Next to the bicycle I got an map and a good suggestion for the trip I want to make. The staff could tell me in detail how to go, pointed out the special bicycle road next to the Moldau. Passing the friendly landscape, following the slow streaming Moldau.. great trip. The bicycle was in good condition, no problem. at all.Next time , want to do it again, will go to Praha bike

Great way to see Prague. We did the 7 hour tour and saw all of Prague. It was a nice small group of only 4 people and a well English spoken guide Andrew. I will say this is a tour you must be somewhat fit to do as we had some steep hills to climb but the views made it worth it!

Good route and information. It was easy biking around the central parts of Prague. Bikes were in good condition and easy to handle. A mix of culture and history included in the stops and it was great to both go along famous avenues and streets and into narrow alleys and through parks we probably never would have found ourself. The guid, Fransesco, was excellent. Fluent English, very friendly and excellent knowledge about Prague, history and architecture.

Great way to get know the city. We have taken city ride with Francesco. It was great tour - very informative comments, very beautiful views, comfortable bikes and excellent mood. I would recommend this tour for everybody who can ride a bycicle. Fracesco, thanks a lot for the tour :)

One of the best bike tours I have been on!. Recently took a bike tour of Prague with Praha bikes. Francesco was our tour guide and did a marvelous job. I have taken Mike's and Fat Tire tours in Berlin Paris amsterdam and I have to say Francesco' s tour was at the top of the list. It helped that the day was perfect but his command of English and his knowledge of the history and the architecture of the city was great. Highly recommend Praha and Francesco!!

Fantastic moment in Prague!. I went there in late Aug 2013. We rode the bicycle among the rain. It was nice and fun. Above all was our guide, ATEM who had background education on history and art. He gave us every details we ask, history, art, people and culture. Also he led us to "place" where only local person might know. This trip was the most favourite one of mine. DO NOT MIssed !!
Great bike tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our 2.5 hour bike ride with our guide Lucy. It was her third tour but it didn't show. Very insightful and we highly recommend taking one of their tours.

Brilliantly great tour!. I've join praha bike for Night Prague Legend Night Tour last month with Atem (our English speking tour guide). I could say that this tour is one of the best moments we have in Prague. Our giude, Atem, can intregate history, art, architect, legends and fun into our bike tour through 2+ hours. I've got experience with many places that cannot be reached by big group tour and around vast area of the city (because we are in bike not walking tour)Highly recommended with "Must not miss" Badge!

great idea!!! funny and interesting!. We are two students and were in Prague for 3 days. So we wanted to see as much as possible, that`s why we decided to make a bike-tour. You get around quickly and you get information you won`t find in any book. Our guide Francesco (Italian who speaks very good english) was just great and we had lots of fun with him. If you get the chance, ask for him!We would recommend the bike-tour to everybody!

Interesting and original !. I thought it was a strange idea to visit Prague by bike but it has been a great experience ! Our guide was young and dynamic, she explains us a lot of things about Czech history and came out with funny anecdotes. I would recommand to do the tour on your first day in Prague because you go through the main touristic places and have therefore a nice overview of what you can deeply discover on the following days.

Beer Garden Bike Tour. We went on the Beer Garden tour during our visit to Prague. The pace was very slow, and some of the ride isn't very scenic, but we enjoyed it nonetheless! Our guide Francesco was lovely and very informative. Before I went on this tour I hated gardens and beer, now I love both! You should take this tour, it's unique and fun.

Excellent, highly recommended. I found Praha bike on tripadvisor and after reading the glowing reviews we planned our trip to Prague around two of their tours:Big City Bike Tour and Country Tour to Karlstejn. I am so glad we did. The reviews speak for themselves and we had an excellent trip.The Big City Bike Tour with Vladimir was an excellent introduction to the city. Vladimir was a great guide and I most enjoyed when he went 'off script' to tell us about life in Prague, the history, the politics and his experiences. He was great at gauging how we were feeling and open to us asking questions. We enjoyed Vladimir's tour very much - he was engaging, relatable and easy-going.The Country Tour to Karlstejn was one of our best days in Prague. The castle is just as a castle would be, the real highlight is biking through the country and villages (although it is nice to end up somewhere). There is a bike path for the majority of the way and pub stops. Lucy was an excellent tour guide with her knowledge, humour and ability to make the group comfortable. Despite a cloudy/drizzly morning, our group of 6 wanted to continue and we made it to the castle by lunchtime before the rain really started. My bikeseat was problematic but Lucy fixed it immediately. She also took the time to speak to each one of us during the long, flat terrain. At the end of the day she helped us plan our evening and we went out to a lovely jazz club. Lucy went above and beyond and we thank her very much for that!We think the best way to see a city is on bike so we find bike tours in all the cities we visit. Vladimir and Lucy were two of the best tour guides we have had. Would highly recommend Praha Bike Tours.

Wonderful experience in Praha - プラハ市内のバイクツアー. I enjoyed very much Praha's histric sightseeing points riding on bike. Although I had my bag, they put a basket on back so that I could handle my bike easier. Explanation is very intelligible, sometimes with humor, very enjoyable. Since this city bike tour is easy for everyone, absolutely recommend to join to get to know more about this wonderful Praha city. I am grateful to the staffs in Praha Bike, thank you for a pleasant time, expecially our guide Fortuna, it happend to be all girl members in our tour, but it was sure more fun.プラハ市内の自転車ツアーに参加しました（英語です）。余裕を持って1１時半からの部に参加しました。自転車はママチャリ的なもので誰でも簡単に乗れると思います。特に日本の都会で自転車を乗りこなせる程度であればこのツアーは楽勝です。カバンがあれば、後ろにカゴを付けてくれます。雨が降れば、カッパは安く売ってくれます。出発後、有名なポイントで随時止まり説明を聞きます。説明は英語なので簡単な聞き取りや、多少受け答えができる方であれば、是非参加すれば楽しいと思います。有名ポイントに自転車で行きますが、入場する訳ではないので、自分で訪問する予習もしくは自分で行った後の復習として参加しても有意義な時間を過ごせます。

A Great Service. Great company and rage of services. We had an informative city tour and hired bikes for a couple of days taking ourselves north and south of the river. Staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Bikes are fine for the purpose (they take quite beating on the bumpy cobbled pavements and roads of the centre of Prague where mountain bikes with front suspension are wisely used). We hired bikes to cycle to Karlstein along the river and were given hybrids. In retrospect we would have preferred the mountain bikes, as some of the route need a Mountain Bike more than a Hybrid. But bike preference is very subjective. Any minor issues with the bikes were resolved on the spot. Nothing is too much trouble and we would use their services again. Free cold water available.The six seat team bike look great fun!Congratulations and thank you Praha Bike Cycle tours!

Fun, healthy and insightful - Panoramic and Castle Bike Tour. Katherine took us for the Panoramic and Castle bike tour. It was amazing and she is awesome.We got a bit of history of Czech as well as the context of the locations where we were stoping. It gave us a lot of ideas of what to do in Prague. Do it early in your trip!The ride was generally easy with a couple of hills and Katherine was patient.

Very informative and fun bicycle tour. We visited Prague with my whole family earlier this month. Being from Asia, first time over in europe, we were amazed by the beauty of this City, same as great customer service everywhere. Since we did not have much time, we decided to take a bicycle tour and it was a great choice. We saw almost everything in just couple of hours, learned all the history and it was a great fun too. Now i want to do bicycle tours everywhere I will go in the future :)

Great Trip, Great Guide. We went on the trip to Karlstejn castle with Lucy, and had a fantastic time. The ride through the countryside was beautiful, and a great way to see different parts of the country. While the scenery was good, our guide was equally professional and friendly. She made sure that everybody was having a good time and comfortable.That being said, as we are not avid bikers, what was quoted as a 3.5 hour bike ride ended up taking 5.5 hours, and the bicycles were in terrible shape. A more realistic estimate of the trip duration would be helpful, but an improvement in the quality of bicycles (my kickstand rotated a full 360 degrees and even got stuck in the rear wheel a few times) is in order.That being said, I would take this tour again in a heartbeat.

Amazing night tour in Prague. We have done the night tour and it was very great, amazing views of the town. Our guide Francesco was super and explained us all history and legends about the city. We recommend the tour warmly !

The best way to see Prague. After coming highly recommended by trip advisor, we were not let down-bikes were clean, well maintained and all came with a bell! Tour was extremely interesting and our guide Lucy was fantastic-couldn't fault her.It certainly beat walking!
Really great way to start your stay in Prague. Very informative and chilled intro to the city. Lucid our guide was very knowledgeable and good fun. Definetely recommend

Excellent guide and bike tours. We visited Prague for the first time and to make the most of our long weekend there, we needed to see alot of things in a little time. I also enjoy maintaining my fitness even while on a vacation, so Praha bike tours was the perfect way for us to see the city in an active but safe way. We did the guided bike tours: Classic City tour as well as the Panoramic tour the following day and together they complement each other perfectly, giving you a complete view of the city. Francessco was our guide on both days, he was very friendly and extremely knowledgable and touring with him gave us an opportunity to learn alot about Prague in our short time there. We did the Panoramic tour which goes to the Prague castle on our last day there. A tip for travellers interested in the Panoramic tour would be to go there before the end of your stay, as I learnt some interesting facts about the castle and cathedral and would have liked to visit, but was out of time.

Prague City tour. Had a great tour of the city with this company. Had terrible rain and wind our first scheduled day, so we had a rain check the next day. Our guide, Fortuna, was interesting and very condiderate. Lots of great information as we rode. Highly recommend this tour.

Great Service Bicycle Rental. I rented a bike for couple of days last month and was really happy with how easy everything went. Comunicating before I arrived - all questions answered imediatelly. On the spot - everyone friendly and very helpful. Very good rates, free maps and excelent recomendation on where to go in and around the city. Great job!

brill electric bike tour to kartstein!. Electric bikes are the way to go to Karlstein! Our skilful and considerate guide Jacob took us on a very scenic ride with enough breaks and lunch and information to make the whole day for our small group very satisfying. Thank you Jacob and Vic . Jan and Sabra

Great tour guide, Andrew, easy pace, lots of knowledge!. Great way to see the city and easier on your feet! Andrew took us to areas that we may not have visited in foot, excellent way to see Prague...

Karlstejn Castle and Great guide Lucy. We very much enjoyed a great day trip to Karlstejn Castle. The scenery was beautiful, it was a nice break into the country side from busy Praha, and our great guide Lucy was very knowldgeable, helpful, and fun to ride with. Her English was excellent and she made sure we were safe and well, and made a point of paying attention to each one of our tour members (our family of three and another couple). The staffs at the Praha Bike store is very friendly, helpful, and accomodating. We highly recommend this Bike store and the tours that they offer. We hope to come back to do more bike tours. Thank you!

A must do!. Our family of 4 (with 9 and 7 year old boys) enjoyed the panoramic tour. Vladimir was very informative. He piqued our interest in some of the areas, in hope to visit on our own when we had more time. This route highlighted the areas we wanted to visit. It also let us know of a good route to travel to them since we had our bikes with us (our previous forays were on busy streets). By the way, Praha Bikes offers a discount if you have your own bikes. Great customer service!

Praha - Dresden, self guided tour. I had the pleasure of biking along the rivers from Praha to Dresden with my 11 year old daughter this summer. Excellent vacation! I had booked and paid for two bikes, airport transport and bike pick-up in Dresden from Praha Bike in advance. A polite and friendly employee picked us up at the airport and drove us to our Hotel. We booked the hotel ourselves and picked the Hotel "Hastal Prague Old Town", located just around the corner from Praha Bikes. Next morning we got the bikes at the bike-shop, got them adjusted and equipped with everything we needed for the trip. We left our remaining luggage (had already been on vacation for a week) at Praha Bike. 6 days later Oleh, the manager, met us in Dresden after we had completed the tour picking up the bikes and returning the rest of our luggage to us. I must say that even if the logistics was a little complex Parah Bike handled everything flawless. There was always a smile on the faces we met. Very good! The trip as such is also highly recomended. Also with a 11 year old. The bike paths are flat, mainly paved, and mostly without any motorized traffic. The landscape is beautiful and you are never far from some small friendly establisment serving food and refreshments along the route. We had 6 days for the complete route. I clocked us in at about 250km with a few minor detours. We brought tent and camping gear and stayed at camp sites for three nights. The other two nights we stayed at hotels (booked "on the fly" per phone using a list of accomodations provided by Praha Bikes)Very pleasant experience, for both father and daughter! Do the "self guided tour" and let Praha Bike provide bikes and "logistical support"

Great tour, helpful guide!. A friend and I took this tour a few weeks ago with Andrew. He showed us around the Prague and was very knowledgeable about the city and its history (both of which we knew next to nothing about before the tour). After our tour, Andrew offered to email us some recommendations for restaurants and night spots in Paris, which was where he had lived previously. We went to a couple of the restaurants that he recommended and they were amazing! We would highly recommend Praha Bike tours to anyone!Thanks again for the excellent tour and Paris recommendations Andrew!

If you're fit enough to bike ride, don't miss this. We did the panoramic tour on our first day and we were very pleased. It is a great overview of the city and leaves at 5:30 pm. The guide was super informative and very knowledgeable and took the time to check on everyone, and explain the important things. The trip was about 3 and 1/2 hours (only meant to be 2 hours).I had never done a bike tour of a city, and this will definitely not be my last.
