Excellent Tour. Everyone should have a bike tour when arriving in Prague. Excellent guide Ryan was very knowledgeable showing us all the top sights of the city. Well worth it, very reasonable and a great way to chat to new people interested in this fabulous city.

Excellent tour to Karlstejn Castle and Panoramic City Tour.. During a recent trip to Prague I pre-booked the Karlstejn Castle Tour and Panoramic City Tour on-line (no problems with pre-paying on-line, and Ondrej was very helpful with the process and answering my questions about the tours). In both cases, I was the only person to book the tours, but Praha Bike honoured the booking and so I had two great one-on-one tours with my guides. Jakub was my guide for a great day trip to Karlstejn Castle. He was terrific company and shared information and stories about life in the Czech Republic. He willingly took me on a side trip to the canyon at Velka Amerika, as I had heard about this site and it was not too far from the Castle. Jakub was also very happy to cycle the 30 km trip back to Prague, rather than taking the train (the usual mode of return for this tour).This trip to the castle and through the countryside on the way was one of my highlights on this trip to Central Europe. I also did the Panoromic City Tour with Ryan, an American ex-pat but very knowledgeable about Prague and the sites on the tour. He too was great company and a great guide.I highly recommend Praha Bikes and the tours they offer.
Excelent city tour. I took the city tour and had a wonderful time. Our tour guide, Lucy, was very knowledgable and interesting. I would definitely recommend this place.

Excellent bike tour to Karlstejn Castle. I took a day tour to Karlstejn Castle. This tour was fantastic. First of all, the other people who originally booked the tour postponed and so i ended up doing the tour alone with the guide. I was quite impressed that the company still ran the tour despite this. So, I was very lucky to have a one on one tour all the way to Karlstejn. My guide was Vladimir and he was great. He is a local with world wide experiences and was able to answer all my questions about the Czech Republic. The ride down to the Castle is very scenic and not difficult (and this is coming from an unfit person, we also rode on a day that was 38 degrees). I recommend this tour, it was a great way to see another side of the Czech republic and experience it with a local.

Panoramic City Tour - I would do it again!. I went on the Panoramic Bike Tour of the city and it was one of my best experiences in Prague. My guide was Kristina and she was awesome! I had a great time with her talking about the history and politics of Prague. We went up the hill over to the Castle region with lovely views of Prague on the way. Then the bike downhill is great fun. You also get to see the Lennon wall, which is a must see in Prague. I also went on one of the their walking tours and I must say Dlouha 24 has some of the funniest, wittiest and amazing guides in town. and oh, of course I don't need to say, bring your cameras. don't run out of batteries like I did, unfortunately.

Excellent Bike Tour. Three friends and I did this bike tour while in Prague. After travelling Europe for so long it was nice to jump on a bike, ride through the city and hear about everything from a locals point of view. Definitely recommend when in Prague - Thanks Atem!

River and beer garden tour. This was a fun and relaxing afternoon bike tour. We got to see many places where locals spend their summer days relaxing. The views from our last beer garden overlooked the entire city and were amazing, but we did have to pedal up the gradual hill to get there, but in this case, the view really was worth the climb.

Are you tired from boring guided tours?. I had been in Prague for 6 days, and I had been really tired from boring guided tours, when I tried a bike tour! It was completely different! During 2 hours I saw almost the all most interesting places of the sity. And even the boring sightseeing attractions, seemed breathtaking. After the tour I rented the bike and had amazing journey by bike along the river. So it was only day, which I remembered in Prague! If I could repeate this travel, I would take the bike more often! On top of everything else it was a good training!

The Highlight of our Weekend. Really friendly and knowledgeable, our guide called Fortuna went out of her way to make this the best possible tour. Well worth it. Tip: ask her to call in at the bar in the pub half way.....a great break.

Classic City Bike Tour. We were in Prague for a couple of days for a stag do and felt like taking in some culture. We purchased the Classic City Tour with the Pub Crawl in the evening and we certainly got good value. Fortuna our guide from Mexico was great. On a very hot day she led us at a gentle pace around the Old Town, stopping to tell us some of the history of the areas and building which was very interesting.We followed the river down to the dancing building and corssed to the Lesser Town which was very pretty and which allowed us to stop in a park for a beer which was great.We headed back passed the Charles Bridge and though the Jewish quarter. The ride lasted 2.5/ 3 hours and was a great experience. It is the best way to get to know the city and get your bearings. The pub crawl that evening wasn't bad either.Highly recommended. I am planning on doing one of the longer tours on my next visit.
Brilliant Trip. We took the Karlstein Castle tripWhich was amazingRural Prague like you dont often see itOur Guide Francesco was wity and knowledgableWill recommend this tour to anybody!!

Wonderful Experience!. Me and my two other girlfriends signed up for this bicycle trip 1 day in advance through our hotel. It was a great way to see Prague and understand more about each building and the city. Our guide, Hatem was very friendly and helpful. Some parts of the route can be a little bumpy.. This is a must do in Prague and we certainly did not regret going for this! Note: It can be a little hot during the summer so you should bring your own water bottles as its not provided in the tour :)

Good Bikes. So, today I went in there and rented a bike. They offered me a map, helmet, repair tools incase, sunscreen lotion etc..They were all very friendly and helpful specially Fortuna. I was told the night before about a tour to Karlstejn castle that leaves around 9am. I overslep. But showed up there and took the trip on my own. Amazing!! Challenging and rewarding. I even stopped to take a swim at some lake around the path with a bunch of locals.

A great way to see Prague. My family and I went on the big tour of the city with Fortuna, the wonderful guide from Mexico. It was almost a private tour with only one other person. We covered a huge distance and saw all the main sights of Prague and some parts which we never would have discovered if we'd been on our own. Fortuna was extremely knowledgable and explained everything in beautiful English. I cannot recommend highly enough visiting a city for the first time by bike.

Awesome tour with An even more assine guide !. This is a very good way to see all historical and cultural monuments in Prague, as well as taking nice pictures with beautiful views on the top of the city.Our guide, Kristina, was perfect ! She is so easygoing, very smart and explain things very well. She is a very Nice person also, we were all pleased to meet her ! A must do in prague !

Must do in Prague!!. I took the beer garden tour on a friday evening. The good thing with an evening tour is that the weather is really nice and there is a cool breeze blowing while you ride. This tour has an excellent path, with a parallel river bank for most part, and going through green parks and over hills to get a bird eye view of the city. We stopped at 3 different beer gardens to have local Czech beers. The guide was amazing too as she told us fascinating stories throughout the journey. Only challenge was the difficulty level, its a 3.5 hour tour with more than 25km of cycling involved, some of it uphill.

Great trip to Karlstejn. From start to finish this trip was beautiful, well organized and informative. My guide, whose Italian name I am forgetting, was super helpful and gave fair warning about the difficulty level. There is almost no elevation but it is a longer ride (38km). It was great to be able to pay the full price online beforehand. If you are looking for an intense workout, this isn't the best tour for you. It's just a nice way to be active outdoors.

Strenuous ride around the city. We took the Beer Garden tour, and even though the website says the difficulty level is "easy," that is not really the case. The first part of the trip was relatively flat, but it took more than an hour to reach the first stop (and the bike seats aren't very comfortable). After that, there were numerous hills to navigate, which were definitely challenging. The beer gardens we visited were very nice, but our guide did not really join in the conversation or tell us much about the beer we were drinking. All in all, it was an okay evening but not one I'm sure we'd want to repeat.

Great full day bike tour. My husband and I had a great time touring Prague on the 6 hr ish "big one day tour" with Fratulla (sorry if I have misspelt). It was a fun way to spend the day checking out all the highlights of the city, plus our guide took us to great lookout spots which were not packed with tourists (a rare find). There were a few hills, but were pretty easy. Our guide was knowledgeable. Highly recommended if you've got a day.

Good stuff - solo tour only. I rented a bike for about seven hours. The bike was in good shape and they changed it because the first one didn't have a kickstand. And they include a lock which i loved because i made lots of stops. They're open till 20:00 which is great and the map they give you is very detailed (with marked bike routes). Loved the map. I followed the employee's recommended trail and it was a good tour. The only thing i'd suggest is they go over the bike with you. Show me the brakes are good. Show me it shifts, the tires are good, etc. Just because users don't always think about it.

great service. On my last two days in Prague I've decided to rent a bike and do some touring around the city on my own. This place looked the most professional from a first look on their web site and I was not disappointed when I got there. They offered me all different kinds of maps and recommendations, told me to call if anything happens with the bike and they would come help me!! The cost was only about 25 Euro for almost two full days too!!  Can only recommend this place. Thank you guys

Fun way to see Prague. We booked this tour after finding it via google search for bike trips in Prague. Easy to book online.Easy to find the start point/bike shop.Our guide-Daniel was Spanish, spoke great English and was an excellent leader. He was really knowledgable and had some good stories and little jokes.The ride was at a very easy/relaxed pace though you do need to have your wits about you as you are cycling on busy side roads and for us-on the wrong side of the road! Overall, a great way to spend 2.5hrs getting used to the sights of Prague.

Fun, but challenging!. We pre-booked this trip on Viator and when we arrived at the bike depot everything was in place and taken care of efficiently. The bikes are sturdy and quite heavy, but the staff were great at adjusting seat heights, fitting baskets, explaining gears etc. We are not regular cyclists, and found the pace quite fast compared with some of the other participants. There aren't many hills, but some of the surfaces are pretty uneven and challenging for amateurs like us. Maybe they should run a separate tour for experts and one for amateurs! Our leader Andrew was really nice, friendly, knowledgeable and approachable. Bringing up the rear was Vic, who was patient and attentive and took care to make sure we tail-enders were safe and on the right track. On arrival at Karlstejn we had a nice lunch (at our own expense, the website says lunch at own expense but the paper brochure says lunch included!) followed by a strenuous walk uphill to the castle. We had been promised a vehicle would take the bikes back to Prague but this never materialised so we had to take them on the train and ride them back - on cobbles through pedestrians - to the bike shop. All in all it was a fun trip and a great experience, but amateur cyclists need to be warned this is a long trip and quite a strenuous one!

not a good experience. me and my friends rented some bikes few days ago from this company. Price is overated for the service they offer: old bikes in not good conditions (gears not working, low pressure tires etc.) and generally it seems that the stuff don,'t really take care so much about the customer as we asked to them some specific direction because we had few time to visit the city and they looked very confused about our request. Anyway, I would suggest to anyone to visit Prague with a bike as it is a very beautiful town, but maybe try to find other option where to rent your bike.

Great Tour-Legends of Prague at night. Found this tour on TripAdvisor and so glad we did. It was a very easy ride and our guide Atem was very accommodating . I asked for a couple of stops a long the way and nothing was a problem. We did the night Legends tour. This was our first night type tour. Started at 8 and we were suppose to be done by 10:30 but our group ran a bit late. It was so much fun discovering the city as it got darker outside. Our guide Atem , made the history and the stops along the way interesting. On the subway ride home the kids just kept talking about how much fun it was.

Karlstejn Castle trip and tour of city. Our group of 5 took the ride to Karlstejn Castle with our guides Fortuna and Victor. What a beautiful ride through the Czech countryside. We had nice lunch before walking up to spend some time at the castle. Everything was well organized and the bikes worked great. The next day we took the big tour of the city. Another wonderful day and a great way to see the city.

Night tour with Francesco. We did the night tour with Francesco on our last night in Prague. We should have done it our first night! On bikes, you can cover so much more than a walking tour and the night tour had fewer crowds to pedal through. Because we had been in Prague for several days, he seemed to adapt the tour spending more time on places that we had not seen. He even helped us find two places (Lennon's Wall and where Mozart lived) that we had looked for on previous days but.couldn't find. My daughters ( in their 20s), my sister and I are casual bikers, typically to the grocery store and back, and found the pace to be perfect.

Best day in Prague. I just did the 35km bike trip to Karlstejn Castle yesterday. Easily the best day in Prague. Lovely ride; bike path goes by two different rivers. Even though we had a large group (16 people) our cheerful tour guide, Jakub, kept the whole day moving and did an exceptional job looking after everyone and making this a really fun experience. The actual tour of the Castle (which is not operated by the bike shop) is not exactly over the top, but once you've ridden all the way out there you might as well go for it.

This was the highlight of our stay in beautiful Prague!. Whether you are a regular cyclist or just want to casually pedal through the Czech countryside, this tour is definitely for you. Our guide, Jacob, is an incredibly nice young man who makes sure all riders are safe and having fun. From our stop at a small cafe for beers, to our lunch at Karlstejn Castle, our small group had an amazing day together. Traveling through the charming, beautiful villages along the river was incredible. I would recommend this bike tour to anyone who wants to spend a fantastic day in a quiet Czech setting with a wonderful, entertaining tour guide. What a great day!

Great tour. We decided to take the tour after hearing one of their tour guides explain a city sight to his group as we walked through town. We did the scenic tour which took us across the river and up to the castle. Our guide, Christina, was very informative and able to communicate well in English. She helped me understand the history of this city as we visited many points of interest. She was objective in her delivery of political issues. Well done.

Reasonable Bike Rental. We had a large group (16) and this place had the bikes ready and waiting and for rental bikes, not bad. The price was reasonable and the guys there were so helpful and friendly. This is the place to rent a bike! And there's a little beer pub next door. It is a little difficult to find, so I'm posting a few photos of what to look for because the shop is actually inside a little cove.

Awesome Tour. My wife and I did the scenic tour and it didn't disappoint. Our tour guide was an American from Louisiana (can't remember his name), but if you get him you will be very happy. He gave a great tour with all of the interesting facts that you can't find in books. He even went over on the time of the tour so we could stop and have a beer at the Beer Garden. If you want a great view of the city and learn a thing or two this tour is a great way to learn.

Fantastic way to see the city. Took a bike tour of prague while on my stag. This was a fantastic way to see the city and Francesco led the tour. He spoke very good English and was very informative and fun. The castle in particular was a real spectacle and the commentary from Francesco very interesting.Cycling around a city is just about the right speed, walking takes too long to see everything and from a vehicle you cannot get up close. I cannot recommend this enough I do have a few negatives though and if those were fixed this would be an easy 5.First, the instructions to get there were poor and appeared to direct us to a different cycling provider which was very confusing. Luckily we arrived early so were able to clear this up. I am not sure if this was the fault of the agent who we purchased the tour through or praha bike themselves but either way it is in their interest to have better directions whoever is providing them.Secondly whilst the bikes were clearly of quite good quality when new, a few had maintenance issues. Mine had a loose mudguard which was not dangerous but rattled constantly and was irritating. One of our party had faulty brakes. There was a repair man along with us but it was not made clear to us this was his role until someone's chain broke about a mile from the end of the tour, if we had known perhaps we could have raised these issues with the repair man earlier.In short a great tour just slightly let down by a few problems.

Better than the tourist books!. Francesco was our guide for the 2.5hr trip around the classic sights of Prague. This is a must " to do" before setting out with your books. It is a great way to get a taster of what the city offers if especially you are limited on time otherwise you can revisit sights at your leisure. The tour was fun and Francesco was very informed and engaging, answering any question thrown at him. Cycling through the city was fun and challenging - just ensure that you walk your bike over the pedestrian crossing if the police are around!

Fun, fun, fun. Highlight of my trip! Can't praise it enough. Prague was brought to life - its secret alleyways, culture, historic struggles, they all came to life. I had a very knowledgeable guide who was patient and friendly, held the bike while I went into some of the most stunning churches I have ever seen. I will now do a bike tour of any city I visit as you learn so much and have such a good time

Bike tour. We did a bike tour with Praha Bike Tours our first morning in Prague.The tour guide - Francesco- provided a great overview of the city's sites & architectural history. We're planning on taking the evening bike tour to see the castle & the city from on high.Highly recommended.
Great Day in Prague. Great day with Andrew in Prague... The floods made it a constantly changing itinerary but Andrew improvised and we had a great day of beer, bikes and sights. Highly recommend!

Wonderful Ride out of the Center. We took the Troja chateau tour with Andrew a few weeks ago, and it was one of the highlights of our trip. As mentioned in another post, Andrew was quite knowledgeable about the area (even to pointing out about the flood gates, which unfortunately were used shortly after our ride). The bike path along the river was lush, peaceful, and very pleasant to ride without vehicular competition. We saw so many things we wouldn't have been able to see timewise, on foot--from the kayak courses to the old section of town, to the beer festival, the dog training center, beautiful park, metronome and more. To top it off, we had a beer at Andrew's favorite pub, and the beer was amazing. We all felt energized and were thrilled to have gone. Great tour--thank you!!

Great tour!. Did the all-in-one city tour with Ryan. The tour was excellent and provided a great way to see the city and its main sights within one day. Ryan was really knowledgeable and provided great tips on places to check out in Prague. Highly recommend!

Good times. we had a great time on our Panoramic bike tour our guide Andrew was super he knowledge about the locale area for someone who had only been in Prague for 6 months was impressive. I can only recommend it

Favourite Part of Eastern Europe. The bike tour was the highlight of my trip to Eastern Europe. Our tour guide Andre shared his wealth of knowledge along with the tinge of humour that really made the experience an awesome one. I learned more about this city than I did of any other cities on my travels. Prague is a gorgeous city and a bike is the perfect way to explore it. It was an exceptional experience that far exceeded expectations!

PANORAMIC-CASTLE Bike Tour. We took a PANORAMIC-CASTLE Bike Tour with Ryan in the late afternoon. This is possibly the best time of day to do this tour because you will get to see the city at sunset. The PANORAMIC tour is more difficult than the classic city tour, as it includes a couple difficult hills. The extra work is worth the effort, this is the best way to see the city!Ryan is very friendly, he has a great conversational style and is very knowledgeable about the culture and history of the city.

Praha view tour. I went on a bike tour on May 15th with Ryan. It was super, fantastic!!! The tour lasted even longer than planned, but every minute was a pleasure. I would definitely recommend to anyone who is in Prague, take a guided tour with Ryan

A great company- highly recommend. My fiancé and I had a great time on the 2.5 hr tour of the city. It was an easy cycle, informative and fun, despite the somewhat crappy weather! Many thanks to Daniel our guide - he has a great knowledge of the architecture and art of this lovely city, and gave us a good basis of knowledge for exploring further on our own.As a group we chose not to stop for a rest break, but you are given the option. The staff in the rental shop were friendly and helpful, the bikes have decent suspension which is essential for the cobbled streets, but do let staff know if you're not familiar with cycling amongst traffic- you have to have some confidence to cross some of the busier streets but Daniel ensured we did so as a group. Good value- would highly recommend:-)

Prague-Dresden self-guided tour. Very well organised, Praha Bike were a pleasure to deal with by email and in person. Thoroughly enjoyed the self-guided tour, lovely scenery and villages/towns en route. Most menus in English as well as Czech/German. First day was the hardest day (got lost a couple of times but can easily get back on track with maps provided) but then got easier day by day (we did it in 5 days). No problems with bikes. Getting train back from Dresden to Prague was a bit chaotic, even if you have a space reserved for your bike, others seem to pinch it! Overall a brilliant trip and would recommend it to anyone who is reasonably fit, helpful to have cycled a bit before, wouldn't want to do it if totally new to cycling.

Highly recommended. Went on a bike tour with Praha while in Prague for the weekend with friends. Really informative ride, great way to see the city if you're only there for a short while. Guide was very friendly and knowledgeable, would highly recommended Praha Bike rental.

Cherry on top. Me and my mom took the big 6.5 hour tour of Prague on our last day there and it did not disappoint. Even though we passed by a lot of the attractions that we had already seen, our guide Ryan always had many historial anecdotes and fun facts to share. We especially loved biking through the park next to the Castle, on to Petrin Hill where the views were amazing. We would definitely do it again. Thanks!

Fortunate to have Fortuna. We took the Prague beer garden and river tour to Troja Chateau on a cold and rainy day in May. If it hadn't been for our incredibly upbeat and charming guide, Fortuna, we would have chucked it all in and called a taxi halfway through. The route is gorgeous, along the river, out of the city center, to areas of Prague we would not have gotten to. When the rain let up Fortuna would point out landmarks; everything from Communist built apartment blocks, the tiny charming summer cottages, the kayak training courses on the river. We stopped for beer but ended up drinking Svařák (hot mulled wine). We highly recommend this trip, ask for Fortuna!

Fun With Francesco. I enjoyed my ride with Francesco and he sent me to a great restaurant for dinner as well (Papa Nero). The group of 4 toured the city sites and saw lots of architecture and city squares. We went to a couple of off the beaten track sites that my husband did not see on his Segway tour. This is a great get acquainted with Prague city tour led by a knowledgeable guide. I strongly suggest a tour of the Jewish quarter with Wittman Tours and then go to the castle on your own.

Prague on Bike. My wife and I really enjoyed the 2.5 hour through the town. Our guide (André) was great and we were shown all the major sites on both sides of the river - except the castle, but that is offered in a seperate tour.We even stopped for some refreshments along the way at a special restaurant.The bikes were just fine and my wife even got a bike with a basket, just like she wanted.We were given really good trip for our following days in Prague and I can highly recommend Praha Bike!
Good ride. Enjoyed the chateau bike ride with Francesco. Takes u out of town for awhile to see the Chateau and then more leisurely ride through city parks coming back.

Fun and Great Customer Experience. We recommend the 25-mile trek to Karlstejn Castle. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more attentive. Our tour leader was Jacob, a second-year guide. Jacob was friendly, attentive and informative--he knows how to "work the crowd" in a pleasant manner. Jacob made sure every participant was welcomed and comfortable throughout the day. On the train ride home, Jacob visited with everyone and made suggestions for the rest of our Prague stay. Very classy.The ride (one-way with train return) is almost exclusively flat. The first half isn't very attractive as you snake through Prague and its close-in commercial zone. But the second half is quite nice as you make your approach to Karlstejn. There's a very nice break in which riders are treated to a refreshing beer or other drink.We'd only make one recommendation. The tour does NOT include admission to the Karlstejn Castle. Riders are given an option to take a tour on their own but that means holding up everyone else which is not desirable as there's not much to do/see in Karlstejn. We'd recommend that the tour company try to negotiate and include castle admission as part of the tour and have the tour leader give a VERY abbreviated tour. It seemed odd to ride all the way to Karlstejn Castle and not go in. But despite that, we'd still highly recommend the current tour. The exercise, fresh air and guide were fantastic.
Panorama Bike Tour. This was one of our favorite parts of the trip. Our guide Francisco was extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. An excellent experience and great value.

Fun time biking in Prague. We had a really cool time on the panoramic castle bike tour with Andrew as our guide. It was a perfect way to end our short stay in Prague and see the city from the hill as the sun set. Andrew knew his stuff really well and gave us a nice tour. I highly recommend using Praha Bike!! Thanks again :)

Interesting and fun cycle tour if Prague!. Despite the weather threatening rain, we had a great tour around Prague. There was only three of us on the tour so it was basically a private tour. Our guide took us to many out of the way places that we never would have seen if exploring by ourselves. Our guide was also very informative and so not only did we learn a lot, we had a great time as well. Would highly recommend this tour over walking tours and bus tours of which ive done many.. Looking forward to more bike tours in other cities now!!

Great experience. I had a great time on the 2.5 hour bicycle tour of Prague. Andrew was my guide, and enthusiastically informed me of the city's cultural, political and architectural highlights, both past and present. He also pointed out a number of very interesting places on my map that I went back to explore during my visit. If you only have a short time in Prague, these bike tours are the very best way to get a great overview of the city. If you have a longer stay in Prague, then these Praha bike tours help you identify those places that you will want to spend more time exploring.

Great Bike Tour. My husband, brother-in-law and I went on the 2.5 hour cycle tour of Prague. There were another 2 tourists (from the USA). Francesco was the guide. He was very patient and informative. He took us to many interesting sites which we would never have looked at during our visit. He also pointed out the various architectural styles of the beautiful buildings. He encouraged questions and not only did he have a great deal of knowledge but had a pleasant manner.We cannot recommend this tour highly enough - a great introduction to the city!
The Best Way To See Prague. This was a great tour of the city which took in most of the sights ! I would recommend this for any fitness level..the guide new history of the city very well.

Magic bike tour by Francisco in Prague.. Just been on your tour by Francisco and it was great. Brilliant tour and friendly guy. Great info and good value for money. Also we booked for my wife and I via Hotel Berenik but on the day my wife was sick so called up and the bike tour refunded her money. Great service and would highly recommend. Johnhttp://mormon.org/me/BW9H

Best bike tour in Europe. Why walk when you can ride? We've done bike tours all over Europe, and this was our favorite. Our guide Élan was unscripted and knowledgeable. The city is a crazy patchwork of color and style, best seen from a bike. Honestly, it would have taken us 3-4 days to experience everything we saw on this 2 1/2 hour tour. By all means go!

Fantastic tour!. My fiancé and me did a 2h30 bike tour on the 1rst of April, what a great thing we did! We had a good overview of Prague, and our guide was brilliant! It was very cold but very enjoyable. We also stopped for a beer in a typical pub. It's something we'll definitely do again if we go back there. Thanks Ryan for this tour!Peter & Emilie

perfect day on the bike. nice tour very good bike and professional guides one afternoon I saw entire city center the next day I borrowed bycicle when I poked it was enough just to call and within a few minutes the mechanic arrived and helped me.
Excellent way to see the city. Had a great 4 hour tour in July, four years ago. We covered alot of ground and the guide was extremely personable and interesting. We were sad that it ended!

All in One Bike tour is a must!. If you are in decent shape and want to see the mainstream sites of Prague and other sites off the beaten path, then the All in One Bike tour is a MUST! The tour lasts about 6.5 hours and is divided in two parts with a traditional Czech lunch in the middle of the ride. If you want to see the best of Prague, learn the most about its fascinating history and experience an outdoor adventure, this is a tour for you. Breathtaking views of the the city and the river...The tour was inexpensive and it was a great way to see everything.

Great way to know Prague. The tour captures many things which most of the tourists' eyes will miss otherwise. Apart from the usuals, it also takes you through masterpieces by David Cerny, scars of cold war era and city's association with theatre and Mozart (seems he is part of urban legend of all central European cities). It starts from Dlouha street, very near to the old town square. They also rent bikes but I feel it's better to have the guided tour for city's roads are not very bike-friendly. Our enthusiastic guide Maria was very informative and full of Prague. Wheels cover lot more than feet, definitely a better option over walking tours.

GREAT IDEA. We got to the cathedral plaza and were so smart as to hire a bike carriage for 850 cz koruna (about 34 euros) to tour us around, the guy took the two of us all over town, even to places I thought a bike couldn’t go through. He explained everything and eventually left us at the bottom of the Prague palace.

GREAT way to spend an afternoon in Prague!. We booked this tour based entirely on the other Trip Advisor reviews, and I'm really glad we did. For the record, we booked the Beer Garden tour. The bike office was easy to find, and they had more "stuff" there for us to use than I expected. Gloves if you need them, bungee cords for putting items in your bike basket, etc.We got our bikes and met our guide, and we were off! Our guide was Davide, and he was great- we loved him. He starts off the tour without really any talking aside from a very friendly introduction. You just bike through some busy streets to get out to the river, and then down the river and outside of the congested historic district. In talking to Davide later, he said he does this so that people can get accustomed to being on a bike, biking in a congested area, etc., and I think that's a smart move. I'm not used to biking in a city, and I was a little nervous and just wanted to focus on what I was doing. If Davide is your guide, rest assured you will have PLENTY of opportunity to sit and talk with him, and this guy knows his stuff. He's Italian by birth, smart, and a great conversationalist, so we had some great conversations about European history, Italian history, and of course Czech history, and he is knowledgeable and engaging.Anyhow, I don't want to ruin the surprises of the tour, but suffice to say you will get some unforgettable experiences, great photos, and some fantastic local flavor. (As well as a lot of knowledge about local beers! Davide single handedly turned me into a beer snob over the course of just a few hours.)Things you should know: While this isn't a terribly long bike tour, you will absolutely use some muscles- Prague is hilly. I'm in good/ very good shape (although I never bike), and there were some moments when my quads were screaming, but never more than 5 minutes or so. Second, as engaging and fun as Davide is, he can sometimes get ahead of you! When streets are crowded, it can be easy to get separated. I should have told him this- he was a super nice and easy-going guy, and I'm sure he would have slowed down. If I were to return to Prague, I would book another bike tour with this company, and I would request Davide specifically. I was really impressed with what we got for the money, and would encourage anyone to use some of their time for this tour.

Excellent. This was one of my favorite things to do in Prague. Kat was amazing, helpful and knowledgable about the areas she showed us.She spent time not only answering our questions but was available to recommend for us where to eat and where to go. By far she was one of the best tour guides I have met and I travel a lot. Thumbs up

We biked Praha to Dresden with smiles!. Praha Bike & Tour exceeded our expectations leading us 8 cyclists on a 6 day group tour along the Elbe River. Led by Oleh, and assisted by Davide, our tour was full of history as well as current information and news of the castles we passed, small towns we rode through, and bike trails we were on. Bike trails in the Czeck Republic were outstanding and sometimes under repair, but never a hindrance. Very impressive to ride upon and see the pride this country has with its bicycle paths. Scenery breath taking, lodging and meals more than excellent, the crew always eager to assist and answer any of our many questions. And did I mention the bicycles? Excellent, comfortable, A1 working order and not one problem. I wish I could do this trip again, today.

Informative and a great way to see the city. My husband and I did the 2 1/2 hour tour around Prague and Kat was our guide. We had read some other reviews about the tour being too short and the guide being "rude." We didn't have any of those experiences with the tour or with Kat. We learned a lot and Kat was a friendly and knowledgeable tour guide. The tour wasn't a full 2 1/2 hours, but it was because we were able to move around the town without running into traffic and throngs of crowds. We went through some of the back alleys and streets that we wouldn't have gone to by walking by ourselves. If we had more time, I would definitely go on another tour or a longer tour with this group. After the tour, the 6 of us that were on it together met a at a bar around the corner for a beer. Kat also joined us for a coffee. She was really open and wanted to make sure we mingled with the other people in the group. It was very easy to pay for this tour and there was plenty of room to sign up the day before, so no need to plan too far ahead.

Great tour. Our tour guide was friendly and knowledgable and gave us a lot of great information. It was a rainy day but the show dd go on. The route was easy for even our less athletic group members. Overall our group had a great time and would highly recommend it.
Castle Day. A wonderful day riding in the Czech countryside, lunch, a castle and a quick train ride home. Knowledgeable, caring guides. Couldn't have been better.

Bike tour. We had a great bike tour, the guide was excellent and told the story of Prague and the buildings and people really well, bringing the history alive. It was very good value for money and an excellent way of getting a feel for Prague and finding your feet. I would strongly recommend it

Highly Recommended the 61/2 hour tour. Great day. Well this my first review on Tripadvisor. I really have found the reviews very helpful so I thought I would write on. We arranged the 61/2 hour bike tour with Praha Bike. We had a great experience Lucy was our guide and did an excellent job. We saw the city in a way you would never see it in a bus or cab. Amazing experience. The only negative was Prague is really not the best biking city from a stand point of being bike friendly as far as bike lanes etc. But do not let that detour you from this great biking adventure. As far as difficulty goes, My group are mid 50's and we had a couple that was in their 70's very much bikers though. But my point is we had no problems.. My only advise would be if you have not been on a bike in a few years, get on one and ride a little before the trip.. Highly Recommended

Bicycled Prague to Dresden. We had a wonderful time. Thank you for conveniently delivery our baggage to our lodgings everyday. The route was beautiful. Our bags always arrived on-time. The lodgings were very nice. The bicycles worked perfectly.

Ride to Karlstejn Castle - awesome day!. I was in Prague at the beginning of October and went with Fortuna at Praha Bike to Karlstejn Castle. It was a fantastic day! Fortuna was great, very patient, and lots of fun. The ride through the countryside was so beautiful, and we had perfect weather on the day we went. You are only on roads for brief periods of time, otherwise you're making your way along the river on either paved or dirt bike paths and it's so quiet and peaceful. I had some speedy bikers in my group who were always well ahead of me, but I chose to go a little slower so I could look around and really take it all in. Fortuna made a few stops along the way to make sure we were all together and everyone was doing ok so I was able to catch up no problem. Bikes were in good shape and just right for the dirt paths. This bike trip was one of the best days of my vacation!

Best Tour Ever....ask for Andre as he's AWESOME!. The tour was beyond what we expected. I traveled with two friends of mine, and they were a bit skeptical doing the Big Tour which was 6.5 hours long, but Andre our tour guide was awesome! We went at a great pace, saw more of Prague then I hoped for, and loved every second of it! I would recommend this tour over and over again! Love from the Bermudian trio!

Rushed tour of Prague. We did the city tour of Prague. There were 4 of us and I felt that the tour guide would rather have been somewhere else. She (Kat?) did not want to know our names, although she did call me 'buddy' and 'honey'. The tour was over in less than 2 hours with no real time to take pictures or relax at all. My bike seat kept falling down and my wife's bike had a problem with the gears. We watched as our guide insulted both locals and other tourists. She did mention that she was slightly hungover. The tour itself was okay but we did not see alot of sights. I did not feel it was worth the 20 euros each and I have done alot of bike tours throughout Europe.

BEST WAY TO SEE PRAGUE. The all day bike ride is simply the best way to see Prague. Our guide Maria gave us an in depth look into the city. She was extremely knowledgeable about the history and architecture of Prague ....pointing details out that one would not normally see. We biked within the city and along the perimeter, stopping at specific sights to take in the surroundings and landmarks. I recommend taking the tour on your first day in Prague in order to get a feel for the city layout.

Another great city tour by bike!. My favorite way to tour a city! Prague city bike was a great bike tour company. Ask for Kat. She was very knowledgable and a very fun and personable tour guide. Thanks city bike! Prague was beautiful!

Really good starter. If you enjoy riding a bike and have no clue what to see in Prague, then this tour will be perfect for you. We really enjoyed all those places we had no idea that existed. Thanks to Kath for a great tour.

Praha Bike tour to Kasrlstejn Castle. Fantastic!!! Even though it was raining and I was the only person to book the trip Praha Bike were happy to continue for me so just myself and my guide set off to Kasrlstejn Castle. This is a ride of around 3+ hrs to get to the Castle but can take longer if people are slower. Beautiful scenery and following the river on mostly on bike paths made for relaxing ride sans cars. A stop half way for coffee etc was an enjoyable break and then off to the Castle. We arrived very wet so my guide picked a lovely restaurant with a fire where after drying off and a great meal we walked the hill to the Castle. Weather cleared and a quick trip back to Prague by train saw the end of a most (if n ot wet) enjoyable day. Lovely way to see Czech Republic countryside!! Highly recommend this trip and company if you like a longer ride out of the hustle and bustle of the city. They were also very helpful and responded quickly to my emails in organising the ride.

City Bike Tour !!. Took this tour last time I was in Prague. It was Great!!! Fun way to see the city and get some history about Prague as well as some not so known quirlky facts and tales! Tour guide Kat was so great...every knowlegable and fun, nothing too serious or stuffy about this girl....even though she is a history major. We needed someone like her to make learning about history fun when I was in school! (years before she was even born!) This tour is a must, even for semi bike riders it is easy and fun!I am going to book another tour next week while in Prague, again!:)
Great bike tour!. Great 2.5 hour tour, covered a lot of the city, Francesco was fantastic! Bikes were really good, probably the best bikes I've had for a tour in Europe.

Panoramic Prague Tour. We did the Panaromic Prague tour on 20 September and it was pretty awesome! The tour went for 2.5 hrs and our guide took us to the top of Prague and saw the whole city. It was pretty surreal being on top of the hill overlooking the whole city! Our guide Maria was awesome, she was very knowledgable about history and everything about the city! Would definitely reccommend this to everyone.
Prague Bike Tour with Kat was experience not to be missed!. Great tour guide, got to see all the main sites with good information! she was patient with less experienced riders as well!
segway. not really a bike but the best fun we had, really was the highlight of our trip to Prague. Was nervous at first but when we got into the swing of riding it I really want another go.

Nice and fun panoramic tour!. The best way to visit the city when you have little time, because they bring you around parks and in the old town giving you information and tips.Thanks Francesko for being our perfect English tour-guide!!:)

Beer garden tour with Kat & "De 17de Periode". Earlier today we had a nice tour with some Praha bikes from beer garden to beer garden. With 8 dutch guys and our tourguide Kat we had lots of fun during this trip. The bikes were excellent and we had some nice views of Prague and ofcourse some nice beers. But the most fun was our guide Kat, who made the trip worthwhile with her sense of humor and witty comebacks.

Great fun. First thing in Praha we did was the bike tour, which they happy to do even with just myself and my friend. It was a great way to see the city from the best view, and all the major landmarks. Our guide Franceso was really friendly and was able to answer any questions we had. I would highly recommend this to people as it quite cheap as well.

Educational. Upon arrival for our 3 day city break in Prague, our first stop was Praha bikes, located very close to the Old Town square. Weather permitting, this is a fantastic way to see the city, much more 'hands on' than sitting on a bus tour. We were kitted out with bikes and cycle helmets were offered to all - but optional. There were 8 of us on the tour and our guide was Maria. She is only in her early twenties but her historical knowledge of Prague was fantastic. She knew so much about all the buildings and happily tackled all the questions thrown at her.The pace for this tour was extremely reasonable, so unless you have never ridden before, you should have no trouble keeping up.This really is a perfect introduction to the city, enabling one to return later on foot to any areas that were of particular interest. Also, if you take the tour, a 20% discount is offered on any other cycle tours you take during your stay.

Tour(s) with Lucy. Our first experience with Lucy on the Castle bike tour was so fantastic we decided to take the City Tour with her as well! This was the best way to visit the city and enjoy the sights (while learning the history of Prague too) no matter how beginner of a cyclist you are. Lucy knew so many facts about the history of Prague as well as any building you could see from the highest tower we visited. Highly recommended for couples, family, friends, or even a solo ride! The price is very reasonable considering the length of the tour and the advise Lucy gave us...not to mention the second tour was at a discount. Perfect way to be introduced to Prague!
Good fun!. A beautiful day for a bike ride around Prague with a wonderful guide, Lucy. We would definitely recommend for those seeking an introduction to Prague with historical context.
City bike tour. Great ride. Lots of historical sites and a perfect way to be introduced to prague. We are taking another tour with them on Monday.
Fantastic bike city tour. Wonderfull 2.5hours trip with guide kath, surprising locations , entertaining and usefull information, absolut recommendation for à Nice urban experience

Wonderful way to see Prague. We had a long weekend in Prague and spent a fantastic afternoon on a bike tour with Fortuna. Fortuna was a fantastic guide who clearly loves Prague and knows so much about the history and architecture. Given how hilly Prague is the tour is very well designed to remain completely on the flat! We loved the tour and it was one of the highlights of our weekend; for us it was the perfect way to see the city as you cover a lot more than a walking tour but you're still out in the fresh air and not on a bus.

Best bike tour of Prague. I wanted to make sure Praha Bike tours knows that Fortuna is the best guide. She is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic. She enjoys what she does and it made the trip very fun and educational. She speaks very good English! She is a true asset to your company!Also, Nina, bartender was very pleasant and because of both of them I decided to do the beer tour also. Brad Shupe, USA, TN
Beat way to c prauge. A great trip with a great guide ours was names michelle i think def a must in prauge def the way 2 c the city

Wow, Prague is beautiful.. My husband and I really enjoyed the 6 hour bike tour of Prague by Lucy. We were a small group and we were given the delux version of all Prague's greatest city attractions. Definatly recommend, better than walking and you see so much more. Still had plenty of energy to enjoy a pivo ( beer ) at the end of the day.

Very enjoyable few hours touring prague with Francesco. Had a great time on the bike tour of Prague with Francesco, he is very knowledgable about the city and it's history and always makes sure everybody is OK and are keeping up with the group. Would definately recommend this tourThanks Francesco

Great way to see the city. We went on the 2.5 hour panoramic tour with Francesco yesterday and it was brilliant. The views were beautiful and Francesco was a great guide, informing us of lots of things we did not know about. I recommend taking the tour as these areas by foot would take a lot of time to see. Thanks guys

Awesome way to see the city!. I joined a 2.5 hour tour of Prague's main center city attractions, and will absolutely want to try this method of touring other cities in the future. My guide, Lucy, was extremely attentive to our safety as we moved around the cobblestone streets and stopped at 15 of the most interesting places. It was fast and easy to get my bike . . . . no problems at all.

Beautiful Day. I just spent a fabulous day out in the Czech countryside with my guide Lucy. Lucy was very knowledgeable and made the day a fun outing. I would highly recommend this tour - Karstejn Castle. Thanks Praha Bikes for going ahead with just one person!

Panorama tour with Kat - fantastic!. If you haven't riden a bike for a while then the cobblestones and hills might be a bit of a challenge but the views and the chance to see a different side of Prague make it worthwhile. Kat is a fun and energetic leader who will tailor the pace and rest stops to suit your riding ability (or lack of riding ability!) Lots of safety tips and reminders about when to brake and which gear to use as well as loads of information and quirky stories about Prague. Don't forget your camera and a bottle of water and be prepared to have 2 and a half hours of fun!

A must do experience. We did the Chateau and Beer tour with Francesco and had a brilliant time.His local knowledge was excellent and the beer was great. If you're happy to spend a few hours on a bike at a lazy speed you'll be crazy to miss this.

Maria smoothes the cobblestones. Have just spent a wonderful warm Prague afternoon on the Classic Cycle Tour. While the cobblestones in the Old Town are not ideal for cycling, our guide Maria's informative and charming commentary more than distracted us from the bumps. The tour route avoided difficult crossings yet took us to many of the places of note, we had heard so much about. An excellent introduction to Prague.

Glad I joined the bike tour. Had a great tour thanks to Vivien. Although I was the only person turned up that afternoon, Vivien didn't mind taking me on a one to one bike tour of Prague. She was great and took the time to explain each attraction and allowed me time to stop and take photos. I had a really great time and learn a lot about Prague within 2 hours - thanks to Vivien.

Great tour. We did the 6.5 hour Big City Tour led by Andre and it was great. I'm not athletic and was able to enjoy the Medium technicality of the ride (definitely got my workout in). We had a small and great group of 7 on our Wednesday ride and stopped twice (once for a drink and once for lunch). Prague is a great city but full of cobblestones which are not always great for a ride. Highly recommend!

Best way to see Prague. Great tour thanks to Kat! She shows you all the main sights and also the things you wouldn't ordinarily notice. Plus lovely stories behind the sights - did you know Mozart and Casanova were drinking buddies? Or the building where Einstein came up with E=MC squared? Kat certainly knows her stuff - I had better bike handling skills though ;)

Tour of Prague with Kat. We decided to go on the bike tour after great deliberation - mainly down to me - would I last 2 hours on a bike!!!! Had no problems at all. Kat was a great tour guide - showed us all the sights, whilst we cycled round the town at a leisurely pace. There was 7 of us in the tour, so not too many. The weather was good. And all 4 of us (differing ages, interests and levels of cycling) had a great time. This was probably the highlight of our city break. Well worth a visit.

enjoy prague like the locals. My husband and I went on the beer garden tour with Kat as our guide and we had a great time. It was a fun relaxing way to get out of the city and to enjoy the city surroundings like the locals. The bikes were also comfortable to ride on despite all the cobblestone. Thanks Kat for the tour!

Great to do something different. I had a great experience on our daytrip to Karlstejn with Andre. We had a small group of mixed ages which rode at an easy pace for a few hours. The tour is mostly on bike paths of varying descriptions. For me it was a great way to spend the day and get away from the hustle & bustle of Prague and into the countryside where life seems very peaceful and focuses on the river. The ride is flat all the way and the bikes are pretty comfortable with good gearing.Going with Andre was definitely worth it as opposed to just hirinig a bike - he is an authentic Czech and could give insight into life in Czech Republic as someone who grew up through markedly transitional years in this part of the world. Karlstejn itself was a pretty castle but I wasn't so interested in going inside which was very easily accommodated. This is a great option to spend your time after you have seen the 'must-see' sights in Prague.
Thanks. I had fun on my tour with Kat, learned a ton. Thanks for showing me Prague, beautiful city.Cheers........

Amazing views, great tour!. Our family of 5 took a personalized tour with Andre this weekend. They accommodated our 1 and 4 yr old in a croozer bike trailer, and our 5 yr old on his own bike, but fitted mine with a large baby/child seat and brought a bike lock along just in case he got too tired. To everybody's amazement, the interesting sites and pace of the tour were just right as our son kept his momentum going for the entire 3 hour, 7 mile customized tour! The vistas were breathtaking and having a tour guide explain the history and interesting highlights of the city and its landmarks was worth every penny. FYI, there are A LOT of cobblestones to bike over in this city. My son said sometimes riding on them gave him "scrambled brains" but he still kept on going. Andre, thanks for your patience with our family. We enjoyed your tour very much!

Great way to see the city. I love biking in cities, so this tour was just perfect for me. With that said, it was easy and enjoyable enough even for those who are less comfortable on a bike. Kat was an excellent, enthusiastic, and knowledgable guide. In 2 hours, you get to see a good chunk of the city. Best of all, Kat joined us for a beer after and gave us more general tips on things to see. Highly recommended as an introduction to this lovely city!

City Bike Tour. I took the city bike tour on our last day in Prague but I wish I'd taken it on the first. It was really informative and I found out about other sights I wanted to explore after the tour. I would also have taken Prague Castle tour if I had an extra day.

A Prague MUST. After three days, this tour was easily the best decision we have made in Prague. Praha Bikes is awesome. Our tour took us to this cool chateau outside of the city. It was a great opportunity to see a beautiful area a little removed from the bustle of tourists. What really made our tour was our guide Francesco. He struck the perfect balance between providing information about the city and letting you just enjoy the ride. Bonus: he gave us spot on advice about where to eat for dinner. After spending the afternoon exclaiming "this is so awesome!" we are going to try and incorporate a bike tour in each of the remainder of the cities we travel to.

Outstanding bike tour!. On August 15 we took the Troja Chateau bike tour with Fortuna. It was a beautiful route through the streets of Prague and along the river to the Chateau. We saw many parts of the city that tourists on foot would not experience. Fortuna was very knowledgeable about present day Prague, its history, culture and popular sites. The trip included trails through some of Prague's beautiful parks with amazing vistas. Highly recommended. Thanks Fortuna for a great experience!

BEST part of Prague!. I just had the fabulous opportunity to go on the Prague to Troja bike trip with a couple of friends, and Francesco, our amazing tour guide. This was by far my favorite part of the trip to Prague - we got to see some of the less touristy places, and enjoy a calm and comfortable bike ride out to the amazing Chateau Troja. I am terrible at biking, but Francesco kept us going a perfect pace. After the Chateau Troja we rode through a peaceful park, and then we climbed up a hill (I can't remember the name!) and were treated to some wonderful panoramic views of Prague. The trip was perfect - I strongly recommend this to everyone! I especially liked that Francesco perfectly balanced being informative and telling us what we were seeing with letting us relax and enjoy the ride! He was an amazing tour guide for sure, and if you choose to go on this tour you should definitely request him!Finally, we asked Francesco for a recommendation on where to eat dinner, and his recommendation was spot on. I can't say enough good things about this tour, so I'll stop now :)

I loved Praha Bike. Prague was the third city on my itinerary, so when I arrived, my feet were aching from all the walking I was doing while sightseeing. So I wanted a way to both see the sights and give my feet a rest while also getting some alternative exercise. My bike tour with Kat was just the ticket. I'd walked briefly around the old town the day before the tour, but Kat filled in the narrative on the 2.5 hour city tour. She also welcomed and answered every question I had about this exotic place. The pace was easy and she invited us all out for lunch afterwards nearby. The perfect last day of my 2 week trip to Europe.

Attentive and informative tour. Three of us did the all day big bike tour. We covered all the major sites at an easy pace. The views were amazing throughout the day. The bikes were comfy with fat tires and suspension to help with the cobbled streets and baskets for our water bottles and extra clothing. Our guide was Francesco - very friendly, knowledgable and attentive to our needs. Highly recommend this as an intro to Prague.

Amazing bike tour!. We went on a tour this morning and it was so wonderful. Francesco was an amazing tour guide. He was friendly and knowledgeable, which made the tour even more fun. We thoroughly enjoyed every moment and I would recommend this company any day.

Praha Bike - thanks to Francesco. I took the bike tour of Prauge and it was the highlight of my trip. Francesco was very knowledgable and considerate of all the bikers. Very impressed with Francesco!!

Relaxed cycle tour taking you to most key attractions.. We enjoyed our tour, easy paced for anyone who cycles or not, went to sights you would want to see. Francesca was a good guide, knowledgable and all round good guy to have as a guide. Marcus and Teresa from australia

Full day bike tour. Excellent bike tour that took us through some of the highlights of Prague. Andre, our guide, gave us excellent information as well as provided his favourite sites of the city. The tour started at 10 and ended at 4 pm. Highly recommend this tour for an overview of the city. Lunch was provided at an excellent Czech restaurant that was located near the bike rental place.
City bike tour. Did the City bike tour led by Francesco. Excellent tour guide, and a great little tour around the vast sights of Prague.Would recommend to others.

Kat our guide was great. The best way to see Prague. Booked thru viator, was so easy. Tour ran on time. Our guide Kat was great and mixed history with great art pointers. Biking was easy and relaxing and a great way to see city. I was on trip by myself and great way to meet people also

friends for tourists. we got this adress from people riding bikes in Prague. We went to this address, and were helped immediately, with complete info and good solid mountain bikes.
We are so satisfied with the service, prices and the people renting the bikes we go back tomorrow for renewal of renting 4 mountainbikes for 2 more days.
4 happy people from Belgium.

Big bike tour with Francesco at Praha bike. Just magic. I had 6.5 hours of great moments. The tour is beautiful and well organized. Francesco as guide, gave me a lot of interesting informations, about architecture, history, yesterday and today day-life. And when you receive a complete answer to all your questions, you know it's not a waste of time. A must for your journey in Prague. Do it the first day, and after you'll know what is left to visit. ( Not much ).You don't need to be fit to do the tour. It's very easy.I would definitely recommend this tour.Thank-you very much Francesco, for sharing with other people your passion for Prague.

Praha Bike Beer Tour. We had a great time last week with Francesco as our guide. He was very friendly and knowledgeable and it gave us a great opportunity to see Prague from outside of the center...of course, the beer stops are always nice too!

Great Bike tour with Vivian at Praha Bike Tour. We had a great time on this tour. We were a group of 9 and we got around the city safely with kids 9&11 years old. It was a nice break from walking to the attractions and with Vivian as our guide, we had a much more in depth introduction to Prague. Vivian's knowledge of the sights and history was excellent. Definitely recommend this tour.

Great way of seeing Prague. Took the bike tour on our first full day in Prague. Vivienne was a well informed guide, taking us around the sights that we wanted to re visit later, stopping and explaining the history of each place, and taking a route that showed you places you probably wouldn't see if you were walking about. The pace was leisurely, an easy bike ride, even over cobbles most of the time!We would recommend this to anybody who is capable of riding a bike!About £20 per person but worth every penny! Book in advance!Thanks Vivienne!Told you we would post!

Great way to tour the city!. Me and my friends took the short tour which took about 2.5 hours. It was a great, easy ride and a fun way to learn a brief history of the city. Our tour guide was Kat who was super friendly and really knew how to keep the tour interesting! She was very eager to answer any questions you have. I can't remember the exact cost, but I know it was excellent value for money.I would definitely recommend this tour!

Segway Prague. I took a Segway Tour of Prague and enjoyed it--mostly. The guide that went with me was great and well-informed. He let me stop at various places for a closer view. The problem that I had was that the Segway is controlled with the feet and I had taken this tour to save my feet. :( That wasn't the Segway's fault, though, and I think others would enjoy Prague by Segway.

Beer Garden Bike Tour not to be missed!. Having joined the tour on a fluke, we left the experience knowing that it had made our time in Prague special. The bike tour took us to another side of Prague away from the city centre, biking by the river, through parks and up hills to enjoy good beers with great company, all expertly lead by the fantastic Kat, our friendly, chatty and knowledgable tour guide, who really made the tour one to remember!

Praha Bike Tour rocks!. I thought the bike tour rocked. Kat was incredible. The sights were great it was worth every penny and more. Kat's knowledge and English was clear and easily understandable. She was also excellent for safety being first! Steve

Praha bike. My boyfriend and I were in Praha in the beginning of the July. Before bike tour we had 3 excursions by foot in the city. We took bike tour only because we wanted some activity. It was suprise for us that almost all sightseeings we visited were new for us!! The tour was really well-organized!! Our guide, Kat, was very helpful and she told us so many new interesting facts about city!! Thank you so much!! Also while we started our tour it was raining and Kat provided us with special coats against rain, and marker to make signatures on the Lenon's wall!! The tour was really so amaizing!!!! Thank you very much to this company and to Kat!!))))

Prague in 2:30hrs!. We love to take bike tours in Europe and Prague was not the exception. Our guide was from California but knew a lot about the sites we covered. Do this on you first day and then go back to those sites that interested you the most. We took the private tour for $33 per person.

Great Value and a good laugh.. We took this trip in June 2012 and it was a great way to explore the city and discover its history. Kat was our guide for the tour. She took us round the historical and scenic parts of the city and was really informative. A great tour and I'd highly recommend it. 10 out of 10. PS A great way to find good restaurants and cheap beer (you can't beat local knowledge)!!

Great way views of Prague. My husband and I did the panoramic and Prague castle tour. It was so beautiful so many great panoramic views of the city. We covered so much ground, this tour definitely had some hills to climb but we enjoy cycling so it was a great trip!Our tour guide was great and gave lots of information about the city.

Full day bike tour with Francesco. No better way to cover all of Prague and work off the many beers this place has to offer!! Francesco has a wealth of knowledge about everything through the city and the pace was easy and enjoyable - recommend this to everyone!!

one of the best tours in Prague. I took a 2-hour tour by bike in Prague. it is rally a nice way to get to know the city. I already saw the main attractions but our guide Kat told a lot of interesting stories about the city and showed us many new sights. She is really a good guide and she can show you another Prague than what you can see with crowds of tourists walking around.

K@'s amazing bike tour!!!. Arrived in Prague in the morning and joined this tour that same afternoon. Great way to see the city - Prague is absolutely amazing, and Kat our guide seemed to have an encyclopaedic knowledge about everything we looked at (as well as any curveball questions). Got to see the main sites around the city, and get orientated with our map (made walking around later a lot easier). Would highly recommend - we have done these in a few cities now and this trip was definitely one of the best. The after-trip beer goes down well too.

Biking with Kat - Local and To the Point. LOVED our tour guide Kat! She knew her way around the streets and was a great story teller. Even though I had been to Prague once before, I learned so much more this time. She showed us a lot of local spots I never would have found on my own. These spots were great to know of to come back to like Kampa Island, David Cerny's statues and the love locks (though they were such a pain to find even with a map on my own). Of course, the highlight for me was the John Lennon wall. She had some great back stories about it and showed us historic sites but also sites that were relevant today. This bike tour is a great introduction to the city. For more on Prague and Eastern Europe, check out my blog, www.nearafar.com I'll be posting an interview I did with Cerny (Kat, I found his local spot and it's on Kampa Island. Plus, he designed the bar there!). And PS This woman totally deserves a massage! :P

Praha 6 hour bike tour. Brilliant. We did the Old Town side of the river in the mornong and the Castle side in the afternoon with a wholesome tasty lunch in between. Our guide Andre had an interesting and informed story for the many, many stops along the way. We spent the rest of our stay re-visting many of the little gems we would otherwise not have considered. This must be the best introduction to the city that can be done. We are both in our sixties so it must be the case that the cycling is a doddle.

Highly recommended.. I booked a tour on line for my wife, my son (10) and me. It was great two hours and half tour around the major places of the city. Our guide was Kate: excellent. She made the tour very interesting and alive adding some extra information. I feel to recommended her as your guide. Definitely the best way to discovery the magnificent city of Prague.

Prague City Bike Tour with Kat - not to be missed!. Our tour was on May 26th with Kat and we had a wonderful time! The mountain bikes are absolutely necessary and a lot of fun to ride. In particular we enjoyed the wonderfully irreverent statues of Czerny - we never would have found them on our own. Kat's observations and explanations were excellent and made the history come alive. Additionally, she also made some great recommendations for a local restaurant and the Jazz Dock, which was perfect for us! Thank you, Kat!

Great tour. Praha Bike Tours was great! We confirmed online and they take credit cards on site. Jacob was our guide and he was fantastic. We were able to see so much of Prague in just 2 1/2 hrs with great detail at each of the tour stops. *I see that the segway tours are higher rated on TA, but I never saw one segway while in Prague. First of all, who is taking those tours and second, why? A bike tour is much better as I cant imagine you would be able to see as much in that time period.

Best bicycle rental for riding Dresden to Prague (or other direction). Bicycle riding the Elbe River from Dresden to Prague is a great way to travel. Flat ground, mostly dedicated and paved cycle routes for slow cycling (as in slow food). Praha Bike rented the bikes, drove them to our pickup in Dresden, took all our heavy suitcases back with them, so it was a pannier-lite trip (the May weather cooperated as well... 85 degrees and sunny). Praha Bikes was great and the price was all-inclusive, so no surprises at the end. Two of our four of us purchased their own Bella Ciao bikes in Berlin (great bikes by the way) to fly home with them, and Praha Bikes kindly agreed to store these after the ride (Prague is a foot city, not bike friendly...too much traffic, no dedicated bike lanes, too many people, chunky cobblestones and compact enough to best be seen on foot), and they also offered to help them pack the bikes for the plane ride home... no extra charge. No guarantee that they will always offer this, but it was appreciated. Be sure to specify what you need and they will supply maps, recommended stopping, panniers, helmets, locks, etc.If you have a choice, don't ride Dresden to Prague, the direction we went, ride the other way. When the wind blows, going Dresden to Prague, it's in your face. Not only does the river run the other way (the drop is insignificant for biking) but so does the wind. The first day, it was a bit of chore... after that the wind stopped so for us it was a non-issue. Also, for the most part the Czech people on the road are more taciturn... reserved, not particularly animated or helpful. So if you start in Czech and go to Germany, each day gets better. By the time you get to Dresden, you have a most optimistic people who have done a most extraordinary turn-around since the wall fell. But this is a subtlety... either way is great. We allowed 35-50k per day so that we would ride about 3-4 hours with long midday stops for glorious lunches, exploring every castle, museum, great view or whatever came our way. This is slow-cycling at its best. One of us wore a helmet, but the others preferred the European way of wind in the hair. Given the slow speeds, no cars for most of the ride, and flat ground, it's very safe and a pleasure to ride bikes the old fashioned way.Our first night was in Bad Shandau, and in hindsight, I would recommend a shorter first day; spend the night in Pirna in Germany. Be sure to seek out Adoratio, the chocolate shop on the Main Square and buy more than you should. It lasted us the whole trip and was glorious. As can be expected, Germany was more refined than Czech, although it was clear that Czech is upgrading the roads. Some were still gravel, but some showing gravel on the map had just been paved. If you keep an eye out for the little yellow Bike Route 2 signs, you will not get lost.When you cross into Czech, the first big town is Usti. Do not stop, ride through and ignore it. It gives a horrible impression of the country, and one's immediate thought is that if this is Czech, skip the rest of the trip and take the train to Vienna. Don't give up hope, it gets much better. By Litomerice you fall in love with the architecture, the ancientness and the landscape.Must do: Dessert (or a full meal) outside the Melnik castle overlooking where the Elbe and Vltava rivers join. The views are stunning, the service and setting is five star with 17th century elegance. We did not discover it until after we had a late lunch on the main plaza, but it definitely is a must-return.The last full riding day, we ran into two German girls who were riding the full distance of Bike Route 2, all 500k of it. They had just come from Prague and said the first day riding out was difficult. Rough track. That night the weather changed, with a predicted drop from 88 degrees to 37 with cold rain, so we found the train station in Melnik and for the equivalent of a few dollars hopped a train that has racks for bikes and takes about a hour to do a day's ride into Prague. Thus, I cannot confirm what the first day's ride out of Prague is like.Prague was of course eye-achingly beautiful, as the architecture is just street after street of drop-dead beautiful, but unfortunately, the locals have not yet understood the concept of care and feeding of the visitor industry. Unlike the river ride, in Prague we kept getting the feeling we were lunch... we were there to be fleeced by the locals. A high price for a cup of bad coffee, and then we see the locals getting great coffee. This is typical of what happens when a country shifts from Communism to Capitalism, but it can be tiring. Having said that, there is a lot to do and English is spoken sufficiently that one need not learn Czech except for the basics to show one wishes to be polite. Of course, at Praha Bike their English was excellent. We found a great place to stay however (Dům u velké boty (House at the Big Boot)), and the proprietor told us all the places the locals go where we would be treated right... he was right. Praha Bikes also offered to help us make those connections, so make friends and ask for help.Bottom line: Praha Bikes is highly recommended, as is the Elbe ride.

Classic city tour. The bike tour in Prague city was fantastic and add more knowledge to me. I thanks our tour guide Kat for her knowledge of historical sites in Prague and the safe journey. I am planing to take the panoramic tour tomorrow.

no better way to cover prague. brilliant tour which they still ran despite my last minute booking and tour party of 1. you can cover a lot of ground on a bike for 6 hours and cover all the main sights on both sides of the river. my guide was very knowledgeable and great company and made the tour the highlight of my trip.

Biking from Prague to Vienna - amazing. My girlfriend and I did the cycling trip from Prague to Vienna in April and had an amazing time. The team at Praha bike, were very professional and helpful in arranging this trip and the gear was of a very high quality. I would strongly recommend using Praha bike.The trip itself was a great way to see the Czech (and Austrian) countryside, and no two days were the same (we cycled for 5 in total but the trip could easily be extended to 6 or 7 days).
Best way to see the city.. This really was the best part of my trip to prague. We saw all of the sights and our guide Kat was really informative in a fub way.

Really Interesting and lots of fun. The Prague tour was a really good way to see the city and learn about some of the history. Our guide (Kat) was really enthusiastic and gave us a great insight into the city. She also gave us some great recommendations such as lunch at the Staropramen Brewery.An awesome way to start any break in Prague!!

Awesome!!. Had a short stay in Prague and this tour ticked all the boxes in under three hours. Our tour guide Kat was excellent and I would highly recommend you get on one of her tours! If you are in Prague, you should do one of these tours.

Proper way to see a place. I went on their Karlstejn Castle Tour. This is a day trip with a 20mile cycle there and a train journey back with lunch included. You do not need to be fit to do this cycle. My sister came with and the only time she rides a bike is on city breaks away and for her this was fine. The route has you following the main river through Prague and so very few hills are involved. The cycle is also leisurely and relaxing. You start at 9:30 and stop about 11 for a cool drink before continuing on to your final destination for arrival at about 1. Where you have lunch and when fully rested you walk the rest of the way to the Castle (15minutes max)You than get the 4o'clock train back to Prague and another final short cycle from the train station back to your starting point. Our guide was very friendly and kept the pace gentle.A great way to see more than just the city and a lovely way to spend a day. A family could do this and the kids will be nicely worn out at the end of the day :o)

No better way to see the city.. Fantastic tour, smashing all the main sites, plus a lot of the not so obvious cultural site into a leisurely couple of hours. Our guide, Kat, was very knowledgeable, was able to give tailored advice on further siteseeing in Prague and kept the tour fun.
