Definately make this your first stop to make the most out of a short stay in Prague. Matt

Kat is a terrific and informative guide. This is such a good way of seeing the sights of Prague. Three hours of gentle cycling with lots of info stops and a cold beer at the end. The cobbles can be a bit painful on the backside - but well worth the effort! Top marks.

Kat was fantastic. Brilliantly informative tour in great city
Highly recommended so ask for Kat

Great day out!. My friend and I opted to do the Big Bike Tour on the first day in Prague and we weren't disappointed. A big bike tour indeed!Our very friendly and knowledgeable guide Andres was fabulous. He showed us all the sights of Prague at a pace that was very manageable for both my friend and I. He has much in depth knowledge of Prague which he shared with us and showed us many sights both usual and unusual (including the hanging man and small narrow streets).Andres was very patient when we were taking photos and asking him questions and he gave us plenty of time to take in the beautiful sights of Prague. He even on more than one occasion, offered to take the photos of us both. The Big Bike Tour included lunch (with a beer!) then another beer later in the afternoon. I felt the organisation of the tour was well timed, with 3 -3 1/2 hours of cycling in the morning then the lunch stop, then another 3-3 1/2 hours cycling with another beer stop in one of the parks overlooking Prague. Lunch was very tasty with vegetarian options.All bike staff were very friendly and helpful and I would highly recommend this tour if you want very informative information of Prague and it's also a great way to get your bearings of the city to then go it alone. If you book on line you also get a discount off the advertised price. If you don't want to do a tour, they also rent bikes for a day but I'm not sure you'd see half as much as what we did, nor would you get the good commentary and information which Andres gave us.Thank you to all the staff at Praha Bikes, especially Andres for a great day out.

Praha Biking w/Kat. On our first full day in Prague we did the two hour morning bike tour with the outstanding guide Kat. As other mentioned this tour is an excellent way to get familiar with the city and also shows you everything worth while outside the normal beaten path. Kat was the guide everyone hopes to get- really made the trip super laid back and fun, thx Kat!!! Definitely a recommended tour.

Great way to see Prague..... great informative guide Kat. My boyfriend & I took the Classic City Bike Tour on Day 2 our of 3 day mini-break in Prague. I highly recommend this tour as it's great way to get to know the layout of the city. I would probably urge you (time permitting) to do this tour on your first day as our guide Kat was full of useful recommendations of things to do, places to eat and drink etc. This information would have been welcomed on our first evening in the city.It was certainly one of the highlights of our short visit and that is largely due to Kat who made the tour both informative and fun. Kat clearly loves the city and her love of the place came across in the way she conducted her tour.It's a fabulous way to take in all the sights as well as be educated as to what you're looking at.Kat was very knowledgeable, friendly and enthusiastic.It's definitely value for money and the company seemed very professional and organised.Thanks for making our mini-break memorable and if we ever visit Prague again, we'll be looking to book another tour with you guys.

Big City tour - a great way to see Prague. My husband & I took the big city tour on our second day in Prague. I highly recommend this tour as it's great way to get to know the layout of the city. It made the rest of our stay much more enjoyable as we revisited several of the sights later in the week. We were in Prague attending a conference and at the end of the week our traveling companions were sorry that they didn't get around to seeing certain sights but each one they mentioned we had seen on the bicycle tour. It's a fabulous way to take in all the sights as well as be educated as to what you're looking at.Our tour guide, Francesco, was knowledable and friendly. Be warned, there is a small amount of uphill cycling. (I elected to walk my cycle up the bigger inclines and it was not a problem).
27th April. Tour guide Jaime was exceptional. Friendly helpful service---1st class !

Great way to see Prague. A great way to see Prague, by bike. You can cover so much ground in a short period if time, and get a bit of exercise, too. You can go back and see the things that interest you.

Great Short Tour - Great Guide. My wife & I elected to take the Sunday morning 3 hour City Tour and were not disappointed. It was quite quiet in the City at that time and ended up getting Fortuna, our guide, to ourselves which made it even better. She is very knowledgeable and took frequent stops to explain the main City sights, many of which you may not see if you were pushed for time by foot, like those crazy faceless babies (!) Highly recommended. Thanks Fortuna. Remember to add the INXS sights in your tour ;-)

Karlstejn Castle tour. Definitely wanted to get out of town and loved the ride to Karlstejn. The castle itself is nothing special although the view is lovely. Lunch was nice. However I think this company needs to do a better job! The guide could not fix a flat tire and had to rely on the courtesy of passing bikers. Cannot imagine if the chain broke - I doubt he would have any idea or the right tools. Second, he did not have the right change for the train on the return. I had to loan him the cash until we got back to the office. Maybe coming from a destination resort I expect more - in BC our guides would know their equipment, first aid etc. Buyer beware with this company.

Great tour guides, perfect city to see on a bike. My husband and I did two of the Praha Bike Tours. First we did a late afternoon Panoramic Tour with Fortuna- our guide from Mexico, who is studying for her Masters degree in Prague. She was interesting, informative and fun. The Panoramic tour was for 2.5 hrs- great views of some of the back roads of the city, the John Lennon Wall, the Locks of Love, the castle with the "changing of the guards," and the park, where we picked and ate some apples. Our second bike tour was a full day event, biking along the river and the countryside to the Karlstejn Castle. Our guide was the self-proclaimed "sexy Frenchman" Farid. He entertained us with his life stories and his take on Prague. The castle tour is more about taking a moderately intense bike ride for the day through the country. We stopped for a refreshing beer at a small biker's stand along the way and played fetch with the owner's dog. Then we rode another hour and had a delicious lunch. Our actual tour of the castle was ok. More enjoyable was our time with Farid, and meeting the other bikers. One of them ended up living 5 minutes from us back home. If you are looking for a tour with tons of history and information, this may not be for you. If you are looking for a fun, informal and informative guide who will show you the city and the countryside, then this is the perfect place to go.

Highlight of our trip to Prague. This bike tour was part of our contiki package for Prague. It was an awesome way to explore the city and our female guide from Belgium (sorry forgot the name!) made the experience that much better. We enjoyed it so much that we joined other bike tours throughout the rest of our European trip hoping for the same experience. This is a "must do" in Prague.

Good tour. We took the Beer and River bike tour, which was a lot of fun. It was nice to get out of the city and ride along the river and through the parks. We went along bike paths and saw parts of the area that we wouldn't have seen otherwise. Our guide was great and very personable. With this tour, there was more riding and less stopping to talk about the area than with other bike tours we have taken. I would give the tour 5 stars if there was more information given about Czech beer.

Good insights into Praha and see a lot of the city in a short time. They're the company with the yellow brochures, located at 24 Dlouha street. From Republiky metro stop, walk north on Revolucni and turn left at Dlouha. We were the only two on the Classic City Tour, so got a customised version, which left out things we'd already seen and didn't want to see. Our guide was knowledgeable and helpful. He looked after us well, especially when changing lanes and at intersections. The 11.30am tour is an odd time so we gulped down our packed lunch at one of the many information/rest stops.Don't miss the pissing statues or the John Lennon wall; both on the western side of the river which is much quieter than the Old City side. Their mountain bikes are pretty well maintained, with suspension forks set soft for the cobblestone roads. The team-members behind the counter speak good English and are professional. But there's a guy in the courtyard who smokes, which is a bit off-putting - he keeps a little dog with him and may be the owner. We had a good time, saw plenty of the city in a short time and I think it was good value for money.PS Avoid the other company: City Bike Tours with the red and blue logo. We considered them, but the employees smoke around customers. So in spite of a glossy website AND facebook page, it's clear that they care more about promoting themselves than caring for their customers.

Fun and Informative. We did the Beer Garden tour. The ride was enjoyable –the scenery varied from very somewhat depressed (but safe) areas to beautiful parks. At first our guide did not stop often to explain the sights. But, he provided more information as the trip progressed and we really enjoyed learning about Czech culture from him during our stops at two beer gardens, and our post-ride beverages at a local pub. Praha Bike is an extremely friendly, cooperative, and efficient group. The tour was definitely worth the time and expense.

Nice ride, little insight. Typically, on my first day in a new city I always try to find a bike tour. I've found bike tours to be a great way to get an efficient overview of the city. Out of the five bike tours (all in different cities) I have taken, I have found that the guides are either really great or really poor (with no in between!). Unfortunately, our experience with Praha Bike tours (Praha Classic City Bike Tour) was on the poor side of the spectrum. While we did get to see quite a bit of the city, our guide was not very knowledgeable of the city. In fact, a few times we stopped we would get "Do you know who/what that is?"… pause for us to guess… "No, no guess?" And then he would proceed to tell us what we were staring at with little insight. I'm all for a little interaction, but we felt that the guide was just looking to fill the time at each stop. My husband and I were the only two on the bike tour (even though the guide rarely spoke to/looked at my husband…) which I hoped would lead to some interesting discussion. Sadly I was mistaken. The end of the tour was strange as the guide stalled around us waiting for his tip. Maybe we caught them on a bad day, but our experience was bad enough for us not to do another ride with them.

So great we did 2 tours. The city tour was about 3 hours. Our guide was Igor. He took us through the city and pointed out many of the main sites. We had our 8 year old son with us and he was fine. Igor was very safety focused and on the really big hills we walked down to avoid crashing.We loved it so much we booked a trip to Karlstejn Castle. It was 25 miles (a 3 hour bike ride for us) - Igor said average time is 4 hours. Again we had our 8 year old and he did well - it was flat most of the way. It was very scenic and allowed us to see some of the small towns on the way. Praha bikes provided lunch and we came back on the train after exploring the castle. We left at 9:30 and were back by 4:00 but it was a GREAT day.

Informative but lacks something. I went on this tour two days after doing a Fat Tire Tour in Berlin so my expectations were high.Our tour guide was good but lacked the energy I was expecting and would very easily go off on a tangent away from whatever he was talking about.

very informative for a bike tour. Lance was awesome! Though the tour only lasted about 2 hours, he managed to cram a lot of information in and still answer all our questions! Beautiful day, beautiful bikes!

City Bike Tour :). City Bike Prague were fantastic! We did the City Ride Tour and then decided to keep our bikes all day as we loved it so much! Great bikes and Emil was a great tour guide. Highly recommend them :)

Awesome, Defo do this in Prague. If you like riding defo head to these guys. City Bikes was an amazing thing to do. The prices are perfect. the Staff that run this are just awesome and funny guys.You might be afraid of the streets in Prague? Don't be, just take your time watch out for the Trams and the cars are super bike friendly.I loved my time riding in Prague, beautiful place and lovely people.
Great all around . Everyone working there was extremely friendly and helpful. The bike tour was about 2.5 hours long and was perfect. The guide (Lance) was knowledgeable and fun. Would do again.

Loved it!. My boyfriend and I had such a great time! It was a PERFECT way to see the highlights of the city. We were only in Prague for a short time, but we were able to see so much on the tour, and learn about the history of the city. We saw beautiful things and met nice people.I forgot our tour guide's name, but he is Italian and with perfect English. He was so great and we loved meeting him. His tour was informative and fun.

Way to see the sites. An easy way to see the main sites of Prague. Tour guide was nice enough, however, we didn't get enough information from the tour, in particular the history of Prague. We have been on many bike tours across Europe, and this tour didn't live up to our expectations.

Great experience. Had an amazing time cycling around this wonderful city and seeing all the most interesting sights. The length of the tour was perfect and the guide really new his stuff. Looking forward to the next tour when I'm back, a must in Prague. :)

We had alot of fun!!. We had a grate gide with good english. Amayzing tour! We sew all the prittyest spits of the city! It was a realy fun experience. All together we had a 3 hour tour wich is perfect.

Good job with a big group of teens!. Adam took us on a tour of Prague without losing any of us (although I had a couple students who were inexperienced bike riders). He was a very knowledgeable tour guide with a great sense of humor - which you need to take 13 teenagers anywhere! - and knew how to navigate the streets of Prague without any mishaps. If Prague were more bike-friendly, I would have rated the tour as excellent.

Great tine. Did the city bike tour with Sean. He was great and gave excellent information on the sites and tailored the tour to what the group was looking for. Rain storm rolled through during the trip but still had a great time. Great recommendations for other things to do while in Prague as well.

Highlight of my trip to Prague. Andrew our guide made this the most interesting, fun guided tour. His stories about the Czech people and history touched my heart. After the 2 hour city tour we wanted more. Before the bike tour I was worried that there would be too many people to maneuver around in this busy city but it just all worked out and we had a fabulous last day in Prague.

Nice city tour by bike. We made a nice trip by bike through Prague and we really enjoyed it. Emir from Iceland was a relaxed and excellent guide, showing us nice hotspots and telling us interesting stories about Prague. Though it was bloody hot, it was easy to do. Really recommend this to anybody.

Good way to tour the city. I like to bike, so this tour suited me. The guide was fairly well informed. Earliest tour was 1030am and it's getting pretty hot by then - the guide always stopped to chat in the sun rather than the shade - he should plan for shady spots. But the tour hit all the top spots - enjoyed it.
Private tour as no one else came. A great cycle round a beautiful city with a great tour guide even though he was from Iceland and I'm from England. Well worth the money!

Bike tour. Had a great day when i rented some bikes together with my friends. Had an amazing guide who you could easily talk to since he was very friendly, but he als was a good guide since he knew a lot about many buildings. He showed us some amazing places in Prague. We definitely had a great time. Thanks!

Nice city, unpleasant owner and lying guides. Although the tour around the city was a good way of seeing it. I went there knowing it was one of the more expensive guides so expected better quality. Instead I received a guide with little in-depth knowledge on significant points in history, but more so, a tendency to lie whenever not knowing the full story. And often spending too much time on irrelevant stories rather than the beauty of the city. To top it off, my meeting with the owner wasn't positive, as he was arrogant and obnoxious. The guide also seemed to hint that they were much more taken advantage of, compared with the other tour guides who receive a larger percentage of the companies profits. I would recommend a free guided tour and renting a bike from somewhere cheaper!

Rent a bike without a guide. Rent a bike for some hours, a day or two and travel around on your own. A perfect experience in Prague to explore new areas you haven't seen by foot. Go south, about 15 km, a long the river and the west side back to city center. The rental staff is really service minded and supportive on places to visit outside the old town.

Great city tours. We cycled around the beautiful city of Prague on a tour by City bike Prague and found the guide Andrew was entertaining and informative and he showed us hidden treasures which we otherwise would not have found on a walking tour.The bikes are reasonably new and are kept in great condition and are perfect for city riding.A cycle tour is by far the best way to tour any city and Prague is relatively flat and so is ideal for easy relaxed cycling.I recommend City bike Prague for their excellent service and prices.

Brilliant. Took two bikes out to explore beyond the city. Standard bikes were near new and perfectly good for a long ride along the river, paths were easy to follow and well surfaced, definitely worth the reasonable cost to see some beautiful Czech countryside, highly recommended
Nice Tour!. Had a tour with Adam - he was a great guide! The classic tour is a great first thing to do when coming to the city to get the lay of the land.
Great bike rental. I rented a bike for a day. It was of good quality, price and I got a nice service. The rental is located in the heart of Prague.

Great tour!. Our tour guide Adam gave a fun and informative overview tour of Prague!
I'd recommend taking a tour at the beginning of your trip and then returning to visit sites you're interested in.

Day trip on a TREK bike to Karlstejn. The TREK bike I rode to Karlstejn was fantastic! I recommend it for solo or groups.....you can go there with pace and return or do what we did and looked around Karlstejn, had a meal and got the cheap train back...Best day out in Prague, fully recommend it :-)

Learn History While Seeing City the Fun Way. We enjoyed a fun and exciting history and sightseeing tour of the beautiful city of Prague. I say exciting because it is a little stressful riding on cobblestone streets filled with cars and crowds. But our guide was very skillful in helping us navigate safely all the while giving us an interesting history lesson of Prague and many of the structures we passed. The tour makes a nice loop covering the old and the new, ancient to modern history and art. Highly recommended, takes about 3 hours and is very economical.
Good tour company. Knowledgeable and helpful staff make for a fun and interesting tour. Seeing the city by bike is a unique way to see the beautiful city.

Good service and bikes. We picked up the bikes slightly late and were looked after well. We needed 16 and were sorted out really quickly after reserving online. Great price and bikes too, definitely would recommend using them...

Fun tour!. The tour shows all the highlights of the city. The bikes are of good quality and als je nederlands bent is het helemaal top, want alles wordt in het Nederlands uitgelegd!Worth the money, thanks :).

Good service - guys there really won't dissappoint you. After couple of years I'm heading East for spring. First and logical stop - Prague. I'm not for the first time here, on the contrary, Two days waiting for my flight, I was just strolling on the Old Town Square glad that nothing changed at least here. Even a bike tour office I never favoured with a visit, driving bike in a city is a suicide!Nevertheless, I decided to take the tour, believing that by bike the guide can cover places of interest that are too far to reach by walking.Well, I was pleasantly surprised. I just walked in and joined a group of English sheduled as the next one.The bikes were in a good shape, apparently, just recently purchased. You can see on their web what they offer. All tours take around 2.5 hrs. I was afraid that the I would be dragged as a cattle by the guide who sure wants to finish ASAP. Contrary. our guide was a lovely Brasilian girl who lives in Prague and she knew the name of every brick and stone we were passing by. What is more important, I could see that it is natural for her to do the best that could be done. She was cordial and truly freindly, not in any way artificial. Im happy I took the tour. The price was fair and I received more than I have expected. Of course, a different guide could have turned this experiment into tragedy, but Michelle made sure that I not only felt relaxed, but I really saw a lot of things I had no idea about.

Fast and comprehensive tour by michelle. We booked a tour for 6. Sadly two of us became ill and we went with four. This was no problem at all. Tour was fun and interesting, a good mix of highlights and action. The guide was michelle, a really kind woman but she could not beat us with the bike(we are dutch, told you;)). She told personal stories and background on the highlightsI would really recommend people to do the bike tour before they do a walking tour, it is faster, more fun and at least as informative!They deliver what they promise

Walking Tours Boring, Bike Tours Rule. I've always been a fan of bike tours to get a real feel for the city in daily life! You can't get that walking a few streets, so I always like covering a lot of ground with a good bike tour! Well, Andrew from Toronto is the guide to make this tour extremely interesting! Lots of great not in the history book stories. You really understand the Bohemian attitude that makes Praha! Highly recommend doing it the first day of your visit- you can always revisit interesting areas you want to explore further! Andrew told us about the free park hidden along a small entry way w Peacocks - just walking around and some people feeding them. Remarkably empty park! We went back to explore and cool!

GPS auto guided tour . I rented a GPS from City Bike to go to Karlstejn Castle.
Charlotte took care of me and she was very nice. I had my own bike and she gave me a lock so I can lock my bike once there.
I would rent from them again. Thanks a lot!

fun day. Just a private group and such a wonderful city. Lots to learn and lots to see our guide was knowledgeable and spent a lot of time with us. He knew so much history and the crazy back stories you dont really hear in the history books so it was fun.

City best seen by bike. We had a great guide named Nick and he gave us a chill tour through the city. He had the right amount of biking and history to keep us all interested and asking questions. We did the city tour but I would recommend any of their tours!

SO useful. These guys have it going on. Not only did we take 2 of the tours but they gave us a discount to rent the bikes for ourselves for the rest of our stay. The service was fast and fun plus they had lots of tips for where to go and what to see. All new bikes. Highly recommended!! If he's working, ask for Drew for the "city" tour... he is very entertaining and knows a lot about the city. THANKS DREW (insert tarzan yell here) ;-)

On your bike!. I am a fan of tours that take you places off the beaten track - ans I saw more of Prague in the 2 and a bit hours i spent with this tour than in the previous 3 times I've visited the city on my own. Ever seen the pregnant lady statue? Ever known you can go up inside of it? Me neither, until our awesome guide demonstrated for us!

Excellent experience. Went with a group of 8 ranging from ages 10 to 60 and we all enjoyed it. Excellent quality bikes and helmets for the children. Our guide, Greg was very knowledgeable and gave entertaining summaries of Prague history as we went around. A great way to orient yourself to the city. Much better than the hop on hop off tour we took the day before. The company was very flexible as we changed our reservation at fairly short notice to another day due to rain on our original booking time

City Bike Praha is awesometastic!!. A 2.5 hour-long tour of the gorgeous city of Prague in the last week of October was the perfect way to explore the city via its cobblestone paths and take all its beauty in amidst the surrounding hues of yellow and red.It was great for me to be in a small group (just me and this really nice girl from London) & our guide, Adam was awesome! He knew the city and it's history inside out, had a great sense of humor and showed us interesting modern art by Czech artist David Cerny, in addition to Old Town, Small Town, New Town, the Old New synagogue, the waterfront and other attractions of the city. Thank you, Adam!! :)

City Bike is fantastique !. I stopped to City bike to ask for some directions and get price information but the guide Andrew was more helpful for me to figure out some very cool places to Czech out ;-) I went back to make a city tour the next day with them and had a great time even with some rain. It was so important in making the Prague experience. Get bikes!

Loved it!. Took the City Ride Tour, it was about 2 and half hours, Got really comfortable bicycle and a great guide, Adam, who was very informative and interesting to listen to, and although we haven't ride bikes for long time he was very patient and helpfull.

Great ride to Karlstein. My wife and I did the GPS guided ride to Karlstein Castle and then took the train back. It made for a wonderful adventure out of the city. Recommended! Although our backsides did feel it the next day!

Full ON -- CITY BIKE !!!. Now this was fun. With the constant busy traffic of travellers, it was truly an upgrade to our holiday to be on bikes. Drew took us out and gave us a very good tour the first day, giving us ideas of some Czech highlights to visit and keeping the stories factual and amusing. We went back and rented bikes for ourselves the next day. What a find!!

Great Way to See Prague. What a great way to see Prague.... We had great time with our tour guide, thanks It was informative but also a lot of fun. We move about the city quickly but learn a lot about the city .... I highly recommend City Bike , especially if you like biking.

Great way to start first day here.. Our bike tour of old city was great. Adam our guide was well-spoken and informative. He had excellent English. He even gave us a lunch spot recommendation that gave us rooftop views of old city and excellent food.

Great tour if you like a bike!. Tour was very enjoyable with good sights visited and very good information on everything. Had to be careful to dodge other pedestrians as there are not so many bikes lanes here. Loved it and recommend to do for sure!

Totally recommend this!. City bike, run by a very nice danish women, is a very good idea when travelling to Prague. Rented 2 bikes for the day, we were asked to deliver them back before 19.00, but since we were indecisive about how long to rent them for, she told us to give her a call and we could keep the bikes longer. Very good quality bikes and good service!
Great way to visit Prague . Easy online booking and good communication. Excellent bikes. Interesting tour with background information and valuable suggestions. Good guide.

Waste of money if you are expecting a tour. We took the 2 hour City Ride Tour and it was a huge disappointment. The tour guide we got was not a local (nothing against that if you're knowledgable, I've taken tours before by non-locals who knew the city well and were fantastic) who only knew the barest facts of the city. We paid good money for a tour of Prague but instead all we got was a guy leading us around a bike ride of the city, with some very basic facts thrown in whenever he felt like it. If you are looking for a proper tour to learn more about the history of the sights around the city, look elsewhere.

Not worth the money. I had high hopes for this tour. I've been living in Denmark and bike every day and thought that biking in Prague would be a good way to see the city. While it is true that biking is faster than walking, I would not recommend getting a bike for your stay and I would definitely not recommend getting a tour. The city just isn't that accomodating for bikers. There were no bike lanes and we frequently had to go between tourists who were walking. As for the tour, I'm sure other people had a better experience, but mine was rather poor. The first thing our guide told us was that he really didn't know much and that it was really a tour just to look. He was able to provide minimal information about the stops we took. Personally, I feel that if you are going to advertise a guided tour and have people pay for a guided tour, you should provide a tour guide who is able to tell more about the city. I didn't pay for a "follow this guy around on a bike" experience, I wanted to learn. I will say though that the guide did his best with a large group, some of whom were very inexperienced bikers.

Great way to see this amazing city!. We signed up for the 1:30 city bike tour. It turned out we were the only two that signed up for that slot so we got a "private" tour from Adam. He asked us what we wanted to see. It was much easier for us to tell him what we had already seen. He took it from there showing us new sights and amazing views. Adam was very personable, knowledgeable, and easy to understand. I would highly recommend seeing the city this way.
Amazing Bikes, Amazing Service. We went on a tour with Adam and it was fantastic. Very informative, took us to great places in the city. A highlight of the trip. Thanks Adam.Callum
Great. Great, easy and fast way to see Prague. We rented bikes for three hours and got to see some magnificent views!

Easy Riding. 4 of us hired e-bikes for a couple of hours and had a great time. The bikes were very new and required very little effort to get around, even up steep hills. We were able to cycle to Letna Park and then via the tram 22 route past the Castle to Petrin Hill. We then came down to the Lesser Quarter before making our way back.The bikes were great, easily adjustable for different heights and easy to adapt to.Make sure you take ID as they will take a photocopy for security purposes. You pay for the first 2 hours up front and then if you use if for longer pay for the extra hours when you return.I'm sure the tours would be fun but we wanted to do our own thing as we'd been around the Old Town and Castle the previous days. We were able to get around and explore much further than if we had been on foot.

Great insights but not school. These guys were really great on the city tour. They took us to all of the major locations and told us about some of the nuances in history that provided a bit of background without getting long winded. Just right.

Great place to rental bikes or take a bike tour. Perfect location and the best bike rentals in the area. The tours are great and the guides very knowledgeable of Prague and its history> Thank you Phillip Ross for the recommendation

Excellent experience. I had the opportunity to visit City Bike Prague a couple times and rent bikes. The owners really went above and beyond for my wife and I. The bikes were new and in great shape. They handle large groups (not sure how large, but there was a group of 15 making arrangements as we returned or bikes). Between Pavel (owner) and Charlotte (employee), they speak 6 languages, Czeck, English, Dutch, and 3 other European languages which escape me right now. Would definitely recommend them to everyone looking for either a tour or to rent bikes. They send you with bike lock, helmet, and patch kit as you want, too. The tour guide (Greg) did a fantastic job of explaining the sites their history.

Best Tour Guide ever!. I started my long weekend in Praque with a sightseeing tour City Bike. I was really lucky because nobody else booked this tour, so I had a private tour. Adrian, the guide, asked me in the beginning about my wishes ( e. g. less history and more stops) which I found really pleasant. He knows a lot about and has good advices regarding the must-dos in Prague and especially the pubs and restaurants. ;)Besides, he really looks like George Clooney! The tour tooks about two hours and after it I felt like knowing everything important about the city and its highlights.I highly recommand a tour with Adrian!
Thanks Adam!. Had an amazing morning with Adam and 5 other cyclists on a city bike tour.He knew where he was going and he told us a lot of interesting facts about the city!Thanks!

Great ride and decent prices. Very close to the Námêstí Republiky subway station and not too difficult to find. This shop offers an enormous variety of bikes. The staff were very friendly and spoke great English. We rented the E-bikes and were thoroughly impressed with them. We rode an E-bike tour the night before with another company, but those bikes were pretty beat up. These bikes were in great shape! The electric was on the whole time and after five hours the batteries still had 75% of their charge left! I highly recommend this place!!

Prague bike city tour. Went on the Prague city tour on a bike with a guide, he was very informative and helpful. Also the man in reception was very helpful with my booking which was booked wrong by the agent. Thursday April 30th at 11.30 am

Friendly staff, high quality bikes. We are leaving in Prague and were renting bikes from City Bike for a weekend. Conveniently located at the city center, open throughout weekends, great quality bikes and very friendly and helpful english speaking staff. They also gave us duscount vouchers for next time. We'll be renting from them again, even though prices are at the high end.

Forget the theater, go for a ride!. When my friends from France came to Prague, they wanted to see something special. But I'm too bored classic city tours! So I was searching for something special. My friend recommended me City Bike Prague and I said to myself that´s better than nothing. So we tried and I was excited! Nothing on it was boring! I even think that I'd take on ride my Czech friends too, because it´s, thanks to Sean's interpretation, surely more fun than the last tour, they attended on elementary school. Definitely recommended!

Prague by Bike. I had a Tour with Dennis who knows the city very well. Thanks to him I learned even more about it. I reccogmand this company because it is very sweet to discover the city by bike with a nice tour guide who knows it by heart. Thanks to that you can see the various aspect and period of Prague.

Up the hill to Prague Castle on a mountainbike. Took the castle tour at city bike prague recently. Our guide was a really likable Czech guy called Adam who really astounded us with his detailed historical knowledge of this impressive landmark. What I also really liked was the way he presented the information. He his way of presenting the facts really seizes your attention. I finished the tour feeling a lot richer for what I had learnt. Thanks Adam!
Best bike tour ever. Had an amazing experience. Very enjoyable, and informative. The weather was perfect, and our guide, Sean, was great. Funny, and knowledgeable.

A break from business with the bikes. We had some business partners visit us from overseas and were looking for a fun activity. This was not their first visit to Prague so I really wanted to do something a little different. We booked an extended private tour with a tour guide from Scotland called Sean. He had some great ideas for cycling routes around Prague, that took us out of the city and into the greenery that the city has to offer. I really enjoyed the tour and although there was nothing historical to discuss along our route, we all enjoyed the scenery and his sense of humour. A relaxing break from negotiations and a refreshing tour offering something different. On behalf of the tourgroup we would like to thank our guide and the staff at city bike for their service. If you want something a little different then I recommened taking a private tour and talking to them about some of the routes they can offer

Words are not enough, you have to experience it!. I was given the task of finding a program for foreign colleagues. Never been to Prague, so it was clear that they must see sights. I live in Prague for a long time and to be honest I'm sick of the whole city. But when we were with Sean, it was so refreshing experience! I think, that from this time I´m in love with Prague again. He took us to places I had never been previously.

Amazing Experience. Pretty good way to see prague with interesting pubs and places and historical stuff pointed out. It was very educative, beacuse our guide (Shaun) knows almost everything about history of this city aswell as many places, bridges, buildings etc. Bikes were in perfect condition. Great opportunity to experience Prague in a different, funnier and more interesting way.

A REALLY FUN WAY TO SEE THE CITY. When my friends from the US came to visit me for a weekend in Prague I wanted them to see as much as possible in such a short amount of time. So one the things I planned for them was a bike tour of the city, and it was an excellent choice!!! The tour was really fun and informative not only for my friends who were in Prague for the first time but also for somebody that has lived here for so many years like me. I would definitely recommend it to everyone!

A different point of view of my Prague.... I live in Prague for two years but I decided to visit it in a different way, I had my tour with Sean a Scottish guy, who showed me many places I didn't know. It was an interesting tour, full of useful information, funny and he recommended me many pubs and restaurants very cool. Thank you for this wonderful experience, Sean is able to convey the right enthusiasm that is typical of those who truly love this beautiful city. Definitively recommended.

Definitely recommend. The best way to see the sights. We had the Scottish guide Sean too. Very funny and very informative. He even pointed out good places to eat/drink that we would have never known about. Definitely recommend

Tour with Sean: Excellent!. We got a private afternoon tour with Sean and visited a handful of interesting places we never would have found on our own, got good tips for local food and drink, loads of colorful historical info complete with book recommendations. Sean has enthusiasm for the history of Prague that brings it to life, and running around on the bikes was good exercise and fun. Highly recommend!!

Different way to see Prague. My friend recommended to me City Bike tour and I can say that it was a very good idea. I spent afternoon with bike guide Sean from Glasgow, who lives in Prague and knows places you can´t find in official guides. He avoided busy places and you can´t be a bike pro to enjoy it.

City Bike Prague Was Awesome!. Went on a City Bike tour while in Prague for Easter weekend. Our guide Sean was awesome! He was knowledgable about the city, its history and made the overall tour incredibly enjoyable. The tour was by far my favorite part of our trip. I learned way more about Prague then I would have gathered from a guide book. Not to mention that it was pretty cool zooming around the city, across the Charles Bridge and along the river on a bike. City Bike was overall a great choice! And you should definitely get Sean for your guide if you can. Just ask for the guy from Glasgow!

Definitely should go. This is the kind of thing you must do. I've looked around for other places and they have the best price and the tour guide was very funny.The bikes are in great shape, that's a plus and I've learned a lot from the cityThe took around 2 hours. If you are here, you must go with them.

A great way of sightseeing in Prague!. We went on a bicycle tour through Prague with our family of six. What a great way of sightseeing in this beautiful city! Within a short time you see so much more of this historic place than you can ever do by foot. Our bike-guide Sean showed himself a walking encyclopedia and with a lot of humor told us about the sights we passed. We got a lot of great insider tips as well to visit for the remaining weekend. This tour is doable for everybody and we would definetely recommend it to all that visit this great city!

Fun tour with a knowlegable local. Great tour with a cute local. It was fun to talk with him about his personal experiences throughout his time living in Prague. The bike wasn't great but it was only for a couple of hours so no biggy. We hit the main attractions and he pointed out where and how to get to the others that we didn't see. Also, I met a really great gal on the tour and we ended up touring the city together for the next couple of days. Now we're great friends! The other folks on the tour were nice and fun too. 10/10 would recommend!

Becherovka and good advices!. We found the implicit urge to do some cityexploring on bike while we where in prague last year, and boy did we strike gold! We found shaun, and we both agree upon he being the friendliest person we met during our vacation in prague (given we only met with him for perhaps half an hour?). He immediatley instructed us on how the city works, where to go and what to eat, all the time with a smile on his face. This place will therefore always bring back the good memories of our praguetrip. The bikes where nice too :)

E-bikes with Shaun . Shaun, our instructor, led us on a great bike tour of Central Prague. He knew, in detail, the history of every place we went to and told us what to see next time we are in Prague. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!Thanks Shaun,From Zack

Best way to see Prague. My husband and I reserved a bike tour of Prague. We were very pleased with our decision. The receptionist at cCity Bikes was especially friendly and helpful. Although our guide, Andrew was a bit late, his tour was fantastic. We got to places we never would have reached and his insight and knowledge of the city was wonderful. With limited time I suggest you try this way of touring. There was a large selection of bikes in great condition.

city bike Prague. An excellent way to see the city, you don't have to be superfit or bike mad..this was a really enjoyable afternoon which packed in some of the best sites and short bursts of history which were captivating. There were 4 of us on the tour and we were fortunate to have amazing weather in October. The guide was very relaxed and seemed to be enjoying the trip as much as we were. The tour avioded busy roads so we felt very safe. This made our weekend and made you look twice at the architecture and rich history that Prague has to offer. This is the best way of seeing the city!! Really friendly team who were more than happy to recommend bars restaurants and other places to visit to suit your taste. BOOK NOW!!

Perfect way to visit the sights. My friend recommended this tour and I was very pleased. The guide was very friendly and didn't rush the tour. it helped that we had a perfect day weather-wise. We went over every importan part of the city center and stopped to get pictures and hear facts. I highly recommend this tour
Good ride for all ages. Loved day out saw lot of sites may have missed on foot. ie john Lennon wall. Jana English speaking guide very good. About 14 in our tour felt very safe

Fantastic bike tour. We all thoroughly enjoyed our bike tour and it was a great way to see Prague outside of the city. The staff were so very helpful and they enjoyed what they were doing. Would highly recommend this to everyone.

Awesome Tour!. Me and my girlfriend, decided to take a tour with these guys. At home in the states we ride bicycles regularly so this was something we were really looking forward to during our time in Prague. Every aspect of the business was on point and our tour guide,Taryn, was amazing!! This tour was definitely one of my favorite moments for our trip.

Great Ride to Karlstejn. Great ride to Karlstejn castle with Taryn and Sean. It took about 3 hours of beautiful views along the river and charming Czech towns. We had great weather and it was a really nice day. Once we got there we had a chance to eat lunch and check out the medieval castle built by King Charles IV before heading back to Prague on the train. Definitely recommend.

Trip to Karlsteijn Castle. I went on a tour from Prague to Karlstejn and had a great time! The bikes were provided and adjusted perfectly for each of us. Our guides, Taryn and Sean, were both really nice and down to earth. The route was beautiful and got a great look at the Czech country side. The ride ended at the beautiful Karlstejn castle where they provided lunch and a couple of beers. They also provided our train tickets back to the city. Overall, I had a fantastic time.

Karlstejn Bike ride. This trip was really fun. The staff made sure that everyone had a comfortable bike that was set at the correct height. Even if you are only in the city for a few days, the ride is a good way to get out of the Prague and see the Czech countryside. Karlstejn is a picturesque town with great little restaurants and shops. The view from the top of the castle is unbeatable.

Loved the tour. Had a great experience with City Bike. The tour was very beautiful and worth every penny! I would highly recommend using city bike. They got us all set up and on our way quickly without any problems.

Very nice tour. This tour was very nice event we had very bad weather. Our guide was very nice and funny. Our group was small. Is it possible to rent a bike for whole day. I very recommend this tour to all of you event Prague is city with many hills. Tour is also for very goo price. Next time will rent here bike again.

Awesome ride to Karlstejn. Last weekend I was on a tour to Karlstejn castle. We had these two guides with us - Taryn and Sean and both were very polite and professional. In the beginning Taryn and other employees helped us find a suitable bike. Our route lead through picturesque places and they also offered us alternative routes for more experienced bikers. They took good care of us the whole time, there was also lunch and train ticket back included in price.

AWESOME guide and AWESOME tour!!!!. When my partner and I arrived in Prague we were juggling with the idea of either taking a bike tour or a segway tour. We'd taken several segway tours before and always really enjoyed them. So we decided to try something different and we were quite pleased with this decision afterwards. Our tour guide Sean was an absolute delight! He was very knowledgable and an excellent story teller. He had us laughing all the way through Prague! In just 2 hours we saw a lot of the city. Some of the sights we probably never would have stumbled upon on our own. There was even a fountain of two men peeing!!! lol.

So great- we went back to them fir 3-days!!. Day we arrived we had a guided tour (by our Scot, Sean)...who shared the city, history, monuments with his gruff Scottish brogue. He was wonderful and kind....and definitely whet our appetites for more. Next day...ebikes to karlstejd castle. GPS helped but it was an adventure by all means! Loved the ebikes!!! Left at 12:30 (too late....must start sooner)...arrived at castle (and amazing hillside village) at 445!!! We looooved the ride. Toured the castle....took the train back to Prague and paid extra since we couldn't return the bikes by the agreed 6:45p. We got back at 930p!!! It was one of the greatest days of our trip. Be flexible, patience is important, you may get lost....get over it and enjoy the journey. The destination, however, is out if this world!!!!!Thank you Pavel and the amazingly sweet Charlotte! They really care about their customers.My husband, me and my teenagers loved it. Btw-went back a third day, rented ebikes again and ride everywhere in Praha!!!Alison- Dallas USA

Bike tour with Drew! with City Bike Prague. Drew is easily one of the best tour guides I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing. Not only is he well informed, he is original, interesting, and inspiring in a foreign city. He gives a historical and a cultural perspective, and gives also (a rare thing) an opportunity to develop ones own perspective while learning all these amazing facts about Prague. The bike tour was Fabulous, and having taken other tours, a definite step up from those. Having an interest in history, I was impressed by the knowledgeable leadership of our tour guide, and I highly, highly recommend it to everyone who would like the opportunity to get a great feel for the city, full of information, without the pain of walking for many kilometers on the average walking tour.

A few inaccuracies!. A great way to get to know Prague. A good tour of the city.Our tour guide was a lovely American girl who had lots of information to give to us, unfortunately their were a few inaccuracies. They were nothing major but I prefer to have accurate information.As was mentioned before on another review the card machine had apparently broken and so we had to use cash. Maybe they should get this fixed ASAP!!Our tour guide also told us that she was only paid her wages from the tips! Really???

Great different way to see Prague and save your feet!. Elena is an awesome guide! As a solo traveler it was a great way to get my bearings on the city and learn about the sites, while having fun on a bike! Though the cobblestone was a bit bumpy, our group covered a lot of the city in the 2 hours, including a stop in a cute park across the bridge. Recommended.

Do not do Self-Guided GPS Tour to Karlstejn Castle. From the moment we got there, things did not work out as planned.They said they accepted credit card, and when we got there, the unfriendly lady said the credit card machine is not working so we need to pay cash. Luckily we had some cash, so we paid; however, that cash was intended to be used for other things, not the bike tour..Here is our experience:The route that Garmin took us was ridiculous and confusing. It took us into a 2 feet wide trail in the forest, and at one point there was a fork in the road and GPS had no clue which path. I was wondering..why was a forest trail even on the GPS? We chose the wrong fork and GPS finally alarmed.It also led us into a dead end, and then we had to carry our bike down the hill to continue in the street..I'm not lying, it was so weird.GPS told us to turn left where the road was steeper, just to get back on the same road.Took us into a unnecessary detour to Morina, where we spent hour pushing our bike up because we could not ride it due to the steepness! Turns out, it was a wrong direction.GPS clearly malfunctioned and they blamed it on an operator error. Perhaps there was some operator error; however, how is it acceptable business for the GPS to cause such a major issue? What should have taken 2.5 hours took us 5 hours.We finally got to the castle but did not get to see it.Workers were rude and un-apologetic.

Unpersonal service but the guide was great. First email contact with City Bike Prague was very correct en quick. But by intern mistake they booked us twice for on the same day (two different employees mailt me). One group tour and one private. At arrival I showed the different emails of contact, but the made it seem is was my mistake. There was little personal contact at checking in, the boss had an very (!) important message to send on his mob Phone. And made that very clear to us. So we just stood and waited. Also we were not informed at intake that there was an max. weight for a childrens seat. So we had to book 2 tandems. In stead of one. Although the website said there was drinks provided, we did not recieved it. The price was ok, but a little strange that a 4 year old has to pay the same as an adult... Well, this all we found not so professional. Our luck was our guide, Martin, He was very well informed about Prague. He told us many interesting facts, histories and showed us a great tour we really enjoyed. He had all the patients (even though biking with a family with 3 young children sometimes goes slow..). So 5 stars for Martin. 2 for the costumer service.

Great tour guide!. We had a very large group - 6 adults and 8 children (ages 2-10). That many children taxed their specialty bicycle limits to the max, but they managed to find a seat for each of us. Please note that a couple of the tag-along bikes and the bikes with baby seats attached were quite wobbly, but we did manage. The other bicycles were in normal shape for bikes at a bike tour company. I never did catch his name, but our tour guide was fantastic and entertaining, and we learned a lot of trivia and history about Prague. We all enjoyed it very much, even with the wobbly bikes. Mostly flat riding, with hardly any hills (they don't go up the hill to the castle or St. Vitus, don't worry.) I would definitely recommend this tour! It was soooo much better than the walking tour we did of Prague the last time we visited.Thank you, City Bike Prague!
Great way to see Prauge . Fantastic way to see the city. Office staff were helpful and polite, tour guide Sasha was very friendly and very knowledgable. Would defiantly recommend x

Awesome way to see Prague!. Martin gave us a great bike tour of Prague. We were able to see the sites in a leisurly bike ride over the course of 2.5 hours. We have come to love bike tours and City Bike in Prague did not disappoint. Our only complaint is that we wrote ahead of time and said we needed a 20" bike for our son, City Bike said they had a bike for us but when we arrived, it was not a 20" and was too big for him, so he had to ride on a tandem bike with me. However, in the end, we really enjoyed our tour and Martin was very knowledgable and gave us a great overview of Prague.

An excellent introduction to Prague.. We did a 2 hour city bike tour on the afternoon we arrived. It really gave us a good perspective of the city and we were able to explore in more detail in subsequent days. The guide was very informative and gave interesting anecdotes as we cycled around.

Great bike tour. Just spent a few days in Prague & really glad we stumbled upon City bikes. Alex in the office was really friendly & helpful. We went on the city tour with Martin who was a great guide & very knowledgeable. It was an easy & enjoyable 2hr ride. We saw many walking tours during our stay & most people looked bored out of their minds, this is the way to go! Went back a couple of days later to hire bikes for a couple of hours & rode along the river to get away from the hustle of the town. Would recommend :o)

Awesome bike tour. We've done city bike tours in Barcelona, Budapest, and Vienna and this one was the best because our guide ,Martin, was so knowledgeable about every site and had a number of entertaining anecdotes. It was about 2.5 hours and covered the city area. Great way to get an orientation to the city.

A Fun&Easy way to explore Prague but be Alert!. We been to Prague for 2 days and 1 night. Decided to explore the city by bikes.Rented Electric bikes from City Bike for full day (6-7 hours) with GPS.GPS helped us to navigate to the places to see. This GPS have a tour Map of places to see in the city. It was a great experience and fun way of exploring the city. They have very good electric bikes and GPS was also good. Our trip gone very well but at time of returning bikes a very unhappy issue happened. The locks of the bikes have 2 keys,1 they give to you and 1 they keep with themselves. I returned the key,they opened the lock and put it inside office but then they started telling me that I did not returned key & they opened the lock by their own so there is 1 key lost. And if it is lost I have to pay money for new lock because a key can't be made for such locks. I repeatedly was telling them I did not lost & returned to you, we told them to double check and then my friend also gone inside the office and suddenly they came to me saying sorry that we found it,it was just misplaced like that. I really don't know if it was a mistake or Intentionally trapping act, but my advice to people is that while returning bikes & other stuff to the company be alert & make sure what you are returning.So that no such issues happen. I am giving 4 stars to City Bike Prague only due to this reason, however I recommend "City Bike Prague" to other people.

Favorite way to see Prague!!!. I have been to Prague many times and this is still my favorite way to get around. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. You can do a guided tour or go wander by yourselves. I did the tour with Taryn and she was wonderful!! If something better than just the boring walking tours this is for you. They take to some more hidden sites as well as hit the best sites in the city. You won't be sorry. But be careful on the cobblestone...

A must do while in Prague!. Taking a bike tour with City Bike was one of the best decisions we made on the trip. Our tour guide, Taryn, was full of information about the city and was hilarious too! We learned about some of the coolest, little known facts surrounding Prague and it's history. Taryn took us to the John Lennon wall, the Prague Castle, the Charles Bridge and a ton of other really cool sites. The ride itself was also great, nice and easy with no hills or rough terrain. It was such a good experience and led us to rent bikes in the other cities we visited while vacationing in Europe. I highly recommend City Bike Prague.

Awesome Tour!. Our tour guide was really knowledgeable and friendly, our tour hit all of the must-sees in the city, the bikes were comfortable and easy to ride (and in good condition) and the price was perfect! I highly recommend this tour!

Just a fun way to see Prague. The tour guide is great! He knew so much about Prague and I learnt a lot.I can't ride a bike very well, but I found this easy- It's an easy pace, so you don't get left behind. It was a really good way to see Prague, it's not expensive, it's fun and I would do it again.

Such a fun way to see the city!. I've been backpacking through Europe for a few weeks now and decided I wanted to stay a couple nights in Prague. The hostel I was staying at suggested I take a bike tour because it was a fun way to see the city. They recommended city bike and I couldn't be more pleased. The tour guide was very friendly and had me laughing the entire time. She really knows her stuff. The ride was also really fun and I saw lots of bits of Prague that I probably wouldn't have seen on a regular walking tour. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Prague.

Extremely informative!. Being from Amsterdam we wanted to bike around the city of Prague! Renting the bike was easy and at a great cost. We were given suggestions on where we should ride, how long it would take and even some location suggestions! The bikes were comfortable and came with locks. Definitely a suggestion for anyone wanting to city the city in a different way!

Energetic and informative. Not only is Prague a magical city steeped in culture but my boyfriend and I were lucky to find a great tour guide. Taryn knows her stuff, was great fun and provided the kind of informative afternoon that enriched our weekend break. Highly recommend!

Fun interesting and informative tour - best way to see city!. We've taken bike tours in several European cities and feel this is a great way to see the sites. The only reason I didn't give this review a 5 was because of the city itself - its not as bike friendly as most European cities, but learning about the history and seeing the beauty of Prague in this way was worth all the weaving we had to do through pedestrians. Andrew was our guide and he was knowledgeable and funny. He helped us with restaurant suggestions and directions as well . We stopped by the day before our ride and the other staff member was very helpful too. Great experience overall !

Top guides and the best way to see the city!. We were only staying in Prague for 2 days so after doing a bike tour in Barcelona, knew they are a good way to see the city. My expectations were beyond met with this tour… We had American Andy as our guide and with his knowledge he could write a book about the city, the history and communism! He was witty and great fun and HE made the tour! He took us to various sites over 2 hours, stopping frequently to point something out. We hired e-bikes which I would definitely recommend - waaaay more fun than a normal bike! Best way to see the city without a doubt!

Best part of our trip to Prague!. I visited Prague for 2 days in April with five of my friends and this Bike Tour was recommended with a discount by our hostel. We walked right in to the center and inquired about a tour, and the friendly staff said they would be able to accommodate us that day. Because there was a large group of sixty students using the standard bikes, we were upgraded to new electric bikes at no extra charge. Our guide was engaging and very knowledgable. He made the tour interesting and fun for us and offered to take pictured of our group at major landmarks. It was a great way to see the city!

Great experience!. We had a group of 7 and booked a city tour in advance on our first full day in Prague. Our guide, Martin was great - very knowledgable and proud of his city. We saw a lot of great sites, got some good tips, learned about the city and some of it's history and got our bearings of the area. Would highly recommend.

Great experience!. Had a great experience on the Prague bike tour! Our tour guide, Taryn, was very knowledgeable and really made it fun. Would definitely recommend to others and will be back next time in Prague!

Simply the Best, the best, the best, the best bike crew!. Thx City Crew, was there for just a short while and we really wanted to get through the whole city and boom in my face was City Bike. Got a guided tour just like that with a native english guide and we pumped it out and we got to see stuff we would of not seen on my own, GREAT JOB GUYS and wait 4 it, wait 4 it...the best is after the tour they gave us a free beer. THX

American Friendly!!! Great Bikes!. What a great service this shop does. I was helped immediately by a guy who knows bikes and knows when you a real rider or a casual sightseer. As a avid rider and bike owner (3) from Colorado - I was given one of the newer mtn bikes that was tuned up and ready for the beating my 200 pound body gave it. The shop is American friendly which is important in a city that does not go out of it's way to speak English. City Bike people were polite efficient and looking out for me the rider not the bottom line. I highly recommend!YOU WANT SHOCKS - if you plan on being on the bike all day get one of his bikes with shocks because many of the roads in Prague are not bike friendly on the back and butt.

Excellent Guide. Excellent Tour. Having been on many tours allover, it is completely true that the tour guide can make our break the tour. This case was the former. We had tour guide Neil who was able to give us a ton of interesting information. Being two mid 20's guys, we lose interest very quickly. Neil was able to keep us interested giving many new and unusual facts. I would definitely recommend this bike tour to anyone who wants to experience Prague.

The best way to get around Prague. Prague is a decent sized city, so if you want to be sure to see everything during a short stay, I definitely recommend renting bicycles. I didn't compare prices before choosing which bike rental to go to, but I am more than happy with my outcome. I simply went to the first place that I saw, which was very well located. Since you're going to end up at some point near the city center, renting a bicycle from City Bike Prague is definitely a good choice. The reason why I like this particular bike rental so much is because of the impeccable service. Alex is the person I spoke with, and he is extremely down to earth, an enjoyable conversationalist, who is very helpful with directions and offers great recommendations. The next time I return to Prague, I will certainly be his returning customer. Thanks again!

Best way to see Prague City. What better way to zip around Prague city and take in the sights than on a bike! The bikes gave us the freedom to explore, the staff recommended where to go and suggested a few nice spots that are too touristy as well. Monk beer at the Monetary was one valuable one! Bikes can be rented for half day or full days. And at the end....they give you a free beer to quench the thirst of cycling:) Friendly staff, very good bikes....best way to see Prague

Look no further. My girlfriend and I had a fantastic experience with this company. Marissa Fernandez is a great tour guide and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. If you are in Prague for a few days, I can't think of a better way of changing things up then taking a tour around the countryside on a bike. Good times.

The best way to experience Prague. Renting a bike is the best way to travel around and see Prague. This place had nice bikes and 3-4 models to choose from. Alex, the owner/manager was very friendly and helpful. Explained us all the routes and places to see. If you have some time renting a bike to go around the city is a must do.

Solid bikes and a great ride. Grabbed some bikes from City Bike one morning and headed to Karlstejn for the burcak wine festival. The directions they gave us (thanks Alex) were simple and straightforward, and we made it there without a hitch. The bikes were in great shape, and we didn't have any problems. They gave us some locks so we had the freedom to wander around the castle and the festival without a worry. Thanks for the good time, City Bike. Cheers!

Fun ride to Karlstejn. Some friends and I decided to rent some bikes to head to Karlstejn for a quick day trip out of Prague. The bikes (they were Treks) were in great condition and the GPS navigated us there perfectly. We rode pretty leisurely there and ended up taking the train back, so it was a fun and easy way to quickly escape the city and take in some of the beautiful Czech countryside. If you have time and want to get out of Prague for a day, I definitely recommend getting some bikes from the folks at City Bike and just riding around. Really excellent day, so thanks CB!

Best way to learn the history of Prague - a must!!. Mr. English (his nickname by the locals) was our tour guide (and he is original a Brit). He was awesome and had so much information about the history, war time, the Jewish quarter, all the various architectures, religious political influences, communist era and so much more. Prague is small but easy to get turned around. Doing this tour made it simple to see all the major attractions in old town. I would do this tour again, easily!!!

Fun and thorough way to get your bearings in Prague.. We did the old town/city tour. The cruiser bikes we rented were very comfortable as we saw all the sights from the square, Lennon Wall, Charles Bridge etc. The guides were ex-pats so they spoke perfect English, but knew a surprising amount about the city including the historic sights, original story, effects of communism and even contemporary issues. They somehow managed to make us laugh the whole way too! We went back the next day to rent bikes for the whole day and tour the castle on the hill, which they discouraged since we insisted on using the gearless cruiser bikes - don't do that, if you take bikes use ones with gears to conquer the hills ;)

An absolute must when in Prague. This tour breathed some life into my trip and made an otherwise good vacation, great! After being in Prague for a couple days, I wanted to something new and exciting. Something different. When I stumbled upon City Bike I knew that I had found exactly what I was looking for. I walked in and the atmosphere was so friendly and welcoming! I was lucky enough to have Marissa as my guide. She was extremely knowledgeable and incredibly helpful. The tour was informative, enjoyable, and easily the best thing I did when I was there. The bikes were great and comfortable to ride and the tour was so interesting (thanks to our charismatic guide Marissa). This is an absolute must when in Prague and I would recommend City Bike to anyone and everyone!

A smashing good time. As a well traveled man, I have seen my fair share of city bike tours, and I have to say that City Bike Prague is one of the best city bikes tours that I have been on in my life. My tour guide, Marissa Fernandez, is a charming and wonderful lass who knows her way around the city and if you're lucky she can tell you some fun and interesting facts about that city. Always smiling and happy to help, she made my bike tour wonderful, and it will be a long time before I can find a bike tour that was as jolly good as this one!

Best way to see the best city!. I came to City Bike near Old Town Square in Prague based on its excellent tripadvisor ratings, and was not disappointed at all! I had an amazing time seeing everything you could ask to see in the center of the city. My guide, Marissa, was extremely personable and knowledgable (she knew everything, seriously. There was no question she couldn't answer). She was also plain adorable. I went back in the next day and everyone greeted me like an old friend. City Bike might have been the best part about visiting Prague.
To do in Praag for sure!. Nice to do. Ask for Phillipe as a guide! He is a very good guide from Miami living in Prague! Private tour is better than the group tour.

City bike keeps it casual!. Wow, just wow. Prague is such a beautiful city and with the help of our trusty tour guide, Marissa, we got to see the best of it! Informative, relaxing, and eye opening are just a few choice adjectives to describe the wonderful experience I had with City Bike. Marissa was such a charming southern belle, you could still smell the essence of the apple pie she had baked that morning. All around a great way to spend the afternoon with my family.

We had such good time !!!. Thanks to Philip for an excellent tour. We had so much fun! The bikes were brand new and after the tour Phillip spent at least 10 minutes helping us mark on our map all the places we wanted to visit. I would recomend City Bike to anyone visiting Prague!!

Nothing short of spectacular.. It was after three days in Prague that I decided to do a cycling tour and it was my best decision and most memorable part of the trip. After participating in several mediocre pub crawls and even more underwhelming walking (read: BORING) tours, I knew I needed something different... something... exciting. City Bike was everything I wanted and MORE. City Bike is a MUST for a bicycle tour of Prague. I was greeted at the City Bike office by Pavel, who in addition to being extremely good looking, was polite and managed to squeeze us into a nearly full tour. Our tour guide, Marissa (who you should definitely request), was amazing: kind, knowledgeable, an excellent cyclist. She calmly and eloquently relayed the entire history of Prague and the Czech Republic while gracefully cycling for two hours over cobblestone and up hills. The tour was riveting, exciting, fast... but Marissa also tailored to those less bicycle-savvy, and was willing to slow down for several Americans in the back of the group. Overall, the company seems to be flexible when it comes to its customers. So, Pavel, Marissa- thank you for making my experience in Prague the BEST it could have possibly been. City Bike is a fantastic company and should be recommended to all those coming to Prague!

Absolutely perfect. City Bike Prague was an unforgettable part of my Prague experience. The bikes were in perfect condition; the service was impeccable. I've taken a fair amount of bike tours in a fair amount of cities, and I'd say that this one is among the best I've had. I'd also like to commend our guide, Marissa, who was very friendly and knowledgeable about the city. The price isn't bad either. I wholeheartedly recommend City Bike if you're looking for a good time!

Great tour. This experience was perfect .. the tour was perfect ,the tour guide (Elena) was very funny and helpful ,the information about the site-seeings was very good ,funny and draws the story line of the Czech people ,the world war II and middle age history . no one can regret doing this trip with this team .

Well done; intelligent, thorough, and pleasant. Our guide, Philip, took the extra time to personalize our tour, and was thorough in both the sites visited and the history of them. The bikes are set up just right for the course, which consists of many cobbles, some low to moderate hills, and spurts of urban cruising. Very helpful before, during and after the ride.

Perfect trip!. It was perfect! Weather, Prague, our guide Elena... Two hours of happiness. You definitely should do this trip, if you love bikes and prefer unusial ways to discover the city.Thank you once again, guys!Maria
Great way to See Prague!. We took a tour and it was a great experience! Plus I learned some history and interesting facts about the Czech Republic and Prague. Highly recommended!

Nice trip through old Prague. Informative tour. Our guide was a bit short of text and sometimes it felt we paused too long or had no extra info to tell. But overall a nice trip that keep you happy for 2 hrs. One tip: on a hot day give the participants some time to buy drinks on route.

Superfriendly staff and cool bikes!. We rented the cruisers to go by ourselves a few hours. It went very smooth - we got to see a lot of Prague in short time. When we came back we asked for some more ideas on restaurants, bars, clubs and things to see in Prague - it was really helpful too.If you think about renting a bike in Prague, this is the place to go :)

Highly recommended. I was walking in the unforgettable historic center in Prague when someone shouted 'Dobre Den!' at me. I immediately recoiled in fear, as I didn't know what a Dobre Den was. It turned out it was only the friendly Marissa from City Bike Prague. We started talking and she told me about how awesome touring Prague WHILE riding a bicycle could be. I was skeptical at first, as I usually find nothing amusing about doing two things at once.we began the tour and she not only expertly navigated the madness of Prague traffic, but saved me from an angry tram driver. I thought I was a goner for sure. I learned a lot about Prague. For instance, did you know that Prague is older than America? I recommend this tour as one of the most important thing you should do while visiting Prague. I was won over instantly by the flexibility and organization of the tour company (the bikes were amazing and well maintained!), and by our tour guide Marissa, who possesses an unworldly charisma and uncanny likability. I couldn't have asked for a more perfect day!
Good service, Great way to see the citt. Very Good service, we had problem with the bike, within 25 minut they Came with New bike for us. Great way to enjoy Prague!

Tour and tour guide were great - saw many city highlights in an enjoyable two-hour trip.. My friends and I have taken several bike tours in cities in Europe, and while this one was shorter (2 hours), it still gave a great overview of the city and allowed us to get our bearings of Prague. City Bikes Prague seems less established than other bike tour companies in Europe, but our tour guide (Emmanuel) was still informative, knowledgeable, personable, and gave great suggestions. The city is a little more difficult to navigate (more cobblestones, no bike paths) but it is still worthwhile!

Highly recommend. Great tour through Prague. We had Emmanuel from Portugal for our guide who took us round most of the main Prague attractions. He has great knowledge,he is funny and interesting guy.The bikes are excellent. I would definitely recommend...

Up close and personal. Very nice experiance.The tour uses well maintained bikes and has an office right next door to the Hotelde Paris. Great location!Check in was easy, efficient. The staff suits the bike to each individual .The tour covers much of the historic inner city with information and details otherwise difficult to acquire.Our guide Emmanuel who hails from Portugal was full of facts, history and passion for this lovely city.

Great Bike Tour!. My wife and I took a bike tour with these guys and It was a wonderful experience. The tour guide seemed to really know a lot about Prague and its history. The tour was about two hours and covered much more than the walking tour. I highly recomend it to anyone!Cheers!- John W

great bike rentals and bike help. This shop rents bicycles for riding around Prague - an excellent way to get around the city. They also do guided sightseeing trips by bike. We are touring around Europe and needed some basic maintenance. Alex was very helpful and friendly. We highly recommend his business.

A Great Eperience! :-D. Hey Guys I rented a bike for the day and road it all over the city and river. It was a wonderful experience. They guys at City Bike where extreamly helpful and friendly. They even gave me a free beer! I highly recomend renting a bike there! :-)

Good tour. Great tour, nice way to see Prague, especially if you're pushed for time. Tour guide was very informative and new a lot. Prague castle is gorgeous. Take the afternoon tour as that includes the castle.

Better bikes. I rented bikes from Praha Bikes and City Bike and I have to say that City Bike's rentals were a lot better for the cobblestone streets of Prague. They have nicer bikes with really nice shocks.
Be sure to bike up to Letna and have a beer while you are biking around Prague! It's beautiful up there.

Great!. Though I did already some walking tours through Prague in the past, the boys and girls from City Bike surprised me with this bike tour. I did see some things which I haven't seen during the walking tours.Our guide, Elena: She was fantastic. Though she's originally from Spain and doing this only since a couple of months, her knowledge of Prague is great. She did a wonderful job. If you ever go to Prague, book a bike tour at City Bikes. They're great (and maybe you should ask Elena as your guide :-) )

Fantastic. We have been doing bike tours in each country we go and this one was great. We had Neil for our tour guide. He was knowledgeable and down to earth.
