The guys at the main office were so helpful and nice also. We liked them so much we went back and hired a bike for our last day. They remembered our faces and again were so helpful. Would highly recommend.

Fabulous family fun. We took the 10.30am city tour today with Emmanuel as our guide. The guys at the shop were friendly and efficiently sorted out bikes for us all, including a tag along for my 5 year old and kids bike for my 8 year old. Its helpful to the rest of the group if you get there 15 mins early to get that sorted. The 2 hr 15 min tour was a flat ride which is suitable or all levels of fitness. Cobblestones added an element of fun and the sections on road felt safe despite some traffic (especially as we had a city bike employee riding at the back of the pack to ensure everyone was ok). Emmanuel was a great guide - offering just the right amount of culture, history and photo stops. This was a great start to our stay in Prague and we would highly recommend it.

Great tour!. We had the company of Emmanuel who took us round most of the main Prague attractions. He had great knowledge of the place and even walked us down to our boat trip after. Only slight negative is our 1.30 tour didn't include the castle but there is only so much you can do in 2 hrs! I would definitely recommend city bikes..

Awesome!. The City Bike team is full of some really cool people. I went to Prague to visit a friend for the weekend. She suggested I take a tour with City Bike while she was working. I'm glad I did because it was great fun! Our group consisted of me, our guide Marissa, and a bunch of guys who were there for a bachelor party. Very dynamic group! Though we had all just met, we had a great time talking and biking around the city. Also, Marissa was super bubbly and friendly. She was very knowledgeable about the city's extensive history, and she took us to all the beautiful sites. She also had great suggestions on other things to do in the city. As for the other people that work for City Bike, they were just as friendly and cool as Marissa! I highly recommend City Bike!

Wonderful!. The City Bike guys, Pavel and Alex, rescued us! Our tandem was dead in the water at the beginning of a 6 week trip, but these two great guys fixed it and refused to be paid. Please repay their karma! Their bikes are in great shape. James & Patty Cagney - bend, Oregon USA,

The best walking tour we've ever had!. We were on our way to another 'free' walking tour that we had booked in advance. On the way, we crossed paths with Diana with City Bike. She gave us a brochure and told us about the walking tour that she was offering. She told us that she would have smaller groups than the tour that we had booked. Man, was she right! Our tour started 15 minutes after we met, and it turned out that we were the only two people on the tour, so we had her all to ourselves! When we started our tour, she asked if there was anything specific that we were interested in. I told her that I was very interested in Prague's recent history - WWII and communism in particular. With that, we started our tour and she took us by many sites significant to WWII and communism, along with all the usual Prague landmarks. Her knowledge of Prague and its history was exceptional - there wasn't a single question that she didn't have an answer for. Diana is a wealth of knowledge and information about Prague. She is super friendly, kind, and you can tell right away that she has a good heart. We were so thoroughly impressed with her that we booked a second tour with her for that afternoon of Prague castle. Again, she was great! There was no rushing, and she made sure that we took our time and saw everything that we wanted to see.Our walking tours with Diana were definitely the highlight of our trip to Prague, and we are grateful to her for making our trip so memorable! During our tour, we saw many other walking tours where there were 10 or 20 or more people on the tour. We felt sorry for them! It would be difficult to hear the guide in a group that big. If you want to take a tour of Prague, I can't recommend City Bike Prague and Diana in particular strongly enough. Smaller groups, super knowledgeable staff, and guides with kind hearts. What more could you want? Thank you Diana!

Fantastic!. I took my first European adventure and did not really have a solid plan for my visit to Prague. I decided to take a tour offered by City Bike Prague. Our tour guide, Marissa, was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. She not only possesses great knowledge of the city's history/culture, but also provided great recommendations on other things to do while in Prague. A bike tour through Prague is a great way to get to know the city. It was well worth the time/money.
Great tour, flexible guide!. Loved the tour and history. Marissa was a great guide and changed up the route to meet our interests. Plus we got free beer! Na Zdravi!

Best way to see Prague. This was not my first choice company as I had been given details of a different service from my hotel. Having been given bad directions and missing the start of the other tour I was given a flyer by someone in the street and went at the appointed time to the City Bike venue.This service was half the price of the other company so suited my budget better. Surprisingly on what was a nice day they had no other takers so I ended up having a personalised tour.Whilst I rate this service very highly I would throw in a few points. I was not offered a helmet, although they have them and I would not have used it. I was also not offered my free drink.I think they will do pretty much anything you want but you may need to ask. For the money I would say very good value and if like me you can get the leaflet from someone in the street you may find that you get it at a discount.

Unprepared. We signed up for a bike tour the day we arrived from Vienna. The weather looked ominous but we figured this is something they have seen before and we be ready. We had been on tours at previous cities and they were ready with rain gear, even gloves if the riders were cold. Basically it started pouring about 45 minutes into the 3 hour or so tour and everyone in the group wanted to stop. The guide led us back to the shop and when asked for a refund we were told "no" with a smile. Would have expected a little bit more like an offer to come back with better weather at a discount (not looking for a handout here) but nothing was offered. Bummer.

Great way to get to know Prague. I had such a great time on this bike tour. I am an avid cyclist, so I try to rent bikes or at least go on bike tours whenever I travel. Here, I got to do both and I couldn't have been happier. On the day of my tour, the weather wasn't great, but our guide was incredible. He knew his stuff on the tour and gave some great tips after. I decided to rent a bike from them and upgraded to one of their nicer Trek mountain bikes. One might assume that bikes are a bad idea in a city with so much cobble stone, but there was nothing my bike couldn't handle! The suggestions and the routes the guys at the shop gave me were terrific, especially the beer garden with the amazing view of the castle, called Riegrovy Sady in Zizkov! The service was great, the bike tour was fun and informative, the bike provided everything I needed for my time there... bottom line, you just cannot go wrong with a visit to City Bikes if you're in Prague. Oh, did I mention the free beer I got after my tour? Bonus!

Disappointing. Had a great time for first hour or so. Then it started pouring rain so we decided to go back. They didn't offer us a refund of any kind, not even to finish the tour the next day or rent bikes again. Yes our idea to turn around due to weather but come on customer service??

Excellent Bike Tour. I tend to like doing a bike tour on my first day in a city because it allows me to see a bunch of the highlights quickly and then I can go back to what I find especially interesting so I've taken quite a number of them. They are generally pretty good but even compared to other solid bike tours, the City Bike tour in Prague that I took a few weeks ago was truly exceptional. Our guide was Deanna and she knew the history of Prague as well as all of the sights backwards and forwards but also had a way sprinkling in lots of really interesting anecdotes and stories. She also gave us great suggestions on where to get some excellent food and drink after the tour. As to another reviewer's complaint about there being actual people in a city (the horror!!!), I can only say that I was there on a fairly busy day and did not find it particularly difficult to ride thorough plazas without mowing down other pedestrians. Overall this was an experience that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Prague.

Best tour I've ever been on. This was our first time in Prague and we wanted to get a good feel for the city and history. We got WAY more than we expected. The staff was so friendly and helped get us fitted for our bikes right away. Our guide, Diana (sp?) was AMAZING. She was so friendly and willing to answer our questions or take photos. We were blown away by her knowledge, especially regarding the history of Prague (and there is a lot of it!) She did a phenomenal job of tailoring it to our tastes. She also knew lots of little trivia and fun facts about the sites. Without a doubt, the best tour we've ever been on. A MUST for those visiting Prague!

Good tour. The tour guide Marissa was good. But the tour had its downsides: the bikes were not the best quality (my back wheel brake did not work well, no toe clips so you felt like your foot would come off the pedal in the rain) and the route required riding through crowds of people walking in plazas or streets or along narrow walking paths by a bridge. This activity could be better.

Great mt biking outside the city. Prague's a relatively flat city and we'd already seen the sites, so me and my friend wanted to hit up some of the trails outside the city. We rented a few bikes from the guys at City Bike and they gave us two sweet brand new trek bikes which rode smoothly over the mountainous terrain. One of the places they recommended we go to a place called "Czech Paradise," about an hour and a half train ride outside the city where there were some nice castles and we saw a bunch of other riders--mainly Czechs, I'd assume--riding out there. Prague's beautiful, but it was awesome to get a more authentic experience of the countryside, too. If you're interested in some nice bikes at a fair price, go see these guys because they know what's up. Thanks for the bikes and recommendations, City Bike!

An awesome way to see Prague!. Face it, Prague has a lot to see, and walking everywhere is really tiring. In the summer, it gets warm, so riding a bike is the perfect way to catch a breeze while catching the sites! The bikes at City Bike are in great shape and not cheap models, they handle the roads well and are lots of fun... Highly recommended!

An amazing bike tour of Prague!. Just got back after our fantastic tour of Europe! City Bike Prague was undoubtedly the highlight of our holiday! Such friendly and helpful service and a wonderfully entertaining guide (Peter). Not only did we see all the important sights in Prague, Peter - who had lived in the for over 20 years - also told us some fascinating stories about the more recent transformation from communism to capitalism. I can't recommend City Bike enough! 5 star!

Fantastic guided tour arround Prague. We were a group of friends from Denmark that took a guided tour with City Bike. It was a really good experience and we saw and heard a lot of things we would not have seen otherwise. Great day.
My girlfriend and I rented the day after the bikes again and went discovering on our own.
Its a must

Best tour and rental in Prague. when i go to a new city, i always try to find a bike tour on my first day to get to know the city. these guys are great. it was quick and easy and the guys who work there were friendly and mad me laugh. the tour was about 2.5 hours long and it covers all the major sites of the city. the guide had great stories and was informative. afterwards, i rented a bike to explore the city by myself. they gave me a map and sent me on an adventure down the river. great experience. thanks to Alex and Paul.

professionalism with lot of fun while exploring Prague. choosing City Bike Prague was the best way how to show my Slovak friend the beauty of the downtown and surroundings. Even I have been living in Prague for 12years, guide tour showed me the town in different light and we enjoyed the entertaining way of the presentation by the City Bike´s guide! Excellent staff attitude and service! Highly recommended for each who requires professionality with fun!

Super!. I highly recommend this unique way to see Prague. The people are friendly and the guide was informative, entertaining, and quite helpful. The bikes themselves are super! I am grateful for the excellent customer service and I give this company 5-star rating.

Best way to experience the City (Bike)!. We decided to rent a couple of bikes on a whim and are very glad we did. We had been to Prague before and this time wanted to see some sites a bit off the beaten tourist track. The guys at City Bike were very helpful and we got a couple nice, well-maintained bikes at a good price. They recommended that we go to Stromovka and Letna parks wich was fantastic! Overall a great, inexpensive alternative to wandering around the center on foot. There is so much more of Prague to see than just the center and having your own bike is the best way to get around!

Great Tour. Me and my friends did a rental with City Bike. Everyone was great there and the bikes super cool. Later on me and my girlfriend decided to take a tour to the castle and we loved it. The guide, Diana, was super funny and we had a great time around the castle.

Rock & Roll!. Spur of the moment group decision. So glad we took a chance on City Bike ... What a great way to experience Praha! Cool staff, very chill, new bikes, obviously knowledgeable about the city and its history. Came came back two days later with our late-arrival friends and did the tour. These guys know their stuff ... Ask them anything! Very helpful "real Prague" recommendations for food and drinking/clubs to round out the experience. The free beer was a nice touch! Rocking!

excellent way how to see the best of Prague. I would like to Thanks City Bike team for great service they provided for my friends from NY. It was their first visit and we decided for unusual way of the Prague sightseeing - bike tour. Our guide was native English speaker what my friends very appreciated and was very good and knew a lot about Prague and history. We could see in few hours’ tour the best places in Prague. They were very happy, enjoyed the tour. Can recommend to all!!

Entertaining and Informative!! Terrific Tour~. I recently got back from a four day trip to Prague, and took in a city and castle bike tour with City Bikes. It was FANTASTIC! My tour guide, Marissa, was knowledgeable, spunky, and incredibly entertaining. She told us information that I had never read in a guide book, and made the whole experience feel like an old friend was just showing me around her favorite city. And to top if off I got a great workout without even realizing it! Which made our trip to the nearest beer garden after the tour all the better! If I'm ever back in Prague and fancy a bike ride, I know exactly where I'm going. Thank y'all!

Super!. Last week we took a 2 day trip to Prague with our little one.Thanks to City Bike we managed to see the beauty of Prague in such a short period of time even with our 3 month old monster:-)...Thank you very much,guys! And see you again...

Awesome time in Prague. This experience was totally awesome. We are five guys from Chicago who rented bikes here about a week ago. Bikes were in great condition, brand new. We planned on taking a bike trip around Prague and then going outside the city. Cheers to Alex and Marissa for helping with bikes and planning our trip. They also gave great advice on what to see, places to stop for lunch, gave directions and insight into the City. We even got a free can of beer!

Great Bike Tour. My wife and took a morning city tour with Diana yesterday. The staff at City Bike was very frendly and helpful with selecting a bike and getting us out on tour very quickly. Diana was a wonderful guild and took us to all the great spots. She was very informative, friendly and fun.

Great tours with Andrew and Vivien. Hi! I promised to leave feedback last August, so here we are). My husband and I took part in two tours - City Ride Tour with Andrew and Castle Ride Tour with Vivien. Both of them like the city so it was pleasure to listen to them. During the first tour there were 5 of us, and we had a small break in the park and chatted a bit. Andrew told us a lot of interesting facts about Prague which you can't find in guides, he is extraordinary and knows a lot of funny stories. And what is important, he speaks understandable English ^^. Vivien is a native English speaker but we had to verify some phrases by her). It was her first tour, but it was nice. There were only her, my husband and I in that group. The bikes were also OK - comfortable and fast.

Fantastic Tour, Great Historical Insight into the City, Great way to see the city.. Me and my girlfriend had a great afternoon biking around with a fantastic tour guide Peter. He was interesting, fun and charismatic, and really kept the tour alive whilst keeping us safe. This has almost certainly been one of the highlights of our stay here in Prague, it's a great way to see the city, get a varied knowledge of Historical context, and a really efficient way of getting around and seeing a large portion of this wonderful city. Me and my girlfriend had come into this city quite uneducated on its historical richness, and what Peter had to share was informative, insightful, and gave us a real sense of the city of Prague's struggle through the years of nazi and communist occupation. The bikes were comfortable and a joy to ride, and we would both want to come back and give the other tours the guys have to offer a go. Again could not recommend this more to anyone, regardless of who they're with. You're thoroughly looked after, you gain a wealth of knowledge about the city, and it's a real joy to do something so efficiently and effortless for a lot of satisfaction.

Brilliant tour of Prague with Emmanuelle. Biking around Prague with the charming and enthusiastic Emmanuelle was the highlight of my short trip to the city this week. Although from Portugal, emmanuelle had an amazing insight and depth of local historical knowledge, I'm still recalling the endless amount of sights and information he shared on our 2hr trip.. It was a brilliant introduction to Prague as nothing i had pre-read about the city had filtered in as easily as on this insightful tour. The bike was a brand new rock machine which made the whole tour thoroughly comfortable and enjoyable. I look forward to coming back with my family and going on this tour again, but for longer.

Great Introduction to the City. The first morning my friends and I were in Prague, we happened to walk past City Bike and decided to check it out. The staff there was super friendly and even despite the drizzling weather, we had a blast on our tour with Diana. She didn't bore us with long winded historical lectures, but pointed out the important places and had interesting stories to accompany the sites. Prague is a beautiful city, and I'm so happy that we first explored it on bike. We got to hit all the major "must sees" of Prague and then some other bizarre places that we never would have been able to find on our own. Diana even gave us recommendations of some of her other favorite places in the city so we were able to go explore after our tour. I highly recommend City Bike for anyone visiting Prague!

Great way to see the city. We had a great bike tour with our guide, Megan. She was knowledgeable about the city and gave us all the highlights. I would recommend the tour in the beginning of your visit to the city- you'll get a feel for the city and then know what you want to go back to visit later in your stay in Prague. They offered a variety of bikes (beach cruisers, mountain bikes, pedal brakes/ handle breaks, etc., which was a nice option and we were thrilled when they offered us a tour even though they were closed for the season. Very good customer service. The tour was roughly 43euros plus tip for the guide. A great use of your money!

The best way to see the sights of Prague is behind two wheels!. What a lovely was to sightsee through Prague! Andrew is a fabulous tour guide...very informative and passionate about the history of the city! I could have spent hours more seeing the city on his bike tour. Děkuji, Andrew!

Great way to see Prague. We went on the afternoon bike tour with our fantastic guide Andrew. He knew so much and had a lot of energy, enthusiasm and knowledge. He didnt bore us at all was extremely funny and gave us many handy tips to use while being in the city! He showed us many places off the beaten track and I couldnt have asked for a better way to see such a beautiful city. The bikes were perfect, comfortable and easy to ride. The staff were also great, after the bike tour showing us on a map where to go and where not to go out around town. This helped ALOT!!

Great way to see Prague. We went on a bike tour on Saturday 15th September. We went on the morning tour which no one else had booked on so had our own guide (Megan) and effectively own private tour. We covered about 7 miles in 2 hours and thoroughly enjoyed the tour. We booked through an agent who advertise in the hotel whose description states "free drink and bike tour" the free drink didn't happen which didn't disappoint us but City Bikes should correct this in the advert. I would recommend at a weekend going on the first tour as the city quickly gets packed with tourists which as the crowds increased, cycling become slower and trickier. Megan was knowledgeable and amenable and amended the tour to suit us to cover more ground and see more sites with shorter descriptions at each stop. You need to ask for a helmet as they do not assume you want to wear one. Check the fit before you leave as mine had a faulty clip and kept loosening - I shudder to think if the helmet would have helped in an accident! The bike was in good condition and there was a choice of bike types. Book direct with City Bikes and pay the little extra for a private tour to suit your cycling confidence and expectations of a city tour.

Biking on cobblestones - tough but worth it!. We had a wonderful morning biking around Prague. As luck would have it, the weather was iffy so my husband and I were the only ones on the morning tour. Our guide was fun and knowledgeable and I couldn't think of a better way to get an overview of the city. It's absolutely jammed with tourists and this got us to some places we wouldn't have discovered. And it was no problem for a couple of 60 somethings!
Great Place to Rent a Bike. Near Old Town Center, City bike provides an easy way to rent a bike or 2 for a reasonable price. We managed to loose one of our keys and they didn't even charge us.

Fantastic tour - thanks Andrew. This was a great bike tour, with our guide being Andrew. Full of enthusiasm and information.Good price, very comfortable bikes, good pace for tour which took just over two hours and took in almost all important Prague sites (apart from main square, and that would be impossible on a bike due to al the pedestrians)

Good way to see the old town. Took a bike tour of the old city in Prague with City Bike recently and had a good experience. Our tour guide was Conner and he did a good job of telling us the history of the places we saw. Even gave us a much needed beer break in the middle of the tour. The riding was easy as it was mostly over flat areas. We covered a lot of ground, more than could be done on a walking tour. I recommend this tour and group to anyone wanting to see Prague in a different way.

Fantastic Tour! Well worth the price!. Do yourself a favor and take this tour. I went with a group of 6 and our guide (Unfortunately I forget his name) was an ex-pat from California. He was great. The tour has two options, a city tour and a castle tour. We were lucky enough to have a mix and did a half and half (ask for that if you're interested in both). Our guide was fun and very knowledgeable of the sights he showed us (I love learning the history of things I see). He was also knowledgeable of sights we just pointed at along the route. This was a very relaxed and very fun tour. Also, the guide was in no rush and the tour went longer than expected (though he asked if it was OK for everyone if that happened). I read another review about an Auzziie tour guide that sucked. I can't speak for that. Ask for the guy from California :)

Good visit with remarks!. A city bike tour is always a good way to learn to know a city because you can do quite some distance on a short time and have a good idea of what is to see (or not) in a city. If you can do this with help of a guide then we are in favourite and we have done this in Berlin, Vienna, Sydney , Budapest etc. In case of Prague it was a short ride (2u) compared with other cities(mostly 3-4u) . The reason is that centre of Prague is compact (so no big distances) and by that some places not feasible due to too many tourists. The ride as such was good , with a guide who speaks perfectly English but at the same time disappointing since he was not a Czech and we missed the local touch. The bikes were of good quality but the price was high (22Euro/person) compared with duration and experience in other cities. We stopped to have a beer and paid ourselves (also for the guide), afterwards I saw on their website that a free drink was included. The price of 3 beers (3 euro) was cheap but nevertheless we felt a bit cheated.

Great way to see Prague. We decided to hire bikes to see as much as we could as we spent the previous day on foot and doing a boat tour. We went for just bike hire for the whole day which we felt was a reasonable price and was really worth it. The guy at the shop was very friendly and helpful. We spent the day on the outer parts of the centre going stopping off in the many parks to take in the view and relax. We spent the afternoon by heading out along the river where there is a great cycle path and we stumbled upon a music festival where we had a great time. Without the bikes it would just not have happened. We then had to race back as we knew the shop closed at 6.45 and were just a couple of minutes late but we were greeted with smiles and they even spent a bit of time giving us information. If you want to see Prague its a great way to get about would highly recommend it

Perfect way to ride around Prague. Very friendly English speaking service. No nonsense bike hire with lots of suggestions as to where to ride. Not overly cheap but not many other options to compare the price to. Worth it for a couple of hours or a whole day. We rode around most of Prague in a couple of hours and you get to see things and places you wouldnt necessarily see if you were on foot as more mileage can be covered. The guys were also really helpful with other questions we had about where to eat and other things to do in Prague.

Informative and fun. Our guide was very knowledgeable and took us to many of the sights we knew we already wanted to see, so it saved us a lot of time and energy to be able to get to things on the bike and have our guide explain the significance of each place to us. I'm not sure of his name but he's from New Jersey (I believe) and was very professional in both his manner and presentation. He knew a lot about the historical significance of each thing we visited and we particularly enjoyed his coverage of the Jewish Ghetto as we were planning to visit again later on our own. Unfortunately there was a very immature Aussie on the tour who decided to try and do some fancy moves with these touring bikes and in so doing, he ruined the bike frame of his bike. We then all had to wait for someone from the office to ride out to where we were with another bike for him to use. Other than that, very good tour and a great way to get quickly acquainted with the main sights of Prague.

Reasonable and Enjoyable. The city of Prague is quite large and My wife and decided to do a morning bike tour in order to cover a lot of it in a single morning. It was a good choice. Our guide's name was Brian; a college student from the U.S. who was temporarily living in Prague. The bikes were in good condition and very comfortable for cobblestone roads. it so happened that my wife and I were the only participants on our tour. Brian was very knowledgeable of Czech history and at every stop he provided excellent commentary and was able to answer most of our questions. It was entirely worth what we paid.

DO NOT DO THIS TOUR!!!!!. Biggest scam ever. I did the Big Mike Bike Tour in Munich which was awesome so I thought, 'hey, let's do a bike tour in Prague'....BIG MISTAKE. The ad is wrong .. big lie. So we get Brian the Ozzie for our tour. He is so spaced out the whole time. We get to the first square and he just sits there silent.... was I suppose to give this tour????? And this was repeated in every location we went, he didnt know much... HE STOPPED US TO LISTEN TO OTHER TOUR GUIDES!!!!! and he tried to pick up two random girls around town while he was giving us this tour where he didn't know anything... BIGGEST WASTE OF MONEY. It was dragging on, we couldnt wait for the tour to finish. The walking tours seem way better. Also, the website says free drink... there is no free drink. The only bad part of being in Prague was this tour!

If you can only do 1 tour...this is it!. My husband and I had an exceptional tour with Brian from City Bike in Prague. The bikes were new, the group was small (just the 2 of us), and Brians detailed commentary and extensive knowledge of Czech history made the city and the culture a special memory for us. Highly recommended.

Ace | Interesting | Convenient. My girlfriend and I went along in the morning. Kinda hard to find but if you get lost ask anyone where Michalska is. If possible, request Harry. Any Americans might not understand his rich Glaswegian accent, but it's worth it! There was one other couple with us from Taiwan and Harry did well to keep such a small and quiet group like ours interested. He is a natural storyteller who clearly enjoys his work and holds a deep affinity for beautiful Prague, which has such an obviously interesting history anyway.The bikes are safe and convenient and the city is very easy to get around and cyclist friendly. Kids would have no trouble.All in all a great experience and one of the highlights of our trip. We did cycle tours in both Budapest and Vienna but we enjoyed Prague the most.

A new perspective. I took my american friends from the student exchange program on a bike tour of prague. Being a czech i was astounded with our guide Sean's knowledge of my capital and we all had a great time. Thanks Sean
Amazing Guide1. Trip - amazing, well planned out.Guide - had Steven as my guide. he was extremely nice and very knowledgeable! he spoke good english, and was a fun guy

Great Segway Tour - Amazing Guide . We just wanted a Segway experience and thought Prague would be a good place to do that. We had already been in Prague for 2 days and did all the popular stuff already. So we asked our guide Arleg to show us some stuff that general tourists would not know. He took us to some insanely good places like the Hanging Sigmund Freud and gothic churches and the Franz Kafka rotating head and explained the history behind these cool places. And he was so happy and enthusiastic while explaining all the stuff and super professional as well. Thoroughly enjoyed the trip. BTW they gave us a great deal too since we were a group of 5.

Great way to see Prague. We were in Prague for 3 nights and booked a bike tour for our first full day. Harry, our tour guide was excellent, very knowledgable and informative with something to see and talk about, seemingly around every corner.The tour gave us a great insight into the city and over the next couple of days we revisited many of the places we cycled to. Things we would never have seen on our own.We are keen cyclists but that really isn't important as we went at a steady pace with regular stops.Thanks Harry for a great few hours

Awesome! . Husband and I had a great experience seeing Prague in different perspective! Being on Segway was so much fun! Our tour guy was Albert and he was very easy going and knowledgable . He also asked us if there is some things we are interested more. So happy we chose Segway tour!

Prague by bike. We took a small group tour with Yellow Zebra Bikes and were shown around the charming city of Prague by the very knowledgeable and friendly Scotsman Harry! Harry showed us so many places in Prague that we couldn't hope to find on our own and regaled us with really interesting stories and facts about the city. He took the time to explain not just historical information but also snippets of interesting stories about the John Lennon Wall, Prague's literary, artistic and musical icons and even shared stories about some of the locations used in TV series and films. Although the day was wet we had a wonderful time and were so impressed by the tour we're booking another one in Budapest!

wonderful experience. tour guide with the name of VLADKA , cheerful and lovelyi'll recomende her to any one who wanna take a tour in pragueshe knows the city very well, so you will be with a nice company

A perfect way to orient oneself to Prague. Had a couples private bike tour with Yellow Zebra Bikes today. Had booked it well in advance. Didn't want to be amongst a crowd of 15-25 riders so we took a private tour with Harry. The tour was thorough and comprehensive. The pacing was perfect. Harry wanted to make sure we had the opportunity to see Prague through his eyes. He was perfectly knowledgeable of the history of Prague.....although he is a charming Scot!The ride was easy, not even a sweat is worked up....no hills! So if you are looking for a great way to see Prague, call upon a Yellow Zebra Bikes and ask for Harry!

Excellent!. We went on our to bike tour with the wonderful guide Harry! We had an awesome time and learned so much about the area. He also gave us some great tips on local places to eat and showed us around. For a fairly large city it's the best way to see a lot and decide from there what to tour after. Harry also gave us great recommendations on what to go see as well. This is our 3rd Yellow Zebra Bike tour on this trip and we could be happier with all the experiences and great guided!

Really worth while !. Harry, our Scottish guide, took us on our comfy yellow bikes through Prague. He knew lots of stuff to tell about the history and famous people of the city.It was a really nice thing to do in the city, by bike you can cover a lot more than on foot.

Excellent Segway tour of Prague!. We booked an early morning (9:30 AM) Segway tour, so it ended up being only me, my wife, and our guide Vladka. My wife and I had never used Segways before, but Vladka was great at introducing us to the device and getting us properly oriented. Our tour ended up lasting around 3.5 hours, and it was absolutely fantastic! Vladka took us all around the city, the park, the castle, Old Town, pretty much everywhere that we wanted to see.Vladka was personable, funny, and well-informed about all of the places we saw. And her English was perfect! Definitely recommend getting her as a guide if you have a choice!

The best thing I've experienced. We took an one hour tour with a guide named Nick. He was very kind. We felt free to ask him anything about Prague. He knew everything. He was like a walking encyclopaedia! We took a trip to Letná. He showed us the most beautiful view and took us to a very mysterious part of Prague. I strongly recommend to go&try this ASAP because this possibility won't last forever due to the ban.
Recommend them!. My guide was called Misha, she was friendly and they offer you to choose the route.. I booked half an hour ride, though we exceeded the time, they said no problem.

Very nice tour on wheels !. We did a tour on Prague on Segway ..We really enjoyed the tour! The facility was downtown and gave all the information. You had a private guide with you to guide you thru the city , and they spend some time teaching you before you can start your tour. That training time does not count in the time of the tour that you contract.Our guide , Vojta, was very friendful, goodmanners and was looking at safety and of course the tour was really nice with the plus of a amazing city sight views from the top of the hills beside the Prague castle ! Thanks!

Amazing experience. We went on the segway tour with a very jubiliant michaela...as we had already seen most of the central town, we requested to a bit offbeaten path and she was quick to oblidge...we saw lot many sites usually not visited...especially the monasteryMichaela even got us a table reserved at the LOKAL for which I dint get a chance to thank her! Hope to get in touchHighly recommended!And thanks
Really fun! . I went on the bike tour with two friends, we had a really fun time! Informative and informal. Sean was a great guide, very funny! I would definitely recommend this tour!!

Best Part Of Visit In Prague. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our private tour with Misha. I highly recommend the tour and Misha as a tour guide, as she was energetic, displayed extensive knowledge of the city and all historical landmarks. Misha also encouraged our Segway riding abilities which made us more comfortable and exciting! Five Star Recommendation!
Segway Tour. Top Tour. Nice and friendly, Germanspeaking guide. Competent Knowledge of Town and History. Gives good advices in driving by Segway.

Segway Tour with 'Steven'. I think Steven took really great care of our group especially of the kids, and the training session with him was fantastic.He is also very knowledgeable about the history and architecture of Prague.Overall, our experience with Steven was wonderful.

Highly recommended!. We took the one hour segway tour with Michaela as our guide, we thoroughly enjoyed it. We had never been on segways before and Michaela was a great teacher. The tour was great and Michaela was very informative and friendly. A fantastic way to see the city, wish we had done it at the start of our holiday, a really fun way to get around.

Exellent way to explore beautiful prague. last week me and my brother took the 1 hour segway prague city tour with Michaela as the guide. the 1 hour tour will give you enough experience and knowledge of prague historical story. Michaela was a superb guide, she was very friendly and she told us many information about all the historical site around prague very clearly. This segway tour experience is one of my most unforgetable moment during our europe summer tour this year.

What a start to our Prague visit. We spent 3 and a half hours with Harry today enjoying all that Prague has to offer. He was fun and charismatic and full of knowledge about the area. We ticked off so many sights off our list and left knowing what we were going to explore further and just how we were going to do it, from trams to nightlife to day trips. Touring with Harry was like having an old friend bring you about his favourite city and he gave us a fantastic start to our trip. I particularly liked the John Lennon wall and listening to a busker play here comes the sun and leaving our mark on the wall.We do a bike tour in every city we are in and this is the first time I have felt strongly enough to write a review. A great tour and fantastic value for the length of the tour also. Cheers Harry

Bike Tour of Prague: As entertaining as informative with Sean!. My bike tour with Sean was amongst the best I've ever done. For several years now my family and I make a bike tour of each city we visit a priority. It is a fantastic way to see learn about a city. We do this early in our stay so we can learn about what we want to explore in further detail. If the tour guide is good, you will learn the history and highlights of the city, and the best spots for dining, dancing, or anything that interests you. I have toured 9 cities this way and Sean provided one to he best. He is quite a colorful character initially from Scotland. He is well read and quite knowledgable about Prague's history. He was able to answer most of the questions we had when we were wanted to go deeper into a topic. To his credit, he did not hesitate to let us know what he didn't know. I've had guides just make stuff up. Did I mention that Sean was entertaining?

Bike Tour with Harry. After a positive experience with Yellow Zebra in Budapest we decided to use the companies services again in Prague. Harry was incredibly knowledgeable and biked according to the abilities and interests of the group. We would have never visited half of the wonderful sights without the tour. We particularly enjoyed stopping at the John Lennon wall and being able to sign our names.

City Segway tour. After doing a Segway in Budapest with yellow zebra, we decided to do another one in Prague. We chose the superior tour which is 3 hours plus a few minute for training. I would recommend this tour but would also recommend the 3hr tour. Damn now the Gilligan's Island song is stuck in my head... Anyway it was a great tour and way to to see the four sections of the city. In the extra hour of the superior tour we did get to see some of the bohemian "hippy art" (as Americans would see it it) including the Lennon wall graffiti and the "pee'ing statues" which was really cool. I will say if you are doing a Viking riverboat cruise from either direction, you should definitely do a yellow zebra Segway tour. But book only one and take the tour then you get a discount on the other of 20% which is well worth it. We took Budapest and then booked the Prague tour after when we got the booking code. I have found this is the case with Segway tour operators that are chains or have sister company's in multiple cities. Two things that would have made this better is if they would have had radios with the guide telling about the area and history. If felt more like a motorized sight seeing tour with just a little history lesson. I have been on some tours in which the guide just wouldn't shut up and put you into information overload. Don't get me wrong we did get some info on the site but not S much as I would have liked. It could be just the guide as well. I'm not sure but it was fun nevertheless. The other thing is they left the Segways in "turtle" mode meaning they were speed limited to 1/2 of the normal speed. This did make it hard to ride in some areas cause the Segway would kick back on you. But they turned it off on the 3rd hour. Much better and easier!The shop is kind of hard to find and there is not a visible signage pointing you in the right direction. Also if you get to the main square you will see lots of Segways with people trying to sign you up for a tour. We couldn't find the office but finally asked one of these guys who pointed out the yellow zebra rep a few feet away and he walked us to the office. Also there is not a restroom at this office so you are on your own but they will stop if you tell the guide. I would definitely do again but might opt to pay a little more for the private tour at this location. One other thing I will mention is this is a crowed city with walkers and cobble stone walkways/roads will give your knees a workout. I suggest taking some Alive before and after or have cocktails afterwards to help you relax :)

A Great Way to See the Sights of Prague!. We did the English speaking half day bike tour and with scottish Harry. It was a terrific way to see around this wonderful city on our first full day here. We were taken to Old Town , New Town, Lesser Town and the Jewish Quarter. The bikes were in excellent condition and obviously well looked after with optional baskets on the front for those who wanted. My husband and I were the only customers on this particular tour so Harry personalised it quite a bit for us, including the chiming of the astronomical clock at midday and a stop off for a cold beer before we returned. Harry was full of historical knowledge about all the sites we stopped at, as well as many others we passed along the way. He was able to link up many of the artistic, religious and political aspects for us since we knew nothing of the area or its history. He also gave us many recommendations about breweries and restaurants to try, as well as suggestions for accessing more sites during the remainder of our stay.

Great bike tour. Had a great time with Scottish Shaun on our tour. He is fun entertaining and knowledgeable. Would highly recommend... Also and extra compliment to the back office staff for top friendly service!!
very good experience and good guide. My tour guide is Arthur, he is very patient to teach us how to control the segway and he introduce the building history very detailed. Good experience in Prague!!

Which way? Segway!. Being novice Segway riders, we didn't know what to expect but our young guide Sven quickly had us riding like experts. The tour itself was fantastic. Sven provided both interesting and humorous insights into the beautiful city whilst keeping us and fellow tourists safe. Segway rIding is great fun but get in quick. They will be banned in the Czech Republic in two months. Don't forget to ask for Sven.

Nice and quick introduction to Segway and Prague. Me and my son have only one complaint and that goes towards ourselves - we took the shortest tour and after we finished we just wanted more and more.Our guide Steven showed us all the major attractions what's managable during 30mins, but we heard a lot of interesting/alternative stuff one can't find in Your average guidebook.Recommended!

Best experience ever! . We had Steven as our tour guide and I couldn't have asked for any better. He was really well informed and patient with us first-timers. We did the 2 hour tour and saw all the amazing sites around Prague. We went to the most beautiful places and it really made our holiday something special. It's situated close to Old Town Square so it's really easy to find and the staff were really lovely and helpful. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Thank you so much for such a great experience.

Fantastic! . We visited Prague on bank holiday and wanted to see all the sites. We walked past yellow zebra and thought we'd enquire about the tours. The people were all lovely they explained everything to us and gave us the options for booking, so we did this via email which was easy as it didn't cost using wifi at our hotel... Our tour guide Harry was great! He had so much knowledge on the city and told us everything and more than what we wanted to find out :) as it was so hot we stopped for a beer which was an added bonus! :') I personally would highly recommend the bike tour it's a great way to see the city! X

The only way to Segway. Renting segways is a great way to see the city of Prague! And they are super easy to operate. The tour was the perfect mix of informative and fun! Would recommend this company and guide any day!

Fab fun tour . I was hesitant to try the Segway however watching my husband practicing with the catcher I decided to give it a go We got taken to the office and the staff were really nice friendly & accommodating Our tour guide Arthur was nothing more than fabulous ☺️We had soooo much fun and learnt more about the city than any other tour we tookArthur was sincere & caring making sure at all times our safety was number 1☺️Would highly recommend this to those want a funfilled tour of Prague YOU GUYS ROCK
Worth it. We did a tour with Arthur who was great.. Its a nice way to get the idea of Prague definitely worth the money.

A great and awesome city tour. I did the electric bike tour and it was quite enjoyable. The guide was a Prague local and art and history enthusiast so he shared some really interesting insights into Prague and the historical changes.He also took us up to the castle area and the bike really did it's job. I recommend this for older people and less athletic people as there isn't much work to ride the electric bike, some minor peddling here and then.
The best city tour ever. The best sightseeing trip ever I liked the guide and his perfect English ) for beginners it will be also great , because the first 20 min its tutorial how to ride a Segway

Best Tour Ever. My husband and his friend went on a Segway Tour with Claudio who was outstanding!! Claudio, our Tour Guide patiently trained my husband who is 76 and his friend who is 61 on how to ride a Segway. Then he took them all over Old Town, Lesser Town and several other areas. He gave them a lot of history about Prague and was very professional. Later when my husband returned from the tour, he took our friends back to the same places that he went (otherwise if it wasn't for Claudio we would have missed some of the best areas of Prague. Great job Claudio!!!

Friendly staff and great tour. We were with a group of 6, and our tour guide was Arthur.This guy's really flexibel, and has a lot of knowledge about the city.We had a great deal and the instructions weren't included in the 2 hours we booked. Nice!

Excellent guided bike tour. Took a guided bike tour of the city with HARRY. He was a great guide and source of local information. I find that taking tours like this early on in my visit to a new city is the best way to get a feel for the area, and to decide what I want to go back to later....
Harry is awesome . Yellow Zebra tours is a must-do tour experience. If you have the chance, Harry is a fantastic tour guide. Harry did a great job in making our Prague experience special.

Bike tour. We took the bike tour yesterday with Harry and it was excellent!! In a few hours we saw most of Prague's landmarks and had an amazing bike ride around the city. Our tour guide, Harry, was very informative and gave insightful information on Prague's history that you dont normally get on traditional bus tours, etc. Highly recommended.
Segway tour! . Had an awesome day sightseeing thru Old Town (praha), on Segways. The tour with our guide couldnt have been much better! Thank you so much Claudio!

Best Bike Tour to date. Wow was I blown away by this tour! Anyojr traveling to Prague please do this tour. The following sites were covered.Prague castle sighting.John Lennon Wall Lesser TownAstronomical Clock Old TownMunicipal House New Town Old New Synagogue Jewish Quarter Old Jewish Cemetery Jewish Quarter Maisel Synagogue Jewish Quarter Charles Bridge Dancing House New Town Wevnceslas Square Estate's Theatre Old Town Karolinum Old Town Tynn Church Old Town St Nicholas Church Old Town Old Town Hall Kampa Park The Hunger Wall Smallest Street in Europe Franz Kafka Museum Rudolphinum The National Museum New Town Bethlehem Chapel Old Town Jan Hus Monument Old Town The Pissers and many other David Cerny works of art + many more sites.If you are english speaking make sure you ask for Harry. Harry covered the content of the tour amazingly and was beyond knowledgeable around the history of this city and current must do's for travelers passing through. There are also german and Italian speaking tour guides through this company. I hope this helps.

Best bike tour with Sean. The day with our guide Sean was amazing!!!Sean used a very funny way to show us the history of Prague. Normally I am very bored by the history but this, THIS was great!We went on bikes through the centre of Prague. The tour took almost 4 hours, because we didn't want to end. After that we went to the pub to drink czech beer.I can recommend this tour to everybody.

Had a great time!. The Segway is a great way to get around the city. We had a Segway tour by Yellow Zebra in Budapest as well, and they never disappoint. We had a very entertaining and interesting tour by Nick around this beautiful city. Highly recommended! Thanks, Nick!

Family fun!. Our Segway tour with Arthur was the highlight of our 3 days in Prague. Our whole family enjoyed it - and my two boys loved it. thank you Arthur! He was kind and patient and very helpful to our younger son.

Thanks Yellow Zebra. Prague is so beautiful and Yellow Zebra’s bicycle tour is the ideal way to view and experience the place. Harry (our guide) was really informative and great fun. His knowledge of the city was extensive as he led us, with ease, through the maze of streets that make up the old and new towns to the more spacious lesser quarter over the river. Three hours of history, architecture and culture delivered by an extremely knowledgeable native English speaker (they also have tours in different languages). Loved it!

Bike tour with Harry. Thanks to Harry, we had a fantastic bike tour around Prague. Great stories to accompany the sites! All of this despite the Prague marathon causing a lot of route restrictions. Highly recommend this tour to get a taste of the city!

Six Star ****** Prague Segway !!!. Called Yellow Zebra Thursday May 5th arrival Prague on recommend from Discovery Budapest our last Segway private tour last week, for 2-3 hour private next day tour, again WOWZA !!!!! Arrived at shop Friday morning to meet our Master Guide, Arthur,and again, safety first, do's and dont's, test drive in tiny square by shop..... Then adventure began !!!! Arthur was so historically schooled, not just Czech Republic , but European continent , having lived in many countries and only 25 years old. We told him where we had foot toured day before so he designed our tour touching on new Prague and on up through the Park walk trials to Monastery, Castle grounds, back down Old Town and Square.... And more....... Ask a question ? Polite, engaging,humerous, informative....Safety first, fun and adventure next, only way to see and feel Prague to get the lay of the city to see and experience !!!!! Go for it !
Great way to see a great city. We had a great tour with Arthur. He was flexible and great with the kids. He knew details on every building, site, and monument. And he clearly loves the city.

Exciting! . As it turned out, it's very easy to ride on segway, even my grandmother could afford that. :) Comparing to classic sightseeing this way brings a lot of new great emotions! Also Arthur (our guide) was great! Great experience, highly recommend!

Best way to see all the most interesting. Never thought that sightseeing can be so interesting and easy without burning your feet )) Central location of the agency and not very old Segways. Artur gave as the most of beautiful city and modern technology - highly recommended!
Segway Tour Prague. Had a fantastic tour today with Arthur! Would love to do it again! He showed us around Prague and told us good stories, he also made sure that we were all save the whole time!

Fantastic. Our Dutch familie of six all liked it a lot. Our tourguide Arthur did a fine job guiding us safe through the nicest places in Prague telling al sorts of interesting stories about history an culture. Realy worth every penny. Thnx.

Segway Tour of Vienna. The Segway tour of Vienna was far more fun than I had anticipated. I have never ridden a Segway before but it was easy to pickup a feel for the controls and it allowed us to see much more of the city than a walking tour. Speaking of which, Vienna is beautiful, even in the rain. Our tour guide, Horst, gave all of the history of the city plus great (and often funny) tidbits you wouldn’t learn anywhere else not to mention suggestions on the best places to eat and check out following the tour. His tour made me want to live here by the end of the day.

My sincere recommendation for the joy and impression we got.. Arthur, great guide, it was a great pleasure to listen to him. In my opinion this was among best ways to meet and get a picture of any place.

Great way to see the city . Had a great time in Segways today , but tanks to our guide Ales . Would suggest you try these as they are great fun , a bit scary at at first but you soon get the hand of it

Great!!. We did a one hour tour and it was really great! Guys are really nice and they also take the time to give us a few words on the places we see during the trip. It's an unique experience, a good way to see quickly the city!
Segway tour.. The tour guide Sven was realy informative funny and friendly. Was able to answer all our questions and adapted the tour to suit our needs.

The best way to see Prague!. Our guide Arthur was amazing! We ticked off all the attractions in the tour, but as both myself and my boyfriend looooooved the segways Arthur decided to take us to a few more viewpoints in Prague which was great!

Segway, the only way. Our guide Alej was knowledgeable and helpful, although perhaps not quite ready to fill the three hour tour. We got in many Segway miles though and some good vantage points over Prague, as well as a very nice beer stop, much better than the usual Pilsner. We probably didn't help by going on the tour at the end of our trip, but it is always nice to see what different guides have to say about the same features. Alej added some stuff to what we had already found. Also, we love Segway. Also used Yellow Zebra in Budapest a while back and they have been professional and genial on both occasions.

Great Bicycle Tour Of Prague !!. We had a brilliant bicycle tour with Yellow Zebra. Our guide Harry was very knowledgeable and cooperative. There was a large group on this tour and he dealt with us admirably, answering any questions we had regarding this wonderful city and its history. Loved the John Lennon Wall. There was a guy with a guitar playing Beatles songs there and the atmosphere was beautiful. The tour lasts for three hours and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a more in-depth look at Prague. John Mann London Uk

Fun and fantastic way to see the city. We had Arthur who was a great guide! The tour had a great mix of learning about the culture and history of Prague while also simply enjoying the fact that we were riding around on segways.

Had a great time!. After two whole days of constant walking around the sights of this lovely city, we decided to try this company for a segway tour. After a quick practice at which we both seemed naturals, the two of us set off with Steven our guide. His knowledge of Prague was excellent and he took us all over the place.I would thoroughly recommend the company to everyone.
Just Great!. Thanks to our guide Nick! He was very friendly and helpful! If i come back, i will do it again. Segway rocks. :)))))))))))))))

Wonderful tour through the city!. We had a great tour through Prague and can highly recommend anyone to go on a segway tour. Our guide, Artuhr, was very helpful, informative and funny which made the tour just perfect. He showed us how to handle the segways before our tour and made us feel save. While explaining many interesting facts about Prague to us, he also made it possible to see very much of the city (which was maybe also due to us being the only two people on the tour). Thank you for a wonderful tour through historic and beautiful Prague - what a fun way of getting to know a lot of the city!
wonderful. wonderful experience！！ had a nice tour with Randall and the weather today was so nice. Already recommend to our friends！
Awesome tour with Arthur!. It was awesome tour with excellent guide! We had so much fun on segway. In one hour you can see the most interesting things in Prague! Highly recommend!

Absolute fun Segway tour!!!. It was a wonderful tour, as Segway was on our list to do anyways for long time. Our guide - Nick was so nice and friendly that he made our tour more memorable by his knowledge of places he took us and his patience to stop by at several places to take pictures. He took our group of 5, to all around the canal, bridge, old city, town square, and many other places with historic importance. He was very cautious of our safety while crossing the roads, downhill, uphill. Overall, a lovely segway tour!!!

Segway tour -tour guide Nick . Went to Prague with my beasties in Feb ,tried segway .at first we where scared but Nick"nikita" gave us extra training and explained how it was clearly . thanks to his our segway tour was success .Thank u Nick

Fun segway tour great tour guide!. The segway tour my friend and I went on was a blast! Sven did a great job explaining to us how to use the segways and provided great information about the different destinations that we visited. I would definitely recommend Sven on a segway tour around Prague!

Segway tour. Me and my girlfriend have decided to try the segway tour while we're still in prague and we were pleasently surprised. Our guide, Steven, was kind enough to show us some of the prague's sites and, luckily enough, the weather was great too.. :) I definitely recommend this experience - especially to the couples..

Bestest segway tour ever!!!!!. If you are visiting Prague anytime soon then you must take a segway tour and explore it. Our tour guide NICK was exceptionally sweet,warm and friendly :) And bdw he speaks fluent English ;) so language is no bar here. Enjoy and have fun!!

Amazing tour. A must tour if your visiting this lovely city. Sven our guide was fantastic and his banter was first class. Would definitely recommend a tour with this guy as he is brilliant and full of fun. The segway was a great way to see the city to xx :0) xx thanks again xx

Great way to explore the City. It was my first time on a Segway and I didnt think it could be so fun. It is a very entertaining and efficient way to explore the city. Also, I can only recommend our guide. Thanks for the nice tour through Prague!!

The best way to see Prague. We had an absolutely fantastic tour with our costarican friend Randall. Many thanks to him for the interesting stories and tips. Especially we liked the stop at the Strahov monastic brewery.

Thanks Dominik!. The tour was simply awesome, the Segways were loads of fun and the tour guide, Dominik, did a fantastic job. I highly recommend this tour, it's a fun way to discover Prague with a local!

Awesome experience !!!. Our guide was Dominik for the segway tours and it was amazing. Firstly, the location of the office was right next to our rented apartment (which was located in the ideal spot between the old and new city), so getting there was easy. Dominik then gave us some general pointers before letting each person try on their own for a mini lesson. We then set off to the main park of the city where we saw beautiful views and were given more freedom on the segways. It was wonderful because Dominik let us roam around freely, but under the right amount of control so there was no feeling of danger. He was a funny and informative tour guide. Would definitely recommend this place. While we only had one tour guide we met some of the others in the office and they seemed just as cool and knowledgeable. Segways are awesome and easy to ride so if you want to try in Prague, go to THIS place !
Fun site seeing . Our guide Michaela made this site seeing trip very interesting. Her English is perfect and she enjoys sharing the Prague history. The segway ride was fun and enjoyable.

Brillianr. Our tour guide was Ales (but he'll ask you to pronounce it Alex). Brilliant tour guide; knowledgeable and funny. Tip well and he'll turn your speed restriction off . Highly recommend going Segway! Lawrence, Alex, Di & Amy

Segways are fun but the guide wasn't so great. Segways are great fun and an awesome way to get around the city quickly.We managed to haggle a bit on price and paid 900CZK per person for a 1 hour tour.Our tour guide was nice, but his English was a little lacking. We requested a bit of a 'custom' route having seen much of the old city before and he was accommodating to this. However, it did feel as though a lot of his knowledge was around the old town rather than the other side of the river which was the part we were interested in. Indeed, we wanted to see some things on the Castle-side of the river, but the guide didn't even mention them (the peeing men, for example).A nice touch was that the guide carried gloves around, which came in handy as it can get a bit chilly zooming around on the Segway.Overall, a pleasant experience, but nothing to write home about.

Class way to see Prague. Tour guide Steven was a super tour guide. Gave us the perfect tour of Prague. 2 hours and not once bored. Took photos for us and waited patiently when not many would as we walked through the castle. I'd highly recommend the Segway Tour to get about Prague we were only here for 3 days so was amazing to see everything there is and still have loads of time to do more. If you decide to do the tour ask for Steven the tour guide in the office I can't fault him.

Loads of fun!. We only wanted a half hour session as we had seen most of the sights that the Segway tours covered, but Nick was very accommodating and we had a lot of fun. He also told us lots of stories about various parts of Prague that we would not have know about - thanks Nick it was great fun and a 1/2 hour we won't forget!!

Super Guide Steven and Super Promoter Randal. We had such a great time with the Segways, Randal was very nice introducing us to the fantastic tour, and Steven did a great job showing us around. We did one hour tour and my friend Blanca and myself really enjoyed it. Everyone at the Office was also very nice and friendly. It is a 'must do' thing in Prague. Thanks guys!!!

Segway with Sean. I've always wanted to go on a Segway, moving around the city like a boss. Well, I can check it of the bucket list since it was as cool as expected, it was also made fun thanks to Sean!

雪のプラハ. 寒い雪の日だったので、３０分コースで。短い時間でしたがガイドのSTEVENさんは要所要所、丁寧に説明して下さりました。セグウェイ、テレビで芸能人が苦労してるのを見てたので、えっ？これだけの練習でもう行くの？と心配しましたが簡単❗️楽しい❗️コツは体を素直〜〜にすることにつきます。StevenThank you so much. It was very cold and snow. However,we really enjoyed the ride with you. You're a great guide!

Fun!!. First time to use a segway. Anna F, our guide, was very patient in showing us how to use it. Calmed me down since I was nervous. She is very friendly and very knowledgeable. Her English was impeccable and very easy to understand. Just remember to bring cash with you when you book since they do not accept credit card.
best hour of 2016. great time in the segway. an hour well spent with our guide shaun. due to the cold i think an hour was enough but it was a highly enjoyable one. definately worth doing

Awesome Tour. We had a private tour with Ales. The 3 of us for 2 hours. We are in Prague for 4 days, he was very informative and interesting. Highly recommend doing a Segway tour as we got to see a lot more than if we were on foot. Not to mention parts of Prague a hilly and the Segway makes it so easy. Highly recommended to use this company.

Terrific Tour with Sean. Well, what a day we had. Best 2 hours of our trip, seemed like 2 minutes it went so fast. We never knew that Prague held so many beautiful secrets and stories. The sights apart, the myths and fables seem to be the very cornerstone of the city, something you will never see in any guide book. Well worth the time and the energy just to listen to this erudite young man's rendition of the city's history and culture. See you in springtime Sean!

Segway tour with Steven. We took the whole 2 hour tour which was so very worth it! our tour guide Steven was informative, funny and very paitient with us wen wanting to take photos. When we got cold he even took us to a small Cafe to get a hot chocolate! Great service and awesome experince!

AMAZING TRIP WITH SEAN. Came yesterday with my wife , took a bike tour with Sean , was amazing , one of the best tours we had. Beautiful city , with an amazing guide, knowledgeable , easy going , nice , man of the world . we were able to learn and taste the city in couple of hours , Sean has many stories about every site we visited .

Great ride with Dominik. It completely skipped my mind to write review for these guys since my tour was taken in September 2015. However, better late than never. My wife and I took a 3 hour tour with our guide Dominik and we had an amazing time. Dominik is very well versed in English and has a very friendly personality. He also was a proper guide with vast knowledge of the place. We took quite a lot of pictures on our way and Dominik was kind enough to take as many memorable pictures of ours and then some.Segway is a must try in Prague but these guys make the tour even better. Keep up the good work guys.

Segway tour with michaela. Yesterday we had a tour around Prague with Michaela counselor , even though it was really cold outside was very enjoyable trip . It was fun to see the places and hear the guide explanations . Michaela was a pleasant professional and charming ! Michaela- We were pleased to meet you and we are waiting for you to come to Israel and the nice places to get to know you . Aggregate us on Facebook : shir kandil, noa naor.

Perfect way to explore Prague. We had a great time on this tour. Sean ( our guide) was informative, engaging and totally hilarious. This way of discovering the city is ideal. Far more intimate and entertaining than using public transport. Highly recommend it for anyone who wants to get to know the city and enjoy themselves at the same time.

Fun activity and great way to see Prague. Four of us had a private Segway tour with Jane Kruglova as our guide. She was helpful and knowledgeable and looked after us well. The Segways were fun to ride and easy to learn (even for this geriatric!), Wear warm gear and extra warm gloves. . Two hours would have taken us much further afield round the perimeter of the parksw across the river but it might have been a bit cold for that length. We booked an hour and covered quite a lot Thoroughly recommend.
Best tour guide. Jane kruglova was a great guide, very happy and a pleasure to be around! segways were fantastic and best way to see pragues wonders

Soo worth it. Me and my sister went for holiday, and we are so glad we decided to do a segway tour last minute on our last day in prague. So worth it. Daniel was very knowledgeable and he showed us some great views and areas of prague that we otherwise wouldn't have gotten a chance to visit. We would definetly recommend this. It's the best way to see Prague and know some of the history of the buildings, neighborhoods and people.

Great segway tour in Prague. Last minute decision to do a segway tour but one of the best decisions we made the whole trip! Our guide Michaela was great fun and had us zooming all round the place in no time. Very informative too. Thank you Michaela, next time we're in Prague we'll definitely do the longer trip. Definitely recommend.
Great Bike Tour!!!. Took a 3 hour bike tour with yellow zebra. Our guide sean was hilarious. Had a great time and would highly recommend! !
Praga night Tour with Daniel. Enjoyable experience in Prague!!!Daniel,our guide, was very nice, professional and patient. Many thanks Daniel.. Antonella &Tore

Segway fun in Prague!. My family and I visited Prage in mid-August this year and we had booked a segway tour of the city as part of our itinerary. I initially was very scared to get on a Segway but it was pretty easy to learn, thanks to our guide 'Anja' who was extremly patient with us. She was very helpful and friendly and gave us good info about the local sites and attractions in Prague. My favourite part of the tour would be the segway ride till the local Effiel tower of the city.I would truly recommend taking a Segway tour with this company. You get see a very different Prague through this tour. Overall an amazing experience! Would love to do it again soon! :)

Amazing way how to see city. We were on segways with our two children and even it seems to be complicated, it is really easy. Our guide clara was really friendly and show us the most beautifull places in Prague. We really recommend two hours tour with this company. It was amazing.

Awesome time with David!. Great way to explore the wonderful city of Prague. The guide David was very helpful and told us a lots of interesting stuff we would otherwise probably could not find out. Nice guy and the machines are incredible. Almost felt sorry for everyone who had to walk.

Amazing Dominique and helpful staff. At first I met a guy on the Old Town Square driving a segway. He asked me if I want to try the segway ride for free. So I did. I didn't expect for it to be that easy. Then he explained me that his company doing tours on segways. I was suspicious at the start, but after I saw the office, how alive and friendly it was, I did the 2 hours tour with Dominique. It worth any penny. Our guide was knowledgeable, funny and dedicated. I couldn't understand how much you can see in 2 hours on segway. We have been up to Castle, saw lot of terrific views and tried best beer I ever had in the monastery. So much fun. Many thanks specifically to Dominique and Yellow Zebra - you made my day. Cheers. Don't forget to tip the guide if he/she did a good job - those people deserve it!!!

Good tour but be aware. We always book a Segway tour. Best way to see the most of a place, and to pin point places we can return on foot. Our original plan was to find our trip advisor researched seller, however, in the main square there were Segway sellers everywhere!!! Wheeling up to you and pushing their tour. One such seller we asked how much for a private 3 hour tour. He quoted €79 and we haggled down to €59. We accompanied him to his base and off we went. Our tour guide at first was really credible. His English was good and he was really attentive, making sure we were happy etc. As the tour progressed he kept stopping at shops, asking us if we wanted water. Although believe real reason was so he could purchase a can of beer. Not a problem for us in the beginning but after four cans, the joke started to wear a little thin. While the tour was exactly designed to our modification - less speak more Segway. We all believe the drink started to impact the quality of the tour. Not an issue of the company, but very clear segways are not liked by the locals. Probably because of the small pavements in places, especially across the bridges. While on road, one of our party was nearly knocked off by a taxi - later told by guide that taxis view segways as competition. By the time we got back to base we were looking forward to the end as the guide was getting a bit 'loud' and was not shy at expressing his views on most things. All in all the tour was what we wanted and not spoilt by our guide. I'm sure it would have been different if not for the alcohol consumption. Recommend you haggle to secure the best deal. If using a Segway for a first time (our fifth time) it would appear that the Czechs are not big on all the health and safety stuff. As sellers are letting people have a go and try in the main squares.

Fantastic biketour in Prague . We went on a very interesting and fun sightseeing tour by bike with Sean from Yellow Zebra on the 17th of October. Sean gave us an all-inclusive tour with interesting facts about Prague and many laughs and fun jokes along the way. I can really recommend this tour.

A great way to get an overview of Prague. I can't recommend this highly enough. Seeing the city by bike gives you such a closer view of the city than a bus tour and allows you to cover much more than a walking tour. The tour company has a great route chosen which is pretty easy for anyone, but there is one hill ( I don't typically do hills and I made it fine). The guide (Greg) was really fabulous. He had lots of interesting history, stories and personal insight to share. He is American, but has lived in Prague long enough to really learn what interests people. We saw the usual highlights as well as a few places/sights we would never have found on our own. Based on this tour, it is much easier to chose what we want to spend our time exploring more in depth. I would put this activity as a must do for a first time Prague visitor.

Zebrafriends with yellow Zebra. Really enjoyed seeing Prague from a bicycle - and the bikes were nothing to complain about (upgraded to the bigger ones instead of the yellow bikes). Our guide Sean was the best ever - his Scottish (I assume) humor made the trip really fun (he speaks frank fluently ;-) ) and he also makes the group become a part of the tour in a stand up comedy way - not to mention he knows all relevant historic facts and other.

Forget the rest...this is the best! . Me and my girilfriend visited Prague wanting to see as much as we could and learn some of the history. Our guide Sean was second to none in this capacity giving us a great balance of sight seeing and history all in one with many useful facts and a unique way of telling the history made quite the experience! We visited Prague in the heat of summer but Sean's caring and consideration as a tour leader ensure we survived with plenty of refreshments and tips on how to keep cool as we went. Would definitely recommend the tour and Sean's excellent customer service. Fully satisfied and would book again!
Segway Tour in Prague . Our tour guide was Jane K and she was very friendly, helpful and knowledgable about Prague. It was a fun and different experience to visit a city like this on a Segway.

The best way to see Prague. We had an amazing 90 minute tour with our equally amazing guide, Daniel. The tour was catered to where we wanted to go avoiding spots we had already visited. Daniel's knowledge was top notch yet relaxed and fun whilst also being informative. There were lots of opportunities for photos and time to hop off the segway to explore. Initially difficult to master at first we felt safe under his guidance despite a wobbly start and would definitely recommend yellow zebra segways!

Best tour guide ever! Phil! . Best tour guide ever! Phillip was so fun and relaxed and completely knowledgable of Prague! He's a local and completely professional. Thank you! Phillip should get a raise!

Highly recommended tour. We used this tour company for a 4 hour bike around the city attractions and it was amazing. We had such an enjoyable time - very safe and well run. Our tour guide, Sean, was excellent. I would highly recommend this tour!

amazing tour. Had a lovely weekend in Prague with my best friend and on our last day decided to do the segway tour, such a fun and easy way to go around. Our guide Daniel was just amazing, we stopped everywhere and took amazing pictures. Not only he explained very well everything we wanted to know but we also had a great chat :) Highly recommended tour + guide!!! Good luck with everything Daniel x Roberta&Roberto

Great and fun way to see the city. We did the Segway tour with Daniel as our guide. We were the only group signed up so it was a private tour that he was able to cater to us. Daniel knows the history of the city well and took great care to make sure we were all comfortable and safe the entire trip. He stopped at all the perfect spots for pictures. We did the 2 hour tour which was the perfect length for us. I highly recommend Yellow Zebra.
