Wonderful tour . I was actually the only one who signed up for this tour, so I got a private Segway tour of Prague from Albers. He was a great tour guide! He was knowledgable about all the sights and was even patient and answered with all the questions I had. However, the main thing I would like to say is that although I also fell off and/or wrecked the Segway 5 or 6 times Albers saved me each time! It was actually quite cold this day even with the sunshine, so after about an hour (when I was doing quite well balancing and driving the Segway) I couldn't feel my toes so my balance was completely thrown off. But, like I said, each time Albers slowed me down, guided me down the hills, and helped me to get my balance back. Although I will probably never ride another Segway again, I had a great time segwaying around Prague with Albers :)
Wonderful Bike Tour. Highly recommended! Greg, our tour guide was very kind, friendly and knowledgeable .Also the staff at the office were helpful.

Quickest way go though prague with fun!. Joined 3 hours bike tour with caring and funny tour guide sean, which show your around the town with your historical focus & nice view path! All in all, its an enjoyable trip for anyone want to explore the city with certain exercise :)

Wherever you want to go, do it by Segway!. Whilst I was in Prague there were lots of reps offering Segway tours, as it was something I wanted to do I decided to go with Yellow Zebra as they beat all the estimations given to me by other company's. I wanted to see the old Jewish town, the new quarter and old. I expressed this to the guide and she was more than happy to give me a tour wherever I wanted to see. The guide had an extensive knowledge about each aspect of the tour and even made time to stop for photos on request. I'm extremely glad I went with Yellow Zebra and would recommend to anyone! I had an amazing experience and would now love to get a segway to commute everywhere!

Awesome beer & food tour with Sean!. We had 4 Aussies doing a beer and food tour with Sean through Discover Prague and we couldn't have had a better time!Immediately upon meeting Sean had our group gauged and fit in well with the banter we had going. He was always ready with a laugh and made us all feel at ease as we took to the streets to start our beer tour!First stop was the beer museum (entry included in our tour) where Sean's knowledge of the beer brewing process and the Czechs involvement shone through. This bloke obviously knows his stuff! It was great having a guide to chat with and ask questions of (Sean readily answered all queries!) rather than just reading an overload of info. We had 4 beer tastings at the museum before moving on to stop number 2!After having a few beers at the museum I seem to have forgotten the name of our next stop but that's not to say I didn't thoroughly enjoy myself there! We sat down to another beer (our group was getting into the unfiltered beers - so tasty!) and a delicious plate of Czech beer snacks! We had sausage, cheese, pickles, more sausage, jellied pork and fried bread which we rubbed garlic onto. Needless to say we cleaned it up pretty quick ;)Sean then introduced us to a very tasty beer concoction that was a mix of dark and light beer- which also went down way too easy!Needless to say we finished off the tour feeling pretty good. A very enjoyable night with a fantastic guide. Na zdravi Sean!
Segway tour on Prague. We took a 1 hour tour with the great guide- Anna.It was great experience, we recommend it for everyone.

Guided bike tour with Sean. Can't rate this tour highly enough. We Saw so much of the City in 3 hours on the bikes. Equipment was in good shape and great value for the price. It was Our tour guide Sean that made this a special tour though. He really knew his adopted home city and its history. His Scottish sense of humour and educated insights into the history art And architecture of this amazing city is something we won't forget. All 6 of us rated this a 5 out of five. Very light physical activity with a little urban commando biking.

Great experience . Excellent experience. Was nervous at first but the segways are very easy to use. Our tour guide was brilliant. Very knowledgeable and knew all the answers tour question. Thanks tour tour guide Daniel

This is the best Segway tour in Pargue!. Wow, what a great day we had on Segways with Yellow Zebra. There are plenty of Segway operators in Prague (you will see when you visit), but this company in my opinion offers the best tour and service. Other tour operators operate with bigger groups, or tiny Segways, this company offers the real deal, the big original Segways. We were asked in the old town if we had taken a Segway tour by a very nice guy called Randal who then let us have a go on his Segway, this gives you the confidence you will be able to Segway for the tour. We then decided we would do the tour the next morning, so we were taken to the office to leave a 10-20% deposit. We would recommend that you do this in the morning as there are fewer people so you can get further. On the morning we met our tour guide Ita Weber, who was a real star! Very friendly, always smiled and very helpful! She discussed the route with us and off we went. In two hours we went up to Letna park, around to the castle, up to Petrin hill and finally back to the office. I would definitely do the tour again. Thanks Yellow Zebra and in particular Randal and Ita!

Prague by Sean. An entertaining although on-the-fly bicycle tour of Prague. Sean truly was knowledgeable about Czech history, he made sure to quiz us at every turn. Sarcasm (which my friends and I are chock full of) is necessary on his tour. We appreciated Sean's input regarding bars and restaurants to visit; all in all a memorable experience! We also used Yellow Zebra bikes in Budapest and would highly recommend.P.S. Sean look out for that curb

Great experience. I was there with my friend from France, i wanted to show him Prague and i am glad, that we went on segway. It was fast and funny way to show him practicaly the whole town. Our guide was Albert and he was quite funny and friendly guy. :)
Great tour of Prague. We had lots of fun in our 90 minutes tour, really enjoyed it!A great way to see the city.We recommend the guide Daniel :)

An amazing experience. An amazing, fun way to see the main city places of interest. Although we had a few minor accidents Daniel was calm, informative, fun, relaxed and made sure our tour experience was memorable! We would go again and recommend Daniel as he is simply the best guide to have!

Really funny!!. Easy to drive: a trip with a segway could really makes you appreciate more the attractions of Prague! We had a great guide, Alex, a young boy really kind who told us some hisory of the buildings we met during our trip.
If you have some free time I suggest you to try this experience!
Federica - Milan

Truly Excellent. A great way to see the city and get your bearings! Our guide Adriene was brilliant, very informative and friendly! Had a great crash course (excuse the pun) of the history of the city! Stopped at "The Strudel House" for some excellent coffee and pastry! I hadn't been on a bike in years and felt very comfortable wishing 5mins of taking off! Will recommend to anyone coming to Budapest!

Zeiteffizient und Gemütlich durch Prag. For 1000 CK / 1 Stunde (about 37 €) our Guide Filip took us through Prag on a Segway. I had the impression he knew what he was talking about and had a very positive and friendly attitude. He also showed us where we could go out at night, which was very helpful as we didn't know the place at all. He showed us loads of interesting places of Prague that we probably wouldn't have seen, hadn't we taken the Segway tour. It is very recommended even though the locals are not to fond of the Segway's but who can blame them. I wouldn't be either.

Excellent . This is my second time using their service as I have enjoyed this visit as much as I had on my last trip. Anja was our guide on the tour , she was friendly , spoke fluent English and provided ton of information about the attractions. Highly recommend the place if you want to try Segway tours in Prague.
Segway. Laslo of Yellow Zebra Segway tours was a fine young man and excellent guide. His instruction for the Segway was excellent. So much fun my wife wants her own!

A Picture Perfect Day (on bike) In Praha!. My boyfriend and I did the bike tour with Dominic. He was simply an amazing guide - a great storyteller, took time for pictures, and answered all of our questions about Prague. He even stopped on the St, Norbert Monastery so I could buy beer to take home. I would totally recommend the bike tour with Yellow Zebra! Great value and experience.

Good Zebras !!. They showed flexibility in offering what we need and adjusted the price even if we did not asked for. Anja made it very easy for us to learn managing the Segway and we enjoyed her company as she was easy going and fun. We will use their services in Vienna too. Well done !

Great Family Fun!. We took the half hour tour with our 17 and 19 year olds this week starting from the Old Town Square and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. It's easy to figure out and a fantastic way to get your bearings in Prague. Anna F was our guide and she provided great commentary at the major attractions and was very diligent about our safety. Highly recommend it.

An amazing way to sum up the trip. Segway tour was in fact not part of our plan for the week. My friend and I got approached by one of the guys in Old Town square and he gave us a chance to try the segways while explaining how we can get a tour on them. Although this was our last day and we've been to most tourist attraction places around Prague, we wanted go on the segways properly so said yes to a short half an hour tour. Daniel was our guide and he was fantastic - really smiley and friendly. He asked in the beginning whether we want it to be a riding segway based or a historical information based tour so we asked for a balanced one with a bit more riding. He took us to the powder tower (one I asked to go to) then along the river - the view was awesome with the sunset. He talked a bit about all the attraction places we could see riding down the bank and also told us myths and old tales about them and my friend and I found those really interesting and funny. Then he quickly took us around the Jewish town too, which was very nice because we didn't know about it at all! We only asked for 30 minutes of tour, so it ended very quickly, but this unplanned tour was an amazing way of summing up our Prague trip. Thank you to Daniel and I definitely would recommend going on it for at least a 30 minutes during your stay in Prague. (and plus, those segways are really easy and fun to ride!)
Excellent . Excellent way to see Prague in 3 hours . Our guide ALFRED was very informative and very good and friendly . Gave us a lot of tips for good places to eat and visit .

Great tour of Prague on Segway. Our guide Jan V. led us from Old Town on Segways across Vltava to Prague Castle through Mala Strana and then back via another bridge by Narodni Trida and back to Old Town. He clearly demonstrated his experience of the city and showed us the right way to use the machines. 15 minutes into the trip, I felt one with my machine. What a great experience and a great way to hit many spots in a short time. Jan even told us about his experience with the secret police during the Velvet Revolution. Nothing beats first hand experiences from a local guide. Oh, I would like to also say thank you to Daniel who sold us the tour. Thanks for being so patient with my son.

Best Way to see the city, Exciting and fun! :). The Hole Segway experience was great, Yellow Zebra Segways & Bikes looked after me well from start to finish, you get to see Prague in an exciting way with hour up my sleeve it was the Best choice . My tour Guide Alzbeta was very knowledgeable and personable, I highly recommend. thanks guys :)

An amazing city and good bikes! . Me and my family rented for bikes here for three hours to ride in Prague. The bikes where a bit simple but they had everything on it and we didn't get a flat tire so that good. We went to the new town to ride our bikes because the old town is to busy with walking tourist and in the new town everything is a little bit more spread out , so this was a wonderful way to see the palace and the John Lennon wall. We are really happy we rented bikes!

Most interesting way to see Prague. Absolutely fantastic, and the best way to see the whole city in a few hours. It goes to all the places you might not see or walk to. Anna was just fantastic as a guide. Thank you.

Great way to tour Budapest with excellent guides and equipment. I signed up for a Budapest segway tour on a whim two weeks ago yesterday. I had never been on a segway and had been frustrated by how little I had seen by spending most of the previous day walking from attraction to attraction. Bacint at Yellow Zebra was our instructor and our guide. He did an outstanding job on both accounts. I would - and have - recommended this to anyone who has the chance to do it.

Entertaining and informative. If you're not too keen on walking around on tours the bike tour is definitely something to do! You cover so much area in the same amount of time a walking tour may only cover one section of Prague. Our tour guide Sean did however make the tour. He tells you the smallest of details about almost everything. You can tell he loves his job which makes his story telling come to life! He also gave us tips on where to eat and drink etc which is always a great thing for tourists. I would confidently recommended to anyone

Good tour, great guide!. The tour on bike is a great way to see the historical sites and get around the city. A lot gets covered. Sean from Glasgow was a very funny and knowledgable lad. He showed us a ton of places to go get food and pubs to go to. He Is also very very funny and makes the tour twice as enjoyable. Despite the heavy rain he stayed good humoured and kept our spirits up! Overall very interesting tour, definately recommend it and definately worth the money!

Segway is the way forward!. My boyfriend and I visited Prague in July 2015 and we booked several tours / activities before we went, Segway tour being one of them. We booked a group tour which was due to start at 9:30am but unfortunately we missed it because we were stuck in very bad traffic. We didn't let it ruin our day, instead we wandered around and did our own thing until after lunch. Then we decided to find the place and see if we could book another tour.Navigation is not my strongest skill so we did struggle to find the place but we got there in the end and explained why we missed our tour and the man behind the desk said we could book another tour with no charge but unfortunately due to our time restrictions for other activities none of the times suited so we paid for a private tour which we could do immediately. While we were arranging the new tour one of the staff had been speaking Czech with the man behind the desk and then suddenly starting speaking Scottish which was great for me also being Scottish, he kept us occupied while the booking was set up and our tour guide arrived. Our tour guide was Anna Duralova (I'm not sure if I have spelled the surname correctly). She was a fantastic tour guide; spoke great English, very friendly and knowledgeable, trained us on the Segway before we set off and gave us clear expectations of how the tour would go (we had to stay in a line for safety, keep a few feet distance between each person, stay slow in the town center and she would stop at attractions / landmarks and give us the history of each one). We set off and she looked back frequently to ensure we hadn't got lost or fell off and helped us when we were struggling to control the Segway when going downhill.The Segway was the best way to see so many things in a short time, we went zooming past people and learned about the history of Prague while having a great time even though it was just the 2 of us with our guide. Highly recommend segway tours from Yellow Zebra Segways and Bikes!Thank you Anna!

Fun way to see City. There are many Segway tours available in Prague, we chose this one, we were not disappointed, staff very friendly - Jane our tour leader was fun and informative. A fun way to explore the city, would definitely recommend a go at Segway in Prague.

Prague Bike Tour - Sean . Sean was a really great guy and guide and we covered a lot of ground. He took us to a lot of the historical sites and even to some sites that he only has access to. Sean also knows a lot of places around Prague to get a pint, get food, or just hang out. He pointed out to my friend and I a monastery where there was good beer and a awesome view of the city. Absolutely worth it, but make sure to do it on one of your first days there to get an abundance of useful information about getting around the city and things to do.

Discover Prague on Bike with Great Tour Guides. Seeing Prague in one day will not be possible without Yellow Zebra e-Bikes. Their equipment are well maintained. Flexible and very accommodating. Helmets and locks are already included in the tour fee. Don't forget to choose Sean from Glasgow who gave us a fun-filled and colorful history of Prague's finest. Up to you, but we decided to get some breaks during the tour so extending the tour is not a huge problem. However I will need to recommend that if you're into bike tours, water, food and 1st aid kit are must bring to make it hassle-free.

Covered so much ground!. Loved our guide Greg! He was super funny and incredibly laid back. The company wasn't busy at all so our group (3 people) got a private tour. Greg took us to a TON of places including a walk-through with our bikes on the church grounds and a beer garden with the prettiest views of the city. Just make sure to eat well before you go. There are no food stops. Excellent tour with an excellent guide.

Great tour on segways. Had a brilliant tour this afternoon with Jane! Very professional went over all the details on the tour thoroughly and didn't feel at all like we were being taken for a ride! Thanks Jane and Adam

Bike tour City of Prague. My wife and I just completed one of the most fun and thorough city bike tours ever courtesy of Sean (leading on the bike) and Martin (leading from behind the desk) If a bike tour is in your plans, this is the team at Yellow Zebra I'd strongly recommend! We saw everything worth seeing, (including some "secret" panoramic views) always felt safe and enjoyed Sean's informative (and funny) commentary.
A first on a segway. A one-hour sightseeing was perfect. Anna F was a well qualified guide. An excellent way to get to know a strange city. The segway-ride was just great fun!

Simple bikes, good site seeing!. We only rented a bicycles, not a segways or got a tours. 4 hrs of the riding allowed see Praha briefly. The first taken bike was small for me, and a guy was not happy to replace it (he had studied a family on segways in the yard). Since the bikes are unorganized, the issue was difficult.Uncomfortable ride a bicycle on a cobbled street, and the wheels was not pumped enough. The tyres are with something inside to protect the wheel in case of puncture. So, the combination of the low pressure, cobbled streets and this feature of the tyres was really annoying. Seems the bicycles are not a priority of this rental point.
Fantastic way to see all of prague!. Absolutely excellent way of getting around prague. Our tour guide Anna was great and very knowledgeable. Thanks again!!

Awesome way to see the city!. We really enjoyed our visit of Prague with Yellow Zebra . We did this tour the last day of our trip and it allowed to see everything one last time. Our tour guide was so kind and helpful. She took her time to explain everything and made sure we were having fun. Thank you!!!

Amazing Experience - Must Do as a Tourist!. The experience by itself was amazing!My friends and I did the Segway Tour in Prague and our guide Petr was excellent!!Highly recommend this company for rentals and their friendly guides.

Much more than I expected! . This was a wonderful tour! The company was very accommodating with my last minute walk in request within 45 minutes of the next tour. I was in a group of only four and our tour guide was Sean. Even though it was an extremely hot day Sean made sure to keep high spirits and accommodate the group and what we wanted to do and made sure that we took breaks at wonderful shady places. He was very knowledge about the city and made sure to include lots of humor in his tour. He was also very helpful in suggesting good places to go eat, listen to music, and where to visit next! Very genuine! I would highly suggest this tour if you really want to get a feel for the entire city!

Must-do in Prague. Brilliant to save aching feet and legs in Prague. We had walked all over the city for 4 days and this was a great way to finish the trip. I took the 1 hour tour with Anna F who was excellent - very friendly and patient. My phone had no memory and so she very kindly took photos and promptly emailed them to me. Thank you Anna ! Segways really fun and took only a few minutes to get the hang of it.
Wow great tour!!!. Had a great tour with our guide Sean. He was very funny and well informed. Gave us some great tips as well. Definitely do this tour. Ask for Sean if he is working

Best way to see the city.. Wow...not much more to say. Never realised how beautiful and historical the city is til after this trip. Our guide was called Sean and was absolutely phenomenal. Knew all the history, took us to everything we wanted to see and some more sites that we had never read about. His knowledge was amazing and he was the perfect host. So down to earth, felt like a long term friend. It's certainly a must when you go and I'd definitely recommend this company. Ask for Sean! Going back soon and will do it again just because I enjoyed it so much

Must do in Prague!!!. The best way to really explore Prague is to do this bike tour! I had so much fun and highly recommend doing this tour when you're in Prague. Shaun was my guide, he is very knowledgable and took the time to explain the history in detail. I would do this tour again in a heart beat next time I'm in Prague.

Amazing day of biking in Prague!. I had a great day cycling through Prague with some of my foreign friends! This was an excellent way to see the city. We had a great time, our guide Sean was very informative, very funny and I enjoyed the verbal jousting!

Great guide on a bike!. Petr was my guide - it was a 1 person tour sine noone else showed up. The day was great for biking so we kept a good pace. He was very understanding when I wanted photos, and helpful with tips on where to buy souvenirs. Petr has great information on topics the I wouldnt expect a guide to understand from curent world politics, to tech history to info from my own home country.Recommended guide! A++. What a complete experience!

Albert Was An Excellent Guide!!. We had a wonderful tour today with Albert. He was very patient as we learned the Segway (which was relatively easy), open to all our questions, concerned for our safety, and extremely helpful. Segways really are an awesome way to tour Prague!! The only negative things I would says out our tour is that we didn't get as much detail about the history and the culture as I would have liked, although I recognize I'm a history buff. And the day before, when we had made the tour arrangement with Daniel who found us in the Old Town Square, he had promised us a private tour and we agreed to it. Apparently, he forgot to tell that agreement to the main office. We truly had a lovely time with the other couple from Australia. And, as I said, Albert was a wonderful guide. I would just recommend that anything you agree on with the sales person be written into the receipt back in the main office.

Trying a Segway for the first time . My friends and I had our first Segway ride today.It was really nice to try such a new activity in the historical center of Prague.We took one hour trip visiting the most historical places and learning more about the city.Our trip Guide "Anna Dupajova" was really amazing, and she made our trip more amazing! She guided us smoothly through the trip and made us more aware by telling us about each place that we come by during the trip.I would highly recommend her as a guide for this tripBest regards

A great morning on an e-bike. The Vltava river with Prague Castle over it in the morning sun is something you will never forget. From my personal experience and if I can give you a piece of advice, take a rest at Slovansky Ostrov and see the astronomical clock at Staromestke square. We also visited Letna with its great views. With an e-bike, we weren't tired a we saw a lot of nice Prague. Unfortunately we got a puncture but, the Scottish bike mechanic Sean was able to get to us and replace the tyre in no time.

A wonderful ride on Segways and Anna DuraJova- Really a superb Guide.. We have just been recently on prague for a gudied tour (Yellow Zebra Segways). Our guide was Anna Durajova. Anna was really a superb and quite an informative guide. She really guided us superbly through the city of beautiful Prague with deep insights on the history,culture and attractions in Prague. We would recommend to take a segway ride atleast once when you are visiting Prague. Anna captured the beautiful city in just 2 hours with no rush. We would definately recommend Yellow Zebra and Anna to our friends and also would opt for Yellow zebra when travelling to Vienna and Budapest.Also the manager at Prague was very courteous and co - operative during our visit for segway tour.
Anna durajova is awesome. Anna, is the best guide you can have. Please use her when you are in Prague. She took care of us and really was an excellent guide.

Great as a first approach of the city. We had a really good tour with our guide Jane. Segway is great to get on the higher parts of Prague. It's also the best way to have a first contact with the city.

Put this on your to do list!. First time doing a Segway tour and oh boy I am now hooked!! (think I will do this in Athens and Vienna next) Prague was so much fun to see in this way, just perfect way to explore all the cobbled back streets and speed up hills and through the beautiful parks (not many limitations). I could not believe how easy these were to master, very manoeuvrable and anyone could use these. We were with our 60yrs old mother and she was concerned if she could do it but before we knew it she was constantly on the tail of our guide leading the group. We chose a 90 minute tour but wish it was the two hour, they are addictive as you cover so much ground with ease. It's best to make use of their hill climbing capabilities so we chose to go up to the castle and we also visited the Petrin tower, wonderful views from that height!Our tour guide Anna was a very pleasant sweet lady, very knowledgable on the history of Prague and told us some interesting facts. She was new to the company so I think she is still getting used to getting around the town and at times it would of been better if we could of taken less busy tourist routes or back streets but I understand that you have to choose routes with less steps and curbs though I must say I was impressed how these machines can climb and bump over fairly chunky curbs. Overall it was a brilliant way to do an express tour of the city. This company was very professional, good equipment and one of their charming reps called Danielle stopped us in the main square, gave us a chance to demo the Segway then gave us a good reduced price for our tour. No annoying hard sell techniques but I suppose once you try these Segways, they sell themselves. Thanks for an enjoyable morning, btw I think it's better if you can plan to do an early morning tour as streets are less busy therefore better for you to appreciate the scenery.

Best way to see the city. This was a highlight of a week long visit to Prague. Segways are so easy to learn to use and such fun. Very useful for motoring up and down the hills of Prague. Our guide was a Prague local and conveyed a very honest, open and interesting view of his city. I recommend it as a great way to get a whistle stop tour and orient yourself in a new city. (Trip was March 2014. Drop down didn't allow me to go this far back.)

The BEST way to see Prague.. Yellow Zebra's Segway tours was the highlight of our family visit to Prague this month. It started off with a thorough briefing by the manager of what the tour included and the appropriate signing of the waiver and disclaimer form which is the norm when one engages in tour activities such as diving, kayaking, etc. What followed was the introduction on how to use the equipment (the Segway) and to familiarize and get first timers like us to use this accordingly. What we truly appreciated was the concern for the guests by the manager and tour guide Anna Durajova, when it came to the children with us who were to use the Segway as well. They took their time and did not rush any of us in learning / familiarizing ourselves with the Segway and took more time with one of us who had initially had difficulties using it. They were supportive and encouraging and helped the person's confidence in using it. As a result of this concern, our group of 9 persons had the most enjoyable, pleasurable, memorable and informatively unique way of seeing the breathtaking sights of Prague. At all times our guide Anna was professional, yet friendly and congenial and always demonstrated concern for our safety while ensuring we saw the best of the city and made sure we all were having a great time doing so. Seeing the city with this tour company is a MUST for all tourists, and if possible, to request for anna as their guide as she was the one who made it as enjoyable and fun and informative and safe for us first timers. Will definitely book with the same company when we visit Vienna in a few days. Worth every dollar spent.

We had a very good time, thank you!!　初めてのプラハとセグウェイ,最高でした！！. It was our first trip to prague and ride segwy. We really enjoied. Our guide knows a lot about the city, so she telled and showed many side stories.初めてのプラハでしたが、良いガイドに恵まれ、本当に楽しめました。慣れないうちは的確なアドバイスがあり、慣れてきたころからスピードを上げたりしていただけました。私たちの予約した時間は２人だけだったこともあり、行先の希望も聞いていただけましたし、ガイドさん1人が２時間ついていただけるなど、手厚いものでした。道中での様々な解説が非常によかったです。

Great experience!!!. We went to visit Prague last weekend and we didn't know much about the city. A guy stopped us and made us try the Segway, he offered us a cheap price compared to what other businesses offered us, therefore we decided to give it a go. Our guide name was Anja she was lovely with us and the tour was great, she also took loads of pictures and a video of us! I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to visit Prague (which is a lovely city) and at the same time wants to do something different. Thanks Anja!!! :)

Segway Tour. This was truly amazing. The guide - iTA - was brilliant! I wanted to take her home with me! My wife and I are experienced Segwayer's and have found this is a quick and fun way to zip around an area to get your bearings and make up your mind where you want to visit later and spend some time. iTA was both extremely pleasant and knowledgeable and her English was excellent. She took us to the best of all the Trdelnik vendor near the castle! Yum! This is a must do in my book.

Our guide was great but the segways :(. Our guide Ita Weber was awesome :) we saw Prague in 2 hours, and all the important touristic points.The segway tour is a quick way to overview the city, and was just perfect :)The equipments just need adjustment because they are unbalanced, we saw they bought lots of new equipments but we used the old ones :(

Exhilarating. This method of touring/sightseeing is simply the best! Our Tour Guide, Honza, knows absolutely everything about Prague & the two-hour tour will leave you wanting more! Great for family fun and site seeing. We will be back for another round!!

A great experience. My partner an I had a tour with Igla and had a fantastic time. The original price was discounted by quite a bit so it's worth talking the price down. We were on the 90 minute tour. we had a fun time and saw more of the city than we expected. I would certainly do this again and again. The Segway's are easy to use, fast and safe. The guide was happy to take plenty of photo's of my partner and I and stopped regularly for photos.

Amazing. Our guide Ita was really nice, showed us what we wanted to see and more. She also gave us pieces of advice for shopping and Restaurants and she took beautiful pictures of us. Segway is really fun and easy to ride even if it can seem scary at first. One of the best hour we spent in Prag!

Great Private Family Tour with Fabulous Guide…... We took this Segway tour with our kids (8 and 10) and had such an incredible time. Our kids each drove their own Segway for 2 hours through Jewish Town, up to the Castle, over to the mini Eiffel tower, and back down the hill. We took them on cobblestone paths, on the road, and on sidewalks and they were so easy to use! Our travel guide Anja was so great. She was very careful with our kids, paved a great path through the crowds, and gave a great history lesson to us.We would suggest this company and our guide to anyone that is interesting. It was a great way to see the city without walking the entire way (we walked 8 miles the day before!).

Disappointed. Disappointed with our guide Ita who was impatient with my friend who was taking time taking pics. Was not particularly pleased with all her personal questions about how much our ticket cost us and how much money I made. Was very opinionated about Americans and she was overheard by two Amerucans. Did not follow where we wanted to go and created her own itinerary. For the money, it was not worth it. We had a means of comparison since we also rode the Segway the day before for two hours with a guide called Matous with I love Segway. We covered so much ground and learned so many things. She was definitely tiered since she had a tour for two right before us. At least that's what she told me.

Best way to tour the city!. Our tour guide Petr was awesome. Very knowledgable about the city. I appreciate the fact that he agreed to be a tour guide despite the rainy weather. I did a 3 hour tour with 6 other friends. Segway is one of the best ways to explore prague.
Super experience. Our guide Honza was super. Was a great experience to visit the city on a segway plus the guide did cover a lot of good areas. Would recommend everyone for the same.

Great fun. The tour was fun as well as informative. It did not take long at all to get used to the Segways, and our tour guide Ita made us feel comfortable, knowing when to give information, and give me and my girlfriend some distance to enjoy the scenery together. Overall, great fun, a good way to get around the city!

Segway heaven. 16 of us had the most fun experience and saw so much of the city centre.After a 10 minute practice all 16 of us 50 year olds were happy to proceed on the Segway for the first time with a 2 hour tour that lasted more like 2 and a half hours. The 2 guides , anna f and petr were friendly and knowledgeable and really helped make it such a fun experience, nothing was too much trouble. I would highly recommend them.
Great tour. Anna took us around Prague to show us the sights and most of the cobblestones. Very friendly and informative guide and good tuition too. Highly recommended.

December visit. I decided to visit Prague in late December, having been there twice before already, thought I knew what to expect, however I was really impressed w the guide, Ita, who took the whole group on segway and showed us Prague in a interesting way, and due to her age was rly cool to get insights frm sm1 around my age.. Defo a must visit again... I rly reckon to get started w tour w her as you will know what to do after , where to go for a beer or grab a bite to eat..

Great way to see the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour. We saw so much of the city in the 90 minute tour and we could tailor the tour to what we wanted to see which meant we didn't have to see things we had already seen. The price was very reasonable and our tour guide (Honza) was fantastic - he knew the answer to all of our questions, told us the best and cheapest places to eat, drink, shop and party and told us some very unique and funny stories! Honza had an incredible knowledge of the city which really helped us - if anything I would recommend doing this tour at the start of your visit to Prague so that then you know what to do and where to go for the rest of your tripWe had such a fantastic time!
Amazing. Firstly I am afraid of, then I bought 30 minutes tour with guide. I liked it and it is very funny. I recommend everybody.

Lovely guide and good fun!. We have been in several cities where there were Segways on offer, but never thought it would be worth the fairly considerable outlay. But this March in Prague we were offered a 30% discount and decided to go for it. We had an hour's tour with just the two of us and a remarkably bright and friendly girl called Ita from Slovenia. She spoke perfect English and couldn't have been more kind and helpful. She showed us some lovely places and the hour spent riding the Segways was money well spent! I think we struck lucky. Thank you Ita!

Great fun and great views!. My boyfriend and I went on a 2 hour Segway tour of Prague yesterday and our tour guide was Jane Kruplova. She was very knowledgable and answered all our questions! The views were amazing and the Segways were easy to get the hang of. I would recommend this experience to everyone. It was great fun and we learnt a lot about the area!

Fun way to see Prague. I loved my segway tour as it was a new experience and a fun way to explore the city of Prague. Our tour guide, Ita, was friendly and very informative about all the sights and attractions that we segwayed past and made sure we got the perfect pictures to capture our experience.

Made our stay Amazing! . We went to Prague for a 3 day short but sweet break. I had researched online what we could get up to out there and Segway tours came up often, when we arrived in Prague centre there was a lot to choose from. We decided on this company as the few promoters we spoke to were helpful and not pushy and we were rewarded with an amazing experience!We had a lovely tour guide (ita)She was so kind and let us have as long as practise as we needed before we set off, she was happy to stop and take photos for us and was very informative. We choose a 2 hour tour as we wanted to get the most form the experience and thins is by far the most exciting thing I have done. ita was very patient with us when we slowed down to look at things and even gave us time to get off the segways and have a look at things.I would recommend having a go and with this company is a must. It's exciting, great way to sightsee and gives you lots of memories.Special thanks to ita and to the gentleman who came along on a bike to take photos ( his name escapes me)We would so this again every time.

Absolutely fabulous. Segways are always fun - and this one is no exception. Our guide Honza was extremely knowledgeable and informative. The tour we did with him was absolutely fantastic. Highly recommended! (And if you think segways look hard to ride - you are completely wrong! 2 mins training and you are good to go!)

First Class. Very friendly, helpful, kind, informative ... The list goes on! An excellent two hours spent whizzing around the southern part of Prague. I don't know what else to say but a big thank you to Anja our guide who was fantastic ! I thoroughly recommend it
Must do activity. I'd highly recommend the Yellow Zebra Prague segway tours. Prague is the new Amsterdam and what better way to see it then via a segway. Very informative and well worth it.

Best way to see Prague!. You must try this tour! Friendly staff, easy to talk and best way to see Prague in 3 hours! Arrange a lunch with guide and he will show you real domestic cheap place with great food! Thanks!

Interesting and fun way to see the city. I did my Segway tour today and Tom was my guide. I felt safe with him even with all the traffic on the narrow roads. I did a walking tour of Prague two days before but the segway is definitely a more fun way to see the city! The price is too much but I suppose it's because the machines cost a lot of money. I would recommend it as I found it was a memorable experience( even though I fell down once!)and a great end to my stay in Prague.
Unforgetable. Ok, the city views are fabtastic, but the toy is the must. It is a very exciting way to make tourism. You see much more in less time.

Awesome Experience.... Great Service. I booked this tour via the online option. I had not expected that it will be so nice. The guide was very nice and gave ample of time on the spots to take photographs. She was good at english and very courteous. I booked the individual tour so it was only me and the guide. Its great to see Prague via Segway. Its faster, convenient and a great experience. I defiantly recommend Prague Tour centre for the tours. It however little tough to locate their office so the office should put some directions boards to guide to the right place.Regards,Abhishek

Great experience in Prague. I find using the Segway on getting to know a location extremely useful as well as fun. The ability to move fast, "above" the crowd and go almost every where is a great benefit to a visitor. I used ISegway in Prague, the two hour tour we went on with Dominick was comprehensive and fun. Dealing with the owner Jakub (the owner) was nice and informative as well. I will be definitely recommending ISegway to my customers who are heading to Prague.

Incredibly Accommodating Staff, Saw a Lot. Jakub at the office and Alicia, our guide were very accommodating. We needed to change our tour day/time twice with no problem and ended up getting a private session. The highlight of my two-week stay in Europe. Prague is beautiful and I believe this is the best way to see it. Would recommend this tour company to anyone.

Fun and different way to see the city. I have seen Segways in many cities and while in Prague, I decided to try it out. Yes it's a bit pricey but to travel almost 13 miles in 2 hours, it's a great way to get your bearings and cheat a bit on the hills. I recommend you do this in the early part of your trip so you know where to go back to. I will say, I thought I would give my tired legs a break from walking but what I forgot is that you are standing the entire time. I easily found the guides in the old square because of their blue shirts. There a few companies that offer this tour but I liked the personality of Kiara so I chose her. As luck would have it, she was available and since there was no one else interested in a ride, I got a private tour for the group price. I told her I had been to Prague before so I wanted to hear what she had to say about the city. Her take on it. Her favorite places, etc. For me, it was easy to learn and before long I was calling myself a professional. I admit at times it was hard to maneuver around all the people walking and sometimes they got mad at us, not for cutting them off but for just being there. I made sure to say thank you if they moved out of the way. When going downhill I was a little tentative but Kiara was a great teacher. If I wanted to stop and take a picture, she was happy to oblige. Overall, I had a great time, exploring the city and seeing it from a different perspective. Plus it was fun.

Little too pricey . . .. Just for the record, we didn't take the tour. We were stoped by one of their guys in the main square and thought we would give it a go . . . than were told the price, after a group discount (the 4 of us), that really was not acceptable. I read a lot about Czechia before we went, so i knew it was about ONE MOTH WORK WOTH OF, given the minimum wage in Czechia, he was asking for a tour to the castle !!! I Know they may not even be the most expensive, but it just seems so wrong! We later got a very good tour somewhwre else for like 20% of the price :(

Tour with David. We had an amazing tour with david. He took us around the city and showed us a lot of great places combined with interesting information. We felt safe driving with him, even in the city with a lot of traffic. No problems or accidents occured and I would recommend this tour to every body who wants to get to know prague. Thank you again David Greetings from Rostock :)

A absolute must :). Went on a Segway tour today! Best experience!! saw so much of the city and the views were unbelievable :) Aneta our tour guide was awesome!! so helpful and so much fun! Would definitely recommend this tour and if I ever come back would definitely do it again :)

Best way to see Prague. Our guide aneta was so helpful... Getting around via segway is by far the easiest way to see this city in the heat of summer.
Aneta made learning how to ride a segway so simple and I thank her for that.
Grest experience.

Guided tour with David !. Went for a two hour guided segway-trip with David. It was absolutely brilliant. It`s a great way to get to see a lot of the city, and also learn a lot. Our guide David was good in english and had a lot of knowledge he shared with us. If we`ve had more time we would have taken more segway-tours with him. Will do next time we visit Prague !

Discoverprague.com. It was weeks ago that we spent 2 weeks in Europe, but one of the highlights of our trip was the 2 hour Segway tour with our private guide, Domink. It's a great way to see this city and Domink was a very fun tour guide.

WOW very cool. I was very sceptical, but I loved it!!!David is very nice and knows the cirty. This is a must do if you visit Prague.We did it as part of a Bachelor Event. I can recommomend it to everybody.

great tour with lots of fun and sightseeing. We had a great 3 hours tour with David during our visit in Prague for a "Junggesellenabschied". We had lots of fun and saw a lot of Prague. Great as you can see more than by walking. Thank you!

Best guided tour in Prouge. We came back yesterday from Prague and we can't stop talking about our segway tour with wonderful Aneta. She took us to all best places and views. For 2 hours we were very excited from all the sites ad places we visited.I recommend this tour with www.isegway.cz We even got a discount to a bar.

Nice change of pace. Our family of 5 including 3 teenagers took the city tour on segway and thought it was a great addition to our 2 hour walking tour of the city that we took with a guide the day before. We saw places we hadn't seen and stopped for fun pictures along the way. We covered a lot of ground and went way up to the top of the park for a great view of the city. Took less than 3 minutes to master. Highly recommend.

Best way to see Prague. Our tour guide David was relaxed and friendly. He was very informative, and had a great knowledge of the city and its history. With only myself, my partner and our 12 yo daughter on the tour, it was great value and highly recommended.

Prague on the Segway. We had a wonderful time. Dominik our guide was very helpful and took us to all the picturesque spots in Prague giving us ample time for a lot of pics. Next time we get to visit Prague we will definitely do it the seg"WAY".

Great Segway tour. We had a great 2 hour tour with David. This was an excellent way to see Prague! We really had fun and we saw all remarkable places. After that it was easy to choose where to go and visit in more detail. Segway was easy to "drive".

Segway Tour. The best way to tour !!
tour guide was very nice
enriched us with stories and details about the places weve. seen.
One hour is enough

Personal, fun, flexible - great value for money!. Loved it! Strolled by on a late rainy afternoon just to inquire about prices and got an "exclusive" tour with one guide just for the two of us. So lucky to have caught the two hours it wasn't raining. And so lucky to have this terrific guide who showed us all the nice places AND the fun of riding the segway. The ratio between price and what we got was really, really good, the segways were in top shape, I can only recommend this place

isegway personal tour. We've been lucky to get a tour for just two of us, and we really enjoyed a ride in old town and Mala Strana. Our guide was Anna, and we didn't have any problems in communicating in English. First, she taught us how to ride a Segway (really easy), then we took 2-hour tour and Anna managed to show us some places we haven't been before (although we lived in Prague for 3 months at that time already).We'd highly recommend to take this kind of tour to anybody. Keep in mind that you can create your own travel loop to visit the places you're most interested in.

Best way to see Prague. David, our Guide was a great companion and had extensive knowlege of his lovely city. Perfect english and funny delivery! First time for us doing a tour on a segway and it is not going to be our last!! Thank you David and thank you Prague!!

2 hour segway castle tour Prague. The tour was fun and engaging. A good way to see the sights of Prague in a short time. David, our Segway guide was most patient with us and always on the lookout for traffic and surroundings to keep us safe. The machine is easy to navigate and use once u get the hang of it. David even picked us up at our apartment in old town square to start the tour. Excellent service.

Great fun. This experience was a great way to visit Prague. Really easy once you get the hang of it. Our guide David was friendly, funny, engaging and really brilliant encouraging the nervous members f our party. He made a great experience a truly fabulous one.

Great experience and excellent service. I would like to strongly recommend this city tour - very exciting, interesting and different comparing to anything I experienced earlier. Pure 10 for David, our friendly and polite guide who was doing his best to make our tour even more interesting!

Segway tour with David. Today we had sagway tour and it is truly unique experience. There is no better way to see all tourist attractions .. even more. David, tourist guide is really polite and speaks excellent English. We had small sagway accident caused purely by our mistake and David offered great assistance. Thank you mate :)

Fantastic!. In a word, "FANTASTIC"! We arrived at the office and met our guide David. He gave us our training and we were off. This is the best way to see the city. We were riding for a good 2 hours and loved every minute of it. David gave us the history and took pictures to capture the fun the four of us were having on our tour of the area. This is the only way to do it. We covered so much ground quickly, we could have never done by walking. Highly recommend this company and guide.
The best guide. I had some wishes that were granted without any problems.A skilled, but especially nice guide.I can warmly recommend David.

BEST CITY TRIP EVER. We meet Mrs. Anetta on the Square and booked with this sympatic Lady a Round for 1 Hour.It was Amazing how much we was see in this short Time. Anetta is a perfect Guide, she know so many things about the City. The only bad thing was that this 1 hour was run so fast as 10 min, like allways if something is really great. So next time we will book for sure minimum 2 hrs. :))) Thank You iSegway Team for the great time !!!! Harald + Hermann (you are a really perfect organized Company)

Great experience!. I had two teenagers who decided last-minute that they wanted to try a Segway tour on a rainy day in Prague. After walking around for an hour and hitting two dead ends with other companies, we spotted David on a Segway in the Old Town Square and asked if he could help us. He was very friendly and accommodating, took the time to make sure these first-time riders were comfortable and safe on the Segways, and then tailored the time to do what was of interest to the kids (instead of going through a pre-set route that probably would have been boring to them). He really made it a fantastic experience that we were talking about for hours after it was over! I highly recommend it.

FABULOUS 2 HOURS !!!. We only had one day in Prague. So we choose a private tour for 2 "old guys" with Annetta... At first we were not sure if at 55+ years old we could do it... but we were surprised how easy it was to learn to ride. We had booked for a 9:00 AM departure for a 2 hours tour; PERFECT in every way. Not too many people...Annetta always made sure we were OK and gave us very interesting facts about Prague. We were like kids riding for the first time! We really loved the fact that Annetta was able to stop when we wanted to take pictures, and it was great to have somebody to tell us where were the "must see" shots of Prague.We cover so much ground in 2 hours... and places we would not go. At the end... we wanted to go back for another 2 hours!!! THANK YOU ANNETTA for a fantastic memory of Prague. We will never forget you. Pierre and Jean

Prague in 2 hours - the fun way!. We only had one full day in Prague, but 5 "must see" points of interest. So we hired a Segway. Wow was that cool! We were met at the hotel, given a lesson for 10 minutes (neither of us had ever been on one before) and then on our way. The guide, Peter, took us to lots of places we would not have bothered going to, but glad we did. The Segway allowed us to cover a lot of ground - quickly. Two hours cost A$90 ea. incl. the guided tour. This is a quality tourist operation and worth every cent. Next time I am bringing the whole family back to do it.

A great way to see Prague. We loved this tour! Jacob met us at our hotel and arranged our tour. Peter our tour guide was brilliant. This is a wonderful way to see Prague on the first day of your stay. You really get an idea of the area and can plan your itinerary for the remainder of your stay. We did the 2 hour tour and thoroughly enjoyed every moment. If I can ride one of these anyone can. It just follows your body movements. Highlight of my trip!

Fantastic way to experience Prague. We did a Segway your in Prague, it was a great experience! The segways are fantastically fun in their own right, but using them to see the great sights of such a beautiful city was just excellent. Our guide was great, friendly and informative and we really enjoyed the whole tour.

Great way to see Prague. My wife and I booked a 2 hour tour with David over Skype at short notice, and we enjoyed it thoroughly. Touring the town via Segway was also a great choice - not only very practical, but gliding about was a blast. Being a private tour (reasonably priced, too), we were able to pick our destinations, and so we toured the park overlooking the river on the west side of Prague. I can highly recommend this - beautiful views of the city and would be quite a long hike without the Segway. It was our first time on Segways, and we were a bit tentative at first, but in 5 minutes we felt much more natural. David was very good with his instruction and always kept an eye on us through the city and cruising through the park's pathways. He was also very good at fielding all my questions about the modern history of the Czech Republic, and was very thoughtful and insighful. Thanks to David - can highly recommend!

Truly awesome way to spend 1st hours in Prague. My wife, 12 yr old granddaughter and I arrived May 7, 2013, checked into our hotel and immediately went to iSegway Prague Tours for our 3.5 hour tour of Prague. After an one minute demonstration of how to operate the Segway, we where off wheeling down the streets and up the many hills of Prague. Looking back, this had to be the most perfect way to begin our trip-seeing and learning about all the sites of Prague in ease while we witnessed other tourist struggling with the cobblestone roads and numerous hills. Now we plan to visit the sites that appeal to us knowing we won't be waiting precious time since we are here for only 3 days. David, our tour guide was just great- Very good English, knowledgeable, polite, easy going and kept a very watchful eye on us to ensure we were safe, etc. FYI- our granddaughter never wanted the tour to end, having a blast on the Segway. Enjoy Prague.

Best way to see Prague. We were only in Prague for the weekend and wanted a way to see all the sites. Segway was the obvious choice and we had looked at some tours on line beforehand. We thought ISegway was good value for money and we could get a private tour. Our guide, David, was really friendly and really made the experience. Would highly recommend it.
Segway in Prague with David. Had never before tried Segway but are now completely sold. It was really fun. Leader David was fantastic. David was professional and easy to talk to.Recommended
Excellent.!. We had a very nice segway experience with David , the only nice person we met in Praha actually. I recommend it!

Great way to see Prague. Prague was our first stop on our honeymoon, and we wanted to see the sights. I came upon iSegway through Tripadvisor, and booked a private tour for 3 hours. So it was just me and my wife with our great tour guide, David. He was really friendly and charming and taught us a lot about the history of this beautiful city. Using the Segway is a really intimate and quick way of seeing all the attractions and since it was just us we got to stop and took a lot of great photos and video. My wife and I highly recommend this tour.

Awesome... best way to see Prague!. Had a great time on this tour. There were 9 in our group, and we had a great time. Dom was an awesome guide. The booking process, 10-minute induction and 90-minute tour was stress-free, friend and great fun. I would definitely recommend this. It's perfect if you want to get your bearings early in your trip, or if you want a whistle-stop tour of Prague if you are short of time.ps. the nice weather helped :)
Excellent tour. Don't miss this amazing tour in this fairy tale city. You can not walk everywhere but segway is the most exciting and enjoyfull method. Special thanks four our tour guide David. Look
David was great. We had a lot of fun when visiting the whole city whe went to the metronome and the castle. It was great

What a ride!!. Our family only had two days to see Prague and all of its beauty so you can imagine our rush in wanting to do as much as possible. We were not let down by all that was experienced with our guide Domink and the iSegway tour. We saw so much and had a BLAST while doing it. Domink is funny and so carefree~we didnt stop smiling the whole ride, except when we were laughing at something funny our guide mentioned!! They made our trip so much more memorable and we would recommend this group to anyone!

Excellent way to spend 2 hours. I booked our iSegway tour after reading the reviews in TripAdvisor and was not disappointed! This was our family's first trip to Prague and iSegway was a great way to see the city. I was amazed at how much we were able to see in 2 hours. The tour was limited to our guide Domink and our family. Domink took us to places that we would never have gone if we were on foot or on our own. After the tour we had a good idea of where we wanted to go back and explore more. I would without any hesitation recommend this tour to anyone!

Excellent way to see Prague!. From initial inquiry to the actual tour, iSegway were first class and we would highly recommend them. It was our first time on a Segway, but our guide put us completely at ease and we had a fantastic 2 hour tour of Prague... what a way to do it! We definitely saw things we wouldn't have otherwise seen - things which relatives who visited Prague recently didn't see. Very interesting and informative and great fun. We would definitely do it again.

Simply Amazing 2-Hour Tour. Our family of 5, ages 14 to 50+, had never riden segways before so we approached this adventure with some trepidation. Our guide, Domink, quickly put our fears to rest, showing us quickly and easily how to master the Segway. He safely took us throught the crowded streets of old Prague, over the river to the comanding heights of a park for spectacular views of the city. We then went to the castle for more great views and into the old town below the castle and to the famous John Lennon wall. We wound our way through the city back over the bridge, seeing many interesting old and new sites. Dominik offered excellent commentary the whole way. Particularly if you have limited time in Prague, the Segway tour gets you around quickly...what we saw in 2 hours would have taken 6-8 if we had walked. ISegway delivered a great experience at fair price...we'd do it again!

Brilliant fun - a great way to see Prague. We had a fantastic guide call Mike who was very informative as we whizzed through the Prague streets. We were a family of 4 (children 19 and 22) on a private tour for 2 hours. . This definitely takes the strain as you effortlessly get around and it is surprising the distances you cover in a short period.

Eight days four Countries and our favorite tour. We had a great time touring Prague on Segways with ISegway Prague Tours. I was with my 13 year old son and the brief lesson was enough to hit he road and feel comfortable. We toured with Dominik and did the three hour tour. Dominik was great and spoke good english and had a great understanding of the history and information for each site. It gave us a fantastic overview of the City and glad we did the Segways on the first day of our stay as it gave us a great idea of what to do on our second. We covered more ground in three hours than we could have in two days of walking. Planning to visit Prague again next year and will definitely tour with ISegway Prague Tours again. Thank you for a memorable trip.

Great way to see Prague!. Since I travel a bit and lots of biz is done in Prague I always wondered if Prague would be good on a segway and guess what? It is terrific! I met the segway tour guide at their office in the very center which is right around the corner from the astromical clock. They trained me and then took me on a personal tour for just over two hours. My guide who was very knowledgable and funny took me through some great areas that I never have seen before on the tour. This made the tour extra special since I told them I was in prague often they showed me a bit more. They were very accommodating and also gave me good insider tips what to see after and a great recommendation for a meal too! I would recommend them for anyone wanting to experience prague in a unique and fun experience.

Supertrip through the all the city highlights!. Through our friend from Coyotes Club we got the tip for the Segway Tour and it was an amazing way to see the highlights of Prague.This is a must do way to see the city.
Highlight of my whole tour of Europe! So fun!. I absolutely loved it. I got sore cheeks from smiling so much. I would recommend for everyone to do this if they ever get the chance.

Excellent 2 hour city tour with our own guide!. My partner and I booked a 2 hour Segway tour of the city with iSegway Prague Tours and I have to say that it was excellent. We only had 2 days in Prague and this is a superb way of getting a great overview of the city. It was just the 2 of us with our own guide and it almost felt like the tour was a Czech friend of ours showing around his home town. We had an excellent lesson on how to operate the Segway and stay safe (it's really rather easy when you get the hang of it) and then a very thorough tour with many stops at iconic builings and views. We learnt a lot about the history of the city and the Czech republic itself from our guide. I would highly recommend this company.

Awesome way how to explore Prague. A few weeks back we were on a trip with friends in Prague. This way of sightseeing was definitely awesome. We had a guide Jakub, it was fun with him :) took us for some nice places ( beer in Malostranska, view from Petrin) It was awesome - fully recomendThank you!!

Prague by segway. Excellent and fun way to do a highlighted tour of the main attractions. The guide was a university student and very knowledgeable. Recommended. We did this tour in winter and so it was not too crowded on the streets but I would imagine using Segways on crowded roads and pavements at the height of the season would detract from the enjoyment. As it was we managed to cover 2 or 3 times the ground we could have on foot in the same time. Not cheap but fun.Be prepared for some hostility from some pedestrians (locals) who seem to regard Segways with contempt. We met one who deliberately steeped into the guides way and refused to move. He gave her a stream of abuse before she managed to calmly placate him. Full marks to her for maintaining civility. There are a number of firms offering Segways but this seemed the most reasonable. They will barter on cost out of season.

Excelent experience. I have been in Prague several times, but so interesting tour never had before.Two ouhres on Segway and you can see all mostly interesting sightseengs of the city. And you are not tired!The well-english-speaking guide told several words about all interesting places, shows best views of Prague and answer of all your questions.Super! Thank you Jakub!

Fast and Fun way to See Prague.. If its your first day in Prague then iSegway can offer you the best way to get your bearings. Our guide Dominic was friendly and fun, and knew his stuff. We did a great tour around the old town and up to the Castle.It was my first time on a Segway, but it's surprisingly easy. I think it is suitable for all ages and abilities.You can really cover some distance. In our two hour tour Dominic took us to so many places its difficult to list.We had a great deal of fun on the Segway, lots of laughs and a sense of accomplishment at the end.If its cold - wrap up warm. Whilst riding the Segway you are effectively standing still so your toes and fingers can get cold. This was a real highlight of our week in Prague and I highly recommend it.

Best experience in Prague.. If you are short on time, but would like to see most (if not all) the sites in Prague, this may be the perfect option for you. There are many Segway companies to choose from in Prague, but we chose ISegway, due to their location and being able to accommodate our specific requests. More on that later. Their location couldn't be any better. It's just inside the Art Passage almost on top of Old Town Square, near the Astronomical Clock. In fact, we stumbled onto to it while walking through. Glad we did, as we never considered riding a Segway before. We had seen many other Segway companies in Prague, but chose (ISegway) after meeting Jakub walking through the passage. He was super nice, and talked to us about their individual structured tours which I believe are 1-3 hours in length. We wanted something a little different and preferred a little extra attention. For example, instead of just seeing all the main tourist sites like, the Jewish Quarter, Charles Bridge, Prague Castle, and Kampa Island (and obviously-Old Town Square), we wanted to see Prague from a native perspective. A person who has a rich history of the city, and has extensive knowledge of the local restaurants and pubs. When we travel, we like to go were the locals go. So, Jakub accommodated us by giving us a custom-2-hour tour of Prague. It was the most memorable experience we've had of any vacation to date. It was fantastic!Plus, you don't have to worry about killing your feet on the cobblestones while walking throughout Prague. And, the Segway literally glides along the pathways with ease and little effort, therefore the higher elevations of Prague are no match. Worried about safety? We were too! No need though, because ISegay provided all the safety gear and training you need (in this case, just helmets, and a camera :)) We were up and running in no time flat. Actually, we're still surprised how easy it was, and may even purchase one (Segway) for ourselves at Christmas.One thing to remember, be sure and bundle up, as it can get quite cold. We took our tour at the right time (between 1-3 pm), but we were prepared. It wasn't that bad at all, but it gets dark around 4:30, so be sure and keep that in mind. All in all, one of the best experiences we've ever had. Thanks, Jakub! Sincerely,Kevin

Great Experience, Great Deal!. We were fortunate enough to come across the opportunity to take a scenic tour through Prague, a magnificent city with ISegway. Really an extraordinary experience, our wonderful tour guide patiently explained the history of the city with patience, genuine interest and home felt pride. The entire experience was engaging, made even better by our tour guide's willingness to share personal experiences of the Czech culture and recommendations of where else to visit during our stay. As well, the experience was fun and exciting while always feeling safe and out of harms way. I would recommend this company and this experience to anyone looking to have a fun and educational experience in a great city.

Cool Autumn experience. We booked the tour at the last minute and isegway was able to accommodate us. We have done the city tour the day before and wanted to do something different. The guide (Dominique) took us through the Jewish Quarter, across Vltava river, to the Letna Gardens, Prague Castle and Kampa Island. The ride though the Letna Gardens in the Autumn was exceptionally enjoyable, away from the tourist crowd. Cool experience.

So much to see but little time?. Having only a few short days in town I decided to hire iSegway in order to see as much of the city as possible in a short time. Jacob, a native of Praha and one of the owners, was my guide. As he grew up in town, he's very knowledgeable of the areas to tour and can tell you about how the city has evolved over the past 30 years. They have mapped routes but are happy to deviate from the norm to customize your visit. After a quick learning and practice session (I had never been on a Segway before) I spent several hours traveling through the city and even stopped for lunch together upon my request. The advantage of seeing a city on Segway over an off/on bus tour is that you can stop anywhere, even if it's just to read a plaque or look at a statue. This company is all about satisfying the guest's interests coupled with safe-riding. If you are hesitant in spending the money required to tour, don't be. I saw so much of a new city without the normal fatigue from a day a walking. It's great!

An excellent, private tour of Prague!. My father and I were lucky enough to secure a half day bike tour with Michal during our three days in Prague. We had many private guides during our time in Central and Eastern Europe, and Michal topped our list as one of the best! Michal was very friendly, professional and helpful. We felt like our tour was perfectly personalized based on our interests and desire to see the "local" side of Prague. Our tour took us away from the main attractions and to lovely neighborhoods, parks, cafes/restaurants, history etc. Michal is very knowledgable and passionate about Prague, and we really enjoyed hearing all about Prague's history and culture from him. He shared great stories about his family, and his commentary really enhanced our experience and understanding of Czech culture.The day of our tour was very rainy, and I was very worried that the bad weather would negatively impact our afternoon. That was not the case as our indoor stops were perfectly timed with the sporadic downpours. We didn't miss out on anything thanks to Michal's great planning and flexibility. I highly recommend booking time with Michal on the front end of your trip. We learned so much about the city, and the amount of information he shared (about Prague's history, must-visit restaurants and museums, where to find meaningful souvenirs, best strategies for visiting major attractions, etc) was invaluable. I can't imagine a better way to cover ground, and learn about Prague, than by bike with Michal. :)

Great Bike Tour. Just got back from a wonderful trip to Prague and was fortunate enough to have taken a bike tour outside of the city with Michal. He is a certified tour guide and has a wealth of knowledge about the rich history of this city. We had a great time chatting with him, having a beer and meal with him at the brewery and getting to know Prague through the eyes of a native. He was sure to point out local hotspots for eating and drinking and none of his recommendations disappointed. A fantastic afternoon! Thank you Michal for a day of great memories.

Great way to see more than just the CIty Center. Michal was a wonderful and fun guide who is clearly immensely proud, and knowledgeable about his country and it's history. We are not avid bikers, and preferred a moderate, easy route. Michal delivered, taking us down babbling brooks and rivers, through the woods, and even a brewery. For those looking to see a quieter, more natural side of the Czech Republic, Michal is your man. Email him, set a date, and watch him show up at your front door!

A great day touring around the outskirts of Prague. The tour consisted of a full day biking around the outskirts of Prague including stops in beautiful nature spots and scenic views as suggested by our guide Michal. Around midday we stopped for lunch in a traditional Prague restaurant. The food was delicious! Michal was not only helpful and informative during the tour, but he also suggested very good restaurants and places to visit in the center for the rest of our stay. Would definitely recommend this tour :)

Prague Behind-the-Scenes with an Insider. Recently during a three-day stay in Prague our group of six went on a bike tour with Born-in-Prague guide Michal. This was a perfect complement to our visit. Why? Well, we had already seen all the tourist-guide locations and were craving some live-like-a-local experiences. We told Michal this (as he tailors the tour to your wishes) so he took us into some nearby neighborhoods representing differing social classes. We saw terrific parks with great views, had a wonderful break at a small hipster cafe, and got some history and local lore we otherwise would have missed. And, besides, it was great fun to roam all around Prague by bike. Great job, Michal—thank you!

Best of Czech Republic with Michal. If you want an authentic tour of Prague and the countryside, you need to experience what Michal has to offer. He met us at our hotel, took us to get our bikes & even had our tickets to get on the train to head out into the countryside. Our trip along the Labe River and through small villages, stopping at a local restaurant for lunch was an amazing experience with Michal. As the guide books say, you need to get out of Prague to really experience what the Czech Republic is all about. We have travelled in many places & Michal is undoubtedly the best guide we have ever had. He not only told us about the history but his own feelings about living under the rule of the Russians. After our bike ride he took us to a bar/restaurant on the top of a department store and pointed out all the sites in the city of Prague that we needed to visit. This included cafes, restaurants, jazz bars etc. and he marked them all on the map for us. We visited all of them & they were wonderful. Thank you Michal for a wonderful tour. We will keep reliving it because of the great photos that you sent to us.

The best day of our trip!. We had the full day bike tour of prague, it was by far the highlight of our trip. The tour started with a sceinic route up to the castle. The views were incredible! We avoided the large tourist qeues and had plenty of time to explore the castle grounds, royal gardens and went into the cathederal. We had lunch in a beautiful little cafe hidden away from the busy touristy streets. After lunch we then saw the Loreto, swan beach, the convent of St Agnes, the old town and Jewish quarter. We also fitted in time for an ice cream!After the tour we enjoyed a drink together on a rooftop bar with breathtaking views over Prague.As a group of women aged 24-60 holding different levels of fitness and biking experience, Michal allowed us to set the pace of the tour and he planned the day around our abilities. Not once did we feel uncomfortable or rushed.I will be recommending everyone to do one of Michals tours. He is very enthusiastic, knowledgeable and friendly.Thank you Michal for a fantastic day!

Nature trails, cafe's and conversation sans tourist crowds and "packaged" tour indifference!. I connected with Michal 2 years ago when my family relocated to Prague from Seattle. I was determined to find cafe's and bike trails that only the locals knew about. Michal has a 100% success rating in getting us connected to off beat places that have become staples in our day to day life. They are amazing places where we actually know the staff and they great us as locals now. We have gone on at least 3 (some solo and some with my wife and 2 kids 8 and12), trips with Michal now (and have a cool night time MT bike ride with lights through the forrest planned for October 016). Whenever I need I new bicycle route or want to explore a castle or village without the masses of people, I call Michal. He has an amazing knowledge of the grand scope of nature in Czech Republic and wonderful little nature getaways right in the center of Prague. He knows the trails, architectural wonders, Czech history, culture, art, and social issues in ways that you just can not get get in guide book. He also has a thorough understanding on the logistics of getting you to these places with train schedules down to the minute to make connections that get you out on the trails and back home again.But best of all (and the reason I keep in touch and do more tours), is that I really enjoy our conversations. Really how many tour guides do you ever really have a conversation with that goes even one sentence off script?So if you want a trip that takes you through nature with a little stop at a small local bakery for breakfast, sees you riding bikes on wonderful empty trails with great views, includes a stop at a Romanesque chapel that is not in your guide book and a stop for lunch at a local micro brewery with great lentil soup that your will never get to through your hotel, more great riding (or hiking), to catch the train that takes back into the city just in time to stop at a hip local illustration exhibit where you can see work by local upstart artists and crafts people, with great conversation along the way (in English), about art, culture, interesting social issues, design, architecture, or other topics-then I would say you have come to the right place! Enjoy!! Michal will give you a tour and a view of this amazing city that you will fondly remember for many many years. And best of all he is flexible and diverse in his approach to make it fit perfectly into what you want to see-not what he wants you to see.KeLan -Prague resident 2 year and counting...

Incredible castle and countryside day trip. We decided at the last minute to organise a day trip to see some of the area around Prague. Michal was more than accommodating to our needs and organised to take us out for the day to see Karlstejn castle and do some hiking.
