We met him at the train station and he took charge of how to get to and from central Prague. He showed us the best view spots of Karlstejn for postcard-perfect photos. He got us to Karlstejn before the hordes of tourists and translated the tour for us (as it was in Czech). After he took us to a local place for lunch, then we continued walking in the countryside for several hours to some scenic locations. We ended the day with a drink at the pub before getting a train back to Prague. Michal let us change our mind on the day about what we wanted to do and where we wanted to go. He was able to give us lots of information about things on our walk and general information on Prague and the Czech Republic. It was our best day in Prague!

The perfect way of visiting Prague with a very nice local guy. We were 3 people, and we enjoyed our walking tour with Michal A LOT! This guy knows absolutely everything about his city: The best real czech pasties place, the best restaurants, coffee and bars, unexpected hidden views over the city, architecture, litterature and history. I recommand this tour, you will not be dissapointed. Plus, he is a funny person, with great sens of humour.

Great trip to the countryside. I did the Beyond Prague Walking Tour. Michal met us at our hotel and took care of all the logistics of getting to the train station, buying tickets, and riding the train out of the city, while covering plenty of history on the way. We took a short hike to a great photo spot that I never would have found on my own, then toured Karlstejn Castle. After seeing the castle we had a great lunch and hiked around some more before returning to Prague on the train. It's a lot of walking but mostly flat with a few steep sections around Karlstejn Castle. My parents are 60 and they had no problem doing it. Thanks for the tour Michal!

Awesome 2 days with Michal. We booked 2 days with Michel... one to explore the Prague, the other a hiking tour of Karlštejn Castle. He was fantastic. He picked us up at our hotel each day and spent time understanding our interests and then tailored each day to incorporate a wide variety of sites. Given that he was "born in Prague," was a wealth of information providing suggested activities for exploring on our own, cafe and restaurant recommendations... and equally important "you can skip that" tips! Highly recommend your trip to Prague includes Michal's expertise.

Great trip. We took the castle hike tour, which was great, but before leaving Prague and upon returning, Michal took the extra time to show us different parts of the city and explain parts of the history as well as local culture. He is someone who clearly loves his city and country and is excited about showing it off.

A must do trip. You cannot spend a better day around Prague than spending it with Michael. He was born in Prague and was a wealth of information. He escorts you on public transportation and takes you on a lovely hike to the castle via a breath taking meadow. The hike takes you away from the crowds and into the nearby landscape.The price is super affordable and he is an extremely pleasant hiking partner, very down to earth. Michael picked out a wonderful cafe where we had a tasty lunch. You won't regret this trip!

a very full half day with Michal. Michal gave my husband and I a half day bike tour around the castle district side of Prague in June. He picked us up at our hotel and we had a nice local lunch before setting out to pick up our bikes which were good quality. Michal is full of information and energy. We covered a lot of territory in our half day. One caveat about biking in Prague - there are a few short hills and a bunch of cobblestones to navigate, so its not the easiest ride ever, especially on the 95 degree day we had. However, the views from up high are lovely and Michal is very happy to share his knowledge, and all his suggestions for things after your tour is over, too.

Escape the throng of tourists with an amazing guide. Of course Prague is a beautiful city, but it is also very packed with tourists! We wanted to get away and see the countryside and get in a little hiking. We could not have found a better guide. Michal was so enjoyable to spend the day with and so knowledgeable about everything to do with the area and its history. We loved our hike and the amazing view of the Karlstejn Castle through a beautiful open meadow. The day away from the crowds was priceless. We enjoyed a delicious lunch at a charming cafe and also had time to stop for a beer before catching our train back to Prague. The map of Prague that he gives is a keepsake and we appreciated all the information about areas to visit. It truly made our trip! I would highly recommend Michal as he is a truly genuine person who will tailor your tour to suit your tastes. Don't miss out...such a find!

The best introduction to the beautiful city! . My husband and I absolutely loved our day of exploring Prague on bikes! It allowed us to get our bearings in the city, to get all the important tips for further exploration and made for an unforgettable experience! Our best photos of this trip come from this day. Michal was such a great host, very knowledgeable in history, and also super fun.

Wish I could give this tour 6 stars. We had such an amazing tour with Michal. It was like having your best friend show you the best places and hidden gems in Prague. The tour was tailored to our interests and Michal was happy to provide us with a host of recommendations after the tour, which we promptly followed up on and enjoyed immensely. I can't recommend this tour enough!

Nothing short of amazing. Such a blessing!. Michal is one of the most humble and knowledgeable people i have had the pleasure of being around. He has such an amazing grasp on the national history, beautiful locations to visit - that i will never forget, and his love for cycling and maps makes him an amazing guide. There is nothing like going with with someone who was born in the city and spent most of that time exploring different spots. Whether i wanted a place to visit for the night, see some heavy nature, cycle around or even visit local festivals and events, he knew exactly where to go. Thank you mate!
One day biking out of Prague. Excellent day trip by bike guided by Michal. Great tracks, paths, views and pit stops with lots of information about the area, culture and history. 100% worth doing!

Amazing tour of Prague by a local. As a solo traveler I wanted to get to know the real culture and local spots. Michal is a young passionate guy, born in Prague and we did a whole day biking tour together, he showed me the best spots and views of Prague and answered any of my questions about Tsjech Republic in general! I would recommend to book him as one of the first things you do in Prague, because he will give you 1000 tips and point you places to go on your map. I'm so great full that I got to explore Prague on such a unique way! The price is totally reasonable and for sure worthy!

Awesome day of bike riding!. We found Michael through TripAdvisor as we were looking for a cycling tour that took in some of the Czech countryside and the less touristy side of Prague.We had such a great day, we chose the half day and traveled 30 minutes out of the city.We went along rivers, off road bike tracks and saw the amazing countryside.We stopped at a beautiful brewery for lunch and Michael talked to us about all the must see places whilst we were in Prague. Highly recommend this tour!!!

Bike tour of Prague and area.. Michal was so knowledgeable and personable, the best day of our holiday was his bike tour.He was very organized, and confident enough to alter plans based on our personal interests as he saw fit, for example we preferred single track dirt trails over paved bike lanes and even though we never asked for the dirt trails Michal was smart enough to figure out what we really liked, and made little choices throughout the day to take the single track trails.My wife and I went with our 13 year old, and even though we are from a small town in rural Canada and not used to biking in a big city, I would hire Michal again without hesitation as he was safe and watchful when biking in the city. He's clearly a very experienced biker wise to the ways of biking in downtown Prague. (By the way, the drivers in Prague were quite courteous, we never got honked at once!)

Great few days with a knowledgeable guide who is passionate about Prague. Michal first took our family on a tour of Prague where we were introduced to the historic sites as well as off-the-beaten track cafes and good (non-touristy) restaurants. He made a terrific recommendation for a restaurant to accommodate our vegan daughter. A few days later, he organized a bicycling tour for us outside of Prague which was terrific and it was great to get out of the city for a bit and see the surroundings. He proved to be very flexible (we had to change the date for the cycling at the last minute). After the cycling tour, he took us on the roof top of a cafe which had a breathtaking view of Prague....what a way to finish! He provides fair pricing and we would highly recommend him, especially if you are curious about things beyond the classic tourist sites.

Special Person , special day. Michal is a special person, sensitive and he´s definetely in love with Chequia.We enjoyed the time we cycled with him and the restaurant tips.We felt less foreigners..Thanks Michal..

City Trip Prague. Been to Prague a couple of times and know the city a bit. But the tour with Michal was really something special. Very nice guy, who will show you the most beautiful places in Prague...

A good guy, who is flexible and knowledgeable. We used Michal for a walking tour of Prague in December, and I used him as a guide for a cross country ski trip in the Krkonose Mountains in February. Each time he was helpful, flexible, knowledgeable, and interesting. He showed us some excellent sites and restaurants in Prague, and took me on two amazing cross country skiing treks from bouda to bouda, with amazing views. A very, very nice guy, reasonably priced.

Incredibly bike ride through the czech country side!. Our bike ride with Michal was truly one of the highlights of our trip. After a couple of days in prague we had seen most of the main tourist sites and were happy to have the chance to tour an area outside the city. Michal took us on an absolutely incredibly 30 mile bike ride on mostly trails (and some beautiful roads) through czech forests and countryside. We met him at the bike rental shop and he took care of all of the details. We payed him a flat fee for the day, and it included the bike rental as well as all of the train tickets.We started with an about 30 minute train ride out to the countryside, during which he gave us some great tips for our time in prague. We then took off onto gorgeous and very mild/moderate trails/forest roads through some incredible forest areas. There were some minimal rolling hills, but nothing crazy. We wove through some adorable small villages, with stops for him to add interesting historical facts relevant to the places we traveled through. We then had lunch at an incredible little cafe with great food and beer. We finished with about an hour of easy flat riding back to the train station.

A wonderful afternoon of cycling. I found Michal after googling bike tours in Prague and was impressed that he offered great places to see outside of the city center.We had a full 5 days of touring with other family members and myself, my husband and my 19 yr old son needed an afternoon get-away in the country. It was better than expected. Michal answered my inquiry promptly with great suggestions and links to sights. He was informative, reliable and safe. We had no complaints except wish we had more time to tour with Michal!

Born in Prague. We are a family of three and our son is 17 and easily bored with tours, so we knew we couldn't do a typical walking tour. This was the best alternative! It was fun, educational, and we got to know the lay of the land for the remainder of our stay. Michal was a dream of a guide. He's knowledgeable, fun, and very accommodating by tailoring the tour to our interests and biking level. We've already recommended Michal and his tour to friends.

Michal was fantastic. My sister and I took the Beyond the Center morning tour today. We were able to see parts of Prague that we would never have seen. We rode the subway, rode our bikes in the forest, saw magnificent views, took a quick ferry ride and rode some more. Michal always had an interesting fact to share. We had an amazing lunch and the entrees were $4! Because I talked about going shopping, he took us to his cousin's shop - a local designer. Beautiful clothes made to order if she didn't have my size. I can't wait to pick them up later this week. Full service bike ride. We highly recommend Michal and his business. It is a great way to spend time in Prague.and learn from a local.

Exceedingly knowledgeable, charming and hospitable individual.. Michal is the perfect tour guide for any amount of time in Prague. He knows a remarkable amount about the architectural history of Prague, the curious nooks and crannies of the city, the unique and inspiring musical events, the affordable and delicious places to eat as well as the lovely surrounding countryside.His personality is endearing and open. His conversation is always interesting and entertaining. The time will breeze by. There is, quite simply, no better travel idea, whilst in Prague than to spend a day with this fine fellow. I'd suggest doing so towards the beginning of your trip as he's capable of providing you with a great deal of insight into what to do for the rest of the time.

A day with Michal. Michal asked me, some weeks ago, if I would be willing, to write a review about our experience. There's nothing more that I wanted. I found his name on Trip Advisor, and everything turned out much better than I expected. My son and I were travelling around Europe, with the idea to cycle outside of all of those famous cities. Michal proved to be the right choice. Mind you, I'm 57, my son is 17. I asked him for some bike adventure into Bohemia, although I am not an experienced off-track rider. Futhermore, I had a knee injury from Dresden. I was amazed about his flexibility to preview alternative routes in case I had a problem. It all turned out very well. Michal is definetely one of the nicest persons I've ever come across. He changed my ideas about how to travel, to look across the horizon. I hoe other people will learn from my experience

LOVED our day with Michal!. We had one day in Prague and wanted to get it right. We did not want to tour on our own or with a huge group on the tourist route. We chose Michal and he was the perfect choice. He spent the entire day with us, taking us to the important sites as well as the hidden gems. His personality is very special and kind and generous. It was like spending the day with an old friend. The experience was tremendous value for the money.

Perfect ride around Prague countryside and city center. We chose the full day ride and Michal tailored our ride to what we wanted to see in the countryside around Prague. We had a great ride in the forest and along the river, stopped for a pivo and snack mid morning, had a wonderful lunch in a small town, and we were fortunate enough to have some time for a quick tour around the city center of Prague when we got back from the train, ending it with a pivo on the rooftop :) It was perfect! Our family basically had a private tour of Prague and Michal was informative, and enthusiastic in providing a tour that we would truly enjoy and remember.

A local's trip into the Woods.. Michal was quite communicative and helpful in setting up a meeting point. After that, we took a trip into the Bohemian woods and walked through the countryside. The setting was gorgeous, even amid the 38C weather. Would highly recommend Michal as a personal tour guide.

A Perfect Introduction To Prague. I brought my own folding bicycle from Canada so Michal showed up punctually at my residence with a planned journey around Prague designed to keep us cool (relatively) on a 37 C day. After asking what I would like to see, he modified it to include places that my Father had attended 100 yrs. ago. Michal gave me some important "rules of the road" and off we went for an entertaining, informative and rewarding 7.5 hr tour. Well worth the money for a safe and private tour custom tuned to my desires. Michal also showed me how to take my bicycle on the Funicular Railway, on the subway (and more importantly, how to take a bike on an escalator), included some local non-tourist stops for good food, lemonade and ice cream (that were genuine Czech) and also directed me to the National Archives so I could find my Father's previous address to scatter his ashes. His follow up email with photo links and more info was brilliant! In closing, the wealth of information that this art history major gave me was easy to digest and getting some exercise (on the shady side of the street!), good food and drink from a friendly, "Born In Prague" local was worth every penny. I recommend starting your trip this way. Thanx Michal!!!

Křivoklátsko Day Trip. I couldn't have been happier with the tour Michal took me on! My friend moved to Prague some years ago and so I've bbeen before, so this time I wanted to see some of the surrounding country areas and Michal suggested the day trip to Křivoklátsko. This is not for the faint of heart! I'm an athletic person and this was a little difficult but well worth all the views and a terrific workout!Michal met me not far from where I was staying and we hopped on a short train ride to the start of our tour outside Prague. From there we rode through a very quaint village until we reached the edge of the wood where the real adventure began! Through woods, fields, and parkland down to a picturesque creek valley with small cottages and a local pub we rode. Then over a bridge and into another village before taking the scenic route along the river before boarding the train back home. We stopped 3 times - once for pivo, second for lunch and third for a coffee (we were hoping for another pivo, but that pub was closed). Michal is extremely knowledgeable about his homeland from it's inception as being discovered by a Celtic tribe where the coutry's name comes from to more current history as well as architecture, nature, and more! The pace is set by the tourist and you can stop and take pictures as often as you like! I'd highly recommend this tour to anyone and I look forward to doing another tour the next time I'm in Prague.

An authentic ride through the Czech countryside. My wife and I enjoyed a full nine-hour day with Michal during which we got to experience the hills and small towns of the Czech countryside. Overall, it was a wonderful way to get out of Prague and enjoy some good local food. Highlights included a local church, a great restaurant, and (especially!) the overgrown remains of a castle on the promontory with a beautiful view.See below for our full day:We began when Michal picked us up from our hotel and walked us to pick up our bikes (included in the cost of our trip). From here, we went on a small detour to see a church before hopping on the train to a small town about 40 minutes away. We then rode through the hills and some beautiful forest to see a local church perched on a outlook, with a nice view.This was followed by an authentic local lunch in a quaint town. While we were told this was the most expensive restaurant in the area, it was very reasonable by Prague standards (less than 10 euros per person for our meal and drinks).After eating, we rode along a river through farmlands to a truly gorgeous ruin. This was undoubtedly the highlight of the trip. From here, we caught another train to a small town, from which we biked straight back into Prague. Along the way, Michal explained the history of Bohemia and the city, demonstrating his knowledge of architecture once we had entered town. After dropping off the bikes, he showed us a rooftop beer terrace a beautiful view on the old town, where we said our goodbyes.

The perfect guide for Prague. My girlfriend and I visited Prague for Easter and asked Michal to show us around the city and give us some tipps. We ended up spending a whole morning with Michal who was giving us all the insight information (history, local legends, etc.) and the perfect tipps where to eat, drink or stroll around. So if you are looking for a good tourguide in Prague, Michal is the perfect choice.

hidden treasures. We had such a great day with Michal :) really well planned trip just perfectly fitting to our needs and wishes. nothing was a problem. Michal knows about the hidden treasures you would never find withou him!

City from another point of view. If you are interested in spending your time in prague exploring cool/interesting/beautiful sites at/aronund prague, go for it. Michal is a great guide and have really good knowledge about prague.
I met him for 2 hour ride, which was included various places- from industrial death metal club to local cycling velodrome..5/5

Well organized bike trip. I love mountain biking in the countryside surrounding Prague. I know many hidden paths and remote places. But when I joined Michal's bike trip, I was surprised – he showed me several routes around the city I was not aware of. He was also a great group leader, the trip was perfectly organized, it included a few stops to have a beer, enjoy lookouts or swim in the river. I definitely recommend Michal to everyone who wishes to explore a bit of real Czech countryside and genuine local culture.

Cycle like a Local!. Michal was great with a last minute request for a tour. I'm glad he was able to squeeze us in! We told him we wanted to see Prague on bike and that we were interested where locals go in the city. He met us at the bike rental shop and took us to parks that gave us beautiful views of the city. Even though I had been to Prague once before, he took us to areas I've never been before! Along the trip he included suggestions for local eats and drinks. He took us to this beautiful rooftop restaurant with the best views of the city at sunset.It should be noted that he also does walking tours, or even half-cycle-half-walking tours. We opted for the cycle tour because we would see more and our time was limited. He even followed up with us after we got back and mapped out our cycle route. Very thoughtful! I highly recommend anyone that wants to get a local flavor of Prague to take this tour!

Great country ride with Michal!. I had the great pleasure of riding with Michal during my recent visit to Prague. Michal is a very helpful and co-operative guide ... I merely said i would like to see some of the Czech countryside (a welcome respite from the crowds of Prague) and he did all the planning. The result was about a 20 km. ride along the river from Prague on a beautiful sunny day. Michel explained the local sites, cheerfully snapped many pictures of us 'in motion', and negotiated our trip back to Prague by train. Michal is a great travelling companion, and wilingly adjusts the schedule if needed. I had hoped to take at least one more trip with Michal, and he planned out three possible routes; unfortunately, the heat wave that hit Prague ' did me in', and he was very gracious when I explained I would have to cancel our second trip. Thank you, Michal, for such an enoyable day ... and we will do that second (and maybe more) trip when I am back in Prague!

Great cycle trip!. We had a great time doing two trips combined. Michal really showed us parts of Prague we would have never found ourselves. He asked out what we wanted to see, and did a great job showing us those places. If you want to see the real Prague, with a guide that takes his time, i would definitely recommend this tour! It is really worth your while!

Great cycle tour. Great private cycling tour through Prague. Michal gave us a great insight were the locals from Prague normally hangout. The atmosphere at these places were completely different (way better in my opinion) than that from the touristic city center. Besides this Michal also told us lots of the history of Prague and of course showed us the more obvious locations. If you're looking for a walking or cycling tour in Prague, than this is probably the best there is.

Many thanks. Hi, my girlfriend and I have been to several trips organized by Michal, on bike, country skiing or just hiking. We could always rely on Michal's knowledge of the road, nice places to visit, all kind of good restaurants and pubs, interesting places and local history. I even feel ashamed to have become a bit lazy about taking care of anything when going for a trip with Michal. He's always ready to help, give some good advice or come up with a back up plan in any moment just to fit the humours of the group.

Amazing hike, very knowledgeable guide.. Michal was an excellent guide who crafted my hike specifically on my requests. The day and the hike turned out really great and was just what I wanted. The diversity of landscapes we saw really showed off the Czech country side. I could not have asked for a better experience. Even after our hike was over and we took the train back into the city, Michal stayed with me for a couple unplanned hours to show me some secret spots within Prague. Not only did he know a lot about the history or Prague, but also the activities and what was happening the days of my visit. I would highly recommend 'Born in Prague' to anyone looking for a personalized hike or bike in the surrounding areas of Prague.

Do it!. Michal is a real fount of knowledge on anything and everything Prague-related. He'll tell you about its history and its architecture but he's also very much up to date with what's currently going on in the city. I definitely recommend taking a tour with him, be it a walk or a bike ride in the city itself or in its surroundings, all is good.

Easy ride to Karlstejn Castle. A beautiful day ride. Merrick our guide was enjoyable to ride with, shared a wealth of information and went beyond expectations to show us around Prague on bikes afterwords. This reflected his pride in his city and desire to share it with us. He was very flexible about modifying start time due to weather. The route was peaceful and gorgeous.

The Great Escape is truly GREAT!. If you are an avid cyclist who enjoys single track riding, the Great Escape is a terrific way to experience the Czech Republic. Biko did a great job communicating with me to arrange the ride and my guide Radek was phenomenal. He combined information, expertise, feedback and guidance with a friendly, fun approach. This is a can't miss trip in my opinion.

What a fun way to spend the day. We booked a private Karlstejn Castle tour which took about 7 hours. It slightly rained that day but that didn't matter at all. Biko has rain gear and the slight rain made biking easier. Most of the route is off the street which is nice. Absolutely gorgeous scenery the entire day. Our guide was really nice and kept a good pace. 20 miles is tough though if you don't ride often. Most of the way is level but there are a few hills here and there (I walked my bike up those). We were really tired after our day but still glad we did it. The only suggestion I'd have is for Biko to have more comfortable bike seats. Our butts hurt for about a week after the tour. We were too tired to walk up to the Castle but had a great lunch with our guide at a place he recommended. Overall just a great day and I'd highly recommend the tour.

Unforgettable Family Expereince (Bike/Boat Tour). If you're looking for an indescribably perfect experience that will you leave you gushing, look no more--this is it. Our family, four adults and one child (age 10), partook in the all day bike/boat tour through Prague. The tour guides were relatable, light-hearted, knowledgeable, passionate, and just down-right fun. It's clear they are skilled at providing top-notch service and excel to be the best in their class. Our Prague experience would not have been complete (or as great) if it were not for our BIKO experience. If you're concerned about the price, don't be; the value this tour provides is far more than you could imagine and I can assure you won't regret your decision. We will forever be BIKO fans! To the BIKO team, thank you for providing us a memory our family will cherish for a lifetime.

Excellent mtb tour. I wanted to do some cycling while in Prague. A quick Google and look at TripAdvisor found Biko Adventures. They live up to their promise of quick response to email with good English. I worked out the details with Filippo over email. We agreed the Advanced Parks tour would be about right and that the guide could pace it according to my fitness. Filippo provided detailed directions on how to et to the stop, even detailing which tram stations and the type of ticket needed. And then a little map was provided showing how to walk from the tram stop to the shop.On the day everything was just as promised. I needed to buy a few items. It's more tour base than bike shop but they have a well chosen selection of solid basics like Endura shorts and jerseys. I rode a Giant Talon. Solid hire machine. Aluminium,so fairly light. Filippo took the time to tweak my suspension forks too. I did the normal (brakes, skewers, cranks) safety checks and everything else seemed very solid.The tour itself was excellent. Took about 4 hours including time for coffee stop. We had the option to stop for lunch but elected to carry on.Lots of sights and good photo stops. Some of the parks are big and you feel like you are in the middle of nowhere even though you're never that far from civilisation.Lots of history available from Daniel who was an excellent guide.On the site they say the aim is to keep the business small in order to run it well. I think Biko Adventures really lives up to thisOverall would highly recommend.

Amazing experience; can highly recommend it to you!. Made the 2 days advanced mountain bike trip and it was awesome. Had a really good guide who was not too pushy but set a good pace though. First day was pretty physcial, around 60km with lot's of climbing, very cool. Second day was more technical and closer to Prague. The equipment and bikes were super state of the art. I can highly recommend you BIKO, they reacted super individual on my wishes. Had a very good time; thanks a lot guys!

Karlstejn Bike Tour. I took the Karlstejn Easy Bike Group tour. I had a great time. Daniel was our guide and was quite friendly. The bike ride to Karlstejn was beautiful. It is a long ride for a non-experienced rider. It’s doable but I would advise that you are honest about your own abilities because easy is a relative term. I think it’s easy compared to the other tours they offer or it’s easy if you’re an experienced rider. If the group has some less experienced riders, adding a few more “photo breaks” would be a good idea. Filippo was very responsive in his email communication and even gave personalized directions to the bike shop.I was happy to took this tour.

Prague hike. Fantastic time viewing an alternative side to Prague. Toby our guide was friendly chilled and not only informative and professional he was relaxed and tailored the hike to our abilities and requests. We would strongly recommend anyone taking the time to go on a hike with biko if they want to see a different side of Prague.

Highly recommend! Road bike tour. We did the road bike tour (ended up about 49 miles total per our choice). Our guide was fantastic, the views were amazing, and the ride had a nice variety of challenging climbs, downhills, and flats. The guide was very flexible to making the day whatever we wanted in duration, difficulty, stopping, going. He also gave us some good info on the Czech Republic. Would highly recommend.

Great for Bike Hire. Myself and three friends hired bikes from Biko for a few days in June to catch the train the Cesky Krumlov before cycling back to Prague. The guys at Biko were very friendly, helpful and the bikes were decent too. Wouldn't hesitate in recommending them to others who wanted to do the same.

Excellent way to see Prague in a short window. I was in Prague for a weekend solo extending a business trip. Had limited time and wanted to see all that I could so I booked with Biko a 10k early morning run on Saturday morning. Before tourists had left their hotel rooms I had seen the whole city jogging with Marek, heard its history and culture along the way and also got in a nice sweat. Marek met me at my hotel at 7 and off we went. We started in the old center, crossed the Charles Bridge which was really neat since it was empty, climbed some nearby hills through parks with stunning vistas, through the church then the castle then through the Jewish quarter and back. About two hours all in for the 10k jog although we also stopped for pictures and history along the way. Could be done in less time if you really want to push it. We covered every major site recommended in every "weekend I. Prague guide". We covered them to the sunrise. Marek's English skills were great and much better than my Czech so we were able to have a nice conversation while jogging. An awesome way to begin the day and highly recommended.One tip: Prague is packed with tourists during the summer so would highly recommend an early start. I had so much fun on the jog that I booked the Prague Parks Mountain Biking ride the following morning to experience life outside of the old city and also get another great workout in. Filipo and I took the bikes out and covered some serious ground in the nearby parks. I was in a very well maintained Giant hard tail. We chatted about history, culture and current politics between single tracks and up/down efforts. The route covers the less explored part of Prague that I'd bet most locals haven't even experienced. Towards the end of the ride we stopped for a coffee and ping pong match then headed back to Biko's store.Biko is a very professional company -- prompt communication, reliable and well operated. They can customize pretty much anything you're looking to do. I was there merely two days and thanks to Biko, when I boarded my 6am flight back to the US, I truly felt like I came and conquered.

Advanced Mountain bike ride with Radek. Biko adventures is very good with their communication I could easily book a tour. I was asked what my skill level was so that they could make sure that they arranged the correct guide. The tour that I booked for was called the Great Escape. I was greeted by my excellent guide Radek at the bike store who quickly set up the Giant Trance to my liking. A great attention to detail was put into the bike setup like shock and tyre pressure. I was handed a good helmet and gloves. Radek was quick to ask me what I wanted from the ride and he gauged my skill level quickly. Basically I asked for the best riding around Prague and it was not long before we were shredding up the forest trails. We even stopped at a riverside cafe for Pivo (Czech for beer) before continuing back to store some 6 hours later. I highly advise this tour for all levels of riders as the ride can be tapered to your skill level and your wants. Thanks Radek and Biko adventures. I hope we meet again soon. Kind regards, Patrick Alexander

The best way to see the beautiful parks in and around Prague. We don't ride a lot, but like to do so every now and then and so this looked very interesting to us. With so many options on the website we contacted the owner to figure out which tour would be suited to us and settled on the Advanced Prague Parks tour.On the day we were expected to be at the shop at 9 in the morning. The shop was easily found with the directions we got and we were greeted wonderfully by the owner and we quickly got the necessary paperwork done. Then our guide arrived and we got our gear. The bikes were excellent, the helmets comfy and we even got a bottle of water (which our guide kindly refilled during the tour from a bigger bottle he had and we again refilled in a cafe along the route).The tour we choose was perfect and showed us a bunch of beautiful spots we otherwise probably wouldn't have found or visited. Our guide expertly showed the way and stopped in the right places for photos and to give us some information about what we were seeing.After 5 hours in beautiful weather we arrived back at the shop, tired, but immensely satisfied. Thank you Tomáš and good luck with your thesis! If we ever come back to Prague we'll definitely do a different tour with these guys again!

Excellent experience. Good bike. Great staff. Highly recommend.. I had a wonderful experience renting with BIKO and would highly recommend them. My Giant Trance was in good working condition. It had Shimano Deore components, not exactly high end but it shifted and braked well. The staff was the best though. They made sure I took a spare tube, portable inflator, tire tongs, bike lock and helmet. This was extremely handy when I had a flat. Another shop may have left me stranded. I also appreciated not being nick-and-dimed for these items that were included with the rental. I can't praise my guide, Lucie, enough. She was the friendliest, best guide I've ever had on any tour ever. She planned an interesting itinerary that not only included some great trails but an airport with vintage airplanes, an amazing overlook of the city from the mountains, and an animal rescue with owls, deer, and other creatures. I would recommend requesting her by name. You will not be disappointed. Lastly, I would like to praise the shop for how the handled the broken brake. I took a spill and damaged the break lever. I wasn't sure whether or not they'd charge me for damages. They walked the bike over to a repair shop one block away. When the technician said it would be an easy repair, they elected not to charge me anything. I felt this was extremely reasonable and fair. I would like to commend Filippo this. Other bike shops may have gouged their customers for this. It's nice to find honest businessmen like this.

A truly memorable experience!. I took my two kids (9 & 13) on the 35km easy ride. Our guide was Toby. We're not at all experienced riders, so it was tough. The almost constant rain was pretty bad luck. But our guide helped us tremendously. We ended up taking the train for part of the trip and he carried our bikes up and down flights of stairs. The kids loved him. He was fun, kind, and seemed to really want us to have a fantastic experience. I can't recommend this enough! Ask for Toby!

Best day ever!. Had so much fun on this tour! I was a bit apprehensive about going on this Level 3 mountain bike tour as I'm not as skilled as my partner (I have very limited biking experience), however our guide Marek was awesome and he really encouraged me to finish the course and I'm so glad I did, best view ever and the beer in the middle was a great incentive to make it! It was a challenge and physically demanding, but if you are a fit person and like to push yourself in terms of new things, I recommend this, so great to see outside of Prague also. Thanks Marek and Biko!

Excellent & HIGHLY Recommended MTB Touring Company. A colleague and I booked two trips over a weekend, The Great Escape and Beer and MTB Advanced. We had an AWESOME experience and I will definitely be back next summer when I am next in Prague, and will recommend it to anyone.Bikes: I usually ride a 29 hardtail and was a little concerned all they had was 27.5 bikes. But after having experienced the trails and some of the many technical sections I think it was best to have a 27.5 - it is perfectly suited to the area. I found the bikes VERY well maintained, which was refreshing after just renting a crappy bike in Berlin. And they are also of very good quality. I brought my own SPD pedals.Guides: The first guide was Tomas and the second was Lucie. Both were very friendly and knowledgeable about the trails. They adjusted the pace and route as needed as each day unfolded. This was my first guided ride experience and I was very impressed. While I considered loading a GPS route in my bike computer and doing an unguided ride, I felt I would not have enjoyed the ride as much and would have spent a lot of time worrying about navigation rather than just enjoying the ride. And the guides bring knowledge of every twist and turn and side trail which is truly invaluable. They are all well trained and personable and it shows that the owner puts a lot of energy into building a good team.Routes: The different routes are carefully planned and you have lots of choices. I am a regular mountain biker and really was pleased with the routes both days. I probably enjoyed The Great Escape the most, and would rate it one of the most enjoyable rides of my life. The team and Biko is excellent and I HIGHLY recommend them and their guided tours!! I will be back again,

Great adventure in the Czech countryside. We had an awesome time of our hoke with Daniel...he pushed us and motivated us with his "easy is boring" mentality. Cesky Raj was gorgeous and we ended by having lunch in the middle of no where in a pub with his elementary school buddy which was awesome. We really enjoyed being able to see more of the Czech Republic and really appreciated Daniel's enthusiasm. Philippo (the owner) was very welcoming and runs a great alternative if ur looking to expand ur vacation beyond the norm...most definitely recommend using Biko!!!

Great bikes from an enthusiastic and helpful team. highly recommended. Great bikes but additional service made Bike stand out; without asking was provided with map, seat covers, pump, inner tubes, helmets, lock, multi tool, tyre levers and very good suggested route for day's hire to get into some of the peaceful countryside surrounding Prague with my 13 year old son. Fantastic day of pedalling would highly recommend - staff are excellent, very enthusiastic about cycling, efficient at everything but laid back and cheerful with it. The shop is located very close to marked cycle routes so no need to battle the traffic, trams and tramways of the old town and Smichov rail station is close if you fancy pedalling one way and putting your bike on the train to get back.

Soooooo accommodating!. It was perfect! Despite the rain, Filippo and Mark helped guide us and we had an awesome day. We went to the Castle, took a great horse and buggy ride up the mountain, had a tour, then went on a great big boat rode down the river. Even jumped in for a fast swim (very fast because it was COLD!). Definitely recommended!

Excellent service and great mountain biking trails!. We visited Biko adventures for two private tours (advanced Karlstejn castel tour and advanced Mountain biking and beer tour). Both tours where great! Our guide was very professional, relaxed and great company for 5-6 hours tours. Bikes where in good conditioning and everything on tours worked just as promised. Can easily recommend this company!!

Pleasant ride to Karlstejn Castle. It was perfect! We had great weather. The ride along the Vltava river weaved through parks and rollerblade enthusiasts :) it was impressive to see how well the city integrates recreation into the riparian area, supporting an active local lifestyle. We crossed multiple rivers on the way to the castle, stopped for coffee and then had an excellent lunch at the base of the castle. Mark was our guide and he was relaxed and easy to hang out with for hours, the kind of guy you'd like to have over for a beer. Also Fillipo, the owner, runs a top notch business and was also great to interact with. The bikes were mechanically sound (high praise from a member of Colorado's mountain biking community). This was such a good experience! Strongly recommend it - don't miss this part of the Czech Republic!

Easy ride to Karlstejn Castle. A beautiful day ride. Merrick our guide was enjoyable to ride with, shared a wealth of information and went beyond expectations to show us around Prague on bikes afterwords. This reflected his pride in his city and desire to share it with us. He was very flexible about modifying start time due to weather. The route was peaceful and gorgeous.

Trip to Karlstejn castle. 35 km ride along the river, great scenery, friendly knowledgable guide Merek looked after us very well, repaired a puncture in minutes. Ride was mix of quiet roads, cycle paths and easy off road section. Very impressive castle at end, great lunch and well deserved beer. Train ride home. All good

The Big Karlstejn Adventure. We are an active family with 3 teens and thoroughly enjoyed our "Big Karlstejn Adventure" with Filippo in June 2016. We hiked and toured the beautiful countryside surrounding Prague and appreciated Filippo's local insight and knowledge. He is personable, attentive, informative and skilled and runs a top-notch business. Our teens really enjoyed the trip.

Prague-Vienna Advanced Road Bike Holiday. There is no better way to see a country than on a bike and with the guys from Biko Adventures. We just finished the Prague-Vienna Advanced Road Bike Holiday (check their website for the video.) I cannot say enough positive things about the trip and our guides. Each day was an adventure with special sites and surprises all orchestrated by them. The mileage was very manageable with plenty of time for lunches, drinks and some site seeing.

the real deal. In addition to more recreational riding, Biko Prague also caters to serious riders. The guys hooked me up on a customized version of the great escape....covering almost 50 k over 5 hours. Some sections of pavement to connect the dots but after that non stop sections of Prague's finest singletrack. A seamless and professional operation. Thanks guys!

Private Mountain Biking Tour. In a city not well-known for its friendliness towards tourists, BIKO was a standout shop that led me on a great mountain bike tour. They are able to individualize the tours to your desire and the guys at the shop are really nice. Definitely take some time out of your trip to do a tour, it will be rewarding to get away from the city and see some views/get a workout. I'm an avid mountain biker from Colorado and the Great Escape tour was perfect. Highly recommended!

Bike from Prague to karljen Castle . 35km, my kids are 9 & 11, huge ride for them but Super easy and a wonderful experience with a bike company that cares about their riders. Loved it. Even stopped for fresh roadside cherries from the tree.

Great tour of Czech countryside and Karlstejn!. Marek lead us on a superb ride to Karlstejn along the Vltava and Berounka Rivers through poppy fields and beautiful villages. The canopy of trees along the route was spectacular. The route and degree of difficulty was perfect for our easy going desires. Filippio was responsive to our questions and booking along with a friendly reminder the day before the ride. Would highly recommend using Biko if you have a desire desire for a biking adventure during your stay in Prague.

Awesome Shop with Everything You Need. I came to Prague w my spouse who had a conference, so my mornings were free to ride bikes. Biko has everything you need to enjoy the roads or the trails in Prague. The guides are exceptional - and can tell you about the roads/trails as well as well as the history behind what you see. If you are thinking about riding bikes in Prague but feeling a little hesitant, contact "Filippo" at Biko and he will set you up with everything you need! I can't wait to come back!!

Incredible landscape!. For those who love to be outdoors and see a bit of the countryside, then this is for you. We had a nice leisurely walk from the city center to his shop. Filippo was very welcoming and genuinely happy to show us this amazing city on bike. The 20 mile ride to Karlstejn was filled breathtaking scenery. Filippo kept us entertained the whole way. Highly recommend.

What a great day!. We went on the private Karlstejn Castle easy bike tour with Petr. It was a great six hours! The bikes are very comfortable and it was nice to get out of Prague a bit to see the countryside. The castle was neat and we enjoyed it immensely! Petr is a great guide and happy to answer questions and take pictures. It was a great day!

a personalized adevnture in nature. Biko offers a variety of outdoors activities. We chose the cliff trail hike. Our guide (Mark) picked us up from the hotel. He had metro tickets and bottles of water for us as promised. We went to a park in Prague away from the touristic zone. The hike was full of surprises and Mark chose the way according to what we wanted to see and experiment. We got to walk across green fields, climb on rocks, stand on cliffs with great views of the city, walk by a river and even through a cave (that is just naming a few of the surprises)!! It was definitely the highlight of my trip to Prague and a real energy booster... It is a must try activity and a very fun way to spend a day outdoors.As for the Biko team, they are very professional. Filippo replies realy fast to his mails and has clear answers to any question you might have. Mark, our guide, was very friendly and made the walk even more pleasant. He knew exactly when to step it up or slow it down according to our needs and was very careful to safety issues.Do not hesitate for a second to try any of the Biko activities, especially the hike :)

Definitely again. What a fantastic day trip we had.I cant recommend Biko highly enough. Excellent company to deal with, friendly staff. The bikes were great.If you want to do something a little different and see Prague in a different light, do it. We took the easy tour however it was great and we had an excellent guide. Thanks guys.

Fantastic Mountain Biking. These tours are the real deal. We did "The Great Escape" tour and it was exactly what we were looking for, a great deal for the price, and a fantastic experience. The owner, Filipo, was an awesome guide who truly cares about his customers experience and is very passionate about what he does. I went with a friend who was not as experienced as I was and we both still had a great time because the trip was perfectly tailored to accommodate both of our riding abilities. Hope to come back to Prague some day to do another tour.

Český ráj - truly paradise!. Český ráj translates to Bohemian (Czech) Paradise and is an amazing area of protected natural beauty well worth a look- and Biko Adventures is the perfect tour to opt for!!! Our guide, Marek, was brilliant from start to finish and my friend and I had a fantastic day hiking with him in the sandstone wonders Český ráj has to offer.Marek collected us from our Prague apartment and drove us out to the area (entry included in tour) and took us on a complete guided hike through the forest and sandstone features. Although the trails are clearly marked, it was peace of mind to go with someone who knew the area like the back of their hand, and since neither of us drive it was brilliant being chauffeured there too! Marek also tailored the pace to suit us- we are snap happy with the cameras so there was a lot of photo breaks. I was suffering from a heavy head cold and cough so nose blowing stops were also made, plus lots of patience when ascending the many stairs amongst the rock features themselves to make sure we traveled together and no disastrous wrong turns were made, whilst accounting for my breathlessness!The number of photo opportunities were countless and we happily blamed Marek for bringing us to such a picturesque location, which he took really well with a wry grin. His great sense of humor, good conversation and general personablity made the tour really fun and enjoyable. We felt looked after, safe and well informed about the local area, the city of Prague and Czech Republic in general under the unintrusive and easy conversation with him, as we wound our way through vast and tall rocky outcrops and forested gullies.We had a snack at the forest lodge before tackling the more challenging part of the hike which was more and steeper stairs up and down through the rock formations but the views and narrow gaps are well worth it- and of course the great photo opportunities too! Marek then drove us to a local town for a Czech lunch and past a couple of castles (more photo opportunities) before heading back into the city.For a break from the delights of Prague itself, and getting out to see some natural wonders, I highly recommend a hike in Český ráj with Biko - well worth the time, the reasonable cost and making a new friend!Thanks again Biko and Marek for a fantastic day out!

Bike trip was a highlight of our Prague trip!. We just completed a fantastic day trip with Biko Adventures last week. We chose the “Mountain Bike and Beer Easy” tour because my wife is not a cyclist and I like beer! From our first interaction via email with the owner, Flippo, to the moment we left his shop at the end of our day everything was wonderful!We were greeted like we were friends, not just customers. The weather was rainy and cold the day of our trip but Flippo made sure we had proper clothing for the conditions (providing us with several jackets to choose from) and went to the trouble of putting extra fenders on the bikes to help prevent the dirty spray off the tires from hitting us. The route was mostly flat with lots of variety, cycling through the city, parks, forests and a small village near the edge of the city. The beer and food at the brewery, our end point, definitely did not disappoint! The option to ride the train back most of the way provides lots of flexibility for riders of all abilities. Our guide, Tomas, was entertaining, relaxed and knowledgeable about both the city and biking. He encouraged us to stop whenever we wanted to rest or take pictures.Don’t visit Prague without going on one of Biko’s tours!

We booked two tours with Biko. We were a little scared about the bike tour because of the distance (35 km) but our guides made it so enjoyable and we even stopped for snack in a little tour in our way, this tour is for everybody, don’t be scared. We were so happy after the bike tour that we booked a second hiking tour around Prague. If you enjoy nature and tourists and crowds drives you crazy, Biko has a tour for you. They offer a different way to enjoy Prague and their surroundings.

Great outing!. Lets get one thing straight the MTB Tour and Brews is not a classic off road bike adventure, which is what I was ready for. But I was not disappointed! The ride was mostly on paved bike trails ~ 75% with some riding on dirt in some of the parks ~20% with a small amount of more difficult MTB terrain ~5%. BUt I was not disappointed one bit. I actually think I saw more of Prague and the surrounding area than I would have otherwise, and this is what I really enjoyed. Ask for Tomasz, he was a great guide.

Couldn't be better!. Filippo and his team were amazing. We told them what we were interested in and they catered a fantastic day for us. The skill level choices were perfect and we saw a great mix of mountain trails and site seeing with some hidden river trails. If you're an mtb enthusiast, don't visit Prague without seeing these guys.

An unplanned surprise!. Thanks to the advise by trip advisor, I was being directed to Biko Adventures. I was just planning to have a little bit sight-seeing in downtown Prague. But then the description of their MTB tours aroused my interest. I joined the Level 1 or 2 "Blocks and Parks" since 3.5 hours is more than enough for me. It is good to check out the other side of Prague, instead of just the overcrowded Old Town. My guide Marek was very patience, showing me around the more "down to earth" part of Prague. Be prepared to wear proper riding outfit especially during winter time. You also need to have enough energy to going uphills and down, through the woods and the mud ( for my case as it was raining the day I ride). I really got a very good and unplanned experience in Prague, thanks to Biko Adventures :)

Family Adventure with Biko. We, my 3 sons and I, went to Prague during the month of Nov.2015 and booked an outdoor hiking trip to The Czech Paradise with Biko. The experience was fantastic and unforgettable. The place is truly magical. Our guide Marek was a very safe driver and a fun, courteous, respectful and knowledgeable tour guide. We had a blast. After 4-5 hours hiking, Marek took us to this lovely picturesque town called, Sobotka (I hope I spelled it right) for lunch. The food was delicious and the price even better. We can't wait to repeat this outdoor trip when we go back to Prague.Thanks to Biko AND Marek for showing us the outdoor beauty of the Czech Republic and the nice people that live in this country.

Great ride!. I was on a business trip and I was spending a weekend in Prague. I contacted them, made a reservation. I came to the shop, bringing only my bike shoes. They took care of the rest. I rode 80km with Marek to the Karlstejn Castle. It was very pleasant. I strongly recommend.

Super tours!!!. We were in Prague in August and took tours with Biko. First day, they set my wife and I up on a couple nice road bikes. We rode out to Karlstejn Castle, stopped for lunch on the way back and had such a good day, we scheduled a Mtn Bike ride for 2 days later. The Mtn bike tur was even better than the road tour. Great views of the city and the countryside and the trails. Prague is a MTB paradise. This is a "must do" in Prague. Oh yeah, the little bar across from the shop has great beer and food too.

Incredible Experience on the Karstejn Advanced MTB Tour!. I had an amazing time biking with Filippo, the owner of Biko, today. I did the Karlstejn Advanced Mountain Biking tour and found it just the right amount of challenging. Filippo tailors the tour to suite the ability of the rider, skipping more difficult parts or adding them in. Everything about the tour is personalized and shows how much Filippo cares about giving his customer a fantastic experience - he's a real professional. In addition to picking out fun trails to a cool castle, he stops for lunch at a really good Czech restaurant near the castle, which has a very homey feel. Really, everything about the tour was great, and Filippo is a cool dude on top of it all. Go here!

Jakub is the man!. First of all, let me just say- if you're going to do a bike tour in Prague- this is the one!My wife and I booked a tour with Biko adventures and had an outstandingly good time! From the first time we went to the shop to dropping the bikes off, Jakub and the guys made sure me and my wife had all the means to make us happy!Jakub was an informative and conscious guide, always finding the perfect balance to be on hand with information about the sights we saw, whilst being sure to give the lovebirds some time alone. We rode at a good pace, not too fast or slow, and Jakub was really helpful in suggestions other routes after I told him of my fear of heights and bridges.We ate lunch at a quaint (and filling) pub on the path to Karljstein Castle. The food was delicious and the locals clearly thought very highly of Jakub and the guys at Biko. We got the train back after seeing the castle and dropped the bikes back to the shop after a really special day with a great guide.See you some day guys!Thanks again,Idika & Arielle (from London!)

Highly recommended!. We had a great day biking to Karlstejn castle! It was about 30km and we took the train back to prague. I would highly recommend this trip to anyone. The biking was flat and you can go at your own pace.

Bohemian Paradise Hike. We booked Biko Adventures for the hike to Cesky Raj and we will do it again, if given a chance. The Bohemian Paradise is beautiful and serene. Biko Adventures made our hike to Cesky Raj really memorable. And if you are doing the hike, avail of their "Treat Package". The photos our guide, Marek, took during the hike were all wonderful, which will forever remind us of the beautiful Cesky Raj.

Great to get into the countryside on a bike. We really enjoyed our Prague Parks Easy tour. The communication was great ahead of the trip - the van wasn't available so we were given the choice of moving days or cycling up to the castle. It was an energetic start to a ride through a lot of areas you wouldn't normally get to see and made a nice change to the crowds in the usual tourist areas.If you haven't cycled in a while you might find it a bit hard going but weekend cyclists would be fine. There are plenty of stops if needed and we went back to one of the parks the next day for beers.The guide was great, the bikes were all in good condition and well maintained with gel saddles.

Karlstjen Castle. Me and my wife choose this trip to get out from city center of prague and explore Czech Republic.Its a 3 hours riding to get to the castle, the road is so amazing that you just have to take pictures all the time. Our guide was Jakub he is a awesome guy and guide. We enjoy every moment on this trip. Thank you Biko Adventures!!!

Awesome day on the trails. Signed up for the Great Escape tour and that's exactly what it was. Super fun trails, super fun company and challenging enough to leave me tired and happy. Absolutely first rate operation. Great coffee and cool t-shirts too!

Outstanding friendly service. We have just returned from our second visit to Prague. We decided to hire bikes and do alternative sightseeing away from the city as we had already done all the touristy thing on our first visit so wanted to explore outside the city. We googled bike shops in Prague and Biko came up. We visited the shop and even though the shutters were down a very polite young man postponed his lunch and assisted us with information on hiring bikes. We returned the next day and hired a couple of bikes. Nothing was to much trouble, we were given information on what to visit along with a map to help us find places. They even had a couple of gel seat pads to help with saddle soreness. We returned after a full days cycling and the service on our return was agin exceptional. We would like to say a BIG thank you to Filipo and your team of staff you defiantly know what you are doing and doing it very well.

An urban hike. When you get tired of the big city, but don't want to go too far, try the urban hike with Biko. It was a gorgeous day. A quick metro ride and up into the hills outside Prague we went. Phillipo was so knowledgeable and kind. We hiked up and down and all around. The views of the city and the river were quite special. The quiet and fresh air were a nice break from the usual city grind. And we were back in the city for lunch! Do it, you won't regret it.

Get off the beaten track of Prague. My friend and I had the best time mountain biking around the outskirts of Prague. It was wonderful to get away from the busy tourist areas. We rode through beautiful parks, forests and trails though the mountains. I doubt many tourists get the chance to see that side of Prague. Our guide Tomas was brilliant and was a lot of fun. The tour went for 4.5 hrs and was good value for money.I highly recommend this trip. I wish we had time to do the brewery ride as well!

Parks tour = outstanding . We went on the park tour it was absolutely beautiful. We had Thomas as a guide and he was very informative and put up lots of questions. Getting out of the busy city was so refreshing and was a delight to see the real Prague. 5 stars for this company, they went above and beyond.

Awesome hike!!. My friend and I took the shorter urban hike and loved it. It rained part of the way into the tour and kept on raining but we had a great time. The hike took us through a pretty suburban park, into orchards and through pastures. We walked up a small hill and then a short very steep climb and walk along the top of the small mountain/hill to an overlook of the city. Given the weather, we were not afforded spectacular views, but they were amazing none the less. I think the hike was about 6 miles total and we ended up in another neighborhood near their office. We had a great local lunch nearby and then made our way back home. Marek was a great guide! He was knowledgeable, friendly and accommodated my recovering sprained ankle. I would definitely recommend this company and would love to do other tours with them if I go back to Prague!

Great experience in Prague. Did the advanced mountain bike & beer, cliff top, & Cesky Raj tours. Tomas, Mark, & Marek were all great. Highly recommended way to get off the beaten path & see the best of the Czech Republic. Rob & Nate September 2015

Mounain biking and beer - these are two of my favourite things!. We selected the easy tour from Biko's shop to the brewery and back. We had very good bikes (Giant) and our friendly guide Daniel took us on a very nice tour lasting just over 6 hours including a leisurely lunch at the brewery. We enjoyed discovering the tranquility that Prague's parks and the Vltava river offer just a few kilometers from the throngs of tourists in the centre. We highly recommend this tour to anyone who can ride a bike and enjoys local beer and good company.Our only suggestion for further improvement would be to offer an intermediate level MTB + brewery ride: the 28km ride was easy (but relaxing and very enjoyable) but the 46km sounded too hard.

A great day out with Beer & a great guide. Me and my father had a great day out with Marek - he was very adaptable and a great guy to hang out with. I am sure that next time I go back to Prague I will take a more challenging tour as this one was quite easy and I look forward to being guided by Marek again! Highly recommended.
MTB and beer adanced. I done the MTB & beer tour with Marek. It was an excellent choice and the food stop was lovely. The cycle was challenging and the views were really good too. Would recommend.

Road bike cycling tour in Prague. Just returned back from a cycling tour in Prague with a friend of mine. BIKO adventures organised this tour for us based on our request to ride 100Kms + per day for 2 days. The routes selected were based on our abilities. We chose BIKO Adventures as recommended to us by another friend of mine who used their services before.As it was just a 3 day getaway, we chose to rent out the road bikes from BIKO rather than travel with our own bikes. This proved to be a sensible decision as the bikes we rented were good bikes and very well maintained. We did not have to worry about what tyres to use or what gearing/cassette do we need for the ride. The bikes were kitted accordingly and also at the right price.We met with Filippo, the owner and Marek, our tour guide. Two great individuals who ascertained that our tour will be a positive one. The weather was beautiful and the carefully chosen routes by Marek were simply awesome, with lovely scenery, historic monuments and castles, monasteries etc. Marek constantly provided us with historic facts and also information about the towns we passed through. The pace ridden by out tour guide was in line with our ability and he was very accommodating with our wishes.Will I recommend BIKO Adventures - definitely. The product they offer is good and at the right price. I actually plan to do a ski adventure together with my family through BIKO and also am considering the Prague to Vienna tour with a couple of friends, again using BIKO's services.
Good bikes and service. The bike that I rented was in good condition, the price charged for the bike was well worth it. They provided me with a all the neccesary equipment and a map.

Czech PARADISE. We had a tour of the Czech paradise route and it was absolutely amazing. I wish I could remember our tour guides name. He was great to hang out with for the day and taught my friend so much about the culture in the Czech Republic as well as life in Prague. Very cool guy and amazing hike! One of the most beautiful places I've ever been. Pictures don't do it justice. A must do in Prague if you are into nature/hiking!

biking through Prague.... An amazing way to see Prague from high above to the city streets...❤️'d the green spaces & seeing life from many vantage points! So glad our friends recommended Fillipo's biz & Mark was awesome!

Great Way to See Prague Beyond the Usual. We enjoyed a 5 hour bike tour through parks and vistas, over bridges and parts of the main city, with sites and experiences you just can't get any other way. Superbly led by Mark and set up by Fillipo and Thomas with solid equipment. Don't miss out on a bike tour with Biko if you are in Prague.

Awesome bike tour to Karlsteyn Castle!. Had the best tour with Biko! Equipment was great and the staff very friendly and knowledgeable. Tomas, our most excellent tour guide, took us on a great single-track MTB ride from Prague to Karlsteyn. Amazing views and a fun ride! Lunch was delicious and the castle itself was fascinating to see. All in all a great honeymoon experience!!

These guys know how to give you an adventure. We signed up for a private tour through a travel agent and didn't communicate what we were looking for very well. Our guide Tomas listened to what we were interested in and made it a fantastic day - even better than we hoped. Get a private tour and arrange in advance what your interests and limitations are. They want to work with you and you will have a great adventure.
Biking to Karlstein. We very enjoyed the trip to Karlstein castle with Mark. The way was very nice and although a bit long(~35 km) but suitable even for children from 10 years old.

Fun ride that gets you out of the city and visit a Castle.. We did the easy tour to Karlstejn Castle. The tour guides were great - Mark and Phillipo. It's not a hard ride but its about 36km mostly flat. Would highly recommend Biko Adventures. The Castle was spectacular from the outside and the lunch was great at a local restaurant. You catch the train back to Prague.

Most memorable experience of our trip. Would definitely recommend to active individuals or those who enjoy cycling. We would not have realised how beautiful the surrounding countryside if it wasn't for this trip and it was the highlight of our trip. Would be the first thing I'd book again if I return to Prague.

Singltrek pod Smrkem. A return to visit to Prague and a chance to go outdoors with Biko again. I’ve had many trips with Biko and Filippo and yet again this turned out to be the highlight of my trip to Prague. Blessed with glorious weather we met at the shop, close to Vycherad, it’s easy to find and get to from anywhere in Prague, either on foot or nearby tram and metro stops.We set off, bikes strapped to the roof and headed north toward the Polish border. A stop on the way to refresh with good coffee from the Agip filling station (great coffee believe it or not!). We arrived at our destination less than 2 hours after setting off. The base station has a good range of facilities and even though it was the weekend it wasn’t too busy. We set off and experienced some wonderful flow trail and single-track, wonderful scenery and exciting trails in a beautiful part of the countryside. Ability as judged perfectly by Filippo and we spent a good four or five hours of stimulating and magical riding. Plenty of places to stop off en-route for refreshment and food. The trails are very well designed and safe, but still gives the rider the chance to experience speed and excitement. Well worth the journey.As I have come to expect from Biko the service and organisation is world class, I genuinely believe you would be hard pushed to find better elsewhere. Check out the shop for some brilliant memorabilia from t-shirts to mugs cycling gear, all reasonably priced. The reviews on TripAdvisor speak from themselves. If you want a brilliant outdoor activity, with personal service, great bikes to ride, well designed and crafted routes then look no further. And as for a Filippo, you’re a legend, keep up the amazing work and see you in December when I’m back!

Easy tour to Karlstejn. We took a private tour to Karlstejn - totally worth it as it wasn't that much more money and our guide Daniel went at our pace and stopped when we wanted to. The Giant bikes were very comfortable. Roads were flat except two on ramps to bridges. There were multiple road types: paved, dirt, metal, rock and sand. I hate off road biking but it wasn't too much. We stopped after 11 miles at a cafe for a snack. Great gelato. The hardest part of the trip was walking the bike up the hill to the castle! Our guide waited for us while we did the 50 minute castle tour then came back to the bottom of the hill for lunch. Took the train back to Prague - was about 35 minutes. We got a flat tire on the way and the guide fixed it immediately. Great time had!
Great Escape. Fun day exploring MTB near Prague. Tomas lead us to forests and nice hills near urban areas. Nice way to explore this beautiful city beyond tourist attractions.

GREAT..... Escape. From the booking to the tour and post tour the staff were awesome.My tour guide Tomas was great, with a constant smile and encouragement I cannot fault.I will be recommending this tour operator to my friends travelling spin to Prague. NPerfect great escape. A challenging ride but a perfect last day in Prague...Thanks all.

Great MTB tour to the old brewery. The owners/guides went out of their way to make everyone in the group (8 people) feel comfortable before, during and after the excursion. It was nice to leave the city and head outdoors! Safe, fun trip that everyone can do, with a nice meal and beer awaiting! In general, a great experience.

MBT and Beer Easy Group Tour. My boyfriend and I had a great time on this tour. It was our favorite Prague experience. We loved being able to get out of the main parts of town to see the beautiful outskirts of Prague. Our tour guide, Marek, was excellent! He is an experienced cyclist and knows a lot about Prague. I do not have a lot of cycling experience but he made it easy for me. The brewery was also great! Definitely do this tour!

Great place to get out and check out Prague on 2 wheels. While in Prague the itch to hit the trails called my husband. He did some research and ended up at Biko's. And he is making me write this review because they had excellent customer service and knew what they were doing. He was able to find the trails they directed him too (he even found a few beer stops along the way). The trails were fantastic and the riding was great. Thanks Biko from my happy husband who got his mountain bike fix while in Prague!

Outstanding organization and ride. My husband and I booked the ride to Karlstejn Castle and had a fantastic time. Everything was ready for us when we arrived. The bikes are excellent and they even have extra padding on the seats. There were six of us in total and our guide, Tomas, managed the pace perfectly for all of us. He stopped several times to point out some history or landscape along the way. We stopped along the river to swim or wade as we saw fit. We stopped to pick apples. We had a wonderful, leisurely lunch and then a look around the castle. Tomas expertly loaded our bikes on the train and then off at the station in Prague. He was so easy going, doing whatever the group wanted to do. Time was not an issue. Our group got along wonderfully and we had great conversation. It was a perfect day, thanks to Biko. They can also arrange other types of tours for individual preferences. Don't go anywhere else.

Nothing short of five stars!. I'll be short and to the point.... this was a last minute trip. I called the night before and poof...the next AM I'm on The Great Escape. The team at Biko personifies the MTB culture! My ride was phenomenal... an amazing mix of Prague's neighborhoods, dirt roads, and fast single track. Note: this is a 50km ride in a city surrounded by woods...you will do some bike paths and minor street riding. This is actually why I liked it the best. It took me to areas I'd otherwise never see. I not only got the chance to kill some epic trails but also got to see Prague's way of life. This is a sporty, fun, beer loving city if I'd ever seen one! Not only will I be back to Prague.... my first stop will be at Biko!

Epic bike ride!!. GREAT ADVENTURE. Wanted to get a serious ride in during my visit to Praha and picked Biko based on their web-site and description of the ride to Karlstejn. It's an easy store to find, and I went a couple of days early to reserve my bike and talk with Filippo. Everything was as promised on the day I came by - good bike, and all the accessories I needed. The only thing to improve is the map for solo riders - not a cue sheet but an automobile road map. So off I went - directions to get out of town were flawless so I didn't start making wrong turns for a bit. But with the map and my GPS I always knew about where I was. And saw some sites I would've missed otherwise. Ended up doing about 100kms on a nine hour adventure that included narrow dirt hiking paths, small towns, dehydration, the Amerika quarry, Karlstejn and a sprint back to town to make store closing. I wouldn't have done it any other way but if you're not that adventurous, I'd recommend a guide, or renting one of their GPS'. Filippo and his wife were great at the store getting me set up and taking care of me at the end. I'd use them again if I ever get back and would recommend Biko to anyone.

These are the ones!. My girlfriend Ellie and I went on the Blocks and Parks tour with Filippo. We had the most amazing day in Prague!!! The service is absolutely excellent (Filippo felt like a friend), and the 3.5 hour tour was just right for us. We couldn't recommend this company any higher!

Look No Further. If you want to get out of the hustle of the city and you're looking for something a bit active, please go no further than Biko. I enjoyed a wonderful ride on a blistering hot day but because we set off early we were already at Karstejn by lunchtime and before the weather was too hot. And being on the bike meant we were moving and got a cooling breeze.Really, these guys were great from the fab response to the email booking request, to the instructions on how to get there, to the quality of the bike and uppermost, the guide. In my case this was Mark who was assisted by 'in training' Brian. And there were just two of us on the tour which was even better.A great trip and one I'll remember. The castle was great but the ride was superb - almost flat the whole way and tailored to suit.Thanks guys

Road bike route to Karlštejn. My husband and I took a private road bike tour to Karlštejn. My husband is an advanced road biker and I am very new to the sport, but somehow the trip was great for both of us! Our guide, Marek, was friendly, insightful, and accommodating in setting a mutually agreeable pace. Even the easiest road bike route had a few big hills during which I had to take many breaks. For those less inclined to a physical challenge perhaps the hybrid bike route on the bike paths would be better, but the views and variety of the road bike route were marvelous.

Relaxing day biking to Castle Karlštejn. Our guide was very nice, and set a very relaxing pace for a three hour ride out to the castle. He pointed out the highlights and chatted happily with us as we rode along. He also had good recommendations on what to do at the castle. Then we had a nice train ride back into Prague.
