Leisure bike trip to Karjlsten Castle. Wow! This was a highlight for me of our weeklong trip to Prague. My husband and I traveled with our kids ages 11 and 14. This is an absolutely beautiful ride through Czech countryside to a medieval castle. The ride follows several rivers and is mostly flat. We crossed the rivers many times on a variety of pretty bridges. Our first stop was a cafe with delicious pastries. Then we stopped by one of the rivers for a dip. Daniel, our guide, then brought us to Karjlsten for lunch and a walk up to the castle. Daniel was funny and patient and I always felt that the ride was safe for me and my kids. Biko was extremely professional. I highly recommend this trip!

Fantastic mountain bike tour. I genuinely thought I could find the trails solo, but don't bother, when Biko can guide you to the best trails for a very reasonable price. Honza and Fillipo arranged a brilliant tour called 'The Great Escape', and it really was,an escape from the bustle of central Prague, through stunning Czech country side and some pristine single track through virgin broadleaf Forrest. Including some not normally seen back suburbs of communist Prague. This ride definitely sits inside the top ten rides I have done, and I can't speak highly enough of the service and equipment provided through Biko. They hired me a Giant Xtc 27.5, with rebas and Deore, good enough for a decent thrash. As I led in, the course involved a lot of twists and turns and would've taken an eternity if I was trying to find it via maps. Especially with my non existant Czech. Over all this tour was my highlight of Prague, much to my wife's behest.

Just awesome!. Rented a bike for a solo ride to Kerlstejn Castle, apprx. 80km. What an amazing trip! Staff was absolutely fantastic! Provided all the necessary equipment and even a map with a highlighted route. A few small self guided detours along the way, but a great adventure.

Wonderful tour. My family and I did the hiking tour through Cesky Raj. Beautiful, strenous hike. Lots of stairs though the sandstone.Would highly recomend for active people looking to get out of the city.

Enjoyed a wonderful 80km road bike tour. My husband and I are 49 and 51 and active triathletes. Biko was near our hotel and I discovered them online a month before our trip. We booked the private Karlstein tour. We had a wonderful time riding through the rolling countryside with only three climbs. Marek was our guide and did a very nice job keeping a pace we were comfortable with, since it was our first ride of the year. We ate at a popular outdoor cafe below Karlstein castle. A great day that we will remember!
Great place to rent a bike. This is an awesome place, the guys in the shop are super friendly, helpful and welcoming, and if you love riding, the countryside around Prague is spectacular!

Best Cycle EVER. My wife and I did the road cycle Tour to Karlštejn Castle and it was incredible! Fillipo, is fantastic at communication and even helped find specialized clips for our shoes before we arrived. Marko, was out guide and he was personable, friendly, helpful and most of all professional. The team at Biko is the best and I would cycle with them again in a heartbeat! If you enjoy cycling and want to get out of Prague for a half-day this is the way to do it!!

Hassle-free beautiful day hike 90 minutes outside of Prague in Cesky Raj. Biko Adventures runs a great operation! Our group booked a day hike in Cesky Raj, or "Bohemian Paradise", and as we were a private group, instead of meeting at their shop, we were picked up right at 8 am from our apartment by Marek and Radek, our knowledgeable and very friendly guides. We were driven about 90 minutes out of the city, and had a wonderful 4 hour hike through grottoes of sandstone rock formations, magical moss and fern gardens. There were plenty of opportunities for photo-ops, and enough up and down to give us all a good workout. We had a late lunch in a local restaurant before returning to Prague by about 4 pm. The 2000 CZK (about 80$) per person included the round trip, guides, and park entry fees (lunch not included, but inexpensive and tasty). Cesky Raj has multiple paths, and it was great to have guides to keep us from getting lost, as well as providing lots of information about the area and the Czech Republic in general. Super easy going day, stunning scenery, and a lovely way to explore the countryside outside of Prague. Highly recommend the experience and Biko!

Wonderful day with a wonderful guide!. Karlstej Castle ride with Marek was lovely. Marek is knowledgeable and it was a joy to spend the day on a low-key bike ride with him. My friend and I wanted an easy ride for a few hours and we really had a great time- even though the sun did not come out! Marek gets my highest recommendation and Fillippo and Betty,who I met in the shop are kind and generous as well. This is a wonderful way to shake jetlag and step outside the city!

four fabulous days with Filippo. My 14 year old and I spent 4 days exploring the Czech Republic with Filippo in December 2013. We corresponded beforehand from Sydney and F met up with us when we arrived in Prague to chat, get to know us a little & recommend the trips we'd most enjoy. He suggested we hike, xc ski and moutain bike - all perfect suggestions. This meeting felt like meeting up with a friend who was going to show you around their town, rather than meeting a travel operator. F drove us to Czech Paradise - he's a really safe and steady driver so it was a very relaxing trip. The hikes were spectacular - misty, crisp air, mossy crevices, bare forests - so different to our Australian bush, ... and almost as beautiful! The XC ski-ing was so much fun. F organised all the gear and then took us on a circuit that was a sufficient challenge for the fit 14yo and didn't knock middle aged mother out! Perfect. Filippo was a great ski instructor. We then had a day in the mountains on our own and F and his team kindly sorted our bus tix etc back to Prague. Finally the mtb trip to Karlstej which the 14yo mountain biker loved. Wonderful ride along the river, over bridges, thru little villages. In K, while I toured the Castle and the streets of K, F taught the 14yo mtb drills on the gutters on the streets of K! Everyone was a winner. Just today my son said - I'd love to go back and see Filippo - which prompted me to write this long overdue thank you. Thank you Filippo - the new shop looks amazing.

Best road ride ever. Me and my wife went for a tour of 70 km road cycling to Karlstej Castle with the one and only guide - Mark. The bikes were in good shape , the views were breath taking, the ride was challenging but managable even with some spring showers. But more than anything our guide was amazing: halpfull, knowlegable, safegurding us and above all funny and nice to be with. We really had great time. Wating for the next chance to ride even longer trips.Inbal and anat

5 Day Tour. I was in Prague from Sun to Sat and Filippo had a great ride for me every day. Each day was unique and it was such a great way to see the city. They really know how to link up all the green sections and keep the road riding to a minimum. I rented a 27.5 Giant Trance which I was very happy with and I think I'm going to have to trade in my 26er now. It really was nice to be riding modern geometry equipment and not 5 year old technology. BTW, we did 175 miles in 5 days, so these guys are no joke. KUDOS to Filippo!!!!

Advanced mtb tour to Karlstejn castle. Great adventure!!!!A bit worried at the beginning to have choosen the advanced tour (around 40 km with a lot of off road), but thanks to our guide Marek, myself and my son, made it to Karlstejn castle, going through single path trails, woods, nice villages, excellent!

Exhilarating MTB trip through the forests nearby Prague. I was really looking forward to my weekend in Prague and although I was there for business, I had some free time to spent. I had heard about mountainbiking in the area of Prague and decided I wanted to rent a mountainbike and do some exploring in the countryside. I quickly found Biko Adventures via google and emailed them my intentions. The answer came within a few minutes from Filippo, the owner, and we struck up a conversation by email. After exchanging a couple of emails with ideas flowing back and forth, I decided to book the Advanced MTB Karlstejn Castle Off-Road Extended tour. It consists of an approximate 65 km of climbing, singletracks and dirt-roads with real cool technical sections in between, and all this through the beautiful countryside outside of Prague.I changed my original plan of renting a bike and go out there alone, after advice from Filippo. He suggested a guide because a lot of trails are kinda hard to find if you're not familiar with the surroundings and luckily for myself I listened to the advice. My guide Marek, a really friendly local guy with extensive MTB experience gave me one of the coolest biking experiences I've had since a long time. During some parts my adrenalin level really went through the roof. Conclusion: Excellent equipment (high level Giant MTB hardtail), excellent guide (cool local MTB guru), excellent route (handpicked trails and routes) and excellent support (great advice and fast emailcontact)Next time I'm in Prague I'll definitely visit again!

Excellent day out from Prague. I highly recommend this company. We took a daytrip to Karlstejn Castle with Marek as our guide. Easy to book (via website) and extremely responsive and helpful with details on how to get there and what is involved. We were well equipped and well looked after on the 35km trip along the river. A beautiful excursion and well worth the effort.

Sensational Day at Karlstejn!. Hubby and I did the Road to Karlstejn with Bety today! Absolutely fantastic! Beautiful scenery and great company, so much so that we didn't realise we'd ridden 35km! The tour has definitely been the highlight of our trip! A wonderful way to see a different element of the Czech Republic outside the business of Prague! The Biko team are enthusiastic, welcoming and put a lot of pride and effort into what they do! Bety was fantastic, very professional and by the end of the day we felt like we were hanging out with a friend rather than a tour guide, and Filippo greeted us with a warm welcome when we returned! A must-do!!! :)

Breathtaking (literally) hike through Czech Paradise with an Outstanding Guide. I had the most amazing hike in the Czech Paradise with Marek!From the start, Filippo, the store owner, provided personal attention as he addressed all my questions through email.On the day of the tour, I met Marek at the shop who was the best guide I have ever had in touring 8 different countries around the world. Since I was the only one on the tour and being a little shy with strangers, I was a little worried that there would be lengthy periods of awkward silence. However, Marek's friendly and open nature quickly made me feel comfortable. He told me about the Czech Republic, other places to see and do, and made conversation about other things, making our 8km hike through the majestic Czech Paradise pass quickly.The Czech Paradise is truly an incredible place to visit. The best way I can describe it is like walking onto the set of Lord of the Rings as we wandered through the sandstone pillars and cliffs and through pine forests. The surrounding houses are also picturesque with older homes and bright green fields, which reminded me of movies from an earlier time in Europe. This hike is definitely challenging at some points since there are many stairs, but the views are absolutely worth it! I found Marek's pace to be comfortable (he might have slowed his natural pace to match mine), so I never felt rushed though I was breathing hard taking some of the stairs that seemed to never end. It was like a playground for adults as we wove around the giant rocks and he challenged me to squeeze through an optional passageway. I had taken my camera and took dozens of photos, which he patiently waited for me to finish before moving on and even offered to take some photos of me (despite the fact that the shop sells an Action Photo Reportage package for an additional 200CZK= $8USD).Following our hike, Marek took me to a restaurant in Jicin where he recommended a traditional Bohemian meal for me, which was delicious and extremely inexpensive. I only paid 150CZK= $6USD for a meal with a soda. Then it was back to Prague.The shop required a small deposit (250CZK=$10USD for my tour) to make the reservation with the remainder of the payment due on the day of the tour. The website states that they will accept Euro at their in-house exchange rate of 1€=26 CZK, but Marek went to the additional trouble of bringing me downtown to an exchange office (EXCHANGE s.r.o. Address: Kaprova 14/13 110 00) with better rates and no commission fees.When we arrived back to the shop, Marek's passion for outdoor sports continued to shine through as he provided me a map and highlighted nice places to go for a run or swim.This hike is not to be missed and the personal attention of Biko Adventures Prague has raised my expectations of customer service. Highly recommend!Additional Tips:-Wear comfortable foot wear with non-slip soles. The hike goes through forest and sandstone surfaces where there are some slippery areas.-A Camelbak is handy, but I found the bottle of water that the shop provided me adequate for the cool weather I had.-Eat a good breakfast; bring a snack. We were walking at a moderate pace and still did not get to the restaurant until about 1300.-Bring a rain jacket (the shop also has some). I came in March and in the time we were hiking, we experienced light rain shower, sun, and snow!-Pack minimally. The ups and downs will make your pack heavier as the time wears on. Plus it makes it harder to fit through some of the narrower parts.

A wonderful mix of physical fitness and exploration of an incredible city.. It's difficult to know where to begin my review, because it really starts well over month prior to departing home for Praha. I must have sent of a dozen questions about location, equipment, tours and logistics. Even with an eight hour time difference, my questions were always answered almost immediately! Upon arrival in Europe the first email that popped up on my phone was a warm welcoming wish from Filippo asking if my trip was good along with an enthusiastic "see you at 9 tomorrow for our first ride."I rode three guided mountain bike tours with Filippo, Petr, and Marek doing somewhere around 100 miles and 6000' of climb total. Each one-on-one trip to a different location was loaded with information about the history of the city and included a stop at a small out-of-the-way gem of pub or brewery I never would have found as a tourist. I'm not the best MTB rider, but each of the staff members knew exactly how to push me to improve my skills while keeping me safe and ensuring I had an excellent experience. They were all skilled riders who struck a nice balance between 'challenging and encouraging' throughout the more technical parts of the rides. Each ride started, finished and ran exactly as represented.I debated bringing my own bike for the rides and I'm glad I didn't. The shop offered very well maintained and current model Giant bikes. I rode three different bikes, each being set for the type of terrain I would experience that day. I know it's not typical, but I was the first to ride one of their new full suspension bikes-- It was a much easier experience than hauling my bike and paying baggage fees. Plus I was able to blame my shortcomings on not having my own bike!! There were absolutely no equipment issues at all.My last tour was a hike to the Bohemian Paradise or Cesky Raj with Marek. While you certainly could do this trip alone-- don't! The shop provided round trip transportation to the park from my hotel and 6 hours of one-on-one time with a local guide who not only has traveled Europe but knows the city of Prague from childhood through adulthood.While you might think you're simply buying tours or time on a bike or trail that's only the tip of the iceberg. What you're really getting is a caring family owned small business that will take the time to recommend restaurants, pubs, things to do and see (or avoid) and facilitators that will educate you about their home country and city. Each staff member is carefully selected and understands that customer service and an exceptional customer experience is the primary thing that matters.I traveled to Prague because of the positive things I'd heard about its beauty, history and culture. I left Prague feeling incredibly lucky to have found Biko on the web, centering my Prague experience around cycling with this caring, youthful, energetic, fit group of individuals. Let's face it-- burning all those calories while taking in the incredible sites preps a guy well to drink lots of pilsner, eat like a Czech and sleep like a baby. Thanks guys-- you all made my experience one I'll never forget!

Awesome mountain biking in Prague. I did two rides with Filippo as my guide. The Wild river ride and the castle Karestejn ride. Both were excellent. The trails fast and rolling, interspersed with small villages and scenic farming countryside. The bike was excellent quality. Filippo was an amazing guide - highly knowledgeable of the areas and also an excellent rider. If you a rider I highly recommend going on a Biko guided tour (without a guide you will spend all your time looking at maps trying to figure out where to go) A great getaway from the city, a chance to see the countryside, lots of fast and smooth single track and a good cardio workout. I guarantee you will go back for a second ride as I did. Enjoy

Best way to see Prague. Biko Adventures is a very professionally run business and suited for all types of adventure seekers and experience levels. My husband and I are avid cyclists and spent one week in Prague in November. The trip was wonderful, and the most memorable part were the two days we spent with Filipo. He was so friendly and accommodating. He is also very knowledgeable of the culture and history of Prague. I truly enjoyed viewing the city and surrounding areas from a different perspective of most tours. And of course, my favorite souvenir was one of his custom designed tees. Love this guy! So cool!

Wonderful day out. I highly recommend Biko to anyone visiting Prague. My husband and I spent the most wonderful day cycling around Prague's parks with a fantastic guide. We're not 'supersporty' people and +30km cycing seemed a bit daunting but the bicycles are very good and the tour is planned in a way that by the end of it we weren't feeling tired, just feeling great.The whole booking process was easy, done promptly and professionally. Our bikes were in mint condition and were chosen according to our needs, tour and height.I can't stress this enough, it was such a great day out.

Biko fulfilled my wishes off-road in Prague . As a runner, running shoes are all the time in my luggage while traveling. I know I could discover the city much deeper and orient myself faster. I choose Biko adventures, because the website looks interesting, Plus the owner, Filippo replied me email efficiently. What he had done more than I expected. He guided me to hit the trails, forest woods and many AMAZING viewpoints. He is not only an authlic, but also a professional sports photographer. Now I had many pictures, very artistic. He fulfilled my wishes and desired place I want to see in Prague. Filippo, You're legend! Biko made my trip memorable. If you like jogging and feeling of being fit after tons of beer, you can't miss it.

Fat Biking in Czech Mountains. Biko Adventures has just launched a new Fat Biking tour through the northern mountains of the Czech Republic. Fat Bikes are essentially bicycles with huge tyres on them which roll over snow seamlessly. I stopped in at the Biko Shop Prague and got talking to Filippo the owner. The most striking thing about Filippo is that he is very smart about his business and cares a great deal about his customers. He loves sharing his passion for the outdoors with you and this is obvious. We drove about an hour outside of Prague, picked up the bikes and headed to the mountains for an awesome day riding the snowy trails. The tours are private and customizable to your level of ability/ fitness. We stopped for lunch up in the mountains and then continued on in the afternoon. It was an awesome experience and a unique thing to take away from Prague. If you are looking for a unique experience of your own, I cannot recommend Biko Adventures enough. These guys are good at what they do because they have an independent approach to their business. All the very best to you Filippo and your team!

I fell down. A lot. . We went for a private guided cross country ski. We were picked up at our hotel and driven up to the mountains and had our ski and boot hire sorted. A couple of tips later and we were striding up slopes and swearing a lot as we (I, mainly) fell over. Our guide was more than patient, zipped up and down the slopes next to us as we made our slower way round the circuit. I think we covered around 12/13km but for those who are first timers with more brain the route can be shorter and if you're better than us it can be longer. I can't fault these guys at all. Great communication and delivered on what we expected. Thanks for the memories we will never forget!

A Great Biking Experience!. Biko Adventures was one of the highlights of our Prague trip. I (in my late 20s) traveled to Prague with my parents (in their early 60s) and convinced them to do a 35 kilometer bike tour from Prague to Karlstejn Castle. Neither had been on a bike outdoors in over 15 years. I researched the different tour options available through Biko and found many options I'd be interested in, but the Karlstejn trip turned out to be the best tour for my parents as beginner riders (though a few narrow passages to navigate over bridges). Petar was our guide, and we rode along with two other couples, which was a nice-sized group. It was really great to bike through the countryside, outside of Prague, along the river and end at a beautiful and historic castle which we had to to explore. We finished off with a Czech beer and traditional meal in the town of Karlstejn. I truly recommend Biko in general, as the staff and guides were very friendly and they have a quaint little shop in Prague (which we bought graphic t-shirts from Filippo, the owner), and I especially recommend the Karlstejn tour for travelers looking for a bit of adventure, but on the more leisure side. I would definitely come back to ride with Biko!
Czech Paradise hike.. Our hike in Czech Paradise was fantastic despite an overcast day and constant drizzle. Marek was a great guide.

Don't leave Prague without taking a bike tour with Biko Adventures!!!. Well, the headline says it all! You really must take a tour with these nice people! They show you lots of places in and around Prague and the tours are for every skill levels. The number one aim for BIKO - I think - is that you should discover Prague and at the same time enjoy yourself doing it! We sure did enjoy it! We, four friends, took the park tour in November 2014 with the owner; Filippo, as our guide. What a great guy! Very friendly, likeable and knowledgeable! We couldn't ask for a better guide! And the parks where amazing! We can only imagine how nice they must be during the hot season! One last thing; BIKO invests in proper bikes so you get really good bikes! Nothing to worry about there! Actually, nothing to worry about at all! Take one of their tours - you will not regret it! We give BIKO Adventures Prague 8 out of 6 stars! :-) (yes, I can count!)Conclusion: We highly recommend BIKO and we will certainly do this again on our next trip to Prague., either with friends and/or familiy (with small kids)!PS. Don't forget to buy a t-shirt while you're there! They are designed by Filippo and are of great quality! Clever guy!

Escape the Prague city centre!. I have to say this was one of the highlights of my trip. The Prague city centre was too full of tourists to be enjoyable (with me contributing to the problem) so I was very glad to get out and see the countryside. I took the "Ride to Karlstejn Castle Classic" tour and I had Fillippo, the owner, as my guide. He was not only welcoming and friendly but he had many interesting stories about the sights on the way, like the holiday houses built during the Communist era, and was also only too happy to share stories about life in Prague. I could see he genuinely enjoyed taking visitors on his cycling tours and it was just brilliant to be riding through roads, bridges, dirt and grass trails to Karlstejn Castle on a beautiful sunny day. I had no idea the Prague countryside was so picturesque!I also recommend checking out the Biko shop: it sells some creative bike-themed t-shirts (all with original designs) as well as bike accessories and stationery designed by local artists.

Outstanding outdoor experience!. We were four guys visiting Prague for three days and we wanted to experience Prague besides old town and the Karls Bridge. We found BIKO on the net and booked a "MTB and Old Brewery" tour. It was just perfect: Good bikes, nice challenging route, beautiful ride through forest, hills and by lakes. And last but not least, a fantastic guide (Filippo) who adjusted the trip to our capabilities and told us a lot about Prague and things along the route. Would definitely do it again, no question! Kind regards, Peter and friends, Copenhagen/Zürich

the only way to go. We found this bike shop by accident when I saw their t-shirts displayed, and went inside to purchase one. (Great designs by one of the owners, Filippo, I think.) We returned the next day to rent bikes, we rode about an hour south along the river, could have gone more but it was threatening to rain. The bikes they rent are of a very high quality, we have rented bikes in many cities and they are not always so great. They also do guided rides where they take you out to the hills by train and you can ride back, and more.

Fantastic day out. I was recently in Prague on business and flew in a couple of days early to see the city. I took the bike trip to Karlstejn Castle, and it was honestly the highlight of the trip. There were only three of us, a lovely couple from Israel and me. Our guide, Marek, was fantastic. The countryside is beautiful, and the route is almost entirely bike routes. The castle is up quite a hill (after 20 miles of biking) but a great view. I'd definitely take another trip with this company if I manage to convince my company that they really should send me to Prague again.

Great way to see Prague. We took the MTB-Beer easy bike tour in late September with Mark as our guide. We rode the entire way rather than taking public transportation back-I think it was around 30km round trip? It took most of the day and we wouldn't have wanted to spend it any other way! This was a great way to see Prague, many things that we would never have known about without this tour. The pivovar was yummy and a great way to break up the day. The bike itself was very nice and had a comfortable gel cover-no soreness here! We highly recommend Biko-we will certainly do this again on our next trip to Prague.

Family experience to remember. We, a family of three, Mum, Dad and an 8 year old keen biker boy had a day we will remember for a long time to come. We rode the 35 kms to Karlstejn castle through gorgeous villages, over bridges, and beside rivers, even stopped for coffee and cake half way! Filippo was fantastic with information before the ride and in accommodating our son. His hospitality during the ride warming,our son felt ten foot tall and bullet proof at the end of the adventure... and of course a little weary. If you visit Prague you must 'BIKO' it!

Great cycling around Prague catering to individual needs.. Had a great 100 km ride on road bike with guide Marek covering some hills around Karlsteijn area. Definitely recommend it, if you are looking for an adventurous or sporty way to discover the area surrounding Prague.

Amazing biking experience . Awesome mountain bike tour in the parks around Prague, Filipo the owner was very nice, helping us to pick the right adventure for us. Me and a friend were the only ones to book a tour on a Friday morning and they still did it, out guide Marek was really cool and helpful. Must go outdoor activity in Prague.

Best baby on bike adventure in Prague!. As a family of two adults and one 15 month old little girl, Biko Adventures provided us with a great and very personalised guided tour along the various rivers leading out of Prague. Thought that Biko Adventures only catered for extreme road bikers and hardened mountain bikers. Instead we found a company that was extremely adaptable and thoughtful of our needs. Guided by Filippo throughout the day, we experienced fabulous country side at a relaxed pace - with baby on a bike. Would recommend to others of all experiences and ages! Thanks for a great day out!

Excellent tour company. High recommended. I booked a tour through Biko Adventures and had the best time. The tour guide Marek was friendly and very approachable. The tours are flexible and adjust to your level of fitness. They even stop whenever you like for a break. I had the best time on this tour. Highly recommend using Biko Adventures Prague

Sweet Mountain Biking Trip!. My family and I had a great time with these guys. We were looking to some pretty serious biking and they took us to just the place. We took an all day trip some ways out of Prague close to Poland, but it was definitely worth it. We rode nice, new, and well maintained bikes and and our guide knew the trails extremely well. Good thing too, cause we only hit the brakes if we saw him do so in front of us. They said they have some less technical and shorter rides around Prague, but if you love biking and want to see more of the Czech Republic, then take them up on the full day trip. Excellent trip.

Best Mountain Biking Trip!!!!. I had a FANTASTIC mountain bike trip with Filippo and Biko. This is THE company to ride with in the Czech Republic! Brand new HIGH QUALITY bikes, excellent routes, and expert knowledge of the area makes for a great trip. Filippo was kind and accommodating to my request for a longer trip and put together a custom-tour for me on only a day's notice. He is passionate owner and entrepreneur who has put together a top-rate cycle adventure company. The trails in Prague are excellent. Don't miss them!Thank you Filippo and Biko!!!!

Prague - Karlsjten castle, easy. This was a really nice ride, even in the mist. Petr, our guide, was informative, fun and considerate of our 77 year old pace. We were very impressed that Fillipo was careful about the weather and wouldn't let us go on a day when it was expected to rain a lot. We'd highly recommend Biko!Ted and Fran, Portland OR i

Original and customized run just for me: priceless!. As I was planning my trip to Prague and Greece I knew I wanted time to relax, sightseeing and learn about these fascinating countries and cultures. I came across Biko Adventures Tours and read great reviews about it. I've decided to give it a try: oh my! oh my! What a wonderful company! I didn't want to go on a bike ride. As an amateur but passionate runner I wanted to run Prague and Santorini. And I did! Filippo was kind enough to come himself to take me on a running tour of Prague. After all, riding his bike at all times with other great bikers needs some compensation for his legs! A short but effective run can do wonders, right?We agreed to run a 5K but felt so comfortable with the pace of running and sightseeing that we continued for over 7.5mks! What a majestic and healthy way to learn about the Czeck Republic! Thanks Biko staff and thanks Filippo for allowing me to enjoy Prague in the way I always wanted to! With gratitude and fond memories from Denver, CO, Virginia.

Great Memories!. The Karlstejn tour with Mark was my first real mountain biking experience and it's quickly become one of my favorite memories from my recent trip to CR. This is listed as a beginner tour and was perfect being that I was new to mountain biking and wanted a new way to explore. Mark and the staff at BIKO made sure I was comfortable and prepared for the ride and Mark was great about checking in and giving tips throughout the tour. I enjoyed the breathtaking views and exhileratiing ride with a knowledgeable guide. The cherry on top was the quiant village, shopping, and castle that highlight the tour. I'd love to make this type of adventure a regular part of my travel itinerary and will look for BIKO in other locals.

Highlight of our Prague Trip. My wife and I took the Road Biking to Karlstejn Castle (65km) last week, and this was without a doubt the highlight of the trip. Communication and setup with Filipo was a breeze.The bikes they provided us were really top notch for rentals, and the route for the tour was incredible. On the way to the castle, the route was mainly small, tree-lined roads through the countryside. There were sunflower fields, quarries, rolling hills, and a few small towns along the way. The approach to the castle itself was spectacular, at which point Marek gave us some time to explore the grounds.We then had lunch at a great restaurant just outside the tourist traps near the castle, which actually ended up being one of our favorite meals in Prague, and returned a different way. The way back included more small towns and bike paths along the river bringing us back into Prague. It was great to see a part of the city and countryside that you just can't experience except on a bike. I'd highly recommend this to anyone visiting Prague.

Great people! Great way to see countryside!. My partner and I love to bike and think it's a great way to travel a bit off the regular tourist trek. To do this, I takes having great guides who know the routes and are easy to get along with. The best rides feel like you're out with a friend who's sharing a favorite route with you. Marek and the rest of the people at Biko Adventures easily fulfilled this. We were so happy after our first ride that we booked two more even though we were only there for a total of ten days. The equipment was great, they changed out our pedals, adapted to our jet lagged tardiness and recommended the best place for lunch after a long morning of biking. Looking forward to going back.

Perfect bike trip!!. If you're tired of crowded carles bridge and touristy castle and if you want to see some special places of prague - get a bike and start a tour with biko!! Just awesome, friendly people guide you to the beautiful places in and around prague! We can highly recomend it!!

Escape the city with Marek. My husband and I took a 22-mile guided ride with Marek, beginning at the Biko shop and ending in Karlstejn at the castle. We really loved the different terrain, from city cobblestone streets, to a paved bike path, a narrow dirt path, grass, and village lanes. We had originally booked the 36-mile road bike tour...but I was admittedly a little tired on our biking day, and Marek easily accommodated my request for a shorter ride. My husband found the option to add a "VIP package" which is basically photographs of your group as you ride, a bakery stop, and lunch. Our whole experience was above and beyond; at the shop, we were greeted warmly and really made to feel welcome. On the ride itself, Marek was superb - he let us set the pace, and seemed to know exactly when we wanted to chat and when we wanted to just ride and soak in the scenery. The highlight (for me) was a stop along the way for pastries. I had an apple strudel and it was divine. The highlight for my husband was riding along the river. When we arrived in Karlstejn, Marek stayed with the bikes while Dan and I walked up to the castle (biking up is not allowed). Best of all, Marek gave us the option of where we wished to eat in Karlstejn. He took us to an off-the-tourist-path place, translated the menu for us, and we enjoyed an idyllic and delicious lunch. Marek arranged a train ride back for us, helped me navigate my bike up and down stairs, and delivered us happily back to Biko. There, we met the owner Filippo, who took time to introduce himself and thank us for riding with them. It was one of the best customer service experiences I've had on a vacation, ever.

Great tour for the adventurous type!. This tour is a great way to get exercise. ...see part of czech you wouldn't normally see and take in history all at once! Biking through karlstejn was absolutely beautiful! Our guide, mark, recommended a great place for us to eat and gave us as much time as we needed to explore the castle. The castle was amazing- looked like it was straight out of a fairy tale! I'm officially hooked on this type of your and will look for a similar one in every city I travel to from now on!

Had a Great time!. We did the "The road to Karlstejn Classic". We had a wonderful time with Marek, our guide. The road to Karlstejn was amazing. We passed through little towns, parks and bridges along the river. I highly recommend it to anyone who has a few days in Prague, and wants to get a general idea of not only Prague but also the surrounding areas. Karlstejn itself is very picturesque and has significantly cheaper souvenirs than Prague.

Great Tours! For dummies and for expert!. I spent a day with Biko in the Prague park.In the morning I did the tour "Prague Park", an easy tour for family in the parks closed to the city center. A very beautiful experience in a natural landscape you don't expect. (about 30km).In the afternoon I did another tour, more difficult for the altitude ( about 20km). It was a very amazing tour! This was the first time that I do free ride and I enjoy so much the tour "Block and Park". Filippo is a good MTB teacher who stimulated me in all the moment of the tour.I recommend a trip with Biko adventures if you like bike and nature and if you want see a very different side of Prague (far from the classical tourist routes).

Nice trip!. After three days of seeing the 'usual' things in Prague together with my fourteen-year old son, we wanted to use the good weather of the last day to see something of the countryside. We found BIKO through google and trip advisor, and after reading the reviews I sent an e-mail the evening prior to our trip. Marek answered immediately and confirmed that we could join the Karlstejn 'easy' tour that we wanted to take. After a little bit of difficulty finding the shop (don't use 'directions' in trip advisor: it sends you to a dusty bike shop; go to the Vratislavova address) we got to the right place and enjoyed a very nice tour through surprising roads near the river, well described in the other reviews. Marek knows the city very well and has also a vast knowledge of running trails. A true recommendation if you want to do something active in Prague.

Amazing outdoor experience in Prague. We had an amazing time doing the trip from Prague to Karlsejn by bike. We saw the suburbs in Prague, we traveled through flower fields, bridges and narrow paths through little forests. Everything was great, it was a highlight in our trip to Prague. I definitely recommend doing this if you travel in Prague and the weather is nice and warm.

The perfect way to experience a new country. In March 2014 I visited Prague for a very quick personal weekend, tagged onto a business trip to Germany. I’m an avid cyclist, so when I came across the BIKO website in my googling for activities I was very excited! And BIKO did not let me down! I did the road bike tour to Karlsten and it was fantastic. It was just me and the owner, Fillipo (the friendliest tour guide ever), riding throughout the Czech countryside, as if we were two regular friends going out for a bike ride. We stopped on the way to the castle, at a fantastic local restaurant for lunch. It was non-touristy, true local cuisine. Riding along, it was great to learn about the local culture from Fillipo, and to be out exploring rather than spending the day in a tourist trap. With only one day to spend in Prague, I was little worried that I wouldn’t get enough of the ‘Prague experience’ by spending the day on the bike…but it turned out to be the perfect way to see the Czech Republic. I got the best of both worlds – a taste of countryside, feeling like a local, with enough time in the afternoon/evening to explore the city on my own. I recommend BIKO to anyone visiting Prague, and I hope I get to come back some day to try out another of their tours.

What a great experience and we are coming BACK!. My partner and I love biking and were in Prague for a good friends wedding. Prior to our trip we contacted Biko to see what they had available via the website. We found that they had bikes, a guide and were always responded in 24 hours to any questions we had. Well we booked a guided 60 mile trip prior to the wedding and after having such a positive experience we ended up booking two more 60 miles trips after the wedding. Each ride was in different areas of the country side which was amazing and what a great way to see it via cycling. The equipment was perfect and the service was outstanding. Our guide was able to set a perfect comfortable pace for us and we had stunning rides in the country side. My job now is to talk them into doing a Prague to Vienna ride. Great staff. Great Times.

Very experts. They can do tours as you want and also they have very good knowledge of all Praha , parks , rivers , hills , so just ask and they will give you many options , don't care if you are a or beginner or expert just go and enjoy Praha in a different way and by the way they have very good T-shirts all are own designs

A ride becomes a memorable day. This is a very professionally run business. The owner Filippo is one of the most passionate guy ever met, and you can see this in all the details, quality and amusement of the ride we had. Perfect equipment, tour chosen and adapted to our riding skills, good fun, and at end the ride just became a memorable day. Suggested to really anyone.

Great bicycle tour. We took tour to Karlstein (35km).We had so much fun from the spectacular scenaris, nice tiny houses, bridges, mountains, rivers, fresh air...It seemed that we were being in fairyland!When we arrived to Karlstein we had a lunch after that we had enough time to walk there.It was a great luck for us to ride with a guide Mark, who is a very interesting person from USA.We were talking about everything and feel ourselfes comfortable and easy.This tour was very memorable for us.We strongly recommend it! =)Anna & Dmitry

The best bike tour in Prague. I was in Prague with a friend for a week-end in July and we had a spectacular mountain bike tour with Biko, the Owner Filippo was wonderful, he is not only a bike guide, he is a friend. He knows everything, any single track, any resturant and any local food...:). I recommend BIKO ADVENTURE to anyone who loves bike, dont' forget to book a tour with Biko Adventures....

By far best part of our Prague trip. My husband and I spent 4 days in Prague this July. We did all the regular sites and ate yummy food for the first three days, eagerly awaiting our day on the bikes with Biko. We chose the Easy Prague Parks because I was still nursing my knee after April surgery. I'd call the trip Easy/Medium because there definitely was some tricky declines single track and it was longer than just a couple hours. Prague has a park system that is incredible...they all connect. We spent about four hours winding around the city through these parks. Such variety and views! It was the perfect ride for us. The highlight, of course, was Filippo, the owner and guide. He is wonderful, friendly, informative and safe. Miklaus also came to learn the trail and he was fantastic too! We were spoiled. There were many highlights but one memorable one was mid-way stopping for a snack where we were introduced to the most delicious blueberry dumplings. I have to learn to make them! Next time in Prague we will have to do the Great Escape...I'll be ready. Oh, and definitely splurge for the photo option. Filippo is an amazing photographer! By the way, he designed his own website because he has that many skills.

Good bikes - Good advice. My wife and I rented a pair of "standard" hybrid bikes from BikoAdvantures for a Sunday cruise up the Vltava river - meaning going upstream, towards the south. That avoids having to go through central Prague.The bicycles were great - like the BikoAdventures web site says, they are clearly above average for rental equipment. The staff was very friendly, gave us advice about routes and a map, and sent us on our way. The shop is very close to the bike trail, so we were on it in moments.The bike trail on the east bank (Old Town side) of the Vltava is well marked, paved, and mostly separate from any auto roadways. There is a new high-level and very cool bicycle bridge across the Vltava several kilometers up the river that gives you access to the smaller river (forgot the name) that runs past the Karlstejn castle. We crossed the bridge and went a few more kilometers but not all the way to Karlstejn before turning back to Prague. It was a great 4-5 hour ride, mostly level with frequent spots to purchase water, beer or snacks. This is the way to cycle!If you are an outdoors person, you should get in touch with the BikoAdventures folks while in Prague.

The best bike experience in Prague. I was in Prague for a week-end in July and I had a spectacular mountain bike tour with Filippo, which is also an italian friend of mine, not only a bike guide. He knows any single track there and he's able to build a taylor made trip for everyone, depending on his/her needs, skills and physical capabilities. Hence, I recommend BIKO ADVENTURE to anyone who loves bike, generally speaking, expecially to those who love mountain biking (from crosscountry to enduro trails). You couldn't miss to visit Prague and its spectacular landscape without contacting BIKO and riding one of the almost 35 bikes he got. Freeride never dies!!!!

MTB tour of Prague and Singletrek. Group of 7 from Singapore and Uk, we had 4 fantastic days of riding off road around Prague, starting each (50/60 km) day riding from the hotel in downtown Prague. The guiding and support was excellent,the riding catered for any level of skills. We have travelled all over the world on MTB trips and this was definitely one of the best for the variety of riding whilst still having the comfort and convenience of a large city. From Prague we travelled to the border to Poland still guided by Biko for two days of amazing single track riding in the hills on purpose built trails around the Smek mountain (Singltrek pod Smrkem) A fantastic combination that I would recommend for any mountain bike enthusiast. Filippo the owner and one of the guides is passionate about what he does and it translate in the quality of service we have enjoyed. Philip

awesomeness. I'd read the reviews on Trip Advisor before our vacation. Could they be that true? Yes, Biko Adventures was a highlight in our visit to Prague. As mentioned, Filippo and his staff are all that and more. I did the "Great Escape" tour with Filippo as my guide. He was informative, sensitive to my riding style, and personable. I had a wonderful ride and got two t-shirts as proof. I'm also going to add that the restaurant across the street, U Krock, and the castle close by at the top of the hill, were equally awesome, both suggested by Filippo. He is one of the good guys!

Prague Running Tour. My sister and I had a great time running with Marek from Biko! We opted for the 10k run, which seemed a little daunting after being on vacation for a while but Marek was great and let us run at our own pace and even walk when we had to climb the big hills. Doing a running tour was a great way to combine exercise with sightseeing. We saw a lot of areas of Prague that we likely would not have seen and so many beautiful views, we are absolutely recommending this to all of our friends going to Prague. Thank you Marek and Biko Adventures for such a great run!

Fabulous time riding singletrek pod smrkem and hiking Cesky Raj. While visiting Czech Republic I wanted to do some Mountain biking. I found Biko Adventures while searching online and quickly booked a trip for singletrek pod smrkem. Filippo and the others at the shop were quick to respond to my emails and answer my questions. Filippo was a fabulous guide, patient, easy-going and provided a lot of knowledge about the area. The following day he was taking a group to Cesky Raj and I was very glad I decided to join and spend my last day seeing some of the beautiful rock formations in the Czech Paradise. I live in CO but this hike was still fun and unique and like nothing I have done before. It was a great way to spend my last day in Czech Republic and I would highly recommend Biko Adventures to anyone who wants to see some of the beautiful country outside of prague.

Off road running/ trail running. I like to run trails. I don't want to risk my safety cause that can put others out. Biko was my answer. They took me to some fantastic off road trails. Not only that, they shared information that enabled me to head out safely on my own when I couldn't link in with them. (They were available, it was my time issue). Friendly and vibrant people that really slot into your personality type.

Prague to KarLstejn Castle. Had a great bike trip from Prague to KarLstejn Castle .. 42km total .. BIKO staff were awesome!! Take this tour if you want to leave the busy city for a few hours and enjoy the country side of Prague while getting a great workout!!! RECOMMENDATION: research KarLstejn Castle history prior to your trip to have a better understanding of its significance and finally choose a restaurant that is close the area of the castle (many nice quaint places). Our tour guide recommended a cheap local restaurant that was close to the train station, food and atmosphere wasn't very good especially after a long day!

Awesome. Filippo fit me in last minute and had great time! Got to see the most incredible views of prague and bike though the national forest. Really an unforgettable experience. Petr was my guide and he did an excellent job showing me around!

Great way of exploring Prague. We were very impressed with Biko and the experience they offered us. Filippo the owner was very nice and welcoming and was super efficient with emailing us back when we were organising our trip. We opted for the "great escape tour". I was a bit hesitant at the start as it had stated online this trip was difficult and for advanced riders (I am no means an experienced mountain biker), however Petr our guide was fantastic, he was really supportive and offered us different biking routes to take if we didn't feel comfortable. We saw a lot of variety on this trip, biking alongside the river and through the forrest. We stopped for a nice drink and some cheesecake along the way too. The standard of the bikes were top notch. We both thoroughly enjoyed our adventure with Biko and we would recommend it to anyone, even if you aren't the most experienced mountain biker they will cater to your ability. Thanks Filippo and Petr.

Great day for an active family!. After spending 3 days of sightseeing in Prague our family of five (boys are 10,13 and 14) was ready to do some biking out of the city. Mark took us on a 6 hour adventure to the castle. The ride to the castle took about 3 hours, nice lunch and visit of the castle. Mark, thank you so much for a day we will never forget. You guys at Biko really go all out to make it a great experience.

awesome. First day in Prague and we're off to Biko.once we arrived at the store Filippo and Mark welcomed us as if we were old mates, which was GREAT. 2 family's with a total of 5 kids and 1 guide Mark.... poor Mark he did an awesome job. Very patient with the kids and very knowledgeable. Made our introduction to prague a great day, thanks mate. The kids are still talking about it.The tour we did was to karlsten castle .Thanks biko.

Yeah!. Guys didn't just show the trails, but also knew some history of Prague. +"Shopping guide". + Extra trails to parks-tour-normal. + Excellent timing&restaurant for hungry riders in the middle of the tour. Just perfect! Thank you Filippo&Marek!

Ride to Karlstejn - loved. Had a wonderful ride to Karlstejn castle with husband and 2 sons. Good bikes, excellent service and beautiful scenery. Mark was a great guide and a lot of fun! This was such a fun way to end our last day in Prague - thanks!

Best service anywhere, great rides, total fun. Very highly recommended. We rented 2 hybrid/trekking bikes, Filippo and his staff just couldnt do enough to make sure we knew what we were doing, and where we were going, without going over the top. Good bikes, well serviced gear, all the spares and maps we needed, with sound local advice. The shop is well located, just off the river a bit south of the city centre (phew!). Nice decor, with handmade bike apparel - belts, bags - Fipipo's creative handprinted t-shirt designs, and all day sunshine. I wish we had more time to explore the district, on-road, bike path, and off-road. Biko is a well-knit team of very nice happy friendly people, who worked together well, nothing seemed too difficult for them, even when we struck a major problem and tested them! In short, the team ticked all the boxes in the small business manual.

Awesome. If you like mtb and trails then this is the place to go! Great service, great bikes,fantastic scenery and trails! Plus the guys are very helpful.highly recommended! Also, if you like beer then go for the advanced mtb and beer tour.loved every minute of it!

Excellent Service! Very nice trails around Prague!. I wasn't able to make a tour however Filippo provided brilliant service and was very prompt with my emails. Biko Adventures provide excellent high quality bikes for rent - which I did! and everything was provided (helmet, spare tube, pump and even a small back pack as I didn't bring one!), Filippo also provided a map and pointed out the best places to ride and how to get there! After returning the bike, I mistakenly overpaid and the staff who was on promptly offered me the extra back once he realised. I can highly recommend Biko Adventures for anyone looking for high quality bicycles and excellent service.

Take my advise - use Biko Adventures!!. I wrote to Filippo with no knowledge of the service his company offers. He wrote to me right away and gave me many option for a 4 day bike trip to Prague. We were a group of three and Filippo accommodated to this.... after some unfortunate events I ended up going on my own. Filippo wrote me a new plan that was at an amazing price with airport pick up and racing bike rental. I met Filippo and Marek on day 1 for an idea of where we were going to go and what routes we were to take. I did three amazing days riding with mostly Marek and then convinced to true the mountain bike which I did with Filippo. These guys were absolutely great and a pleasure to be around. Very professional yet awesome guys to ride with. I am planning another trip and I will be going to Biko Adventures for sure. Highly recommend using them especially if you are planning a few days riding around Prague. Well done guys... worth every penny!!!!... Pat

Great Tour!. For everyone interested in MTB, it is a super nice way to discover the trails around Prague! Good bikes, great guides and good organization (communication before the tour, pick up at hostel, right bike sizes etc). 100% recommend it!

Best biketour ever. We took the Great Escape advance MTB-tour, and it truely was a great escape, with great nature, stunning views, hard workout and awesome single tracks. Our guide Filippo really made the tour personal. Don't forget do buy the Biko t-shirts as a memory. If you are into MTB this is a must do when in Prague.

Hike to Karlstejn Castle and Czech Paradise. Both the hikes were simply breath taking. The long, tired but wonderful hike to karlstejn castle makes the surrounding views from the top of the castle most appreciative. Our guide Adam made us felt like we were old friends. The other trip to Czech paradise was another really wonderful hike. The walk and climb through the rocks formations were most exhilarating. Our guide Marek really knows his way around and showed us the most beautiful and breath taking sights. Thank you Biko!!!!!

Bike Ride to Karlstein . Best time ever. Filipo was awesome, I was the only female for the 37 km bike ride, thus the slowest he made sure I kept up. It's people like Filipo who have the heart for what they do that makes all the difference! Also when I left my windbreaker at the shop, he volunteered to help mail it back to Singapore. The bike ride to Karlstein was beautiful not to mention I got a work out !!

Pure Pleasure!. From the very first email with Fillipo, I knew we would be on great hands. Responses to our inquires were prompt and professional so it was not unexpected to receive the se great service upon our arrival. Despite our lateness, Fillipo and our guide Mark were so friendly and patient. We were quickly on our ride out to a local brewery approx 25 km. Mark pointed out interesting facts and features along the way. Had great food and beer at the brewery too! Aside from touring the must sees in the city, do your self a favor and get out to see the countryside. You will love it! I highly recommend Biko adventures to get your adrenalin going!!!!

Put Biko Tours on the 'Must Do List'. If you really want to get to experience what is outside of Prague then do not miss getting out & cycling through idyllic country settings. Filippo was our guide who gave us a history of the 'now' versus the 'then' when under communism, it was very informative & helped you to understand the Czech mentality. I can not recommend the quality of the bikes high enough, I have done a number of bike tours in other countries, & these are very well maintained. Filippo is an exceptional person, very honest & ethical with a big emphasis on being environmentally friendly. If you want to maintain a level of activity then this is your adventure company. Thanks Filippo for a great day.

Awesome Bike Ride to Karlstejn Castle with Biko Adventures. We took the "Road to Karlstejn" tour last week, and it was the highlight of our trip to Prague. Not only was it a beautiful ride out of the city to Karlstejn along 2 rivers, but it was a fun experience due to the enthusiasm of our friendly guides, Filippo and Peter.It was a 30 minute walk or a 20 minute tram ride from our hotel to Biko Adventure's new shop, where we quickly got our bikes and headed out of the city. Prague has fabulous bike paths in the city and out into the outskirts, and we really enjoyed riding along these and the quiet local roads on the way to Karlstejn. The castle itself was great to see, and then we had a delicious lunch at a local restaurant near the train station. Thankfully, Filippo and Peter could decipher the Czech menu!Sightseeing in a city like Prague is great, but getting out of the city and into the countryside on a bicycle and speaking with the local guides is an awesome way to see something different and learn about the culture of a place. If you are going to Prague, I highly recommend that you check out Biko Adventures and go on a biking or hiking trip with Filippo.... you'll be so glad you did!

A whole new world!. Filippo, you win! I visit Prague about twice a year for business and I so far I managed to see as much as a regular turist sees. I find Prague as a beautiful city, a must see, but walking in the city centre can become....too crowded. Than...I came to BIKO!Filippo took me to The great escape, starting in the centre, passing by the river, into the woods and to Prague periphery from where you can see the whole Prague from above. What a fascinating view! I fell in love with Pragu for the first time and I cant wait to go back....Try it. You will never ever regret it. :)Barbara

That's what Prague is about!. Great Escape with BIKO and Filippo showed me Prague in a whole new way, away from crowded streets and traffic but still in touch with this impressive city. The nature around it its absolutely amazing and the sights Filippo took me and my girlfriend to....well,you have to see it to believe it! The tour took us from the centre, by the river to the woods and up the hill with stunning view of Prague, than to the other side, where endless fields and pastures begin... Beautiful! I never loved Prague as much as I love it now. Thank you Filippo for that! Jaka from Slovenia

Best bike hire and tours in Prague. Had a great days biking with. Thanks Filippo and all the staff. Professional and friendly. Best bike hire in Prague. All bikes are excellent quality and helmet and repair kit is included. Their location is the best in Prague right next to the river. We had a great 15 mile ride along the river taking in the sights, there is always plenty of opportunities for beer stops

rain was not a dampner. we did the 'road to karlstejn' bike tour! it was pouring with rain but our guide was still committed to taking us - which we thought was great as we only had a limited number of days in Prague. the ride was quite long for us, about 35 km but only had a few upward slopes (I wouldn't call them hills). our guide was friendly and patient and pointed out some really good sites/sights, a bit more info on the names and uses of the buildings and areas would have been a bonus. the karlstejn castle was a great way to end the majority of the ride (and the rain had slowed by then), what a beautiful historic place. thanks Biko!
Great mountain biking. I rent mountain bikes regularly from Biko. Great people, always ready to help with useful tips from good trails to places to eat. Really good bikes and gear. Thanks

Mountain biking in February. Think that the outdoors are out of reach in winter months in Prague then think again. It was a return trip to Prague in early February and my thoughts, once the flight and hotel were booked, turned immediately to Biko and the programme of activities. I was wondering what would be available but a quick email to Filippo confirmed there was plenty of adventures to be had. The weather was excellent so lots of options were available, but I decided on two separate days, one the mountain bike and beer advanced and the second the mountain bike to Karlstejn advanced.I have had the pleasure of using the services of Filippo in the past and have always admired the professionalism of the outfit. Great quality bikes and fantastic customer service so that's why I keep coming back for more. Biko is relocating to their own shop and Filippo was in the advanced stages of refurbishing the shop so things are looking even better. Day one was the mountain bike and beer. Filippo met me at my hotel and we headed over to the new shop. 30 minutes later I was out in the fresh air cycling the streets of Prague. We quickly made our way up to Petrin, then onward through the countryside to the star castle and beyond. Breathtaking winter scenery mixed with a solid workout and some single track adventures. The conditions were fine so my worries about freezing temperatures were not realised. Filippo is ever conscious of safety and ability so tours are matched to the prevailing conditions and your skill level. After around 4 hours of mountain biking we arrived at the famous brewery. Bikes secured, a hearty lunch was washed down with some fine Czech beer. Definitely recommend purchasing a few bottles for yourself or gifts for family if your luggage allowance has spare capacity. Refreshed and fed we left the brewery, downhill to the river and a crossing by boat left us a straightforward ride back to the centre of Prague. Obligatory coffee stop on the way back at the Trojan Horse was an extra treat. A wonderful day!A few days later I embarked on the Karlstejn trip. I was ready for a bigger challenge having no problems with the earlier trip. Again we were blessed with glorious weather, bright winter sunshine and clear skies. It was cold but once you get moving that soon changes. Again quickly out of the city centre had us exploring the stunning scenery. Stop off at a hidden lake, cycling through a pitch black rocky cave and some climbing of steep and muddy tracks. Options are always provided.. We can go the easy way or the hard way.. The choice is always yours. We cycled onwards deeper into the country side, across bush and marsh and through forest. Cycling across a ridge suddenly opened up to stunning views across the valley, high above you could see for miles across the sprawling countryside. Filippo in designing his routes has managed to bring in the constant art of surprise, just when you are least expecting it another stunning scene or fast downhill single track! Extras on the tour, if your legs are up for it, can include a visit to a deep lake which has formed in a disused quarry, well worth the extra 8 km for the views alone. Then after a hard few hours cycling we had reached the highest point in the tour. Downhill all the way though amazing countryside and forest track, very few people other than you, the bike, and nature for company and the cool wind in your face. At the end of the downhill the castle appears in all it's glory. Lunch and a beer at the station had us both refreshed so instead of catching the train there we cycled two extra stops closer to Prague before finally jumping on the train to sit back and relax. This was a physically demanding tour but exhilarating, great sense of achievement completing the day. If you spend time in Prague I am sure you will love the city and all it has to offer, if you spend time with Biko I'm sure you'll have memories which will far outlive your memories of Prague! Or perhaps like me you'll end up coming back time and time again to enjoy them both.There are other activities to do in Prague, you could even hire a bike and tour round yourself. But the real value with Biko is the quality and personal service that is given. Filippo is genuinely passionate about all he does and your enjoyment of the tour is his primary aim. His knowledge and research into hidden games of the Czech countryside gives a unique insight and experience you would struggle to get anywhere else. Cannot recommend Filippo and Biko highly enough.. I'm already looking toward to my next visit.

Bohemian Paradise Walk. We had a fabulous walk in the magnificent rock formations of the Bohemian Paradise - with snow as an added bonus. The area is about an hour by car from Prague (Biko picked us up from our hotel) - and well worth the visit, not only for the natural landscape but also for the chance to see interesting stuff away from Prague - rural life and to have lunch and walk around a small town. Also if you are into castles, the area has them for viewing. Filippo from Biko made the day with his excellent organisation, great local knowledge and good fun - and his English is excellent!HughSydney, AustraliaHighly recommended.

Great morning walk with BIKO. A huge thanks to Filippo for a great morning exploring some of the beautiful parks around Prague. Had initially booked to go X-Country Skiing, but really appreciated Filippo's diligence in checking the trails would be good to ski given the unusual (very little snow) in and around Prague. Unforatunatley, the skiing was not to be, so decided to go on the The Cliff Trail walking tour, a 10km walk with some great views of the old and new parts of town. Having thawed out from the -10C temperatures, we both agree this walk was a great addition to a normal city break .One final thanks as we really appreciated Filippo's professionalism, friendliness and knowledge of the regaion - not to mention a fantastic recommendation for lunch after the walk to warm up!

Absolutely fantastic. Should have posted this months ago...my wife, a friend and myself went on the Castle bike tour in July, 2013 and could not have had a better experience.....I booked it with some reservations as I'm in my mid 60's and it was roughly 30 KM but was assured that it would be fine and it was...flat basically and at our pace. Filippo was the best as was our guide....the equipment was top notch and he spent time with us and had a beer after the tour...we spent a month in Europe and several days in Prague and this tour was the highlight of the trip....Filippo is a fine young, enthusiastic, businessman who's company is well run and efficient beyond the norm...thanks Filippo for your help and company...we would HIGHLY recommend the tour and Biko Adventures....Rick Dory, Canada

Mother son adventure. On a hot August day we escaped the crowded city on a beautiful ride along the river to Karlstein.Filippo met us at the hotel and brought us to bike shop to select bike. He escorted us on the tour.Great personal service. He speaks perfect English and is a great guide. It was an easy ride. Excellent bikes. I highly recommend this outing!

Australian's riding with Biko. I'm from Australia and last year my wife Lesley and I rode Biko's Prague Parks Advanced tour with Filippo and it was one of the highlights of our European mountain bike holiday. This year we had another mountain bike trip with our friend Kylie and we had to visit Prague again to ride with Biko, this time the Great Escape, another real mountain bike tour, with Honza as our guide.Biko's tours are well planned and give very special views of Prague that few visitors would ever see. Honza, like Filippo, was an excellent guide, friendly and careful to make sure everyone was enjoying the ride and that we were happy with the terrain and skill level. Riding with Biko is great fun and just like riding with good friends.Once again our Biko tour was a very memorable holiday highlight and I would recommend them to all bike riders.Warren from Brisbane.
Great Escape. We had a very nice trip along beautiful landscapes with some impressions of Czech food and a professional guide!! Thanks Filippo

One of the best days of my 7 week Europe trip!. This is a must do when visiting Prague. There is no other way to see the country side than with a small group bike tour outside of the city into some fantastic little downs all with the company of a friendly tour guide. Thanks Filipo for such a memorable day out - one of the highlights of my European holiday for sure!!!

Awesome ride with a fun guide. I've been on erasmus in prague for sometime and was looking for something different beyond the usual touristy attractions. Chanced upon Biko Adventures and didnt hesitate to sign up for a bike tour in the czech countryside - as i was itching to do some freeride, i signed up for the Great Escape package.Fillipo has a great fleet of well-maintained bikes, and offers various pedal options to suit one's preferences. He provided insights into old czech communist housing developments and architecture when we rode through en route to the park which I thought was a nice touch. During our ride he makes an effort to get to know his fellow rider better so as to tailor the trail to your liking. We started out doing some xc climbs and small drops, After awhile I got a little tired from climbing and opted to do more descents and we went through an alternate path along mad fun singletrails and river crossings. Fillppo really cares for his fellow rider, and will stop if you need rest, or drop by a convenience store along the way if you need a bite. It's nice to have him navigate for you so you dont have to worry about getting lost and finding your way back. He really knows his way around town and the countryside.On the way back to the shop we dropped by Prague's first castle by the river where there was a great view. For seasoned riders, Fillippo provides excellent service at a good price. Even better prices during the autumn/winter season. He has no qualms getting muddy with you.For those who like cleaner rides, he also offers urban rides that are really scenic and will help you to see another side of Prague.

Friendly, professional and fun, all on 2 wheels. It was my first visit to the Czech Republic and I wanted to explore some of it by road bike. Marek gave me an unforgettable tour of Prague by MTB which took in all the sights, the hills(!) and some lesser-known neighbourhoods. The next day, Filippo joined me on a road ride around the Jested mountains. The local knowledge of both Marek and Filippo, their patience and resourcefulness, plus the excellent condition of the bikes I hired, made my three days with them an absolute pleasure.

Unique & fun way to spend a day!. Three years ago I had a great pleasure of experiencing the bike tour through beautiful Prague parks with Mark and had so much fun. This was one of my favourite visits to Prague. I really enjoyed riding a bike through the city center, seeing parks and forests which I would' ve never explore alone. Mark was fantastic! He was so amusing and well - informed. He tried to show me and describe as many sights as it was possible.I adore MTB so I decided to renew my experience and ride with BIKO one more time.This time Filippo took me on Great Escape tour.Perfect tour for MTB fans, with plenty beautiful viewpoints and attractive singletracks. I had an opportunity to ride a very good bike so the experience was more than fine. Filippo and Mark were so friendly, kind and fun to be with. I highly recommend the Biko Adventure tours for any type of cyclists. It will provide pleasure of driving down atractive and technically challenging tracks for demanding riders, while amateurs will enjoy sighteeing, lightly driving by fabulous sights and parks.Highly recommended!!

Just great. Had to pleasure to make a self guided (with gps) bike trip to Karlstejn Castle. Everything is perfectly organised; bikes are great, route is perfect and the service by Filippo is excellent. Don't hesitate to book a tour!!

Wonderful bike tour of Czech countryside. We are two couples celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and were lucky enough to find this company on Tripadvisor. We booked the tour to Karlstejn Castle. It was one of the highlights of our trip to Prague. Our guide, Filippo, was personable, knowledgeable and accommodating. We left the bike shop mid morning and rode along the Vtlava River through the outskirts of Prague. The weather couldn't have been better - 65 F and sunny - in late October (we certainly lucked out). The 21-mile ride is flat and meanders through some little villages, across scenic bridges, and along two rivers. The trees were just past peak but beautiful. We loved Prague, but loved getting a glimpse of life outside of Prague as well. Mid way we stopped in a small town for a delicious lunch and the next stop was Karlstejn Castle. After climbing to see the castle we hopped on the train - modern and comfortable - back to Prague. During the tour Filippo provided lots of insight about the Czech culture. We'd love to do another more extensive bike tour if we return, and we'd definitely book with him again. Thanks, Filippo, for such a fun time!

long or short, fast or leisurely, Filippo had it all.. I found myself in a last-minute bind in Prague and had to organize bikes and a guide for a small group tour. Filippo took the time to meet with me, show me different itinerary and bike options, and even took me on a short tour. Excellent customer service, local knowledge and flexibility. I couldn't recommend Biko Adventures more highly.

Biko Brilliant!. If you're looking to do a bike tour outside of Prague- and you should- then look no further. Biko is a prodigious start up filled with great tour guides, excellent bikes (better than the others for sure) and terrific variety of routes to choose from all at top value for money. I did the classic castle route with my girlfriend yesterday. Filippo was an excellent guide and pitched the route perfectly for us. It was a little raining when we started and he gave us anoraks and a water proof bag free of charge and didn't mind stopping for all my photos. Biking with Biko is well worth doing. Consider this a recommendation of the highest order! Do it- you'll love it.

Super helpful bike hire. The Bigman Triathlon clearly involves a bike but logistical issues from Australia = easier to hire in country. Flippo was so helpful and supportive in the hunt to find a midget size bike. Ultimately without his assistance I would not have been able to race (and win the female category!). Thanks so much :-)P.S The cycle based t-shirts designed by Flippo are a great memento.

Biko excellence. My time with the team at Biko adventures was simply amazing. Filippo, Marek, and Marten my guide were very helpful and supportive in all the time I spent there. I did a guided road ride with Marten to the castle and it was amazing in the beautiful countryside and Marten was an exceptional guide with great pacing and information. We stopped for a lovely riverside lunch and overall the experience was fantastic. I had the hire bike for a few days and Fillipo gave me various options to cater for my needs in terms of levels of difficulty required . This company is fantastic to deal with and provide a high quality service to satisfy all your cycling requirements and the beer in the fridge was also very nice......Thanks Biko for making my stay in Prague one to remember

Seeing a different side of Prague. The ideal vacation for me is To be outdoors and physically active while exploring a new area. Biko did not disappoint!!! My twenty-something kids and I did the bike tour to Karjlsten Castle and the trail 10k while we were in Prague. I really can't say enough about the entire experience-- from gathering info about the best tours for us, the booking,transportation and actual tours , Biko was a pleasure to work with. In contrast to some other tour companies, Fillippo and Mark were so professional and are obviously committed to providing the best experience possible. I wish them the very best--they are ahead of the curve with offering a more active way to vacation! I really wish we had more time in Prague--there were more Biko adventures we wanted to experience!!

Road to Karlstejn Castle. We were fortunate to end up having a private tour to Karlstejn Castle, as the rain had dissuaded the other booked riders from coming along (Aussies are made of sterner stuff than that!), so we headed off with Marek, our guide for the day. We had no wet weather gear, but no problem, Marek provided raincoats for both of us - along with good helmets, water and of course, great bikes. The scenery was gorgeous (even in the drizzle), the route taking us mostly along the riverside. We stopped at a village bakery for pastries, then late lunched at a cafe right at the base of the castle. Then on to the train with the bikes for the trip back to Prague.We couldn't recommend this trip strongly enough - a lovely way to see some of the countryside outside Prague. We only wish we had been able to avail ourselves of the other Biko options in Prague - next time!

Road bike to Karlstein. We wanted to travel independently, in spite of Filippo's warnings about cycling with Prague trams and route finding.Biko were efficient and welcoming , and we spent an enjoyable if at times hair raising day. Maybe we should have taken the advice and had a guide.
