Great fun, great views. A group of 7 of us took this tour. The guide was great and we got to see much more of Prague than with a traditional tour. We stopped off for some traditional Czech beer and food which were enjoyed by everyone. Would definitely return if In Prague again.

Karlstejn Castle-ing!. Great weather when we biked off and it was awesome to get out of the city into the lovely countryside. It gives a different feel from the Old Town. Mark was very nice to take care of us throughout the journey and helped to snap photos of us too for memories. Filippo was also very friendly when we were booking this trip.We were pretty novice in biking, so a tip would be if you are super slow like us, do take a completely private tour so that you could ride at your own pace and enjoy the moment. Else, it will be a little stressful trying to keep up with the team on the bike trail yet trying to soak in the lovely views of the river streams and pretty houses. The castle visit wasn't that fabulous but the trip with Biko to it makes it worthwhile.

Singltrek pod Smrkem. If you are only to Prague you can miss one of the best mountain / trekking bike single tracks in Czech Republic. Just 2 hrs from Prague via highway to Liberec and the 30 minutes to Nove Mesto pod Smrkem and its one way, forest and amazing views equipped tracks that are available for all categories - from kids (green) to teens (blue), or experienced bikers (red) and finally the black marked for MTB enthusiasists.There is more than 80km of tracks, some partially in Poland, bikes are there for rent (any type / dimension) starting at cca 500 CZK (25USD) per day, two ID's needed.http://www.singltrekpodsmrkem.cz/?lang=enTracks are safe, easy to bike, be ready for a fresh air!

A great way to see the countryside!. We did the road to Karlstejn classic tour. The route follows the river most of the way and the scenery is just beautiful. There are many quaint villages and beautiful homes, bridges and other gorgeous scenery to admire. It was so nice to get into a bit of nature after being in the hustle and bustle of the city. Our guide Mark was excellent at making sure everyone was comfortable and the group was going at a good pace. You can make this trip no matter your level of fitness. We ride regularly so we went pretty fast but you could easily go more slowly and there aren't many hills to battle as well. Great tour and if we'd stayed a few more days in Prague I would have loved to take more with Biko!

fresh air in a city. Professional, reliable, excellent escort [very chivalrous too - carried my husbands bag] around the parks of Prague. Great day's cycle, we did the difficult version, we'd say it was nothing more than a blue technically - but could be made a red by guide. You needed strong legs though..

Great experience!. My husband and I did the Karsltejn Castle ride from Prague and had such a great time, would highly recommend it. Filippo helped us arrange everything and was incredibly friendly and helpful, due to the recent floods we had to change some things around but he made it work. Mark was our guide and we were lucky to have a private guide that day so he was really accommodating and let us go out whichever pace we wanted. Bikes and helmets were nice and they provided water for the trip. Overall this was one of our best memories while in Prague thanks so much for a great time!Ryan & Jackie

An Amazing Time. We visited back in June right after the huge floods in Eastern Europe. Because of this, Filippo could not take us to the castle but we could not have had a better time. He gave us a custom tour encompassing everything.....gorgeous views, the city, parks etc. He was not only knowledgeable but very down to earth, friendly and he really cared that we had a good time. It was a huge contrast to a bike tour we took in Germany a few days later. You would be doing yourself a disservice if you don't reserve with Biko Adventures when you visit!

Terrific Time - went back for more!!. My son and I were travelling through Europe and made a stop in Prague for a few days. I had contacted Filippo about doing one of his bike tours, and settled on the easy Ride to Karlsjen Castle. We were set up with very nice bikes, and had a great time with our guide Mark taking a leisurely ride out to the castle. We went at our own pace, so there was not pressure to ride fast (or slow - if that was the case). Both of us enjoyed the ride so much that we came back a couple of days later and did the Blocks and Parks tour (took the easy ride on that one too). Marek was our guide on that ride, and he kept us informed about the history of the areas we rode through as we progressed through a section of the city that was built up during the communist rule in the 1970's and 1980's. Then on to some park areas in/above the city where we caught some beautiful scenery of the countryside and of the city itself. Do yourself a favor and sign up for one of the tours with these guys, it's a great way to spend a few hours and see a different perspective of the city! I will definitely be coming back for more next time I'm in Prague!

A great day, a great trip. Lucie really did an excellent job. I did the advanced trip to the brewery. It was challenging at points, but easily doable by a reasonably fit novice mountain biker such as myself. The course was very scenic and varied. Some city riding, but plenty of trails through woods and fields; dirt/mud, gravel, and asphalt equally. I got quite dirty, but no more than expected for such a trip.

Mountain Biking in Prague. We took the Great Escape tour with Biko and enjoyed it immensely. We booked directly with Filippo, who is the owner and was very responsive and took care of our requests. If you mountain bike and are in Prague this is a must do. It's a great way to see the city and surrounding areas that you normally do not get to see. Our guide Honza was great and provided us background of the areas we biked. All in all, an excellent way to spend couple hours in Prague. Thanks Filippo and Honza for a great day!

Fun ride to. My husband and I did the private ride with Adam to the Karlstejn castle. The route varied from roads to bike paths to trails. It was a really hot day but we had a wonderful ride. We saw a lot of the countryside and some small towns on the way. I must admit that the ride was a bit challenging for me with the weather but the pace was good and the distance good. We both ride often but I don't ride on city streets or trails much so I was a bit nervous. My husband was experienced on all aspects. I would highly recommend this trip. Thanks Adam for guiding us as I would not have done it without a guide.

Great tour great tour guide ...so much fun! Everyone must do it!. This was so much fun! I have been totally recommending it to everyone! First we were greeted by a very lovely tour guide Marek. Everything he did was very professional yet super friendly! I really enjoyed the mountain biking ok... Maybe there was one part where I got a little scared (I am a big wimp) Marek was so great as when he could see I was struggling he slowed everything down and helped me and I didn't feel like a loser haha! I kept saying "oh I'm sorry" and he was like "no worries" the second part of the tour was really beautiful we were really lucky to see some hidden parts or Prague! I also loved how we finished the tour with a nice cold beer! Exactly what you need :-) Thank you guys and I've been wearing the t-shirt heaps haha xx

My favourite tour of all time!. Although I usually do a short tour to familiarise myself with a city, I generally have less interest in buildings and monuments, and more interest in the contemporary culture and authentic experiences. I also like the outdoors aspects of a city. The blocks and parks tour with Marek ticked all my boxes. We saw parts of the city outside the central district that few tourists would ever see, it's a taste of real life for real locals. The other part of the tour is the amazing parkland that surrounds Prague. You get to do some real mountain bike riding along tracks through fields and forests and it's great fun. Make sure you dress for the outdoors. You will see some great views. Finally, Marek was a great guide, he speaks perfect English having lived in the UK and is a really easy going and good humoured guy. It requires a little bit of hard work so is also a good workout which you will need after all the food in Prague. So if you want an authentic view of life in Prague and to get away from the tourist masses (and to get a bit of exercise) then I can't recommend the blocks and parks tour highly enough.

Savage Single Tack in Prague. Spent a day with Fillippo on the Great Escape cycling tour... highly recommended for those who want something different and are up for some single track fun... Some really nice flowing single track and plenty of real nice fast technical bits to get the blood flowingl...Kamikaze and Barking Dog are lots of fun for those who are up for it..... Great way to spend a day away from the hussle and bussle of central Prague...good craic and all in all a top day out.......

Great adventure up to anyone. We enjoyed more than anyhing during our visit to Prague an exciting bike trip to Karlstjen. Despite weather was not the best we felt always safe and guiding was exceptional. The road is fairly easy and the views are incredible. We would recommend it to everybody.

Bike Hire. We hired bikes from Biko in order to take part in a local triathlon. The service we had from Filippo was wonderful; he couldn't have been more helpful or more accommodating to our specific and detailed needs. If I was ever in Prague again I would use Biko without any hesitation whatsoever - and the T-shirts and beer were wonderful as well!

Permium single track. We went with Biko on their single treck paradise tour and had an excellent day with fun mountain biking and good company. If we go back to Prague we will definitely try another tour and will not hesitate to recommend Biko to others

A fantastic intro to Prague!!. I went on a 10k running tour with Marek and had a great time. It was a fantastic way to see the city in short period of time and because we left early, we beat the crowds to all the great locations. If you are an advanced runner, you can move quickly and you will enjoy the incline challenge. Beginners can walk the hills if need be. Either way you will get spectacular views send a great workout. The experience enriched my later tours and long walks.
Bike Hire. I hired a bike from Biko to compete in a local triathlon. Exceptional service and friendly staff. The bike was great and saved a lot of hassle. Thanks Fillippo.

Great Morning running with Marek!! Definitely recommended!!. My son and I did a 10k run with Marek this morning! This was a great way to see the city! Marek was a great host and even led us off the route to show us a vegetarian restaurant that he recommended, (which we later went to for lunch and it was fantastic!!) I would definitely recommend this as a great way of seeing the city, Marek ran at a pace that suited us, and I'm sure would be happy to speed up or slow down to suit everyone's needs!!

Not your average bike tour. I participated last week in the Great Escape tour with Honza. I was very impressed with the quality of the equipment that they loan to their customers, as well as the warmth and friendliness of the entire Biko staff. I was very happy to find Biko because I was looking for a tour that was a bit out of the ordinary. I did not want to ride a bicycle in the old town, but rather see a different side of Prague, and I was not disappointed. I strongly recommend Biko to everybody and definitely the "Great Escape" tour to any mountain biker.

An active day in Czech capital. Biko Adventures are a small, starting company, yet their service is professional in every detail. The bikes are all of very high quality. Owners accompanied us on the trip and took good care of us. They know the roads and have everything planned. Besides, they are very nice people and were a great company on the way. Our tour was one of the easier ones. Also not very sporty people could easily follow the trip thanks to electric bikes. But it was challenging enough to feel tired afterwards, which was good for us who spend most of the time at work sitting at our desks. The only thing I could complain about, was that the tour was delayed almost an hour, but it was not actually Biko Adventures' fault - they had to borrow some electric bikes from another company, as we were a big group, and someone from the other company was late. I would recommend taking such a trip to anyone, who wants to spend an active day in Prague, not necessarily in the most common and crowded tourist spots.

Fantastic Ride!. We selected the Block and parks tour. I would say this tour is 60% city roads and 40% dirt. For my wife it was a little too much, she is not adventurous and you must be in good shape. We rode aprox 30kms, 3.5hrs. Unfortunately we were not dressed accordingly, we had no idea we were going to do dirt roads and mountains, we thought it was more like a city tour.Our tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable, it was quite interesting hearing all the stories about communism.The giant bikes we used had disc brakes in front and back wheel, excellent equipment. If you like to ride bikes and have the time I really recommend this tour.

Great ride to Karlstejn. While visiting our son and daughter in law in Prague, they surprised me with a Father's Day gift -a ride to Karlstejn Castle!! I can check off "Cycling in Europe" from my bucket list - it was geat!!Flippo and Biko did an outstanding job fitting us on some top notch road bikes, provided maps and a GPS. He thought of everything, even sending a repair kit which we needed to fix a flat tire. And he was so responsive to our calls (the flooding in the area created some rerouting), he walked us through it all. If you are headed to Prague and enjoy outdoor activities, get in touch with Biko - they will make it happen for you! Thanks Flippo, until next time...

The highlight of our trip to Prague!. The tour with the Biko Team to Castle Karlstejn outside Prague was absolutely amazing. Everyone in the group was taken care of, nobody left behind. The organization was perfect and we got really nice bikes (normal and E-bikes) which were fun to ride.We can recommend everyone who spends a few days in Prague and wants to have an unforgettable day to book a tour with the Biko Team. You won't regret it!

A Must Do In Prague..... I did a recent mountain biking trip with Filippo. He and his staff are outstanding and provide a great experience. If you mountain bike, this is a must do activity in Prague. Thanks for the great experience

Fantastic Experience. I had a fantastic experience with Flippo, the owner. Because of the river flooding he had to improvise a new route, and wound up combining multiple of the difficult routes for me. The end result was a wonderful 6 hour journey that let me see more of Prague than I'd ever see in a lifetime as a normal tourist. The equipment is great and well maintained. Flippo speaks impeccable English and is a great riding companion.I'd recommend a guided tour over renting a bike as route finding around Prague is less than obvious, and few Czech's outside of the Old Town Square.

Beautiful sights, fun bike, awesome day!. We really had a magical day on our Karlstejn Classic tour with Adam. It was so neat to see the transition from city to country over the course of the 23 mi bike trip. Whenever the wind really shook the trees, a cloud of delicate white flowers would float down around us- I felt like I was in a dream. The route was just beautiful: following 2 rivers, through green pastures, stopping at a wonderful country bakery, past a stone monastery all the way out to the base of the Castle. Our guide Adam is a very smart Prague college student, and he was knowledgeable and accommodating for the many hours of our tour. Adam took our group of 4 to a wonderful restaurant with a view of the castle and gave us plenty of time to walk around the castle and its beautiful grounds. We took the train back to Prague (good planning on their part!) and had a fun quick pedal through the city to get from the train station to their shop. Fillipo managed our tour selection and reservation process via email. They have tours to suit everybody from couch potato to triathlete, and the Karlstejn Classic was the perfect tour for us. Like many of the interesting and creative people in Prague, Fillipo also has a passion for design. He designed and printed the Biko T shirts for sale in the shop which look beautiful and have fun design references to major architectural styles of the city. We each bought a shirt, and I thought is was so great that each shirt came with its own hand made tag that gave a fun history lesson about the architecture that inspired it.We had such a great time that we tried to do the Prague Parks tour the next day. We were rained out (little did we know the flood was coming 48 hours later). For our next visit, I will schedule our Biko tour during the early park of our trip so we can have a make up day in case of rain. Thanks for a great experience, and we hope to see Adam, Filipo, and the Biko team again!

Karlstejn Classic. We booked up and joined the classic tour in May as a couple. It was excellent, everything it says on the tin and more. Our group was small, just us and another couple. The bikes were new and in excellent condition, helmets were provided and the guide, Adam, was local, knowledgeable, informative and friendly. He also set the pace for the group and asked if it was OK for everyone. The route was well planned but also allowed flexibility on where and when to stop and for how long. We cycled along riverside cycle paths for a great part of the way. This was relaxing as they were wide and well-maintained. The scenery was lovely, very green, lots of glimpses of local life including a stop at a little bakery. The castle at the end was fairytale-like and the restaurant recommended was great, super friendly and offering a variety of traditional local dishes. he tour was the highlight of our trip to Prague. Thank you to Filippo, Adam and the Biko team!

Great way to see Prague. Our first full day in Prague we took the 10K running with Marek - it was a great experience. He took us to all the major landmarks as well as some locations off the beaten path. The tour is a great way to see Prague with a very knowledgeable guide, I highly recommend it when visiting the city.

Can't Miss. I took the Mountain Bike and Beer tour and it was well worth the time and money. Filippo was our very hands on and engaging tour guide. Unlike many guides who just lead you geographically on a tour, He took the time to guide us through Pragues culture as well. At the brewery we had great beer and even more amazing food that was by far the best meal we had in Prague. I felt like Anthony Bourdain, with Filippo being the local showing me the off the beaten path places to go to eat and drink in Prague. The brewery is far too distant from the main part of the city for normal tourist to see, and I'm glad i got the opportunity to experience it with a GREAT guide who was really worth getting to know.

Highly Recommended. I came to Prague looking for a bike to ride for the day and these guys hooked me up. Filippo and his wife even came in on a Sunday morning to get me a bike and gave me a nice description of where to go. I am a starving graduate student and didn't want to pay for a guided tour but I am sure it would have been a great time. My bike was in good working order and they gave me tools, patches, an extra tube... everything I needed.
Great ride. Biko offered a great way to see the Czech countryside and to get away from the crowds of Prague.Top quality bikes; personable and informative guides and a good ride. We highly recommend

The best thing we did. It was our aim to see some of the Bavarian countryside and the ride and the leader did not disappoint! Beginning at the shop the fantastic quality and range of bikes were impressive. It was clear that the bikes were well maintained. The owner and guide for the day was so friendly and knowledgeable. The country side was lovely. We did the 32km course and riding on a range of smooth paths and flat off ride was the perfect mix for someone like myself who hasn't ridden for 6 months. This was a much better way to see the local castle and to enjoy a local lunch nearby. The whole day was so much fun.

Wow and wow again!. I wanted a unique way to celebrate my birthday while in Prague...and Biko allowed me to do just that. What a wonderful, fun and memorable experience it was. Customer service is key to Filippo, the owner and Adam, our tour guide. We were glad to sit on a bike after walking all over the place and to get out of the city to explore the surroundings of Prague. The bike ride to Karlstejn was relaxing but you still got some good exercise out of it, while enjoying the small Czech villages and bakeries on the way. The castle was majestic. And the Pilsner tasted so much better after the 5 hour of riding. So thank you Filippo and Adam, you made my birthday memorable!

A fantastic day in the country. Filippo tailored a wonder day trip out to Cesky Raj for my Mum and I. As my Mum is almost 80years old Filippo was able to show us the best sights with the least amount of walking. He also showed us places we would never have found by ourselves. We had a wonderful lunch in the forest. Filippo is so passionate about providing a wonderful experience to all of his customers.He is so friendly, it was lovely to spend the day with him. If you are looking for something a little different try Biko, it is a wonderful company.

Awesome mountain bike & beer tour. We did the relatively easy mountain bike and beer tour as part of a stag do. The tour was a great break from the usual stuff you do on such occassion and we all loved the passion of Fillipo, Mark and Denisa for the outdoor and making sure everybody was having a great time. Their flexibility and transparant approach made it all so easy for us as organisers too. Definitely the high light of our trip to Prague and highly recommended if you want to something active & fun and see some more of Prague's beautiful surroundings.And the beer at the brewery wasn't bad either ;)

Real MTB Experience with Biko!!!. Wanted a challenging MTB ride and BIKO delivered. Filippo was my private guide for his Wild river adventure which took us through Prague's parks and country side with some challenging climbs, and downhills, nice combination. We had lunch along the way and finished with a beer and train ride home. Fantastic experience well worth the time the money!!

Family Fun in Prague!. Biko organised a great half day bike trip for us & the kids!
Following the river and through some great parks.
We can highly recommend Biko for a different way to see beautiful Prague and
to have a fun day with teens.

BIKO- Prague Parks Advanced: AMAZING!. Myself and my fiance booked the Prague Parks Advanced tour late the night before we wanted to go, and Biko were accommodating enough to take us. We were greeted by our guide, and Biko owner, Filippo who showed us the beautiful parks Prague has to offer. The tour was definitely, 100%, without-a-doubt THE best thing I have done in Europe. We saw a part of Prague that very few tourists would see and had several amazing panoramic views of the old town square and Charles bridge. Filippo was really friendly, offering knowledge and a bit of the history of Prague. He made us feel really comfortable and was super down to earth.Initially, I though 37kms would be tough to ride, but a lot of it was flat or downhill (aside from the big up hill at the start) and there are plenty of breaks along the way to rest if needed.I would recommend this tour to anyone without any hesitation, it was absolutely fantastic! Thanks Filippo!From Andrew & Jemma from Australia

Totally awesome experience. I did my first mountain biking with Biko and loved every second. I did the Great Escape tour and it was everything I hoped for and more. Filippo was a great guide and completely amazing. Sweet bikes too. I'd 100% recommend Biko.

Biking in Prague. We decided we needed some exercise after all the great food and beer. What a good idea. Had an awesome day with Fillipo touring the outskirts of Prague. Ride not too demanding and the stop at the brewery very good. Fillipo is a great host and guide. When we are back in Prague we will definitely do another ride with Biko.

Way better than I imagined. It was my best biking experience.Flippo is very concerned with making the tours as high quality as possible and he deffinetly delivered, amazing views and sites , super good bikes, and very nice technical parts.I think it's a must for every tourist, local or bike lover. Deffinetly coming back for another one next time :).Kirill

Best ride in Prague!!!. Filippo and his team by far exceeded my expectations.If you are a beginner or a pro @ mountain biking, Biko Adventure is your one stop shop!!The passion shown by Biko’s crew is truly inspiring, they love what they do and clearly reflects in the ride.Thanks a ton!!!From your new friends in Florida

Amazing experience!. My friend and I were taken mountain biking with Filippo and had an amazing time. We got to see everything from small towns outside of Prague to gorgeous parks. Filippo is not only an excellent guide and instructor, but a great person as well. If you enjoy outdoors activities you have to sign up for this tour!

Two fantastic days!. I have now done two mountain bike tours with Biko Adventures and really had a great time on both - Prague Parks and Blocks and Parks.The highlights for me were seeing parts of Prague that I never knew existed, under the guidance of an experienced instructor. The routes had clearly been really carefully planned to give maximum enjoyment and variety. Filippo is flexible in approach, very knowledgeable about Prague and biking, and great company, I recommend Biko tours wholeheartedly - not just for hardcore MTBers but also for anyone who loves getting on a bike and experiencing great scenery and fresh air.

Karlstejn Castle trip with Filippo!. My husband loves to bike, but I'm not such a huge fan (I fall down a lot, even when standing still), so as a treat for my husband we booked a bike tour with Filippo to Karlstejn Castle from Prague. Before the tour Filippo assured us that if the biking was too much for me I could catch the local train to the castle, which is what sold me on such an ambitious journey. Sure enough, at the first opportunity to catch the train I had to do so, but the first half of the ride was still really fun for me and certainly for my husband! Filippo feels like an old friend the moment you meet him and he couldn't have been a better person to spend the day with! Once we all met up at the train station we rode into Karlstejn and my husband and I got a chance to walk up the hill to the castle. At the end of the day we all rode the train back into Prague. As we rode from the station back to the bike shop Filippo pointed out a great Italian spot to eat at, which is where we ended up having dinner and it was fantastic! If you like biking (or your significant other likes biking and you're a good sport) I'd highly recommend taking a tour with Filippo. It was the highlight of our vacation!

Excellent bikes!!!. I can can only say excellent service and bikes. Every year we have a company trip to a city in Europe. It is only at the airport when we know the destination, and that is when we contacted Filippo. Prague would be the destination. The bikes were brand new, Filippo explained where we could have some fun in the hills just outside Prague.If I ever go back to Prague, I would not hesitate to go mountain biking again, but then accompanied by Filippo! To explore the real nice tracks and roads Prague has to offer!!Thanks again, And till next time!!

Great way to see Prague.. I can can only say fantastic. I ride all the time at home and thought it would be fun to do it in different conditions. It was the start of march when I was in Prague so it was cold and snowing but that was great. I had never seen snow before so for me it was very special and coming from the red centre of Australia the conditions couldn't be more different. Filippo was fantastic, very professional and helpful, it didn't feel like I was on a tour rather it was like I was out riding with friends. The bikes are brand new in fact Filippo only assembled the one I was riding the night before. If I ever go back to prague I would not hesitate to go mountain biking with Filippo againThanks mate

If you are up for some serious riding, you'll have a blast!. I booked the "Great Escape" tour with Biko during a three day visit to Prague.The ride was simply amazing!Criss-crossing between urban and wilderness areas I was treated to a lovely view of the city, as well as some VERY beautiful and challenging single-tracks.The gear provided was high level (Scott scale 29' MTB, fitted with SPD pedals as per my request). Fillipo, the manager and guide of my tour, was both fun and knowledgeable - making the ride quite an experience. As a bonus, I was treated to some lovely pictures Fillipo took during the ride.The "Great Escape" runs along approx. 40km, and is Ideal if this is your first time in Prague.If I chance by the area again, I'll be sure to try one of the more single-track oriented trails that Biko offers.

Birthday bike ride in Prague with Biko. For my 50th birthday my wife and I enjoyed a Biko adventure to the Castle Karlstejn outside of Prague. Filippo gave us the first-class treatment, filling in the details about the areas we were riding through, taking photos to help us document our day, and making many helpful suggestions about restaurants and attractions in and around Prague that might interest us. He was very conscientious about providing an exceptional experience, with good quality equipment, and enjoyable rest stops when needed (a welcome cappuccino on a frosty morning!). The scenery was amazing and we felt well taken care of. We definitely will plan another adventure with Biko when we come back to Prague!Thank you Filippo!

The best way to see Prague. I am an avid cyclist and I love to ride and see new places. I had gotten in contact with Fillipo about 3 weeks before my trip to see about renting a bike. They did not have the exact bike I was looking for, but the interactions and the hospitality that Fillipo displayed trying to help me out was very impressive to me. I was so pleased that I decided to try the mountain bike Prague Parks Advanced tour instead since the road bike was not yet ready.I spoke with Fillipo back and forth through email for days leading up to the tour. We talked so much I felt like I was meeting a friend by the time I came to his shop.The tour was a fantastic mix of sight-seeing through some of the best parks in Prague and major tourist attractions. He was willing to go as fast or as slow as I wanted to, stop to take photos and explain the history of the area to me. I love being able to ride a bike so to be able to learn so much about Prague while on a bike was great for me.The tours are set up so even someone who rarely rides a bike could easily enjoy one of the easier versions of the tours without missing much of the history and sight-seeing. This was what impressed me the most. There is also some very difficult sections for people like me who love to test themselves.I am from the USA where customer service is not at a very high level anymore. Fillipo is a genuinely nice guy who loves to show people the city in a fun and unique way. I was more than happy to spend the first half of my day with him, especially because it was obvious that his main goal was to make me happy and be sure that I enjoyed myself in Prague. This was refreshing!I will definitely be back. If ta tour with Biko is not on your "must do" list for a trip to Prague, you are missing out!

Amazing day in the snowy wilderness with Biko. We had an amazing day of cross-country skiing with Biko. Filippo was fantastic from the very first email - friendly, knowledgeable, professional. He made everything so easy - from pre-booking all the kit, to offering biscuits and a thermos of delicious tea on the drive up to the mountains. We had never tried cross-country skiing before, so it was great to feel like we were in good hands, with a friendly guide and someone who had a real passion for the outdoors. We did a 16km route - enough to work up a great appetite for some hearty home-cooked Czech food in a fantastic traditional mountain cabin.We would 110% recommend Biko. I can't wait to go again and am already looking forward to mountain biking in the summer.

Two more fantastic days...... The week before Christmas was my third trip to Prague and the second time that I had chosen to spend some time with Filippo and Biko tours. Yet again it proved to be an inspired decision.Filippo was as helpful as ever in when trying to decide on which activities to do, clearly weather conditions are a consideration at this time of year. Communication in advance of my arrival was excellent, Fillippo emailed frequently with options and suggestions and some pictures to help with the decision making and was happy for the final decision to be made the day before I arrived in the Czech Republic.I chose to try cross country skiing on my first day with Biko and Filippo. I was picked up from my hotel, Mamaison Riverside is just round the corner from where Biko is based so is ideal, and we set off at a rather early 7 a.m. The early start was to avoid the rush hour into Prague, and this allowed us swift progress to the northern region of the Czech Republic called the Jizerske Mountains. Coffee stop en route and we arrived at 9 a.m. This was my first time cross country skiing and the last time I was ever on skis must have been some 20 years ago. Equipment hire was all organised by Filippo and went as smoothly as anything else he organises. I took the suggested option of a lesson with an instructor; this would be a sensible option for any novice. Filippo skied with me that day, though I believe the tour is normally not guided. The scenery was stunning, despite the early morning mist. This area is off the beaten track with limited numbers of tourists, another opportunity to see the real Czech Republic! We had a lunch stop at a ski house where a hearty meal was served and it would be rude not to supplement the lunch with a beer. After 16 km of skiing we were back to the car for the journey back to Prague. A great day was had, as a total novice I found the day physically challenging – but that’s what I wanted – to try something new and see what it was all about. As always Filippo was considerate of my ability and adapted the route accordingly. Despite his best efforts at some extra tuition though, I still never mastered the perfect technique! Well done for tying Filippo!I had two days arranged with Biko and for the second chose the option of hiking. This was at the Czech paradise, or rock city, which is a Unesco world heritage site. An early morning start, once again, allowed us to avoid the Prague commuter traffic. A slightly shorter journey than the skiing trip by car, and a coffee stop en route, got us to the area in good time. This was the day the world was supposed to end... so what better place to spend it than in the wilds of the Czech countryside. The hiking was fantastic, the weather was cold but bright, the routes well signposted and paths well maintained. As described on the Biko web site, the rock formations and mysterious valleys are magical and well worth a visit. Fillipo and I were the only people there which added to the surreal atmosphere. The end of the world arrived and went with no major catastrophe despite the fact we waited with a view over the valley and the rocks to meet our end at the predicted time..... hiking over we headed off to the local town for another authentic Czech lunch, a walk around the square then the trip back to Prague.Both trips were followed up with a brilliant action photo reportage to add to your memories of a great day. As many other have said the tour organisation is fantastic, nothing is too much trouble, the activities are well thought out and planned and you cannot help to feed off the infectious enthusiasm that Filippo has for the great outdoors. The web site is brilliant with clear instruction, guidance and transparent pricing, and offers great value for money in my opinion. The personal service that Biko gives means I’ll be back on my next visit to Prague – many thanks again Filippo for such a memorable couple of days!

Beautiful Prague, beautiful parks by bike. This bike trip is a wonderful way to view Prague and its surrounding parks. Filippo was a most companionable guide and he kindly pushed me up the steep hill at the start of the ride! Thank you Filippo. We saw parts of Prague that most people would never see, as well as enjoying a delicious lunch in a wonderfully un-touristy pub and experiencing a quirky river crossing. Highly recommended.

Fun Times! Must do activity in Prague. In summary: A memorable highlight to my trip to Prague - a "must do" activity if you want to see Prague from a different angle! Unique experience, fun guide and friendly customer service. Best way to see Prague while being active and not the typical tourist attraction. Filippo will take excellent photos of your journey for free and send them to you ! A big plus! Highly recommended.Read below if you want the full details *it's long*After visiting the main sights in Prague's city center and Old Town, I wanted something other than the typical tourist experience - this is where Biko Tours came through to elevate my Prague trip to a whole new level. Filippo Mari is the entrepreneur and owner of Biko Tours - designing guided tours on high quality bikes to bring people to the outer edges of Prague - tours for different activity levels (easy / med/ advanced) and various bike routes to off the beaten track destinations. He's created several themes, routes and itineraries for each tour, i.e "Parks and Blocks" tour to visit Prague's great city parks, or the "Road to Karljsten Castle" which winds its way through the country side to the famous castle. Each route is unique and Filippo strives to make each ride a new experience, so it's not just a "cookie cutter" route. I stayed in Prague during low season (late Nov), so I wasn't sure there were tours still running. Turns out I was the only one who requested for a tour that day, but Filippo went out of his way to take me anyway. I received a private tour (low season has its perks!) but even during peak season, I'd imagine you will receive the same level of undivided attention since he limits his tour groups to 8-10 ppl and makes sure there are 2 guides so everyone is taken care of. Prior to the excursion, he responded on email very promptly and made sure I had all my questions answered, and took great care to email me exact directions from my hotel to the bike shop.On the actual tour, he spends time tailoring the itinerary to what you want to see. He goes at apace you're comfortable with, whether you prefer easier paved trails, or want to amp it up with off road mountain biking for advanced riders, Filippo knows so many different routes that everyone will have a good time without feeling rushed or pressured. Above all, you will be SAFE. He makes sure that everyone is comfortable and no one is left behind. We rode for 35 km starting off in Prague (Andel neighborhood) and biked our way through pretty villages, bridges, and country roads so I could see what life is like outside Prague. The journey was peaceful, picturesque and charming. Filippo led me through hidden trails off the main road so I can catch a glimpse of the best views, something only locals of the area would know about.Filippo will photo-document the trip (he calls it reportage) so you don't have to stop at every picturesque vista to snap a photo. On the other hand, if you are a snap-happy photographer and want to stop every 10 feet, he'll be patient so you can get all the shots you want! What I love about the reportage is you'll finally get to be in the picture - one of the perks if you're traveling alone so you don't have to ask someone else to take a photo for you, or set up your tripod. His photography is creative and professional - Check out his cool website at www.bikotours.com for more information and a photo gallery. He designed it himself and his eye for creative details shows through because he is a former marketing/design manager. Unlike a jaded tour guide, he really seems to care and want to learn more about your culture, your story and is very knowledgable about Prague life, history, and Czech culture. So, in addition to getting an active experience, you'll also get a good dose of education! We even went to hidden little bakery where they gave us free donuts and baked goods!I had an amazing time and highly recommend his company. Biking is the best way to see a city and the countryside, since you can travel so much farther on a bike than on foot. Go visit Prague with Biko Tours!

Something else!. Great trip on the bike in the surroundings of Prague! The guide was really nice and made it a fun and interesting day. Good equipment as well. If you do not want to do the standard stuff in Prague I can recommend this activtty. Also they send us some nice pictures of the day! Can recommend it! Cheers, Robbert

Biko Adventure Mountain Bike & Beer - a must do!. I have been living in Prague for years and I only recently found out about Filippo and Biko Adventures through a friend...and I am so glad I did! To begin, Filippo is incredibly down-to-earth, caring, accommodating and fun, making the hours spent on the trail highly enjoyable and relaxed. He provides a nice balance by letting you be in control and fulfilling his role as an experienced biker/ tour guide. On the trail I asked him if we could stop many times for pictures, I let him know if I needed something like water, and at the end when I was getting tired I just told him this is my pace and I could not go faster. He is there the whole way making sure you have a good time! Also, Filippo really goes above and beyond by taking high-end digital pictures of you along the way...and then he sends them to you after so you have really nice memories of your tour. This guy is really stellar and it reflects throughout the whole tour.The trail itself was a combination of the advanced and easy tour, as I was the first customer of this new route. I love beer, thus I wanted to do this tour in specific. The Uneticke brewery (pivovar) that you bike to dates back to 1710 and produces a very smooth and drinkable lager. The food at lunch is made from produce and farms right there in town - sustainability! Its nice for you as a tourist, you can also see a small town and how the people there live. And as the Czechs do consume the most beer per capita than any other country in the world, this tour is very fitting as you will experience one of the most important part of the Czech culture...their beer!If you have already done the city center, are tired of the masses of people and want to see more of our beautiful city and all the wild nature it has to offer I cannot recommend this or any of Filippo's tours enough! Thank you Filippo for letting me be your guinea pig!

Exciting!. Philippo was awesome as a guide. It was me and him in the melting snow. Not only did this make it amazing scenery in the fall month, but exciting. I'm 23 and fit, and I found Philippo was able to push me enough to challenge me. Very enjoyable and fulfilling. Must do in Prague

Mountain bike fun in Prague. We decided last minute to book a mountain bike trip with Biko Adventures. We got a fast response from Filippo and two days later we were riding the trails around Prague. It was a fantastic tour and a great way to see what else Prague has to offer. Filippo was a great tour guide, he adapts the tour to your wishes, skills and level of physical fitness. Strongly recommended! Check our video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M1HpMJpoYVM&feature=plcp

Very well organized bike tour. I had a short trip to Prague in October and I was lucky to found out several hours for very nice bike ride with Biko Adventures. The tour guide (Filippo) was helpful even beforehand by email and recommended for us to have The Great Escape ride. On the trail the ambience was warm and friendly and it was nice to chat with Filippo. The ride itself was very well planned and there were always possibilities to have short snack breaks or just to enjoy the scenery and wild life (we saw two dears somewhere over there). We had a lunch in just on the right spot on the ride, it isn’t mandatory, but I think that the rest of the ride wouldn’t be so enjoyable without proper Czech country side meal. As a physical workout the Great Escape is good, but not too hard that you couldn’t do anything else on the same day. There are several different stages, like described on the website, some with more demanding technical sections. I really did enjoy the ride and it’s really easy to recommend Biko Adventures to others!

Road Rider Has Great Adventure Escaping The Road. I am a discriminating consumer who rarely feels compelled to provide feedback about a travel experience. That is until I booked a mountain biking tour with Bikoadventures in early October. I am a very fit and competitive road cyclist. I haven't been on a mountain bike in 20 yrs, but I figured I'd swallow my pride and ride "The Great Escape" for the workout. I met my guide Filippo at the shop the morning of the ride I was immediately put at ease by his friendly and easy going manner. When we began our ride I was also very impressed by Filippo's ability to quickly assess my off road skill set and customize the existing route to keep me out of trouble, yet still allow me to enjoy a strenuous workout.  In addition to a physical experience, it was clear to me that Filippo wanted me to be inspired on an emotional level. "The Great Escape" has a great deal of beautiful scenery and thought provoking sights. I will never forget riding along a pasture where sheep were grazing and later stopping near acres of freshly tilled farm land to view an old Communist housing development in the distance. Throughout the ride Filippo acted as a guide and a generous host. He is truly a warm and friendly person who is very concerned about providing his customers with a memorable riding experience. So road riders have no fear, and put a ride with Bikoadventures at the top of your to do list when you visit Prague.

Biko is absolute top!. Biko Adventures was absolutely outstanding in every way. We went to the Singltrek for our tour, which is about 100km away from Prague city center. The van was comfortable, and the driving safe. The mountain bike they provided was very well maintained, meaning it shifted flawlessly, every time. Filippo was my guide, and he knew the riding area "like the back of his hand." Every twisty turn.. right, left, right, hop-over-log, straight, left, etc. Very fast and very fun. At the end of a great, calorie burning day like this, Filippo had the perfect little restaurant picked out to serve a hearty meal. I wish to be in Prague for more time to do another tour with Biko. Ride on Filippo... keep living the dream!"

"Exceptional tour of Prague". My husband and I visited Prague for his birthday and I had booked this tour for him. Filippo was a wonderful guide and not only helped me to pick the best tour, but was able to tailor the tour for both my husband, a more advanced cyclist, and myself. The parks in Prague are beautiful, we would not have had the time to see them if we hadn't done this tour. It was about a 6 hour tour with wonderful views of Prague and great conversation. No need to bring a camera, Filippo sends you home with fabulous pictures to remember your day. If you are looking for an active day to see a beautiful city, this tour should not be missed! Thank you again for the wonderful memories!

Best Bike Tour Experience Ever. My husband and I travelled Europe and love taking Bike Tours. We were referred to Biko by a friend in Prague and were blown away by the experience. We took the easy tour to the Castle with Fillippo and had such a lovely 8 hour bike day. Conversation and company was great, the fact that it was a private tour made it even better, PLUS Fillippo provides wonderful images free of charge (or included in the very very reasonable priced package, however you want to look at it) that made it an even more memorable occasion - a few that will soon be framed in our house! The bikes are top notch and so very comfortable. The stops along the way are well thought out and the lunch and Czech beer even more delicious. Highly recommend anyone wanting a nice way to bike around Prague and get their legs moving to get in touch with Biko. They have a very special thing going on!

Loved our bike adventure!. I was thrilled through my research on Trip Advisor to have found BIko! The" Parks" bike ride was the "five star" highlight of our visit to Prague! A true professional, Filippo provided a truly unique, incredibly fun, full day bike tour which you will not find elsewhere! My husband and I experienced beautiful, out of the ordinary locations, views, scenery as well as delicious local cuisine. I sing my highest praises to Filippo's ability and the product he has put together. The bikes and equipment are of highest quality. Filippo even had back packs for us! While we enjoyed Filippo's delightful company during the ride; his concern for detail, customer service and our well being was evident from my first communication with him through email. After our ride, he sent us fabulous photos which recorded our day! If you enjoy biking, as we do....we HIGHLY recommend a Biko tour! In fact, don't miss out...it will be A DAY TO REMEMBER!!!! IT WAS THE BEST!!!!!  A&M Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

The best day in Prague ever!. It was a great experience and I recommend it to you! I was so many times in Prague, but this was something special. I take Prague Parks tour so I have seen Prague on some different way. It was a great ride with great people. I rode with Filippo and John. They boot were very kind and friendly. Filippo is the owner and he is the right person for this job, he contacted me before the ride and tell me all informations. After the ride he send me beautiful photographs. He is so helpful and beautiful person, so I have really enjoyed ride with him. The ride last about 6 hours, and I have smiled whole the time...I couldn't take of a smile from my face for a rest of the day!Thank you Filippo and John for a great memories!Warmly , I recommend to everyone who like to ride a bike in friendly company, and who want to explore beauty of Prague!

Excellent staff. Once I needed to rent a bike for a day. I found out this shop, met Mark and Pipo, and then my problem was solved. They are really helpful and friendly. I definitely recommend you to ride with this company!

Czech Paradise hiking tour- a wonderful day!. This was even better than we had expected. The Czech Paradise is a magical place and definitely a highlight of our trip. Fiiippo is a great tour guide, we enjoyed our time visiting with him as well as the beautiful scenery. A great way to see the countryside and escape from the city. I would highly recommend this tour.

Great Afternoon!. After reading the reviews and exploring the website, our Biko adventure with Fillippo didn't dissapoint. We are by no means expert bikers, and with my wife being 6 months pregnant, we took Fillippo's recommendation for the Karlstejn tour. The 35 kilometers were no problem for her and Fillippo made it clear from the beginning that we were the boss and could stop and go at our own pace. It was great to traverse through Prague, the surrounding villages, and the countryside in the fresh air and not from the inside of a car or train. I highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for something away from the big crowds and touristy activities straight from the travel guide. Fillippo is a great guide and passionate about what he does. His carefully crafted route was a unique and rewarding experience. We also really enjoyed our photo reportage to remember our BIKO adventure.

Biko - Parks & Blocks and Great Escape Tours. As many others have said in previous reviews you really won’t be disappointed. I spent 6 days in Prague, two of them spent with Biko. Filippo was my tour guide and I did the parks and blocks and the great escape advanced. The tour descriptions are covered on the web site in detail so I won’t repeat here. Both were amazing experiences. The chance to see elements of Prague, beyond the usual tourist haunts, that so many fail to see was inspiring and incredibly enjoyable.Filippo is an incredibly engaging guide, and obviously passionate about mountain biking and the great outdoors. He provides enough information to describe the tour but also leaves time to take in the wonderful views, scenery and architecture. The tours are all his own design and he has managed to put together a brilliant mix of exciting single track runs through woodland countryside, open park cycling, key points of interest and Prague suburbia, truly outstanding. I’ve shared the included reportage with a few friends and they think the pictures are a fantastic record of my adventures and I will treasure them together with the memories of my trips for a long time.On a practical side, the tours are very well organised, consideration is taken of the riders ability and tours can easily be adapted so don’t these are just for the hardcore mountain biker. Communication is great, Fillipo texted regularly to make sure we were OK to go and confirmed I was happy. If you forget some of your gear (as I did) Biko have very reasonably priced replacements.This was my second visit to Prague and I was delighted to have chosen to spend two days with Filipo. I can’t think of anything better that could compare on a ‘things to do in Prague’ list than the tours with Biko. Businesses that offer this level of service and quality experience deserve all the praise they can get. I will definitely be back whenever I am in Prague again, and if you have a spare day or two then get yourself along I’d be amazed how anyone could not have a fantastic time.

Perfect day biking outside Prague. We took the Road to Karlstejn Classic bike tour with Filippo in July 2012 and loved everything about the experience! Biko Adventures is a professional outfit and Filippo a true professional.  We were supplied with excellent bikes - not the usual clunkers we got when renting in Europe - and helmets.  It was just the two of us and Filippo, which we much prefer to large, impersonal tour groups and which allowed us to bike at our own pace. The tour begins on the edge of downtown Prague and the route is planned meticulously to avoid both the cobblestoned congestion of the tourist core and busy roads thereafter. The path quickly gives way to Czech countryside, far from the hustle and bustle of the old city.  It traverses dirt and gravel paths, small side roads, river banks and bridges.  We stopped for lunch at a wonderfully authentic small Czech restaurant, where we enjoyed a cool pint of beer and fried cheese - must-try! - on the patio.  Karlstejn itself was an interesting visit but the majority of the fun was the journey itself, including Filippo's insights and sense of humour.  He loves what he does and it shows.  We highly recommend this tour to cyclists of all levels - we're talking flat route - as the perfect way to escape the crowds and souvenir shops of Prague and discover a different side to the city's environs.

Tremendous day with excellent company!. My wife and I visited Prague for three days last week. During the first day we completed a great deal of sight seeing and we really wanted to see more of the surrounding country. We therefore signed up for the Karlstejn BIKO tour. As a regular cyclist, I was rather apprehensive at first as I don't really like guided tours however, this one is TOTALLY different. Filippo is an excellent, unassuming guide who knows how to get the best out of a tour for his individual customers. We learnt so much about the country and about the Czech way of life. We were able to appreciate the beauty of the surrounding area outside the lovely city (particularly loved the bridges!). Many thanks to Filippo, Denisa and Daniele for a truly inspiring and wonderful day. I would recommend this tour for cyclists of ALL abilities and the bikes were great.Carl and Claire Garton (Jersey,UK)

Great day trip escape from Prague. My wife and I recently took a 2 week trip to Europe and wanted to get off the beaten path for a day trip in Prague. We came upon BIKO Adventures and figured we'd give it a shot. Overall I would rate this company very well. Our bikes were in god shape, the guide was very nice and knowledgable and we had a great time. The trip was very flat and along nice trails or roads and along the river for the most part. We stopped for a nice traditional Czech meal along the way and got to see the Karlstejn castle at the end. Our guide also took some great photos of us along the way. The trip back from Karstejn is on a train in which the guide also paid for (it was included in the 57 € price). Next time if I went back I would challenge myself with the single track ride or the Offroad Karlstejn trip. If you are an experienced rider you will find this ride very easy, but beautiful for an enjoying day trip. The views along the ride and over a rail bridge are one of a kind. I would recommend for couples or groups.

Fantastic day in the sun!. We are a family of 4, two boys aged 13 and 10. We travelled with Filippo on the 35 km bike ride to Karlstejn Castle today, the 14 th August. If you are the sort of person who likes biking, but nothing too strenuous, this trip is an utter joy. Whilst 35km might seem daunting, this route is almost totally flat, has minimal time anywhere other than cycle paths and offers plenty of opportunities to stop en route. Out two kids would readily have cycled back. The countryside is beautiful as is the approach to Karlstejn.Filippo is an outstanding guide and looked after us all very well. We travelled at our own pace and stopped as and when we felt the need.This is that "something different" you always want to do on holiday. So, rather than talk about it, book the tour and enjoy a little more of this beautiful country than you would otherwise see. And, while I am sure there are other bike tours in Prague, this is the ONLY one you should consider.Planning now to get fitter and try the hills next time!

Feel the flow, SingleTrek pod Smrkem. I had an amazing day with Honza doing the fairly new single track area Smrkem. The drive was 2 hours but it was well worth it, the tracks were very well maintained and it really is for anyone, from young kids and families to those more experienced. You go as fast as you want. Honza was really helpful, making sure my bike was always in perfect order and teaching me a few tips about taking the corners faster. If I visit Prague again I'll definitely be back!

A great experience in and around Prague. My wife and I recent spent a week in Prague and one of the highlights of our travels was a day spent with Biko Adventures mountain bike tours. We chose the Karlstejn Castle Classic tour and really enjoyed it. We enjoy bike riding, but we are not "hard core" mountain bikers. That tour was perfect for us. If, on the other hand, you are a truly avid mountain biker, they have a variety of unique tour offerings to suit your skills as well.Our tour lasted for about 7 hours. The company owner, Filippo, emailed me prior to the tour and gave me explicit directions to his shop. Our guide met us at the tram stop and walked us over to the shop, about 2 blocks away. On bicycles, we left from their shop in Prague and the bicycle riding part of the tour ended at Karlstejn Castle, a picturesque "fairtale-like" place in the country. We then traveled by train with our bikes back to Prague. This was a truly private tour with just my wife and me and our guide. The pace was whatever we wanted it to be and was completely in-line with our abilities. We made a stop for lunch at a quaint local Czech restaurant (with excellent food!) We were offered to stop whenever and where ever we wanted...even to swim in the river if we chose to do that. At the Castle, our guide (Martin) watched our bikes for us while we walked the remaining distance up to the Castle. After visiting the Castle, we met up with another private tour (one of the more difficult off road tours) being guided by the company owner (Filippo) and we all stopped together for a drink and a snack right by the Castle. We then all took the train together back to Prague.I highly recommend this company for a unique and really fun experience while in Prague. The tours are truly customized to each individual's desires and abilities. We wanted a scenic, leisurely, fun bike ride through the country and that is exactly what we got. If you prefer a challenging off-road experience, they have that too.Finally, Filippo runs a very good business. He communicates well, responds to emails quickly, is personable, and he appears to truly love what he does. As a bonus, after the tour, he sends a file with photos that the guide takes during the ride.I highly recommend Biko. Please feel free to email with any questions.

Excellent way to get more from your stay to Prague. my girlfriend and i took 2 tours with Biko, the first was for both of us, a relaxing day to Karlstejn castle, the day was a easy ride along the river taking in the wonderful countryside on route,Filippo was a great guide setting the perfect pace to make the most of the day, one of the best ways to arrive to the castle is along the river, I cant recommend the day enough.Tour 2 was a full on day of hard core MTB, we went to a single track on the Polish boarder, amazing day with red and black runs to test yours skills,the sights from the top of the climbs were amazing, as were the descents sweeping through the trees .Amazing way to spend a day, organized perfectly by Filippo, great time we will be back

Perfect cycle guide. Filippo took us to Singltrek pod Smrkem today- the singletrack paradise tour. It's a mountain bike trail centre about 2 hours north of Prague, and recently won an award as one of the best mountain bike centres in the world. Filippo was able to judge our ability and put a route together that worked and was on hand for any malfunctions during the day- bike or rider related! A great value day out and he also shared his tips for where to eat and go in Prague- well worth the money.

Get out of the city for an unforgettable experience. Prague is a beautiful city, but as with all cities there is much more to it than the main tourist attractions, and Filippo's tours are the perfect way to get a feel for the real Prague.My mum and I did the Prague Parks tour and it was one of the highlights of my whole trip. Filippo is a great guide and it was a pleasure to spend the day with him.We cycled through a number of parks around the city which we would have never have seen otherwise. It was great to get away from the crowds of tourists and see some beautiful areas of the city. There are some stunning views of the city as well.We had lunch in a little place where the tradesmen come to get their food, a great way to get a feel for the local culture.If you have a free day in Prague do yourself a favour and go for a ride with Filippo!Thanks for a great day mate!

Outstanding experience. Biko has great mountain bikes - even one big enough for me (I'm 6' 4", 193cm). That alone sets them apart from a lot of MTB tour outfits. Filippo is an extremely entertaining guide with a great sense of humor. We had a great day on the Great Escape tour during our sales kickoff meeting and I am anxious to get back to Prague and do some of the other tours he's put together. One of the best things about Biko is the photo/video souvenirs that Filippo puts together. All in all a great life memory.

Great active-day trip out of Prague!. If you enjoy being active and want to get out of the citty for a bit, this is a great way to do it!Filippo made a real nice route from the outskirts of the city, through the sometimes georgeous Czech countryside all the way to Karlstejn. It's adventurous, sometimes tough and its get your blood and adrenalin pumpin for sure! The guides are very friendly and engaging and also willing to explore new routes along the way. They make great photo's along the way as well.We did the Karlstejn day tour with some friends a while ago and it was really nice and worthwile. It's is definately not just for tourists but also for Prague residents like us. I really recommend it, you might even discover a new passion.We definately come back and do it again!

See the real Czech Republic. If you're the type who doesn't enjoy being herded around the typical tourist route explore around the city and try out Biko Adventure Tours. We had an excellent time riding the outskirts of the city. The staff was engaging and friendly, our guide Fillipo took some high quality photos and customized the tour to match our abilities.

Beyond the architecture and culture of Prague - experience the beautiful sceneery. If you are an outdoor enthusiast who enjoys experiencing the beautiful scenery of the places you visit, look no further than Biko Adventure Mountain Bike Tours while visiting Prague. It was a refreshing change of pace from seeing the typical sites of Prague. Both Fillippo and Mark were superb guides that provided an excellent mix of history and a personal touch to the day. The bikes are top quality and well-maintained. Beyond seeing parts of Prague I never would have experienced otherwise, I have made some new friends that I hope to stay in touch with. If you love to ride, don't miss out on this great experience!!

Great Scenery, Great Company, Great Ride!. My boyfriend and I went on a tour of Prague parks with Felippo and his wife and it was our favorite thing we did in Prague! The route was expertly mapped out and we passed through an amazing variety of different types of parks and neighborhoods, all the while enjoying the friendly company and interesting background information provided by our guides. We rode through forests, along streams, past giant cliffs that you would never imagine to be so close to the city centre, through cute local neighborhoods, beer gardens and historical landmarks. It was nice to get out of the crowded touristy part of town and get a feel for what real Prague was like and we feel lucky to have met such wonderful people. There were amazing views of the city and Felippo took beautiful pictures so we will always remember this ride. This is a great tour and a great tour company.

Once in a lifetime chance!. We did the bike tour to Karljstein Castle last Thursday while we were in Prague. It was amazing!! If you can do one tour this is it! Filippo was the best tour guide. Very professional, courteous, and knowledgable. Never felt rushed and was extremely accomodating to whatever we wanted to do. Ride was easy and the castle was incredible. Best tour ever!

Look no further for a Prague MTB Guide. As I am a technical but not-too-aerobic rider, Biko designed a custom private tour for me which I enjoyed so much that I cancelled my plans to ride with them a second day. The first day we rode pod Smrkem (a world class trail system designed by renown trail-builder Daffyd Davis) outside of Prague, and then a fantastic and unique must-ride route Biko designed called the Great Escape, which is a 30 mile trip all around the city of Prague which impossibly included 20 miles of singletrack. It's an incredible way to experience Prague, get some exercise, and of course ride some killer singletrack. In addition to designing great routes, my Biko guide (Filippo) was a skilled, knowledgeable, and incredibly gracious guide who did everything he could (and indeed even more that he probably should have) to make my ride perfect. I've hired MTB guides all over the world, and Filippo is as good as they come. Totally fluent in English and Italian (and probably other languages with which I am unfamiliar).

FUN has a new definition...and it's right here!. Singletrek at Skrem is where the FUN is at!! 3 days ago I had this wonderful adventure with Filipo and Denisa and I seriously STILL have the smile on my face!!! I honestly can't express just how incredibly beautiful this special place is....it's pure BIKE HEAVEN! ...and nothing will make you feel more ALIVE!! I HIGHLY recommend! BIG thanks to both Filipo and Denisa for the AWESOME day of riding (and the expert tips). I will DEF be back again. :)

Great Day in Prague. My daughter and I just returned from a month of backpacking in Europe. We had a wonderful visit to Prague. One of the highlights of the entire trip was the bike ride to Karlstejn with Biko Adventures. Filippo was a fantastic guide and the bike ride was a very nice escape from the crowds in Prague. The bike ride gave us the opportunity to see the Czech Republic outside of Prague, and it was lovely. I highly recommend this activity.

Great day trip from Prague!. After a few days visiting the beautiful sights in Prague, it was time to venture out of town for some exercise, elbow room and fresh air. Fortunately I found Biko bicycle tours! I met Filippo at his shop, easily reached by public transportation. The bicycles at Biko are first rate and assure a comfortable ride. Filippo made sure that I was fitted properly and then we were off. Just a short ride in the city and then we were on a bike path and rather quickly reached the Czech Republic countryside going along a couple of rivers. How refreshing to not be in the middle of a large crowd at a tourist stop! We would periodically take a stop for a bottle of water along the 3-4 hour ride. We eventually reached the town of Karlstejn with the beauiful castle almost floating in the clouds at the top of a hill. I took a tour of the castle and enjoyed both this and the wonderful views from the top. Filippo then had a great lunch recommendation which we enjoyed outside on a deck. At the end, we loaded our bikes on to a train for the return trip to Prague. A great day!

Prague - a great adventure with Biko. My wife and I did the Prague Parks advanced tour with guide Filippo from Biko Adventures and it was the highlight of our time in Prague. The ride was a mix of bike ways and gravel paths to some testing mountain bike tracks through big, beautiful parks and forests. It was beautifully put together with climbs, descents, single-track and forest roads, passing famous landmarks and giving fantastic views in areas rarely seen by visitors to Prague.Filippo was the perfect guide, friendly and enthusiastic with a great knowledge and feel for the history of Prague and of the areas we rode in. It was just like riding with a long time bike friend. He's a skilled photographer too and provided great photos of our ride.This was a real bike adventure in a famous city of the world and many of my friends who have visited Prague are amazed at how much more of Prague we saw by doing this tour. We would highly recommend Biko Adventures. Warren & Lesley, Brisbane, Australia.

Exactly what I was looking for in a bike tour. I've been living in Prague for two months and wanted to escape the city for a day with my flatmate. I stumbled across the Biko website, and Filippo was quick to respond to my last minute request and find us a guide (Mark). Mark did a great job catering the tour to our interest and cycling ability. The ride itself was very scenic and dotted with the occasional market and beer tent for a short break. Afterwards they shared some great action shots of the day (for free!), and took care of all of the logistics for getting the bikes back while we explored Karlstejn. I'd definitely recommend this company if you're looking to go on a bike tour in or around Prague.

Filippo makes for a fabulous trip. On our recent vacation to Prague, my wife and I wanted to get out and see the Czech countryside and despite being occasional bikers opted for a bike tour with Biko to Karlstejn castle. What a wonderful decision! Beyond choosing a varied 3 - 4 hr route of not-too strenuous biking with gorgeous scenery of rivers, farms, breweries, and bridges, Filippo literally insures that you have a phenomenal experience. In our case this went as far as literally sawing a bike seat-stem prior to our setting out to make sure for a perfect fit ! Filippo always has the client in mind by doing all the little things such as tempering the route, pace, and rest breaks to the riders - and most important of all does not mix groups to insure individualized attention. He also is quite the photographer and sends you a great set of photos at the end. During the trip, we also had ample time to discuss and learn about day to day life in the Czech Republic and see many families enjoying biking, roller-blading, etc. So, getting to that picture perfect castle at the end was almost anti-climactic (but worth the visit too). Definitely will take another ride with Biko next time we are in Prague - and you should too.

Super Fun Single Track in Prague. If you like to MTB on great bikes - this is the place to do it. Filippo is a great tour guide and superb mountain biker - AND he takes awesome photos. You will love these tours - if you like to ride this is the place to go. We liked it so much we went twice during our week in Prague. Super fun time. Highly recommended.

Bike with biko.. My wife and I just got back from a trip to Prague and we spent half a day doing the Prague Parks tour. It was great, our guide was Mark, and he was super laid back and easy going guy. After biking around the parks and villages, we finally made it to the beer garden overlooking the city. While we were sitting there about to get some brew, Filippo showed up and decided to join us for the remainder of our trip, it is clear he just loves to ride. The whole day was very relaxed, and fun, we learned a lot, and saw many things that the standard Prague tourist never even hears about. First rate all the way, and I am already considering a return trip for the Singletrack Paradise...

The higlight of our weekend.... A friend and I booked up the Road to Karljstein off-road during a long weekend trip to Prague in late November 2011 (an unusually mild one!). I was a little anxious about doing the off-road version as I didn't have any previous off-roading experience, but it appealed to me more than the on-road version and my more experienced off-roader buddy assured me I'd be fine, so we decided to go for it. The description on the website is pretty much spot on. It is pretty hard going in places, with some tough up hills and exhilarating downs. It probably pays to be relatively fit, and either fairly experienced / brave / stupid (like me) for some of the more hairy down hill sections. I can also add that from experience, going on a guided beer tour the night before and consuming large amounts of Czech beer is not the best preparation for this trip (although it does make for a damn good night out!). We met our excellent guide Filippo at a local bike hire shop, as it was out of season so his regular bikes had gone back. After a short Metro ride to the outskirts of Prague, our journey began through one of the old Communist suburbs. After the first of three 'substantial' up hills (a good hangover cure!), we soon hit the forest and the true off-road tracks. I found it fascinating looking at the little cottages we passed scattered in the middle of the forest, a throw back to Communist times, when foreign holidays were not an option. Some parts of the forest were a bit on the muddy side (hardly surprising given the time of year), which made for some tricky riding but excellent fun. Upon leaving the first section of forest we soon passed a small herd of deer grazing in a field next to the road, which was a bonus, before passing through some smaller more traditional Czech villages. Next followed one of the most gruelling sections of the trip, a seemingly never-ending up hill along the side of a field. Thankfully this section also has some of the most beautiful scenery, so you have a good excuse to take regular 'photo stops' to get your breath back. At this point in the trip you have a decision to make... take on another up hill and go to see the canyon, or head straight to the castle. Rather surprisingly we had just about enough energy at this point to go for the canyon option, and I'm glad we did as it's a beautiful spot and well worth checking out. The final forest section has the most exhilarating down hill of the trip, which really gets your adrenaline going. Finally the forest clears to reveal the stunning Karljstein castle looming up right in front of you. It really is a spectacular sight, and makes the all the effort worth while. We had just enough time in Karljstein to have a quick look around the castle before grabbing some food, and catching the train back to Prague. During the entire trip Filippo (also the creator of BIKO) was very informative about the places we visited, and we made regular stops for him to point out things of interest. Although he's only lived in Prague for a few years he really knows his history, and it's clear he is very passionate about it. Nothing was too much trouble for the guy, and he is a very warm and friendly character. On top of all of this he's also a talented photographer, and within a couple of days he had e-mailed me a set of professionally processed photos of the trip, what a bonus! In summary, if you like biking and getting outdoors, or just fancy doing something a bit different then I can't recommend BIKO tours enough. Whether you go for one of the easier on-road, or a more demanding off-road tour, it's a fantastic way of seeing a different side of Prague (and beyond).

Get away from the masses of tourists and enjoy some roads less traveled. Biko bike tours was the highlight of my trip to Prague! I spent the first part of my trip seeing the traditional sights such as Prague Castle, Jewish Quarter, the Charles Bridge, etc. It was facinating, but I felt herded like cattle along with the masses of other tourists. My last full day in Prague I did "The Great Escape" expedition with Biko. It was fantastic! In addition to a great workout, I saw post-war communist buildings, amazing back roads, local farms, an abandoned bomb shelter, some great single-track, lunch near a farmer's market in a rural village, and a scenic ride back along the Vltava river. We returned to Prague mid-afternoon and the falling sun illuminating the buildings along the river was gorgeous! I take pictures as a hobby and never felt rushed by Filippo, who was a fantastic guide. Overall, it was a great workout, an amazing education and I have some unique pictures of Prague to share with friends and family back home. Highly recommended!

From castle to castle. As a long term citizen of Prague I was very surprised to discover how much of the country side I was missing out on after I took the BIKO trip to Karlstein castle. It was a great summers day and BIKO made the most of it.
