The route combined witha little improvisation was well tailored to the group's needs; swimming in the river, stopping for some cold beer with sausage and of course when we finished a great garden lunch at the castle. BIKO trips are perfect for those who like to see the city and its surroundings. They offer an alternitive point of view in an active yet still very relaxing way. Even though I went on this trip on my own, the guide made me feel welcome and part of the group immediately. He always tried to accomodate everyones needs. The guide and owner of BIKO company is the one lovely, enthusiastic and inspiring Italian. BIKO trips are highly recommended not only for forigners discovering the Czech Republic but also for adventurous Czechs.

This was great tour and a different way to experience Praha.. This excursion through the countryside of Prague to Karlstejn Castle was an incredible experience. The transition through the heart of the city center to the calm, beautiful Czech countryside is an excellent way to spend the day. Our tour guide from Biko was great. Filippo was knowledgeable, friendly and entertaining. We made brief stops along the way for rest and refreshments, which were very welcome. This was a perfect example of the tour being more about the journey than about the destination.

Fantastic way to see the town. I must say as one who enjoys culture, sights, sounds mixed together with a fantastic workout that Biko tours is a fantastic way to see Prague. Tours start in the heart of the city, but rather than just taking you through the sights of the city you will adventure outside to the surrounding countryside. It's really beautiful, the guides are fun, the pivo alongside the road is ice cold and there is a fabulous adventure awaiting you should you decide to take one of these trips! Ciao

Bike tour of Prague Parks and other features that should not be missed. If you enjoy bicycling and have a couple of spare hours or more I would highly recommend that you take a tour around the Prague Parks with Biko. Biko is run by Filippo. He has developed some unique tours of the city that are suitable for all levels of biking. Filippo is a charming Italian who will show and tell you about each park feature that you visit. A tour with him is unique and a special experience.On a beautiful day in June, in a couple hours of easy biking, we visited a number of the parks around Prague and even took a small ferry across the Vltava. It allowed me to get a new perspective of Prague and it's hidden beauty. I was able to visit some unusual sites in Prague that I would not have seen if I had been a tourist on foot. Strongly recommended tour if you visit PragueSimon Gordon-Smith

Unique and Exciting Tours of Prague!. First and foremost, Filippo is a great tour guide! He's very friendly and knowledgeable about Prague and its surrounding areas. I did the road to Karlstein with a friend and two of my cousins. The sights you see along the way are great and any questions you have Filippo is quick to answer. Lots of great stops along the way as well like a stream to go swimming in(and on a hot day trust me its worth the stop) and even stops at little establishments along the way for some Czech beer or some delicious Kofola! If you are in Prague do yourself a favor and get in touch with BIKO, its loads of fun and they have tours for intermediate to expert riders!

Great way to see the Czech countryside and to do some fantastic single track riding.. We had a great day out with Filippo who arranged dual suspension bikes, sized to accomodate. The route to Karlstejn is a mixture of cross country, through forests and fields, and quiet roads, with some technical downhills in the forests to keep life interesting. Filippo was really accomodating and knows a lot of Czech history so you can get a great overview of where you are riding. All in all a great day out. We would definitely do it again! Good luck Filippo and Denisa. Chris & Sue

Loved it!. Great experience in Prague! Jan was our guide and shared interesting facts and background. Appreciate that short breaks were built in. Would do again!
Karen and Dave

EBike trip in Prague. We were on an E Bike trip in Prague and has previously tried it in other cities, which is a really good way to experience the city of a reletiv short time. Our guide, Jan was really good and have a great knowledge about Prague. In the 5 hours we saw many interesting areas and beautiful views of the city. An experience that only can be recommended. All the best from us.

Done it twice, loved it both times. I would comfortably recommend I Like EBike to anyone visiting Prague and suggest it a compulsory addition to any first time traveler's priority list. I first visited Prague in 2013 and did a tour then and loved it, and just went back with three friends and had an even better experience. The bikes were great, the guides were friendly and informative, and Prague simply has to be seen from the various vantage points included on the trip. Well worth the investment.

Wonderful family afternoon!. We had an absolutely wonderful afternoon recently with I Like eBikes on a private three hour tour for our family of four (mom and kids ages 15, 12, and 10). The eBikes were very user friendly and the tour, especially the parts away from the heavy tourist zones, came with wonderful stories and amazing views. We could have done another couple of hours and been very happy.

Adventurous ride with Mike through Prague. On my visit to Prague, I decided to book an e-bike tour of Prague for the adventure of trying something new and the prospect of covering vast areas quickly. My tour was with Mike, a very friendly, laid back and cool guy who gave me and the group an introduction to the bikes and opportunity to test ride it. The tour itself was full of thrills and exciting challenges, such as navigating out par way through some crowded and uphill areas while adjusting to the quirky and powerful features of the bike. Being in a small and very sociable group felt like it was an outing among friends and Mike took us to very beautiful and rarely visited places in Prague like the football training ground with an interesting Soviet past, the monastic drinking brewery, and some stunning viewing points. Mike was never rushed and keen to have us savour each place we visited and was great company when we did take a break and have a beer. Mike gave us opportunity as a group to socialise and was very patient with our adjustment to the bikes. Overall, it was an extremely enjoyable tour and one I would strongly recommend with Mike who is a fantastic guide. Thank you Mike!

Wow, Wow, Wow!. A much delayed, but necessary review. I took the Prague View Points tour with Patrick in August, and not only were the sites incredible to see via a bike, Patrick was wonderful. After doing a walking tour of Prague, wasn't sure how much more was to be seen. All I can say is this tour allowed me to go places, experience stuff, and see things that no walking tour could have covered. Would I recommend this tour....heck yes! It is a once in a lifetime experience, which I still am talking about as probably my favorite part of visiting Prague.After taking this tour, I did book the tour in Budapest. There was no comparison. Budapest was good, but didn't live up to my expectations after experiencing Prague with I Like EBike which was AMAZING.

Favorite Tour Anywhere!. Jan is the best tour guide ever! The evening tour was perfect. Our small group of three stopped at numerous viewpoints overlooking Prague, allowing for great photo ops. We made short, perfectly adequately-lengthened stops at interesting sights (sculptures, Lennon Wall, etc.), covered the main sights in greater depth, and enjoyed drinks during some free time at the Monastic Brewery. The Ebikes were fun and allowed us to cover so much ground we would have otherwise missed during our short Prague visit. All that being said, Jan really was the best part! He provided interesting insights into Prague culture and politics. I feel that I learned more from Jan than I have any other tour guide, all while zipping through town and taking in the sights. Thanks so much!

Great experience!. Me and My family Did the "real prague" tour with the guide Jan. I just want to say that we had a really great time and Jan is both very Friendly and has a lot of knowledge about prague that he shared with us during the tour! The food we had on the lunchstop was awesome and we just enjoyed the whole experience, getting to see another part of prague than the typical tourist sites. Big Thumbs up!! :)

Excellent guide. If you are in Prague do yourself a favor and book this trip. We took a 5 hour eBike tour with Jahn who is just a five ***** star guide. Funny, interesting and knows his history. I can't say enough here about this operator, just brilliant.
E-Bike tour of Prague. The E-bike tour was so interesting, with lots of great information and stories, and history, with fabulous views and lovely places. Our guide was GREAT, and it was fun!

Best way to see the city. I was visiting Prague from Toronto for a 4 day extended weekend and really wanted to make sure I properly saw the city - I did the 3 hour central tour and the 5 hour "real Prague" tour which was focussed more on Prague's communist history/architecture. Both were excellent but if I could only do one, the 3 hour central tour is the way to go - great for individuals, couples and families. Our tour guide Mike was very knowledgeable and a lot of fun.
One of the best tours. I really enjoyed the tour. It was something different and a chance to see Prague in a unique way. I would recommend it to every one. Guides were nice and pleasant.

Excellent way to visit Prag. We had a fun tour, fantastic way to discover Prag. We went through different parcs and had magnificent views over the city. Jan gave us lots of explanations about the monuments, but also about the culture and traditions in Prag. I highly recommend this tour!

Nice tour with great views. We took the 5 hour city highlights tour and enjoyed it. The tour took us along bike paths for the most part and offered quite a few stops where we were able to capture sweeping views of the city. The tour was a comfortable pace and entertaining. The e-bikes are easy to use once you figure them out and extremely useful on those few occasions you are riding on cobblestone and/or uphill.

Prague electric bike tour. We were fortunate enough to have the tour to ourselves. (Tip: do the morning tour, less people and less traffic/crowds).Mike was great, personable and knowledgeable.Well worth it, bikes make the hills a breeze and cover plenty of territory.

Great Experience in Prague.. We had a great time with Jan on 3-hour tour on the eBikes! I really enjoyed the time with the team, it was a great fun. It is really great experience to explore the beauty of Prague on a bike.Well recommended!

Great way to see the highlights of Prague with a personal touch. This was our second tour in two years with I LIke eBike, and it was just as good as the first. Our personable and enthusiastic guide, Mike, went to great lengths to ensure we had a great time. When one of our party had difficulty handling her bike, Mike gave her his own lighter version after which she had no problems. On the View Ride, we saw more in 5 hours than we could have in more than a day on foot. Highlights included a stop at Prague Castle, a cruise up Petrin Hill, the stadium, the Strahov Monastery brewery, and Letna Park.Thanks again to Mike and the team at I Like eBike for another great tour!

Real Prague tour. We did the Real Prague tour as a way of escaping the hoards of tourists and seeing the authentic local way of life. Our guide Tomas was excellent - friendly, knowledgable, and fun to spend the time with. The ride took us to see some great views of the city and river as well as showing us some really interesting places which showcased local life both of the communist era and the present day. Learnt a lot and had a really enjoyable day. Would recommend for anyone wishing to delve beyond the tourist circuit and see a fascinating side of this wonderful city.

Please don't miss this amazing Bike Tour. With the greatest of ease, excellent instruction on bike usage, and full of great knowledge we had some amazing tours (I saw Tour 2) with lasted about 5 hours and hit most of the desirable sites while getting a perspective on city size and place in history. I thought Mike did a great job leading our tour.
EBIke Prague . We had a great time with Jan from EBIke. A great tour, great sites visited, very caring and knowledgeable leader and great bikes all at a reasonable price. Thanks you Jan.

A Must. This was one of my favorite things I got to do in Prague. If you only have one day, or a whole week to visit this magical city, you must do the eBike Tour!! My cousin and I did the five hour tour and it was an absolute blast. Our guide Jan was so informative and fun! There was never a dull moment and every site was spectacular- I honestly couldn't ask for more or give a higher rating. I can't wait to go back and do it again.

Prague e-bike tour. We had 3 days in Prague and had seen much of the historical spots but before we even had arrived we had booked "The Real Prague" with e bikes. We wanted to get a bit off the beaten path and see Prague by bike. We thoroughly enjoyed our day. Jan was a wonderful guide and host. He was informative and answered any questions we had. The e bikes were easy to use and so fun. There was no limitation to where we toured. The staff all friendly. A great way to tour and see parts of Prague we would have missed. We also booked e bikes for our time in Budapest. Can't wait. Thanks e-bikes & Jan

Great way to tour Prague. We visited Prague in September 16, and decided use Ebike tours to visit some of the popular spots. First of all Prague is quite hilly especially when touring the old town, but the EBikes we used made cycling around very easy, and we very quickly got familiar with the assisted gearing on the bike. Peddling up hill was no effort at all.Our tour guide for the afternoon was a guy called Mike, who was very knowledgeable and passionate about Prague, we enjoyed his enthusiasm and company during the tour.We started the tour at 2:00pm and visited many areas of the city, stoping at each point of interest to be told and chat about the history and stopped a couple of times for refreshments, the tour ended back at the office around 7:00pm. Neither me or my wife are cyclists, but this tour was a very safe and relaxing way to visit the popular spots. I would recommend this tour to anyone who visits Prague.
Prague biking tour :). The best bike tour ever!!with the magnificent tour guide "MikE". We really enjoyed our time with you :)

Awesome way to see Prague. We were looking for a way to see Prague that wasn't your standard tour-and we found it! We had walked around for a few days and saw many of the attractions the city has to offer, but were looking for a little more. Our concierge highly recommended 'The Real Prague' ebike tour, and we are so happy she did! We were able to see areas we never would have known to check out, beautiful parks, a beach area where locals go, and some neighborhoods that are outside the city center, but more typical of how many Czech people live. Our guide, Tomas, was great. He shared some history of the city as we stopped at many different locations, and was open and willing to answer any questions we had. He even had some great suggestions of places to go over the next few days (Tomas, the beer garden and ice cream place were phenomenal, and we never would have known!). And the bikes? So fun! Hardly had to pedal, and very easy to use. Don't hesitate to go on this tour or any with them! You will be pleased that you did. Definitely a highlight of our trip.

Prague e-bike Tour with Jan. A fab tour and a fab way to see the city & learn some history. Jan was a phenomenal guide, and -- WOW, Prague by bike!!! It's relaxing because you're on ebikes for all those steep roads, and it's just silly, simple fun to boot around on the bikes like that. I really enjoyed myself.
E-Bike Prague Tour. Wonderful chance to get around Prague: by E-Bike. Easily access the mountains and ride through Pragues nice places and parks.

Highlight of our trip - booked 2 tours in 5 days. I like ebike is the best way to see Prague! Mike & Jan were excellent guides and showed us the beautiful sights as well as the real Prague. They were knowledgeable, fun, and super informative. Enjoyed this so much and cannot recommend this tour enough. Truly the highlight of our stay in Prague.

I'll only Ebike from now on!! . 5 hour Real Prague Tour. First time using an E Bike and loved it, the Prague city is hilly and when we first thought of a bike tour (we do them everywhere we go) I was nervous as not an amazing bike rider. The Ebike took all those nerves away in minutes, especially for the small amount of riding on big roads during the tour - most of the riding is done on paths or through parks. Patrick was a great guide! Fun, informative and really open to conversations about the sites he is showing you and general life in Prague itself and some of his own experiences. You'll see areas of Prague you'd never find as a tourist and I don't think any or many other tours would include the suburbs to get a feel for real life. A meal in a local suburban pub, a traditional Czech meal was great to try - it was a really cool experience. (The meal is at your own expense but very cheap and tasty) The bikes are of high quality and really well looked after. Small group sizes - there was on my partner and I in the group and I believe they mentioned most groups are about 4 or 5 people.

Fun day out! . Highly recommend the Real Prague tour and getting a little out of the centre and off the beaten path. Patrick was a lot of fun; informative, happy to suggest photo spots and take snaps for us, adapted his style and language to his audience and added charisma to the day. The tour itself was fun - we saw places we would have never seen on our own.Lunch was a good, traditional experience. I can't say I'm in love with Czech food but we enjoyed trying something authentic. The e bikes were fun. Took a few goes to get used to it but in a few minutes, we were loving it! Definitely recommend over segways which are banned in many parts of Prague and mostly just annoy other people. Price seemed reasonable and fair, especially for 5 hours. Would recommend this tour to friends in a second.

"Amazing tour". We recently visited Prague in June just prior to doing a River Cruise. Jan was amazing !He was very professional and very friendly from beginning to end. The bikes were very easy to handle and in great condition. We opted for the 5hr tour which was great. It was the best way to see Prague. We went to places that we wouldn't have been able to go with a car or bus tour. Jan was lots of fun and very knowledgeable . We highly recommend this tour ! Don't miss it !

I like EBike Tours. It was simply AMAZING!I usually don't like tours because I honestly find them boring and the guides sometimes go into too much details that at the end you can hardly remember any of it! BUT this experience was totally different! Patrick was an excellent guide and was very interesting and friendly and really made us fall in love with the city and its history. We discovered places we would never have discovered without this tour! Plus Patrick helped us plan the rest of our trip!So to conclude it was one of the best days we had here in Pragues and i would recommend EVERYONE to have this tour!

Discovering Prague by Mike on an e bike !. It was a great experience for me and my husband. We discovered Prague with our super guide Mike. It was such a fun! We were in all hidden places which wouldn't reach otherwise. Completely different from an ordinary city tour and worth to take! Thank you Mike and e bike:)

Best value and pedal assist!. Terrific value and super guide that will hit all the highlights of Prague. You will have some pedaling in traffic during the full day tour, but not a problem. It was great having the small pedal assist motors on the bikes for scaling the many hills of Prague.

Prague ebike tour. We spent a wonderful day touring the outskirts of Prague on ebikes. We had never ridden ebikes before and were somewhat nervous about embarking on this tour. Thanks to Tomas there were never any issues and his patience and concern for our safety was exemplary. Tomas thanks so much for taking care of us and sharing with us the parts of Prague that are home for you. And best of luck as you commence your university studies!!

Take this tour!. What a great way to experience Prague. We took this tour in Budapest also and loved them both. Jan was a great tour guide. He was knowledgeable and a fun guy to hang with. The bikes are easy to handle and it gives you so much freedom to see so much of the city. Don't think twice about booking this tour...you will love it!

Best Way to See Prague. It was such a great decision to do this tour. Our guide Mike was wonderful - super nice, funny, fun, and knowledgeable! We did the five hour tour but it went by so fast. The bikes were really easy to use and we stopped at all the right places. Lunch was amazing too - so glad we got some delicious authentic Czech food and beer :) seriously the best way to see Prague. Highly recommend. Thanks for such a good time :)

Must do way to explore the city!!!. We had a fantastic tour yesterday with Patrik. He took us around the city and shared the history of Prague as well as his own. If you want a break from the crowded cobblestone streets, this is the perfect option. We give them FIVE STARS!!!!

Ebikes make touring a breeze!. Patrik took us around the city and through the outskirts to get great views of the city. Everything was well planned and the bikes were easy to use while providing a lot of assistance when needed. The 5 hour tour ended up feeling pretty short and I felt like I had a great perspective of the city. Thanks Patrik!

best way to see all of prague in a day. We had the best time riding around prague with Tomas and his brother. We were a group of 14 ranging in age from 12 to over 50 and everybody's first time on an e-bike. Everyone in the group enjoyed the tour, they managed to keep the group together and knew just how to keep the kids organized and engaged. At the end of this day you really feel like you saw the majority of this beautiful city.

I like Veggie. What a great tour! The sites, the food stops, It made for a pleasant way to see and experience Prague. Karolina was a friendly and knowledgeable tour guide. It was nice to hear the back stories about the sites. Also the food was very good. Nice to get the inside scoop for a "veggie" like myself. Plenty to eat as well. I would highly recommend this tour. Great job!

Best electric bike tour of Prague!. Highly, highly recommend! Tomas, our guide, took us to all the hot spots around Prague...many of which we wouldn't have know about. This included a monk's brewery and an awesome beer garden with beautiful views. The tour was small (just four of us and our guide) and lasted for about 4 hours. So worth the time and money! I wish there were more ebike options in more cities. Do it!

Top tour. My first time on an ebike and this was lots of fun. We covered a huge amount of territory (without raising a sweat), saw a heap of interesting spots and learned a lot from our super friendly and knowledgeable guide Patrik. The electric bike meant we got way out of the centre, climbed steep hills through parks, and had lunch at a little local piece of heaven I with fabulous food. I can't think of a single improvement: it was well paced, informative and relaxed, with just the right amount of information and anecdotes.

Great way to see Prague. Myself and my partner did the afternoon ebike tour with Jan. Having done ebike tours in Berlin and Rome in the past year we knew that this was an excellent way to see so much of the city very quickly. You will see far more than you would on a regular bike tour or obviously, a walking tour.We both highly recommend this tour and endorse all the other previous positive comments from people who have been on the tour.Enjoy Prague it is a beautiful city!

Fantastic sights and insights. We did the Real Prague tour - 32 km over five hours and we saw so much, and while this was our first time on ebikes it was sooo easy. Patrik was a fantastic guide - excellent english, lots of insights, happy to take questions as he showed us all around the area outside the city centre. There was only the two of us today, but i understand they keep the groups small.

Great EBike tour!!. We had a great E-bike trip in Prague. This is a nice way to discover the city in the beginning of your trip. We had a little bit rain, but the beautiful surroundings during the tour, the poncho's we received AND our positive and excellent guide Mike did us forget the weather. :-)I should recommend this tour to everyone who's visiting Prague for the first time. And don't be affraid of the Ebike's -> young or old, anyone can ride it!

Must do !!. What an experience ! We visited Prague with the talented guide Jan during 5h on an electric bike. We were lucky to be the only ones on Tour so it was very private. With the bike it is effortless to climb the steep city hills and we were rewarded with stunning views ! I recommend i like ebike to all people visiting Prague. It will lift your experience to a higher level ! Thanks Jan ! And btw : Noi was amazing :-).

Fun, entertaining, interesting and personal. After a couple of days walking the usual city centre streets of Prague, this electric bike tour was a perfect way to expand the range, view and scope of my visit. With five other riders in our group we enjoyed some great vantage spots, chaperoned by Jan, our guide, who added fascinating background, history and local insight. Riding uphill effortlessly under electric power was fun and the bikes allowed us to cover a lot of ground, taking in several city-wide vistas and points of interest well off the usual tourist trail. Highly recommended!

Prague electric bike tour. great way to get around the city. Informative guides, friendly. No way you can see the city in two days as you can on the bikes in 5 hours. learning curve on how to handle the bikes is about 5 minutes, after that you are a pro! The scenes from the hills, parks is breathtaking. Stopping for local fair, beer and sausage, is fun.

Perfect way to see the city!. I was so satisfied with this tour. Our guide Jan was personable and friendly, as well as very knowledgeable. Immediately after my friend and I agreed that there was no way we would have had the same experience without the EBikes (walking that much would've taken 2-3 days) and that we saw everything and learned about everything we wanted.

E bikes are the best!. My wife and I were given a recommendation from some friends who had been in Prague the week earlier that we had to try the 5 hour tour with a Mike. I was a bit skeptical about being on a bike for 5 hours, but it wasn't an issue at all. The e bikes were comfortable, easy to use, and made getting around Prague easy. Even going up steep hills to the Prague castle was easy. We covered all the places around Prague I'd researched that I wanted to see. The chance to talk to Mike as well as the other couple on the tour who were from Belgium, about life in Prague and life in Europe was very enjoyable. We dropped by a monastery where we had a chance to try the beer brewed by monks - great opportunity. As it turned out, the day was very rainy, but that didn't take away from our enjoyment at all. Thanks Mike for a great tour!

I like EBike . We had an amazing 5 hour tour of Prague with tour guide Mike. The tour gives you the opportunity to see areas of interest and historic places, it's well planned with excellent chosen rest spots for refreshments. Mike is so knowledgeable and gives a brilliant explanation and history of the areas you visit as your guide. The bikes are well maintained and very comfortable let the bike take you across Prague with ease. Well done Mike the restaurants you recommend were just fab !!! Debbie and Elwira

Absolute best way to see prague. This was by far the highlight of my trip. The tour and the bikes are fantastic. Guides are very knowledgeable and are super friendly, making sure you have fun and see all the best spots. The electric bikes provide you with the opportunity to see the best views with ease, walking or biking up those hills would be treacherous. I can see how some may find it pricey, but for the 5 hours i spent with michal, i can say it was worth every penny.

The Best Way To Visit Prague !. BEST 5 HOURS SPENT IN PRAGUE !There are many types of tours you can take in this beautiful city, but this bike tour is by far the best of the best. I have traveled to many European cities and loved this concept. This tour gives you an entire overview of what the city has to offer. What makes it special is the tour guide – Jan. He was very informative about the attractions, but the best part was his insight into every day culture in Prague. Ask him anything, and he has a great story to tell. He was very patient when we took a little longer at some stops and he was always concerned for our well- being. You might be thinking “how can I bike for 5 hours” . . . These bikes are equipped with small motors that give you just enough push to get up hills and terrain effortlessly. There are baskets on the bike for a coat or package, but a backpack is the easiest. Even after the tour was over, my daughter and I asked him about restaurants and night life options and he was filled with great suggestions. He had such an easy going nature and great sense of humor and was always happy to take pictures for us. If you are a little early for your tour, there are great restaurants just a walk away from the bike shop. This was the highlight of our Prague experience and Jan made the magic happen.

Greatest Bike Tour of Prague!. During my last visit to Prague a friend of mine met me there for her first visit.She is an avid bike rider and wanted to experience a bike tour thru Prague.Since I have been to Prague close to 20 times, it was a challenge to find a tour that would interest me, but we did.We contacted the I Like Ebike Team and found out they have many types of tours.We took the Real Prague Tour. It was interesting and our guide Patrik showed us parts of Prague I had never seen. The tour was fun, the I Like E Bike team provided us with great bikes, helmets and even a bottle of water. You just need comfortable clothing and a sense of adventure..The I like E bike team will provide the necessary instructions and guide you the whole way. We even stopped for lunch in small pub style restaurant on the outskirts of Prague for lunch.The cost of lunch was not included in the tour price, but it was the most affordable meal I had during the whole 5 weeks I was there.This tour is an efficient way to see a lot of Prague in a few hours.I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to have a good time seeing real life in Prague from the outside of the tourist areas.We had a blast.

Highlight of our trip to Prague. I took my 11 year old son and 14 year old daughter on the "Romantic Tour" which is referred to as romantic in name but entirely appropriate for children and teens because it is shorter (3 hours) than the other tours offered. The bikes were easy to operate and so much fun! We went to the top of Petrin Hill, rode around the outskirts of Prague Castle and toured up to Letna Park where there was a beer garden and a cool hip area where the locals hang out. We ended our trip at the John Lennon wall. Our guide Mike was awesome- super friendly, knowledgeable and clearly had a love for his city. He provided us with a history of each area we visited and offered up personal stories of his own impressions of the city. We had lots of photo op's and saw parts of the city that we would never have seen on our own including a brief visit to the now abandoned Straha stadium built in the 60's when the country was under communist rule. Fascinating! I highly recommend this bike tour for kids in particular. Both my kids loved it and said it was the highlight of their trip.

Great tour of the city. My daughter and I went on the view point ride. Our guide Tom was great, and with just the two of us it was a great tour. He was knowledgeable and helpful with the bikes. The bikes are an American brand and were great fun, just got a bit of getting used to, as the power was quite a surprise. I was a bit sorry when the tour finished as I would have liked a less urban setting to ride in and perhaps push on a bit on the bikes, the city was crowded and I think these bikes could be great fun. Still a fab tour and a great way to see the city.

Excellent tour of Prague and the Bikes are so much fun!!. Informative and entertaining--one of the highlights of our European vacation! Patrick was an outstanding guide for our tour (which included our kids who are 9 and 11 and did great)--a wonderful experience all around.

Three hours tour in Prague. We have done a three hours tour with Patrick. Our e bike was the perfect tour to see Prague from a different perspective. It is one of the best experiences in my life. Staff are really nice and professional. I even recommend to have the five hours tour bike. Well done guys.. All the best, and definitely i will repeat such tours.

Highly recommended!. We had very nice view point tour in Praque on July. We got priviledge to have two quides (Mike and Patrik) and we had so much fun with them during the tour. The weather was extremely hot, but it did´t matter because the bikes were so easy to ride. We saw a lot of interesting places and we got many good ideas what we can do or where we can go in Praque. We recommend this tour to everybody who can ride a bike. That`s all you need.Kiitos, kippis!

Two Amazing Tours with I Like EBike. We had so much fun on our View Point Tour with Jan that two days later we came back and did the Real Prague Tour with Mike. These tours were the highlights of our trip to Prague, a city we fell in love with.We did the View Point tour on our first day in Prague. The bikes were super comfortable and make the ride a breeze, pedaling is optional as the bikes simply just go. I was amazed at how well the climbed even the steepest of hills up to the Castle. We did far more sweating walking to I Like EBike than we did on the 5 hour tour. The content of the tour was perfect, Jan was super knowledgeable as a local with great history and context, yet not too much that we overwhelmed. This tour gave us a great appreciation for all the Prague has to offer, and gave us our bearings to explore the city. We took Jan's recommendation on where to eat dinner and he didn't disappoint!Two days later we wanted to get out of the city and decided to try the Real Prague tour, this time led by Mike. Again the bikes were great and the guide amazing. Mike took us on a journey that was very off the beaten path for tourists. We rode across bridges, took a boat taxi and rode through the most beautiful parks. It was great context to see how the city works beyond its tourist attractions, and to simply see how the people live, which was impressive and beautiful. My wife and I highly recommend I Like Ebike and highly recommend both tours!

An AMAZING, Very MEMORABLE Biking Experience. This 5 hour biking tour of Prague was one of the top highlights of our month-long tour of Europe! Our very personable, engaging and knowledgeable tour guide--Mike--was a real treasure. Our group of six bikers thoroughly enjoyed the experience! I would highly recommend this tour that was effortless with the electric bikes and truly amazing given the Prague sights and memories we experienced. I'm buying an e-bike when I return to the USA, thanks to I Like eBikes!!!

A Very Interesting Trip. We took the Romantic Trip, which wasn't as romantic, possibly because we had a teen and a child. Our child, Mina, took a spill shortly into the tour and convinced herself that she wouldn't like the electric bikes. Once she got going, though, she loved the experience. The bikes are very comfortable, and very little effort is required to pedal, even going up hill. The trip was very fun and exciting, and took us on a trip that would have taken hours on foot. Our tour guide Mike was very friendly, helped us with broken shoes and had panchos when it started to rain. He adapted the tour to fit our group very well. I would definitely recommend this tour, it beats walking around on foot, or being on a segway.

Fantastic Tour. I was very hesitant about doing this tour as 5 hours on a bike is not my cup of tea. But it was amazing and I would do it again with Jan and Tomas. Our group of three families traveling together (6 adults and 6 kids ranging from 11 to 15) was large but Jan and Tomas handled it extremely well. Jan led the group, always keeping the kids close. And Tomas followed behind to make sure no one got lost, and to fix bike chains when needed (and always with a smile). Both Jan and Tomas were fantastic tour guides with so much knowledge about the cultural and political history of Prague. Everyone in the group learned something and had a fantastic time on the tour. And at the end of the tour they went over a map of the city and provided us with information on the best restaurants, ice cream, and other sites to see. Both Jan and Tomas seem to love what they do and where they live, and it shows in how they present the city. Five hours seems like a long time, but they will show you so much of Prague and provide you with so much wonderful information it is absolutely worth it.

A Memorable Experience. We have been on many bike tours in different countries, but our day with Mike was one of the most memorable. He was engaging and gave us fascinating insight into this beautiful city, its history and its culture. We were delighted to be on the e-bikes given the terrain and it certainly was an adventure at first as we became comfortable. The e-bike is the perfect way to see Prague. We traveled with our college age daughter and he was most responsive to us all. We loved traveling to all the different quarters of the city and it was invigorating to travel up to the Palace and in around the gardens. Our son works in the international soccer world and we were fascinated to learn the profound history of the Strahov stadium and see it up close and personal. Lunch in the country side was perfect to help us feel that we were part of the community and not just an American tourist. Thanks to Mike and his colleagues for introducing us to the magic of Prague.

Entertaining!. The five hour tour gives you a great idea of the city's history and life in beautiful Prague. E-bikes are the best way to explore (a lot easier than Segways and the peddle support comes in handy with all the hills to climb!) and Jan was the best guide we could ask for. There were only 6 of us, which meant we could add an extra stop for one of the guys who wished to see the football stadium. We had a great time.Therefore when in Prague and looking for a great afternoon exploring the city, get on this tour!One tiny remark for those of you planning to do this city tour: the tour doesn't really cover the Old City part of Prague. Which is better to walk through anyway.

Highlight of our vacation. We did the 5 hour afternoon tour with Jan. We did bicycle tours in other histories with just as much history, but for both our 9 year old son and us this was the highlight of the vacation.The e-bikes are just the only way to see a city like Prague now. It was our first time on e-bikes, and a bit nerve racking to start as they are more powerful than you would think (despite the 75km range from a tiny batter), but after the first 100m become very easy and just a joy to use on both hills and flat alike.The bikes are modern, US-origin, and well-maintained, and allow one to focus on the sights. We saw 7 of all 10 Prague boroughs, and covered so much ground and yet felt the tour was nicely slow paced and could probably have been done in half the time if one was in a rush.Jan was a wonderful host, both concerned about our enjoyment and well-being (suggesting a longer rest stop at the monastery, recommending an order of hot dogs at the beer garden, and even suggesting a cheap football/soccer game that evening at AC Sparta).He took another 20 minutes after the tour to create indivualized maps of Prague with his recommendations for each of the two parties in the tour. Since we had a child they often do a private tour at no additional charge, but in this case we were with one other family that worked out well.There is so much to see in Prague, but we felt we got a taste not just of the historic sights (e..g., timing to see the Changing of the Guard at the Palace) but also seeing the basic student dorms, the world's largest stadium where the propaganda gymanastic videos were shot, and much more.Prague became our 9 year old's favorite city really because of this tour, and he is already planning the return visit.Any fitness level is fine for these bikes. So much more efficient and effective than the Segue tours.

HIGHLIGHT OF OUR TRIP. my husband and i took the 5 hour electric bike tour with patrick a couple of weeks ago, and it was the highlight of our trip to europe. ( and on this same trip we took two other similar tours in two different cities) partick was just wonderful, he took time to explain everything, and also to answer all of our questions, a very knowledgeable young man, taking a serious interest in his job. we had walked prague for two days, but could NEVER have seen all we did without the convenience of the electric bike tour. prague became even more beautiful and interesting to us as the morning went on. we covered an amazing amount of territory at a leisurely pace. patrick was very obliging in taking pictures of us at all the stops. the lunch stop was great too, if a little early. well, we had had a full breakfast and the food was plentiful. so if you aren't overly hungry, order one plate for two. the price for lunch is not included. so again, just let me emphasize the professionalism of patrick, and the chosen sites and route are tops! i would ride with i like e bikes again in a minute!
This tour was a total blast!. The bikes are so much fun to ride and the guides are awesome and very knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Prague.

Awesome outing with Patrick. Patrick was fantastic showing us around Prague. He was patient with all our questions and open to talking about Czech Republic and what it is like. He was knowledgeable in the places we visited and wasn't rushed about getting is back at all. Terrific day out with him. Thank you. We had a lot of fun.
Afternoon tour. Had a great afternoon with our guide Patrick. Learned a great deal and saw a lot of the city from both above and in the heart. Great way to spend 5 hours to learn about Prague.

Super fun day Ebiking with Mike. Ebike is certainly the way to get around and see the sights of Prague. The four of us went out on our first day to Prague and had a great time with our tour guide Mike. He was one of the best tour guides we have ever had. Really knowledgable, spoke excellent English and took great care in getting us around the City and away from the busy tourist zone. Awesome day!

Super nice tour!. We really enjoyed the tour on the e-bike!We were a bit skeptical as my wife doesn't love so muck riding a bike, but actually it was fun and very easy also uphill.The tour allowed us to see beautiful spot in Mala Strana, as well as enjoying some local beers.Thanks to ohr guide Tomasz, very nice and knowledgeable guy

A life-changing tour of the most beautiful city in Europe. This was our first trip to Prague and I cannot stress enough how important this bike tour was to the success of our the entirety of the trip. JAN IS THE BEST! We had no idea what were getting ourselves into when we signed up for this trip other than that it'd be on electronic bikes. There are a few different types of routes you can select and we chose to scenic one ( I plan on coming back and picking a different one!) and spent 5, almost 6 hours exploring the most beautiful city in Europe. It wasn't just the views and the architecture that blew us away, but the knowledge and pride Jan had of Prague was astounding. A Prague resident who knows 5 different languages, Jan paired his sense of humor and sheer knowledge of his beloved city by creating the most informative tour I have ever been apart of. We booked our tour for a group of 3 and were lucky enough to have us and Jan for the entire trip. We felt safe and secure the entire time and it was clear that Jan was an experienced tour guide. It didn't feel like a proper tour guide though, it felt like, by the end of it,we made a true friend and discovered/learned about one of the most incredible cities in all of Europe. I cannot stress enough how amazing this trip was and it had EVERYTHING to with the I Like EBike experience.What to bring: Sun Glasses (weather permitting), Shoes or sneakers, a camera, a sweatshirt (weather permitting), cash for a drink and/or food at the biggest beer garden in Prague, a smile, a willingness to explore. Jan had a bottle of water for us each once we arrived and offered us the usage of the restroom as well. He even let us charge our phones while we got everything set up for the trip. The bikes come with a big basket in the front, so you can store your water, sweatshirt, bags, etc.

great info and fun!!. This is the only tour you need!! We took the 5 hour tour and the guide, Jan, was amazing. All we needed to do afterwards was go back and revisit some of the places that we wanted to spend more time at. Great food suggestions........went back to the restaurant and ice cream place twice more after your suggestion.......thank you!!! Awesome!! With ebikes you can cover so much more of the city. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!

Very Enjoyable and Informative Review. We did the View Point ride with Mike recently and had a great time. He took us to a bunch of places that would be impossible to find on your own as a tourist without spending a significant amount of time looking for them. Our tour only had 4 people so it felt really personalized. The E-bikes were great as well. I had some trouble the first 5 minutes but they are super easy once you get the hang of it. We did bike tours in a bunch of other European cities and this was definitely my favorite!

Great experience! We saw everything!. This tour was great! We took the scenic route and witg our easy to ride ebikes, we climbed all of the steep hills with no stress. I want an ebike! They were so funand easy. Our tour guide was Jan. He was so knowledgable and friendly and gave us very helpful pointers for the rest of our stay. I loved this so much, I am cancelling our regular bike tour in Budapest and scheduling another ebike tour! Thanks Jan!

Great day!. We had a great day with Charles on our eBike tour on June 25th. There was only 3 of us on the tour which was fun. The eBike was very easy to use and a HUGE help when trying to get up the big hills in Prague. We rode for 5 hours and I never sweat once! Charles w very knowledgeable about Prague and very friendly. We enjoyed the tour quite a bit.

Great way to see Prague. This was one of two I Like E-bike tours we did while we were in Central Europe. Before this trip I had never done a tour like this before. I was skeptical about their claim that you could bike up and down hills without breaking a sweat, but they were right! The electric pedal assist really works well. On flat areas you can leave the assist on a low setting (2 or 3), and on steep hills you can bump it up to 5 and the bike climbs the hill easily. Our guide, Charles, was a resident and really gave us a great tour. We covered many areas in Prague during our five hour tour, from areas around the Old Town to the giant stadium to the castle district and more. It was very interesting and with the e-bikes we didn't feel tired after 5 hours of biking, despite some VERY steep hills. The tour was also nice because there were only 3 of us on it total--it felt really personalized. This is a great way to experience the city at a very close level. We would definitely recommend it to others who want to get a detailed overview of Prague.

Informative and Fun!. Our guide Patrick was super nice and knowledgable. He made the tour really fun and showed us the best look out spots on to Prague. Biking around the city was a fantastic way to see a number of landmarks throughout the city (including the babies :s like my boyfriend wanted to see). He knew lots of history and present information about Prague and taught us so much about the beautiful city. We had a great time and hope Patrick is able to visit Canada some day like he hopes :)

Excellent service, comfortable bike. During a one week vacation in Prague I wanted to rent a bike and found ILIKEEBIKE office/shop very close to our accommodation.The company requires a minimum rental period of 5 hours (which is fair deal) for a very comfortable bicycle with electric motor and front wheel suspension.On my suggestion to split the contract into two hours today and three hours tomorrow the answer was "Yes Sir, of course we can do that".Two days later I made the same agreement again (renting same bike for additional five hours over two days), but this time I even got a rebate of 90 czk without signing additional formal contract.This is an example of excellent customer service, thank you ILIKEEBIKE.I can really recommend you experience Prague by bicycle on your own (or guided tour if first visit). A bicycle supported by electric motor is actually better (and much cheaper) than a Segway if you want to cover distances beyond walking.Try it !!

Best Way to Explore the City. We had the pleasure of taking two trips with I Like eBikes - one time in Prague and the other in Budapest. We had the best time! Our guides were friendly, informative and fun! You are able to experience the city in a much more intimate way. Don't be scared off thinking that a 30 kilometer ride will be too exhausting. The electric bikes make it so easy. There are frequent stops along the way and your guides will ensure that you are well taken care of. Although there are many bike paths along both routes, there are times when you are riding in traffic but both of our guides were very safety conscious and we felt safe at all times. Many thanks to Tomas (Prague) and Fruzsi (Budapest) for making your beautiful cities "come to life" for us.

Electric bike your in Prauge. Bloody fantastic. Jan our tour guide was a wealth of information. He was a great guide, fun and took great care of us. This trip was worth every cent and I think one of the best things I've ever done on a trip away. I'd recommend this company and the 5 hour tour in a heart beat. Don't be scared of the bikes as it's so easy. One our our guys hadn't been on a bike for 30 years and had no problems at all. We did a group of 4. Fantastic. Thanks heaps. Karen and Lew.

Simply the best. We have just returned from our 5 hour ebike tour with our tour guide Jan. He was so knowledgable and his English was perfect. There were only the 4 of us on our tour and as we were travelling as friends it was a fun time. We are now having a beer and reminiscing about the wonderful overview we have had of Prague. This tour is excellent if want to see and hear about Prague in a short time. I would highly recommend I Like Ebike. I haven't ridden a bike in 40 years and it was so easy.

What a tour!. Wow. What a tour that was. I arrived to Prague with couple of friends for a 3 day beer trip. Didn't know much about the city - beside from the good beer. Our receptionist at the hotel mentioned these guys as a fantastic way how to see what Prague has to offer but honestly: 5 hours on bike in like 30 degrees sounds brutal. That was our only concern and it didn't last very long. The bikes ride themself without any effort whatsoever and the tour is so entertaining it makes the time fly. As in many cities with historic centres there are literarily million things to see. This guy showed us the most exciting and entertaining bits with an enthusiasm I haven't seen for a long time. I wish he could be our tour guide wherever we travel Thanks Mike for everything!Joe

Loved this tour. Friendly, knowledgeable and pleasant guides made this tour a delight. It would be good to do this early in your trip to Prague, as it will give you a tour of the city, hints of good places to go back to, orients you to the landscape so you can walk the city without getting lost. Really helpful and fun. The electric motors on the bikes make this a breeze.
Best way to see Prague!. We had a great day touring Prague by electric bike. Mike was a very knowledgeable guide and made the day fun! We highly recommend this tour!

Favorite part of the trip. I visited Prague for the weekend with some friends, and this was not only my favorite part of the trip, but honestly one of the coolest experiences of my life. We did the 3 hour night tour and saw the most incredible views of the city while learning about its history. Mike was our tour guide, and I genuinely can't imagine having had a more knowledgeable, friendly, and fun person teach us about Prague from the perspective of a local. The electric bikes are very easy to get used to and you won't feel tired at all after hours of biking. I highly recommend this tour and guarantee you'll have an amazing experience!
We saw everything. Our family had a great tour with Mike who made us feel like a local when our tour was over. He pointed out all sorts of facts about the town and special points of interest.

Great trip with i like E bikes. The E bikes are amazingly comfortable and easy to use. You will not feel tired after 5 hours of cycling.Highly recommend this tour if you want to see prague in a short time.These guys are really professional and know every corner of prague.In the end they will give you great guides for cafes and restaurant around, which is very useful.

A great time with the family. My family and I visited Prague in June and wanted a tour of the city. The only thing was we were only going to be here for 2 short days. We decided on I like ebike tour. We were NOT disappointed. Mike was our tour guide and he was awesome. Very nice guy who was knowledgeable and friendly. The electric bikes were easy to use. My 12 year old was a pro after a short time. Highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants a good overall tour of the city. And ask for Mike!!

e-bike prague. The trip was amazing and brought me to many sites around Prague that would have been otherwise hard to get to within such a short time frame. Even better was our tour guide, Jan. Jan has the local knowledge that makes a tour like this really worthwhile. He was charismatic, well spoken, and an overall delight. I would recommend this tour.

Electric Bike Tour in Prague. Great tour, small group with excellent guide. Highly recommended. Choice of three separate city tours. American electric bikes are near new and very comfortable. Very good value for a small group five hour tour.

The greatest tour in Prague! :D. 這是這趟布拉格最超值的tour了!!整整五個小時，完全不冷場!由當地人所帶領下的布拉格變得很生動有趣，從當地人的觀點可以看到不同的布拉格。基本上這五個小時透過EBIKE完全都不累，超好騎，但第一次騎可能要熟悉一下，路面平整度時好時壞，但基本上不費力很舒適。極度推薦沒有時間但又極度想了解並走遍布拉格的旅客，這會是最佳選擇。This was the most worthy tour I took ever. I and my boyfriend enjoyed it!They provided the excellent E-bike in the tour,let me really want to get one home. :DOur tour guide was born in Prague,he shared his local opinion and secret spot for us,and we could know more about Prague.Due to our tour guide sincere sharing,Prague was more vivid and attractive in our mind.This tour is the best way to know Prague! You can't miss.

Great experience, amazingly freindly staff, a must do!. What a great way to experiences and see all the sites in Prague!We took the 7PM Romantic Tour (3 hr).We had Charles as our guide. What a great guy! Funny, friendly, down to earth, and very helpful and insightful!The tour was well laid out and well paced. You're never really biking for more than 5-10 min. This is a not a grueling, sweaty experience. Very fun, laid back, and ENJOYABLE.Getting used to the electric bikes took only a few minutes. With just a little practice ANYONE can learn to handle the bikes and get around safely!We can't say enough good things about our experience with this business. It was easily in the top 3 highlights of our entire trip. You MUST do this!

Highlight of the trip. We visited Prague for 4 days and there is no better way to see not only the main historical locations in Prague but also what daily life around the city is truly about. The ebikes make for a great time! It is a must if your a visiting Prague without a doubt!

Great Bike Tour in Prague. My husband and I and two other couples took the three hour Prague e-bike tour this morning. We are late 50’s – early 60’s and have traveled Europe a fair amount. For this tour, we were picked up at a central location in Prague and were driven in a small van to the e-bike tour’s office. We met the staff, chose our bikes and were given a demonstration about how to control them. I am the least mechanically inclined of the group and a small woman, and when I tested my bike I nearly drove it into a wall. Our guide, Mike, was more than understanding and got me a much smaller and lighter bike I was able to manage and we were off. This was a fabulous tour. Mike is knowledgeable, personable and very helpful throughout the tour. Some of the highlights were a stop at Petrin Hill Park area, saw the changing of the guard at Prague Castle and even stopped at a beer garden for a quick beer. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone spending more than a few hours in Prague. A great morning or afternoon activity – well worth the investment.

Nice and relaxed biking!. First of all: you won't break a sweat riding the E-bikes! There are modes which help you ride easily on steep hills, or just help you a little bit. Up to you :-)I did a very nice tour (Romantic tour) which covers different parks with beautiful nature. My guide Mike was really chill and we had a nice talk just about everything you need to know about Prague.Would definitely advise to do this tour!

Ebike Tour of Prague. I absolutely love our Ebike tour of Prague with our guide Jan. Jan was extremely kind, interesting and knowledgeable. We had an incredible day touring around Prague, seeing all the sites and learning all the history. The bikes made it adventurous and exciting. If you aren't used to being on a bike, you might be a bit scared!

Super!. Perfect way to move around Prague, saving your poor feet! 5 hours went by really fast. We saw some places travel guides won't mention, and heard interesting things about Prague's past and present. Thank you Mike!

This excursion is an excellent way to see and experience Prague!. We completely enjoyed this tour. Mike our tour guide was personable,engaging patient(as we adjusted to the electric bikes) and quite knowledgeable about the history of Prague. He shared stories as we rode and showed us the beauty of Prague including areas where most people live. I would highly recommend this excursion to anyone seeking a less traditional way to experience Prague. And the electric bikes makes it possible for anyone to partake in this adventure. Enjoy!

Fun, easy and fantastic way to see Prague. Loved this ebike tour. We're 3 friends spending a short weekend in Prague and we were looking for an original way to soak up the atmosphere and see some of the sights when we came across I Like Ebike. Thomas, our fabulous guide, took the challenge and even the person least comfortable with cycling in our little group quickly got into it and no matter how steep the slope, it was easy :-) We enjoyed incredible views along the way, stopped for a bit in the monastery and the Beer Garden and loved the sunset ride along the river. Thomas was very knowledgeable and happily shared what he knew with us in a fun way. I'm in Budapest in a few months where they offer a similar experience and intend to do the bike ride there too. Would definitely recommend!

The best thing I could do. I was travelling alone and had only two days in Prague. So I decided to book an e-bike tour to see as much as possible. It turned out to be the correct decision!! I spent 5 hours with Tomas, my guide. He did a really great job. As a local, he knows the city very well and he showed me also parts of the city which are not typical tourist cynosures. Tomas always was careful during the tour and there never was a dangerous situation. He's a good guy! We went for lunch to a typical czech restaurant, the food was so good. The tour was about 30 km, but no worries, everybody can do this! The quite strong motor makes it very easy to cycle, even up to high hills. So it's really no hard work :-) So in my opinion, this is a must for everybody who wants to see Prague without having the classical walking city tour. Book it!!

Amazing sites and views!. Took the 5 hour tour last week with Jan. Jan was very enthusiastic and genuinely happy to show off his beautiful city. The ebikes are easy to operate and despite the traffic, never once felt nervous or scared. We took multiple tours in Prague, Munich and Budapest and this was certainly in the top two. The concept of this tour is simply that you can cover a lot of ground and see multiple sites while listening to an interesting narrative from knowledgeable guides. Highly recommend!

Best Adventure in Prague. We just got back from our European vacation and one of our best daily adventures was on our ebike tour. Prague is very hilly and we wanted to see the city so we decided to go on an ebike tour. We signed up for the morning tour which is 5 hours. I thought it sounded so long but we could've stayed longer! Mike, our tour guide, was a pleasure to be with. We went to the castle, through the parks, down the river, across the river, through a czech town where we stopped for lunch. and that is just of the few places that we went. We saw more of Prague in 5 hours that gave us a rel appreciation for the city and the people that live there. This is a MUST DO tour in Prague! Thank you Mike.

Excellent. Took a 5 hr e bike tour of prague w Mike and Jan. These guys were knowledgable and friendly and explained all the relevant history of this beautiful city. The e bikes are definite way to go in prague with all the hills and cobble roads, to cover the most ground and see the most sights in a short time (I've done segway tours and push bike tours in other cities). The group was small, only two other people, nearly felt like a private tour. The route was a good mix of the key tourist sights and some great local areas like parks, art/graffiti areas that you would not normally find following a tourist map. I found this guys based on their trip advisor ratings, and happy to confirm they run a great tour operation.

Brilliant!!!. Had the best afternoon on the 3hr romantic ride tour. Our guide Mike was absolutely sensational. Such a great way to see beautiful Prague, to learn some of the history and an enjoyable visit to the best beer garden we have ever been too! Definitely would recommend this tour, such a great way to spend the afternoon. Thanks so much Mike, you were a great guide!

The best way to meet unique Praque. We liked so much this trip! It was fantastic to see so much interesting during one day and we were not tired only happy because it's easy and nice to drive electro bikes . Our guide Told us a lot of things about history of the city , and we saw amazing views of all Praque from different points . Our impressions are super ! Recommend absolutely !

Private tour on an electric bike. I booked a Saturday afternoon 3 hour electric bike trip. I was picked up at my hotel by the company's minibus. A large group just left before I arrived, and I seem to have the last bike as well as the owner, Jan, as my personal guide. He welcomed me with a big smile and off we went..uphill, soft fat tires made it easy over the cobblestones. Jan was constantly looking back to check how I was navigating through the Saturday crowds. He has a wealth of knowledge and Is proud of this remarkable city. I highly recommend this tour. It was exhilarating.

Great way to see the sights and taste some local beer!. John was an excellent guide/host and the ebikes are awesome. I found that Prague was somewhat bike unfriendly at least compared to Budapest where we did the same tour with the same company a few days earlier. Not nearly as many bike lanes and bike crossing signals. Johns route uses a lot of parks and side roads so that helped a lot. Highly recommend!

Super!. Met up with John, our guide, and two other couples for a great afternoon of biking on the View Point Ride. We spent the next five hours effortlessly pedaling around the city. The ebikes were comfortable and easy to use. We had done the Budapest tour with the same company and highly recommend them!
Flawless . Lucy is a great guide, and also an amazing person. She showed us the best of prague, and also joined us for a beer, thanks Lucy for a fun experience :)

Best bike tour in Prague!. Highly recommend this tour when in Prague!! 'Real Prague' Tour gives you an amazing insight into the real Prague and modern day living. Great tour if you have already seen the major sights and want to do something different. Jan was the best tour guide having grown up in Prague so really gives you insights into his childhood and growing up in the city!!
So chilled. Lucia was a charismatic tour guide and we visited some amazing places. The E bikes are a very efficient way to get around.
AMAZING!. Had an awesome time, Lucia was the sweetest person and the best tour guide in the world. So very informative and fun.

Great Tour for the Family! . We are a family three with a toddler, and we booked the View Point Tour with Jan. Jan was a great tour guide, and he was able to appeal to us as well as our three year old son. He tailored the tour to serve our particular interests, stopping twice for beer for my husband and twice at parks for my son. The tour was wonderful and we walked away with some great family photos and a better understanding of the history of Prague. Take this tour for a guaranteed great time!

Fantastic tour. Would recommend for the beginning of your stay to get a great overview of Prague and to get your bearings.Jan had excellent local knowledge and ensured that every part of the tour was suited to his customers.Electric bikes are easy to use and would be suitable for all biking abilities. After 32KM absolutely no fatigue or muscle aches. Just many memories and stunning views. Thank you Jan.

Best way to see the city. We were only in Prague for a few days so decided to do this tour to get and overview of the city and to see some of the main sites....we weren't disappointed. We chose to do the three hour tour and we were taken through beautiful parks and to all the best viewpoints of the city. Having not ridden a bike for many years, I was a little apprehensive however they are very comfortable, easy to use and made the steep hills a doddle. We were fortunate, not only to have glorious weather, but to have a lovely and very knowledgeable tour guide, Lucie. If you are in Prague, it's a must.
Prague tour. Best 3 hour tour ever! Jan, the owner, took us for a fun, informative and picturesque ride. If you visit Prague DO THIS!!!

Amazing view point tour. We've only spent 1 full day in Prague and I was glad to have done the 5 hours Ebike tour on that day. On our tour we stopped at lots of awesome view points and places. Our tour guides were really friendly and anxious to make the tour as good and comfortable as possible. They told us lots of interesting things about today's Prague and Prague's history. I'd definitely do the tour again and recommend it to everyone visiting Prague. The tour is an excellent opportunity to discover many places of Prague that one would probably not go to by foot.

Best way to see Prague. We had great fun with Jan our knowledgable English speaking host on the 'Real Prague' tour. The electric bikes made the distance covered very manageable ( about 20 miles in five hours). We would certainly take one of his other tours on our next visit to Prague.

Best Tour with no effort. I wasn't expecting the Bicycle trip was that enjoyable. After finished the tour, I was so glad I did the tour on E Bike. The things I did within 3 hours need 3 days to do by walking. Beside the places we visited won't be able to reach on foot. The tour guide was very knowledgeable, doing the job with pleasure, and very friendly.

Best thing about Prague. Was so good we did it twice!One of the best tours and ways to enjoy the city. No effort needed and Jans was very knowledgeable and friendly. Probably the best thing we did in Prague and would highly recommend it for an alternative way of seeing the sights. Our only regret is that we only did the 4 hour tour and obviously better in good weather. Chris and Leona.

Great intro to the beautiful view of Prague - highly recommended. I booked this on the first day I was in Prague and I was very glad I did. I was the only person on the 5 hour tour (as it was at the beginning of the season) and it was a very enjoyable afternoon of views, hot chocolate and beer. It was my first time on an ebike - they were brilliant for the hills!Take some warm clothes as it gets quite cold as some of it is quite exposed.They also took photos and sent me them afterwards which is a great extra

easy to get up castle hills. Electric assist for bikes is great when riding to the castle. The guide was a nephew of the owner. He was very knowledgeable and made sure that we were always comfortable.

Great way of seeing the city. I had never thought that electrical bikes would be that convenient, and fun, to go with. We had a great trip around all of Prague, covering 15km and all great sights. Very professional and friendly guiding, too.

So much fun!. First of all, these bikes are AWESOME. It's like having the power of a scooter while still pedaling -- very welcome on all of the hills. Jan was a great tour guide, a gracious host, and the pride he feels for his city shone through on his tour. We would never have seen the majority of the sights that we stopped at with Jan and having his insider local knowledge was priceless. We were a bit hesitant because of the weather (and it was cold!), but this was our favorite activity on our ten day trip!

Speedy tour of a beautiful city!. I Like EBike was wonderful at accommodating a last minute request for a three hour Ebike tour of the city. Jan was a perfect host to my husband and I as we explored so much of the city! The territory we covered on electric bikes was easily four times the amount we could have attempted on a regular bike. Not to mention the Ebikes were fashionable and fun! Spectacular views, and a great craft beer at the monastery! We plan to return with our kids in a few months.

Bike tour. Lucas,Edinburgh.Hi, this is my second visit of the lovely city Prague. And second time of a bike tour!! This time I have spend time together with my gfriend. We took the tour for over a free hours on wonderfull bike Pandedo by the Local tour guide name Jan. He was just splended, he has spoke fluent english and show us more than we expected!!!We biked all over the historical down town to President castel. Than along the river which is just Superb!!! Than Jan showed us the Local pubs with regular prices not those over prices tourists pubs. We even had a pint with Jan in down town in pub name Coala and price for pint was under £1..just fantastic!!! We save so much time and had a great time!!! Thanks again mate!!!

Nice way to experience Prague - renting ebikes. Prague area is hilly and that is why ebikes are really good for going around the surroungings of the city. Cycle paths are not too well marked with traffic signs in Chech but we could easily find our way. Kids bike is very funny, like an electric moped. You do not have to use pedals at all, just turn the handle and it goes. Our 6year old kid easily cruised with it for almost five hours. The only minus was the lack of tyre pump. I had almost flat front tyre that but they had no pump available in bike rental ?!

I Like EBike - even when cold, foggy & 3 degrees!. We had the pleasure of meeting our guide, Jan, on a very cold morning in Prague. He had gloves ready for us and showed us some fantastic sights, including some brilliant street art. Jan is clearly very patriotic and proud of Prague - everything he talks about is with passion and a non-stop smile!

Wonderful Tour and Experience. The city tour was excellent! It is the best way to experience Prague! The people are great and the bikes are in great condition! I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Prague!

Effortless way to see Prague; excellent customer service. I chose I Like EBike because of its excellent website, which very clearly laid out the various tours offered. We chose the 5 hour View Point ride, which we scheduled for our first day so that we would get a good overview of the city. We were not disappointed. The I Like EBike people made certain to contact us a few days prior to give us information on the predicted weather, a map to their location, and personal information about our guide. The office was easy to find on the castle side of the river and was only a short walk from a tram stop. The bikes were a little scary at first, especially when going down the steep hills of Prague at full speed. Going up those hills on the electric bikes is a breeze, though. Helmets are provided. There were only four in our group on the day of our ride. Our guide was so enthusiastic about the city that the tour ended up being extended by an hour, for a total of 6 hours, as he gave thoughtful answers to every question, no matter how silly. Even at 6 hours, the time flew by. Based on our interests, he gave us tips on what we might like to visit in our remaining time in Prague. Our 6 hour tour was time well spent.

THE ABSOLUTE BEST TOUR SERVICE IN PRAGUE, FROM A REPEAT CUSTOMER!. I visited Prague several years back and found I Like EBike via web search. I am SO glad that I discovered this tour company. I took the tour back then and knew that it would not be the last time for me. I was blessed to return to Prague last week, this time with my husband, to celebrate our 25th Anniversary. I Like EBike was on my "MUST DO" list once again, and was one of my primary reasons for returning to Prague. My experience was top-notch both times. When folks decide on which tour service to use, there are two crucial elements that should be considered, Tour Content and Tour Guide. The following is my reflection on both:TOUR CONTENT: No doubt, Prague is the most beautiful city in the world! However, it is perched in the hilly areas of the Czech Republic, so a traditional bike tour or walking tour could be challenging. Using the EBike, which is suitable for those who are both athletic, and not so athletic, we were able to cover many major sights, including Petrin Hill, Lennon Wall, Sparta Stadium, Strahov Monastery, Prague Castle, St. Nicolas Church, and Metronome, just to name a few! The pace of the tour is set in accordance with the tour participants and stops are given for snacks and coffee! Jan stopped to take several photos of us, even without us asking. TOUR GUIDE: I am sincere when I say that you could not find a better person to guide your group through the city. Jan and his team are not only incredibly knowledgeable about the history and the sights you are viewing, but they are truly kind people. The personality of the tour guide can make or break the experience of the tour. You will not be disappointed in this regard with I Like EBike. Jan is a wonderful human being who works hard to take good care of his guests. He takes his business personally, and operates with the highest of professionalism. He even thinks of the smallest details, such as providing gloves on chilly days. Customer satisfaction is his goal! When you visit Prague, don't miss out on this opportunity!

Fantastic Tour. Having injured my foot from all the walking I had to do during my trip to that point this was the perfect easy way to see the ENTIRE city without straining my foot. The bikes were easy to use and a ton of fun. If you want a solid overview of the city do this tour. Also our guide was super bubbly and very informative. A proud Czech who was very happy to show us around the city. I highly recommend EBike!

Awesome experience/ Eine unfasbare Erfahrung. It was our first time in Prague and on ebikes and we could not be more pleased afterwards. Prague is so magical especially seeing all those beautiful view points and exploring it on bright ebikes was really cool. Our guide was Kate and honestly I have never met a guide with such a big heart. She was sweet, super friendly and the fact that she was local made it extra special. As it was quite cold already she offered my wife even her jacket so she would not freezed. After those 5 hours there, we felt like having a new friend rather than a normal guide. It was really amazing, perfect guide, we were really lucky. Thank youEs war erste mal in Prag und mit dem eRad und ich könnte nicht mehr zufrieden sein. Prag ist so zauberhaft und special alle die schöne Sehenswurdichkeiten zu sehen und alles auf dem Radfahrt erkunden war wirklich cool. Unsere Fuhrerin war Katja und ech tich habe nie so einen fuhrer gesehen, der so ein grosses Herz hat. Sie war sehr freundlich und im Fakt dass sie in Prag wohnt war noch besser. Wenn es kälter würde hat sie uns meiner Frau ihre Jacke angeboten, dass sie nicht friert. Nach diesen 5 Stunden, wir haben uns gefühlt als, ob wir eine neue Freundin hätten. Sie ist wirklich fantastisch und eine sehr gute Führerin. Wir hatten Glück sie zu haben. Vielen Dank

Best tour ever. Having travelled the world , this was my first EBike tour with 4 other family , it's the best way possible to see so much so close , we got to tick off all the sights in 5 hours ,the bikes are effortless and so much fun , had a laugh at the Segway tours as they couldn't get near half the tour we did , I thought 5 hours would be to long but we all wanted more at the end as it past so quick , so take my critical word and book this as you will look for them in every city , it's that good , cheerS to the team

Couples tour. This was a drizzly rainy evening private tour of Prague. My guide Peter was knowledgeable, encouraging and lots of fun! We zipped around Prague on our e bikes and stopped for him to tell me about the amazingly beautiful sites! He was very knowledgeable! This was the most fun I had in Prague! I highly recommend this tour!

I Like EBike Tour-September 28, 2015. This was a great 5-hour tour with a very informative and entertaining guide named Peter. Our group was small (5 persons) allowing for lots of interaction. The eBikes took a little getting used to, but there is something fantastic about pedaling slowly while rocketing up one of Prague's steep hills. Our tour included a leisurely stop at the monastery where great Czech beer and food was enjoyed by all.
