With eBikes, we were able to visit a lot of landmarks in a short time, some of which (Petrin Tower) would have been difficult to reach. We thoroughly enjoyed Peter's commentary and the wide variety of locations we visited.

프라하 개인투어 전에 꼭 해보시기를 추천합니다.. 주요 관광 명소 및 현지인이여야만 찾아갈수 있는 아기자기하고 이쁜 길들의 엄선된 프라하 뷰 포인트를 감상하시면서 약혼녀와 같이 투어하고 갑니다 너무 좋네요.많은 여행의 투어 중에서 가이드(케이트)분의 설명이 정말 체계있었던것 같습니다.I recommend this tour before you start travelingwhen you go to E -bike tour you can find guide(kate), she guided us very friendly and systematically gave us lots of information for tour in Prague

Active and informative. Small group tour (7 on ours) with time to acclimate to the bikes - then off to explore. Kate is a fantastic guide - stopping to give context and explain when apprpropriate. Most of the tour is on back roads and parks where the views are impressive and the biking a pleasure. Kate gave us a great intro to the city along with a chance for a moderate work-out (keep bike in lower assist for a bigger challenge!)

Best view of Prague. Kate our you guide was amazing, E bikes is something cool too experience. Kate, showed us amazing views of Prague and explained the history of all the parts we stopped at. Prague is a city you must see from the mountains. This tour is a must and you won't regret it!!

Fun Tour. A really fun way to see Prague. I would recommend doing this tour on your first day in the city, so you are able to get a good idea of the layout, and perhaps some places you may want to visit again. Our guide was very informative and friendly. Would highly recommend this tour company.

Fantastic way to see Prague!. Our tour guide was Peter, and he started by getting the group comfortable with the E-bikes. If you haven't tried one yet, they are simply amazing. Prague has many hills with great views, and an E-bike makes the trip so easy that you don't break a sweat. Our 5-hour tour took us around the entire city, from the castle to parks to an old monastery (beer! goulash!) to the old town area. If you are in town for just a couple of days or for a longer trip, there is no better way to see a wide swath of the city as taking this tour!

Amazing views, beers and Prague history!. I stumbled upon this tour while checking out brochures in my hotel. I was still nursing a sprained ankle so this bike tour was a nice break from all the walking on cobblestone streets. The day was a little gloomy but everything else about the tour was great! I've never been on an electric bike but found it super easy to adjust and so much fun easily speeding up hills! I sort of wish my bike had home had an electric motor. I did the 5 hour View Points tour of Prague. This is one of the best ways to see all of Prague from the various hills in Prague. Karel was our tour guide and we had a small group so we were able to ask many questions. He grew up in Prague so we got some personal insight into the city from a true local's perspective. In addition, he was very knowledgeable about the history of Prague and just an all around fun tour guide! Most of the tour was on bike paths and through parks with just minimal time on city streets. There are a few places on the tour through city streets and crowded town squares but it added to the entire experience of biking in quaint Euroean city.I highly recommend this tour!

View point ride. A great way to see highlights in Prague while on an electric bike! Beautiful countryside, important sites and a lot of fresh air. Peter was a delightful guide: enthusiastic, knowledgeable, friendly and spoke English very well.
fantastic bike tour of Prague. Our guide Peter was terrific - spent 5 hours with him biking around Prague. The E-Bikes were fun and easy to ride. Would strongly recommend doing this activity.

A tale of two cities. We had a very interesting ride with Peter our guide. He was knowledgable, friendly and informative. He spoke very good English and took us on a tour of the southwestern parts of the city centre and beyond. We must have covered some 20 miles or more and yet the e-bikes made it so easy. Anyone with a reasonable basic level of fitness could do this and find it enjoyable. It really was a highlight of our 6-day visit to Prague and it showed us something of the "real" city rather than just the touristy bits. We saw some of the older Communist developments, a counterpoint to the rich and lavish architecture of the city centre and a taste of how the majority of Czech citizens live. If you're in Prague for a long or short stay, we would recommend a trip with I Like E-bike.

Highlight of 30 days in Central Europe. Perfect day, three of us and the guide, Kate. This trip would have been good with any guide; with Kate, it was the best. We had another bike tour two weeks later in another town that was not a highlight. This eBike tour was the perfect way to spend 5 hours in Prague on a nice day.

Fantastic!. We took the View Point Ride on our first full day in Prague. It was a fantastic way to see the major sites, get orientated in the city and learn some history. Cannot say enough about how knowledgable, personable and fun our guide Kate was. We walked away with a great feeling for the city and the people. We would highly recommend this company.

The highlight of our time in Prague!. We ended up being the only booking for the evening ride around Prague, and with four of us travelling as a family it was a very personalised experience. We chose the night ride as it was ridden predominantly through parks and a few of us hadn't ridden bikes in years. The bikes themselves were absolutely fantastic to ride after the 5 or so minutes of getting used to how they operate, and those of us that were slightly larger in the rear and who hadn't ridden bikes in years even found them comfortable for the 3.5 hours it took to complete the tour. Hills were a breeze! It was great to see Prague by twilight, especially some of the views over the city. The most memorable part was at one of the lookout stops, we pulled up and fireworks started going off over the city, it was so perfectly synchronised it was like it had been planned that way. Everyone we told about the e-bike tour wished they could have come along, and we gave glowing recommendations for a well operated and professional business. It was the highlight of our time in Prague. Thanks again!

Best way to know Prague. This is the best tour by far to know Prague. We ran 32 km in the all city, we went everywhere. Also we can stop to take pictures. The electric bike was so easy to drive. The tour guy named Pete was so prepared and he know very well the city and his job.Congratulations!

Bike tour around Prague was great!. We had a group of four, and the bike tour was a perfect introduction to the city. The bikes are surprisingly easy to ride, and made for a fun day - listening to our guide and seeing the sites. Peter was our guide and was excellent! He had many stories to tell, and took his time in laying out different elements of history for us at each point. The tour was one of our favorites, and we are going to try to same tour in Budapest!

Amazing way to see Prague & learn its history. I went solo and did the general Prague tour, which is 5 hours but we went overtime to 6, which was a bonus. The guide (Karel) was very knowledgable about Prague history and facts and you can see the guy loves his job. We were a group of 5. We got to see amazing and important sites of Prague and learn a lot of history behind the way things currently are in the city. The E-bikes are super easy to use and the overall trip was very safe. We were provided with a bottle of water and had 2 breaks for washrooms and snacks. if it's your first time to Prague I highly recommend doing this tour. If you like a site you've seen during the E-bike tour you can revisit it again. The information and personal opinions provided by the guide during the tour are well worth it as well.
Ebike tour 5 hours. Excellent guide (Peter), a very personal approach. Some stops for local good and drinks as well. We learned and saw very much of the city Prague.

View Points tour review. The ebike tour with guide Peter was a great adventure. I wish that I had taken the tour on my first day in Prague to help me get oriented to the city. Peter provided a lot of interesting info regarding the history of Prague and the Czech Republic. The ebikes were easy to use and were fun to ride. It was a great way to see some sights that were just a little too far for a walking tour. I would definitely do it again. Larry

Great start for your Prague stay. Prague is an amazing city, but if you try to explore it without proper guidance it's easy to get lost, then miss some of its extraordinary views and sites. I strongly recommend this tour, as it's physically effortless, and the bicycle can take you to sites where buses or "walking tours" can't (at least easily). Also, the guides are extremely well prepared to provide you all the explanations you need.

Highlight of our honeymoon . We did the views of Prague tour which lasted 5 hours and it was amazing! We not only learned so much from our knowledgeable and friendly guide, Karel, but were in awe of the beautiful views he shared with us. Using the ebike up the hills made, a task that would otherwise seem impossible, very enjoyable! Thanks to Karel for keeping us safe and making it a great experience. We recommend this activity for anyone!

Great tour to get to know the city!. The e-bike tour was definitely the highlight of our trip to Prague. The guide was the most friendly woman in the whole world. She told a lot of interesting stories and trivia that we will remember for a long time. Also, the bikes were supereasy and they came in handy as there are a lot of heights to conquer. Even though it was a little pricey, this tour is definitely worth the money!

E-Bike tour is a must in Prague!. The e-bike tour with Kate was the highlight of our 3 days in Prague. The bikes are easy to use and even in 95 deg F weather, it was a comfortable ride. We were able to see so much of Prague and get insights into the culture, history, and lifestyles by talking with Kate. She is a great tour guide and we really appreciated her time with us. The trip was so fantastic that we immediately booked the Budapest e-bike tour for later in the week. We're so glad we did the bike tours, they were truly the highlight of our experiences. Thank you Kate!

Exciting Experience. We had a wonderful day with Peter as a tour guide in Prague. Riding on a EBike is fantastic, we chose the longest tour from 9 am to 4 pm, but we did not feel tired. Highly recommended, even to famillies.

Awesome!. The real Prague Tour, with Kate as our guide, was awesome! It was the best part from our visit to Prague. We saw all Prague’s highlights in 5 hours time. The day after; we went back to several places. Thanks to our bike trip we were able to find our way easily! Kate also told us so many interesting things and riding on an Ebike was just fun! We can recommend everybody an” I Like EBike” trip! Especially with Kate, such a lovely and unique guide!

The Real Prague Tour!!!!!. It was a very very good guide:Kate! She's lovely and friendly.This Tour takes you to real original places of Prague and not only to the touristical points.It's a big Tour, but you love it from the first second. Riding on a EBike is fantastic and not that intensive :DThis tour is GREAT AND YOU SHOULD TAKE IT PEOPLE!!!!

What a beautiful experience. So glad we went on this. Kate our guide really put her heart & soul into giving us the best possible experience. The bikes were really good (my wife isn't an experienced cyclist and found them easy to handle, comfortable and not at all tiring.) We particularly liked the various stops at different viewpoints to photograph this beautiful city as well as cruising through the busy city streets, taking in the many sights, sounds and smells.Well, well worth the money. Kate made it special because she cares about people and gives her all.

excellent experience. Had a great cycle around Prague. Peter was an excellent guide. Got a great over view of the city and culture. Thoroughly recommend especially early on in a visit. We also got recommended some restaurants near our hotel and other areas of Prague to explore. It has been great to eat out and explore away from the tourist hot spots. Cycling was so easy with the e bikes.

amazing trip. We went on a 5 hour tour in Prague with the ebikes. We have seen so many beautifull buildings, local and touristic attractions. Kate, our guide, told us many interesting facts about the city. We can recommand everyone to do the tour, and its also fun for the children!!!

Ebike is great A MUST. The Ebike /electric Bike is the way to see Prague or more so ALL of Prague we ended up taking a Private guide ADAM who was Excellent & highly recommended we combined elements from the scenic castle tour & the city tour so in 3 hours we saw the whole city about 20 Kilometers it was a lot fun & we got to see it riding an ebike instead of walking all the while just having a great time Highly Recommended.

Excellent way to get to know Prague. The e-bike tour was a perfect way to get to know all the important places in Prague as well as other special ones. Our tour guide Kate was not only very experienced but made us feel all very at ease. She was also very willing to give us travel tips for the other days we would be in Prague.I would definitely recommend this tour.

Awesome. The tour was great, the guide was nice! First, e-bikes are awesome to explore Prague, second, our guide was very nice so we learned a lot about Prague. We got to see much more than we could have if we walked. I can really recommend this tour as it is one of the best I've done so far.
View point ride (5hours). Karel was a great tour guide!! We got to see sights we never would have seen and from the view point of a local! All around great experience... Two big thumbs up!!

A Unique Adventure through Prague that You Will Always Remember. Professional, great fun, and very knowledgeable about the city - if you're looking for an interactive tour and wonderful, outside-the-box memory that requires zero preparation in advance (e.g. cracking open a history or guide book to know what you're looking at), then this is the adventure for you! Good for family, friends, partners, or even lonesome
Ensure the batteries are charged. We had a great time exploring Prague bye e-bike! However, we rented the bikes for 5 hours but after 4 hours 2 out of 5 bikes ran out of battery.
I like ebike. Great way to visit Prague. Thoroughly recommended, made special by commentary and comments from Peter!

What a wonderful romantic tour!. This was really a fantastic way to discover such a wonderful city.
The organisation was excellent (e-mail, ...), our guide Peter was sympathetic and very competent. He has adaptated to our expectations.
We'll return to Prague and we'll do another tour ;)

Best way to get to know to know the city. I have decided to kick start my trip and explore the city by booking a bike tour that was really worth it. I have reserved the View Point Ride that gave me a panoramic view of the city while exposing me to the different and diverse neighborhoods. The guide (Karel) was really knowledgable and took the time to share the various stories and mythes. This tour was an exceptional experience and I highly recommend it specially on the first days.

Great way to explore the city!. Our first day in Prague we decided to explore the city on the bikes! It was fantastic!!!! Our guide Kate took us around most beautiful points of the city. Kate was great! She introduced us to this beautiful city and its history and was very informative and knowledgable.It was a very unique experience and so much fun! Definitely recommend this activity to anyone!

Fantastic Real Prague tour. My sister and I took the Real Prague bike tour with Kate our guide. This tour takes you to see things outside of the city center including places where the residents of Prague, live, eat and relax. First, the bikes. It was our first time on ebikes and Kate showed us how to use them with no problem. They were excellent, brand new Pedego Comfort Cruisers - really nice bikes and I can't imagine doing the hills in and around Prague without them especially as it was about 95 degrees the day we did the tour. Second, Kate, our guide. We loved riding with Kate. She is Czech so she is showing and telling us about her country unlike some other tours that use American or British guides. She spoke beautiful English. She was knowledgeable and funny and a pleasure to be with for five hours.The Real Prague tour is really great and gives the visitor a nice counterpoint to the historic center of Prague. We saw lots of neat places but a highlight was the decaying Strahov stadium where the bizarre Spartakiada events (synchronized gymnastics for thousands) were held during Communism.

SO MUCH FUN!!!. Our family just returned from Prague where we had the best time and city tourwith I Like EBike!! We took the afternoon 5 hour tour. We were a little nervous aboutbooking a 5 hour tour in the 95 degree heat, but the time flew by and we loved everyminute of the tour. Our guide, Karel, was great!! He made sure we were comfortable with the electric bikes before starting the tour and we had no problems at all with the bikes. You do have to pedal, but getting up the hills was a breeze and allowed us tosee so much of the city. Definitely will do this type of tour again! Great idea andgood company to book with from the US. Reservation done online and the company followed up with us a few days before our tour to make sure we knew where to be atour tour time. Highly recommend!!

Best thing we did in Prague!!!. We had so much fun on this bike tour. The bikes were really new and in perfect condition. We went all over the city with very little effort. Our leader, Kate was so good with her knowledge of the city and ever so friendly. Most of the Czech people that we encountered were distant and did not engage. Not so with the staff here. Make a reservation and go on this tour. It was by far the best thing we did in Prague
So much fun!! Wonderful tour!. So much fun! Wonderful tour!! Very well worth it, just great!Wear a liner in the helmet, I had an allergic reaction - not rare, to the helmet - manufacturing problem.

Best of Prague!!!!. My partner and I booked the scenic 5 hour tour and we were not disappointed!!! Our group was made up of 4 groups, seven people including us and all different nationalities! Katarina our tour guide was amazing. We made one hell of a group whizzing around the city getting the best views ever and some great pictures. We learned so much about the city and Katarina made the whole thing so enjoyable. Honestly, this tour is worth ever single penny and it NOT to be missed. Skip the segways and get an ebike. Thank you so much. Thoroughly enjoyed our halfway pint at one of the beer gardens <3

Great Day out in Prague. Ebike tour is a great way to see Prague, we can highly recommend this tour. We went with 3 adult children and this was a great day out for all of us. Time goes by fast. Jan is a great tour guide, friendly and professional . You get to see lots of places that you wouldn't discover by yourself, great to be with someone who has grown up in Prague.

Great tour of Prague on electric bike. We did this tour our guide was very good due to his true fondness of Prague we had a great time with people from all areas of world recommend it for great four hours of getting to places that you could not do on foot or by car thoroughly recommend this trip

Best tour I have ever had!. Ebike tour was an amazing experience!The bikes are very easy to control, and adding a lot of fun to the whole adventure.Our guide was kate, she is a very funny and lovely person who talked with everyone and made the group feel comfortable.The people on the group were special, we became friends even before the tour began.. during the tour we stopped for beer and laughed a lot. The tour was long but we wished it never ends. We learned a lot on Prague, and we visited and cycled anazing view points, gardens and city itself, learning about anything with a smile.Definetely recommended! Thank u kateGood group

Never seen so much in one day without even getting tired. Loved it!. I absolutely loved the 5 hour tour. I couldn't believe how much of Prague I saw in such a short time. After 5 hours cycling around stunning views in Prague I wasn't even tired. The electrobikes are just ingenious for the Prague hills. Such a good idea, I learnt and saw so much. The guide was super friendly, down to earth and very knowledgable. Thank you!

Fantastic way to see the city. My friend and I went on the ebike tour with Kate and had a fantastic day. She told us lots of interesting facts that we would not have known about the city. It was a small group and the bikes were comfortable and suitable for all ages! We went to some beautiful points with attractive views of the city. We completed a tour of 35k in five hours and it was super! Kate was always willing to answer our questions and took a genuine interest in learning about the countries that we were all from and comparing them to life in Prague. She also recommended the paddle boats for the following day which we thoroughly enjoyed. Thanks for a great day!

Tour De Prague. My partner Michael and I spent a fantastic 3 hours last Sunday with Tomas our guide. He showed us most of the main sights and explained the history of each place. We would highly recommend I like Ebikes as a very fun and informative way to see the City in very good company.Thank you Tomas.

ebike is the way to see Prague. Charles was our tour guide and knew history and places to show us and sensitive to the needs of the traveler. The one tough thing is that the cobbled roads were challenging to ride over. This was a great tour!
Good experience... I like EBike tour. we had our tour of one hour with guide. per person just 18 Euro. If you dont know how to ride their guide teach 5 to 10 minutes .

Definitely a Highlight. While visiting Prague we went on the ebike tour of the areas where the locals live, work and play. Our guide was Kate and she was wonderful--very friendly, fun and knowledgeable. We were 2 couples in our 60's who had never been on ebikes. It was easy and fun! As we had already spent a couple of days seeing the popular sights in Prague so decided to go on the tour of the not-so-frequently visited areas which proved to be a good decision as it seems to be not as popular with the tourists and we had the tour guide to ourselves.Highly recommend doing this!

See the best views in Prague. I went on the 5 hour tour and it provided me with a much different experience to simply walking around town or doing a walking tour. It combined seeing the major attractions of Prague with detailed historic anecdotes, thanks to our tour guide Kate, and experiencing some of the best views in Prague. All while coasting along on an electric bike. Highly recommended way to spend an afternoon.

My favorite experience in Prague. My wife, Doris and I went on a fantastic 5 hour tour up and a down and around the hills of Prague, over bridges, under the Charles Bridge on and on. Even had some great local beer, but best of all we had exhilarating riding and great views. Local student and guide, Kate was absolutely terrific.

Splurge on this experience!. We were a group of three adults, two girls, 14 and 9. The bikes seemed intimidating at first, especially on a big cobblestone hill. This was the most stressful part, helmets, kids trying on bikes, filling out a form. Do not panic, just start peddling, turn on your electronic device, and you'll notice that there is a delightful throttle on the handle which adds power as if your bike is magic. My youngest struggled with the hand brakes on the first hill, but soon we rode smoothly. There were frequent stops and our trusty guide Karel (Charles in English) briefed us on history, politics, social issues, economics, happy to offer a lecture or go with the flow of our questions. Five hours might seem like a long time, but these bikes do not require much effort and I never broke a sweat. The views were stunning and we went on such a tangled route through areas I would never have known about, that I highly encourage a guided tour. It was as if Karel magically cleared the path for our single line of motley cyclists. If anyone needed bathroom/food breaks, he easily worked them in. He even stayed out with our group later than the designated finish time to ensure a few extra breaks just so we didn't feel hurried. My kids thought it was the best part of our stay in Prague. We recommend doing this at the beginning of your trip so you feel like a master of the city! This is a splurge well worth doing.
brilliant tour. loved it all - can see so much of a city in a very short time. Perfect way to get around this city when one does not have a lot of time

A night on the bikes. Great ride!! Our guide went of his way to get my wife comfortable on a bike. He was very encouraging to make her more confident on the ride. He was very knowledgeable on the history of what we were seeing. The bikes worked great, really helped on steep streets that were part of the tour. The views of Prague from the Prague castle were awesome.

Awesome family tour!. My husband, 2 boys (aged 11 and almost 9) did the family tour. It was great! Our guide Carl was great! He shared a lot of valuable information with us, was patient with us and took us to spots with great views! The steep slopes were challenging at times but we were all able to handle it! Tour covered a lot of sites (much more that what we could have done with our children without a bike). There was even a stop for beer and ice cream. I would recommend this tour to anyone who likes to be active.

Best 3 hours in Prague. We did the 3 hour plus night ride. Our guide took us on an amazing journey, up and down the hills. It was an exciting night that brought our family together. Although at times a little hairy, it was a great experience. Our guides, the two owners, were the best!!

Really Fun!!!. We had a great experience and lots of fun on the bikes. We toured the whole city in a way we never could have without the bikes. The breathtaking vistas and the distance we were able to travel was well worth it. Our guide, Peter gave us history, lore and current event context of the sites. Can't recommend this way to see the city enough.
great day. Very good way to see the city--we covered a lot of ground, and saw some terrific views. The e-bikes a very good at climbing the big hills of the city.

We did the bike tour with ecotours, the guide Matt was very pleasing informative and helpful. A must if you are a biker. The guide spoke good English, was very polite and a wonderful person. A must for exploring all that Prague has to offer.

Fantastic electric bike tour with photos emailed after!. we turned up without a reservation and Peter was great by accommodating our request for a tour at such short notice..we spent 5 hours covering about 32km but it was unbelievably easy with electric bikes. It's definitely a fantastic way of seeing Prague and learning more about its history. I would say you need to be reasonably confident on a bike to do this tour as it is fairly busy with people and cars at times but you do spend the vast majority of the time on cycle paths and away from traffic, so don't let that put you off. All in all a great experience and one I'd thoroughly recommend.

In the Action, Nearly Effortlessly. Prague is a city worth experiencing by foot, but doing so might take you several weeks. Consider taking a pedal assist bike tour that hits most all highlights of this city of hills. In the course of five hours, we covered over 18 miles. Our tour guide, Peter, was especially helpful and clear in his English speaking. He was also mindful to ensure that we were outfitted with safe bikes, and he was cautious to ensure that no stragglers were left behind. The I Like EBike business is run ethically and with the customer in mind. Take it...it beats walking, Segways, and of course, those ever-so-popular rickshaws.

Prague was amazing by Bike. Pete my tour guide was great. It was just he and I cruising around Prague. He had a ton of history and knowledge about his city and country. When said it was over after 5 hours I was a little sad. Hope you try this adventure.

Great way to see the city!. We are a family of four and thoroughly enjoyed the ride around the city, it was a great way to see many sites. Our guide was Kate and she was very knowledgeable and fun. My wife and I are in our fifties and the hills around the city would have made a regular bike tour difficult, but even our 20 something girls appreciated the Ebikes. I highly recommend it

Fun day on ebikes.. We highly recommend this activity. Our guide was Peter and he made sure the trip is fun, engaging and safe. Thanks to the bike's electric support cycling uphill was easy. We have done the Real Prague trip which took us about 5 hrs, and included the city, it's parks, valleys, football stadium, meal in the outskirts of the city and some more.

Viewpoint tour. This is brilliant. A 20 mile circuit of Prague passing along the major viewpoints, parks and castles along the way. The electric bikes are incredibly good and make even the steep hills very easy indeed. Kate, our guide, was lovely, very knowledgable and spoke great English. Almost all of the tour was on cycle paths. It takes about 5 hours, and we saw a load of the city that we would never otherwise have seen. I can really recommend this (so much so that I have written my first review - never been inspired to do this before).

Super fun adventure through Prague!. My husband & I rented e-bikes & explored Prague on our own, as we only had a few hours (not enough time for a tour). We had such a blast! It was our first visit to Prague & we had no idea where we were going, but we found some beautiful views & fun spots. The staff was very helpful, informative, & kind. I wasn't sure I'd be able to drive an e-bike, as I can't drive a scooter, but it wasn't hard; if you can ride a bike, you can do this. I would definitely recommend getting around Prague this way. We had way more fun than we were expecting to!

You have to check this out!. I have never written a review before but I think this is the least the staff deserves. I did the 5 hour tour and it was extremely worth it. If you are here for only a day, I recommend doing it... If you are here for a while, I recommend doing this on the first day, it'll give you a great overview of the city and it'll be easier for you to go back to your favorite spots. Peter was great! Knowledgeable, dynamic, entertaining, and funny. Honestly, I can't say it enough, I've traveled half of the world and this is by far the best tour I've ever received!

Best Way to See All of Prague in a Few Hours. There are many hills in Prague and we were able to get a birds eye view of much of the city in 3 hours. The e-bikes are easy and fun to ride up and down the hills.

Exceptional Prague Experience. We highly recommend the Prague View and/or Real Prague Ebike tour it was the highlight of our one week vacation in Prague. There is NO better way to experience this beautiful city! Kate, our guide, shared tons of interesting facts and history of Prague. Also don't let the distance scare you, the Ebikes do all the hard work. DON'T MISS THIS EXPERIENCE!!

Perfect sightseeing!. We had a another sightseeing tour two day before with a lady and a big agency. With them we was absolutely unsatisfied and bored. Then we find "I Like EBike" and had a 5 hours View point ride tour on eBikes.WOW! It was a very good offer and just a perfect afternoon with a competent guy guided us, lot of fun and very interesting facts about prague. A MUST when you want to see and discover Prague. Thank you Peter!!!

Awesome way to highlight the city!. Our group of 4 friends went on a night bike tour with Peter on our first night in Prague. We had the greatest time learning about the city and were amazed at the incredible views Prague had to offer at night. It was our first ebike experience, and we loved it! It made the hills of Prague easy. The only downside I can think of was the lights on the bikes not all working, but Peter was a great guide and kept us feeling safe and informed throughout the tour. Overall it was an awesome night!

Great tour of Prague. What a great way in exploring a city. eBikes are such an easy and fun way to get around seeing the attractions a great city like Prague has to offer.We stopped at plenty of places, with our tour guide (Kate) taking time to provide us with a "ton" of information.I can highly recommend this kind of sightseeing!!

Amazing Way to View Prague!!. We have just had a fantastic day on our 'view point' I like Ebike tour & absolutely loved it! Jan was our tour guide & he did a fantastic job throughout, he made us feel very welcome & safe the whole time, we would highly recommend this tour. He was very knowledgable on history & everything to do with Prague, the tour wasn't just about this though, it was about being taken to places in Prague that you wouldn't necessarily get to go to on foot or even know about. The views were spectacular & had lots of photo opportunities, which was brilliant as there was so much to take in & admire. Not only the pictures we was taking, but Jan was taking pictures of us through out the tour and emailed them to us, which was a nice touch. The bikes were great fun & so easy to use, 5 hours exercise has never been so easy!! There are plenty of stops for refreshments, especially beer gardens :) Has been the highlight of our trip and would happily do it again & recommend to all!

A fun, easy way to see Prague. We had a great time. Our guide Kate was very helpful. She even came in early on a Saturday in order to accommodate our schedule. Wish we could do a longer trip with her.

Highlight of our trip to Prague!. Choosing I Like eBikes was a great decision! We were able to see views of the city we could never reach on foot. Lots of great photo opportunities and laughs. Kate was fantastic and answered all of our questions. We highly recommend this tour!

Excellent tour through the "real" Prague. This E-Bike tour was the highlight of our Prague stay. It was a windy and cold day, but Jan and Kate were incredible guides and made sure we enjoyed ourselves the entire time. We rode through some of the sites within Prague while being taught different facts about the city all the way to the surrounding communities where the majority of the Prague people live. Along the way we stopped at a "real local" restaurant where the food was amazing, incredibly cheap, and not a word of English spoken. We thoroughly enjoyed this because it's the type of place you'd never find without the knowledge of such great guides. While all the credit goes to the guides, the E-Bikes were a blast as well! We were able to cover so much without getting worn out. My wife and I walked away joking that we have to get our own. If you're going to do 1 tour in Prague, we HIGHLY recommend I Like EBike. You won't be disappointed!

" A most wonderful day in Prague". Our "I like E Bike" tour was simply fantastic ! Riding an electric bike is the best way to fully explore a city. We saw so many sites and had so many experiences that we wouldn't have had any other way. Our guide, Jan, was amazing......besides being extremely knowledgable, he was friendly, caring and most entertaining. The weather wasn't the best ( it even snowed ) but that didn't dampen the day at all. Try this - you'll have no regrets !Meg and Joe BurkeWisconsin, USA

A Great Way to See Prague for the 1st Time. I really enjoyed the tour, and highly recommend it - the highlight of my short stay in Prague. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly. We saw the main attractions in the city. However, by riding a bike, you really get to see the city outside of the tourist core. Much better than a walking tour, I thought. Plus, the e-bike was a great vehicle - especially for the hills around Prague. If you want a little exercise by peddling, you can. If you want the electric motor to do the work, that's fine too! Definitely bring a camera and probably some water. Maybe an extra layer or two to stay warm. You probably need to have at least some level of fitness and proficiency with a bike. I probably wouldn't bring small children. You should also probably be a little flexible and spontaneous and just ready for what the tour brings - which was a big part of the fun!

Great way to see Prague - Easy Ride, Gorgeous Views, Wonderful Guide,. These e-bikes are awesome! You must pedal to keep the electric assist motor working and after a little practice you easily get the hang of it. You control how much assist you need, and you can vary it for uphills and flats or not use it at all for the downhills. I am an avid cyclist, so this was fun to try out (and almost necessary on the hills as the bikes are on the heavy side). A little practice and you're off to explore all the major sites in Prague. From each vantage point you get a great sense of the layout of the city and how/what you want to see in more detail. The views are spectacular. The pace is set by the group and there are two rest stops (at the monastery for a taste of beer that the monks brew; and later at a park for a quick snack). Peter, our guide, was quite knowledgeable and his english is perfect. I prefer to explore by bike, because you can cover a lot of ground and get a feel for the layout - this was a perfect tour for me - Thank you EBike!!

One of our best experiences in Prague. We did the grey View Point Tour on our 1st day in Prague to help get a feel for the city and also identify places we would visit in more detail later. Prior to arriving in Prague we had booked the tour via email and Jan had answered all our questions quickly and efficiently and had offered a private tour at the same price as a group tour. We found the office easily from the instructions and met Jan and our guide Kate there where we spent a few minutes getting used to the e bikes. They take a bit of getting used to but they work really well and make all the hills pretty effortless. Kate was really friendly and knowledgeable and it was fun to spend time with someone who was passionate and proud of her city and keen to help you enjoy it. The tour took about 5 and a half hours and covered 35 km but this really wasn't too strenuous and we say areas and places we probably wouldn't have visited if we hadn't done this tour. We did revisit a number of the places again on foot and by tram etc especially as some of the views are stunning. We would thoroughly recommend this tour company if you want friendly and helpful service and an enjoyable way to see a fair bit if Prague in a relatively short time frame at a reasonable cost. Thanks again Kate and Jan!

A pleasing Prague experience. It is nice to travel around a historical city on bike, a city which is pretty bike-friendly. The grey tour includes a stop where you can taste a very good special beer. Our tour guide Peter was very friendly and informed us about almost everything that we could ask for. E bike really does not tire you, and you really do not need to be an expert rider. It was a great experience.

Could not have done anything better on our last day in Prague. This tour was incredible, we did the 'purple' tour which took us and another family outside of the main tourist areas of the city, and into the lesser seen, but just as interesting and beautiful parts of Prague. Peter our guide was great, really friendly and had lots of interesting things to point out as we rode around on the assisted bikes.

Very unique and beautiful tour.. We loved our guide, Katarina (Kate), and would recommend this to everyone. Especially great if you have already seen all the popular attractions. We saw unusual sights and outskirts of Prague. It was just my college-age son and myself on the tour. It was a great way to spend the day together.

e Bike tour in prague. We took the ride around the most famous places in the heart of Prague on e-bikes with our guide Jan. It was great way to learn more about the city.For hilly areas its really helpful and gives you immense pleasure even not getting tired and enjoying the city with playful manner & having fun.kasia
Best activity we had in Prague. Fun, easy and really interesting from a cultural stand point. A 3 hours tour on the heights of the town.

Beautiful ride with all the highlights!!. We were looking for a nice tour around the city. And then we met I Like E-bike and booked a trip. It was treuly great. The guide Jan was nice and showed us the beauty of prague. All the best vieuwes and history of the city. We had never see that mutch in that short of time. It is the best way to see the city. And the e-bikes helps you perfectly in the hills.If you want to see prague this is the trip.

Fabulous, very interesting and fun.. We had a very interesting tour and loved every minute ,me and my husband were lucky enough to have the tour alone as we were a day early before the season started. Jan was very friendly,professional and knowledgeable, the bikes were very comfortable and easy to ride, all in all an excellent experience and great start to our short break in Prague.

It was amazing and very worthly. This was the highlight of my trip. It is definitly a must do for all travelers to Prague. Jan the tour guide is soo chill and knows many things and will bring you to the best places in Prague. You will also go to a typical Czech restaurant and the food is soo cheap and so amazing !!I had a blast !!Frederic from canada

We LOVE EBike. Jan was a wonderful guide. Lots of fun, knowledgeable, and laidback. The EBikes are very easy to ride and fun, too. Obviously, the scenerary was amazing. We has 6 in our group and all were VERY satisfied with everything!

Jan's the man. This was the highlight of our trip. Jan brings Prague to life in style and is not afraid to show you the more gritty parts of the city so that you get an accurate feel for the real Prague. He is also a very entertaining chap who is happy to tell you about what he thinks of the current Czech President (not a lot ! ) . For an unfit middle aged man I was surprised to find how effortless cycling on electric bikesis. Quite simply this is the best way to see one of the most beautiful cities in the world

Highlight of our trip to Prague!. This Ebike tour will be one of your favorite memories of your trip to Prague! We took the evening tour with Jan as our guide and had a terrific time. Bikes were safe and comfortable and Jan was patient, knowledgeable and a lot of fun! Would highly recommend the evening ride in good weather; the lights of the city are beautiful!

Best way to see Prague. I highly encourage anyone to do this bike tour before venturing on their own in Prague. You will see and learn about Prague with an experienced tour guide who will guide you through Prague beautiful scenery and key locations. A MUST for any tourist.Orfilio

great experience. i took this tour with my family and it was the best way to get around prague, our guide Jan was very good with us and always answer all the questions that we had, we also learned so much about the story of prague.do it do it!!! excellent tourthank you very much

Exciting visit!!!!. Our tour with EBike in Prague was very nice. The bikes are very comfortable and it is a very nice way to get around the city.Our guide was very kind and let us feeling the flavour of the city!I would recommend it to everyone!

Jan was a great host. This was an excellent tour of Prague. The bicycles were easy to ride and also had assistance with a propulsion system. We saw great sights and the tour lasted for several hours. Many great memories and Jan our tour guide could not have been better. Highly recommended!

Prague in a way many don't get to see it!. What a way to see this amazing city! Jan, our guide and owner of the company, was entertaining, informative and attentive. We saw so much of the city inside and outside of the tourist areas and learned so much of its history and little known facts in the several hours we spent on this tour. WELL worth the money and time. Do it!!

Best way to get around a beautiful city. My boyfriend and I did the 3 hour romantic ride. It was a wonderful way to get around the city and hear about the history of the sites we were visiting. Jan our guide was very kind and fun to talk with. He was very thourough giving us advice about where to eat and what to see. We had a wonderful evening. Thanks again!

EBike Tour - Prague. I went on this tour with my Aunt, Uncle and 3 cousins back when I visited Prague in May. We had already been in the city for a couple of days at the time we went on the tour, and had seen most of the major attractions. We told our guides this and they we extremely accommodating and gave us a very off-normal tour to many of the more unknown parts of the city, which is exactly what we had in mind! The bikes worked great all day, and were very easy to ride and get adjusted to. Our guides were both great, and even recommended a restaurant to eat at afterwards that was my favorite meal that I had in Prague! Highly recommend this tour.

Bike tour was fantastic!. My husband and I had a great time on the bike tour. We visited Prague in April and went on a 5 hour tour. It was just us and Jan, our guide, so it was very personable. She was very informatuve and friendly. I was nervous about riding for so long on a bike but the ebike was very easy to use.We saw so many sights that we would not have been able to see by foot. This is definitely a must do!!

Top-top-top-tour on e-bike!. Because we were in Prague late in season (November) not so many people took the e-bike tour, but Jan arranged especially for us a guided tour. In and around Prague we noticed a few pretty steep hills, but on e-bike it's very easy to climb them, even without getting tired after the 5 hours on the bike! Theresa was our private guide and she have learned us a lot about the history of Prague and showed us basically more of Prague then anybody can do in 5 hours! (thanks Theresa!) So... if you want to see and learn all of this city in one day, this is absolutely the way to do it!!

Great overview of Prague with incredibly accommodating hosts. After a slight timings misunderstanding in my behalf Ilikeebikes went out of their way to accommodate us and basically gave us a private tour. Veronika was very knowledgable and super friendly. The actual ride is not strenuous at all meaning it's s good way to see the city

Go, or should I say ride for it. We took the 5 hours trip that took us to most of the main attractions in Prague. The EBike is really easy to control and you can feel the help they give you when you go up the hills, so when we finished the tour we could still walk :P. Our tour guide, Veronika, was so nice and we had a great time biking with her. She also gave us tips and recommended about places to see. She knew a lot about each and every site we were. It is great for groups or for couples.

Must do!. Jan gave a fantastic tour of Prague! We was willing to customize our tour to make it perfect for our group. He knew his history well and brought great energy to the tour. He also made the tour a lot of fun. This is a must do experience if you travel to Prague.

excellent! highly recommend. I think this was one of my very favorite parts of my visit to Prague. Jan was an exceptional guide, very informative, knows a ton about the city, and has a great sense of humor and a passion for his job. He has terrific energy. I loved seeing some more out-of-the-way places in Prague, and the lovely viewpoints and parks that we went through. I learned a ton about the city, everything from the history of the first castle in the city to the Lennon Wall next to the French Embassy, and the baby statues with bar code faces in the park. I recommend this very, very highly, and have to say that Jan is one of the best tour guides I've used in Europe. I went on a Segway tour in Prague also, and it doesn't even begin to compare to this ebike tour. I wish I would have done this tour first, then done another tour with Jan instead.The ebikes are great - easy to use, and not strenuous, once you get the hang of it (after just a couple minutes of cycling).

Great idea when visiting Prague. My girlfriend and I had a good time with Ebike tour. Our guide, Jan, is very friendly and fun to ride with. We spent roughly about 5 hours riding the city of Prague but time seem to fly by quickly when you are having fun. You will get to see different sides of Prague with Ebike tour that many tourist may not see. This is a great way to learn more about the city from a first person perspective.

Great Tour in Prague!. Fantastic trip through Prague! We did the "Real Prague" tour with a group of friends all living in Prague and still we managed to see places none of us had ever been! Jan was our guide and did a great job, it was fun and informative. The bike allowed us to see the city from a different perspective compared to more traditional walking tours and the "e" on the bike made it all very easy to do:-) I would definitely recommend this tour.

Great Time. We had a wonderful time on the Ebike tour. We had a large group and Jan did a great job of catering the tour to what we wanted to see! He was very informative and fun. An easy way to see the city first hand and get personalized information. Would definitely do again if we get the opportunity to return to Prague.

great tour and tour guide. a fantastic trip through Prague. 5 hours of riding but not extremely strenuous because of easily ridden e-bikes. Jan was very informative and friendly. the hot wine and beer came at just the right time.

Best 5 hour tour for the adventurous. This is no ordinary tour so you have to know what you're in for before you can really enjoy it.Although the tour we were on was called the 'View Point Ride', it was far more than that. Jan was our guide and he took us on a 20+ mile whirlwind tour of the city to areas of town no tourist would dare venturing on their own.Along the way we stopped at several beautiful parks and Jan's knowledge of the city made it particularly more interesting. The bikes are easy to operate but be warned that your bum will likely hurt by the end of the 5 hour tour. The cobblestone streets take their toll! I recommend you use some sunscreen too. On our trip we had overcast skies and I still managed to get a little burned.The tour was the highlight of the trip but it's definitely not for everyone. For those wanting a more general tour, perhaps a 3 hour tour would be better suited. Jan was outstanding and he made the tour extremely fun.

Fantastic way to see Prague. This bike tour was one of the highlights of our visit to Prague. Our tour was 5 hours and we saw so much, but the nice thing is you don't get tired because the bikes do most of the work! Our tour guide was Veronika, she was awesome and so friendly, and gave us lots of information on each place where we stopped. I would highly recommend I Like Ebike Electric Bike Tours, it was such a fun way to explore the beautiful city of Prague.

Easiest way to see more of Prague. We rented their electric bikes on our 5th day in Prague for 5 hours, it allowed us to view the city and the surroundings from angles we would never have seen. We rode along a nice park (Letenské sady) above the city that offers nice views (see the photos). Then we proceeded to another park north (Stromovka) and then all the way to the zoo. While we didn't go to the zoo, we did saw some nice wines and stumbled upon the Trojský Zámek palace. We followed the river's bank all the way back to Old-town riding nice cycling paths.There was a short time where we had to share the roads – mostly in the old part of the city. Otherwise, we were in parks and bike paths, safe from traffic. Anyway, the drivers in Prague are very cyclist friendly.We were with our 1 year old daughter. They provided us with a free infant see and a helmet for her. We decided to rent just the bikes as we are the autonomous tourists-type. In retrospect though, we should have considered a guide: the staff is very friendly and it would have been a great occasion to spend time with the locals :)I really recommend getting an electric bike as some parts of Prague are quite hilly.We liked the experience so much that we did it again in Budapest (same company)! :)

Simply wonderful. Such trip should not be missed where you get a chance to explore the in & out of the city & surrounding effortlessly as per your own convenience. I'll certainly avail this trip next time.

The best way to see the real Prague. We did the Real Prague tour and it was an excellent choice. It lasts about five hours but it is not exhausting at all since you have the Ebike and there are several stops to enjoy the view, take pictures, have a drink and so on. Importantly you are guided mostly through the places where local people go having the possibility to meet the "Real Prague" usually overlooked by tourists. Last but not least our guide Veronika was fantastic.

Let's start at the beginning, it's a very good place to start. I have developed a habit of taking a bicycle, Segway or bus tour on my first day in a destination. In this case, Veronica was ultimately responsible to deliver the promised services. She exceeded my expectations in all categories. She was friendly, thoughtful, insightful, entertaining and fun. I would also like to note the quality of the business. I received a cofirmation email with directions, a welcome advance note from Veronica and perhaps most importantly was the decision to keep the tour even though I was the sole participant. If you haven't ridden an e bike take this tour. If your are new to Prague take this tour. Even if you just want a fun afternoon take this tour.

Highlight of our trip. We did the night tour with Jan. It was so much fun! They were very easy to use and made getting up all the hills a breeze. We learned so many things and loved our tour guide. If you go to Prague-you should do this bike tour!

Great macro view of city. I originally found this offering on TripAdvisor. Emailed group that was traveling together, and everyone agreed. Jan was our guide. Its a much larger radius of the city than the in town guides and tours may encompass. Jan was very knowledgeable and informative.. Always communicating where we would be going next and what we would be seeing. Having been on an free "in-city" tour the day before, the ebikes complemented views and subjects covered. Jan mentioned that he was a startup created 5 years ago and since then many copycats have appeared, be sure who you are dealing with and make sure you have his address correct. He is just down the street from the American Embassy.
A Must Do in Prague. A really good way to see the city riding electric-assist bikes. Our guide Veronica was great, knowledgeable, and fun. All in all, a really good experience.
Fun!. We rented a couple of eBikes without a tour guide. It was an excellent way to see Prague.We usually tour places we visit on our own, so this suited us very well.

Great way to cover a lot of ground and have fun doing it. Veronika was our tour guide, taking us on an extensive ride to see Prague from a dozen different angles. We were traveling by train for our trip, so we would have had a hard time getting to many of the places around the city and enjoying the views and history. The bikes take a few minutes to get used to, but really make an otherwise hilly and difficult ride a breeze. The closest we've done to this in the past was a Segway tour, which was fun, but I think the bikes make more sense and are more fun in this busy and bumpy city.

Fantastic fun and wonderful service. The staff at Ebikes could not have been more helpful, kind and professional. I took my 10 year old boy to Prague and this was definitely a highlight of the trip. Thank you so much I like Ebike - we could not recommend you more!

Wow! Great tour of Prague!. This is the best way to see Prague. We took the 5 hour tour with Veronika as our guide. It was awesome! The bikes were so fun and easy to ride and Veronika did an excellent job of showing us parts of the city we never would have seen on our own. She was GREAT and so was the tour! I highly recommend this tour.

Awesome time in Prague. We (my colleagues and I) had an awesome time in Prague, specially the e-bike tour. Our tour guide Veronika was very helpful and very good in what she's doing. We're glad that we booked the e-bike tour. Recommended to anyone visiting Prague.

Breath of fresh air!. We hate big, group-like tours. This is fun and personal. We took 2 tours during our stay in Prague. The View point tour and the Romantic night tour. As some of the areas overlap, our lovely guide improvise on the Romantic tour and show us some other interesting places . This is not just about the history of Prague, but also the personal experiences of our guides. After we returned from the Romantic tour, I was presented with lovely gift of chocolates. What a wonderful way to celebrate my birthday! Thank you!

Fantastic complement to our Prague tour. My wife and I took the Romantic 3 hour tour. At the beginning we didn't know what to expect, as we had been in Prague for 3 days and had visited most of the sites. To our surprise this tour took us to places where locals hang out and with fantastics views of the City. Our guide, Veronika, was amazing and gave us an insider perspective of the City, we would never get with the regular tourist guides.The electric motors in the bikes help out managing to hills around the City, but you still need to pedal your way around, so you get some exercise done.I highly recommend this tour.Congratulations to Jan, Veronika and their team.

Highlight of our first visit t Prague. My wife and I took the 'Real Prague' I Like EBike tour, and it was definitely the highlight of a fantastic four days in Prague! Jan is a super guide, very friendly, knowledgeable and has excellent English. We got to see parts of Prague that we would never have seen otherwise, and through the eyes of a person who grew up in Prague. The E-Bikes were great for getting up the hills to spectacular views.... we were over 5 hours on the trip and did not feel tired afterwards. We wish Jan and his team every success into the future! Brian & Pauline, Ireland.

Spectacular and priceless!!!!. Our tour guide,Jana, was excellent!!! She spoke Spanish and English fluently and she knew everything about Prague. In 5 hours we visited the most important places in Prague. I highly recommend this tour if you have children. We have two boys (10 years and 14 years old) and they had a blast. The best way to know Prague is definitely by ebikes. Thank you very much for a wonderful and unforgetable day. Ponce Family

Electric Bike Tours in Prague. I am so glad we took the Electric bike tour with I Like E Bike instead of going it alone in Prague. First, Prague is an amazing city but the tourist areas are not made for biking. The crowds and traffic will eat you alive! We did the 5 hour view point tour on 8/13/2014 and had a great time in spite of a few sprinkles. Janna was our guide and did a great job. We stopped frequently and she explained the scenery and points along the 35 km route. We even got to grab a St, Norbert beer, brewed at the local monastery atop one of the mountains above Prague. Get the amber!  The route takes you around the outer parts of the city near the castle, tv tower and soccer stadium but gives you view points you won't see in the teaming masses in old town. The price was 1475CZK which is $70.8 per person. It's not cheap but in comparison to most European cities, this event has great value.

Best day in Prague!. Took the 'Real Prague' tour with my boyfriend on the last day of our stay and it was incredible. We opted for this tour because we were tired of walking around the city center and main areas of Prague. I have to say, the tour was a complete breath of fresh air. This tour takes you to places that are difficult or nearly impossible to see by foot. Our amazing guide, Jana, showed us so many wonderful things about Prague and educated us quite a bit on the history of the Czech Republic. I'll admit that I was a little hesitant about the ebike but it was SO fun to ride! The ebikes are roughly the same size and weight as a regular bike. After pedaling for a few rotations the motor kicks in and you're off!

Highlight of Prague Trip!. The E-bike tour of Prague was so amazing! My husband and I booked this so we could see Prague from another prescriptive besides foot and it was great. We were brought to places and viewpoints we never would have gone to on our own. Veronika our guide was so great and informative. Being that she has lived in Prague her whole life she had great knowledge and history to share with us! It was really neat hearing about the city from a local. She was super friendly and fun to spend 5 hours with. She even arranged the tour we wanted at a special time due to the weather forcast to make sure that we would have the best time. We never got tired on the E-bikes and would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Prague who wants to do something different and see amazing sights!

A must do while in Prague. We were in Prague for a week and the 35km e-bike tour was the highlight. The tour that Jan planned gave us a great overview of the city and enabled us to see a fantastic variety of sights in a short time. The bikes were very easy to use. Jan is very knowlegeable about the histtory of Prague and managed to keep us interested with many amusing anecdotes. The small group size was especially welcome and our many questions were answered patiently. The personal attention given was fantastic. This tour is very worthwhile.

It's an ingenious concept, perfectly executed.. The Real Prague Tour is perhaps the best tour of any city, ever. The e-bikes are so much fun they made my giggle all day. It was hot when we went and I never broke a sweat while riding. It's just like biking, no special skills required. We are a very curious couple and the content of the tour was full of the exact kind of educated insider information we crave. It's just as if we called up a distant cousin in Prague and he said, "Let me show you around." Our guide had a personal story about every one of the oddball sites we visited. He grew up here and Prague is his city, but through the tour he made Prague my city, too. Tips:They have water for you to bring along, but I appreciated the extra water I had with me.Send an email to make a reservation. They are very quick with responses and even recommended which day would be the best for the route we chose. Saturday morning was awesome! There was little traffic and the farmers market was in full swing. The scenic tram #22 gets you close to their office. I liked that we did this tour the day after we toured the touristy parts of Prague. It gave me added perspective. (The touristy parts are easy to do on your own or with a free audio podcast walking tour.)The quirky sites of the Real Prague Tour you could never find on your own. Or appreciated them if you did.

Best way to see Prague. We went on the 35 Km bike tour with Thereza. We were astounded how many sights we saw, the history we learned and how fun it was. Thereza was a great host and went out of her way to help us continue to have a great trip in Prague with all her insights and tips. This was indeed the highlight of our trip to Prague. Art and Carol, Pittsburgh, PA

A great but different way to see Prague. My wife and I visited Prague as part of our honeymoon. We are so glad to pick Ebike as part of our journey. Jan and Terezka were great. They showed great passion in the business. We spent about 5- 6 hours together and we made great friendship at the end. Jan is very proactive. He provided many information and reminder ahead of time. He also emailed us pictures and summary of the tour at the end of day. He obvious loves what he is doing and would love to excel in this business.The Real Prague tour is a great way to see Prague. We got to know the people there, what they think and what kind of life they live in: we visited the stadium, the student dorm, artist resident, a park near the Castle, a geocaching location, a pond with injured swans, a great local restaurant with cheap price-- much cheaper than the tourist area, a beach next to the river, local's shopping area.....many many things. I am impressed how many things we covered in a few hours. A very good way to put yourself in the local culture. Ebike is nice way to cover bigger area and easy to go uphills. You wouldn't be able to cover as much using Segway. Both guides are local with abroad experience. The communication was great and they provided a lot of their perspective, which we really appreciated. One tip of this tour is: you will ride bikes outdoor. So you are better off check the weather forecast, bring sunblock, and wear comfortable clothes and shoes. The rest? Just take it easy and enjoy your time in Prague.Both my wife and I would love to go back to Prague. We will visit Jan and Terezka again as old friends.

I am the rockstar of the trip for booking this tour!. I was anxious about booking this tour as I really did not know all of the folks traveling with us. During the day, however, each one of them approached me to exclaim that is was probably the best activity of our week! Jan and Teresa were amazing guides. Teresa even convinced me and my friend who NEVER eat hotdogs to try a Czech one--yum!! Don't miss this!!

Fabulous way to get intro to Prague. Jan was a great guide, and adjusted the tour for our needs (recommending the Family Trip for us instead of Real Prague due to my initial unease with the bike).Riding the bike was unbelievably easy, and turned out to be a really great intro to Prague. Jan was very thoughtful in directing us and watching for traffic. The hills were no sweat because of the ebikes. We got great background from Jan on various political/social highlights on Prague (why do the doors have symbols over them?), and loved the insights as a way to get to know the city and the people.Bonus: get a couple of the delicious hot dogs if Jan takes you to a biergarten with great views overlooking the city.

Value for money. The tour by eBike was perfectly planned. We took the tour on 21 st June 2014. The guide was excellent with total knowledge of Prague. She gave us indepth details of places. Prague is very up & Down , so it is very difficult to ride ordinary bikes. But, Ebikes were most suitable as we went to almost all corners of Pague in a short period of 4 Hours.

We really LOVED " I Like Ebike" and our "Real Prague" tour!. Our ebike tour exploring the parts of Prague that tourists don't get to see was the highlight of our four days in the city. Our tour guide, Tereza, was friendly, engaging and highly knowledgeable. She freely shared historical anecdotes from her own experiences and those of her family, giving us unique insight into what it meant to live under communist rule, and then through a revolution and cultural rejuvenation. We rode through scenic parks, had lunch at a working class pub in a small village, viewed and learned about communist-built housing where a majority of the population still live, cycled through the wealthy housing district and even bought fresh vegetables at an open air market in the communist housing blocks. The electric bikes made for effortless traveling, even on the steepest of hills!. I can't say enough about our wonderful experience with "I Like Ebikes" and our memorable guide Tereza. This is a must do tour!

A beautiful day in Prague. My friend and I visited Prague last month and had a wonderful day with Petra riding our hilarious ebikes around town. Trust me, you don't want to ride a real bicycle around Prague unless you are an Olympic athlete! It is a beautiful city with many sites and the unique part of this tour is we saw the park and other locations that we wouldn't have seen on our own. Certainly one can walk through the Old Town, but where would a tourist know where to go in the other districts? We learned parts of Prague's history, social life, food, beer and made a new friend. She was wonderful the whole day and even took pictures that Jan sent to us later, free of charge. I would recommend this trip to everyone.

A great day out after you have exhausted the sights on foot!. We really enjoyed our day out with e bikes and our guide Tereza. We thought the bikes were amazing and such a great way to cover a lot of ground.We covered so much ground it's hard to believe we did the Real Prague tour in six hours. We really got an insight into the Real Prague as well, seeing the castle grounds and park before the huge stadium and then out to the suburbs along the river. Loved our stop off at the restaurant for lunch. Very fine goulash! And Our thirteen year old was happy with her potato pancakes and enjoyed trying Terezas fried cheese!It's a great thing for kids to do probably once they are street safe on a bike and tall enough to handle an adult bike and gives your feet a rest from the cobbles. It is also a marvellous way to escape the crowds.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND!. My husband and I heard about I Like E-Bike from a friend's recent visit to Prague. We took the viewpoint ride (just the two of us on the tour) and had a blast. The bikes are super easy to use...not even a workout. Anyone from any fitness level could do these tours with ease. Barbara, our guide, was very fun and energetic. It started raining on our bike ride and we stopped for a bit to see if it would slow down. It did, and we were able to finish our tour. This is a must do on your trip to Prague!

Highlight of the Trip! Awesome Staff. I Like EBike was definately the highlight of our trip. The fun bike tour brought us to the main sights of Prague, and the views are truly stunning. The staff, and mainly our tour guide Jan were super friendly and fun, and even took us to a beer/lemonade break in the park. The bikes were great and easy to ride, and the tour was never boring for a single second; nonstop fun. Thank you I Like EBike! We enjoyed it a lot and the photos you sent us look great. Highly recommended! From Dominican Republic and Israel ;)
Private Tour Of Praugue. Touring Prague on an eBike is a great way to get the lay of the land and hear stories about Prague. My guide Tereza was fun to hang out with for 5 hours.

Prague ebike amazing!. I arrived early as I wasn't sure where I was going and greeting warmly by Tereza, we had a lovely chat and it turned out I was the only one on the tour so we started early which was great. The tour was so fantastic and I had such a great time. Tereza and I talked about everything and the sights as well! Was such a fun way to see Prague, riding my regular bike is going to seem like such hard work now! Fantastic tour thank you so much :)

Beyond the local tours of Prague. It was our last day in Prague and my wife and I wanted to see Prague up close and personal. Little did we know we were to be the only two that day. Barbora was our guide and instantly became like a part of our family. She made the tour a lasting memory of Prague we will treasure forever. During the trip thunderstorms caught up with us for about 45 minutes and Barbora's concern was for our comfort and safety, she found a quaint graffiti tunnel to wait out the storm. The tour as a 5 hour tour that stretched well past the time, all the while Barbora was more interested in making sure our experience exceeded our expectation............and it did!! What a way to experience the local Prague and the lovely people. It is well worth the time if you want to see Prague from a different perspective than a standard tour package.

Top tour and a great way to see Prague. We did the View Point Ride and it was a great way to see some of the touristy sites as well as the real Prague. Our guide, Barbara, was friendly, informative and an excellent companion. Having not ridden a bike for a good few years, we found the electric bikes fun and easy to get to grips with. It also made travelling around effortless. The 5 hour tour provides excellent value for money.

excellent experience. it is very worth to join the ebike trip, thx tourist guide Tereza brought us to go around Prague and detailed explain each places. thanks for her caring and we really feel like frds.

No other way to see the Real Prague!. I can't remember the last time I rode a bike, and am not in the greatest shape, but I Like EBike made it a pleasure to cover the hills and curves of suburban Prague! The bike's battery kicks in as long as you keep peddling. The Real Prague tour is not a typical city overview. You won't see the touristy sites. You'll be led through the little-seen outskirts of the city and see remnants of the Soviet occupation, where people live, play and hang out. Our guide, Barbora, provided great insight into what life is like in Prague now and how it has changed since the Revolution. I was a slow rider, and she was patient and encouraging. Our 5 hour adventure took 6 hours, but I felt no pressure at all. We loved our stop at a local tavern for goulash and beer. The next day, when we visited the tourist sites, we had much greater insight into what lies beyond what the crowds come to see!

Excellent EBike Tour of Prague. What a great way to see an excellent overview of Prague. Our family of 5 (all adults) had a really good time seeing the sights and with Prague being really hilly, it is such a great way to go. We decided at the last minute we wanted to try an EBike(this was our first time - WE LOVED IT!), and missed the morning tour. So we asked if we could suggest our own type of tour (3 1/2 hours) and they were so accommodating. Both of our tour guides (Bara and Tereza) were informative, friendly and had a very good knowledge of the history of Prague. The tour took us to through the Royal Gardens which offered breathtaking views of the entire city. We continued along the river and to the most beautiful architecture of any city we have visited. They even sent us pictures from our tour that we enjoy and bring us great memories! Definitely recommend "I like EBike" tours!

Wow!. I booked in for the view point tour and was blown away by the sheer volume of attractions and beautiful views seen on just one tour. The guide was very helpful and knowledgable and also was flexible with requests. I would recommend if only for the different and beautiful views of the city but the art and history were just as interesting. The Czech foot massage at the end was unexpected but greatly appreciated! :)

An amazing afternoon. We, a family of 6, signed up for the family tour. Construction suggested that they modify the tour, which they did perfectly, and we had 4 hours of a very gentle ride (no problem for kids age 2 to 13) through beautiful parks, along cobblestone streets, and getting a fantastic overview of Prague. The guides (Barbara and Petra) spaced out a couple of short stops at playgrounds, which the kids loved. They were full of interesting information and stories, and seemed to adjust the ride to our interests and abilities.  We very highly recommend this as a fun way to get an overview of Prague -- do it when you first arrive and you'll quickly understand the layout of the city and know how to schedule the rest of your visit.My daughters think they should change their name to I Love EBikes. We all did!

Best Bike Tour We've Taken!. My family and I (adults late 40s and daughters 22 and 18) had a great time on our bike tour yesterday with Teresa! In our travels we've taken similar bike tours in Paris and London but this was by far the best tour and time we've had. I highly recommend touring with electric-assist bikes versus standard ones in Prague due to the hills. These bikes were great assisting as we climbed and allowing us to see the whole city in an afternoon versus smaller routes offered by others. We took the views tour on the first day of our trip and saw not only the normal tourist stops but also two or three parks, the worlds largest stadium, where the Stalin statue once stood, and many other unique areas and stories about this great city. Our guide also gave us a personal perspective of the fall of communism and many other stories....leaving feeling we found a new friend! She was also great in providing recommendations for local restaurants that we visited and enjoyed immensely - would give this bike tour company higher ratings if I could!

Excellent Experience, You should do it. It is a very good way to see the beautiful prague city, rather than getting on Hop On Hop Off all the time, we chose to do it by these e-bike, which gave us the opportunity to see and feel the scenes from a different angle. Dont worry if you are not fit on riding a bike, as the electric motor will do it for you, you just have to half ride the pedal. Thanks to Babara and Teresa.Albert and Kathy

excellent tour for families. We are visiting Prague with my 13 year old son, 19 year old daughter, and 75 year old father-in-law, and stumbled upon EBIKE tours. They have bicycles that have an electric assist for getting up hills with almost no effort. My father-in-law loved it. Our tour guide (Burt) was fully knowledgeable about Prague history, and had some good jokes to add in. They are a great bunch, and we highly recommend the company for those that want to really see Prague off the beaten path.

Prague as never before. While on an offsite, we took the occasion to visit Prague by bike, which seemed almost impossible at first, until we heard of I Like EBike.What a great and easy way to visit places that you wouldn't find otherwise ! Jan and Terezka took us on a 5-hour trip around the city, showing us great view points and parts of the daily life of the city, and sharing their passion and knowledge of Prague. They tried their best to meet our expectations and mood by being very flexible and chilled, which contrasts with other kinds of all-in-1-hour tourist tours that you can find in Prague.

So much fun and the best way t see Prague. This was just awesome. Our guide Teresa was lovely and had so much interesting information about the sites we visited. The bikes were so fun to ride and required very little effort! We did the three hour romantic tour which was perfect. I had accidentally mixed my dates up with the booking yet Jan still managed to fit us in a couple of days later without penalty which was very kind. I'm just sorry I mixed the dates up as I wish I learned everything from this tour at the start of our stay instead of the end! Highly recommend you do this if you're contemplating any tour of Prague, it is well worth the price. You will see the best views of the city and have a great time.

Great view in a chilled out atmosphere. We took the eBike tour with 8 people today as part of our Prague offsite, and everyone had a great time on the tour, thanks to our lovely guides, great stories and of course the eBikes. This tour is of special value, because you can see parts of Prague that you usually would not see as a tourist while getting a feeling for the 'real Prague'. I would recommend the tour and the provider to everyone!
