Some notes:- Riding the eBikes is very easy and not exhausting at all!- The tours are flexible regarding duration in case you think 5 hours are too long (which is actually not the case!)- According to the founder/ guide this is actually the first and original eBike Tour of Prague and even in Europe (quite amazing!)

Perfect tour of Prague. This was my third bike tour in Europe, with the first two being larger group tours with 10-20 people. The eBike experience trumped both of these tours as I felt as if we were biking with friends. Tereza and Bara took us to the best viewpoints, shared their knowledge on Prague's history and educated us on Prague's culture. Some of the best parts were during breaks where we chatted as a group while having a snack. In addition both guides helped us plan the remainder of our time in Prague and made sure our restaurant choices were wise ones.

Fantastic way to see Prague. I called I Like EBike the day I arrived in Prague to schedule a trip and, even though it was past 7pm, Jan pick up the phone and we arranged a tour for the very next day!The following day, we met Barbora, who would be our very friendly guide for the tour. We were supposed to have another couple on our tour, but they didn't show up, so it was as if my wife and I had a private tour. For the next five hours, we braved the blazing sun. Barbora was very patient and showed us parts of Prague that are probably not in guide books. The fact that we did all this on e-bikes made it so much easier. I can't imagine doing it on a regular bike especially if you're just here on vacation and not training for a race.At the end of the tour, Barbora gave us a great recommendation for a restaurant that serves local Czech cuisine. I highly recommend going with I Like EBike if you want to see Prague.

Highly recommend!. Our family had a fabulous time getting to know Prague through the e-bike tour. Not only were the bikes user friendly, but we were able to cover so much ground and see numerous sights because of the e-bikes! I can't say enough wonderful things about our guides, Jan and Teresa! They were knowledge of the history and importance behind landmarks as well as provided us an image of what it is like to live in modern-day Prague. We are looking forward to trying more e-bike tours in other cities!

Amazing way to see the city of Prague. This was such a fantastic way to see this beautiful city. Our guide, Petra, was amazing. Very knowledgeable about Prague and it's history as well as a really nice person to spend the day with!! I highly recommend this as a way to get the blood flowing after a long plane ride and to experience to majestic city of Prague!!
View Point Tour. Fabulous tour of Prague! Highly recommend !! Saw so much of Prague that would never have been possible any other way......this is a must see tour!!!!

Amazing!. This has been the highlight of my trip to Europe so far! The Ebikes are awesome! Easily biking up the beautiful hills of Prague was continuously enjoyable. The route was breathtaking! The staff were very sweet, knowledgeable, and enthusiastic! Would highly recommend this to anyone!

A great way to know the real Prague. Jan and his assistant Babora were enthusiastic promoters of Prague. The 5 hour "Real Prague" tour was full of sites we would never have seen otherwise. We saw the beautiful parks and a fabulous view of the city. We saw where the "real" people live away from the historic city centre. We also travelled through Prague's "Hollywood Hills" of beautiful mansions and through the graffiti covered back trails. We had a typical lunch in a delightful Prague suburb. We were very impressed by the tour, the information we received and the bikes that took us effortlessly up the steep streets! It was cool and Jan thoughtfully provided gloves. We highly recommend this tour. It was a lot of fun!

Highlight of visit to Prague. Jan our tour guide was very friendly and accommodating. We had a wonderful time pedaling and zooming up the hills of Prague on a beautiful spring day over the Easter weekend. We saw many sights, enjoyed the conversation and the fascinating landscape of Prague. Thanks very much vor this wonderful adventure!

We liked eBikes & rode our hearts out!. This was the second of an e-bike tour that we had on a recent trip through Europe and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Our guide was very sweet and lovely!Some Pros: - You get to see a lot of Prague - Excellent if you're in Prague for a day or two- Nice to see life outside of the old town square- VERY easy to get around - no strength required to cycle up the hills Some Cons:- The tour was very long, even for hardened nosy explorers like us we got a bit tired of cycling and had to stop for a drink/chocolate break. Some parts could have been cut out but we enjoy cycling and this was a comfortable way to see Prague -My partners bike brakes were quite squeeky but nothing that a few downhills didn't sort out- We would have liked to get more background information from the guide in certain places but overall were quite happy and would recommend the company to others.

Magical eBike + magical Prague = magical trip. When I and my girlfriend were looking for the best way how to discover Prague we came across I like eBike and we thought we would give it a go after reading the reviews. I must say that we were not disappointed AT ALL! Our tour guide, Jana, was just awesome! Not only she was nice and cheerful but also she told us lots of interesting stuff about the history, monuments and secrets of Prague. We had a little stop in this cool monastery where the monks brew their own beer which was really tasty, by the way. We were told that we had done 30km which we just could not believe! The bikes are so easy to go uphill, and especially, they are great fun. In five hours we had done what we would have never been able to do in like 3 days. All in all, we love Prague - we love I like eBike!

Best choise ever for value price if u dont like walking as I do!!!. Hey my name is Lucas live in Scotland and visited Prague for second time but im March with my girlfriend so like real turist. To rent a bikes was best choice what we could done!!!! 1st save so much time and most save ur feet!! After day of walking I hated to do another day of running thru town. In 4 hours we have seen half of the Prague sighseeing. Riverside is just gorgeus!!! U can bike along both sides of river where u would never explore ur experience by walking. Superb was tour around zoo aswell.And such a easy way to see president palace..3minutes from that place. 2 girls who work in shop had surpisely good english.(cute aswell btw). So in point of view best choice..taxi is overpriced. Metro dont really big fan of it and buses..its a chinatown for foreins.

Loved EBike Tour of Prague. We took the View Point Tour and were not disappointed. Although I had already been living in Prague for 6 months, I had friends visting from Canada, what a great way to see the city and learn the history. Jan has great insight and knowledge, you can tell he is passionate about his city and country, plenty of rest stops, and even a stop for a beer along the way. We had to make some last minute changes, and Jan was very accomodating, great service. A few things that might be good to know...bring some water with you, some snacks too, the bikes have a nice basket up front to carry a few items, take a restroom break when the opportunity presents itself, good blend of cobblestone and paved roads, and dont be concerned about safety or cycling ability - the bikes really do all the work. The tour was 5 hours, however think four hours would be just perfect - we tired near the end of the tour. Overall, the price is worth the experience - good value and will do it again when my family visits in the summer. Sandra K

Perfect trip to see Prague. We just had to days in Prague and did not know where to start. So we decided to do an electric bike tour with Jana. We got a perfect overview and saw many beautiful places with the bikes. Our guide was very nice, funny and told us all the interesting things about Prague and its history. The electric bikes really helped to go uphill- I would not have been able to do it on a normal bike ;)So it was a great experience for us and I can only recommend it! Thank you again Jana for being such a great guide!

Awesome way to see Prague. We had a great bike tour with our guide Jan. he was extremely knowledgeable , personable and lots of fun he went at an easy to follow pace and always made sure everyone heard his speeches and were safe on the bikes. I might suggest a shorter tour, ours was five hours which was a little long. Four hours would be great with perhaps a water break along the way and some light snacks to keep you going. He treated us to a beer which was very welcome.

MOST DO IT. My best experience in Prague. You really get to see the city as a whole, not only the few touristy areas. The staff courtesy and knowledge was exceptional. Jan, the owner is the best!!!! On my way to Budapest where I will certainly do the tour.

Prague castle and view tour. Barbora was great, and the tour amazing. Although we bike a lot, the electric bikes were fantastic going uphill- we had never been on an electric bikes before. I highly recommend the tour, company and the guide, beautiful views and palaces, very knowledgable guide.

So fun!!. Jan showed us Prague in a fun and exciting way. My husband, sister and I took this tour last week. We got lots of information and a local perspective, as well as pertinent history. He took us all over on paths we would have bumbled around to find on our own. The pace was perfect. My only suggestion would be stop for a beer at the monastery.

Great perspective of city outskirts. I really enjoy the 5 hour biking tour outside the city so that I have gained a different perspective of where the locals are living. Area of improvement will be to do a pre-survey as to what the people are looking for and how fit they are. It will help to ensure the tour is catered to the right audience.

Bike Tour. Jana our guide took us on a fantastic bike tour and showed us the city on a way we never would have seen it ourselves. She told us a lot about the wonderful Prague. We loved the bikes and are now ready to buy 2 new e-bikes here in Denmark.

Amazing Day!. I am in my 50's and a grandmother and I had two 17 year old girls with me. We had an amazing time with our Electric bike tour! We saw sights and went places no other tours take you! It was a full day exercising but the e bike kicks in and literally helps you cruise up the hills! They were easy to ride and we had such a beautiful and insightful day. We went through the public housing areas, several parks, some rural areas and biked along the river! I travel a lot and I have never enjoyed a tour more! Beats the heck out of sitting on a bus all day! I cannot recommend this tour company more highly! Our guide was informative and delightful.

Bike Tour. My partner and I went on a bike tour in March 2014. We booked it the day of and ended up being the only 2 on the tour! Jan our guide gave us a wonderful tour and provided us with interesting facts along the way. He was very nice and took his time. We expected the tour to be around 5 hours but Jan spent extra time with us and we ended being on the tour for 6 hours. He took pictures of us throughout the whole tour with our camera and his camera. The next day he sent us the pictures and edited them and they were terrific. It was a really nice gesture and it meant a lot that he was always offering to take pictures of us. My partner and I never get pictures of us together traveling so it was really nice that Jan did this for us. The route Jan took us on was great because they were places we would never be able to see if we had a car, walked or took public transport. Most of the locations were along the outskirts of prague with beautiful views and sights. I highly recommend this tour!

Best way to see Prague. Jana did a wonderful job of showing us the city. We saw so much more than we would have been able to discover on our own. E-bikes are a revelation -- a great workout but help when you need it. Thanks for helping us learn about your wonderful city.

It was ok i guess.... For such a highly rated tour I expected to be thrilled. I was disappointed, and felt that I needed to do another tour to find out more on Prague. After doing 18 tours in Europe, this was one of my least enjoyable. The most disappointing aspect was the depth of knowledge from the guide. The information was just scratching the surface and the delivery was poor, as if being read straight from Wikipedia. We asked questions to provoke more info but didn't get answers. This opinion was shared by others in the group.The eBikes were fun, but overdue for replacement. We had to wait around for the batteries to be propped with folded up cardboard before we were on our way. Adjustments and fittings were well worn and difficult, delaying the tour beginning and had us returning late. eBikes used by other eBike tours are far more modern.It was a nice tour to see the sights. We clearly didn't have the same guide as the other reviews I have read here.
Great experience!. "View point ride tour" - Five exciting hours, with beautiful views of Prague, guided by two friendly and knowledgeable guides, Jan and Bara. It's a must!

Truly unique experience. Amazing team, Jan and Bara are full of knowledge and very proud of their town, a huge thank you to both of them for making our first trip to Prague so interesting and fun. There is a lot you can learn about Prague by reading guides, but going out on this tour helps you to discover another face of the city and makes it so much more interesting and lively. I thought 5 hours was going to be too long but time flew by and i was ready for more, don't be put off by the length it is so worth it.Thank you for sending some great pictures, lovely personal touch.I highly recommend this tour and thank Jan and Bara for making this a truly unique experience.Hope to be back one day and book another tour!
My trip in Prague. Excellent tour .Choice the full afternoon offer and visit the main points of interrest with very nice guides.Good deal!

AMAZING tour!. I have done several bike tours across Europe and this one really stands out! The personal attention is amazing and they are so knowledgeable. I cannot imagine seeing Prague in another way and feel like I saw the city in a way that not many others have. I highly recommend taking this tour!

Excellent introduction to Prague!. This group was great. I found them here. The equipment was in excellent shape, the guide was fun and knowledgable. Both the owner and guide had excellent English skills and were well traveled (so appreciative of tourist needs and questions). The tour was fun, a great way to see a hilly and large city while able to adjust to different biking skills and athletic fitness levels. Alex, out guide took great photos, one if which is a favorite for my FB page! Do this first thing, to get a taste if what Prague has to offer, then explore In more depth what intrigues you!

A fun, healthy, and thorough tour of Prague!. Back in August we had a rich experience with our tour guide, Jan, through I like ebikes. This was our 10th tour after visiting Paris, Bruges, Amsterdam, and Berlin. Therefore we had a lot to compare to. We were very pleased with how patient and caring our tour guide was. We showed up late due to a mix up in starting points. Nevertheless, Jan generously took to time to give us a 5hr tour. I believe the tour was named the “Real Prague.” This was my third visit to Prague and this tour was the whole 9 yards and then some. We hit up several historical points such as the Castle and Prokops Valley. I never had seen so much of Prague before! Using the electronic bikes was a joyful experience and an engaging way to burn some calories. There were several steep points we would have not been able to make using regular bikes. I would humble say we are in decent shape (we have a daily workout regimen, but not Olympians). If you are looking for a tour of the bridge, clock tower, and other key areas, definitely do a free walking tour. I like ebikes will cover everything else and other beautiful nooks and crannies you would otherwise never see! The tour is not overtly information dense, since you spend so much time traveling around the whole city. I do suggest bringing a snack or just make sure to let your tour guide know beforehand you would like to stop somewhere for a quick bite. Again, they are a generous tour company and will work that into your tour. The next time we are in Prague we know which tour company to enjoy!

A special way to to see Prague. We visited Prague my wife and I and did the Romantic ride tour.Our tour guide was lovely Jana, we received a very interesting explanation.Throughout the tour was fun and we enjoyed it very much.We saw special places that we would not reach them without the tour.No doubt it was one of the highlights of our visit to Prague.During the tour Jana took pictures of us and after the tour finished she sent us the photos by email.Recommended, recommended, recommended!!!!

Electric bike tour. Jana was excellent and we had a great time. After the trip, we were so glad that we decided to do electric bike instead of segway or regular bikes. We saw 2 different people eat pavement on the segways and some of the hills would have been brutal without the electric bikes.The tour was informative, fun, and very well done.

Best way to see prague. We were in prague for 4 days and our tour with jan was one of our attraction in our vacation.It able us to see a lot of prague and get explanation by jan and really have a great time.The E-bike was useful and we did a lot of places that without it we would not have the time to see it and enjoy it.Thank you,Allon & Ariel

You don't want to miss this tour!. Originally EBike tour wasn't in our plans on our visit to Prague however Jana a reception person at Louren Hotel suggested we make this tour and we do not regret making it, in fact this trip became the highlight tour of Prague! We chose View Point Ride. We had the best tour guide Chris who was absolutely superb! Chris was charming, knowledgeable, playful. He has perfect English. He showed us the city as insider and it was awesome. Henry is still talking about the Pilsner beer Chris suggested to try. Chris told us about wine festival, so the very next day we went to it and had our burchack. Nice experience. In our bike tour we were on the top of the mountain in the Park and in the Strahov Monastery, in the old sports stadium, in the center of the city we saw guard changing ceremony at Prague Castle, we were next to Dancing House, TV Tower. We were all over the city. We had our exercises and enjoy city view. Don't worry about your leg on the next day. Because our bike tour was EBike the next day was absolutely normal: no aces or pains. Now we became an advocate for EBike tour: taking the tour is an experience you won't miss. We didn't try other tour guide, but if you got Chris as a tour guide - you are Lucky one!

Great way to see Prague. My husband and I had a fantastic 3 hour tour with Alex when we were in Prague in September. We stumbled upon their office while out walking, took a brochure and went back the next day to book the tour. Alex was very accommodating and even changed the time of the tour to make sure we missed the rain forecast for later in the day. The bikes make climbing hills and travelling distances easy. What a fun way to get around to the best vantage points and learn more about a city from people who live there. Can't recommend this tour too highly! The guys really know their stuff and are friendly, funny and informative. Thanks Alex and Jan

THE best way to view Prague!. We booked a tour online after viewing the fantastic reviews here on Tripadvisor. We took a short tour, as i have quite a bad back, which makes sitting down for too long difficult. This wasn't a problem though, as there were plenty of stops along the way. We arrived on the morning of our ride and were greeted by Jan, who was THE nicest person we met whilst in Prague. He gave us our bicycle helmets and a quick tutorial on the bikes. OMG! The bikes are AMAZING!!! I want one at home! I had no trouble with the bike at all, it was surprisingly easy to ride up a hill (something that i would have great difficulty with normally). We had a great tour around the city, stopping off for stories about Prague, city life and various places along the way. We even got to see the darker side of Prague, which made it feel like a more rounded tour. Something we both thought was a good thing. We stopped off for a few photo opportunities along the way, as suggested by Jan. I can honestly say that Jan really helped to bring the city alive for us and this activity was one of our favourite things that we did whilst in Prague, and even over a year later, we still talk about how great it was. Can't wait to go back some day!Visited September 2012

The best thing we did in Prague. Jan at I like EBike was great. We took the 5 hour "The Real Prague" tour with the owner Jan Pavlica. We were in Prague for 5 days but did not really connect with the city until we took this tour. Jan has lived in Prague his whole life and showed us sites and told us stories that no one else could have. The bikes are great and fun to ride and totally safe. This is a must if you like bike riding and want to really see the city.

Wonderful experience: a must-do!. I highly recommend the e-Bike ride, particularly the View Point/River route (4-5 hours) through in Prague. It was the absolute highlight of our trip. The four of us were lucky enough to have an outstanding guide (Kryštof!), whose knowledge of Prague's stories- sites, sounds, anecdotes and history- was fascinating. If I ever find myself in Prague, I will definitely do it again, as the nature of the experience is one that is constantly changing, with new tales and knowledge gained. The views were spectacular and the tour lent local flavour to our holiday. We even had a spontaneous apple-picking break mid-ride! Hidden-away areas and secret cafes and pubs were visited, adding to the experience. It is an ideal way to see the city, (allows one to venture through tiny, out of the way paths towards beautiful views) the bikes are a dream to operate, and is suitable for families, friends and couples (anyone who can ride a bike, really!). All in all, a must-do!

E-Bike ride was the best part of our trip to Prague!. What can I say...if you have time to do the e-bike ride, I highly recommend you do it. This truly was the best way to see the city. Jan, the owner, took my bf and I all around the city on the View Point Ride (5 hours). This was a long tour, but really allowed us to see the city (though I'm confident the other tours are equally as great). Jan is amazing, and his sense of pride as he shows you around his city is admirable. He truly wants you to have an amazing experience. He went above and beyond what any business owner/tour guide does, he even took pictures of us along the way, and emailed them to us. I was preparing for a cardio-intense workout, but on the e-bike (in September), I didn't even break a sweat, so this is suitable for all fitness levels. Don't pass on the chance to see Prague with this e-bike team!!!

Best tour ever. Our guide was super knowledgeable and friendly. He took us to some very cool out of the way "local" places that gave my wife and I the real flavor of the city, and city-life for Prague residents, as well as some of the most spectacular views and beautiful secret areas. The key to getting to these locations was the bikes; and they worked great. The very steep cobblestone hills were a breeze to go up and down. No athletic prowess required.I cannot say enough about this tour, and highly recommend it to anyone. Bringing your camera is a must, and dress in layers for weather changes on this five hour tour through sun and shade. There is a basket in the front of the bike that can fit cameras, snacks and light weight jackets. etc.

Electric Bike Tour of Prague. After a three week vacation of the Czech Republic, we spent our last day in Prague with a wonderful tour of the city with I like EBike-Electric Bike Tours. Our guide Jana was a great guide who amazed me with her ability to take us through Prague. I don't know how she did it but we went through cobblestone alleys,parks,main streets, slums, new and really old sections of the city on a tour we would never have been able to do on our own. We certainly enjoyed the tour and would highly recommend it to everyone. When we return we will ertainly take the tour again and ask for Jana.

Must do while in Prague!!. My husband and I did the view point ride tour and it was fabulous! We had never done an ebike tour before and it was very fun! Alex, our guide, was very pleasant and professional. The sights we saw were breath taking and beautiful. We took wonderful photos and our guide took photos as well and emailed them to us. We would definitely recommend this trip to family and friends!!

Soooo much fun!!. The bikes are great, after a few pedals the electricity kicks in and you're off!! The hills are no problems. The city is a beautiful place and our tour guide was fantastic. She was flexible to our wants. I highly recommend this to everyone, you will not be one bit disappointed.

Pierre et Cathy : Notre tour de Prague en Velo Electrique (35Km). This tour was really a good moment (if not the best) of our stay in Prague. To my opinion it was the best way to visit the maximum interesting place and monument in Prague and I can say that after our 4 days trip we have been very inspired to start our visit with it. This "electric" tour gives us very good things:1) Escape from the crowdy streets 2) Visit the most interesting monuments in and around town (with all good explanation during 5 hours).3) Experiment the electric bike ( we are thinking about buying one each) 4) A good moment with others participants5) Last but not least: digesting the heavy GOULASH. Try it one time (only just not to die ignorant) and eat in a very good Italian restaurant "Oliva Verde" or French Restaurant "La Gare"And one less:1) the stoned streets so beautiful to see....; We were still shaking one hour after! Could the bikes be fitted with better suspension? I know what Parkinson means now! Jana thank you for guiding us and sharing your knowledge about Prague history . Stoneless, It was wonderful!Pierre and Cathy

Electrifying experience.. We have rented several bikes and take a great tour around Prague. The service was excelent. The guy were helpful and suggested several interesting places.
I can recommend them if you want to look around but don't want to walk all the way.

The bike tour. This trip was the hi-lite of our visit to Prague...we saw things that we never would have if we did not take this tour...saw the real Prague. Our guide Chris was excellent, very informative,and a lot of fun!! This trip is a must do if you are in Prague and if you get Chris as your guide are in for a great day!! We loved this tour so much we did it twice!! Barb and Paul Turner Calgary, AB Canada

The best place in Prague to rent an ebike. :). We really enjoyed to discover Prague with the ebikes rented from I Like EBike! The staff was very friendly and helpful, the service was also excellent.They are located in a very good place near to the castle. Recommended for everyone.

Prague tour. Great deal with guide that had excellent knowledge and understanding of the history, political, and nature questions we had- Our first experience with electric bikes was super and helped move us rapidly around area- We loved the tour and highly recommend this one for other travelers- Guide was very thoughtful, accommodating, and smart

Highlight of our vacation. Being in our 60's and never having ridden a electrically assisted bike, I was a little apprehensive -I didn't need to be - it's as easy as riding a bike! Somehow the steeper the hill (and there are a lot of steep hills) the easier it is to pedal. We took the 22 mile viewpoint tour - appropriately named because as you come around a bend - again and again - you're treated to another gorgeous vista. There is no other way to see so much in only 5 hours. Our guide Kristof was awesome, he was so knowledgeable and fun to be with. He scheduled lots of stops for photos and a lovely beer garden stop too. It was a day we'll never forget

Fabulous way to see the city. We were only spending two days in Prague and feeling overwhelmed by how much there is to see. TA led us here and it was a great success! We did the 5 hour, 22 mile (35 km) viewpoint tour. Here is what you need to know- the bike has an electric assist so you can make it up the hills with no problem. But you are still riding a bike and you will still be tired after 5 hours. You should be used to biking. You don't need to be an expert but you are gong to travel on bike paths, pedestrian areas, roads with traffic and crossing paths with trams. You are on and off the bike frequently. I highly recommend seeing Prague this way. So if you are planning in advance and haven't been on a bike in a few years, take a ride one weekend and brush up on your skills.We met up with our tour guide Jana who gave us a quick lesson in the assist features. Our group of 6 Americans then headed off into the city. The tour is arranged well with some short hops then longer bike path sections that helped us get acclimated to the bikes. You see remarkable vistas and reach areas you would never get to any other way. Not only do you see the traditional sights but most of the more interesting sights also (Dancing house, big babies, metronome, peeing statue). Dress comfortably, bring water and a camera, plan for bouncing on the cobblestones. It's a long but comprehensive excursion with one built in rest stop for food and drink. The sore muscles were also a great excuse to get a massage the next day!

Wonderful excursion. Wonderful excursion, and our guide Alex was enthusiastic in spite of the 100* temperature. She was also full of insights regarding Czech politics and culture. Great opportunity to travel to the surrounding hillsides for wonderful vistas of Prague without a lot of exertion. I think that this was the favorite activity for all of us (teens included) on the trip. Highly recommend it for all ages.

Great Tour. Wonderful way to discover Prague, not only the center but also all the hills/parks etc., amazing views, perfect for a short weekend trip as we had, you drive with the bike for 5 hours and you see really a lot. The guide Jana was nice, helpful and told as really much about the town/history/communism time/present time. We enjoyed the tour a lot! If you ever will visit Prague you have to book this tour!

Nicest experience of Prague/Excellente experience a Prague. This was an unforgettable moment with our guide who is local. By his stories of life in Prague , he made us discovered the reality of the citizens. Another side of the story, a great story about their way of living. Very kind personnel and very very fun experience with the bike! We even want to buy one back home! We give the note of 15 on 10!Cette tournee de la ville de Prague avec une personne locale, qui a vecu et nous raconte ses propres experiences de vie a ete tres enrichissante a tous les points de vue. Ca a fait du bien de sortir des sentiers touristiques. L<experience du velo a ete tres amusante, tellement que nous voulons mon pere et moi en acheter un a notre retour! je donne la note de 15 sur 10!!

See the real Prague. We took the 5 hour e bike tour around Prague and loved every minute of it. We were a small group of 4 people and Alex showed us all the hidden treasures of Prague. We covered approx 32km in and around Prague and it was an easy ride up and down the hills with the electric bikes. She took us to some fabulous view points and through some beautiful bike paths around the parks and gardens including the John Lennon wall. Put it on your list to do you will not be disappointed.

Great way to see Prague. We were given some info from our accommodation and this was one of the tours. We decided to do the tour on our first full day. We chose the City View 35km ride with Chris as our guide. What a great choice, we saw so many sites that we may not have made it to as well as seeing the old town/new town city area from various beautiful vantage points up high. Being a mature couple we had no problems, you get into the rhythm of peddling and the electric motor kicking in, in no time at all. It was great to ride on the bike paths and through some beautiful parks. There is a small amount of negotiating the traffic and cobblestone paths but we felt comfortable with Chris's instructions and guidance. Toilet stops are available along the way and we enjoyed a cold beer about half way through (own cost). We thoroughly enjoyed our 5 hours and would highly recommend.

GREAT fun. Let me say that if you want to avoid the tourist crowd, want to see real Prague, want to experince the city, see where people live, see how is was in the 70's and have a blast doing it then BOOK this excursion. I never imagined I would see and experince so much. I booked the 5hr real Prague tour and it was worth every minute. Our guide Alex was wonderfull, filled with information she was always concerned about our safety and every request was fullfilled. Riding the ebikes is simple and fun. This is an active tour for people who wanted to experince the city away from the standard tourist traps Just do it! 1ST CLASS OUTFIT.

The most fun i had in prague. Me and my wife were in Prague at the end of august and took the ebike tour of the city. We absolutely loved it and had an amazing time. Our Tour guide was Janna and and she was extremely helpful and very friendly and spoke great English too, so a big thumbs up and thanks to her, you really made our day. Riding the Ebike was super easy specially if you get one with the throttle control (You don't have to pedal it all the time :P ). Saw so many beautiful places that we would never have been able to see otherwise. It was raining when i was there so i had to take it on my last day there, otherwise I would have loved to take a different tour the next day too.

Best thing to do for a short visit to Prague. Me and my 3 other friends decided to visit 3 european cities in a span of 8 days (including flight times) in August 2013. Prague was our first city to visit and we only have 1 1/2 day to explore it. The electric bike tour was the best decision I have ever made to see a beautiful city like Prague in a day! Janna was our tour guide, and she was simply AMAZING! Sorry if sometimes we were not listening, it's only because we were so taken by your beautiful city! She had so much knowledge with this awesome city, it's history and culture and always had a smart answer to our sometimes mundane and silly questions. Thanks also for being our official photographer.....the pictures turned out GREAT! Will definitely recommend your company to friends and family visiting Prague. I just wish you would add additional safety equipment like helmets. Its could be a jungle out there biking in open streets.... but you have always kept a eyeful on all of us and made the tour safe for all of us. 5 STARS, you deserve to be "number 1 to do in Prague" in TripAdvisor

The BEST way to see Prague. By FAR!. When it comes to seeing Prague from the best possible perspective, look no further than I Like eBike!!!The three of us booked the I Like eBike Viewpoint tour way ahead of time and Jan and Krystof kept in touch during the days leading up to the tour, answering all our questions, sending maps, weather updates and tour guide bio. We were not in the best shape and actually wondered whether we would be able to stick it out for the whole five hours.The tour started on time. Krystof showed us the bikes and we tried them out. Well, all our fears proved unfounded. The eBikes are AMAZING. All you have to do is pedal as if you were on flat ground and they do all the work. At the slightest slant upwards, it feels like there's an invisible hand pushing you forward, you gain momentum and whoosh past everything, even the awkward, slower segways.Our tour guide, Alex, was helpful, patient and very sweet. The tour was well paced and the five hours flew by. There are several stops along the way and the tour is very well thought out, with all major climbs (not that they matter, anyway!) concentrated in the first hour, making the rest of the tour a total breeze. And it feels great riding the bikes through Prague's beautiful parklands with the amazing views of the city in both the fore and background! The next day we realized how much ground we covered and all the nooks and crannies we were able to see. It would have been impossible to do the same on any other mode of transport!One of the stops was especially great: Krahov Monastery's beer garden. Delicious trapist beer, great ambiance and service!Young or old, if you're going to Prague, do yourself a favor and book yourself a few hours on an eBike!

Fantastic bike tour of Prague!!. Our bike tour was fantastic!The bikes were so fun to use!! Jan our guide showed us some great sites, helped us out with a map & more sites to see once we finished our tour.Would highly recommend seeing Prague this way!

Best thing I did in Prague. I took the "Real Prague" tour, which takes more than five hours and takes you to several landmarks of the city, parks in the outskirts and finally reaches the apartment complexes build in the communist era. We also saw a typical recreation area by the river and a former industrial neighborhood. The bikes were great and managed very well Prague's steep alleys on the Castle side. Our guide was a history student, who knew absolutely everything about the recent and ancient history of the Check republic. I took the tour on a Sunday, which was probably a good decision, since the traffic was much nicer. This tour is worth every penny.

Perfect. The ride was fantastic. Chris was a great guide, and nice and funny as well :)We got to see things that we did not see on our foot tour, and they were very interesting and beautiful.The ride is not physically demanding at all.An overall great experience :)

Excellent - don't miss this tour!. My husband and I did the 5 hour Viewpoint tour and it was fantastic. The e-bike tour is a great way to see Prague and also get away from the swarms of other tourists walking around. The tour covers a lot of ground and it’s a great way to get oriented with the city. I checked off most of my “must-sees” on this tour and did it a lot faster than I would have walking.The e-bikes are easy to use and I would recommend this for people of any fitness level.Alex was our guide and she was great. She was knowledgeable and fun. We had a fun beer stop at the Strahov Monastic Brewery which was lovely and not a spot we would have gotten to on our own.I highly recommend this tour and wished I had time for the Real Prague tour as well.

Great way to see Prague!. My son and I rented two e-bikes and took them out on our own. We had a great time. We went up Petrin Hill and all throughout the park there to get some amazing views. We also got to some neighborhoods we never would have gotten to by walking. Our first time with e-bikes and we really liked them. You can get as much of a workout as you want but the motor is very helpful with some of the steep hills in Prague - especially in the Mala Strana. Excellent way to explore in and around the city.

Great way to see the city. We toured Prague on e-bikes. It was a 5 hour tour, mostly viewing the city from the surrounding hilltops. We rode a total of 37 KM, but it was totally do-able because the e-bike helps on the climbs. Our guide Jana was great. It was nice to be able to ask a lot of questions about the history, people and culture of the Czech Republic. My only regret is that we did the tour on our last day in Prague rather than on our first day there.

Viewpoint e bike tour. Took the 5 hour e-bike view point tour. It was a great way to see parts of Prague away from the Center with many fabulous views. Guide Janna was friendly and knowledgeable and was able to remedy initial problems with the battery of the e-bike quickly. We did this tour on the second day following the Taste of Prague tour, and the 2 tours really complement one another, as you get to see many of the highlights talked about during the Taste of Prague tour (like the stadium, and some of the sculptures around Prague) up close. Definitely worth doing. The e bikes were alot of fun to ride as well and the terrain was quite varied from shaded bike paths to cobblestones to more urban areas.

E bike the best. We visited 3 cities, Amsterdam, Paris, and Pragus, and did bike tours in all. First bike tours are the way to see a city and E bike is the wayto do it. The E bike makes navigating the hills a breeze and is easy to get used to. The best part of the tour was our guide Jana. Her English was great and so was her sense of humor. She took us to parts of Prague we would not have otherwise seen. We especially loves the photos she sent of out trip. That was a real treat.
Great experience. Great views from all over the city. Chris was awesome! Knowledgable, funny, and easy to talk to! The bikes were great and hills were a breeze! Definitely worth your time!

Bike tours are the way to go....... Our third bike tour in Europe. This one was fabulous. Krystof, our tour guide, was excellent. The ebikes are easy to handle and necessary given the elevation and the cobblestone roads. Would definitely recommend this tour. You can't beat the views. You also ride through parts of Prague you would never see.

Fantastic Experience. Took the 5 hour tour labeled Real Prague, having experienced the major highlights of the city on my own. Tour was worth the expense. Chris was a very informative guide with flawless English. Experienced many areas of the city I would not otherwise have seen. Because of the Prague hills this was a great way to witness different vantage points of the city with virtually no effort; if you can ride a bike you should take this tour.

Awesome!. 2 adults and 2 teenagers in Prague for 4 days. We took the "Real Prague" ebike tour on our third day and it was definitely a success!! We had already visited the spots travelguides suggest and this 5-hour bike tour was a lovely and interesting discovery of hidden places only those living in Prague know. A relaxing ride (no effort, electric bikes are great!), wonderful views of the city, caves, swans along the river, gulash and dumplings, a beach for locals, hidden graffiti, rose gardens....Our kind guide Jan from Prague took great care of us and told us lots of things about his city. He definitely offered us a delightful day!!! You can't miss it!!!!

Loved this tour!. This was a ton of fun. We always try to take bike tours the first full day in a new city. Having read that Prague is very hilly, we took the suggestion and booked this tour. Not only is the city hilly, but most of the tour took us over cobblestone streets. I can't imagine getting around this city on a regular bike. The boost of power you get when you need it is really amazing! We covered a lot of ground, had a great beer at the Monastery, viewed the city from the top of many hills. Just an all around great time!Our guide was a very sweet girl, Alex, and she took very good care of us.Highly recommend this tour, you will love it!

Absolutely Amazing. My husband and I took this tour on our second day in Prague and we both agree this was most definitely the highlight of the trip. We met with Jana who was by far the best tour guide. It so happened to be just us three on the tour so it really felt awesome to have such a personal experience. We did the View Point Tour and saw all the major sights along with parts of Prague I know we wouldn't have seen on our own. The e-bikes themselves are awesome. The hills that we went up would have been so hard walking or on a regular bike...this e-bike felt like a turbo boost just when you need it and really made the experience even better. We have been joking since returning that we'll never feel the same on a regular bike!We had plenty of opportunities to stop for pictures and Jana was kind enough to even take some from her own camera and emailed them over. We also took a break at a cute café and had a chance to eat ice-cream and chat before doing the second half. Truly, this was a wonderful experience and I highly recommend it to anyone. Great way to get oriented to the city and learn history and see awesome views and doing this on the e-bike enhanced the whole experience. Cheers to the I Like EBike Tours!

Adventure. 1st time on electric bike & so much fun. Uphill is a snap so biking all around Prague for hours is very doable even if your skills are not up to Tour de France standards. The guide was very friendly & pleasant and took us to many sites of interest that we would have surely missed otherwise. A definite recommend!

Excellent tour - highlight of our weekend. We did the view point ride and it was the highlight of our weekend. There was only four of us including Jan our tour guide, who was friendly and knowledgeable. The electric bikes were easy to master and great fun. Despite the extremely high temperature it was a relatively comfortable ride. Uphill was easy but it was a bit of a bone shaker on the cobbles. Would highly recommend.
Best way to see Praha”. What a perfect way to explore Prague.We did the View Point ride at night 8-11 pm and had a wonderful time. Our tour guide Jan was great full of facts at each stop.

Great & fun way to see the city!. I took the View Point Ride and got to see way more of the city than I would have by just walking. The guide was great fun & full of facts at each stop. Since the bike was electric the hills weren't an issue at all and we covered a lot of ground. Stopped at a fab spot for a beer too :)

Best way to see Praha. We did the View Point ride and had a wonderful time. We were able to see so much more than just the touristy areas. We really appreciated seeing other areas that we would have never found on our own. The electric bikes were fantastic, not much work was required to get the bike to move. Our tour guide Jan was brilliant. IF you only do one thing in Prague, do a bike tour with I like EBike.

Absolutely amazing.. What a perfect way to explore Prague. I went with my Fiancé in July and had an absolute blast. I could not say one thing bad about I Like Bike tours. We were constantly informed about the history of Prague and taken to places we would have never normally seen. After an effortless 6 hour tour, we were given maps with information on their best spots for food and entertainment. This is definitely a must do in Prague. Thank you.

A unique experience. From the very moment we picked the tour, we were delighted by the kind attention provided to us: the time of departure was arranged to suit our request, Kristof, our guide, showed us how to deal with our electric bikes (a first experience for the not-so-young-anymore 5 of us) and, all the way, proved to be very thoughtful and informative. Enthusiastic as we were, we chose the grand tour (45 km, as we were told) and enjoyed every second of it: the beauty of the city, the interesting comments of our guide, his kindness and willingness to answer our questions about the city, the history of the country, the way it has evolved, etc. I don't know if my tiredness has to do with it but I particularly enjoyed the drink we had towards the end of the day, on a small boat, along the river, on a spot where you can really feel that the heart of the city beats. I can only warmly recommend this tour and hope I can do it again, some time in the future, with my daughters !

An amazing experience.. We took the "Real Prague" e- bike tour with am amazing tour guide named Chris. We enjoyed our visit to Prague thoroughly but the unique nature of this tour was second to none. This tour took us to the places which are not always visited, including aspects of Prague that are remnants of the communist era. Our guide was knowledgeable. The experience was well worth it. And we would recommend this tour and this electronic bike company to anyone!! The motorized bike helps on the many hills of Prague. And our lunch at a traditional Czech restaurant was an amazing goulash dish.....don't miss it!

Best tour in Prague. We absolutely loved this tour. If there's only one tour you do in Prague, then this should be the one. The guide, Jan, is young, enthusiastic, passionate about his country and making sure the tourists get a taste of "real" Prague. The destinations were off the beaten track and we would never have found them by ourselves. The bikes are easy to use and we didn't even work up a sweat even although we travelled 32 kms. We traveled throughout 5 countries in Europe on our trip and this tour was in the top 5.

A Great Way to See Prague!. A five hour bike tour? My friend signed us up, and to be honest I was a bit wary. However, it was the highlight of my time in Prague. If you want to become fully educated about Prague, visit a museum or hire a private guide. This isn't meant to do that. It's a tour that gives you a glimpse of the everyday Prague. The tour takes you to the tourist laden sites, but it also takes you to the not so obvious places, that you wouldn't see otherwise. The guide is charming, friendly, and looks out for his charges. At the end of the tour he called a taxi for us, and personally spoke with the driver. He advised us that if we were charged over a certain amount to call him. We had no problems. If you want more information than he initially tells you, just ask. He'll be happy to answer or direct you to where you can obtain more information. I am not the most in shape person, and if the bikes had not been electric there is no way on Earth I could have done this tour. I was still sore for a few days afterwards, but felt the fun I had on the tour was totally worth it.I plan on returning to Prague with my husband, and this tour is definitely on our list!

A fantastic tour!. I took the view point tour, a 35km ride through Prague city centre and the beautiful green suburbs.Our guide was very friendly and showed us all the best and most interesting sights. My favourites being a stunning rose garden at the top of the city, the views of Prague - it really is a pretty city, Prague castle, the padlock bridges and pausing for a taste of Czech beer.I had never been on an electric bike before and have to admit that I was slightly afraid of cycling 35km, especially knowing that some of it would be uphil. However, I was pleasantly surprised at how powerful the bikes were - cycling for 5 hours was not even the slightest bit difficult. I am even tempted to buy an e-bike for at home!I like e bike are great, they are all really friendly and even took photos of me on the tour after I forgot my camera, these were emailed to me later.I would definitely recommend this tour, its an amazing way to see Prague and the perfect start to your visit to the Czech Republic!

Great Introduction to Prague!. I signed up for the I Like EBike – Electric Bike Tours on my second day in Prague and was not disappointed. The 5 hour tour took me around the whole city of Prague where I got some really spectacular photos. I have never been on an e-bike and within seconds I thought, “I have to buy one of these.” The e-bike is a smooth ride and for the most part effortless. In minutes, the tour group was speeding up hills and down cobblestone streets. Our tour guide Jana spoke excellent English and she was a pleasure to be around. She was kind, thoughtful and knowledgeable. I find Prague street maps to be confusing. Prague is a maze and the streets run on crazy angles and twist without any logic. I had a difficult time finding the I Like EBike store, so give yourself a good cushion before venturing out for your trip. I strongly recommend this tour because it’s an easy way to see the whole city, gather your bearings, meet nice travelers and get photos that your friends wish they had.

BEST part of our 12 days in Europe!. We did the 5 hour View Point Tour with our 3 teenage children and absolutely loved it! We spent 12 days in 4 different countries with our family and at the end when asked all 5 of us agreed the ebike tour in Prague was the absolute highlight of our trip. Our guide was Jan and he was excellent and really involved our kids in the tour. We saw and learned things about Prague that we never would have without taking this tour. We thought 5 hours seemed a little long when we booked it but it flew by as we traveled all over the beautiful city of Prague. Jan told us endless details about the city and was happy to take pictures for us along the way as well. My youngest is 13 and we were a little worried about her handling the ebike but it was so easy to use and none of us had any trouble at all. I can't say enough about this tour - we will always remember it!!

Sightseeing on e-bike. We took part in e-bike tour with few friends and we really enjoyed it. It was easy to visit a lot of interesting places in the centre of Prague and it was so easy to get up the hills (which is quite often here in Prague). Surprisingly, it was much easier to ride e-bike than I'd expected. You don't need any special equipment and it requires almost no effort or riding skills. :) I can only recommend this activity as a good way of spending the afternoon in the city and enjoy sightseeing in a different manner.

great way how to discover Prague. It's a best way how to see all the beauty of city center in a short time and don't be tired of day walking and it's really funny to ride eebike, also you can taste different types of beer at various locations. I definitely recommend this way of learning basics about Prague, which is provided by helpful and pleasant staff.

Wonderful experience. We took the Real Prague tour and really enjoyed the day on our eBikes with Jan and Tony. We saw so much of the less visited areas of Prague which provided a great complement to the conventional tourist sites. We learnt much about Prague and its people, rode through some wonderful gardens and woods and had a very relaxed and enjoyable lunch in a local hotel on the outskirts of Prague. Jan and Tony are both very passionate about Prague and about ensuring their riders have a great time. Very very highly recommended tour.

Great introduction to Prague. Whenever we first arrive in a new place, we take some kind of tour to get acquainted with the city and learn the history. The e-bike tour was an excellent introduction to Prague. The bike is fun and easy to ride and you get to see places you wouldn't on foot. Jana was a great tour guide. She is knowledgeable, funny and very sweet. The View tour takes you to many overlooks and there is always picture opportunities. The beer at the monastery and the rose gardens were two of my highlights. I would definitely recommend you take this tour!

Bike By Night in Prague to C More. Absolutely fun and worthwhile evening with Krystoff at EBike by night in Prague. Little traffic, the bikes were great and made going uphill a breeze. We saw things, and obtained great photos that would have been impossible during the day. Our guide Krystoff was a great guy and a lot of fun. I give this thumbs up - even if you are tired - this will give you that 2nd wind. JHoll, SF CA USA

Best activity in Prague!. We did the E bike tour with Jana. It was one of the best activities of our entire vacation. The bikes were so much fun, easy to use and required very little effort. Our tour guide was terrific. We saw so many interesting sites and learned so much about Prague. A total blast!

Such a fun way to view the city!. This bike tour was a blast! Electric bikes are definitely the way to go when exploring Prague. We had a traveler with us who has bad asthma, and she had no problem with the help of the motor. With this tour, you definitely see places you may not otherwise. It was a highlight of the trip. I would absolutely go on an electric bike tour again! We stopped at a brewery for wine and fried cheese and conversation with our tour guide. Lovely way to spend the day. Seems ilke you can explore places for as long as you choose.

Great afternoon on an e-bike. The e-bike tour is the best way to visit all main Prague attraction and still save some time (and energy). We did the tour with Jan, who pointed out many interesting facts, even for someone, who had visited Prague before. Apart from the excursion purpose, it is really fun to ride this bike (and it is easy)...moreover you will have a chance to try one of the best Czech beers :)))

Prague by e-bike. This is an absolutely fantastic way to see Prague. Our guide was Jana, and she took us to some wonderful sights in addition to the classic tourist visits. She was a wonderful fount of knowledge and it was a superb way to spend a Saturday. My friends and I took the Viewpoint tour and I highly recommend it. The beer at the Strahov monastery was outstanding and you definitely work up an appetite. Although the tour is about five hours in length, the electric bikes make it incredibly easy, even on the hills. You barely break a sweat at all. definitely a truly wonderful way to see such a beautiful and historic city. Make the reservation and go TODAY!! You'll enjoy it.

Awesome!. This is the best way to go sightseeing, ever! The electric bikes make every hill a breeze and you can focus on every sight rather than how to get there. The groups are small and our guide, Jana, was super friendly! We absolutely got to see things we normally would not and the five hours went by fluently! I also appreciated the extra service of the guide snapping a few pictures of us during the day and sending them to us later. This tour is a great concept, thank you!

Must do in Prague!. I was initially hesitant to see Prague this way, but I'm so glad we decided to do the electric bike tour.. it's the perfect way to see the city. Our guide Jana was incredibly knowledgeable and professional, and we got to see parts of the city that are off the beaten path. The bikes are easy to control and fun. You can work if you want to, or (as I did) you can just relax and let the bike do the work. I would highly recommend the I Like eBike tours to anyone visiting Prague!

We wouldn't have experienced and loved Prague unless we took this bike trip.. Taking a tour around Prague on e-bikes was the best choice my mom and I have made since we got to Europe. The second best choice we made was going with I Like EBike. This company is great because everyone is extremely friendly, the routes they take you on are very safe, and they keep the groups very small. We went on the site seeing tour, and there were only 3 of us and a tour guide, which made it very easy to get around and easy to hear everything the guide was saying. Our guide, Jana, was amazing. She is super friendly, funny, and because she grew up in Prague, she knows everything about the city. I highly recommend using this company, we will definitely do this again next time we're in Prague.

Pure excellence. Did the trip together with my girlfriend and three friendly americans. Our guide for the day was Jana, a knowledgeable, friendly and professional guide who knows her city well.We did the view point tour, and got to see many different sides of Prague, from its charming old parts, its quiet green areas as well as different residential areas.Using the bikes was a breeze, and this together with the great guide, great weather and friendly company makes for a winner combination. Why sit in a bus all day when you can ride a bike out in the fresh air?However, if you suffer from back or joint injuries, beware, as the bikes' stiff frames and Prague's cobblestones will give you quite a beating. :)Recommended!

Great experience--even for a fatty like me!!. First let me say the Jan and the staff at I like EBike were great, before, during and after our tour. We took the 5 hour view points tour...best money spent in Prague. Admittedly, I am sore today, but a 5 hour bike tour by an out of shape city dweller has to have SOME consequences, lol. There's no way we would have had such a comprehensive viewing of Prague without the help of Jan, our guide (and owner of I like EBike). What an amazing adventure. I could never have done such a thing on a regular bike. (Did he say 37 kilometers??!)The only real downside: cobblestones. But fortunately, Jan has no compunction about riding on the sidewalk (much to the dismay of several pedestrians we "ran into".) We went everywhere. We made many stops where Jan explained what we were seeing and its historical/political/cultural significance. With a great sense of humor and a wonderful (and sometime unintentionally amusing) command of English, this Prague native made us feel like this could be a city you would want to live in.And he called a cab to pick us up and take us back to our hotel, insuring that we would not get ripped off by having a "talk" with the cabby before we drove off!! Thanks Jan!! You're beautiful!!

I do not ride bikes - LOVED THIS!. This was the highlight tour of my 8 day eastern european vacation. I can not believe the miles we covered and all the sights we saw in our 5 hour (flew by) Viewpoint tour of Prague. I haven't ridden a bike in ages because of knee issues but I decided to give this a go because I was traveling with my two children (in their 20's) and it offered a different type of tour than all the others we had been doing. I had absolutely no issues! It was definitely the way to bike because you could actually enjoy the scenery without thinking about how you would get up the next hill! This was so much fun!

The highlight of my trip to Prague!. I can't tell you enough how much I enjoyed this experience. I am 70 years old and have never ridden an E-bike. I do ride a "fat tire" bike at home with gears so there wasn't a lot to learn. I had been in Prague for 7 days and seen many of the sights but this sounded intriguing! Jana was my guide and was recommended to me by a couple I met while in Vienna. The ride was17 miles around the city, thru many, many lovely parks, thru city streets, up some hills that reminded me of San Francisco and when I was done, I was not one bit tired. While I had walked there from my hotel in Wenceslas Square, I decided to walk back as it was still daylight and the air was invigorating. Jana's knowledge of local culture, command of English, and funny little historical tidbits meant more to me than any tour or audio guide I had taken so far. She even sent me pictures that she had taken along the way. Now, I am in Berlin and looking to see if they have something comparable!

Cheating in Prague. Exploring Prague by electric bike felt a little bit like cheating -- we cruised up hills.. barely peddling! You really get to see so much in just an afternoon. And, Jana, our guide, was terrific. She shared lots of 'local' information that you won't read in a guide book. Highly recommended...

Best and Most Amazing Tour. My 13 year old son and I spent 4 days in Prague in June. Thanks to another posting I found out about I Like eBike and I made online reservations for us for the 5 hour View Point tour. The entire experience was extremely positive. The tour far exceeded our expectations. eBike was easy to use and it was great that after 5 hours of biking we were NOT tried and actually were ready to run around and do more site-seeing. The staff were extremely kind, knowledgable and professional. This was my second time in Prague and I was happy that because of this tour I was able to see some new places that I had missed the previous time. I just wish that they had a sister company in Budapest or Ljubljana where I am heading in September.

fun in the rain. Not even constant drizzle could dampen the fun 6 old Aussies (60ish) could have in 4-5 hours biking around a beautiful city like Prague. What a great way to get away from the crowds and see more of the city and its surrounds.Jan was a great host..definitely the friendliest local we had met...and our wives thought he was pretty good looking also.We all finished the trip wanting to buy one of these bikes and bring it home to Sydney.

Brilliant way to get an overview of beautiful (and not so beautiful) Prague. We went on the Viewpoints tour with Jan who is a friendly, relaxed and knowledgable guide. The bikes are amazing; a few pedals and the motor kicks in so the 35 Kim's of the tour feels like you've ridden down to the end of the street and back. Yet they feel entirely safe - you are always in control. (I wanted to take one home with me).Jan is really helpful too. We mixed up our timing for the tour we originally booked but he very happily made an extra tour just for us the next morning as the scheduled one was pretty full. He was full of personal recommendations based on what interested us.The tour takes you around the edges of the tourist centre of Prague and really gives you a feel for the real city rather than only the well-beaten touristy tracks. We thought it was the best thing we did there. Highly recommended, probably at the start of your stay as it provides the context for the rest of your explorations on foot.

A Great Way to Explore the City. We booked the Viewpoint tour based on all the good reviews I had read on Tripadvisor and I was so pleased that I did. It was a great afternoon and our guide Jana was great - very knowledgeable of the area and its history and she made us feel very welcome. We had perfect weather for the tour and we got to see a lot of Prague, much more than we would have done if we had been left to our own devices. I couldn't believe we actually cycled 35kms - it didn't feel like it at all as I never even broke a sweat! The ebikes are so great and so much fun to use and they made getting up the hilly streets very easy. I felt like I had a permanent smile on my face the whole time! We visited many sights around Prague including Petrin Hill, Letna Park, John Lennon Wall, and Prague Castle to name a just a few, and there were lots of opportunities to take photos and take in the gorgeous views over the city. I would highly recommend I Like Ebike - it was the highlight of our visit to Prague and if we go back (which I hope to as it was an amazing city), we will most definitely be booking another tour with them. Thank you so much!

EXCELLENT IDEA !!!. My son and I went to to Prague for the first time in May and wanted to see as much as we could of this beautiful place. We couldnt have made a better choice than to rent this electric bikes with I LIKE EBIKE. We had the best time, the best views and the most wonderful time!!!Jan was a wonderful person and guide!!!!!

The only way to see Prague. We had a blast with Jan and his E Bikes it is a cool way to cover some distance with out to much effort. Plus having Jan there to give a full commentary about the history of Prague as he was born there he new everything that's need to know.For us this was the best thing we did while in Prague and with the help from the ebikes it can be done by anybody age or fitness level...You will not be disappointed if you choose these guys !

See all of the city. I took the five hour "vista" tour, and I'm very happy with the experience. One, my tour guide (Jana) was great, and two, I felt like I got to see a lot the city I wouldn't have been able to otherwise. I had already toured Old Town Square, Wenceslas Square, and the castle before going, and combining that with this tour, I felt like I had pretty much soon all there was to see in Prague before the day was up. A lot of the places Jana took me in Prague I had never even heard of before, so I definitely wouldn't've known to go there on my own. I think that's the great advantage of this tour--it takes you to the little sites. As far as the bike is concerned, it truly does make it a "no-sweat" experience, a claim I had been somewhat suspicious of before going. But it was hot the day I took the tour and I had on long sleeves, and I never did actually break a sweat, so the claim is true. The electric bikes were great, and the tour's not really possible without them. Those bikes went up some hills I'm pretty sure I'd have difficulty walking up on my own, much less riding up on my own. I have only one caveat: if you have some sort of medical condition that makes "jolting" dangerous, I wouldn't go on this tour. There are a lot of cobblestone streets in Prague, and bike + cobblestones = jolting. It's just something you'll have to deal with occasionally on the tour, but I think the tour is worth it despite it.
Great to visit praga. Very good solution to visit great.Team os very nice.Very good advices in order to choose the right way to visit the city. Thanks to the electrical bike, u can go everywhere.

EBike with and without shoes. We absolutely loved our tour. It was a great way to see Prague, and get to know a local. Alex was our guide and she was so patient with me - considering I wore the wrong shoes. For visitors, this tour is a great way to spend your day 2. You get to see all that Prague has to offer on wheels - and then decide what you want to explore more for the remainder of the days now that you have had a glimpse of everything. This was the best move, and I highly recommend Ebikes!

EBike Ride Prague. This was a great tour! Even with the flooding around Prague that required Jana to re-route us. I would highly recommend this early in a trip to see all the different sites and decide which ones you would like to go back to and spend more time! Loved it!

Our whole family loved it!. Just went on the tour with Jan today--great time! Jan was able to customize the tour for us since we'd seen castle complex the day before. Bikes are easy and so much fun. Our 2 teens both enjoyed the bike tour--much preferred over walking tour the day before. Great time, highly recommend--go and enjoy!

One of the most fun tours I've ever done!! Definitely my favorite!. My husband and I absolutely loved our tour! The electric bikes were awesome and so fun to use. We did the romantic night tour of Prague. This was definitely our favorite thing we have done here. Great way to view the city and get information without having to walk all the way up those steep hills. It was just the tour guide, my husband, and me. The tour guide was so outgoing and very knowledgeable about Prague and its local life and hidden secrets. He was so flexible about where we went and personalized our tour for us. I highly recommend this to anyone looking to get the most fun out of a tour without all the waking. There are different courses you can choose from. Although Prague was flooded during our trip, we were able to work around it and still had an amazing time. It makes a huge difference when your tour guide is so passionate about his job as well as Prague. He even showed us YouTube clips after the tour of the different stories he told us about during our tour. So worth the money! Definitely doing this again next time we visit prague!

Great way to see beautiful Prague!. I had such a fabulous time on this tour. On the day I went, I was lucky on a couple of counts - firstly, the weather was great (apart from a brief shower!). Secondly, I happened to be the only customer that afternoon, so got a private tour!My guide was Jana, who was fantastic! She was very knowledgeable and friendly and taught me heaps of interesting facts about Prague along the way. The bikes are really easy to use (and the electrics are very handy for some of the huge hills around the castle!). We got to see so much in 5 hours - it was my first time in Prague and I think this tour is a really great introduction to the city. I got to see so much I wouldn't have seen otherwise.Highly recommended!

Fun and less exhausting way to see prague. We had a great time on the Romantic Tour of Prague (4 hrs). As the only ones on the tour it was essentially a private tour, and was great value for money. Jan was friendly and enthusiastic, and the bikes where fun to use. Much recommended.

Lot's of fun, even in the rain!. My daughters, 21 and 23, and I booked this trip online prior to leaving home. The weather on the day of our tour wasn't cooperative, with rain in the forecast. Jana was very flexible in letting us decide if we still wanted to go, we ended up shortening the trip to the 3 hour tour and going for greatness. We borrowed their rain ponchos and off we went. It rained maybe half the ride...not ideal, but honestly, we'd all choose to do the tour again as it was our only opportunity. The bikes were really fun to ride, Jana was an excellent guide with very good English. If we can have fun in the rain, that says a lot!

Best way to experence Prague. We weren't sure to try ebikes as I wasn't particularly keen on doing 6 hours on bike, considering we had little time to spend. It turned out to be the best decision we could take. Ebike really take you to see not only the best views in town, but also parks, alleys, streets that tour buses can't take you. Our tour guide (Jana) was very kind and helped us in any way she could, explaining clearly everywhere she took us to. It is also worth noting that she spoke in absolutely clear and fluent english - a definite plus. She even tried to help me as it had been years since I didn't ride on bike, and was always very patient. She always went at our pace, never trying to push the schedule. The "electric" part of the bike really helps to enjoy Prague better, as it lets you go through hills without much effort, but still retaining the sense of cycling. All around, a highlight of the city.

Visit Prague in a different way. Cruising a city by bike is fantastic. In Prague this is not different. Only, to visit the Mala Strana neighborhood, and the different parcs with their astonishing views over the city and river you almost need to be a trained cyclist....With I Like EBike everybody can do this, and even more it's fun.A must do!

Real Prague EBike Tour. Our EBike tour was truely an unforgettable experience. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Prague. We enjoyed the Old Town Prague but by the third day felt we had seen most of the sites. The EBike Tour was a perfect ending to our trip. It was our first time on EBikes but we easily mastered their operation with minimal effort. The EBike is an awesome piece of technology that provides access to places previously out of reach. Jan is an excellent host and made us feel very welcome. The Real Prague Tour was a great choice since we saw parts of the city that would have been otherwise inaccessible to us. You really get a sense of Prague before being discovered by mainstream tourism.Thanks again guys and best of luck with your business!

A Great Way To See Prague. We booked our e-bike tour online, which was quick and efficient. Just a couple days beforehand, we received an email with the weather forecast for the day, with a kind note from Jan. The actual tour was a comprehensive view of Prague. Having come from Prague, Jan, the owner, gave us a very personal perspective amongst all the other notes of history and tradition. The bikes themselves were in good shape, and they had a strong "lift", making the more difficult aspects of the tour very easy for us. At lunch we stopped at a traditional place on the outskirts of the city. The food was delicious at a reasonable price. Most importantly, Jan was very aware of giving us signals as we cycled, always looked back to ensure we were there, and constantly checked to ensure our motor was running after lengthy stops. One thing of note for those who are unaware: Motorists are very courteous of cyclists in Prague, something that North Americans are not necessarily used to. Take advantage of it and enjoy! We recommend this tour to anyone who would like to cover a lot of ground in a short period of time, or for those who enjoy being free from the constraints of local transport.

Must do. Our guide was Janna a beautiful Czech woman. This was an electric bike tour. 37 km on cobblestones, dirt paths and at least 50% uphill. The bikes do a great job of minimizing the amount of effort needed, especially on uphill slopes. The day was perfect, bluest sky, whitest clouds and about 70 degrees. This was a great choice; on this tour I got to see the city as you could in no other way.Down blind alleys and twisting lanes we passed ancient Romanesque basilicas, Gothic turrets up like magicians' hats, brutalist Soviet tower-blocks, fortresses, and Art Nouveau facades. Prague is a mass of extrovert styles knitted together in a glorious and unique cityscape.5 hours later we return to our origination point, butt sore, and cobblestone shaken. Wouldn't change a second of it.

Excellent afternoon. We had a great time seeing the city of Prague, including places we would never have gone on our own. Tour guide excellent and the electric bikes were amazing, didn't break into a sweat over the five hours we were riding. Thanks for a great time

A must when you are in Prague!. On our last day in Prague we tried the electric bycicles with our guide Jana. We took the tour that goes up the castle then thru beautiful parks, across the river and back to the bike tour office. We were 4 of us all over 60 but in descent shape. With the help of the ebike in the "more power" mode it's little effort going up even in the steep hills. The trip is beautiful and you get a great perspective of Prague. It's a great way to visit the city and I highly recommend it particularly iif you are the outdoor type person and would also like to do some light excerzise and tour the city. We enjoyed it inmenselly and it's a must and the best thing you can do in Prague. Try it! You will remember and agree on my comments. Alfredo Arias. Panama,Panama.

See all of Prague. This was a wonderful way of discovering Prague outside of those areas where tourists typically go. The host was knowledgeable and told a great story about the city as we biked all around it.

A good way to get away from the crowd in the city.. Really nice staff and well worth the price. Easy to use once you get the hang of it. Prague is hilly and the e bike made it possible to see more of Prague. For example we saved some time struggeling up the hill to the park that we wanted to see. The que to the cable car in this park was enourmous and many people looked enviously and pointed at our bikes as we just passed them all. Before you are used to it you should be careful in crowdy streets or even walk with the bike.

The best way to discover Prague . I really recommend this tour because in half a day you have a panoramic view of the city. The personnel is fantastic and always help any inquiries. The only historical areas it not cover is the old quarter and Jewish neighborhood. But you can do it in another day. Don't miss it.

"A MUST FOR OLD TRAVELERS".
