We are both aged 66 and my wife has bad knee pains, she cannot easily walk for longer than 1/2 an hour, this is why I wrote Jan in advance to book two e-bikes and allow her to experiment without any engagement on our side.Not only the experiment was succesful, but I now ask myself how else we could have enjoyed visiting relatively distant sites such as Petrin or hard to reach such as the Castle etc...I am thus grateful to Jan for his friendly assistance e.g. set up charging and parking facilities at Certovka Hotel were we were staying and carrying back my wife's bike while I was riding on mine at the end of our charming stay in Prague.

Exceeding value! Can't do it without ebike. Excellent value bike tour. To be honest, this is the most expensive bike tour I've done. But I'm most satisfied! Ebike is the only way to tour around prague. Effortless paddling all the way, and prague is rather hilly. One thing though, biking through the cobblestones is no fun! I pity anyone who has to bike around Prague with normal bike. I've seen more of Prague than I've expected with this bike tour! Highly recommended ! Thanks to jana and Alex, and Jan, warm service and great communication.

Our best afternoon in Prague. We were in Prague for 4 days and decided after 2 days that we were tired of walking and that a bike tour would be a good way to take a rest while visiting the parts of Prague we would not have been able to see otherwise. We made a good choice when booking the 2 PM view point ride by I Like EBike ! Our guide Jana was so friendly and knowledgeable that it was very interesting to see the monuments and sites we had already seen and visited from a different point of view. We enjoyed the ride through the gardens and through parts of the city less touristic. In fact we saw the real Prague during this 5 hour-bike tour ! And as they say in the website, we were still fresh after this 35 km ride ;-) Excellent !!!

Fantastic way to see Prague. We took the View Point ride on our second day in Prague at nine o´clock in the morning. It was quite chilly, but Jan had prepared some gloves for us and we were well dressed. Jan was our tour guide and he was really trying to make this tour special. The e-bikes was nice with the little engine helping when climbing the hills. We were able to see a lot of Prague that we sure wouldn´t have seen without the tour. Jan also gave us some nice tips of where to eat and other things to see. It was really worth the money to take this tour. Tip, take the tour early on your visit so you get an overview over the city and then know where you want to return again.

Rolling Tour of Prague with a Power Boost. We were visiting Prague for our 30th Anniversary and decided it would be fun on two wheels. Our hotel concierge recommended EBike and we decided to check it out. Jan was wonderful making sure we were comfortable with the electric bikes before committing us to the contracts. We rode the bikes back to our hotel, stored them overnight, and then spent the next day riding them throughout Old Town, New Town, and Lesser Town, climbing hills with ease (and we aren't so young anymore). The motorized bikes made the hill to the Prague Castle almost easy. We did not partake of the organized tours, but were able to travel easily on our own, stopping when we wanted to. We had a great time and the adventure was well worth the price.

Excellent personable tour and indeed best way to see Prague for the first time!. This tour exceeded my expectations. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly, and took the time to personalize the tour allowing me to stop and take pictures along the way. Incredibly beautiful and interesting sites and visit to places I would not have known to go to. Excellent bike made the trip fun and very easy.Would recommend to anyone. All they say in the website is true and more. I give it a 10++. !!

Must-do in Prague! Highlight of the holiday!. Our hotel recommended the tour to us, and we are so glad we did it - what an absolutely excellent way to see Prague. You get to cover so much in the tour, with some of the most amazing views of the city. In relation to the other walking tours, or segway tours on offer - you definitely get value for money with I Like EBike. Our guide Alex was brilliant, very friendly and so knowledgeable with some amazing stories. We hadn't appreciated at first that they were electric bikes, but with the steep hills throughout the city - we were very glad they were!! Could not recommend this enough - definite must-do when visiting Prague. Most bikes have deep baskets at the front, ideal for carrying water and bags..although you do get time to stop off on the way.. Thank you - all five of us loved every minute.

Electric Bike Tour,best way to see Prague!. My husband and I planned on renting bikes to tour Prague on our own. Fortunately, a concierge at our hotel highly recommended the electric bike tour with I Like eBike, and thank goodness she did! We met with Jan and scheduled a "Real Prague" tour for the next day. It was our last day in Prague, so we had already walked all over and seen most of the sights on our own. The real Prague tour was a fabulous way to get a feel for the other parts of the city and surroundings that we never would have explored on our own. I never write reviews, but had to this time because it honestly was the highlight of our trip. Jan was very knowledgeable and personable. Do yourself a favor, and take a spin around the city with Jan and his crew!Tip: Bring water, sunscreen and a camera. Great deep front baskets on bikes for storage.

Best way to see Prague!. My husband and I both agree that this was our best activity in our 3-day stay in Prague. What a great way to explore the city - the ebike made it so much enjoyable, riding uphill in minimum effort! We had a lovely time with Alex, our guide. She took us EVERYWHERE! Loved every minute of it. We were not rushed at all - even stopped for a relaxing lunch. I wish all our adventures turned out as perfect as our day with Alex and ebike!

Super fun and unique way to see all of Prague with very friendly staff!. Jan and his team are absolutely great! Super friendly, and easy to book a tour/ explain the many incredible routes that are available. My friend and I were in Prague for only a couple of days, and did the 3 hour View Point tour. We were able to see so many wonderful places, as well as learn so much because of this tour. The bikes are so fun and very easy to use, this is the BEST way to see Prague! We had so much fun! Thanks Jan and I Like EBikes- I cannot recommend this tour enough!

the best way to experience prague!!!!. My husband and I did the Viewpoint tour of Prague in April 2013. It was an amazing way to see Prague and we certainly went to areas we would not have like to walk up! Riding the EBikes allowed us to see so much more of the city and allowed us to get photos from some of the most amazing spots!!!! Our guide was super friendly and told us so many facts and legends about Prague that we would not have gotten out of a book. You can tell she really loves her job and the city of Prague! They even went the extra miile and emailed us photos they had taken! This is the must a do tour if you really want to see all of Prague!!!!

Great Tour and Service. It's is a must - No better way of knowing the beautiful Prague. Excellent tour, the bike is amazing (forget about 5 hours standing in segway), the little motor helps you to go on the hills without any effort, my tour was 30 km and it did not feel like.Jan The owner helped me to coordinate the trip where to park, where to stay, etc everything through emails with very quick response time (one day). They had a big event and since he committed with me, he kept one bike and guide for my tour, so I had a private tour with the price of group tour, I could not ask for more.JanaThe guide, she is amazing she knows a lot about the history of Czech Rep. and the places, and always with a smile on her face, telling that he enjoys what she does. Very pleasant and relaxed tour.I will do it again.

Excellent viewpoint tour of Prague. My girlfriend and I went on the Viewpoint tour of Prague with guides Jan and Jana in March 2013. It was a fantastic way to see the city, and in 5 hours we covered so many different areas and saw so many sights. The ebikes are very easy to ride and meant that we didn't even break a sweat when cycling up the many hills in Prague! Jan was a very friendly and informative guide, and was very happy to answer any questions we had. We learnt a lot about Prague which you wouldn't necessarily find out in a guide book. At the end of our tour Jan spent a long time giving us recommendations for things to do during the rest of the trip which we really appreciated. I highly recommend going on a tour of Prague with I Like EBike - it was the highlight of our trip!

Seeing Prague in A Swift Manner - Motor powered E-Bike. My brother and I have thoroughly enjoyed the 5-hr biking trip, seeing Prague as much we could, up the hills, down the uneven cobble stoned lanes, swimming around the crowds, how exciting! Many thanks to Jana, our tour guide of the day, who is extremely considerate and offering the lovely cup of tea that kept us going! As for Jan, he's kindly adjusted the seat of bike and ensuring our comfort! In addition, little gesture like given pair of gloves, keeping the hands warm is what counts too! In short, this activity is highly recommended for those who would like to cover as much within short period of time! No worry for level of physical capability, as the powered bike takes over anytime when paddling!

Best way to know something else about prague. I just did it snd was really nice. Jan is very helpful and tell you every story of the city. Without this tour i would just done the typical tourist tour. He drives you through many places of the city and many view spots in the parks hills. If you consider yourself a non typical tourist, you must do this tour.Thank you Jan it was a great experience!Andres from Colombia

A flying visit - by electric bike!. Wow! What a great way to view a great city ... Prague!My EBike experience, guided by Jan, was just fantastic. Once I had mastered the bike and made it up the hill, all the viewpoints and attractions were superb, especially as Jan described all the details. Then the downhill was fantastic ... over cobblestones, along smooth roads and pavements and through parks, avoiding adults, children, dogs and other cyclists! Remember to use your bell!Thank you very much, Jan, and good luck with the expansion of your enterprise in other European cities!Steven (Little Snoring, England)

Experience the REAL Prague EBike!. Friends and I booked the Real Prague tour that last 5 hours. At first I thought 5 hours, that's too long, but I was wrong. I firmly believe our guides Viktoria and Jan made this one of the highlights of our Prague vacation. Both guides were very informative and truly enjoyed showing us their pride in their beautiful Prague. The tour started at Petrin Park, then the Planetarium, Barrandov Studios, 'Beverly Hills', Barrandov housing, stopped for lunch, Love Locks and the Lennon Wall. We really enjoyed eating lunch where the locals eat. It was both affordable and enjoyable.FYI-skip the segways and do this instead.Thank you Viktoria and Jan for the ride!!!

Most Fun Way to See Prague!. We did the Viewpoint tour of Prague with Krystof. 5 hours of covering the city that seemed like 50 minutes because it was so fun! Krystof set a nice pace and made sure the group (six of us age 10 through adult) were all maoving at our enjoyable pace. It was amazing the area we covered, basically the whole city! The bikes were great and took all of 100 meters to get comfortable riding. Jan did a great job too setting it all up and helping us decided which tour to take. I have taked many city bike tours when travelling, and I feel that I Like EBike was one of the best!

Trip according Prague on Electric Bike. Electric Bike - a great way for the first day of sightseeing in Prague. You will see a variety of attractions in a short period of time. Given that the city has a lot of hills, the presence of motor bike makes the trip up the hill is very easy and enjoyable. Ride better on a pedestrian sidewalk as when driving on a roadway (it mostly of pavement) feel a strong vibration. Minimal rent time bike - 5 hours. Price - 25 euros. There are also several bike tours through historical Prague with guide.Recommend it to anyone who is going to Prague on holiday.

This was really funny and interesting !. My wife organized our weekend trip to Prague as a birthday present incl. the eBike tour. It was such a great idea and we had so much fun cruising with these ebikes visiting the top spots of Prague ! Jan and the team was very friendly, supportive and knows the city very well !Thanks Jan & Team !PS: We choosed to take the tour on our own and it was great - but I am sure a guided tour will be even more interesting

Great Tour of Prague - highlight of our trip!. I found I Like EBike on Trip Advisor and found a lot of positive reviews. This was a fun and different way to see Prague! We definitely saw more than we would have ever seen on foot. Our guide, Krystof, was very knowledgeable and super nice! The bikes are great as the motor kicks in just as you need it and especially on the hills. I was worried that 5 hours would be too long but it went by very quickly and we had a good, traditional Czech lunch at a restaurant outside of the city. This was the highlight of our trip! Krystof and Jan also helped us with restaurant recommendations and reservations when we got back which was very helpful!

Brilliant bike tour. This company was recommended by our hotel Aria - very close by and all of their other recommendations had proved very sound. We took 5 hour tour which sounded so long but the time flew by. Christoph was ultra knowledgeable - a warm and informed communicator. He was an excellent tour guide and we learned a great deal in a relatively short space of time. My 16 year old son enjoyed this tour too. The electric bikes enable you to circle the whole town in this time and do as little or as much work on the bike as you choose - you can go electric all the way or as I did - turn it off on the flat but either way you come back feeling great and not at all exhausted. Wonderful views to be enjoyed this way and no hard slogs up the hill to the castle! Brilliant company - don't go to the others - they can rip you off!

A good way to see Prague!. This is a great way to see Prague. E-bikes is a fun and a easy way to see most of Prague in a short time. Our guide, Jan was awsome! He has good knowledge and he is a great and likable guy! This is a must when you are in Prague : -) Catrine - Norway

E- bikes Rock, great :). Visiting Prague, you have several travel opportunities to see prague, by segway, by car by foot or by E bike. The E- bikes motor kicks in when you pedal, and makes journey really fantastic. Doing the Viewpoint tour, it`s easy to get discouraged by the steap hills of Prague, but by E-bike you don`t have to worry about aching feet. So, did I see the most of Prague by E-bike? Absolutely! Our guide Jan was upmost professional and gave us the tour with a big smile on his face. He gave us insight to Pragues history and historical places, and a really good overview of the places to visit. And the viewpoints was spectacular. We even got handed woollen gloves so we shouldn`t freeze.I recommend this over Segway and riding a car -. Gets much more intimate and you can travel the parks with no hassel at all. Did I mention the fantastic guide Jan? Well now I`m sure I did:)Mikael Karlsen

Best way to get an overview of Prague. We did the "real Prague" tour with Jan & had a great time. Ebikes are a great way to get around the hilly parts of Prague & enabled Jan to take us further than an ordinary bike would. Jan clearly knows Prague very well (I think he was born there) and is very enthusiastic in sharing his knowledge. This probably only applies during low season - If the office is closed the first time you try it is worth trying again (maybe better to contact online).

Best Surprise of our Trip!!. We came to Praque with a 1,000 things to do and see, but a bike tour was not one of them. We happened to stumble across the "I Like Ebike" shop, as we stopped across the street at a great local pub for a glass of wine, beer, and some people watching. Seeing Jan and team demo the bikes for potential clients got us curious as they were just very friendly, even from afar, and the reaction of clients as they tried the bikes on a hill for the 1st time made us go check it out. Jan even came over and had a beer with us at the pub, after hours of course :).Well, the excitement was justified as the bikes are just so so fun to ride, and effortless on the hills. They really are a great experience, even for novice riders. So, after giving them a try near the office, we signed up for a tour to ride the very next day. We originally wanted to do a city tour, but Jan spoke with our guide, and she really wanted to show us some outdoor/counrty side too (her specialty and favorite ride). So, being easy going, we agreed on some exploring adventure and met Odessa, our tour guide, bright and early the next day. As soon as we met Odessa, we knew we were going to have a great time. She was a vibrant, young lady, very intelligent about local and national cultures, and spoke english very well. She is also a jetset traveler, just returning from a trip afar, and has lived in the US for many years; so we had much in common. She was as excited to ride as we were, which we realized is simply that she loves her job and riding the bikes are just a lot of fun.Our trip started out rolling thru the parks, and cultural areas of the city, with Odessa showing us many interesting and exciting new things we missed before on foot. She knew her way around town and gave us plenty of opportunity to stop, talk, and learn about Prague. Next, we rode our bikes down the canal and out of the city into the countryside where we ended up in a national park. The area was remote, scenic, and beautiful - just a great contrast with the bustle of the city life. We even stopped at an area with a small cave for exploring. Along the way, we stopped at a small town pub for beers and pretzels too - FUN! One of the nicest surprises was when Odessa took us thru the back hills of the countryside, where we were riding our bikes thru orchard fields with the city skyline as a backdrop - a little off road riding. We went thru the fields, around some cherry trees and into the woods, where we ended up at a nice, quaint, zoo with local animals for viewing and feeding. Not something we really expected, but a great adventure nonetheless!All in all, our trip was way more than we ever expected. Everyone at "I like Ebikes" was super friendly and personabl and really made us feel good about our trip. If you are going to Prague, there are the essential things you need to see and do - taking a bike tour with "I like Ebikes" should now be on that list. FANTASTIC!!Joe KoppSan Francisco, CA
Very good overview. Jan couldn't have been nicer. He was wonderful. We did the 'Viewpoint Tour' and it was a great way to see different areas of Prague that we never would have been to on our own.

So much of Prague that you would never see!. When planning this trip, I took careful note of the trip advisor reviews in all the major European cities we were to visit. The e bikes in Prague rated so highly, we just had to give it a go. The viewpoint tour covered lasted 5 hours and covered an amazing 37 km around the parks and scenic highlights of the city. Our guide Jan owns the company and was the perfect host. The electric assist on the bikes was awesome and made the hills easy whilst helping work off that incredible pork knuckle from the night before. Jan welcomed questions and really enjoyed the interaction with the group. We would NEVER have experienced and appreciated as much of what Prague has to offer without this tour. So if you have a sense of fun and adventure put this on your list!

Highlight of our Prague weekend!. My family and I (wife and two kids, 9 and 12) selected I Like EBike based on reviews we had read here and we were not disappointed.The Guide: We found Jan to be an excellent host and tour guide during our time spent with him. He went out of his way to make sure that my youngest would be comfortable on a bike on her own. He also also was extremely flexible in finding a time to take us on a tour when the weather was nice. He spoke excellent English and even tried to teach us a little bit of Czech during one of the breaks. He seems to get along with everyone and made sure that we had plenty of opportunity to ask questions while giving us a great deal of information. He also knew a couple of good local snack shops that we stopped at for a quick bite to eat and some warm drinks to keep the kids happy. The equipment: This was our first experience with an electric assist bike and we were a little nervous about how the kids would do and how much work it would be to tackle the hills around Prague. Our fears were unwarranted. The bikes were all in great condition and we had no problem getting up and down the many hills we encountered on our 3+ hour tour. The bikes have adjustable "boost" settings and we were able to set them for the varying levels of skill we had. My 9yr old had one setting, the 12yr old had a slightly different one, etc. Helmets were provided and Jan brought along raincoats in the event the weather didn't want to cooperate.The sights: We did the bike tour on our second day in Prague so we had seen a few of the sights Jan took us to but we got a lot more out of them with his 'local' knowledge. We weren't sure which of their preplanned tours to take so Jan came up with a personalized tour just for us. We saw all of the major sights and went through several of the parks surrounding the city. We were able to really expand on what we learned from Hop on/Hop off tour from the day prior which gave us a good overview while Jan filled us in on more of the details and what it meant to live there. If we can work in another visit to Prague we will definitely do another tour with I Like EBike.

Best tour we did in Europe. An excellent way to see a huge amount of the sites in Prague in one day. Our guide (owner) was excellent, giving us the history and information, but more importantly a true feel for a local's feel of Prague. We rode with our 1 year old and 3 year old children. Our guide even rode the bike with our son on board, as my wife was nervous. The e-bikes are excellent and so easy to use, I would recommend this tour to anyone visting Prague, we spent a few weeks travelling Europe and this was by far the best tour we did. We can not speak highly enough of this tour.

Exhilarating and interesting, the true beauty of Prague.. With only 2 days in Prague and wanting to see and learn about the city but not wanting to get stuck in a group tour all day, we opted for the bike tour. What fun! Jan, our guide was both informative and fun. He took us throughout the city showing us the tourist highlights but also the lesser know stories and locations of this beautiful and historical city. We loved this tour!

Best way to get oriented to Prague. A fun and complete tour of key sites around Prague such that we came away with a comprehensive view of the city and key historical events. Well informed and equipped guide. Only concern was the bikes periodic sluggish response such that we were not certain about performance.

Wonderful Tour of Prague. Great tour! We got to see everything we wanted and more. The guide was informative, answered any questions we had including about the local life in Prague, and was great with conversation. The ebikes are great for everyone. I injured my foot and ankle 3 weeks ago from a fall rock climbing and still have pain walking, but I was able to ride the ebike with out problems. My wife also enjoyed the ebike and felt it allowed us to see so much more without wearing ourselves out. We were also able to see the layout of the city and where everything was relative to our hotel which made it easier to plan and navigate the city over the next 3 days we had in Prague.

If you travel with a baby. We were visiting Czech Republic last August with our one-year-old baby. During our stay in Prague we were looking for a quick way to get the Castle avoiding pushing the baby buggy along the slope so we contacted Jan to get info about Ebike. The main question was whether they had baby seat for the kid. As the answer was YES, we went to rent two bikes at once for the rest of the day. Not only we got turistic places such as the Castle with no effort at all, but we also were in places recommended by Jan especially done for children. Prague has amazing parks where is difficult to see any turist. An example can be Letnà Park, if you travel with kids, dont miss it! Ride to the Prague parks! You can enjoy a beer there while your kids are happy playing not far of your sight. Then come back to the city centre riding along the river. We did not book any tour because we depended on our baby routines. However we will have other opportunities in the future. That is sure because we came back to Spain delighted by the country itself. Český Krumlov is a medieval town in the south you must visit if you have the time. We really enjoy that day in Prague riding the Ebikes.

Genuine,Caring, 5 star plus service!!. Booked the "Viewpoint" tour late at night for the next morning 9am departure. Showed up at office to find it closed. Jan (owner) sent an email saying the company had an internal meeting booked that day but could accommodate the next day. Due to my work schedule, I was not available the next day and let Jan know. As I was contemplating what to do that day, I received an email from Jan proposing we do a 3 hr (vs the regular 5hr) viewpoint tour from 5-8pm that same day. Well....imagine my surprise....HOW NICE IS THAT!! Talk about customer service....seriously he did not have to come back to Prague at the end of his day to take one person on a 3 hr tour and I told him so in an email. He insisted it was no problem and met me at the office at 5pm. Jan is a very kind, caring, enthusiastic young entrepreneur who could teach businesses about what customer service is all about!!! The bike was easy to ride and a lot of fun....went on a lot of trails,saw the BEST views of Prague AND got an enriching history lesson along the way. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this tour to all as it takes you through some beautiful parks, a lot of the historical sites and is very relaxing and enjoyable. The directions and guidance given by Jan is excellent and the price is a great value. Jan was never rushed and truly seemed to love his work...I predict a lot of success is in store for this young man! Thanks Jan!

A must!. Four of us had a terrific day with Jan and Victoria. They were very knowledgeable and friendly. We took their "real Prague" tour which lasted five hours. We thought this was a bit long at first, but the time went fast. We got to see things that we would have missed had we not taken this tour. Love the bikes too. They are very fun!

The Point View Tour with I Like EBIKEs. The electric bike tour with I Like Ebikes was the high point of our stay in Prague. Jan and Krystof went above and beyond the call of duty to make our tour one of the best we ever had. The equipment and instructions given were excellent and the price reasonable for what you get. I highly recommend the Point View Tour for anybody staying in Prague for a short oeriod. We went places no other tours take you and Krystof is one heck of a great guide. He knows the nooks and crannies of the city and His english is better than some Americans I know. Hats off to Jan and Krystof for making our stay in Prague wonderful. George L. and Suzanne P.

Favorite part of our trip to Prague- best way to see the city as a wholw. EBike was an awesome way to see and learn about Prague! You can cover so much more than on a walking tour, and with the assisted electronic aspect of these bikes, you can physically last a lot longer to see a lot more. The electronically assisted bikes were so fun and worked so well.I got such a kick out of zooming up hills with no effort. In my view, so much better than a bus tour too as you're outside and physically active, and you really can see things better. Importantly, you're not riding in the middle of city traffic but mostly on paths all around and above the city in its parks and surrounding hills, many of which areas we wouldn't likely have seen otherwiseAnd then there was wonderful Kristof, our very knowledgeable and enjoyable guide. He's a history major at university, and his wealth of knowledge about the city and country was amazing. He was so thoughtful and responsive to our interests, needs and questions. Just a really nice, sharp guy.My friend and I agreed that the EBike tour was our favorite part of our trip to Prague.

The best way to see Prague. We thoroughly enjoyed our eBike tour! I have to admit, I was a bit skeptical when my husband recommended that we sign up for this tour because it seemed like it may be too challenging, given the 5 hour duration coupled with the hilly terrain of Prauge; however, I was pleasantly surprised at how fast the time goes by and how easy it is to navigate through the beautiful city via the eBike. Jan, the owner and our guide, provided just the right level of information (without bombarding us with too many facts to absorb) about the highlights of the sites we visited. We took frequent stops for pictures, which were amazing as Jan knows all the best places to stop for 360 degree views of Prague. We even stopped for beer/refreshments along the way, while we enjoyed beautiful views of the city. Jan was pleasant, easy to talk to and a great ambassador for his city.What makes this tour different from the others is that the eBikes make it possible to cover a lot of ground without expending a lot of energy. I am 4.5 months pregnant and I easily navigated through the 5 hour tour, never feeling like I over-exerted myself. The cool thing is that you still need to pedal and balance (like a "normal" bike) but the eBike offers assistance when traveling up hills, etc. Much of the tour was on bike paths, which were safe and easy to navigate.Have done bike tours in multiple cities around the world and this was one of the best! Would highly recommend this tour!

Enjoyable ride around Prague's heights. The e-bike was a very enjoyable way of seeing Prague during the evening when I didn't have much time at my disposal. You just pedal a bit and the motor kicks in and gives the whole bike-and-you package a push! Especially when going uphill this is really fun. Victoria was a wonderful and very friendly guide, and the experience really made my conference-packed stay a little lighter and pleasant to recall.

The View Point Ride. Myself and my wife did the View Point Ride a couple of weeks ago with Vicki as our guide and we both thoroughly enjoyed the tour. Neither of us had been on an Electric bike before so were amazed how much fun and how easy it made the tour. Also i recommend doing this View point tour as you get to see some spectacular views from the hills that surround Prague. I doubt a lot of the places we would have got to see if we hadn't gone on the ride.....definitely recommend it.

The most fantastic way to explore Prague.. I was with a group of friends from university and we had the most incredible experience with the eBike tour in Prague. Our guide, Kryštof, was both fun and extremely informative and tailored the tour exactly to our interests. I couldn't recommend the tours more as a way to see the Prague away from the tourist traps of the centre and find out much more about the city. A highlight for me, for example, was going to the Strahov Stadium, something I would never have heard about but a unique insight into the Communist past of Prague. The views from the hills which surround the city are breath taking and the electric bikes mean you can really cover a huge distance without being too exhausted!

EBike Prague. We are in our 50's and not very fit! Would have taken a week to walk up and down the hills of Prague, we saw some 25km at an easy pace more often on bike paths with a full commentary from Jan. We did the real Prague tour and saw the city away from the tourists a glimpse of the locals lifestyle. I loved the electric bike so much I will buy one in Sydney to commute and shop.

Electric bike tour in Prague. The electric bikes were such a nice surprise! They were so easy and so fun to maneuver up the hills. I was literally squealing with delight! Our guide was such a sweetheart and so knowledgeable about the area. My husband & I ended up being the only 2 on this particular tour, so we felt very special. I enjoyed every second of this experience and highly recommend it!!!

Don't miss this excursion!. My husband and I just returned from Prague and were thrilled with our 5 hour "view point" tour with Jan. He is the dynamic young owner of this new company and obviously knows the city very well. He took us on bike trails all around the city with wonderful Kodak moments around every bend. We took this tour on the first of 8 days in Prague hoping that it would give us a good overview of sights we might want to see in more depth throughout the following week. That is exactly what happened, plus Jan supplied us with more ideas for excursions that we hadn't considered, for example, climbing the clock tower of St. Nicholas church in Mala Strana to see the secret police office found at the top after the 1989 Velvet Revolution. The views from the top weren't shabby either! So glad we booked this bike tour.

I LOVE EBike Tours. By boyfriend and I recently took a trip to Prague and one of the highlights was the fabulous and very affordable tour we took with Jan from I like E BIke. The staff at I like Ebike are friendly and accomadating and Jan was a very personable, enjoyable and informative. We took the "Real Prague Tour" and were able to see very interesting sights beyond the tourist Prague. Riding the Ebikes is fun and easy. I would highly recommend I like ebike as a matter of fact I have been recommending to all my friends at home. We took the Real Prague tour but I like EBikes as a variety of tours for families and couples. If you visit Prague you really should visit I like EBikes.

Not just buildings but insight.. Jan offers 5 tours on ebike. We did the Real Prague tour which is 5 hours. The bike part can be done as a lazy coast, even up the hills, or a big effort if you feel like exercise, just by altering the assistance meter as you go. So no problem with that! Real Prague is not the Prague of cathedrals and palaces and museums, but about life as is is lived today. It is the living and concrete (much of it crumbling) story of the Czechs' ongoing struggle to rebuild their country following the Soviet occupation. You find also that for the people, engagement in and respect for culture is not just part of their history but of their lives and we saw and could appreciate the humour and creativity everywhere, because our guides showed it to us. It was more like being shown around by friends, swapping observations on each other's lives, intelligent and insightful discussion and a bit of ribbing. And a huge amount of fun!The best possible tour you could have, if you travel to understand other people and their lives.

What a tour!. Just did a real Prague tour with Jan. apart from the wet whether the tour was fantastic. Jan was very friendly, informative and took us to many sights some tourists don't get to see! This is a must do when coming to Prague

Fun and Informative, great for all ages. I did this trip with my family over the summer and it was perfect. We were able to have it be just us 5 which was great. The ride was very relaxed and fun and we very informative. I would highly recommend this activity to both locals and tourists. Our tour guide Jana was so nice and funny, which made the day go by really fast. Oh yeah, the electric bikes are AWESOME!

Fun and exciting ebike tour with "I like EBike". My girlfriend an me visited Prague in September. We found "I like EBike" in the Internet and signed in for the "Real Prague" tour. We did not really know what to expect, but the tour and our guide Jan were awsome! Jan showed us not the centre of Prague that was crowded by masses of tourists, but some very interesting spots on the outskirts of Prague (e.g. the biggest stadium of the world, parks close to the Prague castle, houses build in the communist era). Jan was very enthusiastic and explained details about all we saw. Our 5 hours tour was very diverse, intersting and fun! And using Ebikes makes riding the bike up and down very easy.So this tour with "I Like EBike" is a MUST for anyone that wants to see Prague off the beaten tracks!

Brilliant View Point Ride. I have never been on an EBike before; it is like riding down hill all of the time = fantastic!! I was certainly glad to have the motor to help during this 40km ride. You will see Prague from all of it's surrounding high points, without being exhausted. This is a truly beautiful city, and it definitely needs to be seen from these View Points.Jana was a fabulous guide; full of great stories and history.Best of all the half way point is in a beer garden :)

Great family fun!. We visited Prague in mid-August and the highlight of our trip was the family tour we took with Jana from I Like Ebikes. Our younger son (11 years old) was very hesitant at first but Jana was extremely patient and soon we were all cruising around happily. The bikes are very comfy and even on an extremely hot day allowed us to get an amazing introduction to a beautiful city. Jana was an excellent guide - informative, friendly and very aware of our safety and comfort level. The greatest compliment I can give is that both of our sons were disappointed we couldn't fit in a second tour!

really hice experience in Prague. We wanted to go up the hills in a nice way and we found it. We decided electric bikes and there we met Petra who from the beginning realized we spoke Spanish and was very exited and pleased to give us the bike tour in Spanish.. We loved it and I´m already recommending this plan to everyone!!!

A 'must-do' when visiting Prague. We stumbled onto 'I like e-bike' while walking around Prague on foot, and decided to try the 'real prague' tour offerred by them. It was scheduled as a 5 hour ride, visiting many places that were 'off the beaten path'. The tour was excellent. Our guide was born in prague, and was very well informed on the history and customs of the region. She was not only concerned that we enjoyed our tour, but wanted our entire trip to Prague to be wonderful. In addition to all of the information provided on the tour, she provided many suggestions for things to do/see in the days following the excursion.Also, we are not a particularly athletic family, so there was a little concern about being on a bicycle for 5 hours. However, the electrically assisted bikes are wonderful. Although you have to keep peddling for the motor to remain engaged, peddling was somewhat effortless, even going up and down the hills of Prague. Our tour actually lasted 6+ hours, and no-one in our party had any difficulty completing it, including mom/dad (45-50 yrs old).I cannot recommend this tour highly enough. It is a terrific way to see some of the more popular attractions, as well as a few things only known to those native to Prague.

Great way to see Prague!. This was our first tour in Prague and it was a great experience! We covered 27 miles on a bike that makes you feel superhuman! It was a great way to see a lot of places in 5 hours and got an amazing perspective of the city The tour guides Christophe and Vicky were personable, spoke great English and really cared about our experience. I would definitely recommend this tour!!

Electric ride on electric bikes. Seeing Prague by electric bike was excellent fun. The bikes provide much more power and speed than I imagined, making getting getting around the steep slopes of Prague a joy. The Staff are both friendly and helpful, and the bikes are well maintained and reliable (we had no problems). There is plenty to see within a short distance of the shop, so it is an ideal start point for sight seeing this side of the river. Cycle up the hill to visit the mirror maze and then grab a coffee or an ice-cream, as we did.

A must!. This is not fitness biking but it's not so so easy, afterall you still have to pedal the electric bike.Words can not express what a great experience our 5 hour tour was, had we had more time in Prague we'd do another.The owner is a wonderful, adorable, personable individual who really cares about his customers and want to help. Two of the staff we met were just wonderful. Our tour guy was Chris I think, I feel badly I can't recall his name, I have a snapshot of him in my mind. He was a bright, perceptive young man, who was so helpful, kind and thoughtful.Check their online site, I can almost promise you won't regret it.Great for couples, friends, older teens, adults, older adults if they have no balance issues, and families - but again the later would be discussed with the owner, as their are options.Keep in mind, this is different than a Segway tour, which can get into the cobblestone areas, but frankly this was much better, and a great use of our time.Raves from New Jersey, Karl and Lisa

We had a great time. It simply would not be possible to get the perspective and understand the geography of the city if you tried to do this type of tour on foot. We had a great time! Our guide Christophe was great. Very friendly and chilled out. The whole operation is easy to use, booking is easy online, web site works well, definately recommend this tour. Do it early in your stay and it helps you to plan the remainder of your time in beautiful Prague.

Brilliant way to spend half a day and see Prague. We sought I Like EBike after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and were delighted find this gem which we wouldn't have found without the benefit of previous reviews so thank you very much to all the previous reviewers.We decided to take a 5 hour viewpoint tour covering 25 miles. We were the only guests on the tour with Jana who was an absolutely brilliant guide. We saw so many interesting areas of Prague that we wouldn't have seen otherwise. We took the morning tour and were really glad that we did as the temperature was very pleasant but it got really hot by afternoon.Very good value for money and an enjoyable day out. Highly recommended.

Fun tour with great views of Prague. We got to experience the best views of Prague, which are far and above what most city tours cover.The eBikes are fun and very easy to use.We took a rest break in the middle of the tour in a nice park overlooking the city where we had a couple of local drinksOur guide Krystof made the trip very enjoyable. In addition to some historical facts about the city, he shared a lot of local information about his city (He's fluent in English)I totally recommend I like ebike!!!

Electric bikes are the way to go around and see Prague. Electric bikes good! Normal bikes nah!. Jan was very good. He is extremely charming and gave a perspective of a local growing up in Prague. He rides safely and he knows the roads well. He made sure the roads were clear. He takes time to explain and is responsive. Electric bikes made a lot of sense. There is a lot of uphill and downhill and electric bikes made it possible to cover all the necessary grounds. Normal bikes would have required too much effort. Would recommend this without hesitation.

Very relaxing trip around Praga parks. During my stay in Prague I rented e bikes (for me and my wife) from I Like Ebike.Very good service. Nice girls explain very kindly how to use and where to go with the bikes.Bikes have a good range and an excellent assistance. You can spend a day sightseeing Prague in a very efficient way and going to corners and Areas probably not reachable by walk.I suggest everyone to take this chance to get an overview of the city.

Just do it!. This was the highlight of my three days in Prague. My wife and I were able to see so many different parts of the city during a tour that was just under five hours. I'll admit when I started the day I only wanted to go out for a couple of hours. I thought five was going to be too much. I was wrong. It was worth every moment from the stunning views from the highest points in the city to the street scenes in neighborhoods along the way. We stopped often for pictures and had a pint or two as well. It was safe and we had an excellent guide Kristof (sp?). A fantastic way to see the city and to get a little exercise too.

I like ebike!. It is really a great way to see Prague, especially with Petra showing us the sights! My wife and I took the View Point ride based on the great reviews provided, and we must say all these reviews are really true to their words. If you really must do a bike trip, this is definitely one that you would not want to miss.

Loved our electric bike tour of Prague!. What a wonderful way to see this beautiful city. We booked with I Like EBike and we were so pleased! It was the perfect way to start our vacation and a great way to cover a lot of territory in the 1.5 days we had in Prague. We took the Real Prague tour with Jana-she was fun, knowledgeable and took us to places I am sure that we would never have seen with a traditional tour (bunkers, beaches, goats, in addition to beautiful monuments, churches, neighborhoods)...we covered close to 50km on the bikes. It was the perfect family outing for our family of six. The riding was not strenuous and we had a phenomenal day. We stopped for lunch at a very traditional spot (about a 1/3 of the cost of lunch in town). It was one of the best meals of our trip. Thanks I Like Ebike Team!

Great trip. We took the short 3 hour trip with Odessa which turned into 3 1/2 hrs and was fantastic. Would never have seen so much of this city w/o this bike. Odessa was a great tour guide. I highly recommend using the tour guide to take you as otherwise we would have gotten lost. This will probably turn out to be the trip highlight.
The way to see Prague!!. We just happened upon I Like Ebike near the German Embassy, across from our hotel. What a fantastic find! If you are hesitating, just do it!!!

Perfect Intro to Prague. My husband and I took two tours on their fun electric bikes-- one in central Prague and the other in the natural area in and on the outskirts of Prague. Our guides were remarkable young adults; both bright, engaging and knowledgeable. We would have never been able to cover so much territory without this tour. Both tours-guides gave excellent recommendations for restaurants and activities. I wish we had taken bike tours in the cities we visited before Prague. It was just so much fun I'm thinking of getting an electric bike to drive around my city.

Amazing Experience! !. The view point tour with Odessa was amazing. She literally showed me all the great view points of the city and the outskirts. All the while being cool to converse with. Definitely recommend this tour to everyone.

See the real Prague - not to be missed. I was in Prague for a conference with my wife and on our way back from the Prague Castle we stumbled upon Jan's bike shop called i like e bike. It turned out to be the best part of our visit. We booked his real Prague tour we had an amazing 5 plus hour tour of sites we never would have seen on our own. We passed through a public market along the river, saw an old soccer stadium coverted to a multi plex, had a chance to see communist era apartment blocks and shopping centres and had a sense of how bleak life must have been living in that environment, saw the high rent district too, had lunch at a small bar in a quiet neighbourhood and met some of Jan's friends that make flying model aircraft. We saw the beauty of this amazing city from a number of vantage points and the electric bikes made the journey up the hills a breeze. Jan was a wonderful guide and as other reviewers have said it was like being with a good friend learning all about why he loves his home town. We had such a great time we booked another excursion a few days later to Karlstejn. Jan was our guide and we spent a full day together riding 45K to the townsite with stops along the way for beers and water refills (it was a hot one and at one stop we were introduced to the fellow that owned the modest refreshment stand and when he was told we were from Canada he changed the music he had going on his outdoor speakers to Paul Anka of all Canadians to chose, no Rush for this guy!!!) After seeing the castle we had a late lunch before putting the ebikes on a train back to the outskirts of Prague for the ride back in. If you ever go the Prague and want to see the real thing from people who know their Country's history and are happy to share it with you, this is the tour comapny for you. You will not be disappointed!!

ebike Tour of Prague. We had a great day with Jan touring through 'the REAL Prague' on electric bikes. The bikes are simple to use and allowed us to climb the steep cobblestone hills with minimal effort. The bikes also allow you to pedal when you want to get into the motion of biking. Jan showed us parks, beaches, soccer stadiums, Communist era housing, a fabulous lunch, local roadways, and even the best ice cream stop. The tour was info-packed but felt more like we were just out for the day with a friend who had lots to tell us, rather than being with a dry tour guide. Highly recommend!

the best way to visit prague!! dont miss it!!. This is one of the best and funny way to visit a city like Prague. I recomend from 6 to 75 years old people, because the bike are very easy to use and the guide are so professional and very nice persons.Jana , our guide, was perfect.

It was amazing. We were in Prague in July 2012. Prague is a very beautiful city, walking where we saw the bikes for hire. We liked the idea and the opportunity to see another Prague, with the bike. We took the bikes for 12 hours.The child is 8 years old, he rides a good normal bike and he was very happy to use Electric bike. Electric bike ride is a pleasure even in the mountain. We got a real pleasure. Although next time I would like to travel with a guide.I want to say special thanks to the guys who work there. Very friendly and helpful. Thank you very much

Perfect way to see Prague - highly recommend. Highly recommend the electric bike tour as a way to get to know Prague!There is plenty of descriptive information in the reviews below, so here are my top reasons to do this activity:- The tour is run by young local people who know the city. Great opportunity to chat to them during your ride and find - The tour is at a relaxed pace and made very comfortable by the electric bike (although you still peddle while riding so it is a nice balance of exercise and comfort)- 4 hours on an electric bike is equivalent to days by foot- All the biking equipment is top-notch- You can access parts of Prague that you normally wouldn't venture to by foot

Best tour ever!. Me and my wife did the 360° tour with a guide called Jana. It was a great tour, visiting the main places of Praha and enjoying the city as a local. The bikes are great and do not demand lots of exercise. Jana was very kind and was one of the best person thst we met at our Eurotrip. If you are in Praha, don't miss the tours of I Like Ebike, they are really awsome!

Romantic Bike Ride at Night in Prague. We discovered this tour while walking around Prague and stumbaling upon the office. My husband grabbed a pamphlet, and upon looking it over, we were super excited to book a tour! There are lots of different tours to chose from, we chose the Romantic tour since we were on our honeymoon and we had already seen how beautiful Prague was at night.Our tour guide was the owner of the company, Jan. He is super friendly and helpful. I hadnt ridden a bike in ages, but he made sure I was comfortable with it before heading out.We went to all the major sights in Prague, all lit up at night. There were hardly any tourists or cars around, and we were the only couple on the tour, so it felt like all of Prague was open just for us. Jan gave us a wonderful tour and explained the history of the buildings and had lots of interesting information for us. At the end of the tour he took us to the beer gardens for a cold one, and took his time taking us back to the office at the end of the night. Not only did we have an amazing tour, but we felt like we had known Jan for ages, and he was an old friend we had come to visit. Jan is so enthusiastic about his job and the city in which he lives, it is conagious. We had such an amazing time, and would love to come back to Prague and do it all over again.Thanks for the amazing night in Prague, we will never forget it! :)

What a great trip. It was an unplanned excursion and it was totally worth it! We made a 5h lasting trip in a nice warm day and thanks to those clever bikes we were still feeling fresh even at 9pm when we came back to the Ebike office in Vlašská street.Before this trip I had never had an opportunity to get to know Prague even though I am Czech living near to Prague because when I visit Prague, it is usually just for a half a day (and it is not possible to walk around the city in such short time). But with 'I like EBike' it was so easy and quick - and still we had enough time to stop at the interesting places...And what more? I want an electric bike!! :))

Awesome bike rental shop. I would recommend anyone to rent a bike at this shop. Three reasons:- Prague is the perfect city to ride a bike. Its safe and small. You can get anywhere in 15 minutes. - The electrical motor helps you to conquer the steep alleyways, and allows you to travel large distances without getting tired.- The employees at this shop were extremely friendly. They were very helpful with the bike and the planning of the bike-routes. In the end I even ended up with them in the cafe in front of the shop.

Great way to see the city. Had a great afternoon seeing Prague with I Like EBike. We were keen to see the 'real Prague' and got to see quite a bit off the beaten track as well as the favourite sites.Highly recommend

I want an Electric bike! Great way to cover ground!!. These electric bikes are a great way to see the lesser known areas of Prague and are fun too! Effortless zipping around the streets on e-bikes meant we covered a whole lot of ground and even a great reprieve from the hot sun! Some of my favourite areas were the parks - which give a slightly less chaotic, relaxed atmosphere and great views of the city. The tour lasted nearly 5 hours but was totally effortless and I learnt heaps from the tour guide. The best stop was in a park (Letna I think) which had a beer garden under the cover of trees, over looking the city - really great place to chill! I highly recommend this tour to cover a huge area of Prague, seeing some key sights, but discovering a lot of less known about gems. Knowledgable guide too!!

Thinking of exploring Prague? Do it on a bike and with this company!. Had a fantastic experience with these guys. Very professional and friendly. Gave you all the info you need and help you set off on your way.Had a fantastic day exploring what Prague has to offer and if you have blisters from all the walking around this is a must. Will be recommending to all my friends.

Excellent way to see Prague. We did the Viewpoint tour with I Like Ebike in Prague in the middle of June and it was absolutely fantastic - a highlight of our whole 7 week trip around Europe. The tour lasted an incredible 5 hours but was not taxing on the body at all as the bikes propel you up the steep hills. We literally cycled 360 degrees around Prague, with plenty of stops for information and photo op's on the way! The office was very easy to find, Jan was great in assisting us with the bikes to start with and get the feel for them and our tour guide, Stephen, was awesome - he was able to give us lots of interesting information about his home city and answer any questions we had, he even stood with the bikes at times while we went into places that the bikes werent allowed. We did the 9am tour which was also great as it wasnt too busy around the city early on and there was no one else on the tour so we had the guide all to ourselves and were able to get a lot done! All in all a fantastic experience in Prague and would recommend to anyone.

This is the way to see the Prague. I really loved the E Bike Tour. Prague has so many hiils that ther's no way I could pedal regular bike for 5 hours. I did 5 hr view point ride. As description says on their web site, I could see the city of Prague 360 degrees. Our guide was Jana. She was sweet and very friendly. It was like private tour so there was only me and my husdand in tour. This was the first time to ride electric bike for me and my husband. You pedal it very slowly then bike pushes you forward without effort. We stopped by at beer garden in Letna Park and had yummy sausage and beerlemonade. If you love taking photos, this is the best way to see the city of Prague. Jana took us to several different spot to take photos of the city which was breath taking. Think that the Charles Bridge is in the middle and you are riding bike around 360 degrees around the city center. You can see the Prague in every differnt angle. The day before this tour, I did Prague Tasting Walk Tour and our Guides, Zuzie & Yan showed us various interesting places on I POD which is usually not included in any walking tours in the Prague. On E Bike tour, we actually saw most of them like Sparta Stadium, World biggest Metronom, Dancing house, Vysehrad , Vitkov, and suicide bridge. We did walking tour, segway tour ( this one was in Budapest), E bike tour and Prague Tasting walk tour. I think you always get what you paid for. Cheap walking tours are hard in hot summer weather. Segway or E bike tours are much nicer with breeze coming while you are riding and also cover many more sights. When we were doing walking tours in Budapest, we were so miserable in hot weather, but Segway was so much better and cooler. If you are in Prague, try the E Bike. You won't regret it.

Best way to see Prague!. ILike EBikes, Prague My husband and I spent 2 + weeks in Europe and Prague was the last city on our tour. Since we only had 2 days in Prague, we knew that the ILIKEEBIKES View Point Tour was the way to go! I contacted Jan Pavlica via email and Facebook and the company were very accommodating regarding our schedule. Our hotel was just a few blocks down from the Castle and the EBikes meeting spot was just across the street from our hotel and down a few steps, so just a few blocks away. Prague is stunning but there are cobblestone streets everywhere and many small hills. The Electric bikes were GREAT and made the entire day very easy and very enjoyable. We had never ridden electric bikes before, but they are very easy to get used to – you must pedal two complete revolutions and then the battery kicks in. Brian was our tour guide and he was just fantastic! My husband and I were the only two on the tour so it really seemed like a private tour. The bikes had baskets so we each had a water bottle, and since it was warm, the three of us stopped and had some fantastic ice cream. Brian was very cheerful, knowledgeable, and a very thorough and friendly tour guide. An extra, added nicety was that a few days later, after we returned to the US, Jan Pavliva sent us an email with all of the photos Brain had taken of us. Also, look at their Facebook site for many more beautiful photos from all of their tours. We had a fantastic day and would definitely recommend I Like EBikes, Jan, and Brian to everyone!
Great way to see Prague!. Just get a good road map before taking off. It was frustrating trying to figure things out with the provided maps.

I could get spoiled on electric bikes!. Though we almost always book a bike tour in cities we visit (Paris, London, Chicago, DC come to mind), we hadn't ever ridden e-bikes. Wow! What a way to be able to cover a lot more territory. And Prague is the perfect city for it, because there's so much to see and do in areas that are both uphill and spread out. We also were fortunate that it was just my husband and I on the tour. Brian, an American married to a Czech, was our guide. He was so interesting and helpful. It was a great way to see so much more than we would have otherwise.

Great experience. We were extremely happy with our ebike tour and it was well with the money. We were lucky enough to have just my girlfriend and I on the tour and were able to see an enormous amount (35 km ride)of Prague in a somewhat short time (5 hours) and still felt like I could do it again by the end of it.Ebikes are an amazing way to see the city of Prague. The ebikes effortlessly took us to places we would of never gone otherwise - don't be worried about fitness levels as after a couple of pedals the motor kicks in and your on your way, uphills are a breeze. You get such a better experience from seeing Prague via an ebike as you can visit beautiful places without spending time or effort normally required to get there.We were in Prague for 3 days and have already been to some of the main areas so it was fortunate that the tour we went on took us to places that we would of never seen otherwise. We were able to see how the local people of Prague live. Our guide told us stories and showed us places from where he was from, how he grew up and how life is really like in Prague from a Czech perspective. Both my girlfriend and I found it very interesting and found some very cool and cheap local places that we would of never been to otherwise.Our guide was also very friendly, always spoke with a smile and went out of his way for us. Great customer service. I want an ebike when I get home!

Electric Bike Tours. Awesome way to tour Prague. We tailor made our trip and visited several pubs along the way tasting the local brew. Our guide grew up in Prague, and we learned about the city from his perspective. Highly recommned this as a way to experience the city.

Fab Idea - Its a must do tour in Prague. We came across this shop on our first day walking back from the Castle. I had accidentally ripped my ankle ligaments two weeks before our trip here, when we spotted this attraction. E-bikes are fab as it requires no effort and allowed us to experiance Prague without me having to limp everywhere we hired the bike for 5 hours and we visited both the new & old town and the nature parks too. Had we not found this gem of an attraction I would have struggled to get around Prague so effortlessly. I would hire again, fit or not on our next visit. The staff were professional, knowledgable and friendly. You can have a guided bike tour too, we decided not to as we have both visted Prague a number of times, maybe next time we will. It's great fun.

Wonderful Bike Tour. Our family took a bike tour of Prague last Saturday. Jan was our guide and was so accommodating of our 2 children. The family tour we took gave us a wonderful overview of Prague. Highly recommend this tour for singles or families. Jan thanks again for s sensational day.

Incredible experience and service - a must do in Prague. We were taken on a private tour of Prague with Jan from I Like E Bikes and can't recommend this tour highly enough. If you are in Prague and want an orientation of the city, then you should take this tour. The service is very professional and courteous. And great value for money.

Lovely tour and not too much hard work!. We went to Prague a few months ago and did a tour with Yana (sp?). It's so much more efficient than going around by tram. You zip up steep cobbled roads and then can cycle down the hills. Great fun and effortless. However, if you want to keep fit, you can adjust the level of electronic assistance down to zero. (We're both carrying a few extra pounds so the help was much appreciated!)Yana was very helpful and gave us lots of interesting info that wasn't in the guide book. It was fascinating to hear about the Strahov stadium, apparently the biggest in the world! There were also some wonderful views of the old city. We also stopped for some Czech "refreshments" in a pub that Yana pointed out.We would thoroughly recommend the tour. A great way to spend a day.Mike and Sophie.

We love it!. We booked a three hour private tour. Our guide Jan was very friendly and funny. He told us many things about Prague. We have see all the important sightseeings and have a lot of fun! We really enjoy the Ebike tour.

Pretty good. My girlfriend & I called on a Saturday at 1:30 and were on bikes by 3:00. We elected to do the 5-hour view point tour for 2440 CZK (1220 each). It was a nice introduction to Prague and worth the money. Our tour guide, pronounced yana (not sure of spelling), was very friendly and accommodating.You get to a lot of beautiful vantage points which would be much harder to access by foot with all of Prague's hilly streets. The E-Bikes give you a strong push which makes steep hills easy. You also see many sides of Prague and many tourist attractions. The stop at the Letna beer garden in the middle of the tour is also a nice break. However, I have a couple suggestions.The first 2 hours of the tour were perfect with moderate biking and tons of nice stops and views. The last 2 hours, however, were almost non-stop biking with only a couple nice stops. Maybe it's just the layout of Prague that leads to this but if there were any way to spread the tour out more evenly, that would have been nice. Also, if you're not used to biking, 5 hours will probably leave you with a very sore bum.A great tour, but in hindsight, we would have gone for the 2 or 3 hour version.
A wonderful afternoon. We booked a five hour tour on a sunny afternoon and had a great time. The guide was really nice and interesting. A fun way to get an overview of the city.

Only way to see Prague!. The ONLY way to get to see sooooo much of Prague! 35km and 360deg circle of Prague on the Viewpoint tour. Did 9.00am tour and were lucky enough to only have 2 of us on the tour which certainly made it feel like a private tour. Stephan was a great guide, very friendly, likeable and knowledgeable. There is no way I would have been able to cycle a regular bike up and around all the Castle area hills so having the assistance of the battery/electric motor when needed was awesome. Jan, the Tour company owner, provided great service, always replying to our emails very promptly. Would definitely recommend this tour very highly. Thanks Jan and Stephan.
Great fun. Saw so much of the city without the physical assertion of a normal cycle tour. The bikes are amazing and so were our guides. Highly recommended.
Great way to get around the city... and up the hill. A great way to see Prague, very friendly tour guides, very convenient to drive e-bikes especially uphill! Can't recommend it enough!

The best experience in Prague!. We stayed 3 days in Prague, but this was the best experience! Driving an e-Bike is the best Way to see al the view points of the City. You cann easily climb up to the castles, Drive at the River or through the Parks. A Lot of Fun for a Good Price. The staff is very very friendly and helpfull!! Er really enjoied our e-Bike-Trip!

Best Way to See Prague!. TripAdvisor recommended the Electric Bike Tours and we decided that early the next morning, that would be the plan.We arrived mid morning and were greeted by Brian from New York, who told us about our options. We immediately signed up for his recommendation (Sights of Prague, I believe) and had a practice run on the bikes. I was very nervous b/c I am not the strongest cyclist, but Brian reassured me that I would be fine.All I can say is that the bikes were a breeze to operate and there was no way that we would have been able to see everything that we did (42 kilometers) on our own and especially with all of those hills. The sights were spectacular and you got to see Prague from so many angles. I couldn't believe how much we covered when we looked at a map!The best part of the tour was being able to see all of these neat things and taking a mental note of what to come a visit the following day for a closer look. Brian was super knowledgable of Prague's history and of the best spots for a good meal at reasonable prices.All in all, the electric bike tour was money well spent and we felt that with 2 full days, we can say that we experienced most of what Prague has to offer

Great experience in with amaizing guide Jan. This is the best ever bikes! I would never ever in my entire life could do 35 km in four hours in Nature tour on ordinary bike. E-bike doesn't a mortocicle it's bike where you have to pedal but it helps to pedal a bicycle especialy when you go up the hill - IT IS REALLY EASY. Our guide was Jan, owner of the company, he showed us the amasing places of old city, parks, posh suburbs with beautifull villas, trip on the boat Ifrom one bank of the Vltava river to enother and this is the real and beauatifull Prague. It was great to see this citi with such livid, active, bright and open guide who knows and loves his city.So Jan thanks a lot for this experience and best withes. Olga
Would recommend to take trip nature. It was excellent and very interesting tour with Jan. It was our first expirience to travel on ebikes which was greate! Dmitry and Olga.

Prague in style. My wife and I were only going to be in Prague for three days and wanted to get a nice overview of the city. The bike tour was just the right thing. We had a wonderful tour guide who took us around the city explaining the history, the culture and current events with the people of Prague. Highly recommend it.
Whole Prague in an afternoon. Hey Jan and Jacob, the guided trip across and through Prag was great. Very well done! Cu next time.

Amazing time.. This tour was perfect for our short stay in Prague. We were able to see all of the highlights of Prague in a comfortable, relaxed atmosphere. Jana, our guide, was so warm and friendly and made the 5 hours pass by easily. The electronic bikes were just the right thing to help you effortlessly up the hills. I would really recommend this tour to anyone who wants to try something different. We have such great memories of Prague as a result.

I Love eBikes. The highlight of our trip in Prague was the 5 hour eBike trip. We set off on foot across the Charles Bridge and found the eBike office right next to the US Embassy. Jan was there to meet us on time and had all the eBikes ready to go. After custom fitting us to our eBikes, Jan gave us a great overview of how they work and the advantages of seeing over 35 km's of the beautiful Prague picturesque views. We went to the largest soccer stadium in the world where the Spartan's practice and play, then set off through beautiful parks and visited the Monastery for a nice cold beer at St. Norton's. Jan is the best guide and was able to provide spectacular history while blending in some fun anecdote's and personal background. I would highly recommend this activity as you will see the beauty that is Prague from every vantage point. The best part of the eBike tour is that you get a little bit of exercise while not killing yourself trying to peddle up some of the hills around town. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to see Prague by eBike. Hope you all love it as much as we did.

Very good. We took the bikes for half a day, without the guide.
they were really nice, gave us a map and even a pair of gloves (it was cold).
highly recommended.

Not to be missed!!. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Europe! There were six of us (adults) traveling together and we took the five hour tour with Jan on a beautiful sunny day in Prague. There is no better way to see that city including areas we would never have known about had we not been on the tour. The views were spectacular and Jan was a terrific guide providing so much information about Prague. I would recommend the tour to young and old alike as the bikes were very easy to handle and made it effortless to get up any hill. It was a most memorable experience that you can't afford to miss!

What a ride!. A terrific way to see prague from every vantage point. My daughter and I took the five hour view point tour this morning. Jan was our guide. He was very accommodating to our time request and for a young man, very pleasant and stocked with information and facts about Prague and it's history. A real plus was his ability to communicate with us in English. Don't hesitate to go the ride is almost effortless and if time is a factor they offer shorter tours.
enjoyable. A great intro to Prague. It would have got five stars, but I thought some of the interpretation was thin, eg WW2, Jewish and communist era heritage.

Fantastic & Memorial Experience!. Our family of 4 (2 adults & 2 college students) went on the 5 hour tour with Jan. It was a fantastic tour of Prague. It was easy to get around the city and see the most amazing sights. You would look back and realize you had been on another view point just minutes ago. The assist function on the bikes really made a huge difference. We are not in 'great physical condition', but were still able to make the 5 hours with very little effort. Jan was an excellent guide. If you have the time and want to see many parts of the city this is the way to do it. Would definitely recommend this tour.

Easy. Cycling on very steep hills has never been so easy and I think it is a great way to see Prague especially when you take the trip which shows you the best views of the city. We cycled fro 5 hours, but I didn't feel tired after the trip, because the battery gives you a lot of support. Our guide Brian gave us a lot of intersting information and showed us parts of Prague we normally wouldn't have been visiting. Great experiece and maybe we will do it again,

a great trip round Prague. We (four chaps) did the 5 hour tour - very good. Saw a great deal, and covered about 23 km apparently. Bikes provide a good assist, and will help you greatly. Perhaps a small bottle of water in the basket could be provided within the cost - or remember to take a drink with you!!Recommended A++ thank you.

Best way to see the 'high' sights of Prague. Brilliant day out! Best way to see Prague and it's beautiful sights. We saw Charles Bridge from every angle and our guide Brian was so personable and informative about the city, and on his reccommendation, we even got to try out the best ice cream in Prague! The city view tour is perfect for people who are not afraid of heights and hilly terrain. The electric bikes are fantastic, and I found them very easy to use. There is one very steep descent and a couple of very bumpy roads, not to mention the climb to Prague Castle (which was made so easy), but being a regular unfit leisure bike rider, this did not bother me. We stopped for lunch, and you could buy drinks along the way if you forgot to take some with youI would definitely recommend this bike tour as one of the must dos if you want to see the best city views of Prague. Definitely the highlight of our weekend away!

Fantastic experience!. My wife and I have travelled extensively through Europe over several years. The 5 hours on an Ebike is one of the best tours that we have ever done. Jan was so full of knowledge about every aspect of Prague and his passion really showed through. The bikes are really comfortable and easy to use.We recommend everyone to try this tour we opted for the Viewpoint, which was fantastic as we could escape the crowded bustle of Prague while taking in the most amazing sites (a beer at the halfway just made the tour so much more special).Thanks Jan & I like Ebike Team for a memory that will be with us for many years to come.

E-Bikes are Excellent. I don't normally submit reviews, but this is really a very special tour that I highly recommend and I wanted people to know about it. We had our tour on a very warm day, and I wouldn't have wanted to be trudging around on the streets that day. The electric bikes were fun to ride as the motor kicks in once you start pedaling a bit, you feel a cool breeze in your hair, and it's exhilarating to just ride around and see such beautiful sights in such a fun way . In my opinion it's also the perfect way to tour with a family (teens), because riding a bike is much more fun than walking around the streets, and you are unlikely to hear any complaining. We did not enter any buildings other than a monastary, we just received an overall visual tour of the touristy and not so touristy areas of Prague. We covered a huge amount of ground, stopped a few times for local beer, and really had a great day. It was the highlight of our time in Prague. Thank Jan for a great day!

Electrical Bike tour in Prague. Electrical bike make the 5 hours visit very easy. An excellent way to see the real Prague, and to avoid the main tourist atrractions that are crowded.
The guide provided us with very interesting information about the city and its history, and was also very friendly.
We strongly recommend it !

Best way to see Prague !. It's the best way to see Prague. The bike really helps you. Plus in Prague there are lots off hills so it's really really helpful. And the guides are great.
So I hope you'll try it ! Because it's great !

Non-touristy tour: Feel the real pulse of Prague. I participated their View Point Ride on April 21, 2012 with a wonderful American guide Bryan and his lovely wife. That particular day I was the only one participant, and I was so glad Bryan's wife could join us for a tour. She was a very friendly and charming Czech who shared her insider's view as we rode through different sections of the town. Bryan was super friendly and down to earth guide who made me feel as if my friend was showing me around the town. The tour stopped at a beautiful beer garden with a magnificent view for a glass of excellent beer and sausages, and then to an ice cream shop towards the end of the tour. So, you'll have some moments to rest your bottom here and there. I won't spoil people's future tours by mentioning exactly where I had visited. Their website has videos that show the rough itinerary for the different tours. I felt the value that I got from this tour was excellent. The name of "View Point Ride" is not a misnomer!! You will definitely enjoy magnificent views of both old and new portions of Prague from different angles with bits and pieces of interesting episodes. Most of the spots that we had visited weren't in my RS's "Best of Europe" guidebook. I am not sure if they were listed in more Prague specific guidebooks from LP or Foder's. The fact was that I mainly saw locals enjoying their day off in the sun in those places. Bryan also took me to a gigantic old stadium that bore the strong atmosphere of communist era which conjured some sort of nostalgic feeling. All in all, I felt that I got to enjoy both "light and shadow" of this town that added more depth to my trip to Prague. I also felt that even if those spots were listed in guidebooks, it just won't be possible to cover all I have seen in one day by biking myself.
