I can't even picture making the ride meaningful and vibrant without someone telling you the episodes that go with what you see. The ride itself was quite easy and safe. I have done different bike tours in Amsterdam, Paris, and Beijin previously, and I felt that this one was by far the most safest since you can ride in pedestrian way. I did this tour on Saturday, and the streets weren't quite busy. However, the ride in the old section of the town gets extremely bumpy with large cobble stones. I would say, about 10% of the tour was bumpy, and rest was super smooth ride. The bikes were pretty new, and comfortable. They have small baskets in front, and you can keep your bottled drinks and raincoats etc. Though it was a mostly sunny day the temperature was about 40 to 50F, and I was glad that I had a long down jacket and a scarf. I highly recommend this tour for solo travelers and groups alike. After taking this tour, I felt sorry for the tourists in the super-crowded touristy areas of Prague for missing what I had just seen. The money you spend on this tour will totally worth it. I hope this helps.

Nice Service. We've been the first time to Prague just for two nights. With the e-bikes we was able to visit nearly all important places in Prague in just 5 hours. Thank you and keep up the good work!

Biking Around Prague. I been to Prague several times and it was only going on the bike to did I really get a broader knowledge of the city. It really gives you better knowledge of Prague than any guide book could. The tour shows you places where you can have fun and meet people local people, other than the tacky & tedious tourist haunts. Also if history, culture and odd facts are your interest. The tour is great for that too.What’s more as the bikes are electric you don’t have to be super-fit to do the tour. So that’s great too.I’d recommend it to everyone & anyone. Do it the tour as soon as possible then you know the best places to go and have a good time.

You definitely want to take this tour!. My husband and I (late 20s / early30s) spent three hours on a guided tour of Prague (5 hours total) on a chilly, drizzly, overcast day in early April and it was still one of the best activities during our trip through Europe. Jan, our guide, clearly loves his hometown and showed us some of the best sites as well as some amazing lookout points we would have missed on our own. After all that and sharing a beer in the beer garden we headed back to Charles Bridge, got some helpful tips and recommended sights to check out and were happily on our own for two more hours that went by way too fast! Jan was an exceptional and knowledgeable host, going far above simply being a tour guide, it felt like we spent the afternoon hanging out with a friend. He took some beautiful photos of us and even recommended a lively local restaurant around the corner from the office where we chowed down on a giant pork knuckle and cold Czech beer (yum!) after returning the eBikes. This was a unbelievable experience with a great new company! The bikes were easy to use and a lot of fun, customer service was fantastic (they took us out immediately when we showed up unannounced on their doorstep hours early because the weather forecast for our initial booking time looked miserable) - and the price was great! If you can afford to do more than three hours on with the bikes you won't regret it, stop thinking about taking this tour and send them an email to set up a trip right now!Good luck to eBikes as they grow, we look forward to another trip with you the next time we cross the Atlantic and make it back to your beautiful city! Thank you Jan and I l Like eBike for turning a grey day into an unforgettable one!

I Like EBikes...THERE IS NO BETTER WAY TO SEE THE CITY, EXCELLENCE IN CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! A MUST!!. WOW! DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND TAKE AN "I LIKE EBIKE" TOUR!!! What can I say? This was a phenomenal experience, the fondest memories of my trip to Prague are with I like EBikes! Jan did an excellent job of hosting my friend and I. He accepted our late request for a tour and made sure we had the best experience possible. He insured that we were comfortable & safe the entire trip, stopping to buy us hot chocolate, and asking us our particular interests so that he could customize the trip. Jan as a person is 100% professional, and genuinely friendly! He is a wealth of knowledge about the town's history and attractions. He excels in customer service like none other I have met in many years. The bike fleet is in top condition and riding them is a dream. Anyone can ride these bikes, as they assist you electronically up hills. It is simply AMAZING!! I can hardly wait to return and bring more folks back just for this experience in Prague. Prague is a great town to walk, but to get to the outskirts, where the beautiful parks are on top of the hills, I LIKE EBIKE is the ONLY way to go!!! Much better than any other tour offered!!

Hands Down the Best Way to Experience Prague!. Thanks to Thomas for a memorable and exhilarating journey to the best spots to view the magical city of Prague. We are two 50-somethings who had not been on bikes for many years. Thomas was patient and overly kind as we made our way up hills and through the cobblestone streets of Lesser Town, Castle Hill, Letna, all the way to and across Nuselsky Bridge, and back to Old Town constantly keeping us entertained with nuggets of history. We took short breaks-one even for sausage and beer--and thoroughly enjoyed the 5 hour trip. We never would have guessed that Thomas had only just started with ebike that week--he was a real pro! Next time in Prague we will most certainly try one of the other tours. Thanks, Jan for the excellent restaurant tip, too!

Biking uphill in superspeed - so much fun!. I always think a bike is the best way to see a cITY, hop on and ride around. In Prague, it would have been impossible to find the best biking tracks without the guides. Without the engine of the bike, most tracks would have been unaccessible, there are a lot of very steep hills in that city. We took the viewpoint tour, and I really liked the mixture of sights. I have been to Prague two times before, and thanks to this site, I got to see something very different than I had before. The tour itself was perfect, our guides was wery nice and helpful. The sights we visited were just great. They could improve the guiding on this tour with some visual aids.If you take this trip during spring/autumn, bring some gloves and an extra sweather. Not so fun if you get cold.

FUTURE BIKE IN OLD TOWN ! ! !. Gr8 ! weekend in Prague and first real spring days of this year! There wasn't other way to enjoi it more, that with i like ebike ! We heard about electric bikes from my friend who's crazy about new ekological technologies and he recommend us to rent electric bike to explore capital city from minimal time to maximum experience. We found hppt: ilikeebike.com and call for reservation. Without problem! When we arrived there we realized, that we have great experience and adventure before us.! And it's became a thrue ! Whole trip was smooth and easy and we, when we again returt in Prague, take another trip from their offer. We have ZOO and bit of Old city ! Great ilikeebike team take really good care about us and helped us to find things about Prague, about which we don't have clue before - and Prague is our Capital city !! i can imagine whot it must be for tourists !! - I must recommended it to everybody !! !! if it will be possible i give them 6 stars ! Peace Jindřich and Bara.THX again !

Just one of the best way how to explore Prague. It was just amazing. Im from CR and im here in Prague on college in 4th semester. I was wondering that its a shame that I almost live here and dont know Prague at all, so i started to look for the best way how to know Prague better. I did some research on web and found this I Like EBike. I was sattisfied with provided service. Personal was just so nice and helpful, they really knew how to tell important things about intereseting places... I think that this is one of the best way how to quickly see interesting things in Prague. I was on nature track and it was just a little different view on Prague, there is so much beautiful parks here in Prague and there were no cars at all on this track. I can highly recommend it.

The only way to see Prague!!!!!. We debated doing a number of different tours including the Segway tour and more traditional bike tours. In the end we decided to do the "I Like EBike Viewpoints" tour. We are 100% certain that this was the best way to see Prague in all of its glory. Our tour guide was Jan who was passionate about Prague and ensuring that we were happy the whole time. The bikes were great - the electric assist made traversing Prague's hills a breeze - no effort at all! We were able to cover so much of the city over our four hours. You'd never be able to do the same by foot, segway, or traditional bike. Don't hesitate to book this tour, this is the best way to see Prague!!!!!!!

Prague can be done all in one day, with e-bike.. This event is amusing. We enjoyed romantic ride a bike with my girlfriend, saw beautiful views of Prague, ride through parks,photographed many photos and had a beer in local pub at sunset. Guide Honza was friendly, funny and trippin with him was entertainment. He know lot of interesting information about city. I highly recommend this trip for all who want to know Prague and yet not to be confused with the tourists, but travel comfortably and swiftly. It's something else than usual and it's worth it!Lukas & Christine

St. Patrick's weekend in Prague. Our choir spent St. Patrick's weekend in Prague in glorious sunshine. In order to see more of Prague we hired electric bikes. As prague have a lot of hilly and streets and cobble stones it was a brilliant way to get around. Up hills, across bridges, through parks with no effort at all. It brought me back to my childhood whizzing around on my bike. Two guides were with the group of nine and were very informative with wonderful knowledge of every area we stopped. We saw so much of prague in 3 hours and would thoroughly recommend this experience to anyone - any age!!. Thank you again for a great memory!!

Prague bike tour on steroids. The experience was amazing! The tour with I Like Ebikes was so much fun. The electric bike really helped with the 4 hour bike ride and steep hills. I did the View Point tour and it was really cool. I had a chance to see Prague in so many different view points. Jan and his team were very nice and helpful. I will definitely come do the tour again with I Like Ebikes.Helpful improvement tip to the I Like Ebike team:*Please work on the hand signals! Clear hand signals and consistency is key when you're zigzagging through the busy streets and sidewalks.*Slow down on certain busy parts of town. Its hard to catch up especially since there's traffic and pedestrians to look out for.

Guided electric bike tour of Prague. This is a great way to see Prague and have great fun while doing it.It was 20 euros for 3 hours and it was fantastic.I would love to do it again,Our guides were very good and a very friendly.

Best tour in Prague!. My brother and I took the I Like EBike Tour on the second day of a three day trip to Prague. Jan was our guide and made the entire tour fun, interesting, and inspired to learn more about this beautiful city. We went on a 5 hour tour, and it was the perfect amount of time. We were able to see sooo much of the city, while seeing some of the outskirts and other places that normally would never have been mentioned to us to look for. Jan provided good information and explain some of the contrasts and changes since communism ended there. While we saw so many wonderful sights, and views fit for postcards...it never felt rushed. When we wanted to stay somewhere a little longer, we did. We even had a little lunch during the ride and just enjoyed the surroundings. Even if I only had 1 day in Prague, I would absolutely make sure this tour is on your list of things to do. You will see more and do it in a fun way! The bikes are so fun! Make sure to bring a camera. We told others in our hostel about the tour and they all wished they had booked it, but ran out of time in Prague. They will be doing it the next time they are there. Thanks again Jan!!

This has to be THE BEST way to see Prague. We had so much fun riding all around the gorgeous streets and along the river. These bikes are fantastic for getting up the steep hills around the castle to see the magnificent views of the city. The bikes make it effortless to reach anywhere and everywhere. They couldn't be easier to ride. No hassles, no worries jusg a very memorable day. The staff are so, so friendly and will make sure you feel completely at ease with your bike. We will definitely be hiring these bikes again when we return. Highly recommended

Up the hill&nice Prague Gardens withou sweat. Prague is nice city for walking and there are lot of famous and wonderful monuments, churches, gardens and castles within walking distance area but sometimes you have to walk up and down because of the hills around the Vltava river. I`ve got a tip for an electric bike rental service and I have to admit that I`ve enjoyed it so much. I`ve made small tour round the famous and nice places in the city center starting with Petrin Gardens, Prague Castle, Letna (nice relax area and Sparta football stadium), down to Vltava river, Rudolfinum, Charles Bridge. With the electric bike you can safe your energy for admiring the beauties around you or for the night life.

Cycling through Prague on an electric bike is fantastic fun.. I have two small dogs and Jen, the owner made it so easy to just slip them into the basket and tool around Prague. He was a lovely guide, relaxed, stopping wherever I wished, knowledgable about all the sites and just great company. He kept our journey at an ideal pace; one very nice guy and one great tour guide!
Excellent bike, good people. It was very nice for me. I was with my friends and it was great experience and good entrertainment. So go with them its very very interesting .)

amazing experience with electric bike, with awesome sightseeing tour in Prague. I heard about this news. I am a student and with my girlfriend we wanted to see most sights. So we chose the longest tour, 5 hours. We went with a guide Stephan.He was professional and so kind. We saw maybe more than we expected and the very best was Vysehrad. Great Shop, bikes and service. Prices were also great even though we are students. Next time we must try another tour. awesome experinece!! I hope that this kind of tours should be in another cities and certainly will continue to develop itself..

Work out if you want to, let the motor work when tired or just lazy :-)!!!. I found this type of transportation as the best way how sightseeing in Prague...Prague has a lot of hills and the most interesting sights are just up on top of them. So that is why we rented electric bike in ILikeebike, we were all too lazy to walk up the hill after crazy friday night. But I have to say it was amazing experience! Highly recommended, even to famillies.

On of the best trips of ever. Small office in heart of Prague. Awesome young guys, who gave us great tips. Bikes were in perfect condition and fully charged. We also got maps, frisbee and padlocks for our tour. Guys gave us tips for tour and guides. They can also pickup bikes in the evening in your hotel, but we didn't try his service.It was whole day fantastic trip (Prague castle, Charles bridge, Old town square) Battery is for 60 km, so you can get everywhere.The first thing what to do in Prague :-)

Amazing, best way to see Prague by far!. Awesome experience, Jan was a great guide! We had gorgeous weather and Jan was able to accommodate us last minute as he had an opening the next morning. The bikes were super easy to ride, and we got to see much more of the city than you would on a walking tour. Well worth the money! Also, we had stop-offs at a Monastery for a great lunch and specialty beer they only brew within as well as another stop for mulled wine. Would do it again, wish they had this in every city!Kathy-Chicago

Absolutely fantastic! A "must" if wanting to see Prague.. EBike provides a battery assisted bicycle which makes Prague's hills easy for everyone. (Two of our group were in their sixties).Jan, our guide, and business owner, provides tours of various durations. We chose the longest, at five hours, which circumnavigated the city and took in all the famous sites. Lunch was local, cheap and cheerful costing £13 for four of us. Jan's route ensured that we were on roads with other traffic for only ten minutes or so, and the paths were all good for cycling.Helmets and gloves are provided but warm clothing is recommended as the EBike does most of the work. This must be the best way to see a city, as we covered some 35k.

Great alternative to get to know Prague. I have just returned from a wonderful weekend in Prague. Reading some good recommendations here, we also tried "I Like EBike" for one afternoon. It was not only great fun to explore the city by bike, but also gives you the possibility to check out place that are a little outside the historic city centre and thus would take some time to check out by foot. We were accompanied by Stepan, who not only had excellent knowledge of the city sights, but could also share some interesting stories that go beyond what you read in a guidebook.Thanks for the experience, thumbs up!

A wonderful, informative experience. I called a bit late on a Saturday but they were able to take me on a tour that suite my timing. I ended up doing a wonderful 5 hour tour which was the highlight of my time in Prague. The bikes themselves are brilliant. You peddle like a normal bike but it is like someone is running behind giving you a push. You cruise up the hills with ease.Jan who runs the company was my private tour guide. As well as being informative and knowledgeable he is great company for the day. I lovely young man. He took me to a great local place for a real Czech lunch which was most enjoyable. As well as seeing the usual sights we were able to go a bit further and see some different things like the old communist time stadium and student accommodation which was interesting. A memorable day. Thanks Jan

Great experience!. We found "I Like EBike" flyer in our hotel, and we decided to try it. It easy to be found: USA Embassy is marked on every touristic map of Prague, and EBike office is just up the street from there.EBike is very similar to normal city bike, but you have an "electrical assistant" which is turned on basically whenever you want. You can adjust the level of the "assistance". The battery was full enough for 5 hours of the ride (we rented the bikes for a half of the day). We thought that it would have been a good way to see more of Prague - but we had so much fun just riding the bikes so we actually didn't look so much (at least as much as we thought we would)! There are bike paths along almost all the streets and it is very safe for the ride. You can also ride the bikes along the river, you can "tour" the small river island - we found all that very interesting. There are also nice big parks in Prague, where you can have a pleasure ride.For the first-time Prague visitors, I would recommend first to take some walking tours, especially in the historical center. But, to see everything else - EBike is really perfect way. You don't need to be in very good shape - the "assistant" is there to help. Sport clothes is not an obligation, but it is more convenient to be dressed in that way, of course. You can put the basket for the EBike - so the small bags, rucksacks are not the problem.I would recommend a half-day EBike ride - maybe because I like the walks as well! The young man who was working in the office is very nice and helpful - he himself took one bike and guided us to the place where we wanted to start our bike tour (not to loose much time in busy city streets).

The BEST way to see Prague!. Wow, this was great! Jan gave my wife and I a tour of everything we wanted to see in Prague. The electric bikes are just like riding a real bicycle, except that going up hills is a dream! We started around 11AM and stopped for a great lunch, then got back around 4PM. I didn't realize how far we'd gone and how much we'd seen until I looked at a map later - really a great way to check out the beautiful sites of Prague. I highly recommend this to everyone! Thanks, Jan!

absolute must do in Prague. Spotted Prague by electric bike on trip advisor just before we travelled when doing some research. Reviews were very positive and we enjoy bike riding so we thought we would give it a go. I booked online and received a telephone call to advise a change of time (only if it suited us) which it did. We booked a 2 hour bike ride which was termed for "seniors" while my friend and I do not quite qualify as seniors (45 & 55yrs) we felt this was the most appropriate ride for us. The other rides were all of 5 hours duration which we felt were a bit long for our limited time. Upon arrival we were able to do a test ride to get used to the bikes and then as there were only the two of us a tour was designed on what we had/hadn't seen in Prague inner area. My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our experience. Excellent commentary was provided by Stephan our guide - a very well educated young Czech with excellent English and with qualifications in history and politics (so he really knows what he's talking about) We were just blown away by the experience it was fun, informative, and provided breath taking views of the city. Basically it was the highlight of our trip to Prague. Although the bikes provided are electric, you are still required to constantly peddle for the electric assist to kick in. We are both quite fit but I would suggest to those who think no effort is required you had better look for a bus tour of Prague instead.

Amazing! One of the best day tours i've done so far!. Our local guide Stephan was very knowledgable about the local surroundings and history. Also very professional and personable. Was willing to go above and beyond his duty of call. Exceeded my overall expectations. Was also well looked after by company owner Jan in regards to price and tayloring the tour according to our needs/requests.Highly recommended!!!

fabulous. This was an effortless and fun way to explore the stunning banks of the river Vltava. Heading south, we joined other cyclists, rollerbladers and buggy pushers . We passed schoolchildren setting out in their tiny dinghies from the local sailing club, university students - some gingerly learning to canoe, others to sail a catamaran, several rowers honing their skills on this relaxing river and also local men out on a sunny October day to try their hand with fishing. We sampled delicious local wines and foods at the market stalls and then explored the beautiful grounds of the castle and brewery but didn't quite make it to the spa!Next time we might cycle to Karlstadt and back - or better again we might do a tour and ask the lovely Jan to guide us - his passion for his beautiful city, its architecture and its history is infectious. One thing is sure - we will be back!

Wonderful way to explore Prague. When you visit Prague, this is an excellent way of exploring places you'll never would see without an EBike.Me and my wife really enjoyed the ride (also uphill) and it was very relaxing. It's great to see Prague from Pertrin Hill including the way up there. There are nice places following the river Vltava to the south.Unfortunately we rented the EBikes only for a half day for a self guided tour. The first half hour, Jan guided us uphill. He was very kindly and had a big knowledge about Prague. If you should have more time, we would recommend a guided tour.

A real on the ground moving fast experience. If only I could find this service in every city we visit! My husband and I totally enjoyed our very fun and customized tour. We asked for changes in the normal itinerary at the last minute and they accomplished that easily. The bikes made traveling over 15 miles or more of hilly terrain easy - even for a non sports oriented person. The information at each site was good - although I would have appreciated their having more diverse background on each site. For instance, we went past new buildings of interesting design and I still don't know who the architects are or what has been done to encourage the growth for that region. Bring your own water, or money to buy along the way. The bikes do have baskets making travel with cameras and other items easy.

Excellent way to see Prague, big thank you to Jan and Sara! :). What a discovery! Jan and his I like EBikes was the best way to see all the magical sights of Prague! Our guide Sara was amazing and really treated us to some of the best vantage points to see the wonderful city! Our whole experience with Jan was excellent, from our meet and greet, getting us settled on our bikes and a quick knowledge session to a brief outline on a map at the end of some of his favorite restaurants and also how to get home!!I don't think i worked a sweat up in the whole 5 hours we rode around, and there was some good hills to go up too! Sara treated us to one of her local pubs for some traditional Czech food and some berry cheese (both of which my girlfriend and I were amused when she asked to pour some beer over!!) :SI would recommend this tour for anyone, the bikes are extremely easy to ride we covered almost 40km and as I said before not once worked up a sweat! :)Overall A++++++

Funny experience which I really recommend :). For me it was first time on this electro bike, I have really enjoyed. At beginning a member of EBIKEs team quided me and my friend out of historical centre to path for cyclists. Gave us a map with instruction where to go, what to see. Then we were cycling around with some breaks. We have borrowed bikes for half of a day. I liked that it is helping you when you are not so strong. I recommend this activity in city of Prague, in short time you can see a lot and you spend your time actively.

Great price, great experience, great people. Hi everyone, My wife and I went to Prague last week and reserved two bikes for the 5 hour tour called "View Point Ride". The website was really easy to use and we received a confirmation email the next morning with all the details we needed. We arrived and signed some simple paperwork and paid the fee...which in my opinion, for 5 hours of tour with a guide, was a steal. They instructed us on how to use the bikes and off we went. On this tour, it was my wife and I and the guide, Sara. If you haven't been to Prague, you will find that when you arrive it is very hilly. This is where the genius of the bikes come into their own. There is NO way that you could do this tour on a regular bike, your legs would be killing you. The electric motor is very helpful in assisting you while riding and the settings can be adjusted so if you feel like getting more exercise, you can always turn down the assist. The tour was 5 hours long and after 3 hours or so, our guide changed the plan for the next two hours so we could visit some of the things we wanted to but weren't on the original route. Sara was very friendly and made for great conversation not just about Prague, but about history, culture and the language of Czech. A quick side note...my wife and I rented Segway's in Berlin and had a blast. But, I don't think that they would have been as nice here. The streets are smaller and more crowded and I think many people have more respect for the bike and clear the way than for the Segways. Bottom line, if you are mildly interested in the idea, find out which route seems best for you and book it.

Best way to see Prague. We just finished our bike tour and had a great time, seeing tons of sites all over Prague that only an electric bike could allow. At first we weren't sure whether to rent regular bikes or electric powered ones, but after about 2 minutes of riding we realized it would've been impossible without the motorized assistance. Had a great trip and our guide was awesome!

A great way to see Prague. A friend recommended this bike tour of Prague. My wife and I went on a 2 hour tour. The bikes are great - electric power assisted up hills. We went to places that would have been hard to reach by car. Stephan, our guide was informative, well spoken and very patient with us two out-of-shape 50-something-year-olds. The only negative was riding the bike over cobblestones - very rough on the backside. Overall, it was a highlight of our trip to Prague.

Very nice day out and I loved the bikes. My husband and I hired a couple of electric bikes on our recent trip to Prague. The guys at the hire shop were so friendly and really made sure we knew how to use the bikes and the route we were going to take. All the equipment was new and in good working order.We really enjoyed our day out on the bikes and it was lovely to see some of the 'real' Prague instead of just the tourist sites (beer got a lot cheaper out of the city centre too)The bikes were such a good idea, Having the motor made riding the bike so easy, even massive hills were no problem.If we go back to Prague we will do this again and try one of the other cycle routes.

We were in Prague for 3 days, and this was by far the best part of the trip!. I and two friends visited Prague with a group of 20 to "see" the city of Prague. Prague is HUGE and for two days we unsuccessfully walked around the city, not knowing what to do or what to see, and it took a really long time to get everywhere. On the last day of our stay in Prague, we really wanted to have a unique experience, so we called I Love EBike and they gave us 3 bikes to use for a half day. First, Jan gave us a mini tour of the city for about 1.5 hours then let us go off on our own. While we were with him, he showed us the AC Sparta coliseum, took us to different parts of Communist era Prague, the castle, and then took us on a look out over the entire city.I would HIGHLY recommend I Love EBike. Thanks Jan and the Crew!

Fantastic experience. We really enjoyed our 5-hour trip on the e-bikes. We saw an enormous part of Prague as well as neighbouring parks and residential areas out of the city. Our guide Jan was knowledgable and friendly. These electric bikes are highly recommended as a way to see parts of the city that some tourists may not get to see.

They make the hill up to Prague Castle so easy. We discovered I Like EBike as soon as we arrived in Prague as our hotel was nearby. We hired the bikes for 2 days as a self guided tour. We returned the EBikes to the shop at the end of the day so they could be charged overnight, ready for us for the next day. Jan was very helpful, showing us how to ride the bikes. He took us up to the Stadium to make sure we were comfortable with the bikes before leaving us to do our own thing. Prague is a city that is quite hilly and spread out. As we only had 2 days in Prague I seriously doubt we would have been able to cover everything that we did without the EBikes. I was amazed at how powerful they were, particularly on the hill up to Prague Castle. I Like EBikes are a great way to see Prague and they are lots of fun to ride as well.

Just perfect!. My children (from 18-9) spent a few days in beautiful Prague. As usual we wanted to see the most important spots. Normally we book an ordinary bus tour. But this time we did it much better: a round tour with those amazing e-bikes is just the perfect way to see Prague! Healthy, interesting and a lot of fun! Thanks to Jan and Stephan for a perfect afternoon!

Best way to tour Prague. When you visit Prague, one of the first things you will notice are those crowds running around with some guide talking in front of them. Well, do not join them, there is a better way to experience Prague. I discovered the I-Like-EBike brochure in my hotel and booked a tour. The office is located between the US and German embassy, so pretty easy to find. The tours are private, so you can choose any time you like and have you personal guide. You can choose between two type of Ebikes, both pretty comfortable and suited for the city. Do not expect racing or mountain bikes, you do not need those for these tours anyway. Since I have used an Ebike before, it was a very nice experience to sit on a bike and drive up hills without sweating. The tour lasted for 5 hours and app. 40km but was never once exhausting. Since theses tours are personal, we changed the tour a little and drove to the inner city. Jan was a very nice guide and it was more like touring with a local friend with stops for a beer etc. So you get way more information and tips than with these bus or walking tours. So if you want to get a real view of Prague and the weather is nice, I would definitely recommend this tour!

Don't Miss This Tour. If you don’t take this tour you will surely miss half of Prague. We took the view point tour and saw some amazing things. Our guide Jen did an awesome job of explaining things. The ride was really fun and easy with the electric bikes. At the store they gave us some really good recommendations for food and drinks, and while we were out riding we stopped for lunch at a “local” place, and had some great Czech food and a beer. This was by far the highlight of our trip! When we come back we will definitely be doing another tour with I Like EBike.

A great way to explore the beautiful city of Prague and an amazing day out. Having simply stumbled across 'I Like EBike' as we were slowly drudging up the hill to Prague's Castle, we decided to give it a go the next day. As we had been in Prague for 2 days previous; we felt we had seen and explored the city to a good enough extent to glide leisurely around on bikes for a day, retracing our steps from our previous ambles. We were wrong. It is only when you are greeted by the friendly staff and talked through the intricate off-road paths of Prague that you really begin to realise just how much there is to see. We followed our maps to the likes of the Letna Gardens to enjoy a picnic with the breathtaking panoramic views as a backdrop- and further down to the sandy beach style hideaway for a much needed cold drink ! - Having only hired for a half day we had to redraw our route in order to get back after 5 hours was up, but we could've easily carried on for at least another entire day. With the major benefit of having electrical assistance these bikes are a truly ingenious way to travel round and explore the city to it's greatest depths...just look out for angry looks on the face's of other cyclists who don't have the electric assist as you peddle without breaking a sweat to the top of the hill to Prague Castle :-)

EBIKES 5*****. I spent only two days in Prague and thanks to I like ebikes I could see not only the usual places, but some of the more interesting, as well. It was so simple. The receptionist a tour hotel offered us tours in Prague. After sime thought we picked I Like ebikes as we were already used to driving electric bikes plus it was also the best affordable option. She also called the company for us and checked, whether bikes were available. We picked the family tour and then we were on our way. Stephen was great! Very knowledgeable and educated. We LOVED the ZOO, Troja chateau, water cannaland some very interesting local places that Stephen seemed to know well. We are planning to go to Prague again next year on our anniversary and we will definately try out the romantic tour!!
Great thing,lovely guid!!!!. That was great experience and lovely way to see Pragua!Thank you!!!!

Faster it goes uphill then downhill. After strolling through city for few days and being tired to continue walking adventures, finding this small shop with helpful people, turned out to be best experience we had on our visit to Prague. If you go without guide I would recommend decent planning if you want to combine orange and green routes. It is really unique opportunity to explore the town off the beaten tracks. At the end, it was first thing that we mentioned to our friends when we were describing out visit to Prague. I know, we rode electric bikes, nothing special. Try it uphill.

EBIKES Tours 5. We went to Prague just for fun and we got it!! We met Jan at his shop in Mala Strana in morning. He let us try his electric bikes and,never having ridden an electric bike before, we were quite surprised.We went up hill with these totally normal looking bikes and the peddling was easy and we could get to the Prague castle with little effort and without breaking a sweat. Our tour guide, Stephen was awesome. He had great knowledge of local places and the history. The tour lasted about 4 hours and we could adjust it to what we wanted to see. Afterwards we felt like we saw and learned so much that Prague instanlty became another place, the place we knew. After returning our bikes Jan let ussign the wall in the shop and we will definitely look it up once we go there again.

The Best Way to See Prague--EBikes!!!. My friend and I could not stop talking about our experience with EBikes. The bikes are amazing...they do all the work so you can sit back an enjoy the fantastic sites of Prague, and let me inform you: ALL THE SITES VISITED (LIKE THE CASTLE, THE PARK, ETC.) , AND THE ROUTES TO GET TO THEM, ARE BREATHTAKING!!! Also, Jan, our guide, is topnotch. I've been around the world and have had many guides at various attractions/excursions and Jan was definitely the best one--kind, patient, humorous, and very informative. I plan on visiting Prague in the future with more friends and I will definitely take them on EBikes so they can experience the beauty of this amazing city!!!Carlos

Great experience - felt very free. E-Bike is a great possibility to get around Prague. It´s very "effortless" and a great alternative to just walking all the time. You can see lots of places, to which you normally couldn´t get to. Avoid the bumpy roads .- it´s not very pleasant to bike there. We went along the river and into the woods (kinda lost our way there). I would recommend to walk in the first district and around the castle and see the e-bike as a great expansion to experience the not so common parts of the city. The bike goes relatively fast (faster than I expected, up to 25 km/h) - we drove in 3 hours about 12 km (without a great deal of effort)I would definitely do it again (even my often complaining girlfriend liked it ;-). The price was ok, could be cheaper for half a day. Very nice staff. I would not recommend for more than half a day - my tushy was hurting a bit after all (or you can take more stops)

Great experience - Jan was a fantastic guide. My wife and I were new to Prague, we had spent a few days just walking around, and then we found ilikeebike. Jan was really good, spoke and understood english very weel, he showed us all the best places to go, he even came with us for 20mins and showed us up the hill and to the castle, until we were comfortable to take Prague on by ourselves. The scenery by the water was great we covered 20-30km over 4 hours, the bikes were very easy, quick and never missed a beat. Gives great flexibility, speed and excitement to the normal tourist trip.

How to see the best of Prague in 4 hours.... Ebike was an excellent experience. It gives you different guides and a unique way to see and enjoy the best points and places in Prague in a very special way. Nice, cool and very supportive staff. If I'll go again in Prague I will definitely repeat this experience...Everyone should go for it.....It's amaizing

A different way to experience Prague. We could visit touristic and non touristic spots thanks to our Ebikes. You don't sweat riding this bikes even on hills. The staff were very friendly. Experience Prague this way!

A FANTASTIC AFTERNOON IN PRAGUE. We had a 3 hours visit of Prague with EBike electric bikes and it was a lovely experience. Our guide was very nice and helpful and he took us to some places we would have never known. I really recommend it!

Amazing - Don't leave Prague without an EBike Ride. My boyfriend and I visited EBikes the last full day of our Prague vacation. Besides this being our first time to Prague, this was the first time we experienced electric bikes. Wow, what an incredible experience. Sara with I love EBikes was able to join us for our journey. We rented the bikes at 10:00am and returned them at 4:00pm. It was the perfect amount of time, as we had ample time to see all of the sites and definitely were spent by the end of our journey. We went for the "family tour," since we had seen much of Prague by foot the days prior. If anything, please enjoy Prague by foot and then explore on bikes. We found we could relate to the sights much more because of our previous days experience with the city. You must take a camera, sunblock, and your sense of adventure. It's so much fun and we highly recommend the sights you see on the family tour. A must for anyone that wants to truly see Prague for all that it is. And you MUST go with a guide - it makes the experience unforgettable. Thank you Sara and the team at I Like EBIkes Prague!!

Unique experience and must do when in Prague. Either alone, with friends or family, if you are in Prague, you must check out "I Like Ebike", because it is an attraction that should belong in every great city and that makes the visit so much more enjoyable!!! I travelled with my wife and young baby and I wasn't sure it was a good idea to ride with a 6-month old child. But the obliging operator Jan and the free test drive made me change my mind. And I didn't regret it. The tour was wonderful, the electric bike made the ride so smooth, especially with an "extra* weight. Also the weather was beautiful...for the first part of the trip. Unfortunately it began raining in the late afternoon and we had to shorten the bike tour...but next time I come back to Prague, I WILL complete the tour.Without hesitation, this tour belongs to my top 3 attractions to do in Prague!!!

great way to save your feet while seeing Prague!. After traveling for a few weeks in Europe, our feet were so sore from walking around! So we decided to rent bikes from this company to help us see most of Prague without walking.The bikes were great....and because they were electric, the steep hills of Prague were no problem.The staff and owners were extremely helpful and friendly. A must-do in Prague.

best thing in all 5 days. Already fisically tired of walking all around bumping on everybody visiting the same things, we decided to go on an electric bike ride. and it was so good! we managed to make the most beautiful pictures from the upper points of view, to some of which Jan himself took us, and even go further away from the center, seeing real Prague inhabitants doing the same thing as us (only not electrical... we could see their envy.. :D), enjoying Pragues' very good cicleway. We had a great time, and we really enjoyed everything about "I Like EBikes".

The best way to see Prague. I Like Ebike was across the street from our hotel in Prague. My husband was very excited about renting the electric bikes and getting a look at Prague beyond the tourist spots. We hired the bikes for a 3.5 hour. Our wonderful guide, Sara, took us to see things that we never would have see otherwise and also to see some things we wanted to see that were not specifically on the tour. She was more than happy to make changes that suited our interests. 3 Hours into our 3.5 hours, we decided to extend our trip to 5 hours. We had a delicious lunch at a small pub and finished the day tired but feeling like we'd seen Prague in all it's many facets.
